description: THE OPPORTUNITY  Exciting opportunity to join the sales division of a global biopharmaceutical company that has been in the business for more than 25 years and in the Asia Pacific for over 60 years. Be part of a high-performing Sales team to drive strong results for the business and significant impact on customers Based in Singapore, the regional hub for the Asia Pacific (AP) and named one of the Best Companies to Work for in 2020 by Straits Times Best Employers 2021  Our Sales team support our customers by providing clinical information about products, educational information, clinical training programs and resources. We support healthcare providers and healthcare systems meet the goals of the patients in their communities.  What you will do Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to  Strategic Sales Objectives & Sales Expertise (50%) To achieve strategic objectives as required by the franchise (eg market growth, sales growth, number of new accounts, formulary listings, new product market priming) Demonstrate a high level of sales expertise and relationship management (through product & TA knowledge, selling skills, product presentation skills & managing customers) Be accountable for sales, activities, and compliance within the assigned territory  Territory Management Proactively plan and optimize overall sales results performance through effective territory management Seek Contract opportunities, suggest and negotiate optimum pricing Demonstrate ability to resolve problems in a timely manner, escalate issues early  Marketing Planning, Operations & Key Program Implementation (25%) Active involvement in the annual brand planning process Effective planning & execution of marketing/promotional activities according to plan (eg FGM, L&L, SL engagement program, patient programs, public forums) Ensure timely submission and approval of documentation for planned activities In compliant with internal medical, legal & compliance processes  Account Management (25%) Build and execute account plans for key accounts, through an in-depth understanding of customers (profile/behavior/relationship network/needs, etc)  What you must have To be successful in this role you must have:  A good Degree in Pharmacy/ Biomedical Science/ Arts/ Busines. 3+ years pharmaceutical sales experience in the Pharmaceutical industry Experience in Oncology is an added advantage Strong presentation skills, positive attitude, and strong sales achievement Strong customer focus and proven relationship building skills Good track record in sales, with a history of achieving results Experience in handling projects from end to end  WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT  Competitive remuneration Innovative and flexible working environment Opportunity to learn and enjoy a rewarding career that technology companies don’t bring; the satisfaction of saving lives and making an impact!  Who we are…  We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.  What we look for…  In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.  We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.  Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully   Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.
industries: Pharmaceuticals and Biotechnology

description: Account Specialist/Manager  This position is accountable for execution of the sales plan / account plan developed by Division Sales Leader in order to meet set revenue and growth targets for the Oral Care Solutions Division (OCSD).  Role will report to Division Sales Leader, OCSD.  Job Responsibilities  This is a local role, where the Account Specialist/Manager is responsible to drive sales and spec-in to OCSD’s existing customers and develop new businesses. In this position, the Account Specialist/Manager will work very closely with the Business Team to deliver the following:  1. Achieve sales goals and year on year growth. 2. Initiates sales process by prospecting, scheduling of appointments, conduct clinical sales presentations, understanding business needs, develop proposals and sales closure. 3. Build customer relationships with the customers and develop these relationships in multiple levels of the organization. 4. Demonstrate a solution-oriented consultation approach to selling 5. Overcome price concerns and other objections by demonstrating value 6. Proactively identify new business opportunities and drive spec-in 7. Constantly provide Voice of Customer/Voice of channel and competitive intelligence 8. Ensures customer satisfaction standards are achieved and maintained 9. Maintain consistent communication and timely follow-up with customers and prospects and be available and responsive to customer’s real-time needs 10. Complete sales activity reports and presentations in a timely manner 11. Organize in-services for customers 12. Work with distributors to achieve Sales Targets 13. Other duties may be assigned  Requirements: 1. Bachelor’s Degree or higher (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited University with minimum 2 -3 years of experience in sales and preferably in a dental / healthcare setting 2. Experience with GPO’s contracts, including negotiation and distribution management is a plus 3. Must be self-motivated; energetic; results-driven and a team player 4. Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills 5. Able to work under time pressure and work independently 6. Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills 7. Demonstrates impeccable sales acumen with passion and drive for success 8. Exhibits clinical and conceptual selling skills in a face-to-face and virtual settings 9. Exemplifies effectiveness in new business development and lead qualification 10. Proficient computer skills including MS Excel, PowerPoint and CRM programs 11. Ability to effectively utilize CRM to maintain and develop assigned territory or account 12. Oversees from preparation to end of dental events/exhibitions and hands-on workshops at all times, including weekends 13. Holds a valid class 3 driving license and possess own car. 14. Actively participating in relevant corporate programs/initiatives, complies with professional and quality standards, complies with corporate policies and procedures, and acts in a manner consistent with 3M’s values and ethical standards.
industries: Mechanical or Industrial Engineering

jobTitle: Sales & Business Development Associate – based in Singapore
description: Sales & Business Development Associate – based in Singapore. Responsibilities: • Business developed to open new opportunities & SMEs acquisition growth channels.  • Build & expand new clients portfolio that requires cross border settlements, sending of funds in different currencies across the globe (FX) regularly.  • Prospecting & proactive outreach such as cold calling, business networking, LinkedIn outreach, lead generation tools. Etc  • Effectively close as many inbound / outbound leads as possible & manage the end-to-end sales process – Pitching, Onboarding, App demo training, A/c utilization.  • Use consultative sales strategies to effectively overcome client objections and maximize sales activity.  • Drive referrals by your exceptional work & connections. • Handle post-sales client engagement to support completion of onboarding Know-Your-Customer (KYC) with the support of Operations team.  • Effectively obtain client and market feedback for product / marketing improvements.  Requirements: • At least 2 - 3 years of experience in either SMEs /Enterprise sales/ Corporate Banking /Fintech / SaaS sales with measurable success • At least 1 year experience with client success or a/c management. • Strong sales negotiation & client relationship management skills • Top producer in your previous companies - never take no to an answer • Self-motivated and able to thrive & work independently in a results-driven & fast-paced environment  • Experience working with cross-functional teams (Product, marketing, ops)  • Must be fluent in both English and Chinese. (Other languages are a plus) • Ability to showcase a clear methodology or framework for task execution • Strong communication skills to interact with both clients and internal stakeholders.  • Previous Experience from Traditional Remittance house, corporate banking, Fintech FX or payment's background is a Big Plus & Bonus! • P.S: Only Singaporean citizens /PRs may apply*  If you're interested in this role, forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to mingwang.l@opalpayment.com

Company Description  Imagine what we can do together. At LinkedIn, we believe amazing things can happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging and their ideas are heard. Join us and help make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can.  Job Description  As an Account Executive working in a pod structure in our customer acquisition business, you will partner closely with the LinkedIn Sales Solutions Enterprise Account Executive to acquire new logos and expand our footprint through repeatable commercial plays and by aligning LinkedIn’s portfolio of professional solutions with the complex requirements of our largest regional and multinational customers (MNC).  The Enterprise acquisition business in LinkedIn Sales Solutions focuses on whitespace accounts (new customers/logos) and accelerates our penetration in the Enterprise segment in Asia through deep client understanding, strategic relationship network and strong value creation. Ready to join this exciting group?  Responsibilities  You will partner with the Enterprise Account Executive (AE) to jointly develop account and territory plans, using external and internal data/insights to prioritise accounts, formulate sales strategies and execution tactics to acquire new customers. There will be direct customer acquisition accountability and ownership within a subset of the Enterprise AE territory.  This role will also lead the development of quarterly plans to engage and nurture key customer communities as part of a larger pod community of Account Executives and Relationship Managers (RM).  This is a highly collaborative role requiring a passion for building strong and lasting relationships which allow our largest customers to be, and feel, successful with LinkedIn products and solutions. Aligned to a pod structure, collaborate and partner with the Enterprise AE’s to agree upon account goals, strategies and tactics for customer acquisition and then contribute on territory and account plans Proactively identify opportunities in buying centers, subsidiaries and divisions where pilot play(s) can be positioned. As required, conduct detailed discovery and needs analysis with both decision makers and end users to recommend the right LinkedIn Solution. Establish a trusted and multi-threaded relationship with your allocated accounts by providing high-quality customer engagement activities, leveraging x-functional partners and regional/global executives. Be open, collaborative and customer-focused in all communications and transactions with colleagues and clients. Use our CRM every day for tracking activities and, most importantly, forecasting. Speak at client & industry events across APAC in partnership with the Enterprise AE to generate demand and ensure attendance at various LinkedIn marketing & thought leadership events Thought leadership initiatives. As part of the AE/RM pod community, impact strategic and multi-threaded engagement within your territory through a planned and deliberate approach to engaging and nurturing targeted client communities (CXO, Sales/BU Leaders, CMO, Sales Operations, Program Leads/Managers, etc.).  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications : 3+ years of sales and business development experience selling to Enterprise accounts.  Preferred Qualifications Excellent communications, team collaboration and analytical skills. Experience in multi-threaded engagement, selling to EVPs, CXOs and end-users (in the same sales cycle) in both individual and team sales environments Experience in solution selling to large regional/global customers, with complex organization structure Experience in managing multiple pilot projects. Demonstrated success in driving new business sales, and ability to develop and manage a sales execution plan at an account and/or territory level. Proven success in selling SaaS or disruptive technology in an Enterprise environment.    You’ll Benefit From Our Culture  We  strongly believe in the well-being of our employees and their families. That’s why we offer generous health and wellness programs and time away for employees of all levels. description: Company Description  LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.  Job Description  Glint helps you see into your organization in revolutionary ways, giving you the power to create real impact on employee engagement, retention and business performance. Glint leverages real-time people data to give leaders and managers a holistic view of an organization’s health, the insight to predict problems, and direction to take action. Glint was acquired by LinkedIn in November 2018, to accelerate LinkedIn's commitment to helping organizations hire, engage, and develop their people  LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume - we transform lives through innovative products and technology.  The Business Development Manager is significantly involved in the execution of Glint’s top-line growth efforts and strategy development. Specifically, you will contribute significantly to the top-line growth of Glint through support of direct sales efforts, increase of our win percentage, and to growth executed through indirect sales channels and inorganic business development efforts. Additional responsibilities include providing People Science (PS) and Customer Success (CS) input and execution, as well as providing direction and commercial feedback to Product Development efforts, and new ideas for Sales Enablement and Product Marketing. The Business Development Manager reports directly to the Head of Global Business Development, Glint.  Responsibilities  Driving top-line growth of Glint through support of, and leadership on, direct sales efforts, including: Discovery conversations with VLEs (very large enterprises) Calls with ENT (Enterprise) / VLE sales qualified leads (SQLs) Critical initial sales meetings RFP response direction and authoring of custom responses Finalist pitches Scoping conversations related to People Science and Customer Success Lead in establishing the strategic and tactical plans to convert existing sales opportunities Directing, coordinating and/or creating pre-sales collateral for both custom opportunities as well as contributing to the creation of scalable materials through Product Marketing and Sales Enablement Assist in the customization of pre-sales collateral, RFP responses, and finalist pitch strategies and materials Identification, articulation, and ensuring the implementation of new ideas, tools and sales collateral Maintain an up-to-date understanding of industry trends and technical developments in the People Success (talent management and HR technology) industry that impact large multi-national clients and Glint value proposition Support Sales and Marketing through the delivery/execution of speaking engagements, city events, blogs and conferences Ensure consistent and detailed flow of feedback between Glint’s commercial discussions with sales prospects and Glint’s Product team Through personal relationships and through established professional networks, identify and/or evaluate the feasibility of new growth opportunities (indirect channels, inorganic growth opportunities) In partnership with Glint’s Head of Strategy & Business Development, act as coordinating force between all departments required to execute a partnership (including, but not limited to, Customer Success, People Science, Engineering, Product, and Sales) Travel 25-50%  Success Criteria Successful achievement of Glint top-line growth targets Outsized won percentage on Business Development supported direct sales efforts Achievement of personal top line targets on direct sales efforts The number and quality of partnership opportunities sourced, evaluated, and implemented Bookings from indirect sales channels Market-share within relevant geography Successful influence of Glint’s overall Product Roadmap to incorporate critical regional requirements Increased scalability of Glint’s People Science and Customer Success team (long-term impact on Gross Margins and EBITDA through increased allocation of PS/CS team and decreased hiring trajectory)  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications 10+ years of experience in global business development in the talent management, HR technology, or People Success fields Bilingual fluency in English and Japanese (spoken and written for both languages)  Preferred Qualifications  Bachelors Degree in Organizational Psychology, Organizational Development, Organizational Behavior or a related field MBA, Masters, or PhD in Organizational Psychology, Organizational Development, Organizational Behavior or a related field Experience Directing, Coordinating and/or creating pre-sales Collateral for both custom opportunities as well as contributing to the creation of scalable materials through Product Marketing and Sales Enablement Understanding of industry trends and technical developments in the People Success (talent management and HR technology) industry  Additional Information  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal. description: Business Development Manager – Asia Pacific Job Description  Reporting to: Stephen Turner, Commercial Director - Asia Pacific  The IWSR is looking to recruit a highly motivated, experienced business development manager to help the company grow the Asia-Pacific business to the next level. Reporting directly to the APAC Commercial Director, the BDM will operate in 18 markets across a diverse range of clients, while also liaising with internal marketing and research stakeholders.  The Role Targeting and developing sales opportunities across 18 Asia-Pac markets Pro-active targeting of beverage alcohol companies Pro-active targeting of companies and organizations adjacent to the beverage alcohol sector, such as: banks, consultancies, packaging companies, government agencies Account management of newly acquired subscription clients Effective networking via Linkedin, industry events and other relevant on/offline events Close cooperation with the Commercial Director to ensure efficient commercial engagement across the region, as well as activation of targeted sales initiatives by country Close cooperation with the regional research team to ensure a two-way flow of new contacts Building and maintaining a pipeline of new opportunities to ensure consistent monthly performance Building a balanced pipeline of subscription, report and custom consulting opportunities Using and updating salesforce.com, with a priority focus on MQL- Marketing Qualified Leads Primary point of contact for in-bound client queries  Requirements  Minimum 5 years new business sales experience in a business information (or similar) role Excellent communication and presentation skills Organized, efficient and self-motivated Competent with Word, Excel, PPT Native / business fluent English:essential Business fluent Chinese or Japanese:desirable  Remuneration ·      Expected OTE of $110 – 120k

We are currently looking for a Sales Account Executive with the right energy, competitive spirit, and personal drive to be the leading force that fuels our growing client relationships in our Australian & Singapore markets. Working in a defined geographic territory, you will proactively engage with targeted companies, as well as follow up and close on various sources of inbound leads.  The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities by using a consultative approach to selling and use their expertise to identify prospects, build meaningful customer relationships and drive momentum across multiple opportunities by guiding prospective clients on their Spend Management journey.  Key responsibilities:  Create client demos/ presentations, quotes/ proposals, and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) Craft an innovative sales pitch to explain product and service capabilities, and initiate the sales process by scheduling appointments and make initial presentations Represent Volopay in all customer-facing engagements, traveling to customers’ locations as required (post covid) and engaging at all levels of an organization Manage the complete and complex sales cycles often presenting to C-level executives the value and ROI/Business Case of Volopay Utilize Hubspot CRM to provide timely and accurate sales activity tracking and status updates Perform cost-benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs understanding account requirements Educating prospective customers on the value of products and services to create growth & engagement opportunities Understand customer’s requirements accurately and communicate with the team internally stating needs, problems, use cases, more  Understand the competitive landscape. Identify new opportunities leveraging your own creativity to engage customer prospects for conversions Develop your own vertical/territory plan and a pipeline that will fuel the ongoing growth of your business Strive to continuously improve your sales process and demonstrate a willingness to learn and implement best practices Collaborating with management on sales goals, planning, and forecasting; maintaining short and long-term business development plans.  Qualifications:  Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience’s needs Minimum 2 years of quota-carrying SaaS / b2b software sales experience as an Inside sales representative selling into the SG market to SMEs & mid-market clients. Successful track record managing complex deals from demo presentation to closing and actively engaging. Strong and demonstrated written and verbal communication skills. CRM experience preferred. Ability to work in a fast-paced team environment. Strong customer references. Experience managing the sales cycle, closing the deal with the decision-makers with demonstrated skill at negotiating business terms.  If you enjoy solving complex problems, work effectively with cross-functional teams, and thrive in a constantly evolving landscape, then this opportunity will be exciting for you. Additional benefits with this role involve – Constant Learning & Development support towards individual needs, flexibility with timings, and opportunity to uncover emerging trends. We observe multiple industry players and their products, and thus you will be always working on some new challenge.

The role will be responsible to drive sales force effectiveness via leading the overall sales execution process of Carlsberg Singapore as well as partnering the Sales Capability Lead to execute capability-building programmes for the Carlsberg Singapore salesforce.   Responsibilities Sales Execution Excellence To partner the Value Management & Sales Capability, Senior Manager and the Sales team to drive FIT implementation including leading the bi-annual PICoS review, briefing of sales staff, maintenance of outlet census and more To assume the role of an independent auditor for Carlsberg SG by conducting a monthly FIT audit for a defined sample size of on and off-trade outlets To actively manage and drive the sales call’s quality including measurement and corrective actions with the Sales Directors & Managers, including implementation of processes and tools  To compute and analyse the monthly audit and sales’ calls results, including proactively reviewing of the findings with the Management team and Sales Directors & Managers to drive corrective actions that can improve overall sales execution To monitor the performance against the agreed sales force KPIs by leveraging on the FIT analytics’ report and independent audits’ findings, then work with the Sales Capability Lead as well as the Sales Directors & Managers to identify opportunities for improvement  To support the Sales Capability Lead in maintaining the key reporting platforms that can ease the accessibility for the Sales team to sales and FIT execution information   Sales Force Training & Development To lead the sales force effectiveness’ diagnosis activities that can identify their needs & requirements, after which collaborate with the Sales Capability Lead to implement training programmes that can drive sales excellence To work with the Sales Capability Lead in coordinating and executing all competency and capability-building programmes for the Carlsberg SG sales force  To conduct on-the-job training for Carlsberg Way of Selling (i.e Picture of Success and other best practices) for the sales force  Requirements: Minimum Degree (Marketing or Business) Minimum 2-3 years of working experience in Sales force Effectiveness, Sales Capability, Sales Operations or equivalent areas Team player with strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills – able to work with and influence stakeholders/colleagues at all levels Proactive, able to work independently, possesses problem solving skills and able to work in a dynamic and challenging environment Strong analytical skills to identify business issues and formulate relevant and actionable recommendations  Highly resourceful, creative and open to challenges Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Powerpoint etc), analytics tools (Qilkview, Power BI etc) and salesforce systems (Distributor Management System, Salesforce.com etc) Fluent in English proficiency  Job Details  Workplace Zhongshan Park, Singapore  Job type Permanent  Part time / Full time Full Time  Working Time Monday - Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm  We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.   THE PERSON: Business, Engineering or Marketing Diploma At least 2 years industrial equipment/ parts/ lubricants & battery sales experience Car ownership is essential Strong communication, interpersonal, presentation and negotiation skills Goal-oriented, resilient and adaptable. THE JOB: Achieve sales growth for a wide range of material handling equipment and prospect to secure new accounts Build and maintain close rapport with new and existing customers to ensure continued business relationships through frequent visits introducing new and updated products while being a resource for the customers Perform market intelligence to strategize market opportunities and business development Sales reporting and administration.

Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. Experience in advertising, sales, marketing, consulting or media.  Preferred qualifications: 8 years of experience in sales, in integrated marketing communications or media sales. 6 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting or media in the technology industry. Experience working in advertising sales environment or within the Go-to-Market aspect of a product organization. Experience with partner relations, account management, and sales skills.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and customer-focused members help entrepreneurs build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. In this role, you will collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends, and create and implement business plans for all types of businesses.  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Oversee and define the product solutions strategy of both performance (Search, Display and Shopping), video (YouTube), and partner with sales teams to influence accounts and achieve in-market business growth objectives. Present Google products with structure, best practice case studies, demonstrations, and data. Build the global product strategy and influence global product roadmap. Provide product updates and insights to our teams and partners. Keep up with internal and external product news and advertising market trends that would have impact on our success. Engage regularly with customers and agency partners together with our initial contact teams to assist in promoting products and stay attuned to their challenges and needs.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Establish a trusted and multi-threaded relationship with your allocated accounts by providing high-quality customer engagement activities, leveraging x-functional partners and regional/global executives. Be open, collaborative and customer-focused in all communications and transactions with colleagues and clients. Use our CRM every day for tracking activities and, most importantly, forecasting. Speak at client & industry events across APAC in partnership with the Enterprise AE to generate demand and ensure attendance at various LinkedIn marketing & thought leadership events Thought leadership initiatives. As part of the AE/RM pod community, impact strategic and multi-threaded engagement within your territory through a planned and deliberate approach to engaging and nurturing targeted client communities (CXO, Sales/BU Leaders, CMO, Sales Operations, Program Leads/Managers, etc.)  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: 3+ years of sales and business development experience selling to Enterprise accounts.  Preferred Qualifications: Excellent communications, team collaboration and analytical skills. Experience in multi-threaded engagement, selling to EVPs, CXOs and end-users (in the same sales cycle) in both individual and team sales environments Experience in solution selling to large regional/global customers, with complex organization structure Experience in managing multiple pilot projects. Demonstrated success in driving new business sales, and ability to develop and manage a sales execution plan at an account and/or territory level. Proven success in selling SaaS or disruptive technology in an Enterprise environment.  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Company Description  Imagine what we can do together. At LinkedIn, we believe amazing things can happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging and their ideas are heard. Join us and help make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can.  Job Description  LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers. Everyday millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. Our mission is to create economic opportunity for every member of the workforce.  At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works and take that leap in your career transformation journey.  The Opportunity  We are looking for a Sales Manager to lead a team of Regional Account Managers within our Global Clients Program (GCP) in growing and maintaining relationships with our most strategic global customers. Your team will be responsible for learning the entire suite of LinkedIn’s Talent Solutions, understanding how they are used and valued by our customers, and making compelling recommendations for additional investments and renewals in LinkedIn.  Your team will be responsible for a book of current customers, involvement in large centralized global contracts and outbound activity within the long tail of your portfolio. Your team will also partner with a select group of global clients to identify solutions that can help them achieve their business and talent objectives.  LinkedIn provides a flexible, high-growth environment where dedicated sales professionals are given the opportunity to excel and be recognized for outstanding results. LinkedIn’s sales team consists of smart, ambitious, and collaborative individuals who excel at leadership, leverage, results, and enhancement of corporate culture.  Responsibilities  Develop and execute a focused sales strategy to renew and expand the customer base for our Global Clients Enterprise. Drive a culture of forecasting excellency across the team and similarly prepare and present accurate sales forecasts to senior management. Prioritize initiatives, create focus for the team and hold them accountable to the use of systems, tools, sales process, and methodology. Directly manage the day-to-day operations of the team with the ability to grow and scale, as necessary. Manage escalations and participate directly in all aspects of the sales cycle to ensure customer and member satisfaction. Be directly involved with the mentorship and development of the team including recruiting, hiring, training and compassionately performance managing new Regional Account Managers. You should have a particular emphasis on coaching and be fully conversant in relation to our Value Engagement and Blueprint methodologies. Ability to build and foster strong cross-functional partnerships. Collaborate with senior leadership to define segment strategy and lead high impact initiatives to fuel new growth areas. Excellent communication skills including active listening, written and verbal across all channels. Demonstrated commitment to building diverse teams and fostering an inclusive team culture.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: 8+ years of quota-carrying sales experience. 2+ years of direct people management experience Experience working with Global Clients or Enterprise customers  Preferred Qualifications: A demonstrated track record of exceeding sales targets. Cross-functional partnership, account team, solution selling, team selling environment experience. Experience with managing through significant change. Expertise in the understanding and application of relevant sales methodologies and metrics. Ability to evaluate sound business opportunities and close deals. Strong knowledge of CRM (Customer Relationship Management) tools to manage sales-related activities. Excellent time management skills and ability to prioritize multiple projects and to guide/direct others. Strong oral/written communication and negotiating skills. Excellent client management, presentation skills and conflict resolution ability. A history of strong Executive level client relationships.  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  What You’ll Be Doing …  The Business Development Representative (BDR) are tasked with strategically developing and qualifying revenue opportunities within their assigned territory. BDR work closely with their Account Executives in a business development capacity. Candidates for this position must be highly motivated, tenacious, and self starters.  We are currently seeking high-energy, driven professionals with sound business acumen and natural sales instincts to join our fast-paced and dynamic team. Ideal candidates should be eager to advance through a clearly defined learning and earning path. Salesforce.com offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be provided the tools, resources and outstanding leadership to sell business application solutions and take your career to the next level!  Some of the things you’ll be doing include … Generate new business opportunities to fuel the sales Pipeline for our products across our Enterprise Accounts Create and prioritize strategic target account lists within India. Research and build "cold accounts" (i.e.: adding contacts, sending emails, cold calling) Consistently meet or exceed monthly sales targets/quotas. Conduct high level conversations with Senior Executives in prospect accounts Evangelize Salesforce and the On-Demand model  Who You Are … Experienced.Relevant experience in sales and/or lead qualification (including outbound prospecting). Domain.Experience with lead qualification at all levels within organizations – managers, directors, VPs, executives. Effective Communicator.You are clear and persuasive in both verbal and written English communications with highly effective use of email and telephone. Technically Savvy.Proficient with standard corporate productivity tools. Performer. Ability to work in a high energy, fast ‐ paced sales environment You are a Recruiter!Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!  Tableau will operate independently under the Tableau brand, driving forward a continued focus on our mission, our customers and our Tableau Community. The acquisition closed on August 1, 2019, and Tableau is a wholly-owned subsidiary of salesforce.com, inc. RTB demand deals with direct advertiser and publishers WW to help them meet their performance/brand objectives in terms of revenue/growth across Video/Display/CPI/Rich Media/OpenRtb spaces RTB demand is HQed in the US with offices in Singapore, Bangalore, and having a presence in China as well through its partners If you want to be part of this growing team which is changing the way business is done in digital space Join us About the Founder Graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and has pivoted and successfully run several startups in Financial, E-commerce space. description: About The Team  After acquiring our digital banking licence, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market aggressively.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  Job Description Collaborate with Sales Leaders on driving key business objectives Responsible for incentives and KPI setting, headcount planning and development of future strategies Business performance evaluation Produce weekly/monthly operational reports for Sales Team and Sales Management Produce ad hoc reports/analysis for Sales Leadership team Initiate BD Projects that help our sales teams perform better Uncover and implement policies and processes to increase productivity, efficiency, and accuracy within our sales teams Lead Generation  Requirements Good university degree 1-3 years of experience in a Sales Operations / Sales Analyst / Business Analyst / Consulting role Experience assessing Sales Capacity and developing Sales KPI as well as corresponding Incentive Plans

description: Empower the Individual Through Crypto  Gemini is a crypto exchange and custodian that allows customers to buy, sell, store, and earn more than 30 cryptocurrencies like bitcoin, bitcoin cash, ether, litecoin, and Zcash. Gemini is a New York trust company that is subject to the capital reserve requirements, cybersecurity requirements, and banking compliance standards set forth by the New York State Department of Financial Services and the New York Banking Law. Gemini was founded in 2014 by twin brothers Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss to empower the individual through crypto.  Crypto is about giving you greater choice, independence, and opportunity. We are here to help you on your journey. We build crypto products that are simple, elegant, and secure. Whether you are an individual or an institution, we want to help you buy, sell, and store your bitcoin and cryptocurrency. Crypto is not just a technology, it's a movement.  At Gemini, our mission is to empower the individual and that includes giving our employees flexibility of choice — our Office Optional Policy allows employees to choose to work from one of our physical locations or from home.  Select roles that are location-specific will still be eligible for flexible schedules  The Department: Business Development  Transforming finance and empowering the individual through crypto is a deeply human pursuit. In Business Development we build relationships, are on the front lines of all critical customer service issues, and help manage the customer lifecycle through pivotal stages in their Gemini journey. Whether it’s identifying new key institutional clients or servicing a retail customer’s needs, our goal is the same: deliver for our customers no matter what.  The Role: Business Development Associate  Gemini is looking for a Business Development Associate to grow our business in Singapore by promoting Gemini’s unique value proposition in the financial space. This person will play a significant part in broadening Gemini’s reputation as a trusted, secure cryptocurrency exchange for institutional clients and will use a thoughtful, authentic, and knowledgeable approach to sales to both gain new business and to cultivate established relationships.  This position is full-time and will report into the Director of Business Development at Gemini’s office in Singapore, and will work closely with Gemini’s global BD team.  Responsibilities Support Business Development team members in the acquisition and management of ultra-high net worth and institutional client relationships Become a subject matter expert for Gemini’s exchange, Gemini CustodyTM, and other institutional products Work closely with Gemini’s compliance, financial operations, and product teams to support institutional clients in a timely and detail-oriented manner Own relationship management processes for existing and acquired institutional clients Develop a solution-driven approach to serve our institutional client base which may require creative out of the box thinking and working closely with our offices globally Engage in good internal stakeholder management Minimum Qualifications 3+ years of relevant experience in sales and in financial services (buy side and/or sell side), with a clear track record of meeting and exceeding sales and revenue goals A resourceful self-starter and tenacious problem-solver, willing to roll up one's sleeves to meet client needs and improve client experience Excellent verbal/written communication, strong interpersonal and presentation skills Strong attention to detail, work ethic, and time management skills Ability to multi-task and collaborate cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment Proficiency in client relationship management processes and best practices Passion for learning about new technology and the digital asset industry Comfortable working in an evolving, high growth startup environment and great in managing internal stakeholders Bilingual in English and Mandarin Preferred Qualifications Experience in cryptocurrency market Passion for cryptocurrency industry Experience in a startup environment Understands derivatives and the general crypto derivatives landscape It Pays to Work Here  We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes: Competitive Compensation and Profit-Sharing Equity Flexible vacation policy Retirement Plan Matching Generous Parental leave Comprehensive health plans Training and professional development At Gemini, we strive to build diverse teams that reflect the people we want to empower through our products, and we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. Equal Opportunity is the Law, and Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. If you have a specific need that requires accommodation, please let a member of the People Team know.

jobTitle: International Growth Consultant, Large Customer Sales
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of experience in sales, marketing, digital advertising, consulting, or related field. Experience working in or with international teams/customers.  Preferred qualifications: Experience promoting to or consulting with app developers and companies. Experience with gaming app business growth and marketing strategy. Experience applying data-driven models that impact business growth and marketing operations across international markets. Understanding of the business and cultural nuances throughout APAC. Outstanding communication skills with the ability to align multiple stakeholders internally and externally to defined goals and deliverables.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grows. You leverage your entrepreneurial drive to target, educate and persuade new customers to embrace Google's latest advertising products and technologies. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, understand the details of individual campaigns and persistently explore and uncover the business needs of key clients. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  In this role, you'll be a trusted advisor and partner to our customers; from strategic planning support, identifying markets, and setting them up for success within their region, you'll help customers reach and exceed their ambitions.  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Develop relationships to serve as a consultant with international customers to fuel their advertising growth. Understand your customers’ objectives, develop forward-thinking, data-driven export business recommendations, and educate customers on broader export-related topics and opportunities. Identify export opportunities based on existing frameworks and tools; develop ideas and approaches to drive export growth for your assigned portfolio. Partner with sales and cross-functional teams to manage support from expansion strategy to campaign execution. Assist in growing export acumen and resources within Google; participate in and lead external workshops and trainings to educate customers beyond your assigned portfolio on export opportunities and strategies.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: About The Role  At ClassPass we believe partnering with companies who share our values can help thousands of more people live active lives. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly-motivated individual to help grow our burgeoning corporate sales channel.  The right candidate isn’t afraid of striking up a conversation with someone they just met. They think outside the box, by iterating on a pitch deck, crafting a convincing email proposal or influencing stakeholders to close a deal. This role is ideal for someone who’s a few years into their sales career and is looking to get more experience in relationship-based selling and prospecting.  Key Responsibilities Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls, emails and SDR set up meetings Research, prospect and engage new medium to large corporate partners in ClassPass markets Manage your own opportunities by utilising CRM, email and outreach tools and resources to cultivate and maintain sales pipeline Drive through the full sales cycle by making/sending introductory calls and emails, assessing and building the relationship, performing sales presentations and closing the deal Develop creative, fun, and innovative ways in which you connect and build out your relationships with potential clients and share across the team Attend various industry events and conferences including organising and hosting stands Share good knowledge of the HR/Benefit world and how ClassPass fits in Manage sales pipeline and project management of signed accounts Collaborate with the Corporate Account Management team to ensure the smooth onboarding of a corporate partner Achieve, and consistently exceed monthly sales goals Maintaining daily KPIs and metrics Contribute to company wide projects Skills & Experience Proven experience within sales, preferably selling to HR teams A strong problem solver with the hustle and drive to hit, or even better, exceed goals A strong negotiator with a passion for results Strong relationship builder; comfortable and confident with a wide range of decision makers (internal and external) and happy to collaborate with other teams Willingness to make multiple sales calls and email contacts per day Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability to multitask, prioritise, and manage time effectively Right to work in Singapore Who We Are  ClassPass is revolutionizing the fitness and wellness industry by bringing together the world’s best classes and experiences into one app. Founded in 2013 by Payal Kadakia, ClassPass connects members to millions of classes in 30 countries around the globe, and is now available as a wellness benefit with some of the world’s leading employers. We make it easy to prioritize your health, whether you decide to head to a local studio, play an on-demand workout or book yourself a much needed wellness appointment. Over 100 million reservations later, we truly believe that we’re just getting started.  What We Believe  At ClassPass, we believe in the power of movement. But we believe in more than just that. We believe in building for the future, creating more opportunities for everyone around the world to live fully and in good health. We believe that we can always push ourselves and our company to be better, and that there is power in the hard things when we’re all working together toward the same goal. We believe in building a diverse company where a sense of belonging is felt by employees, customers and partners alike. And we believe that the secret to ClassPass’ success is its people.  ClassPass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected characteristics.

description: Exceptional opportunity to join a high growth Analytics & AI firm that focuses on the Energy & commodities market.  Our client is looking for a Sales Director to join their Singapore based APAC sales team, owning a vast part of the region and looking to play a major part in their ambitious growth plans.  In this role, you will proactively develop new relationships with Oil, Gas, Chemicals and Shipping companies and be the first point of contact for incoming sales leads, responsible for generating qualified sales opportunities, moving leads through the pipeline and researching new markets and client segments. You will leverage your existing network of contacts to promote our client's subscription products and solutions in your region.  You will report into the MD for Asia and work closely with the Product, Customer Success and Sales Revenue Operations functions to provide a best-in-class experience for prospective and existing clients.  You must be a driven self-starter that thrives in the face of challenge, with a resourceful and positive approach to problem-solving in a fast-paced and constantly evolving scale-up environment.  Responsibilities: Achieving the yearly sales and revenue targets by identifying, building, and strengthening relationships with prospects, customers, and partners Incoming lead qualification and outreach to target accounts Proactively developing new relationships through phone email and other channels where appropriate to establish meetings with decision makers and influencers at our target accounts Developing a deep knowledge of our clients and prospects; developing supportive and collaborative long-term relationships with them Collaborating daily with the MD of Asia, as well as Product, Customer Success, Marketing and Revenue Operations to research target accounts, map user personas, identify key players, generate interest, and develop target accounts and account plans Utilizing pipeline and CRM tools to ensure information about prospects and clients is recorded and well-maintained Maintaining and continuously developing a robust pipeline of commercial opportunities, including assessments of contract risk and up-sell potential, and detailed records of client interactions within our CRM application to build and manage an appropriate level of pipeline to support quota and sales cycles Driving local partnerships in Asia where needed to better serve our customers  It would be great if you also.. Thrive on working in a fast paced, scale-up environment Are passionate about the energy industry and our customers Have excellent engagement and influencing skills with an ability to establish trusted advisor relationships with business decision makers Have values and mindset that closely match ours Have an entrepreneurial spirit Have exceptional organizational skills and communication skills Have strong business acumen and problem-solving skills Are results orientated with the ability to prioritize multiple objectives Are self-sufficient and able to work without the need for close management Value working in an open and collaborative environment  Skills & Experience... Hunter mentality and track record of new business success in a proactive sales environment 6+ years’ experience within a sales or business development role within the energy commodities industry (SaaS Sales a plus) in a solution sales environment Strong relationship building and relationship management skills Excellent communication skills – verbal and written in English. Mandarin a plus Experience using CRM systems, such as HubSpot and Salesforce The best product in the market with significant technology edge over competitors - and high conversion rate  In return, they offer.. A competitive remuneration package Medical and dental insurance Stock-options in a fast-growing, high-potential business A vibrant and diverse workplace An open, collaborative, and supportive working culture built on merit, which celebrates creative thinking and “getting things done.” The opportunity to work with AI-driven technology in a scale-up environment with commodity trading experts Continuous training and development opportunities  Please feel free to reach out for a confidential discussion.
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: After acquiring our digital banking licence, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market aggressively.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  We are looking for someone to Amplify and Supercharge our sales teams by: Collaborating with Sales Leaders on driving key business objectives Being responsible for incentives and KPI setting, HC planning and Development of future strategies Evaluating business performance Producing weekly/monthly operational reports for Sales Team and Sales Management Producing ad hoc reports/analysis for Sales Leadership team Initiating BD Projects that help our sales teams perform better Uncovering and implementing policies and processes to increase productivity, efficiency, and accuracy within our sales teams Generating leads  In short, we are looking for an experienced analyst in sales strategy and operations, who can play as a trusted advisor to the sales leadership team.  Requirements: University degree 1-3 years of experience in a Sales Operations / Sales Analyst / Business Analyst / Consulting role Experience assessing Sales Capacity and developing Sales KPI as well as corresponding Incentive Plans
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: We are inviting individuals who share our values of constantly doing things that make sense, willing to face challenges, making necessary sacrifices, and adapting to changes.  The ideal candidate is someone who has a client-centric mindset and is capable of analyzing customer behavior in a dynamic environment. As a Sales Executive, your primary focus will be cultivating strong client relationships. You will bridge the gap between merchants, key business stakeholders, and customers. You are expected to have strong interpersonal and communication skills to collaborate across departments in enhancing the effectiveness and efficiency of the business operations and sales strategies.  Therefore, a commitment to overcome difficult challenges and the conviction to serve merchants and users are must-have qualities.  Responsibilities: Attending networking activities to research and connect with prospective clients. Maintaining meaningful relationships with existing clients by having genuine interests in minimizing frictions in their day to day business operations. Build customer relationships through strategic conversations to understand organizational business objectives and goals. Conduct comprehensive research for all merchants which are in Singapore that are suitable for our products and services. Find solutions for all the problems that occur during the operation hours of all existing merchants which include physically being at merchants’ business locations as soon as problems appear. Facilitate proper onboarding of merchants by being physically present at the merchant’s site for roughly two weeks to assist on matters relating to taking orders, serving their customers, and guiding merchants on the operation of the app while introducing and explain the app to new and existing users. Analyze feedback from both merchants and their customers to provide solutions on how current approaches can be improved. Provide support for day-to-day operations as required.  Key Qualifications: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills while capable of working under pressure. Exhibits strong communication, relationship management, and customer retention skills. A great team player who can work with internal and external partners with an immense amount of curiosity to learn from the best practices. Ability to manage time, smartly organize work priorities, and multi-task in an efficient and effective manner. Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision. Good computer literacy and proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.

About this opportunity FastJobs has consistently ranked among the top recruitment apps in Singapore since our launch in April 2015. Our team is committed to making job opportunities accessible to everyone, and we're continuing to develop new solutions to help that happen. We have a great product, fantastic feedback from the market, and are embarking on our next ambitious goal for the Singapore market- to be the top of mind for all employers looking to hire. To join us in that journey, we're looking for a driven and inspirational Head of Sales to grow and lead the sales team.  Job Description Reporting to the General Manager for Singapore, this role will be responsible for leading a team of account managers to hit aggressive growth targets. You will craft sales strategy together with the GM and lead your team to execute those strategies. As a sales leader, you enable, guide and grow your team members, and in building a strong team servicing our employers, establish FastJobs as a leading solution for employers.   The success of this role will be measured on the following criteria:  Team management and creating a robust culture Driving and optimising sales strategies based on data & feedback Sales target achievement & P&L management Engaging the key clients and providing the best solutions to address their business needs Client satisfaction, experience and retention Constructive collaboration with the rest of the FastJobs team  The Successful Applicant As a successful applicant, you will have:  8 years or more experience in B2B sales with at least 5 years in Singapore Minimum 2 years in a leadership role Expertise in crafting sales strategies to maximise limited resources Expertise in identifying, qualifying and closing business Strong collaborative player that believes in developing the strengths of the team Excellent attitude and strong communication skills An affinity to working in a build-test-learn environment  What's on Offer This is a challenging role aimed at individuals who are looking for a growth environment that rewards based on team success.

Company Description  Imagine what we can do together. At LinkedIn, we believe amazing things can happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging and their ideas are heard. Join us and help make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can.  Job Description  We are looking for a  Account Executive (Talent Solutions)  to join our team in tapping into potential client opportunities and generating new business for corporate accounts ranging from start-ups to large enterprises in Singapore.  What You’ll Do: Prospect relentlessly to build pipeline and build strong personal relationships with prospects Create reliable forecasts and be completely transparent with management on the pipeline status Close new business consistently at or above quota level Develop and execute on a strategic plan for the territory and document and distribute competitive information Invest in colleagues and give coaching and advice when you see an opportunity for improvement Work to develop and circulate the set of best practices that will be the foundation of this team Travel (approximately 10%)  What Success Looks Like: Listen to the needs of the market and share insights with product and marketing teams Be proactive about solving problems even if it’s outside of your area and be ready to take on additional initiatives and responsibilities as they emerge Seek out opportunities to be a leader and do everything you can to help the company achieve its larger objectives  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: BA/BS degree in a related field or equivalent experience 3+ years of experience in a quota-carrying sales role  Preferred Qualifications: Experience with recruiting, recruitment media and HR software Experience with SaaS opportunities and Salesforce.com platform Experience selling IT or recruiting solutions Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions Strong negotiation and accurate forecasting skills Demonstrated ability to find, manage and close high-level business in an evangelist sales environment Ability to assess business opportunities and use data to inform decision making and persuade others Ability to manage a large number of prospect situations simultaneously while positioning company products against direct and indirect competitors  You’ll Benefit From Our Culture  We  strongly believe in the well-being of our employees and their families. That’s why we offer generous health and wellness programs and time away for employees of all levels. description: We are seeking a new Senior Business Development Manager . You will be responsible for acquisition of new clients and requires relevant sales experience. You will drive business development efforts that generate leads, enhance brand visibility, and increase sales. In addition to personal sales goals and assigned targets, you will be pivotal in winning business to reach targeted goals by ensuring that leads are exchanged, relationships are managed, and clients are given a seamless experience — working with the international business development team, as well as Space Matrix offices in Asia and the US.   In Brief   ● You will Drive business development efforts in the region, acquire new clients and manage sales targets . ● You will Gather market intelligence, including information on clients and competitors in the Workplace Market Sector, industry trends, future projects, etc. ● You will Generate and track leads and forecast your sales efforts to create new bookings. ● You will Develop and take part in pitches and other presentations that meet the client’s needs and expectations. ● You will Work closely with the Director and the Team to complete the sales cycle ● You will Collaborate in developing the systems, materials, and resources necessary for business development, including proposals, presentations, and serving offerings to win work. ● You will Represent Space Matrix by targeting potential clients, project partners, and collaborators; identifying opportunities; building relationships; and creating direct and indirect advocacy affiliations to expand Space Matrix’s competitive position.    What We Expect ● You have Experience in managing complex sales cycle with B2B selling process to multi-national companies ● You have Undergraduate or graduate degree in business, marketing, or another field relevant to this role, with a minimum of 10 years of sales/ business development experience. ● You have Knowledge of the Workplace Market Sector in Asia-Pacific including competitive positioning and strategy. ● You Should be able to travel in the Asia-Pacific region. ● You have Experience working in Architecture, Interior Design firms or related fields. ● You have Experience working in Multinational companies.   Who we are   Space Matrix is a dynamic and innovative design consultancy that specializes in workplace  design. With relevant project experience in over 30 cities and 15 office locations in Australia, China, India, Thailand, Singapore and the United States, our mission is to be the No. 1 office design firm in Asia and to continue revolutionizing the delivery of design and build globally.   We have a company culture that is transparent, collaborative, innovative, progressive, honest   and fast. Be part of the team that constantly challenges the industry norm and wants to be the best in the game.   To find out more visit www.spacematrix.com
industries: Design, Commercial Real Estate, and Real Estate

description: Job Description  Sales Solutions - Enterprise Account Executive  Location: Singapore  LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume – we transform lives through innovative products and technology.  Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.  LinkedIn’s Sales Solutions team is dedicated to changing the world of sales through the use of Sales Navigator, our flagship product that connects and builds mutually beneficial relationships between buyers and sellers. As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will use your strategic social selling skills to educate prospective customers on the benefits and value of Sales Navigator. You will serve as a trusted adviser, share insights and continually seek opportunities for growth to make your customers as strong and successful as possible.  Responsibilities  Inspire yourself, our company and your customers to embrace a new method of connecting value to customers Leverage your skills and your customers’ experience to continually evolve our product and the sales process Develop and execute strategic plans for your territory and create reliable forecasts Consistently over achieve the business and revenue objectives set forth in your plan Drive revenue by connecting with customers and building opportunities that will make all parties more successful Work to develop and circulate a set of best practices that will be the foundation of this growing team Listen to the needs of the market and share them with the Product and Marketing team  Basic Qualifications  8 + years of experience in a quota-carrying sales role Experience selling SaaS solutions, CRM platforms or software platform solutions  Preferred Qualifications  Experience in a SaaS-based environment Experience using LinkedIn as a sales professional Proven history of overachieving quota and results in a large, high-growth company Demonstrated ability to find, manage and close high-level business sales Ability to assess business opportunities and read prospective buyers Ability to predictably forecast and execute on business goals Ability to use insights and data-driven decisions in the sales process Ability to effectively build trust-based relationships with senior-level sales professionals Ability to bring together multiple buyers in the same company to build groundswell while leveraging partners within LinkedIn to effectively evangelize the solution  Additional Information  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.
