description: Position Snapshot  Location: Eightrium, Changi Business Park, Singapore  Company: Nestlé Singapore  Type of contract: Permanent  Position Summary  Joining Nestlé means you are joining the largest Food and Beverage Company in the world. At our very core, we are a human environment – passionate people driven by the purpose of enhancing the quality of life and contributing to a healthier future. A Nestle career empowers you to make an impact locally and globally, as you are provided with the opportunity to make a mark and stand out, as long as you seek it. With Nestle, you are enabled and encouraged to grow not only as professionals, but also as people.  We are looking for an experienced Key Account Manager to maintain solid relationships with our company's key clients and grow the company’s revenue in the assigned channel. Key responsibilities include growing the company's revenue by identifying new business opportunities to maximize distribution, sales and profitability in either the Horeca or General Trade channel.  A day in the life of... Support the National Channel Manager in executing and optimizing Trade Term Negotiations, the development of channel and customer strategies. Support and contribute to Category strategies & Category Sales developments and Shopper Insights to Channels & Category Sales Development team. Involved in integrated Commercial Planning for Channel/Customer delivering rolling 18-month commercial plans and execute strategies & standards within framework developed by Channels & Category Sales development. Execute Point-of-Purchase Strategies delivering Total Trade Spend efficiency and effectiveness. Develop Annual Activity Plan with marketing/ Channel & Category Sales Development team. Manage Channel Trade Spend within Total Trade Spend allocation at category level and support the route to market distribution plan strategies. Work with the Channel & Category Sales Development team to develop Customer Cycle Activity & budget plan. Involved in Monthly Forecast Review plan and Category Management projects with our retailers and communicate with Field Sales to achieve execution of plans and desired merchandising in stores. Involved in promotion management & evaluation to ensure cost effectiveness & ROI by Channel and Customer Promo Mechanics. What Will Make You Successful Bachelors' Degree in Business Management, Marketing or equivalent At least 4-6 years of commercial experience demonstrated in account management/ brand/ trade marketing in the FMCG industry Experience in training: Customer Management Best Practice, Foundation of Strategic Category Marketing & Total Trade Spend Strategy Possess distributor management and business managerial experience within sales, marketing, trade marketing or commercial function
industries: Consumer Goods, Food & Beverages, and Food Production

description: Darktrace is rapidly expanding due to unprecedented growth and accelerating revenue. We are looking for ambitious and driven candidates with previous B2B sales experience to join our vibrant, friendly and fast paced Inside Sales team based at our Singapore offices.  You’ll be working in a high growth sector and will be well rewarded for your efforts with uncapped commission. You will be provided with extensive training and support from your mentors and team leader.  Day-to-day you’ll be: Sharing your passion for cyber security whilst making outbound calls and setting appointments Researching and contacting decision makers Providing regular metrics and reports Following up on prospects and booking meetings after events Inviting VIP guests to events  You’ll likely have: A minimum of 1 – 2 years’ previous experience of cold calling outbound sales – showing us your enthusiasm and drive for a career in sales Clear communication skills, able to be compelling with a variety of individuals Resilience and tenacity – you will be able to bounce back and carry on  More about us: Darktrace’s mission is to make the world more secure in the face of targeted threats and evolving, machine-speed attacks. Our award winning technology applies cutting-edge machine learning and mathematics to the field of cyber-security. By augmenting human security teams and autonomously detecting and responding to attacks, Darktrace’s Cyber AI Platform reduces the risks of data theft and technology disruption that organizations face on a daily basis.  Founded in 2013, Darktrace currently has over 1,500 worldwide employees spread across over 40 countries. The technical hub and headquarters are located in Cambridge, UK, with a US headquarters in San Francisco, CA.  This is an excellent opportunity to join a fast-growing company that was recently named one of Fast Company’s 50 ‘World’s Most Innovative Companies’.  For more information on our cutting edge products and company please visit our website www.darktrace.com
industries: Computer & Network Security

description: Job Description  The successful candidate will be part of SIA's Sales & Marketing Division.  Key Responsibilities Responsible for the revenue performance of corporate accounts assigned Understand corporate accounts’ travel policies and needs (key routes, travel class, price sensitivity) Prepare account plans and conduct regular reviews with corporate accounts and ensuring their commitment to the agreed targets Propose and execute interventions as needed to drive performance via sales levers (e.g. discount levels, overall net pricing, soft benefits, etc.) File sales reports and sales action plans in Sales Management Tool (SMT) Develop and maintain good relationship with corporate travel managers, procurement personnel and all key influencers within the corporate accounts including regular travelers and their travel arrangers Embark on initiatives to create brand affinity with corporate travelers and their travel arrangers Coordinate performance review, engagement and interventions with Global Account Managers for global corporate accounts Maintain good working relationships with travel management companies (TMCs) Organize corporate engagement events Participate in corporate RFPs and negotiate corporate agreements of existing and/or new corporate accounts Represent SIA in industry events, trade shows, fairs, etc. Meet, present and sign up new accounts based on leads and referrals from TMCs, Corporate Sales Support Desk, etc. Gather market intelligence on competitors' activities in the corporate segment Any other duties as assigned. Requirements A degree in any discipline Prior experience in aviation industry will be an advantage Customer-focused and results-focused Good communication and interpersonal skills
industries: Airlines/Aviation

description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 10 years of experience in sales and sales management. Experience leading, coaching, and mentoring teams.  Preferred qualifications:  < Experience creating and implementing sales strategies with customers. Passion for value-based solution selling with a drive to innovate. Track record of building top performing teams through coaching and frequent, high quality feedback, and role modeling a growth mindset. Ability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment with excellent problem-solving, creative thinking and analytical skills. Ability to take ownership for decisions, secures support, and remove key obstacles. Effective at influencing others, and driving cross-functional collaboration.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Google Customer Solutions (GCS) sales teams are trusted advisors and promoters who maintain a relentless focus on customer success by bringing the best Google has to offer. Our GCS team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic, and customer-focused members help entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We grow the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers, and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends.  As a Sales Manager for Mid-Market Sales, you will lead a high-performing sales team, who works directly with medium- and large-sized advertisers in Singapore. Through educating and consulting customers directly, you will help develop compelling and scalable solutions for our customers, and coach your team on growing customers’ advertising business at scale, utilizing digital advertising in Search, Display, and Video in an increasingly mobile world.  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  Responsibilities  Manage, inspire and motivate a team of client-facing and high-performing Googlers to create a goal-oriented culture with inclusivity and collaboration in mind. Coach your team on engaging with and influencing stakeholders across your team’s portfolios to deliver client success and shared business results. Lead your team in analyzing customer data and industry trends to develop strategic plans for customers and/or partners. Lead and strengthen executive-level relationships through key C-level meetings, business reviews and speaking engagements. Ensure team readiness to deliver digital complex solutions. Create a culture of sales innovation and customer success on the team based on diverse, equitable and inclusive team environment.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: Job Description:  Get to know the team  You will be part of an exciting sales team that is responsible for acquiring, growing and managing the accounts of key merchants and partners for GrabRewards in Singapore.  Day to day activities Develop a sales pipeline of partners for GrabRewards Pitch and sign partners for the sales of GrabRewards Points Acquire and manage a portfolio of rewards partners, responsible for driving redemption Manage rewards inventory, replenishment and breakage. Cross sell Grab’s services to merchants / partners Collaborate and work across functions to deliver on partnership plans The must haves Experienced in sales and/or account management in financial services, technology or FMCG Self-motivated, results oriented, problem solver Confident, able to engage with senior executives Numerate and analytical, able to develop cogent business plans Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish rapport with clients across all levels High energy, organized, and independent Bachelor degree, min. 5 years of work experience (min. 3 years of relevant sales / AM experience)
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Job Description  Customer Sales Representative, Singapore  THE OPPORTUNITY Exciting opportunity to join the sales division of a global biopharmaceutical company that has been in the business for more than 25 years and in Asia Pacific for over 60 years. Be part of a high-performing Sales team to drive strong results for the business and significant impact for customers Based in Singapore, the regional hub for Asia Pacific (AP) and named one of the Best Companies to Work for in 2020 by Straits Times Best Employers 2021 Our Sales team support our customers by providing clinical information about products, educational information, clinical training programs and resources. We support healthcare providers and healthcare systems meet the goals of the patients in their communities.  What You Will Do  Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to  Strategic Sales Objectives & Sales Expertise (50%) To achieve strategic objectives as required by the franchise (eg market growth, sales growth, number of new accounts, formulary listings, new product market priming) Demonstrate high level of sales expertise and relationship management (through product & TA knowledge, selling skills, product presentation skills & managing customers) Be accountable for sales, activities, and compliance within the assigned territory Territory Management Proactively plan and optimize overall sales results performance through effective territory management Seek Contract opportunities, suggest and negotiate optimum pricing Demonstrate ability to resolve problems in timely manner, escalate issues early Marketing Planning, Operations & Key Program Implementation (25%) Active involvement in annual brand planning process Effective planning & execution of marketing/promotional activities according to plan (eg FGM, L&L, SL engagement program, patient programs, public forums) Ensure timely submission and approval of documentations for planned activities In compliant with internal medical, legal & compliance processes Account Management (25%) Build and execute account plans for key accounts, through in-depth understanding of customers (profile/behavior/relationship network/needs etc) What You Must Have  To be successful in this role you must have  Qualification A good Degree in Pharmacy/ Biomedical Science/ Arts/ Busines. Experience 3+ years pharmaceutical sales experience in Pharmaceutical industry Experience in Oncology is an added advantage Strong presentation skills, positive attitude, and strong sales achievement Strong customer focus and proven relationship building skills Good track record in sales, with a history of achieving results Experience in handling projects from end to end What You Can Expect Competitive remuneration Limitless opportunities across various areas in IT; well-structured career path You will tackle the biggest challenges in the healthcare industry and information technology Innovative and flexible working environment Opportunity to learn and enjoy rewarding career that technology companies don’t bring; the satisfaction of saving lives and making an impact! Who We Are…  We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.  What We Look For…  In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.  We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.  Current Employees apply HERE  Current Contingent Workers apply HERE  Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully  Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme Corp., Kenilworth, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.  Employee Status  Regular  Relocation  No relocation  VISA Sponsorship  Travel Requirements  Flexible Work Arrangements  Shift  Valid Driving License  Yes  Hazardous Material(s)  Number of Openings  1  Requisition ID R131100
industries: Biotechnology, Pharmaceuticals, and Veterinary

description: Hi, I’m Austin Essam, Senior Manager Sales Development at Puppet,  We are looking for a strategic Sales Development Representative (Thai speaking) to join our highly driven and talented team.  Our SDR's are a key part of selling products and services using modern prospecting techniques and best in class tools. This is a great opportunity for an aspiring inside sales professional or graduate who wants to learn how to prospect and generate business. Cohesion on this team is key, so if you’re applying, you’ll need to be a team player! You will learn how to get and keep the attention of Global 5000 prospects amidst all the noise by researching companies and people, building contact portfolio’s, creating personalised/bespoke prospecting plans and delivering this via a multi-media approach. Our team has a burning desire to be successful and exceed expectations, that means the very best will be demanded of you.   At Puppet, the Sales Development Team is the tip of the arrow for sales and predominantly works outbound with some inbound responsibilities. We work closely with Marketing to make the most of campaigns, events, webinars and workshops, while also work closely with the field team/Account Directors to leverage their territory knowledge and strategies to build pipeline.  As a Sales Development Representative at Puppet, you will:  Drive net new business acquisition Expansion & growth of Tier Two customers  Build strategic outbound prospecting strategies to target G5K accounts, underpinned by an account based sales development methodology Produce qualified prospects by following up on inbound leads Align to force management (MEDDPICC) sales methodology Nurture prospects over time, discover needs, offer relevant resources, and learn where they are in the buying process to help propel the sale forward for Account Directors  Conduct pre-event activities to drive attendance to a specific event or post-event follow up to increase our connection with attendees. Build your knowledge about Puppet offerings and our value proposition so that you can have knowledgeable conversations with potential customers and prospects. Work closely with Account Directors to develop strategies for their territories and execute tactical elements to support those. You will be in a unique position to learn from some of the most experienced Enterprise Sales Reps in our industry. No matter your background or tenure, there’s always something new to learn.  You are...  An excellent communicator with a high emotional IQ. You strive to be articulate and empathetic in your interactions. You have a way with words—you can write a great email and carry on a good conversation. You are a team player who values outcomes over effort—you are someone who is driven to succeed both as an individual but also as a team. You care about quality, wanting to get the job done as well as you can. Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions. Gutsy and self-directed when it comes to problem-solving and working on multiple projects at once. You’re looking to work with a team of high performers where you’ll be responsible for the impact you make and the freedom to explore your creativity. Working with folks in different time zones will be standard issue for you around here, so being able to stay determined, even when the answers aren’t in front of you, is essential. You are determined to succeed. A lot about being a successful SDR is attitude and drive. When the going gets rough, you don’t throw in the towel and accept defeat - you push forward and aim to win.  Valuable experiences and skills you’ll bring to Puppet  Preferred 1 years of work or internship experience in lead generation, sales, business, operations, marketing, or related Proven track record of achieving measurable goals Avid technology evangelist  Bonus, but not required  Sales Development, customer service, or account management experience for a SaaS or B2B solution Language skills (Thai)  Experience with Salesforce.com or other CRM Experience with Salesloft. Best practices and applicability Cold-calling experience a plus  We are hiring at various experience levels and we’re particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway!  *Visa Sponsorship Please note, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.  About Puppet Puppet’s core mission is to eliminate soul crushing work. We created the industry standard for managing infrastructure as code. And we didn’t stop there—our product portfolio has grown to help organizations automate across their entire software delivery lifecycle. With more than two-thirds of Fortune 100 companies using Puppet’s open source or commercial products, our code is helping power thousands of organizations across the world.  As the industry leader in DevOps solutions, we realize that our success is a collective effort; all made possible by the incredible people working here, our customers, partners, and Puppet community. Our culture is built on positivity, diversity, inclusivity and support—and we seek people who are resilient, entrepreneurial-minded, team players who continually strive to be incrementally better every single day. In our work together we aim to be curious, accountable, empathetic and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like the environment you’d thrive in, why not say hello?  Learn more about Puppet by checking out the values we live by and the awesome benefits and perks we offer employees!  Puppet is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, ancestry, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact +1-877-575-9775 for assistance.  Please see Puppet's privacy policy here.

description: About The Role  At ClassPass we believe partnering with companies who share our values can help thousands of more people live active lives. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly-motivated Corporate Sales Associate to support our Corporate Team and to help grow our burgeoning corporate sales channel.  The right candidate isn’t afraid of striking up a conversation with someone they just met. You're a master at market research, and aren't afraid to strike up a conversation with someone new. This role is ideal for someone who’s a couple of years into their sales career and is looking to get more experience in relationship-based selling and prospecting.  Key Responsibilities Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls, emails and SDR set up meetings Research, prospect and engage new small to medium corporate partners in ClassPass markets Continue developing understanding of HR/Benefits world and how ClassPass fits in Manage your own opportunities by utilising CRM, email and outreach tools and resources to cultivate and maintain sales pipeline Drive through the full sales cycle by making/sending introductory calls and emails, assessing and building the relationship, performing sales presentations and closing the deal. Develop creative, fun, and innovative ways in which you connect and build out your relationships with potential clients and share across the team Attend various industry events and conferences including hosting stands Achieve, and consistently exceed monthly sales goals Collaborate with the Corporate Account Management team to ensure the smooth onboarding of a corporate partner Maintaining daily KPIs and metrics Skills & Experience A natural problem solver with the hustle and drive to hit, or even better, exceed goals Strong relationship builder; comfortable and confident with a wide range of decision makers (internal and external) A natural negotiator with a passion for results A natural relationship builder with the ability to collaborate Willingness to make multiple sales calls and email contacts per day Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability to multi-task, prioritise, and manage time effectively Right to work in Singapore Who We Are  ClassPass is revolutionizing the fitness and wellness industry by bringing together the world’s best classes and experiences into one app. Founded in 2013 by Payal Kadakia, ClassPass connects members to millions of classes in 30 countries around the globe, and is now available as a wellness benefit with some of the world’s leading employers. We make it easy to prioritize your health, whether you decide to head to a local studio, play an on-demand workout or book yourself a much needed wellness appointment. Over 100 million reservations later, we truly believe that we’re just getting started.  What We Believe  At ClassPass, we believe in the power of movement. But we believe in more than just that. We believe in building for the future, creating more opportunities for everyone around the world to live fully and in good health. We believe that we can always push ourselves and our company to be better, and that there is power in the hard things when we’re all working together toward the same goal. We believe in building a diverse company where a sense of belonging is felt by employees, customers and partners alike. And we believe that the secret to ClassPass’ success is its people.  ClassPass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected characteristics.

description: We have a winning culture. But to win, hard skills are not enough. Just like in championship, our leaders need mental strength. We foster our Sales Leader’s mindset through a set of coaching system that we want to develop and empower in our people. These are the leaders who will be the core of our unique company culture.  What you can achieve: - Opportunities to travel overseas for business exposure and conference - Personal growth and development - Confidence over time and achievements  What do we see in you: - Competitiveness Driving yourself to be better than who you were before. To thrive in a 100% performance base environment and refuse to give up even after the buzz beater. - Team player Actively contribute to the team in order to meet desired goals. Respect team's idea and aim to improve the process at hand. - Not Afraid of Failure Always experimenting new ways to improve the process and in the mist of it, overcoming countless failures and still keep on going.  What you have to do: - Conduct face to face presentation to potential customers - Generate high quality sales and market shares - Assist in expansion of company’s operations  DON’T send in your resume if you just want a friendly match. SEND if you’re ready to win!

jobTitle: Business Development - Singapore, Account Management (Food & Beverage)
description: Job Description: Sub-Category Management Work with category manager to define, implement and execute the growth strategy for a sub-category Carry out analysis & survey to better understand brands and/or sellers requirements and behaviour Develop online merchandising and promotion proposals to achieve sales targets Work closely with internal teams (e.g. marketing, sales etc.) to secure and optimise the sub-category visibility and performance Relationship management Analyse brands and sellers' progress, activities, sales performance and category initiatives to drive transaction numbers and revenue Manage each account relationship by setting targets via joint-business planning Execute sales and marketing strategies to achieve category, brands and sellers ambitions Work closely with 3rd party partners to ensure all execution are completed successfully Partnerships Secure exclusive partner partnerships for key campaigns such as 9.9 and11.11 Secure new exclusive product launches, sponsorship and exciting mechanics each month/quarter for PR pushes Reporting Plan the B2C landscape for the assigned sub-category by analysing sales performance Work closely with the respective categories' RM and BI to achieve overall Food & Beverage category's mall target  Requirements: Bachelor's degree in any field, coupled with at least 2 to 5 years of working experience Experience in Food & Beverage industry, e-commerce industry, business development, sales or account management is a plus Excellent communication capability Strong analytical skills (proficiency in Microsoft Excel is required) Team player with an aptitude for work and the drive to constantly outperform your KPIs

description: Job Description  The successful candidate will be part of the Sales & Marketing Division, Global & Corporate Sales Department. He/She will be tasked with acquiring, managing and developing global corporate accounts, as well as leading the field in developing and implementing local corporate sales programmes. He/She will be expected to proactively network with Travel Management Companies (TMCs) and corporate accounts to garner market intelligence and competitor activities, and derive/execute sales strategies that will grow SIA Group market share. The successful candidate will also be involved in the development of MICE traffic amongst contracted corporate accounts or identify new leads.  Key Responsibilities Identifying new global corporate accounts and responding to Request For Proposals (RFPs) issued by companies. Analysing performance potential, preparing offers, and negotiating with prospective accounts to achieve a win-win commercial arrangement. Ensuring productivity of existing corporate accounts and the retention of corporate accounts at the end of the contract cycle. Maintaining effective working relationships with procurement personnel or decision makers at corporate accounts and their fulfilment agencies (ie TMCs). Liaising with stations on fare matters and finding resolution for any operational issues that arise for SIA corporate accounts. Conducting performance reviews with corporate accounts. Preparing and reviewing contract documentation to ensure that SIA's commercial interests are protected. Providing advice to corporate sales teams at stations on trends in travel procurement and how to address them in sales processes / fare structures etc. Sharing best practices / success stories across the network. Support sales recovery efforts. Required Skills Possess a good university degree in a related field and have good business acumen. Manage projects and communicate with various stakeholders. Respond quickly and effectively to the changing environment and difficult situations. Anticipate and respond to (internal/external) customers' needs and driven to deliver high-quality results.
industries: Airlines/Aviation

description: Singapore | Sales Team | Full-time  Are you passionate about understanding and giving the best to your prospects and customers?  Are you always ambitious in seeking newer sales opportunities?  Are you passionate about the mission, and ready to help Netcore take its message to businesses across Australia.  Then this is the role for you!  The Impact you will create:  ·        Build and grow a new market focusing on enterprise accounts through prospecting, collaborating with an SDR and networking ·        Conduct discovery calls, customized demos, and presentations to prospective customers. ·        Actively engage with key team members who share a passion about customer success ·        Effectively sell the value of Netcore to key stakeholders within the account while navigating a multi sponsor sales process including stakeholders across product, engineering and marketing. An Opportunity to present a multi-product suite that is enterprise ready, with 20+ years of proven success globally. You get to be part of a team with a mission to capture market share in Australia by building on Netcore’s established success in global markets. Help build top of the funnel working closely with other cross functional teams. Help acquire new customers and identify opportunities for upsell and cross sell. Achieve revenue goals by addressing a massive untapped market. Organise trainings and carry out sales enablement activities to partner up for success. Help organise events, ideate with marketing team and help execute marketing activities Work very closely with a team of partner managers, marketers, solutions engineers and partners to acquire new customers and drive revenue goals for your territory. Maintain business hygiene in relation to CRM and Accounting.  What we look for?  Transformational talent who shows leading attributes of Problem solving, Efficiency, Passion and Self direction. Entrepreneurial mind-set Ability to “blueprint” and create account penetration strategies in order to aggressively pursue new business opportunities High-energy driven  with solid B2B SaaS sales experience.. ·        7+ years of closing Enterprise SaaS Experience in the marketing technology space with particular emphasis on email and marketing automation ·        Experience in building, leading and growing new business within enterprise companies ·        Experience with account and territory planning ·        Proven track record of exceeding sales quota preferably (e-commerce, digital marketing) SaaS solutions ·        Sandler or Challenger sales trained a plus! ·        Strong interpersonal communication skills and relationship building skills.   Why Netcore?  Being first is in our nature. The first and leading AI/ML-powered marketing automation enabling better customer engagements for businesses of all sizes with cutting-edge technologies that include AI, automation, top-notch product experience, customer data platform, communication API and multi-channel client engagement options, - a comprehensive customer experience platform to enhance and exhilarate the client journey.   Our CEE platform includes 6 products – Customer Engagement, Email, Personalization, Product Experience, Customer Data platform (CDP) & Raman – our AI engine.  Netcore has a perfect combo of experience as well as an agile mind. We currently work with 5000+ enterprise brands across 18 countries and serve more than 70% Unicorns in India, making us among the top-rated customer engagement & experience platform.  Headquartered in Mumbai, we have our global footprints across 10 countries worldwide. Being certified as a Great Place to Work for three consecutive years only reinforces Netcore’s principle of being a people-centric company – where you will not be just an employee but a family member of the organisation.  A career at Netcore is more than just a job — it’s an opportunity to shape the future. For more information, please visit netcorecloud.com or follow us on LinkedIn.   What’s in it for you?  Immense growth, continuous learning and consult with top-notch Singaporian brands Work with some of the most innovative brains Opportunity to explore your entrepreneurial mind-set Open culture where your creative bug gets activated   If this sounds like a company you would like to be a part of, and a role you would thrive in, please don’t hold back from applying! We need your unique perspective for our continued innovation and success! So let’s converse! Our inquisitive nature is all keen to know more about you.

description: Company Description  LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.  Job Description  We are looking for an SMB Account Executive to join our team in tapping into potential client opportunities in APAC and generating new business. You will be responsible for responding to inbound inquiries as well as blanketing your region with outbound activity. You will strategically approach target companies and teams in the SMB space, identify the best technology options and sell corporate solutions for recruitment and learning solutions. Although you strive to meet and exceed quota, you will always act in the best interest of the client.  Responsibilities Prospect relentlessly to build pipeline and build strong personal relationships with prospects Create reliable forecasts and be completely transparent with management on the pipeline status Close new business consistently at or above quota level Develop and execute on a strategic plan for the territory and document and distribute competitive information Invest in colleagues and give coaching and advice when you see an opportunity for improvement Work to develop and circulate the set of best practices that will be the foundation of this team Listen to the needs of the market and share insights with product and marketing teams Be proactive about solving problems even if it’s outside of your area and be ready to take on additional initiatives and responsibilities as they emerge Seek out opportunities to be a leader and do everything you can to help the company achieve its larger objectives  Qualifications  Basic Qualification: 1+ years of experience in sales or account management  Preferred Qualifications Experience with recruiting, recruitment media and HR software Experience with SaaS opportunities and Salesforce.com platform Experience selling IT or recruiting solutions Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions Strong negotiation and accurate forecasting skills Demonstrated ability to find, manage and close high-level business in an evangelist sales environment Ability to assess business opportunities and use data to inform decision making and persuade others Ability to manage a large number of prospect situations simultaneously while positioning company products against direct and indirect competition  Additional Information  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.   Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  This document provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://lnkd.in/GlobalDataPrivacyNotice

description: Careers that Change Lives  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  SEEKING EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST FOR SALES AND CLINICAL ROLES: This posting is intended to pipeline talent for potential future needs You will have the opportunity to be part of our market leading technology across a broad range of products in medical devices as Sales Representative or Clinical Specialist, Working within a high performing & collaborative team, you will be able to achieve your career aspiration while positively impacting patient lives!  A Day in the Life  SALES REPRESENTATIVE:  Typically, sales professional (individual contributor) with direct sales responsibilities. May direct the work of other entry level sales professionals or manage sales processes and / or accounts involving multiple team members. Majority of time is spent establishing and maintaining customer relationships, developing new customer relationships, implementing sales strategies and meeting sales targets.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Promotes and sells Medtronic's products and services within an assigned geographic area and/or specific customer accounts to meet or exceed sales targets Responsible for developing, building, and strengthening long-term relationships with stakeholders including distributors and healthcare professionals Responsible for pursuing leads, assessing needs and providing product services to maximize the benefits derived from Medtronic's products and/or services Promotes and establishes education of the company's products and/or services Conducts market research including customers and competitors’ activities Implements market development plans/strategies and changes as needed Communicates customer feedback on new products and/or modifications to existing products or applications to internal stakeholders including R&D, Operations and Marketing CLINICAL SPECIALIST:  Typically, an individual contributor with responsibility in a professional discipline or specialty. Delivers and/or manages projects assigned and works with other stakeholders to achieve desired results. May act as a mentor to colleagues or may direct the work of other entry level professionals. Majority of time is spent delivering and overseeing the projects – from design to implementation - while and adhering to policies, using specialized knowledge and skills normally acquired through advanced education.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. Conducts on-site education and/or consulting Supports field personnel in providing the best possible outcomes and service for Medtronic customers Partners with sales colleagues to develop and execute plans of sales for within one or more business unit(s) Participates in conventions, forums, and meetings to increase product awareness Works closely with Clinical Lead, Clinical Management and Regional Sales team to provide customer case and sales support Identifies and facilitates execution on growth opportunities with Sales and Clinical Support Team Serves as a technical resource to support sales of a specific medical product or solution Minimum Requirements (Sales Representative): Bachelor’s degree in any discipline, preferably in biomedical science/engineering or nursing Years of relevant experience in pharma and/or medical devices between 1 year to 5 years Requires practical knowledge gained through experience of sales techniques and job area typically obtained through education combined with sales experience Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues Minimum Requirements (Clinical Specialist): Bachelor’s degree in any discipline, preferably in biomedical science/engineering or nursing Years of relevant experience in pharma and/or medical devices between 1 year to 5 years Practical knowledge and demonstrated competence within job area typically obtained through advanced education combined with experience About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Aug 6, 2020 Travel: No

description: Candidate should expect the following- ·         Building pipeline and executing new business opportunities and meet/exceed targets established for the designated region ·         Big emphasis will be on building pipeline from new prospects within the region ·         A successful candidate must be capable of engaging at a CXO and Senior levels within Banks, fund administrators, asset managers, insurance companies and pension funds to understand their strategy and key business drivers; strive to develop a buying vision and roadmap with the customer; introduce Oracle solutions and to convince the customers of the value it delivers  ·         Strives to position Oracle as a market leader in the Fund Accounting and Servicing space ·         Collaborate closely with Sales, Pre-sales, Consulting, Marketing teams to drive sales in the assigned market ·         Will be the face of Oracle FSGBU Fund Services business within the region and actively contributes towards thought leadership vie- speaking engagements, writing blogs etc..  ·         Provide direction and input to the Product Management, Product Marketing and Product Development Groups on product plans and new product roll outs by analysing the changes and advances in technology to anticipate the market trends  Skills you need- ·       10-15 years of experience selling enterprise software to banks, preferably in the space of Wealth Management, Fund Accounting and Servicing space ·       A strong track record of pipeline and revenue growth ·       Has strong connects within the business and technology teams within Banks, fund administrators, asset managers, insurance companies and pension funds in the region ·       Should have a sound understanding of the Fund Accounting and Servicing domain ·       Should have good understanding of the technology trends and should be able to articulate the Functional and Technical value proposition to prospective customers  ·       Should have an excellent presentation and demonstration skills and should have the prior experience in public speaking at conferences and trade events

description: Job Description of Senior Sales Representative for Johnson and Johnson Surgical Vision (Singapore)  J&J Surgical Vision is inviting highly motivated, tenacious and self-starter talent to join our Singapore Commercial team! In this role, you play an important role in achieving sales and driving share gain within our Singapore private and government Ophthalmology accounts in Cataracts and Refractive segment. This role is rewarded with sales incentives/sales commissions on top of the basic remuneration, so if you are keen, join us now!  What the successful candidate will do: This role has an overall responsibility for driving sales, achieving targets and manages assigned territory while operating within an assigned budget with the below scope: - Be part of the team in determining sales forecasts for business planning to the management through active inputs on market insights and information, sales reports and required documents - Proactively assist in implementing market development and field marketing activities with the clear focus in attaining established sales goals including market share objectives - Performs contract and/or tender management activities - Proactively schedules appointments and make sales presentations to customers - Develops customer and product focused presentation packages to address our customers’ needs - Regular customer engagement to gather information on orders and market conditions, at the same time active follow up with customers to ensure customer satisfaction with our products - Executes promotional activities that are designed to advance sales in specific product lines or areas - Coordinate Professional Development activities to enhance the knowledge of Healthcare professionals - Partner with our marketing team in development of marketing plan, execution of marketing programs and materials and fulfil internal processes to get marketing materials approved for commercial use
industries: Information Technology and Services, Financial Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience 3 years of experience in analytics in marketing, sales, or business operations Experience with databases, SQL, data visualization, and advertising products  Preferred qualifications: Experience with other scripting/programming languages (e.g. Python, R) Experience with learning systems and tools, and driving or designing improvements Ability to speak to both technical and business stakeholders at all levels of the organization Excellent presentation, communication, problem solving, analysis, and collaboration skills, and strong business judgment Passion for continuous optimization or process re-engineering  About The Job  The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  The APAC Sales Efficiency team is focused on empowering the work of Large Customer Sales (LCS) teams through the improvement of capabilities, excellence, and support teams utilization. In close partnership with other teams (Product, Global Business Operations, gCare, Subregion/Country) we aim to streamline the complexity of the sales landscape.  As an APAC Sales Operations Analyst, you will be a member of a small team and be responsible for the deployment and activation of different projects related to Customer Satisfaction and Sales efficiency for APAC LCS teams. With deep knowledge of Google’s analysis tools, products, back-end infrastructure and LCS sales processes, you will also represent APAC LCS back to Global Business Operations Leads. You have a passion for innovation and simplification of the sales experience.  The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.  Responsibilities  Derive actionable business insights from in-depth analyses of datasets; (e.g. prioritization of initiatives, impact estimates, and correlation between operational behaviors and business outcomes. Manage cross-functional regional projects or workstreams involving collaboration with a wide range of stakeholders. Partner with the Global Strategy team to cascade Business Operations initiatives and represent APAC’s point of view in Executive reviews. Ensure a consistent approach where applicable. Partner closely with market teams to improve sales efficiency and customer service. Liaise with global and regional counterparts to share best-practices. Present progress and impact of solutions to leadership.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: OVERVIEW OneConnect seeks a fearless, multi-faceted Business Development Director to bring our digital banking and Insurtech solutions and services to financial services in situations and demonstrate our customers how to create value with our technology.  JOB DESCRIPTION To promote and sell OneConnect’s technology solutions to banks, insurance companies, and other financial institutions in Singapore and Malaysia To build a strong pipeline of customers / projects; Maintain strong relationship with existing customers and build new relationships To lead the end to end sales cycle of RFPs with various sizes and complexity; Prepare and present sales materials (PowerPoint, Excel) to explain our solutions and demonstrate their value to customers To manage accounts during project implementation by communicating frequently with the internal and external stakeholders To actively provide feedback and drive customization of our products with the product team, to fit the local context in Singapore and Malaysia To build strong relationships with decision makers in the financial services industry To build market intelligence of the financial services industry of the target markets  ACCOUNTABILITIES AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES Achieves assigned productivity and revenue targets Maintains a strong sales pipeline Achieves product growth targets for the assigned geography or account base Maintains high customer satisfaction ratings that meet company standards Completes required training and development objectives within the assigned time frame Coach younger sales and pre-sales staff and build a high performing sales team   JOB REQUIREMENTS Similar position in B2B technology solution sales (with exposure selling to banks and other FIs) with proven track record of sales attainment Or candidates with experience in consulting (with exposure to financial services, at least manager level) or banking (as an SME RM or mix of frontline and product role) Passion in FinTech, highly adaptable and able to cope with frequent changes typical to start-up companies Able to operate as an individual contributor role at the beginning, and with the expectation of leading a small sales team in 1-2 years Highly proficient in MS office (PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Outlook) At least Bachelor Degree, ideally with Engineering or Business background Singapore or Kuala Lumpur based Mandarin is a strong plus

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Tableau, a Salesforce Company  Tableau helps people see and understand data. Our analytics platform fuels exploration, allowing you to quickly answer questions with data and share insights across your organization. Global enterprises, early-stage startups, nonprofits, and governments all use Tableau’s intuitive software to quickly transform their data into actionable insights. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!  What You’ll Be Doing…  The Account Executive will be responsible for driving sales revenue among and managing relationships with specified customers within an assigned geographical region and market segment.  The AE will represent Tableau, demonstrating relentless Customer Focus while managing all aspects of the sales process and customer relationship from Account Planning, Lead Qualification, and Management through Negotiation and Closing and will play an integral role in the success of the overall sales team. This role is a quota-carrying sales position.  Some of the things you’ll be doing include … Create and execute effective territory and account plans for the specified region/customer base to deliver sales objectives considering: overall opportunities, customer business priorities and anticipated business changes, our unique product capabilities, and value proposition. Meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing sales opportunities within the assigned territory. Lead/leverage a matrix account team of Sales Consultants, Business Development Representatives, Services Practice Managers, Marketing, Inside Sales Support, and Customer Success Professionals to develop and manage sales pipeline and enhance customer relationships and value. Build and manage strategic partner alliances and relationships as part of the fully integrated account and territory plan. Manage and track customer and transactional information in a CRM system. Provide regular and accurate reporting of pipeline and forecast through the CRM system. Nurture and expand the company’s relationship with customer accounts of various sizes and industries. Drive customer success by developing and maintaining a deep understanding of customers’ business and industry challenges, market competition, competitive issues, and products. Practice effective, excellent communication with leadership, customers, and extended team and partners. Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategic planning, sales training, customer marketing efforts, and customer care. Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts.  Who you are… Experienced. Strong field-based enterprise software sales experience. Complex sales / solution sales and extensive large figure deal experience. Performer. Consistent over achievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory. Missionary. Highly driven individual with an execution focus and a strong sense of urgency and a belief in Tableau’s mission. Entrepreneurial. You’ve worked with start-ups and emerging organizations. You understand how to build and grow a successful business. Domain. Experience with analytics, data, databases or business intelligence preferred. Relevant Degree preferred. Go-Getter. Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful. Excellent Communication. You know what to say and more importantly, how to say it. You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world  Tableau will operate independently under the Tableau brand, driving forward a continued focus on our mission, our customers and our Tableau Community. The acquisition closed on August 1, 2019, and Tableau is a wholly-owned subsidiary of salesforce.com, inc.  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.
industries: Computer Software and Information Technology and Services

description: Company Overview: H2O.ai is the open-source leader in AI with a mission to democratize AI for everyone. H2O.ai is transforming the use of AI with software with its category-creating visionary open-source machine learning platform, H2O. More than 18,000 companies use open-source H2O in mission-critical use cases for Finance, Insurance, Healthcare, Retail, Telco, Sales and Marketing. H2O Driverless AI uses "AI to do AI" in order to provide an easier, faster and cost-effective means of implementing data science.   H2O.ai partners with leading technology companies such as NVIDIA, IBM, AWS, Intel, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform and is proud of its growing customer base which includes Capital One, Progressive Insurance, Comcast, Walgreens and MarketAxess. For more information and to learn more about how H2O.ai is driving an AI Transformation, visit www.h2o.ai.  Job Summary: Are you a top performer at your current or previous company? Are you fluent in Spanish? Are you a self-starter that can talk to anyone? If so, read on. H2O.ai is looking for exceptional candidates join our LATAM BDR team. As an H2O.ai Business Development Representative you will be finding, engaging, and qualifying prospects to drive continued sales growth. We invest heavily in our BDRs and CAEs so we can promote them into more senior roles.  Responsibilities and Duties: As a Business Development Representative, you will work closely with H2O.ai Sales & Marketing Teams to: Professionally and persistently follow up with inbound leads and outbound cold calls, emails, and LinkedIn Identify target prospects and perform analysis through a variety of online research methods Set up introductory calls with target influencers and decision makers; your job is to make sure a majority of these calls become qualified opportunities for our Account Executives Develop creative tactics and strategies to reach prospects Understand the latest industry trends Dedication to continuous learning Record and track activity in Salesforce.com  Qualifications and Skills: Proven industry-related inside sales experience Previous experience in cold calling sales pitches and prospect research Track record of over-achieving quota must be experienced in making a minimum of 50 calls per day Experience working with Zoom, Salesforce.com, Outreach.io, ZoomInfo or similar tools Excellent verbal and written communications skills Strong listening and presentation skills Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively Comfortable with ambiguity Fluent in Spanish and Portuguese BA/BS degree or equivalent  Benefits/Perks:  Flexible work hours and time off. Competitive salary with uncapped commission and accelerators above quota  H2O.ai is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service

description: 10 million wounds treated with 3M™ V.A.C.® Therapy. If it doesn’t say V.A.C.® Therapy, it’s not.  We are looking for a highly motivated individual who will be primarily responsible for achieving business and sales objectives by promoting and selling 3M medical devices and consumables used in the administration of negative pressure wound therapy and other advanced wound care therapies.  Principal Accountabilities/Key Responsibilities  Proactive identification of new users and business opportunities for accelerated product penetration Independent management of own schedule to coordinate regular internal and customer meetings and support activities including regular bedside support in the use of 3M products. Build account intimacy, generate sales leads and leverage various products to meet the customer's needs. Manage all aspects of multiple customer accounts and coordinate input and support from other internal business functions Consistently build strong customer support and a preference for company products. Gain expertise in both 3M and competitor products. Identify and foster opportunities to develop and utilise Key Opinion Leaders. Work with 3M Clinicians to co-lead joint calls with customers to discuss scientific evidence and procedures utilising 3M products. Accountable for customer satisfaction and providing high quality service. Responsible for keeping commitments in a timely manner and resolving issues promptly. Monitors and reports to Sales Manager any marketing information and competitor sales and product strategies. Participates in all trade shows, conferences and other projects as determined by Sales Manager. Conducts all business activities according to applicable rules and regulations and observes all company policy and procedures to ensure meeting ethical standards and compliance obligations.  Position Qualifications, Experience & Skills              Sales experience in medical devices preferred Nursing degree preferred. Post-graduate studies in wound care advantageous. Excellent command of both written and spoken English essential. Self-motivated, willing to learn and to take responsibility, matured. Able to work independently and pro-actively manage their own schedule under time pressure. Excellent presentation and public speaking skills. Proficient in relevant Microsoft Office applications. Results-oriented and self-motivated with a high energy level, initiative, drive and creativity Initially a contract role, convertible to permanent
industries: Medical Devices

description: Our client, a leader in consultancy, is looking for an Account Executive - Director who will manage relationships and provide digital transformation, and technology services to clients.  As an Account Executive, Director Level, you will help clients to provide effective results against some of their complex business and technology initiatives in Financial Services. You should be able to project your planning, execution, and client relationship management skills.   Responsibilities: ·       Drive sales, build and manage relationships with key decision makers ·       Implement and perform a comprehensive business plan – identify customer requirements and providing them solutions ·       Provide accurate forecasts, and generate consistent revenue ·       Be accountable for the implementation of agreed accounts and business plans ·       Routinely sell-to and interact with executive-level customer decision makers, up to CXO levels ·       Communicate feedback from customers to internal stakeholders to provide improvement and solutions ·       Enhance brand recognition and mindshare – publicizing success stories  Requirements ·       Minimum of 8+years of professional experience ·       Digital Solutions, Transformation / M&A projects experience ·       Experience in shaping & structuring sales proposals in Consulting or IT Services solutions – Financial Services ·       Excellent leadership skills, customer service skills, presentation skills, negotiation skills and business skills ·       Fully adept at consultative effectiveness ·       Ability to have a complete, “big-picture” understanding of the business and technical contexts of the account  Interested, please contact: Dietrich at d.yap@gravitasgroup.com OR Kimberly at k.tagle@gravitasgroup.com
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Project Management
industries: Management Consulting, Information Technology and Services, and Financial Services

description: Regional Sales Manager- Singapore (Work Remotely)  Job Overview: • Identify and qualify business opportunities within Enterprise, Public Sector, and Service Provider markets with or without partners. •  Negotiation, coordination, and business decisions to close deals. •  Develop and hold professional sales presentations, control project progress at each stage, make constant sales calls and follow up with any potential leads, work with partners aggressively to close deals and finalize contracts, meet/exceed sales quotas and revenue goals. Provide effective communication of A10's technology value propositions and solutions. •  Interface with resellers/distributors/channels to become an extended A10 sales force. •  Determine market strategies and business goals for A10 product lines and services. • Manage forecast reports as well as short-term/long-term business plans in an effective manner. • Maintain constant internal communications with the Sales Engineering team and outside staff of resellers and customers. • Turn in business forecast pipeline regularly and review with Regional Director on a regular basis. •  Grow the business and deliver results to meet/exceed the assigned targets.  Experience & Qualifications: •  Seeking candidates with a mix of extensive business and technology experience •  7+ years of networking industry experience within Sales, Business Development and Strategic Alliances • Extensive relationships and experience working with leading telco/wireless equipment/solution vendors •  Prior working experience in (or with) Nokia/Ericsson/Huawei (or similar MNSc) with broad understanding of their business units, products, and customers is highly desired •  Strong understanding of security infrastructure, DDoS mitigation and detection, application networking (L4 & L7), SDN/NFV transformation, cloud infrastructure and services, and mobile networks evolution, including IoT •  Great track record of strategic partnerships and alliance development with System Integrators and cloud providers resulting in exceeding annual targets and MBO’s  •  Vast hands-on experience developing, structuring, and closing large international business contracts •  Superior presentation skills and written communication as well as problem-solving skills at both a strategic and functional level •  Good knowledge and experiences to manage the Deal pipeline with a strong commitment •  Excellent technical, industry, business, and cross-functional knowledge •  Solid work ethic, customer-focused, team player, with passion for success  A10 Networks is an equal opportunity employer and a VEVRAA federal subcontractor. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. A10 also complies with all applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment.
industries: Computer & Network Security, Computer Networking, and Computer Software

description: About The Team  After acquiring our digital banking license, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market aggressively.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  Job Description Relationship management Manage each account relationship by setting targets via joint-business planning Execute sales and marketing strategies to drive transaction numbers and revenue Work closely with 3rd party partners to ensure all execution are completed successfully Partnerships Secure exclusive partner partnerships for key campaigns such as 9.9/11.11 Secure new exclusive product launches, sponsorship and exciting mechanics each month/quarter for PR pushes Reporting Plan the B2C landscape for each category by analyzing category sales performance Work closely with the respective categories' RM and BI to achieve overall category's mall targets  Requirements Minimum 1 year of experience in key accounts management, ideally in the e-Commerce space Strong written and oral communications skills Strong analytical skill Entrepreneurial spirit Positive, team-player, and energetic attitude

description: Duties and responsibilities:  To meet and exceed monthly & annual sales targets on a direct B2B selling “hunter” role   To generate targeted rate of outbound calls and other methods of communication (e.g. email) in creating new prospects and organising meetings with key stakeholders and decision makers. This is the key part of the role.   Perform all sales duties including sales presentations, sales negotiations, closure of sales, Agreement finalisation & key client account management with the support of the Sales support team. Manage all aspects of pre-sales that includes RFP responses, coordinate product trials etc.   Managing sales funnel and sales activity reporting on a daily, weekly & monthly basis   Work closely with our strategic partners on lead generation, advertising and promotional campaigns.   Build customer relationships to achieve high customer service rating and manage a customer database.   Monitor, track report pending payments from sales meeting target date.   Monitor and report competition activity and keep up to date on market conditions and product development.   To perform any other assignment as and when required by the management.   Work efficiently and effectively in line with company procedures and guidelines, delivering exceptional results against our key performance indicators (customer satisfaction, productivity and deal volume)     Prerequisites   A self- driven, target oriented individual with at least 3 years sales experience in B2B environment. A proven track record in hunting and closing sales. Experience in an Solutions/ Insurance/IT/Product sales environment is an added advantage Diploma or a Degree in Sales & Marketing, IT or other field is a minimum requirement Experience in prospecting, selling, consistently meeting and exceeding targets is mandatory. Ability to work independently with minimum supervision should be demonstrated. Excellent Presentation skills and strong command of English both written and verbal is a must Highly Passionate to be part of a team that is aspiring to be ranked #1 globally. Well Groomed and Highly Ambitious   An attractive Commission + Incentives scheme will be offered and an exciting career progression path towards regional sales management roles are on offer for top performers with BoardPAC being a global organization.

A cloud-based F&B company is looking for a driven Account Manager. Joining the team in their largest market, you will partner key clients to drive growth and sales.  Responsibilities: Support existing accounts and identify key business opportunities to up-sell and cross-sell Own client relationships and periodically analyse data and gain insights to further improve merchant performance Assist the sales team in the onboarding of new merchants   Requirements: Degree in Business Management or related At least 3 years of experience in business development, sales, client account management/servicing Experience in a SaaS/eCommerce company is a plus Analytical with keen interpersonal and negotiation skills  Send your CV to alicia.lee@cornerstoneglobalpartners.com today to kickstart an initial conversation.
