description: Company Description  Are you looking for a brand that will invest in you and your career? Do you enjoy working as part of a team? Could you make the difference to a customer’s day?  If you answered yes - we would love to hear from you...  Here at COS we are recruiting a sales assistant to join our Singapore store. The role is full time and able to work retail hours, including weekends and public holidays.  About COS…  COS is a fashion brand for women and men who want timeless, modern, functional and considered design. Offering reinvented classics and wardrobe essentials, we create pieces that are made to last beyond the season. Since launching in 2007 we have opened stores in over 40 countries worldwide, all in carefully considered locations, applying a design concept that preserves the buildings’ original features whilst creating a modern, contemporary space.  About The Role…  Job Description  Although every day will be different, some of the things that you will do regularly include: Offering our customers a high level of service; starting conversations with them and helping them to create great outfits Processing deliveries & stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the shop floor Stock replenishment Selling to customers at the cash desk, fitting room and on the shop floor About You...  Qualifications  To work as a sales assistant, previous experience is not essential. Instead we look for people with the qualities below Customer focused Self-motivated & positive Considerate Adaptable A genuine interest in others Open to learn about and sell our products Additional Information  Why choose COS?  When you first join COS we will give you a full training plan. In addition to this you will also receive 25% staff discount 13 month salary Up to SGD1040 per year clothing allowance 14 days holiday Sick leave Additional holiday for long service Medical care & insurance Birthday Leave Over the last 10 years we have carefully built a culture where our people are supported, inspired and encouraged to be the best they can. Our brand is creative, forward thinking and modern; choosing longevity over passing trends.  We set the bar high at COS; we are committed to recruiting great people, offering an environment where talent is recognised and valued. We believe that a diverse workforce plays an important role in the success of COS. We celebrate individual differences and appreciate the contribution that all our colleagues make.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

description: Kronicles Asia, a member of the Kronologi Asia Bhd group, offers innovative solutions for Managed Services and enterprise solutions that deliver flexibility and agility to support customer’s business needs. Challenging traditional paradigms with traditional and “as-a-service” offerings to customers across the Asia Pacific, Kronicles integrates solutions from best-of-breed technology partners and is the Exclusive Asia Pacific Distributor of Seagate Systems storage.  We are expanding and seeking a highly motivated, experienced and high-energy Sales Director to grow business in Asia. In this role, you will be responsible for planning and executing sales strategies, lead generation and for bringing the product to market with both direct customer interaction and via channel partners. In the role, you will be an integral part of the leadership team as we continue our journey of growth.   Responsibilities Create strong relationships with customers and channel partners at both senior and mid-management levels Develop and execute on sales and marketing plans for the full product line across South Asia to achieve or exceed revenue targets Desire to own projects and exceed expectations, with ability to find solutions and deliver results within a rapidly changing, entrepreneurial, technology-driven culture Ability to identify and solve client issues strategically Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with management and cross-functional teams, for both technical and non-technical audiences Understand and effectively communicate the company's value propositions, technology processes and current partnerships  Requirements Proven work experience with more than 5 years in Storage Sales, product positioning and forecasting Experience in Channels Sales Management Excellent written and verbal commutation skills Degree in Business Administration, Marketing or equivalent experience Ability to speak Mandarin advantageous   Qualified candidates (Singapore citizen & PR only) are requested to apply via email stating current and expected salary to: hr-sg@kronicles.asia
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: We are looking for a Software (SaaS) Sales Development Representative to develop new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers. To be successful in this junior role, you should have previous experience developing leads from scratch and meeting sales quotas in the software (SaaS) or technology industry. You will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, from first contact until you closed or passed on a deal. If you are motivated and results-driven, if you enjoy working in a team environment, we’d like to meet you! Ultimately, you will boost sales and contribute to our long-term business growth.  The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills, time management skills, a startup mindset, the ability to function successfully both as an individual and on a team, and should be a globally-minded individual valuing diversity.  Responsibilities Qualify leads from marketing campaigns, events and self search as sales opportunities. Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails. Present our company to potential clients. Build long-term trusting relationships with clients. Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market. Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) clients and Account Executives. Report to the Sales Manager on weekly sales results. Stay up-to-date with new products/services and new pricing/payment plans.  Requirements 1-2 years of work experience in sales development. Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls). Track record of achieving sales quotas. Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce, hubspot, etc.). Familiarity with MS Excel (analyzing spreadsheets and charts). Understanding of sales performance metrics. Excellent communication skills. Associates Degree (BS in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field is preferred but not required).  About Glue Up Founded in 2013, Glue up, formerly EventBank provides all-in-one engagement management cloud solutions that give professional communities the power to streamline operations, enrich audience engagement, and maximize value underpinning expansive networks. Our cutting-edge platform has helped hundreds of organizations in more than 60+ countries modernize processes and eliminate engagement challenges. Glue Up has offices in Hong Kong, Singapore, Philippines, China, Malaysia, India, Indonesia, USA, LATAM, EMEA and Russia.  Our core products are Event Management Software and Chamber of Commerce & Association Management Software.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Tableau, a Salesforce Company  Tableau helps people see and understand data. Our analytics platform fuels exploration, allowing you to quickly answer questions with data and share insights across your organization. Global enterprises, early-stage startups, nonprofits, and governments all use Tableau’s intuitive software to quickly transform their data into actionable insights. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!  What You’ll Be Doing …  The Account Executive is responsible for driving sales of Tableau products within a specified a set of Mid Market accounts, exceeding sales objectives. This role manages all aspects of the sales process including prospecting, lead management, qualification, product demonstrations, evaluation, close and account care. This is a quota‐carrying sales position that plays an integral role in the success of the overall sales team.  Some of the things you’ll be doing include … Define and execute territory sales plans and then meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities within the assigned geographic territory Develop and manage sales pipeline – prospect and assess new sales potential while moving a large number of transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline Manage and track customer and transactional information in a CRM system Coordinate resources throughout the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering Provide initial product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers Nurture and expand the company’s relationship within customer accounts within geographic territory Provide regular reporting of pipeline and forecast through the CRM system Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products Practice effective, excellent communication with management, customers and support staff Participate in team‐building and company‐growth activities including strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts and customer care. Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts.  Who You Are… Experienced. Relevant sales and/or lead qualification experience (including outbound prospecting) preferred. Experience with analytics, data, databases, predictive modeling, or business intelligence preferred. Amazing Salesperson. You have a desire, even an obsession, to bring / expand customers into the Tableau franchise and maximize revenue. You have the ability to develop and manage a sales pipeline with a proven track record of handling and closing a large number of transactions simultaneously. Technically Savvy. You don’t shy away from opportunities to get into technology – and you can learn it quickly. Go-Getter. You are willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful Missionary. You “get it” and understand Tableau’s mission deeply in some way. You believe Tableau will become one of the most important technology companies in the world, you want to be a contributing member of a winning sales team, and you want to have fun all the way. Effective Communicator. You are clear and persuasive in verbal and written communications Cross-Cultural. You have experience relating to customers from a variety of countries. You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world!  Tableau will operate independently under the Tableau brand, driving forward a continued focus on our mission, our customers and our Tableau Community. The acquisition closed on August 1, 2019, and Tableau is a wholly-owned subsidiary of salesforce.com, inc.  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Regional Sales Manager, Japan and Korea Our mission is “…to safely deliver life-saving products” the products we make are geared towards healthcare companies who require the highest level of quality and care. As a result, we are looking for people who understand the importance of a higher purpose. The inside sales manager serves that function by ensuring our customers are getting the right service and products, specific to their needs. This role requires a good understanding of consultative sales, solution and interdisciplinary collaboration experience are a must to be successful. The role is responsible for developing cross-functional relationships with new and existing customers in a culturally and geographically diverse market. The inside sales manager must have an ability to consistently follow-up and bring multi-year projects to a close, while meeting quarterly and annual performance objectives. The primary role objectives are: Responsibilities: Sales Growth - Develop and maintain good relationships for given territory - Support global key accounts in territory and share insights and intelligence within global sales organization - Consistently update and work from customer relationship management (CRM) tool - Develop new customers and new business to meet territory sales growth objectives - Follow up quickly on marketing leads generated, ensure consistent messages and needs are addressed when leads are routed - Promote company products and capabilities via customer meetings, industry exhibitions and technical seminars - Develop adjacent industry relationships with companies serving healthcare manufacturers - Attend regional association meetings, networking and become member as necessary to expand Oliver’s presence in the region - Interface regularly with commercial leaders regarding new product and new market opportunities - Identify target accounts and create a strategy for closing new business - Uncover price targets and competitive information - Tailor conference calls and pitch to meet the needs of different buyer personas and market applications  Account Maintenance - This role covers Japan & Korea market - Understand the customer’s market, financial results, and buying cycles - Manage account forecasts and assist with budget process at year end - Capture and communicate competitor activities - Maintain great customer relationships and maintain high level of customer satisfaction - Maintain marketing databases including lead follow up and maintenance from existing accounts - Communicate customer specifications and requirements to manufacturing, process engineering, production planning, graphic production areas, etc. - Work internally to negotiate accurate ship dates that are close to the customer’s request date - Expedite all customer requests for rushed deliveries, and communicates schedule request changes to production planning and manufacturing departments - Captures all customer complaints and tracks them in accordance with established practices and procedures  Requirements: - Bilingual in English, Japanese and/or Korean to liaise with customers from Japan and Korea - B.S. in Marketing, Sales, General Business, Engineering or closely related field. - 4+ years of successful business development experience required - A record of building great customer relationships - Strong presentation skills required - Strong negotiating and closing skills - Computer and business writing competency - Ability to travel 50% of the time internationally

description: About the Role  At ClassPass we believe partnering with companies who share our values can help thousands of more people live active lives. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly-motivated Corporate Sales Associate to support our Corporate Team and to help grow our burgeoning corporate sales channel.  The right candidate isn’t afraid of striking up a conversation with someone they just met. You're a master at market research, and aren't afraid to strike up a conversation with someone new. This role is ideal for someone who’s a couple of years into their sales career and is looking to get more experience in relationship-based selling and prospecting.  Key Responsibilities  Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls, emails and SDR set up meetings Research, prospect and engage new small to medium corporate partners in ClassPass markets Continue developing understanding of HR/Benefits world and how ClassPass fits in Manage your own opportunities by utilising CRM, email and outreach tools and resources to cultivate and maintain sales pipeline Drive through the full sales cycle by making/sending introductory calls and emails, assessing and building the relationship, performing sales presentations and closing the deal. Develop creative, fun, and innovative ways in which you connect and build out your relationships with potential clients and share across the team Attend various industry events and conferences including hosting stands Achieve, and consistently exceed monthly sales goals Collaborate with the Corporate Account Management team to ensure the smooth onboarding of a corporate partner Maintaining daily KPIs and metrics  Skills & Experience  A natural problem solver with the hustle and drive to hit, or even better, exceed goals Strong relationship builder; comfortable and confident with a wide range of decision makers (internal and external) A natural negotiator with a passion for results A natural relationship builder with the ability to collaborate Willingness to make multiple sales calls and email contacts per day Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability to multi-task, prioritise, and manage time effectively Right to work in Singapore  Who we are  ClassPass is revolutionizing the fitness and wellness industry by bringing together the world’s best classes and experiences into one app. Founded in 2013 by Payal Kadakia, ClassPass connects members to millions of classes in 30 countries around the globe, and is now available as a wellness benefit with some of the world’s leading employers. We make it easy to prioritize your health, whether you decide to head to a local studio, play an on-demand workout or book yourself a much needed wellness appointment. Over 100 million reservations later, we truly believe that we’re just getting started.  What we believe  At ClassPass, we believe in the power of movement. But we believe in more than just that. We believe in building for the future, creating more opportunities for everyone around the world to live fully and in good health. We believe that we can always push ourselves and our company to be better, and that there is power in the hard things when we’re all working together toward the same goal. We believe in building a diverse company where a sense of belonging is felt by employees, customers and partners alike. And we believe that the secret to ClassPass’ success is its people. ClassPass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected characteristics.

description: Join our international team  Statista is one of the world’s leading statistics portals.  As a multiple award-winning innovative digital company, Statista provides customers such as Google, Bloomberg, Forbes, Procter & Gamble, or Porsche with high-quality research & analysis, data intelligence, and content marketing products and services.  With 1,100 employees from over 70 nations and 13 subsidiaries in Europe, North America, and Asia, Statista derives its innovative energy from its internationality and diversity.  Statista provides a company culture based around learning by doing and entrepreneurship, offers great career opportunities, and combines the pioneering spirit of a start-up with the stability of an established company.   About the ROLE  A self-starter with strong ownership and accountability to achieve revenue targets independently and quickly Build up the Academia and Public Sector vertical for the allocated markets Acquiring new business and further developing our B2B client base Proactively develop sales opportunities within the industry and allocated territories Identify prospects and communicate effectively on our value propositions clearly and concisely. Consistently deliver individual sales targets every month Draft, conceptualize and share new sales campaigns and ideas within our growing team Ability to identify customers’ pain points quickly and recommend suitable solutions to the customer to create a win-win situation. Throughout the process, provide a high level of customer service, display an ability to build strong relationships and achieve a deep understanding of customers’ commercial objectives and motivations accurately. Work as a liaison between the sales team, customers and other departments at Statista (research team, product team, etc.) Monitor the advertising and sponsorship of competitive publications and events  About YOU  2-3 years minimum direct sales experience Proficiency in effective communication and presentation abilities MUST-Have: outbound B2B direct sales experience / experience in acquiring new business Experience dealing with client from the Academic/Public sector will be an advantage Strong written and verbal communication skills. Fluency in English is a must, advantageous to speak other South East Asian languages for development of other markets Extroverted and professional character with an ability to put yourself in your customers' shoes Competitive, aggressive sales nature with a desire to win Desire to be part of a rapidly expanding business Willingness to undertake business trips Keen eye for detail and organization skills

Summary  Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Apple’s sales organization generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team, is in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers.   In this role you will be responsible for driving eCommerce sales for SEA. You will be a catalyst to Apple’s regional digital strategy and be responsible for delivery of Apple’s online sales growth programs and digital customer experience (CX) programs. You build relationships, develop partner capabilities, and ensure flawless execution across the programs. You collaborate closely with Worldwide (WW) and SEA channel sales teams, cross-functional teams and external partners to improve and grow Apple’s eCommerce Channel business in SEA.   Key Qualifications  In depth experience in eCommerce across digital channels, traditional online retailers and social commerce  Proven experience succeeding in sophisticated, matrix and cross-functional projects  Solid understanding and experience implementing Sales models and working with eCommerce  Experience setting, managing and reporting against multi-year plans, budgets, KPIs, milestones, roadmaps, etc.  Deeply data driven with proven analytical and numerical prowess; versed in site analytics and proficient in analysing data for decision making  Experience coordinating program roadmaps; high attention to detail  Ability to encourage, influence and collaborate across many functions and levels of the organisation  Ability to communicate in a clear and effective manner to key partners and leadership teams to influence the overall digital strategy and program development  Demonstrated organisational skills, ability to prioritise tasks and manage time efficiently while maintaining attention to detail  Excellent written, presentation and oral communication skills  Willing to take action and enjoy working in a fast paced, dynamic environment   Description  - Have a deep understanding of the SEA channel, eCommerce landscape, partners and the needs of our end customers.  - Define and implement a SEA Regional Digital Strategy by working with SEA Channel teams and WW Digital teams  - Study market trends, partner capabilities, performance metrics and results to identify areas for optimisation and new online growth opportunities.  - Support the tactical and strategic management of key regional digital accounts, which includes but is not limited to developing digital account plans, driving digital sales programs and sell-in to partners, program and offers negotiation, demand generation, operational optimisation, premium digital CX  - Analyse business opportunities to develop and drive regional and partner specific digital sales strategies, plans and roadmaps  - Develop regional digital reporting, reviews and planning, analysing data insights, digital KPIs, digital CX monitoring results to determine appropriate forward actions  - Work on special projects related to strategy development for digital channels.  - Support and build a community of digital specialists across SEA, transferring knowledge and sharing best practices.   Education & Experience  Bachelor’s degree or equivalent education.   Additional Requirements  Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.   We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. description: Sales Development Representative  Description  ethiXbase is currently seeking a high achieving Sales Development Representative to join our Go To Market function as part of the Marketing team. You will play a critical role in qualifying leads, profiling prospects and customers and providing input on which campaigns generate the best leads. Working in collaboration with our Global Sales Development and Field Sales professionals, your primary goal is to identify and qualify opportunities across all ethiXbase business units across our primary target markets in APAC. You will own the inbound lead qualification process and will look to move leads into and through the sales funnel - from an unaware contact through to sales qualified opportunity for the Sales team to convert. This full time role is both home/remote working with some time in the office with the APAC team, which is located in Singapore.  Background on ethiXbase   About us  ethiXbase is a RegTech business that delivers robust technology and data analytics to assist corporates and third parties, create and maintain sustainable business practices. We play a strategic role in helping businesses globally, elevate their third-party supply chain by understanding and applying the standards and principles set out by the United Nations Global Compact (UNGC), including: Human Rights, Labour, Environment and Anti-Corruption.   How we do it?   We create the most intuitive, robust, and entirely configurable platform, which helps elevate sustainability throughout the global business network. We make the process of accessing and understanding millions of records and complex data sets simple. Facilitating a transparent information exchange between corporates and third parties.   Our Mission  To accelerate the worlds progress towards sustainability, by crafting the most compelling solutions, that help our clients build and maintain sustainable supply chains that benefit the world.   Job Spec   Reporting line and structure  This role reports into the Global Head of Growth Marketing and sits within the Marketing department, though it will work very closely with the Head of Sales for APAC and Chief Revenue Officer (CRO) in the UK.  Payment Structure Pay is dependent on experience, however you will earn a generous wage, as well as a monthly commission for every sales qualified meeting that meet a prescribed criteria.  What you get to do in this role:   The Sales Development Representative builds sales pipeline while achieving monthly, quarterly, and annual objectives.   Follow up on Marketing-generated leads to qualify them for potential Sales opportunities  Create, manage, and drive all inbound leads to Sales acceptance  Provide account team with detailed call notes in the CRM to ensure opportunities are understood and next steps are clearly identified  Collaborate with Marketing in executing various demand generation campaigns  Drive attendance to all company events and regional trade shows  Understand how ServiceNow solutions address various customer pain points and  Research, identify, and prioritise target accounts for prospecting activities  Build prospecting contact lists  Create org/account mappings of prospective clients  Acquire, update, and maintain contact information within Salesforce  Build and manage reporting Salesforce dashboards along with technical team to showcase ROI based on activity  Utilise and leverage internal and external technology to identify, develop and manage marketing leads effectively  Knowledge of Marketing Automation Platforms (Desirable)  To be successful in this role you should have:  An ambitious, creative, goal-oriented, and customer-focused mindset  A basic understanding of Cloud computing and SaaS offerings  Excellent listening, verbal, and written skills  Ability to build meaningful business relationships with ethiXbase customers, prospects, and internal colleagues  A growth mindset, consistently working to improve your skills and adapt in a constantly changing environment  Humble confidence and the ability to articulate the value of ethiXbase to customers  Ability to work flexibly and pivot focus based on company needs or industry changes  A digitally focused mindset   Other   Based in the Singapore, Philippines or Malaysia, remote working but with time in the office with the APAC team Start date in October  We provide competitive compensation and a professional atmosphere. This is a collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and positive attitude will have opportunities to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.     ethiXbase is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, gender identity, or veteran status. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at hr@ethixbase.com for assistance.

description: At Singtel, we believe in the strength of a vibrant, diverse and inclusive workforce where backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people help us innovate and create strong connections with our customers. We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative    Why Join Us? Group Enterprise is the core of Singtel’s business strategy. Our vision is to create next-generation digital platforms and we would like to tap into talents of diversified backgrounds to help us achieve our vision. All talents will have the opportunity to be part of growth programs to further   What will your day look like? Understanding customer’s businesses, challenges and developing strong value propositions to meet business objectives through technology solution sales.. Establishing close working relationships internally as well as with customers to map the key drivers, pain points and challenges to the best fit solution. Articulating the value of Singtel’s offerings in tune with customer’s projects and adopt a proactive collaborative approach. Generating qualified pipeline through customer facing unit teams, direct reach outs and collaboration with marketing and partner teams. Conduct high impact sales presentations and prepare sales proposal. Developing a strong network with key product vendors and partners for successful sales engagement & support.   Is this you? Considering a sales career Possess any technical background Keen to join an industry leader Able to communicate and build relationships   Apply with us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020

description: Our Purpose  We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a culture of inclusion for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.  Job Title  Sales Specialist - MPGS  Overview  South East Asia is one of the fastest growing divisions for Mastercard, with markets at different stages of development and maturity for digital payments.  The individual will be responsible to manage MPGS customer engagement in collaboration with our country, MPGS product and its functional support teams to optimize existing business & eliminate service delivery impediment for SEA markets. This Sales Specialist will report to the Director, MPGS Sales for Southeast Asia to defend existing business and expand new service revenue growth.  Role  This Position Is Responsible For Working closely with MPGS Sales, Account Managers, MPGS Product, Customer Delivery and MPGS Helpdesk to drive accelerated sales growth Providing data analytic to support sales lead generation and opportunity development Equipping MPGS Sales team with good data analytics / business performance reporting to optimize existing business and customer engagement Working closely with MPGS Product and the Director to develop GTM strategies and business deals for Southeast Asia markets and generating new sales opportunities. Supporting MPGS Sales to win new RFPs  All About You Digitally savvy with strong communication and presentation skills Good knowledge of payments system Customer focus and passionate for service excellent Strong team player with good ownership to carry out responsibilities to the end Preferably possess strong command of ecommerce service suites with the ability to identify opportunities to cross-sell and maximize revenue in each client portfolio. Deep knowledge of MPGS product functionalities would be a key advantage Versatile to pick up new responsibilities with strong project management skill Good grasp of financial modeling and business case development Skilled at management reporting and gathering insights from granular data for better business decision making Comfortable with ambiguous situations and able to carry out works with little instruction Flexibility to travel in Southeast Asia at short notice  Due to COVID-19, most of our employees are working from home. We’ve implemented a virtual hiring process and continue to interview candidates by phone or video and are onboarding new hires remotely. We value the safety of each member of our community because we know we’re all in this together.  Mastercard is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please contact reasonable.accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.  Corporate Security Responsibility  All Activities Involving Access To Mastercard Assets, Information, And Networks Comes With An Inherent Risk To The Organization And Therefore, It Is Expected That The Successful Candidate For This Position Must  Every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security. Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices; Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed; Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

description: Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 87 million registered learners as of June 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.  Job Overview  The Sales Development Team is a critical component of our growth plan. All inbound and outbound engagement with prospective customers starts with the SDR team. As a Outbound Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will be responsible for generating interest in Coursera by contacting prospects, presenting our solutions, and qualifying leads for our sales team. You will work closely with sales and marketing teams to ensure we operate as a seamless organization to build our pipeline of business.  The ideal individual will have experience with enterprise sales/partnerships and be interested in working for a social enterprise. Your knowledge of Edtech, and enterprise learning combined with superior communication skills and analytical abilities, will shape Coursera’s B2B business to help us provide more access to education globally.  Responsibilities Build a pipeline of leads for the sales team by qualifying inbound inquiries and reaching out to high-potential prospects Conduct effective discovery and qualification conversations with prospects through your deep understanding of our product value proposition and use cases Develop creative strategies for engaging and nurturing prospects using content, email, phone, social media and any other strategies that work Partner closely with members of the sales and marketing teams to coordinate engagement strategies and improving processes Use your frontline knowledge of customer needs to educate the broader team on learnings and opportunities Basic Qualifications A graduate degree or professional experience of 2+ years Preferred Qualifications Excellent written and verbal communications and listening skills Experience selling or marketing software or services and meeting a quota Entrepreneurial drive and comfort working in ambiguous, quickly-changing environments Experience with sales and or marketing tools such as Salesforce, Outreach, DiscoverOrg, Lusha Post-Graduate degree, preferred If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:  Successful Negotiation: Essential Strategies and Skills  Connecting with Sales Prospects  Work Smarter, Not Harder: Time Management for Personal & Professional  Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.  Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

description: As a Funds Services - Business Development Specialist this role will work in collaboration with on-field sales executives in each of the markets and will take  responsibility for selling into a designated territory  Candidate should expect the following- ·         Building pipeline and executing new business opportunities and meet/exceed targets established for the designated region ·         Big emphasis will be on building pipeline from new prospects within the region ·         A successful candidate must be capable of engaging at a CXO and Senior levels within Banks, fund administrators, asset managers, insurance companies and pension funds to understand their strategy and key business drivers; strive to develop a buying vision and roadmap with the customer; introduce Oracle solutions and to convince the customers of the value it delivers  ·         Strives to position Oracle as a market leader in the Fund Accounting and Servicing space ·         Collaborate closely with Sales, Pre-sales, Consulting, Marketing teams to drive sales in the assigned market ·         Will be the face of Oracle FSGBU Fund Services business within the region and actively contributes towards thought leadership vie- speaking engagements, writing blogs etc..  ·         Provide direction and input to the Product Management, Product Marketing and Product Development Groups on product plans and new product roll outs by analysing the changes and advances in technology to anticipate the market trends  Skills you need- ·       10-15 years of experience selling enterprise software to banks, preferably in the space of Wealth Management, Fund Accounting and Servicing space ·       A strong track record of pipeline and revenue growth ·       Has strong connects within the business and technology teams within Banks, fund administrators, asset managers, insurance companies and pension funds in the region ·       Should have a sound understanding of the Fund Accounting and Servicing domain ·       Should have good understanding of the technology trends and should be able to articulate the Functional and Technical value proposition to prospective customers  ·       Should have an excellent presentation and demonstration skills and should have the prior experience in public speaking at conferences and trade events

jobTitle: Regional Account Executive, Global Client & Agency Solutions
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of experience in media, marketing, brand management, consulting and/or advertising sales. Experience driving digital marketing business growth for clients.  Preferred qualifications: Experience working with advertisers, agencies, and/or clients. Ability to deliver results under pressure and show dedication to client services. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent leadership, organization, communication and teamwork skills.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  As a Regional Account Executive (AE), you'll help to provide integrated, cross-platform advertising solutions. Google has become a leader in this space because we've developed effective products and services targeted to marketers and consumers. You will work with brands in Asia, Middle East and Africa.  You'll manage business relationships to ensure that clients' needs and requirements are met. This will require you to serve as their advocate within Google while collaborating with other Google teams to provide them with a comprehensive portfolio of solutions and options. You will play more of a cross-market role to drive global and regional strategy and influence the category C-suite regional teams based in Singapore.  Our Global Clients & Agency Solutions team helps serve some of the world's largest brands. Our dedicated teams of marketing and advertising specialists use their unique skill sets to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We aspire to advise our clients on all aspects of their online business strategy. Using Google's broad range of products, we help our clients connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Support the execution of client initiative in reporting, optimization and detecting growth opportunities for the brand. Foster relationships with regional client decision makers, as well as their agency counterparts, to build and carry out long-term digital strategies and optimize their business growth. Support activation of regional Joint Business Plans (JBP) initiatives across various Google products and services, countries, and channels. Work in partnership with the regional/global team members on business plans and strategies. Create large scale advertising programs regionally (e.g. global sponsorship campaigns, cross-market product launch or brand campaigns). Manage multiple cross-product opportunities and projects. Develop scalable and leading edge solutions for the client to optimize their business growth and maximize the use of Google products (Search, Video, Display, Google Marketing Platform, GA360).  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description: After acquiring our digital banking licence, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market rapidly.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  To achieve this goal, you will be part of the dynamic Business Development team to: Acquire and Grow ShopeePay's offline merchant network Cover end to end Merchant Acquisition cycle - from Lead Generation to Outreach, Pitch, Negotiation, Closure and Onboarding Develop and maintain a clear understanding of ShopeePay Create, maintain and manage the working relationship with merchants and collect data/feedback from merchants  How do you qualify? A poly/university/college degree in any major At least 1-2 years of experience in sales Motivated, Resilient, Persistent Have a hunger for success Hardworking A team-player who can work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment Excellent communication skills in English Experience/knowledge of the local F&B and/or retail industries will be a plus  Depending on performance, there will be opportunity for contract conversion to full time role upon completion of contract.

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  Position: Business Development Representative, Singapore  Our Sales Development team is comprised of Business Development Representatives (BDR) and Sales Representatives (SR). SR's manage inbound leads while BDR's (the more senior of the two roles) focus on outbound lead generation. This opening is for BDR. We are currently seeking high-energy, driven professionals with sound business acumen and natural sales instincts to join our fast-paced and dynamic team. Ideal candidates should be eager to advance through a clearly defined learning and earning path. Salesforce.com offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be provided the tools, resources and outstanding leadership to sell business application solutions and take your career to the next level!  Business Development Representatives are tasked with strategically developing and qualifying revenue opportunities within their assigned territory. BDR's work closely with their AE's in a business development capacity. Candidates for this position must be highly motivated, tenacious, and self starters.  Responsibilities Generate new business opportunities to fuel the sales Pipeline for our products across our Enterprise Accounts Create and prioritise strategic target account lists within Singapore Research and build "cold accounts" (i.e.: adding contacts, sending emails, cold calling) Consistently meet or exceed monthly sales targets/quotas. Conduct high level conversations with Senior Executives in prospect accounts Evangelize Salesforce and the On-Demand model Required Skills Minimum 3 years Inside Sales experience within IT (New Business Development, Cold Calling, Planning/Strategy etc) Excellent track record selling to Singapore clients Excellent Written/Verbal communication skill High Energy. Positive Attitude. Fluent in English to converse with clients in the Singapore market Ability to multi-task, prioritise, and manage time effectively. Company Overview  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World’s Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running, while currently being #1 best place to work in Singapore. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: The Future Is What We Make It  Senior Sales Manager  Singapore  Honeywell offers employees the opportunity to work on the world’s most exciting projects, redefining the cities we live in, the buildings where we work, and the vehicles that move us.  We are currently seeking a Senior Sales Manager to join our Building Technologies (HBT) team in our Singapore office. Reporting to a Product Sales Leader, your focus will be oversight of new prospects and maintain existing customers to drive sales; Facilitating connection between channel partners, M&E Contractors, M&E consultants, architects, developers and users for specifications; assessing market intelligence support and covering the developments going into the market place by competitors and their pricing.  Responsibilities  Drive product sales that bring together both hardware and software products add value to the team with your expertise by driving ideas for new products, principles, theories and concepts. Help Honeywell be the customer's top choice by improving upon Product Sales solutions. Responsible for the market development and growth of HBT business in Singapore. This includes identifying & appointing key customers (Developers / Architects / Interior Designers / M&E Contractors) to increase pipeline. Manage the business and the existing customers to grow the HBT business. Understand the local markets and identify opportunities where our businesses can succeed with current offerings in all relevant market verticals especially Residential, Commercial, Leisure & Entertainment Hospitality, and Healthcare. Develop and execute an overall business plan to achieve the growth targets set for the business in terms of Revenue and margin expansion. Coordinate sales opportunities with the correct engineering and product deliverable. Undertake regular consultant/customer visits for ongoing product and sales training, joint sales calls, and open project reviews Manage any channel/M&E contractors conflict that may arise Evaluating competitors in the local market Establishing and owning the plans and strategies aimed at serving and expanding the customer base Responsible for the strategy and execution of the sales plan for a specific system and vertical market. Accurate forecast of revenue and growth opportunities You Must Have 3 to 5 years’ experience in Project related sales background (Electrical and building management systems knowledge) Bachelor's degree, or equivalent Project / Product Sales Experience Proven track record preferably within the building solutions industry preferred. Excellent written and oral presentation skills. Ability to present and communicate complex technical solutions clearly at all business levels. Ability to work in diverse cultural and multi lingual environments. Proactive mindset and able to work efficiently within virtual and distributed teams We Value A proficient understanding of the principles and best practices in Product / Project Sales Excellent team and communication skills An ability to take initiative and work with limited direction An ability to influence across a broader organization About Us  The world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.  Discover More  We’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/  If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.  The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, religion, or veteran status.  For more information on applicable equal employment regulations, refer to the EEO is the Law poster.  Please refer to the EEO is the Law Supplement Poster & the Pay Transparency Policy .  For more information on how we process your information in the job application process, please refer to Recruitment Privacy Notice.  If a disability prevents you from applying for a job through our website, request assistance here. No other requests will be acknowledged. description: In this role, you will: Provide a stellar customer experience to all inbound leads expressing interest in Pigeonhole Live via multiple channels Conduct context gathering and qualification calls with inbound prospects in order to drive new sales pipeline Become an expert of Pigeonhole Live’s product, user and customer personas. Learn and deliver Pigeonhole Live’s consultative sales practices Work with marketing team in building and fine-tuning lead nurturing processes Build, measure, fine-tune metrics that contribute to SDR ready scores for leads Develop and execute effective methodology in profiling and qualifying leads with SDR ready scores Identify inefficiencies and implement improvements in our processes Be meticulous in recording all interactions with leads in our CRM (Salesforce.com)  Requirements 1+ years of full-time work experience in sales, marketing or customer success Commitment to pursue a sales career in enterprise SaaS Demonstrated familiarity with enterprise SaaS Consistent track record of overachieving Empathic listener and persuasive communicator Must have excellent command of written and spoken English. Positive, self-starting and results oriented. Team player and performs in fast-paced environment. Bachelor’s degree required Experience in the enterprise SaaS / corporate communication / event technology / consultancy agencies would be a bonus.

jobTitle: Sales Insights Lead, Sales Strategy and Operations
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 5 years of experience in business analytics, business intelligence, data analysis and data visualization Experience with SQL and visualization tools (e.g. Looker) Experience structuring and solving cross-functional problems  Preferred qualifications: Experience developing and communicating actionable insights with compelling written/verbal comms and presentations Experience leading projects or initiatives that go beyond insights and into driving change Experience with statistical concepts, business planning, and automation of insights solutions Knowledge of sales and revenue analytics in cloud or similar business models Demonstrated ability to apply problem solve and innovate solutions in a fast-paced and complex business and to balance multiple projects and priorities Stakeholder management skills and ability to identify, influence and align on shared objectives, priorities and outcomes  About The Job  The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  As a Sales Insights Lead for Google Cloud Sales South East Asia, you will be part of the APAC Sales Analytics and Insights team and deliver insights that help to drive growth and improve operational excellence across Sales. You will partner directly with Sales Operations and Sales leadership to become the key analytical partner for the team. You will build a deep knowledge of the business and priorities as we continue to scale and you will provide insights, analysis and dashboards to accelerate our strategic goals and drive our ongoing management of the business. You will collaborate closely with the sales team to find creative ways to solve business challenges, leveraging analytics and automation and you will get to collaborate across APAC and globally to share and scale best practices across Google Cloud.  Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.  Responsibilities  Develop a deep knowledge of the business and partner with Sales Leadership and Sales Operations to develop actionable insights across revenue, sales pipeline, customer lifecycle, sales productivity, and other sales activities to drive growth Be the analytics ‘thought leader’ for the sub-region and think like a business leader to proactively identify opportunities to improve performance through analytics Ensuring accurate and timely reporting for management cadences using automation to streamline and simplify reporting Empower Sales Operations and Sales Managers to drive operational excellence by analyzing and visualizing sales activities such as pipeline management Scale best practices / increase efficiency of how analytics are used and align with global teams on best practices. Design and prototype visualizations and dashboards that enable internal customers to consume and understand data faster and partner with APAC and Global BI to scale  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description: Coinbase has built the world's leading compliant cryptocurrency platform serving over 30 million accounts in more than 100 countries. With multiple successful products, and our vocal advocacy for blockchain technology, we have played a major part in mainstream awareness and adoption of cryptocurrency. We are proud to offer an entire suite of products that are helping build the cryptoeconomy and increase economic freedom around the world.  There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for signals that a candidate will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, disrupt ourselves, and expect sustained high performance because we play as a championship team. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people with the desire and capacity to build and share expertise in the frontier technologies of crypto and blockchain, in whatever way is most relevant to their role.  As an Account Manager, Client Services, you’ll join a high functioning team of passionate support professionals whose performance is critical to Coinbase achieving its mission. You will serve as a primary subject matter expert for Coinbase’s institutional suite of products (Prime Broker and Custody), providing world-class service and support to our most valued institutional clients such as hedge funds, investment managers, market makers, and private wealth managers. Diligent, empathetic, and have a bias towards action, you will play a crucial role in the success of the Client Services organization as we help build the cryptoeconomy.  What You'll Be Doing (i.e., Job Duties) Serve as the primary account manager for a group of Coinbase’s highest value institutional clients, co-owning the relationship with our Institutional Coverage sales teams from top of funnel through on platform support Build and maintain strong relationships with new and existing Coinbase institutional clients, driving successful integrations with the institutional product suite and impact to the overall business Provide a best in class experience for our clients through effective stakeholder management, decisive prioritization, and efficient execution across institutional teams Understand complex, multi-product client workflows and strategies to ensure that our institutional clients are integrated appropriately and using our product suite optimally Effectively triage, manage and prioritize incoming client requests. Manage requests through to resolution, including delegating across teams of subject matter experts Facilitate prospect and client demo calls, serving as subject matter expert on product features, answering technical cryptocurrency related questions, and demonstrating how Coinbase can fit into their overall strategy Distill client feedback to internal teams including Advocacy, Engineering and Product when surfacing bugs, incidents, and product feedback What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements) Motivated by Coinbase’s mission and creating a seamless, white-glove support experience for our highest value individual and institutional clients Experience managing relationships with Market Makers and Introducing Brokers and working with Engineering and Product teams. Minimum of 6 years of relevant experience in an institutional client partner / services / advisory role in financial services or technology industry Experience with relationship or account management for institutional clients, liaising with executive leadership, management, and/or senior operations contacts In depth knowledge of global financial markets, prime brokerage, margin, lending, derivatives, trading platforms, custody, and/or crypto Experience with different channels of support, including voice, e-mail and/or chat Fantastic communication skills in order to operate across multiple departments, stakeholders, and clients Flexible and adaptable to meet the evolving needs of a high-growth and fast paced organization Travel requirements up to 20% to Coinbase offices and client locations (depending on business need) Nice To Haves High level of proficiency in cryptocurrency and Coinbase products Advanced degree in business, finance, project management or client experience ID: G1774  Commitment to Equal Opportunity  Coinbase is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected by applicable law. Coinbase will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. For US applicants, you may view Pay Transparency, Employee Rights and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notices by clicking on their corresponding links. Additionally, Coinbase participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.  Coinbase is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to accommodations@ coinbase.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. For quick access to screen reading technology compatible with this site click here to download a free compatible screen reader (free step by step tutorial can be found here). Please contact accommodations@ coinbase.com for additional information or to request accommodations.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates and Applicants  Depending on your location, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) may regulate the way we manage the data of job applicants. description: About the Role  At ClassPass we believe partnering with companies who share our values can help thousands of more people live active lives. We are seeking an entrepreneurial, highly-motivated individual to help grow our burgeoning corporate sales channel.  The right candidate isn’t afraid of striking up a conversation with someone they just met. They think outside the box, by iterating on a pitch deck, crafting a convincing email proposal or influencing stakeholders to close a deal. This role is ideal for someone who’s a few years into their sales career and is looking to get more experience in relationship-based selling and prospecting.    Key Responsibilities  Source new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls, emails and SDR set up meetings Research, prospect and engage new medium to large corporate partners in ClassPass markets Manage your own opportunities by utilising CRM, email and outreach tools and resources to cultivate and maintain sales pipeline Drive through the full sales cycle by making/sending introductory calls and emails, assessing and building the relationship, performing sales presentations and closing the deal Develop creative, fun, and innovative ways in which you connect and build out your relationships with potential clients and share across the team Attend various industry events and conferences including organising and hosting stands Share good knowledge of the HR/Benefit world and how ClassPass fits in Manage sales pipeline and project management of signed accounts Collaborate with the Corporate Account Management team to ensure the smooth onboarding of a corporate partner  Achieve, and consistently exceed monthly sales goals Maintaining daily KPIs and metrics Contribute to company wide projects   Skills & Experience  Proven experience within sales, preferably selling to HR teams A strong problem solver with the hustle and drive to hit, or even better, exceed goals A strong negotiator with a passion for results Strong relationship builder; comfortable and confident with a wide range of decision makers (internal and external) and happy to collaborate with other teams Willingness to make multiple sales calls and email contacts per day Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM Excellent verbal and written communications skills Ability to multitask, prioritise, and manage time effectively Right to work in Singapore  Who we are  ClassPass is revolutionizing the fitness and wellness industry by bringing together the world’s best classes and experiences into one app. Founded in 2013 by Payal Kadakia, ClassPass connects members to millions of classes in 30 countries around the globe, and is now available as a wellness benefit with some of the world’s leading employers. We make it easy to prioritize your health, whether you decide to head to a local studio, play an on-demand workout or book yourself a much needed wellness appointment. Over 100 million reservations later, we truly believe that we’re just getting started.  What we believe  At ClassPass, we believe in the power of movement. But we believe in more than just that. We believe in building for the future, creating more opportunities for everyone around the world to live fully and in good health. We believe that we can always push ourselves and our company to be better, and that there is power in the hard things when we’re all working together toward the same goal. We believe in building a diverse company where a sense of belonging is felt by employees, customers and partners alike. And we believe that the secret to ClassPass’ success is its people. ClassPass is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We highly value diversity at our company and encourage people of all different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or other protected characteristics.
industries: Consumer Services

description: Cellebrite is the Global leader in digital intelligence, providing law enforcement, military and intelligence agencies, a wide range of solutions for digital forensics, triage and analytics. With cutting edge technology, Cellebrite provides a one-stop shop for digital intelligence to Law enforcement and to the private sector, across the world. With high-energy and high motivation, here at Cellebrite we are creating a safer world day by day.   Role Description: Sales Operations is a key function in Cellebrite’s winning sales team. As such, the Sales Operations Specialist plays a pivotal role in the sales process, managing the back-office operations from End-to-End for a specified territory. The Sales Operations Specialist is a customer facing role, and as such, requires being Customer, sales and service oriented. As a member of the Center of Excellence, the Sales Operations Specialist is required to provide high quality support to both internal and external customers.  Responsibilities: Manage end to end support of the company’s customers. Build a strong, close relationship with the partners and end users, and be their focal point of contact Be the backbone of the sales team, providing support to Sales Directors and assisting in all Back-Office operations Manage all Opportunity-to-Cash activity. Lead the sales cycle from order to shipment Forecast management and data accuracy both in the CRM system (SalesForce), and in the ERP system (Netsuite). Be the company’s Gate Keeper. Work closely with Finance and the Legal department, and implement the company’s policies and procedures Oversee all processes to make sure we meet SOX compliance   Charged with managing all collection aspects. Build processes to improve collection rates, and customize them to the relevant customer type/ culture Manage company’s renewal sales. In a company of over 60K licenses, maintaining and increasing the renewal rate is an important step within the sales process Know and understand the Sales processes, understanding how to prioritize and differentiate between different assignments in a high- pressure environment  Position requirements: 5-year experience in a similar position in a High-Tech Global company- a must! English fluent speaker- a must! Full knowledge of SalesForce- an advantage Full knowledge of Netsuite- an advantage Knowledge of Microsoft Office – must, particularly advanced knowledge of Excel High energy and high motivation Creative thinking- ability to solve complex problems and think outside the box Attention to details Ability to perform in a multicultural environment Work in a high-pressure environment   Cellebrite: Digital Intelligence for a Safer World Digital data plays an increasingly important role in investigations and operations of all kinds. Making data accessible, collaborative and actionable is what Cellebrite does best. As the global leader in digital intelligence deployed in 150 countries, we provide law enforcement, military, intelligence, and enterprise customers with the most complete, industry-proven range of solutions for digital forensics, triage and analytics.  By enabling access, sharing and analysis of digital data from mobile devices, social media, cloud, computer, cellular operators and other sources, Cellebrite products, solutions, services and training help customers build the strongest cases quickly, even in the most complex situations. As a result, Cellebrite is the preferred one-stop shop for digital intelligence solutions that make a safer world more possible every day.  Founded in 1999, Cellebrite is known worldwide for innovation, commitment to our customers’ missions, and technical expertise. With HQ in Israel the company has more than 750 employees across the globe, with dedicated Sales operations in the United States, Israel, Brazil, United Kingdom, Germany, Singapore and Australia.
