description: Job Description of Senior Sales Representative for Johnson and Johnson Surgical Vision (Singapore)  J&J Surgical Vision is inviting highly motivated, tenacious and self-starter talent to join our Singapore Commercial team! In this role, you play an important role in achieving sales and driving share gain within our Singapore private and government Ophthalmology accounts in Cataracts and Refractive segment.  This role is rewarded with sales incentives/sales commissions on top of the basic remuneration, so if you are keen, join us now!  What The Successful Candidate Will Do  This role has an overall responsibility for driving sales, achieving targets and manages assigned territory while operating within an assigned budget with the below scope: Be part of the team in determining sales forecasts for business planning to the management through active inputs on market insights and information, sales reports and required documents Proactively assist in implementing market development and field marketing activities with the clear focus in attaining established sales goals including market share objectives Performs contract and/or tender management activities Proactively schedules appointments and make sales presentations to customers Develops customer and product focused presentation packages to address our customers’ needs Regular customer engagement to gather information on orders and market conditions, at the same time active follow up with customers to ensure customer satisfaction with our products Executes promotional activities that are designed to advance sales in specific product lines or areas Coordinate Professional Development activities to enhance the knowledge of Healthcare professionals Partner with our marketing team in development of marketing plan, execution of marketing programs and materials and fulfil internal processes to get marketing materials approved for commercial use  Qualifications Bachelor's degree with min 3 years working experience in sales & marketing Good to have medical device industry (Ophthalmology preferred) Ability to handle multiple projects Excellent interpersonal, communication & presentation skills Team player that strives to maintain excellent working relationship while demonstrating strong, demonstrated leadership qualities, driven by a passion to excel in a customer-centric and innovative organization Cultural sensitivity and ability to work and thrive in a multi-cultural environment, as well as an ability to work in a matrix environment are required  Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore-Singapore-  Organization  AMO Singapore Pte. Ltd. (8387)  Job Function  Sales  Requisition ID  2105954618W
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

description: At Talkwalker, our Sales team is responsible to attract, nurture and close business opportunities generated from both inbound, outbound and partner activities. They are responsible to connect with prospective clients to introduce them to Talkwalker and demonstrate the value of our analytics platform throughout the Marketing, Communications and Insights departments.  Talkwalker is a leading social listening & analytics company with over 2,000 clients globally. Through our AI-powered analytics platform, we gather data from the conversations that happen around brands - online, in the media, and within companies themselves - to uncover, understand, and action consumer insights. We are extremely international, with headquarters in Luxembourg and offices in New York City, San Francisco, Frankfurt, Paris, Singapore, and Tokyo.  Key Responsibilities:  Effectively communicate Talkwalker’s vision to potential prospects in a well organized, thoughtful approach Generate new business opportunities through outbound prospecting via phone calls, emails, and LinkedIn with support from our world-class marketing team Work in tandem with Account Executives to help them identify and develop opportunities within their defined territories Manage pipeline and outreach via CRM and Sales Automation tools Bring a positive attitude to our team on a daily basis   Qualifications:  1+ year of sales or SDR experience, SaaS experience preferred A verifiable history of exceeding personal targets Excellent verbal and written communication skills A sense of accountability and commitment to attain goals The ability to perform day to day tasks with minimal supervision  Strong work ethic  What we offer:  20 days of vacation International health insurance Competitive base salary and opportunity for bonus Internal growth and development programs Company events such as social activities 1 volunteering day per year
industries: Computer Software

jobTitle: Corporate Field Sales Representative, Google Cloud
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in software sales, channel management / sales and strategic account management at an enterprise B2B software company.  Preferred qualifications: 7 years of experience selling Infrastructure Software, Databases, Analytic Tools, or Applications Software with a demonstrated track record in exceeding business goals Experience leading cross-functional teams within the organization and with the partner organization. Excellent at leveraging C-level relationships to sell cloud solutions against competitors. Demonstrated success with large complex commercial and legal negotiations working with multiple teams in large enterprises. Strong track record working with partners in complex implementation projects. Ability to work with pre sales (in house/partner) and customers’ technical leads to inventory existing software estate, define migration plans, and build business cases for migrations.  About The Job  As a member of the Google Cloud team, you inspire leading companies, schools, and government agencies to work smarter with Google tools like Google Workspace, Search, and Chrome. You advocate the innovative power of our products to make organizations more productive, collaborative, and mobile. Your guiding light is doing what’s right for the customer, you will meet customers exactly where they are at and provide them the best solutions for innovation. Using your passion for Google products, you help spread the magic of Google to organizations around the world.  As a Corporate Field Sales Representative, your primary responsibility is to grow Google Cloud’s market share across the identified set of accounts through partners. You are skilled in building executive level relationships, comfortable aligning our cloud offerings and partners’ value proposition to our customers’ needs. You’ll be excellent at prospecting, qualifying, and leading a cross-functional team, while leveraging the right resources including partner engineering, corporate sales, and partner sales to maximize outcomes.  Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.  Responsibilities  Align to the identified corporate accounts in the mid-market segment within a defined Sales territory and drive resold business in those accounts through a set of suitable partners on various sales engagements. Lead account planning process that aligns partner and Google resources to maximize growth, customer satisfaction, and market share. Drive consistent business growth by managing business cycles (including prospecting, qualifying, forecasting, and managing your book of business) in the identified accounts through partners. Negotiate and manage end-to-end complex business cycles, often presenting to C-level executives in the identified accounts. Ensure identified accounts attains business targets by aligning, managing and holding partners accountable in sales engagements. Be responsible for managing partners success and increase Google Cloud Platform consumption in partner-led customer engagements.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description: Describe the position to be undertaken:  The Vertical Manager Tire ASEAN is responsible to maximize market share and establish local ecosystem for Vertical Tire in ASEAN countries with focus on Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia and Indonesia.  The main responsibility is to support the sales organization of the assigned organizational unit in developing strategic and business strategies, structures and processes, focusing options to exploit best market opportunities in Vertical Tire & Semiconductor.  The Vertical Manager Tire ASEAN derives and develops Vertical Tire by cooperating with HQ and relevant regional functions to manage short, mid and long-term objectives and economic successes in defined focus countries according to strategic and operative targets defined by Vertical Tire HQ  Describe the main duties and responsibilities:  Business development of Vertical Tire in ASEAN with focus on Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia and Indonesia. Explore the business potential and seize the growth opportunities for Vertical Tire to enlarge the market share, install base and enhance satisfaction of Top Customers and Partners in ASEAN with focus on Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia and Indonesia. Create market & customer transparency and perform in depth competitor analysis. Deploy push & pull strategy to generate turn over in respective channels such as OEM and SI, or direct business where applicable Performs project coordination in assigned projects and supplies information for the development of new strategies. Relationship management with Top Customers and Partners of Vertical Tire in ASEAN with focus on Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia and Indonesia. Performs long range strategic planning and analysis of Tire market and prepares summaries, and performs operational activities enabling the exploitation of customers. Collaboration with sales unit to systematically capture product & system opportunities in Siemens CRM tool. Provide local support for relevant headquarter functions for the best possible approach for the Vertical Tire to penetrate the local market and enhance Vertical specific expert knowledge about latest technologies and trends in defined countries.  Describe the qualifications, essential skills & employment experience required to be held:  Major in Automation, Business administration, or any relevant disciplines More than 5 years working experience in vertical Tire, understanding characteristics, trends, supplier chain operation of this branch. (can change based on the person’s years of experience) Key account management skills & strategic mindset with effective customer orientation and readiness to intensive working and multi-tasking Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal, with the ability to communicate with internal and external partners of all levels Competence on organization coordination & leading virtual team running smoothly based business driven.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basic of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. description: Job Reference # 237570BR  Job Type Full Time  Your role Do you love discussing financial markets and investment opportunities? Are you a great communicator?  You will be responsible for  develop sales strategies to meet our business goals partner sector heads to drive our sales process keep our sales teams focused on their plans develop, launch and monitor sales initiatives straddle our sales, product partners and CIO team to deliver best-in-class ideas and solutions to our clients contribute to sales narratives development process project manage when required  Your team You’ll be working in Sales Management for Wealth Management, Singapore. Our team's experience ranges from Wealth Management to Investment Banking, research to sales and business management across key financial markets in New York, Hong Kong and Singapore.  Your expertise  5-7 years in financial markets are an expert in one asset class (preferably) have some power point and excel skills (preferably) great with people at all levels excellent communicator creative and out-of-the-box thinker hungry, humble and diligent able to work hard under time pressure someone who has Integrity, passion and tenacity. Always striving to improve and innovate!  About Us Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.  We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?  Join us We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.  Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

description: The ideal candidate is a motivated, organized, and creative individual who welcomes the challenges of acquiring and developing new business through sales efforts. You will build key customer relationships, identify business opportunities, and close business deals while maintaining an extensive knowledge of current market conditions.   Responsibilities Develop, identify and qualify prospective accounts. Understand prospective accounts and communicate effectively the best ways to utilise our platform based on their marketing needs. Assist in the onboarding of prospective accounts. Continually engage with existing accounts to gain feedback and suggest improvements  Be the advocate of your accounts, ensuring customer success.  Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree with at least 5 years of progressive Business Development experience in a fast-paced environment, essentially in Startup, Technology or similar industries Experience in B2B sales and love the sales process, every bit of it Able to drive changes and with continuous improvement mentality A start-up attitude – highly collaborative with an entrepreneurial, roll-up-your sleeves attitude, pragmatic, and able to work independently when required Comfortable with ambiguity - we're a fast-growing business and there's always unchartered territories, which is part of the fun. You should be comfortable with it and understand that not everything is 100% defined all the time. Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Quadrant is looking for a Sales Development Representative to find and support potential customers who can benefit from our products and services. As the first line of communication with prospects, ideal SDRs have a strong understanding of the sales process, excelling at researching leads, starting new relationships, and setting our sales team up for success.   To be considered for this job, please fill out this form so we can get a better picture of your previous experience: https://forms.gle/YMLb9YsRAFHPCLnQ8   Objectives of this Role  Represent Quadrant’s products and services, starting with a comprehensive understanding and leading to consumer research to identify how our solutions meet needs  Generate leads and build relationships by nurturing warm prospects and finding new potential sales outlets  Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects and engage sales executives for next steps  Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation playbook   Daily and Monthly Responsibilities  Utilize LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Meet Alfred, HubSpot, and email to generate new sales opportunities  Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) customers and sales executives  Identify prospect's needs and suggest appropriate products/services  Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects to qualify leads as sales opportunities  Build a list of target companies and proactively seek new business opportunities in the market  Report to the commercial and marketing team with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results   Required Skills and Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree or at least 5 years of relevant work experience  2-3 years of experience as a sales development rep with a track record of achieving quotas  At least 1 year of experience in using LinkedIn Sales Navigator  Strong communication skills via email and LinkedIn  Impeccable English skills, especially in writing  Proven creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills  Strong desire and ability to move up within a sales organization   Preferred Qualifications  Proficiency with HubSpot or other CRM software

jobTitle: Account Manager, Global Client and Agency Solutions
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in advertising sales, marketing, consulting or media. Experience with Google Ad products including Search, Display, Video, and Programmatic.  Preferred qualifications: Experience in discovery and management of Beta products and working with go-to-market teams. Knowledge of both brand and performance solutions, as well as familiarity with the App ecosystem in APAC. Knowledge of SQL and Data Studio. Ability to communicate Google Ads performance solutions clearly to a large team and conduct trainings independently. Ability to collaborate cross-functionally and be quick in execution.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  As an Account Manager, you'll manage relationships with Google Marketing, as well as their digital agency. You will be a media advisor and consultant, developing and driving App Campaigns, Brand and Performance media strategies, and implementing robust measurement solutions to ensure success. You will help shape how Google uses Google Advertising Solutions and you’ll help establish the vision for our marketing efforts. You will be responsible for sharing approved learnings with our Sales team to help drive customer narratives in the market.  Our Global Clients & Agency Solutions team helps serve some of the world's largest brands. Our dedicated teams of marketing and advertising specialists use their unique skill sets to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We aspire to advise our clients on all aspects of their online business strategy. Using Google's broad range of products, we help our clients connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Manage and develop relationships with Google Marketing and Google Media Lab, and help them resolve their business challenges using Google Solutions. Support the agency in planning and execution of on-network (Video, Search, Display, Apps) campaigns. Develop forward thinking, data-driven analysis, and media recommendations that align with customer goals and quantify high-impact opportunities with clear recommendations to pitch to customers. Engage with Marketing teams to leverage learnings from Google’s campaigns to build thought leadership for our narratives. Engage with Google’s Media Lab to drive Google's Beta testing program and develop case studies.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

within the CRM system Rigorous follow-up of offers and client development Monitor shipment cuts (lost clients) and implement counter measures Provide timely feedback to superior regarding performance description: The ideal candidate is experienced with business planning globally across various verticals and sales channels to manage pricing, lifecycles, promotional calendars in the technology or consumer electronics industry. We are looking for someone who is resourceful, adaptable, team-oriented and the ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines. You should have a proven track record in taking on end-to-end ownership and successfully delivering results in a fast-paced and dynamic business environment.  Responsibilities Manage financial analysis, pricing and promotional calendar to ensure that we increase our leadership and market share position Conduct and run competitive benchmarking and product price comparison Work with the Head of Sales & Marketing to ensure regional sales teams are guided in terms of product knowledge, pricing and promotional planning Drive product lifecycle planning for peripherals Responsible for developing and maintaining tools to track, measure and share sales data on Razer and competitive offerings Manage the internal pricing approval system Requirements Degree in Business / Marketing with 5 years of product marketing or business analyst experience with consumer / lifestyle products Proven business planning background with excellent understanding of sales channel management Good analytical and high adaptability skills Excellent interpersonal, communication, and time management skills Possess strong people skills, with the ability to work with the regional Sales & Marketing Teams to bring about increased sales to the market

description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 4 years of experience in analysis and sales operations  Preferred qualifications: Experience working in Sales Experience with learning systems and tools, and driving or designing improvements Ability to speak to both technical and business stakeholders at all levels of the organization Ability to articulate business needs and derive insights from large data sets Basic/intermediate SQL skills. Excellent presentation, communication, problem solving, analysis, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills Passion for continuous optimization or process re-engineering  About The Job  The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  The APAC Sales Efficiency team is focused on empowering the work of Large Customer Sales (LCS) teams through the improvement of capabilities, excellence and support teams utilization. In close partnership with other teams (Product, Global Business Operations, gCare, Subregion/Country) we aim to streamline the complexity of the sales landscape.  As an APAC Sales Operations Lead, you will be a member of a small team and be responsible for the deployment and activation of different projects related to Sales capabilities and Sales efficiency for APAC LCS teams.  With deep knowledge of business analysis, sales processes, customer planning and opportunity management, you will engage with key Country Go-to-Market (GTM), Global Strategy and Operations, Media Operations and Leadership to drive large scale sales efficiency initiatives across APAC. You have a passion for change management, optimizing processes, and helping shape an exceptional sales organization.  Responsibilities  Set and drive the operating rhythm for LCS Sales excellence. Prepare timely reviews and in-depth information at APAC Executive reviews for Operational Metrics, and give actionable information. Partner with the Global Strategy team to cascade Business Operations initiatives, as well as represent APAC’s point of view in Global Executive reviews. Partner with Country teams to ensure alignment with Regional and Global initiatives, scale best practices, and activate desired seller behavior. Act as regional point of contact on day-to-day sales processes. Develop and scale tools, reports, and materials to empower LCS sellers (e.g. playbooks and dashboards). description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Tableau, a Salesforce Company  Tableau helps people see and understand data. Our analytics platform fuels exploration, allowing you to quickly answer questions with data and share insights across your organization. Global enterprises, early-stage startups, nonprofits, and governments all use Tableau’s intuitive software to quickly transform their data into actionable insights. We are passionate about our product and our mission and we are loyal to each other and our company. We value work/life balance, efficiency, simplicity, freakishly friendly customer service, and making a difference in the world!  What You’ll Be Doing…  The Enterprise Account Executive will be responsible for driving sales revenue among and managing relationships with specified customers within an assigned geographical region and market segment.  The Enterprise AE will represent Tableau, demonstrating relentless Customer Focus while managing all aspects of the sales process and customer relationship from Account Planning, Lead Qualification, and Management through Negotiation and Closing and will play an integral role in the success of the overall sales team. This role is a quota-carrying sales position.  Some of the things you’ll be doing include … Create and execute effective territory and account plans for the specified region/customer base to deliver sales objectives considering: overall opportunities, customer business priorities and anticipated business changes, our unique product capabilities, and value proposition. Meet and exceed sales goals (quotas) through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing sales opportunities within the assigned territory. Lead/leverage a matrix account team of Sales Consultants, Business Development Representatives, Services Practice Managers, Marketing, Inside Sales Support, and Customer Success Professionals to develop and manage sales pipeline and enhance customer relationships and value. Build and manage strategic partner alliances and relationships as part of the fully integrated account and territory plan. Manage and track customer and transactional information in a CRM system. Provide regular and accurate reporting of pipeline and forecast through the CRM system. Nurture and expand the company’s relationship with customer accounts of various sizes and industries. Drive customer success by developing and maintaining a deep understanding of customers’ business and industry challenges, market competition, competitive issues, and products. Practice effective, excellent communication with leadership, customers, and extended team and partners. Participate in team-building and company-growth activities including strategic planning, sales training, customer marketing efforts, and customer care. Travel to customer locations in support of sales efforts.  Who you are… Experienced. Strong field-based enterprise software sales experience. Complex sales / solution sales and extensive large figure deal experience. Performer. Consistent over achievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory. Missionary. Highly driven individual with an execution focus and a strong sense of urgency and a belief in Tableau’s mission. Entrepreneurial. You’ve worked with start-ups and emerging organizations. You understand how to build and grow a successful business. Domain. Experience with analytics, data, databases or business intelligence preferred. Relevant Degree preferred. Go-Getter. Willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful. Excellent Communication. You know what to say and more importantly, how to say it. You are a Recruiter! Tableau hires company builders and, in this role, you will be asked to be on the constant lookout for the best talent to bring onboard to help us continue to build one of the best companies in the world  Tableau will operate independently under the Tableau brand, driving forward a continued focus on our mission, our customers and our Tableau Community. The acquisition closed on August 1, 2019, and Tableau is a wholly-owned subsidiary of salesforce.com, inc.  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  The Account and Partner Management team is a sales team that is part of Facebook’s Global Business Group. This team is focused on connecting every business in the world with their customers on Facebook and then helping them grow through solutions like Facebook Pages and Advertising. Account Managers are directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients grow their own business results on Facebook through consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will have the ability to drive marketing strategy coupled with a willingness to roll up their sleeves and execute their sales tactics. Success in this position requires exceptional consultative sales, coaching, and client service skills; a willingness to experiment; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others to achieve results. This position is full-time and located in our Singapore Office.  Responsibilities Become an expert in Facebook’s digital marketing solutions for small and medium clients and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs Grow revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with small and medium clients, and manage complex relationships Demonstrate vertical expertise in all matters relevant to your book of business, including escalation and troubleshooting to resolve client issues Work with small and medium clients to improve the performance of their overall Facebook campaigns Minimum Qualification BA/BS degree 3+ years of experience in account management, brand management, performance marketing, digital marketing, sales or consulting Strong communication skills Fluency in Vietnamese language & knowledge of Vietnam market are essential as the role requires to manage local accounts & communicate business strategy in local language Ability to effectively prioritise and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail Structured problem solving and quantitative analytical skills Sales discipline and feel aspired to go after sales goals

description: Summary  The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionised entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it!   Apple’s Sales organisation generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team is, in many ways, the face of Apple to our customers.   Apple expects innovation in every part of the company, and the Sales team meets that challenge by identifying and creating new commercial models for Apple products and services. The areas of work span, but are not limited to new business development, partner and channel management, team leadership, and collaboration.   At the end of the day, we are here to grow Apple’s business through partnering with our Distribution network. As the SAGE Account Manager, you will join our fast growing Distribution Sales team based in Singapore and managing values added distributor to grow in market demand.   The position plays a meaningful role in Apple’s sales performance and growth in SAGE. You will collaborate closely with internal and external partners to create account/country/regional plans and programs that scale the business across a broad product & services portfolio. Are you ready to do your life's best work here at Apple?   Key Qualifications  Experience in setting up, growing, and leading open channel distributors in emerging/mature markets, driving conversion and in-market demand  Experience in leading carrier/vendor strategic planning and carrier/channel partner commercial engagement at a whole of country/regional level.  Deep knowledge and understanding of the telecommunications, IT & mobile device markets and ecosystems.  In-depth understanding of distribution business models, history, economics and underlying value drivers, with proven commercial acumen & analytical capabilities.  In your experience, you’ve balanced delivering on short-term goals, while creating sustainable value for customers and partners, and demand for the future.  Extensive experience building and maintaining relationships with large and sophisticated organisations.  Clear ability to influence others and navigate diverse and demanding stakeholder groups including C-suite.  Confident and articulate communicator. Able to present insights, proposals and drive conclusions in an engaging manner.  Capable of working autonomously yet able to build, develop, and harness strong internal and external networks.  Ability and drive to encourage cross-functional teams to programatic delivery excellence.  Experienced in delivering successful outcomes through internal and external collaboration.   Description  - Grow in market-demand for the Apple ecosystem, and expand Apple's business and focus within channel partner sales teams.  - Create and execute account/country/regional plans to achieve/overachieve quarterly business objectives, as well as key initiatives across different routes to markets in the territory (distributors, carriers, retail, open channel)  - Identify demand generation/promotional opportunities to optimise sales performance, negotiate commercial arrangements, and drive execution against agreed plan.  - Build and maintain channel structures that provide a phenomenal customer experience coupled with sustainable profitability for partners.  - Ensure optimal channel performance through ongoing analysis of sales data to understand performance, identify growth opportunities, and maintain an effective sales partnership.  - Work with distributor and retailers to develop and deliver valuable services that compliment the sales plan and help add to the customer experience.  - Coordinate below the line marketing activities with the carrier ensuring compliance and appropriate use of Apple creative assets provided by Apple Marketing teams.  - Drive channel programs to ensure excellent customer experience and partner consideration.  - Ensure compliance with the Apple retailer/distributor/carriers iPhone agreements  - Develop and maintain broad relationships with key partners, developing a strong understanding and alignment with their respective focus areas, value drivers and strategic priorities.  - Work collaboratively with key partners to ensure competitive positioning of Apple Products in all market offers.  - You will always represent the Apple brand to the highest level   Education & Experience  We anticipate you will have a MBA/Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.   Additional Requirements  Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants.   We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.   Role Number: 200290403

jobTitle: Sales Strategy & Operations Manager, APAC (Global Clients)
description: Company Description  LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.  Job Description  We are looking for a Sales Operations Manager to support the growth of LinkedIn’s Global Clients Program (“GCP) Business. The role is part of a team that acts as an advisor to executives in the global sales and operations teams and is responsible for helping crack the most important strategic and operational issues facing the Talent Solutions business; and will be responsible for supporting GCP’s Sales teams in APAC, in addition to taking on global work on behalf of the global GCP business.  The GCP organization supports LinkedIn’s largest and most strategic clients worldwide. This position will offer a candidate an exciting and high-profile opportunity to influence the trajectory of a significant portion of LinkedIn’s overall business, interact with some of LinkedIn’s most senior sales professionals, and lead projects with key stakeholders and cross functional partners to make data-driven decisions.  The ideal candidate will have exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills and will be able to handle highly sensitive, confidential, and non-routine information. We're seeking a self-starter who can recognize suboptimal processes and who will take the initiative to improve them. Using strong communication skills, the Manager will effectively collaborate with a variety of people and job functions, accomplishing tasks of high complexity and scope in a challenging and extremely fast-paced environment. The candidate is expected to produce insights that will be utilized in executive level presentations and help drive critical business decisions.  This is a people manager role. This position is based in Singapore and reports to the Senior Manager of GCP Sales Operations.  Responsibilities Include  Play a pivotal role in our annual strategic planning process by making recommendations in areas such as go-to-market strategy, how to restructure/grow teams, and improve rep productivity Lead projects with key Sales stakeholders and cross functional partners to make data-driven decisions on topics including; forecasting, growth/churn strategy, territory optimization, process improvement, sales incentive design, and product mix analysis Partner with Sales executives on operational and analytical requests, e.g. team restructuring, quota setting, territory planning, business performance analyses, etc. Establish strong working relationships with Sales leadership, Business Operations, Finance, Systems, and other cross-functional teams to achieve objectives Gain direct exposure to senior leadership, including the opportunity to present insights / recommendations to executives Manage and develop junior Sales Operations teammates Some travel required  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: BA or BS degree 5+ years work experience in Sales Operations, Management Consulting, Sales, Strategy and/or Finance 2+ years People management experience  Preferred Qualifications  Advanced quantitative or business degree preferred Strong written and verbal communication skills Experience working in high-growth, fast-paced, performance-focused environments Experience supporting global accounts teams in SaaS businesses Experience using and developing reports, metrics and dashboards Interest in analyzing data to drive sound decision-making  Additional Information  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal. Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  This document provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://lnkd.in/GlobalDataPrivacyNotice

description: Company Description  FireEye is the intelligence-led security company. Working as a seamless, scalable extension of customer security operations, FireEye offers a single platform that blends innovative security technologies, nation-state grade threat intelligence, and world-renowned Mandiant® consulting. With this approach, FireEye eliminates the complexity and burden of cyber security for organizations struggling to prepare for, prevent, and respond to cyber attacks. Learn more about FireEye's world-class solutions and global footprint at https://www.fireeye.com/company.html.  Job Description  The objective of the Channel Account Manager position is to be responsible for managing all Channel Sales aspects of the company's business for select named accounts . The primary focus is on Channel sales development, and the proper “care and feeding” to help supplement existing FireEye Sales and SE staff.  What You Will Do: Provide incremental revenue in addition to managing existing and the growth of new prospective Distribution, Channel, System Integration and Consultants that will allow better market and vertical sales/support coverage Help train partners to qualify target accounts and opportunities that will lead to successful POC(Proof of Concept) evaluation. Lead as a facilitator for communication between partners and FireEye. Help facilitate resources from FireEye Region and FireEye Corporate for partners. Validate that FireEye partners are meeting the training, certification and support requirements to stay competitive with quality of service to the end-users. Facilitate product and sales training to partners field Sales/SE staff Drive product marketing, and demand generation activities with partners to accompany FireEye products/solutions on partner’s website, seminars and tradeshows Proactively communicate with FireEye region staff on Channel pipeline and forecasts. Develop and execute a comprehensive Channel business plan for the region: to be reviewed on a quarterly basis by the Region Manager. Monitor, assess and report on a continual basis, the security vendor competitive situation within the channel partners in the region.  Qualifications Channel Sales experience working with local and regional Partners in computer networking & security space. Outstanding Presentation, Written and Verbal Communication Skills. Strong technical knowledge with a broad range of security and networking technologies. Must have both the sales skills and technical knowledge to make presentations and lead customer discussions to advance the sales process. Ability to develop relationships and work extensively at the executive level. Provide accurate forecasting to Reporting Manager regularly (SalesForce.com). Ability to self-motivate and multi-task and work independently or within a team Success Factors. Strong leadership skills. Direct interaction with the Customers, Partners, Marketing, Peers and FireEye’s corporate team will comprise a major portion of this assignment.

description: Account Executive, Singapore  Darktrace is the world’s first and largest self-learning Cyber AI company, helping thousands of companies around the world solve one of today’s most pressing challenges. As we continue our rapid expansion, we have opportunities to join our global sales team, earn significant commissions, enjoy fast paced development, and be part of one of the world’s most exciting and innovative companies.  We are seeking ambitious and driven individuals to join our highly successful team of Account Executives in Singapore covering the Singapore market.  Is this right for you? As an Account Executive you'll play a key role in driving the sales operation, from prospecting for new business to closing deals, and managing an exciting portfolio of client accounts. You'll work with in-house technical experts to present Darktrace’s unique AI solution to information security experts. This role is suited to candidates who are seeking a target-driven sales environment, and have the ability to manage accounts high levels of autonomy. You'll be looking for a meritocratic environment with strong opportunities for development and progression. You'll also have: A degree from a leading university, achieving at least a 2.1 or B equivalent Confidence prospecting your own leads Polished communication skills and ability to build strong and lasting working relationships  About us: Darktrace is a global leader in cyber security AI, delivering world-class technology that protects over businesses, critical services and infrastructure from cyber-threats. Its award-winning technology applies cutting-edge machine learning and mathematics to cyber-security.   The company was the first to develop and commercialise AI for cyber security, and its software engineering team is world renowned.  One of Europe’s fastest growing tech companies, Darktrace listed on the London Stock Exchange in April 2021 and now has a market cap of over £6bn, 1,600+ employees and 5,600+ customers, with offices worldwide.  Darktrace has been named one of TIME Magazine’s ‘100 Most Influential Companies’.  To learn more about us and our leading technology, visit www.darktrace.com.

description: The most important characteristic of our Business Development team is that we love talking about Chainalysis. Our job is to help understand customers’ pain points and determine whether or not our solution will help them overcome the challenges they’re facing.  Business Development Reps are great at asking the right questions, never get discouraged, and are incredibly persistent. We measure our success by the number of introductions we make to the Account Executive team and the overall revenue that started with our outreach.  In one year you’ll know you were successful if... You’ve introduced prospects to the Account Executive team that turned into valuable customers You can talk to anyone at any skill level about Chainalysis, our solutions, and how they’re driving the cryptocurrency industry You are an expert Salesforce, SalesLoft, and Linkedin Sales Navigator user There’s no objection you haven’t heard or overcome in the last 12 months A Background Like This Helps Previous experience in a sales/lead generation role for a SaaS or cryptocurrency business An overachiever in whatever makes you tick - sports, drama, music, underwater basket-weaving, etc. Curiosity and interest in the cryptocurrency industry At Chainalysis, we help government agencies, cryptocurrency businesses, and financial institutions track and investigate illicit activity on the blockchain, allowing them to engage confidently with cryptocurrency. We take care of our people with great benefits, professional development opportunities, and fun.  You belong here.  At Chainalysis, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. Some of the ways we’re ensuring we keep learning are an internal Diversity Committee, Days of Reflection throughout the year including International Women’s Day, Juneteenth, Harvey Milk Day, and International Migrant’s Day, and a commitment to continue revisiting and reevaluating our diversity culture.  We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, spirituality, ability, experience and more. Additionally, if you need any accommodations to make our interview process more accessible to you due to a disability, don't hesitate to let us know. You can learn more here. We can’t wait to meet you.  Applying from the EU? Please review our Candidate GDPR Notice.  By submitting this application, I consent to and authorize Chainalysis to contact my former employers, and any and all other persons and organizations for information bearing upon my qualifications for employment. I further authorize the listed employers, schools and personal references to give Chainalysis (without further notice to me) any and all information about my previous employment and education, along with other pertinent information they may have, and hereby waive any actions which I may have against either party(ies) for providing a reference. I understand any future employment will be contingent on the Company receiving satisfactory employment references.

It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that encourages the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.   We are seeking an experienced Search Ads - Client Partner with a real passion for B2B sales to join our Marketing Platforms team to help businesses with promotion and discovery across Apple Services.   You should have very strong communication and interpersonal skills, you are highly analytical, resourceful, customer focused, team oriented, and have the ability to work independently to meet revenue and business objectives.   You have a proven track record of meeting or exceeding revenue targets in the mobile and app developer space with performance type advertisers and agencies.   https://searchads.apple.com   Key Qualifications  Experience in performance media sales for the India market.  Deep understanding of the India media landscape and in particular Shopping, Social Network, and Entertainment verticals. Owns sales network in the market.  Deep understanding of how Performance Advertisers go to market and measure success.  Strategic selling aptitude working with performance advertisers as well as advertising agencies.  Excellent communication and presentations skills - both in person and over the phone.  You possess strong collaboration skills and you're able to work in a dynamic, exciting environment. description: About The Team  After acquiring our digital banking licence, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market rapidly.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers, but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  Job Description Acquire and Grow ShopeePay’s offline merchant network Cover end to end Merchant Acquisition cycle - from Lead Generation to Outreach, Pitch, Negotiation, Closure and Onboarding Develop and maintain a clear understanding of ShopeePay Create, maintain and manage the working relationship with merchants and collect data/feedback from merchants  Requirements A poly/university/college degree in any major At least 1-2 years of experience in sales Motivated, Resilient, Persistent Have a hunger for success Hardworking A team-player who can work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment Excellent communication skills in English Experience/knowledge of the local F&B and/or retail industries will be a plus Depending on performance, there will be an opportunity for contract conversion to full-time role upon completion of contract.
industries: Internet

description: Foursquare is the leading independent location technology company, powered by our deep understanding of how people move throughout the world. Our solutions help businesses make smarter decisions, developers create more engaging experiences, and brands build more effective marketing strategies.  Foursquare’s platform includes Attribution, Audience, Proximity, Places, Pilgrim SDK and Visits. As the industry’s first and only accredited company for location data from the Media Rating Council (MRC), this foundation powers all our solutions — those that exist today and those we have yet to build. Over 14 billion consumer-verified place visit confirmations help us keep our map and models fresh and up-to-date, building a phone’s-eye-view of the world with 105 million unique places of interest worldwide.  About The Role  As the Sales Manager you will be responsible for a defined set of independent agencies and brands. The position requires a strategic thinker who will be deeply involved in creating location-based advertising solutions for advertisers that lead to strategic and long term partnerships.  Responsibilities You will spend time meeting with agencies and brand direct clients, evangelizing Foursquare and location-powered advertising. You will be responsible for building positive relationships with client/agency counterparts, maintaining ongoing communications and ensuring that client needs are met. Along with the Business Development, Product, and Data teams you will craft custom opportunities to address marketer’s goals. You will take complex, and at times technical, sets of capabilities and translate that into a compelling story for the marketplace. You will maintain a high level of internal and external client service orientation while providing excellent customer service. Tracks all activity in Salesforce and manages/closes opportunities in a timely fashion. Qualifications 7+ years of experience with digital advertising in sales, account management, programmatic or data led sales experience preferred. Has a network of contacts throughout the industry at both agencies and clients. An entrepreneurial approach to business Demonstrated success in a goal oriented, highly accountable sales environment. Strong work ethic with excellent organizational, project/time management, and analytical skills Experience structuring, negotiating and closing large partnership deals with top holding companies Experience using Excel, Powerpoint, Salesforce, Google Docs Ability to think and plan strategically BS/BA degree Foursquare is proud to foster an inclusive environment that is free from discrimination. We strongly believe in order to build the best products, we need a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds. This leads to a more delightful experience for our users and team members. We value listening to every voice and we encourage everyone to come be a part of building a company and products we love.  Foursquare is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Description  Optimizely is focused on unlocking digital potential and we are the recognized category leader in Digital Experience Platform (DXP) and created the category for A/B Testing and experimentation software. We have incredible customers – isn’t that one of the most important aspects of looking for your next job? Optimizely has over 9,000 brands from global organizations such as Visa, Sky, Yamaha, Wall Street Journal to tech innovators like Atlassian, DocuSign, FitBit and Zillow.  Not only are we financially sound and growing but we have unicorn status: Exceeded $300M in revenue in 2020, is profitable already, and has all strategic options ahead of itself. Optimizely continues to invest and addresses a market opportunity north of $30 billion, providing significant personal career growth opportunities.  We are an inclusive culture with a global team of 1200+ people across the US, Europe, Australia, and Vietnam. We blend European and American business culture with emphasis on teamwork, inclusion, and moving fast. People make the difference!  If you are looking to work on the next generation of digital technologies in a fast-paced, hyper-growth environment, apply! We’re just getting started...  What's it like to work here?  "Nowhere else in the tech industry can you find a role that puts you on the frontlines of digital transformation, speaking with the world's most exciting brands to help them build the online experiences of the future. As a bonus, we let loose with fun outings to awesome restaurants and activities." - Henry, Current Account Executive, former SDR  What You'll Do Help us bring the world’s most adopted digital experimentation platform to your assigned markets Become part of our proud front-line as the first touch-point for clients, establishing long-term relationships Collaborate with Account Executives and Marketing to further develop the territories Drive targeted customer engagements with senior marketing executives Educate businesses on the value of testing and personalization through experimentation Become a specialist in SaaS solutions sales Be part of an intercultural environment with inspiring and ambitious colleagues Great support for personal development and mentorship  Qualifications Sales experience, customer service experience or another type of client-facing experience preferred Knowledge from and insights in tech/SaaS business is preferred You take ownership of everything you do You love making a direct impact You are a keen communicator and love to meet new people You are passionate about technology and online business You are a self-starter with a growth mindset You are solutions-oriented and not afraid to speak up or share an idea You are fluent in verbal and written English  Even if you meet 60% of these qualifications, we encourage you to apply! We are looking to create a diverse and multifaceted team. We embody inclusion, which is reflected in our company values where we embrace diversity and equal opportunities for everyone.  Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

Self-starter mentality with experience working in a dynamic start-up environment Experience in managing large scale and privileged client events Excellent sales track record with experience of selling advertising and creative solutions Ability to sell creatively, manage complex projects and multi-task A team leader, committed to supporting the team goals Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty. Experience in editorial writing is a plus   Salary range reflected is the base salary, on top of which a commission structure will also apply for the Business Development Manager role.

description: Lynk is the best place to seek, build and share credible human expertise. We power the new knowledge economy. Our Knowledge-as-a-Service platform unlocks the insights, experience and expertise of experts from around the world, helping people and companies make informed decisions. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, leading investment houses, global family offices, top professional services firms, governments and other organizations. We have been a member of the World Economic Forum since 2019, and we have also formed a Global Alliance with UBS.  We are looking for an experienced people manager to rapidly grow our Southeast Asia Client Solutions team in Singapore. The SEA Regional lead will also be responsible for growing our business across SEA with high focus on Singapore.  What You’ll Do Manage a regional Client Solutions team of 20+ team members across offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, and Vietnam with the aim of providing the best client experience Grow our SEA team as we ramp up hiring for your team in Singapore. Mentor, train and manage new joiners at a rapid pace to meet our increasing client demand Collaborate with multiple departments (sales, marketing, talent acquisition, tech) to ensure the proper execution of the company’s vision and initiatives across SEA Network with our client base in SEA and conduct regular meetings with senior client stakeholders based in Singapore Lead demand generation efforts and collaborate with the marketing team to engage our client base across SEA with thoughtful marketing content Lead productivity growth efforts in the region by closely monitoring data, identifying trends, and deriving solution-focused insights through effective people management and data analysis Work with the product team to be the voice of the customer and proactively lead the adoption of our suite of tech products across our client base in SEA Ensure that team members are actively developing a granular understanding of our clients’ companies/sector coverage in order to build meaningful long-term relationships Experience Required For This Role Minimum 8 years of work experience with 2 or more years of experience in the expert network industry is required for this role Must have experience in a regional leadership role. SEA is preferred Prior experience hiring, training and managing large teams (15+ people) that work across different regional offices is essential An established network among our client base across SEA (consulting firms, investment banks, hedge funds, private equity,venture capital firms) Self starter with experience building business operations in a fast paced environment.. Proven track record in increasing productivity and managing organizational change Results oriented, and driven to meet aggressive targets as the role has considerable topline responsibility Experience in managing cross functional projects and working collaboratively with various departments to achieve company objectives Experience using and deploying CRM Systems (eg. Hubspot) Good communication skills as you will regularly meet and engage clients through in-person and remote meetings Emotional intelligence and a penchant for connecting people Self-disciplined and capable of identifying and completing critical tasks independently and with a sense of urgency A masters degree in business is highly preferred Familiarity with SaaS business models is a plus What We Commit To You Competitive remuneration package in a rapidly-expanding growth stage global company An environment that respects diversity and inclusion Comprehensive medical insurance coverage The opportunity to travel and work around the globe with our international clients and growing number of offices (Hong Kong, Shanghai, Singapore, Mumbai, Hyderabad, Manila, Ho Chi Minh, New York City, Toronto) Notes LYNK employees are prohibited from trading Restricted Securities (defined as any security whose performance is linked to a single company) on any Personal Trading Account. All future new joiners are required to undergo a background check. Lynk is an equal opportunities employer.

description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  The Account and Partner Management team is a sales team that is part of Facebook’s Global Business Group. This team is focused on connecting every business in the world with their customers on Facebook and then helping them grow through solutions like Facebook Pages and Advertising. Account Managers are directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients drive business results on Facebook through consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will have the ability to drive marketing strategy coupled with a willingness to roll up their sleeves and execute the tactics. Success in this position requires exceptional consultative sales, coaching, and client service skills; a willingness to experiment; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a drive for helping others achieve results. This position is full-time and located in our Singapore Office.  Responsibilities Become an expert in Facebook's solutions for businesses of all sizes and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs Grow revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with SMB clients, complex relationships Demonstrate expertise in all matters relevant to your book of business, including escalation and troubleshooting to resolve client issues Work with small and medium clients to improve the performance of their overall Facebook campaigns Minimum Qualification At least 4+ years of experience in account management, brand management, performance marketing, digital marketing, sales or consulting Must have strong web analytics experience Knowledge of digital marketing landscape of Australia/New Zealand is essential because a successful candidate will be working closely with clients based in Australia/New Zealand and responsible for building relationships and helping them drive business Account Manager will manage clients whose usual business language is English. Knowledge of English is essential for success in this role BA/BS degree with strong academic performance Preferred Qualification Ability to effectively prioritize and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail Strong problem solving and quantitative analytical skills

description: PSG is a global pump and dispensing solution expert and leading manufacturer of pumps, systems and related flow-control technology for the safe and efficient transfer of critical and valuable fluids and materials. Headquartered in Oakbrook Terrace, IL, USA, PSG is comprised of several world-class brands, including Abaque™, All-Flo, Almatec®, Blackmer®, Ebsray®, EnviroGear®, Griswold®, Hydro Systems, Mouvex®, Neptune™, Quattroflow™ and Wilden®. PSG products are manufactured on three continents, North America, Europe and Asia, in state-of-the-art facilities that practice lean manufacturing and are ISO-certified. PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of Dover Corporation. For additional information on PSG, please visit psgdover.com. PSG: Where Innovation Flows.  PSG is part of the Pumps and Process Solutions segment of the Dover Corporation® (NYSE: DOV). Dover is a diversified global manufacturer and solutions provider with annual revenue of approximately $7 billion. We deliver innovative equipment and components, consumable supplies, aftermarket parts, software and digital solutions, and support services through five operating segments. Recognized for our entrepreneurial approach for over 60 years, our team of over 23,000 employees takes an ownership mindset, collaborating with customers to redefine what's possible.   To develop and expand market coverage in the Asian semiconductor market with our Almatec brand we are looking for a Business Development Manager (f/m/d) – Semicon, Asia starting in September 2021, located in the Philippines or Singapore.  Your tasks: ·        Develop and execute a strategy to leverage commercial, operational, and organizational opportunities to deliver revenue synergies. ·        Drive revenue in the targeted market by identifying, acquiring, and managing new customers with focus on end-users, OEMs and other relevant semicon market participants. ·        Collaborate with account managers on account specific challenges and sales strategies. ·        Proactively understand the customer strategy and needs. ·        Develop, establish, maintain, and manage relationships with key influential contacts of customers. ·        Identify acquisition and product development opportunities within core and adjacent technologies. ·        Interface with product managers, engineering, and sales to develop new products, create business cases, execute field trial plans, and product launches that are aligned with overall product life cycle strategies. ·        Drive development of value-added customer materials and training. ·        Train and accompany new partners in their way to market.  Your profile: ·        4 year degree bachelors degree from accredited university. ·        Prior customer interfacing responsibilities (ex. sales, business development, technical service etc.) with strong communication and presentation skills. ·        Experience in selling the values of a premium product offering. ·        History of achieving sales goals using a collaborative, cross-functional team. ·        Deep knowledge of production technologies in general and of fluid handling systems in the Semicon market. ·        Ideally personal professional experience in the regional Semicon market. ·        Expert in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and experience with SharePoint. ·        Willingness to travel 50%, mostly Asia, occasionally EMEA or USA. ·        Fluent in English (written and oral).
