description: About You: This is a high-impact role which will be primarily interacting with entrepreneurial business leaders. The target candidate is seeking a young fast-growing fintech and a role where they can deliver something special. We are looking for the following: A hands-on, self-starter with the ability to quickly learn new markets and industries, together with demonstrable digital fluency; Seeking experience of B2B sales, preferably in a finance-related business, selling into both SME’s and large corporates; A working understanding of accounting principles (in particular the working capital cycle); Proficient in both English and Chinese; Graduates from University or Poly in Singapore, Singapore citizen or PR. Responsibilities for the role: As a SDR you will build a portfolio of new clients and your success will be driven by your perseverance, ability to hunt prospects, understand their business and articulate a strong value proposition. Below is a detailed list of responsibilities: Build a deal pipeline and actively close deals across the core product areas. Use a variety of sources including self-generated opportunities to build and maintain a qualified pipeline of sales opportunities: o Use Direct Selling methods – Cold calling, emailing, social and other channels to generate new business conversations; o Work with Indirect Sales partners to qualify and close inbound leads; o Work closely with the wider sales and marketing teams to qualify and nurture new leads Produce collateral and reports to support closing of opportunities: o Leverage and enhance sales and marketing tools (e.g. Salesforce/LinkedIn/Hubspot) and resources to best enable the sales process; o Report daily, weekly and monthly performance against KPIs, metrics and targets; o Produce high quality business documentation including proposals and business cases; o Maintain prospect and customer database, and individual pipeline in CRM tool Build expertise and presence in relevant industry sectors so as to: o Articulate TradeBridge’s value proposition/consultative approach with new opportunities; o Build credibility amongst prospective clients in the market Develop your own sales strategy to achieve and exceed sales volumes and revenue targets Input into development and execution of sales and marketing strategies;

Company At a Glance  Founded in 2013, Sendbird is the leading user engagement platform trusted by modern digital apps like Reddit, Delivery Hero, Dream 11, Carousell, Teladoc, DoorDash, and Hinge. We allow any app (or Website) to quickly and easily embed rich real-time chat, voice, and video experiences into their app to build connections with users and between users. This could be connecting drivers and consumers in a timely fashion to reduce cancellations for a delivery app, helping buyers get their questions answered from sellers to increase transactions in a digital marketplace, or increasing engagement between users in an online community. The platform has over 150M MAUs from over 50 countries operating in industries ranging from marketplaces, ride-sharing, and online communities to gaming, live video streaming, and healthcare.  The company is headquartered in San Mateo, CA with additional offices in; New York, Seoul, London, Singapore, and Bengaluru and has raised over $220M from leading investors, including: ICONIQ Capital, STEADFAST Capital Ventures, Tiger Global Management, Shasta Ventures, Softbank Vision Fund 2, and Y Combinator.  To Learn More, Visit The Company Website  www.sendbird.com  We are looking for an experienced Strategic Account Executive who can find, support, and grow our largest customers and continue to challenge them to increase in-app chat adoption as part of their core user experience in various use cases. We expect you to develop your leads, transform the imagination of customers and developers, close, and grow strategic mega-deals. We value a tenacious work ethic and being relentlessly resourceful.  Who You Are Relentless work ethic and dedication towards customers Fast learner with a high level of energy, positivity, and curiosity A thoroughbred hunter - excited at the prospect of networking, finding leads, and winning our next largest customers. Competitive and collaborative in equal measure A natural extrovert - Passionate about technology and how this relates to solutions for customer and end-user benefit A compulsive winner Relish change Strong alignment with company values  What You Will Do Own your area of responsibility, engaging with and conducting the wider organization to ensure our continued regional success and attainment of significant new business Identify our next biggest customers Use proven methodologies to gain traction and ultimately win significant new logos Form relationships with co-founders of ‘Unicorns’, Chief Product Officers & Chief Technology Officers. Uncover & drive opportunities of with an annual value in excess of $1MM Work with Sales Development Representatives to target and prospect Manage and grow any accounts you are responsible for increasing traction and awareness and ultimately net new ARR Use your extensive relationships and networking skills to win and upsell new and existing accounts Be an expert in the Sendbird proposition and your prospect’s business, create custom presentations, and work with Sales Engineering to present according to known requirements from your prospects and customers. Represent Sendbird at industry events, host customers, and deliver speaking engagements as necessary to promote the Sendbird brand and message as and when suitable Report and forecast accurately, deliver internal business reviews, and ensure Feedback internally on how we can improve and be comfortable pushing for change  Experience And Skills Technology field face to face sales experience working with developers and product managers Experience in identifying significant, new, and compelling opportunities within large and/or fast-growing organizations Demonstrated ability to close large complex sales opportunities Able to orchestrate around significant opportunities Exceptional verbal and written communication Understanding of SDK/API business and/or a quick learner in B2B technology product space  NICE TO HAVES Experience selling cloud-based and/or middle-ware solutions to developers and product managers Experience in vertical industries (communities, live-streaming, on-demand, e-commerce, gaming, etc.) Experience being a product manager for mobile applications Established network with large digital 1st organizations and/or System Integrators.  Finally, there is no such thing as a perfect candidate. Sendbird is a place where everyone can learn and grow. We encourage you to apply if this role excites you. At Sendbird, one of our core values is Global Citizenship. We respect, promote, and encourage diversity for equal employment opportunities. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal state, or local law.

description: HRM Asia is a fully integrated, dynamic publishing and events company serving Asia’s human resource (HR) and people management professionals. We present authoritative insights and proven ideas on domestic and global HR and people management matters through a distinctively Asia eye. We are currently looking for an experienced Delegate Sales Executive to be an integral part of our business to promote and acquire delegates for our market-leading conferences. Delegate Sales Executive  Job description The successful candidate will play a key role in reaching out to and growing our customer base by selling our world class flagship conference as well as supporting revenue growth through the conference ticket sales. The high level of activity requires the individual to balance a range of responsibilities via phone including lead qualification, B2B sales, new lead generation and enquiry follow-up.  Responsibilities Achieve and where possible exceed agreed sales targets Efficiently and effectively handle minimum set positive outbound calls per day Ability to understand, communicate and educate the customers on the conferences Timely follow up and thorough qualification of marketing and sales leads Manage designated opportunities from lead to close, including proposal and registration Respond to inbound sales related inquiries  Qualifications General awareness and understanding of the function of a telesales representative. 1-3 year’s sales/sales support, lead management, telemarketing or customer service experience. Experience working in a goal-oriented environment. Strong organization/prioritization skills; proven ability to consistently meet deadlines. Customer satisfaction focus. Strong listening, probing, and phone skills.  Interested candidates should provide a resume detailing all relevant experience. Please forward to: yeeling@hrmasia.com.sg

O.C. Tanner is a global HR software and services company, specialising in workplace culture and employee recognition.  We are a privately-owned, 93-year-old start-up. Our experience and vision support an unwavering focus on thought leadership and innovation. This ensures we change tack to meet evolving client needs and influence market trends.  Our purpose is both simple and profoundly important - we help people thrive at work. This purpose unites and guides every aspect of what we do.  An exciting opportunity now exists in O.C. Tanner’s Asia sales team for an experienced Sales Development Representative to join us to provide support to the Business Development and Marketing functions for O.C. Tanner Asia through lead generation and nurturing activities.  The key responsibilities of the role include: Proactively participating in the development and execution of targeted prospecting campaigns across the Asia region, aimed at generating new relationships, meetings and new business opportunities; Conducting market research to define targeted companies and audiences; Undertaking discovery meetings; Responding to and qualifying inbound leads, marketing-generated leads and enquiries within the region; Maintaining up-to-date client account and contact records in our CRM; Attending sponsored and industry events, as required; Regular reporting of prospecting activity; Supporting broader O.C. Tanner business development and marketing activities.  As the ideal candidate, you will have: Strong experience working across key Asia markets in an inside sales roles with a SaaS or HR service provider; A proven track record of success, demonstrating your experiencing in achieving results;   Excellent verbal and written communication skills; A strong collaborator and team player; Excellent time management skills; Fluency in Bahasa Malay, Cantonese and/or Japanese will be advantageous.  In return you will receive a competitive salary package and a range of fantastic employee recognition and benefit opportunities which include access to company-wide bonuses, medical insurance, a wellbeing reward program and a great company culture that promotes flexible working arrangements to ensure a genuine work-life balance.

Overall Purpose:  The Regional Key Account Manager is responsible for managing and maximizing SingPost’s business result from the assigned regional accounts and business development through a combination of world class account management, business development, and consultative selling. Responsible for developing relationships and effective solutions to ensure revenue growth, retention and customer satisfaction, in order to achieve the assigned sales, volume and financial targets. Reports to the VP of Group Sales.  Must effectively and diplomatically manage the competing interests between internal profit centers in such a way that the customer is served in the best possible way, and SingPost Global Strategy and objectives are achieved.  Areas of Responsibility Develop, manage and execute a Regional account development plan in accordance with goals and objectives for the account, including acquisition of new business, maintenance of existing business and maintaining or improving profitability. Sell end-2-end eCommerce Logistics solutions; both from a technology and logistics perspective. Accountable to provide the VP of Group Sales with concise, data/fact-driven information and analysis on opportunities, issues, trends and financial results inclusive of identification of alternatives and options. Develop and drive a regional/global account engagement strategy, including the virtual network of local account managers in several Asia Pacific countries and levels, involvement of Executive sponsors and appropriate use of other company resources. Responsible to ensure the accounts are serviced and managed properly and is positioned to grow and gain profitability in accordance to the account plan. This is done through direct and frequent contact with operating management to know the current state of service delivered to the account.  It’s the duty and authority of the Key Account Manager to bring attention to shortfalls as early as possible and to make recommendations to operating management at all levels for the placement of resources, plant and equipment in order to adequately service the account.  Accountability Responsible for achieving assigned Business Objectives such as Revenue Targets Improve customer satisfaction with SingPost  Education: Degree in a related field (Candidates with Diploma that demonstrate extensive relevant experience would also be considered)  Experience:  +5 year working experience in eCommerce or International brands (Account management / Business Development/similar) Ability to work in a fast-moving environment APAC experience Fluency in English and preferably in Mandarin  We are pleased to collaborate with e2i as our recruitment partner.

description: Want to work for a company that is open minded, innovative, values contribution, and lets you take pride in your work while having fun? Join our team of 750 employees around the world who all help Advantek be the world’s leading provider of precision component delivery systems. Our customers are some of the biggest Microchip producers and automotive companies in the world.  We are looking for a Key Account Director to join our team! The Key Account Director is responsible for building relationships and providing their customers with solutions in order to meet sales revenue and profitability goals for those global key accounts. They build and expand relationships with strategically important global customers and represent the entire range of company products to customers, while leading the customer account planning cycle and ensuring assigned customers’ needs and expectations are met by the company.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop annual sales plan and long-term strategic plan for assigned accounts. Promote and sell existing and new products following the established plans. Achieve revenue and profit targets. Establish productive and professional relationships with key stakeholders and decision-makers in assigned customer accounts following a periodic meeting plan. Coordinate the involvement of regional sales team and internal support functions such as Application Support, Customer Service and management resources across multiple locations in order to meet account performance objectives and customer’s expectations. Proactively lead a joint company strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones for both short- and medium-term horizon. Proactively assess, clarify and validate customer needs on an ongoing basis. Lead solution development efforts that best address customer needs while coordinating the involvement of all necessary company personnel. Monitor and report all customer and competitive data.  SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE: 10+ years professional sales experience 5+ years of direct semiconductor sales experience University graduate in business administration or in any engineering discipline Advance degree in business administration preferable Work experience in an ISO certified manufacturing environment helpful LEAN programs or related process improvement systems knowledge helpful

description: Would you relish the opportunity to sell world-class technical products?  Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and ensuring customer success?  Join our Web Core Business team Our team works with world leading companies in every major industry to make the internet fast and secure. As a partner to the Global 500, we collaborate with customers and prospects to align Akamai solutions to business needs. We build relationships and insights to maximize product value through the full scope of our global platform.  Successfully generate new business As an Inside Sales Representative, you will successfully guide new customer sales over the phone and own the full sales cycle. You will be generating new business through outbound calling, email, inbound inquiries and marketing events. Articulating the Akamai value proposition, you will generate interest and enthusiasm for Akamai’s solutions in the market.  As an Inside Sales Representative, you will be responsible for: Becoming a trusted advisor in ensuring customers get the most value out of Akamai platforms Generating new business through to contract negotiations to ensure customer satisfaction and adoption of Akamai technologies Creating and managing a full sales cycle and sales pipeline by articulating Akamai value to prospective customers Building customer relationships and engagement through events and training to encourage business growth Partnering with pre-sales to make recommendations for customers to expand the use of Akamai services and solutions  Do what you love To be successful in this role you will: Have 2 years of relevant experience and a Bachelor’s degree or its equivalent Show proven experience of being persuasive, influential and professional on the phone, social media and email Have experience of meeting daily, weekly and monthly targets, and proven consultative sales skills and quota achievement Demonstrate excellent communication skills and be able to present to various stakeholders Show some experience with accurate forecasting and pipeline management  Work in a way that works for you We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone. We are happy to discuss flexible working options in this role, please discuss your requirements with the recruiter when you apply.  Working with us At Akamai, we’re curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, you’ll thrive here.  Working for you At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life: Your health Your finances Your family Your time at work Your time pursuing other endeavors  Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.  About us Innovating on a global scale, we deliver our customers a fast, smart and secure intelligent edge platform. Working against a backdrop of digital collaboration, our highly skilled teams build progressive solutions that have the scope to transform entertainment, business, and life in ways that we have yet to imagine.  Join us Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!  #LI-DNI

jobTitle: Regional Head - Sales & Key Accounts, Grab for Business, SG
description: Job Description:  About Us  Grab was founded on the belief that a technology company in Southeast Asia could both run profitably and create sustainable social impact. We hold ourselves responsible to the environment and socio-economic development of this region, not just for today, but also for the future.  At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles, which we call the 4Hs. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.  WORKING WITH GRAB POSITIVE & COLLABORATIVE ENVIRONMENT. Grabbers thrive in a corporate culture that values every team member's contribution towards our goal of improving lives. ROCKET FUEL FOR CAREERS. Grabbers experience hyper professional growth and all the challenges that entails. Grow your skills while working to solve real issues across the region. FUN & DEDICATED FAMILY. Grabbers work hard and play hard. Our teams grow as one as they overcome challenges and have fun along the way. Our Team:  As a member of Grab, not only will you bring your skill sets to drive your team forward, but you will also develop your untapped potential and be inspired by some of the most amazing minds in the industry. Our team consists of both young and experienced individuals who are tenacious, motivated and energized by the fact that we exist to make a change - have a societal impact in Southeast Asia.  Grab for Business is the B2B SaaS team within Grab that helps to simplify business transportation, corporate food & package deliveries as well as related services for companies across Southeast Asia. We actively engage with top companies and brands across the region and its imperative that we drive efficient revenue channels within our organisation. To this end, we are looking for an incredibly resilient and capable regional sales leader in our Grab for Business team.  To perform this role well, the candidate needs to have exceptional leadership skills, strong sales strategy and communication capabilities, attention to detail, ability to create and follow sales processes, and an exemplary track record of exceeding expectations.  This role is based in Singapore.  The Role: You will report to the Regional Director - Grab for Business Manage multiple revenue generating teams and own the gross bookings and sales quota for multiple channels and B2B products in three core markets (Singapore, Malaysia and Philippines). People Leadership: Work with the Regional Director to oversee all people management aspects for your teams, including building a highly motivated team, hiring / coaching / mentoring best-in-class performers, resource planning and career development. Provide a conducive and progressive team environment for growth and learning. Be a Role Model by ensuring a healthy working culture for your team leads and members based on mutual respect, and by personally embodying and demonstrating all the Grab Way principles. Sales Planning: Ensure critical monthly / quarterly / annual milestones are consistently met or exceeded. Provide regular sales reports, forecasts and set clear performance metrics and be accountable for all sales & key accounts strategy across all your teams. Identify growth areas for existing and new B2B solutions. Implement a customer-centric based mode of working. Key Accounts Team: Lead from the front for multiple high impact teams of Regional & Enterprise Key Account Managers across the English-speaking markets of Singapore, Malaysia and Philippines, focussed on a portfolio of top corporate and multinational clients. Ensure client success by nurturing and expand our working relationships with top corporate clients and decision makers. Enable the team to leverage customer, industry and data-backed insights to achieve excellence and close high value deals with speed. Ensure your teams understand customer pain points, provide the right solutions and ensure a continuous process of up-selling and cross-selling Grab’s B2B solutions. Be extremely organized, and bring a high level of attention to detail and efficiency while working under tight deadlines and on multiple initiatives simultaneously. Inside Sales Team Manage a remote Manila-based team of Team Leads, Inside sales & Sales Development representatives Lead Generation: Build, implement and continuously improve lead generation (online / offline) in your markets. Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to lock down lead generation and sales pipelines for the team. Ensure Sales Development and Inside sales teams work on an always-on acquisition framework in lead nurturing. Pipeline Management: Own and oversee the Salesforce CRM pipeline for all new prospects and existing clients at every stage of the sales funnel. Setup and implement clear pipeline management guidelines for teams to diligently track qualified prospects, and analyse data to understand and forecast gross bookings value and sales potential on a monthly / quarterly basis while taking remedial steps as necessary. Channel Partners Build and scale a channel partner network with carefully selected partners Provide direction to the the Channel Partner team on strategy and operations Build and implement strong SOPs and processes with the Channel Partner to lock down lead generation opportunities and marketing plans that ensure a healthy sales pipeline. Ensure adherence to contractual obligations and commercial terms for Channel Partners The Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s Degree (minimum) required. Work Experience: Candidates need to have at least 8-12 years of total experience in Sales / Key account management in a fast paced B2B startup or B2B corporate environments dealing with SaaS, Recruitment or Technology digital solutions for corporate clients. Candidates should have at least 2-3 years experience in people management and leading high performing sales teams, with an exemplary track record. Experience in successfully running business teams for high growth startups will also be considered. Demonstrable sales planning based thinking ability with excellent communication skills (verbal, written) and presentation skills is a must. Strong interpersonal skills with an ability to effectively network within the industry and the overall Grab organisation. Direct connections to Finance / HR decision makers , other senior management and C-level executives will be advantageous. People skills: Committed and highly collaborative leader who can coach / mentor their sales team while establishing a healthy working culture based on the Grab Way principles. Ability to effectively manage and motivate a team to focus on the overall sales planning roadmap, pipeline management and high velocity sales to close multiple customer deals while ensuring client success. Ambitious, self-driven and highly motivated individual who can work well in a startup VUCA (Volatile, Uncertain, Complex, Ambiguous) environment. Should have a deep desire to excel and develop a career in a fast growing tech company. Should have demonstrated integrity and respect in the performance of their duties. Proficiency in customer experience tools (Salesforce CRM tools, reporting dashboards) Excellent in data analysis (MS Office, Google Docs / Sheets / Slides), pipeline management and forecasting
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: About The Team  After acquiring our digital banking license, ShopeePay is now expanding its presence in the Singapore market aggressively.  We are not only looking at providing another popular payment solution for the merchants and customers but also striving to build an ecosystem via ShopeePay.  Within this ecosystem, merchants can market their products & services more cost-effectively, hence better attract customers to their offline outlets. At the same time, customers are able to enjoy a variety of good-valued deals too.  Job Description Acquire various offline merchants - reach out to them, understand their needs, and find a place for them in our ecosystem where we can have a win-win-win situation among Merchants, Customers and Shopee. Lead a team of field salespeople to source for merchants that have high potential to be attracted to ShopeePay’s consumers Construct, pitch and negotiate cooperation that meets expectations of merchants, customers and ShopeePay Be the point of contact for matters specific to your accounts and our merchants  Requirements Highly motivated and target-driven individual Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills Proactive and always push to deliver extra 1-2 years of working experience in sales or related field is a plus
industries: Internet

description: Instructure was founded to define, develop, and deploy superior, easy-to-use software. (And that’s what we did / do / will keep on doing.) We are dedicated to the fight against iffy, mothbally, shoddy software. We make better, more usable tools for teaching and learning (you know, stuff people will actually use). A better connected and more open edtech ecosystem. And more effective ways for everyone everywhere to access education, make discoveries, share knowledge, be inspired, and do big things. We accomplish all this by giving smart, creative, passionate people opportunities to create awesome. So here’s your opportunity.  We are looking for an experienced Sales Development Representative to join our Singapore team.  What You Will Be Doing Responsible for creating pipeline of qualified business opportunities for designated APAC markets. Manage inbound lead workflow daily and efficiently qualify inbound leads based on business needs and revenue potential. Develop and implement effective outbound strategies to prospect and target new clients, by utilising a number of available sales tools. Provide an outstanding first exposure to Instructure and our products, introducing and positioning our learning software to new clients. Work very closely with your designated Regional Director and together identify business opportunities and develop impactful and effective strategies to target new prospects. Meet and exceed quarterly and annual meetings booked and revenue quotas for assigned markets. Provide regular and accurate forecasts, ensuring that there is enough pipeline coverage in order to meet assigned revenue quotas. Here's What You Will Need To Know/have A hard working, self-motivated person that is willing to achieve excellence. Creative and assertive communication skills. Open to feedback and development.A minimum of 2 + years of proven sales experience in a B2B environment selling technology solutions. Consistently meet/exceed sales quotas within specified timeframes. Experience selling software products and services is desirable. Demonstrated ability to learn complex enterprise software solutions and use of that knowledge to sell to prospects Bachelor's Degree in any related field is preferred, but not needed. Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM. Get in on all the awesome at Instructure. Excellent benefits and perks, because we want you to be happy and healthy: fully paid private medical insurance, pension, life assurance, personal travel insurance, contribution to your commuter and fitness/welfare Equity!! - Yes, everyone at Instructure gets equity, because your success is the company's success and the company's success, is your success iMacs or Macbooks Most importantly, you get to work with a tight knit team who embrace innovation and are committed to being excellent at what they do We’ve always believed in hiring the most awesome people and treating them right. We know that the more diverse we are, the more diverse our ideas will be and when we openly welcome those ideas, our environment is better and our business is stronger.  All Instructure employees are required to successfully pass a background check upon being hired.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Black Box® is a trusted IT solutions provider delivering cutting-edge technology products and world-class consulting services to businesses across the globe in every industry. The breadth of our global reach and depth of our expertise accelerate customer success by bringing people, ideas, and technology together to solve real-world business problems.  We deliver technology solutions for our customers by harnessing technology innovation to digitally transform and accelerate their business in the areas of connected buildings (incl. IoT), digital workplace & customer experience, data centers, networking (incl. Wi-Fi, SD-WAN), in-building 5G/ONGO and cyber security.  With more than 80 years of technology excellence and thousands of team members globally, managing over 175,000 customers across 150 countries, we are uniquely positioned to build a global IT services brand that can deliver maximum value, world-class integrated solutions, deliver results, cultivate strategic relationships, and enable lasting relevance for our customers across six continents.  Position Summary: The Regional Business Development Manager is focused on the development of customer relationships sales opportunities within new and dormant accounts to Black Box. Strategically-minded, the BDM will establish and build a trusting relationship with potential prospects, and develop and close sales opportunities within new accounts (high touch sales).  As this position is focused on the pursuit and acquisition of ‘new logos’, the BDM will cultivate the teams that will support the account beyond the initial opportunity wins, which will enable the BDM to pursue other new prospects for Black Box.  Job Responsibilities: Identify prospects, and establish relationships with new customers and dormant accounts. Specifically, the BDM will target larger organizations, with a primary focus on Fortune 1000 prospects. Seek opportunities to cross-sell and up-sell to the client by introducing additional solutions that will enable the customer’s success. Develop strategic pursuit plans. Engages with other internal sales professionals (direct and overlay), solutions experts, engineering when appropriate to actively drive pursuit opportunities. Main focus SG & ASEAN region.  Skills, Knowledge, Abilities: Able to cultivate relationships with large enterprises, including Fortune 1000 targets that do little or no business with Black Box at the present time. Able to understand the customer’s business, and provide strategic insights to help the customer’s business will positioning Black Box solutions as a way to enable the customer’s business success. Encompasses strategic pursuit management skills from opportunity start to finish. Able to use Black Box CRM to own benefits in the business prospecting and sales processes. Able to work independently, as well as part of a team environment. Must be a self-starter, entrepreneurial and able to work effectively with minimal direct supervision. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Proficient in standard business software programs, such as Microsoft Office.  Qualifications: Undergraduate Business degree is required. MBA preferred. Must have more 10+ years of sales experience in developing new accounts within the technology/business IT services sector, preferable with leading system integrator (SI). Extensive, existing and relevant network of customers, OEMs, Distributors, SIs, Vendors and Supplier relationships. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with one of the OEMs; Cisco, Aruba, Silver Peak. Minimum one or two valid Sales certifications in above OEMs is a pre. Knowledge, experience and proven sales track records with Professional and Managed Services solutions. Ability to travel 25% of the time.  Supervisory Responsibility: This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Job Description  The Inside Sales Representative team is aligned to our sales regions and is a direct quota carrying role which focuses on our Non-Named accounts in Korea from Singapore.  The Inside Sales Representative is responsible for all duties from actively prospecting to closing out on opportunities in this sector in partnership with the field sales and channel team to ensure the greatest results are achieved. The ISR is required to also work with the channel partners and Partner Business Manager (PBM) to drive pipeline generation via partners.  Performance Objectives Will carry your own quota for assigned territory in addition to assisting the field sales team on some deals Work closely with channel partners in a set territory to drive marketing and sales activity Solution selling to existing customer base and new prospects Identify and establish relationships with new business prospects and maintain relationships with the existing installed base Navigate org charts through outbound prospecting to identify new opportunities Sell/Market to large audiences (1: many) utilizing web conferencing technologies Manage and maintain accurate account and opportunity details in Salesforce.com (SFDC). Focus on generating qualified leads through strategic planning, outbound calling, follow-up to marketing campaigns and fielding web site inquiries Lead generation and lead follow up from marketing events Forecasting accuracy is required Competencies 5-10 years Inside Sales and/or Renewal Sales experience in the IT Software Industry Excellent organizational skills and the ability to manage many diverse projects simultaneously The ability to develop in-depth knowledge of company infrastructure, operations, contacts, and buying cycles Experience in building, generating, and managing a business plan across Enterprise Accounts and Commercial Accounts Strong proficiency with Microsoft Office 365, Zoom. Experience with Salesforce.com (SFDC) preferred The ability to interact professionally and reliably with senior level executives within and outside the company, as well as with customers, vendors etc. Ability to work within a team environment and build rapport Enthusiastic and outgoing personality Strong sense of urgency and efficiency in completing work Ability to take self-initiative, be proactive and ability to multitask, prioritize workload Exemplary verbal and written English and Korean communication skills and attention to detail Category : Sales  Subcategory: Inside Sales  Experience: Manager and Professional  Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time  Posted Date: 2021-04-21  VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.
