description: We are looking for a Sales executive that will serve as the point of contact between a business and its prospects or clients and have a range of responsibilities including identifying and educating prospective customers while supporting existing clients with information and assistance that relates to products and services.   Beyond simply a sales executive, we are looking for the building blocks as the first 50 employees of an exciting startup. Essentially, we are looking for a "Hustler" that can grow with the company whilst handling the pressure of accelerated growth and responsibilities.  On a business development end, they will also aid in seeking new business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers.   Expect to be involved in the growth of the company in the local and new markets and in key product & market development.  We frequently work in small teams to solve problems, explore new technologies, and learn from one another. The ideal intern for this environment will be enthusiastic and collaborative.  Responsibilities Responsible as a key account manager and seeing through the customer sales life cycle from onboarding, closing, after sales-support and client engagement.  Able to establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships After sales-support - Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule Coordinate sales effort with the marketing department.  Analyze the territory/market’s potential, track sales and status reports Supply management with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services. Familiarity with BRM and CRM practices along with ability to build productive business professional relationships

jobTitle: Business and Sales Operations Lead -Southeast Asia, Korea & India
description: At Microsoft, our mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. In Consumer Channel Sales & Marketing (CCSM) our purpose is to create value with our partners, to market and sell innovative consumer solutions powered by Windows, Office, Surface, and Xbox. We’re positioned right at the intersection of customers, hardware partners, and channel partners. Our team works with ecosystem partners and internal business groups to drive digital excellence and e-commerce capability, as well as accelerate cloud and subscription adoption. Together, we win by delivering compelling at-home and on-the-go experiences combining intelligent edge devices and services that create Microsoft fans for life.  As a member of our team you’ll be part of growing a multi-billion-dollar business, charting new areas of innovation and impacting billions of lives around the world. You also will be a part of a culture centered on embracing a growth mindset, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. If that appeals to you, it’s an exciting time to be here in CCSM.  Responsibilities  The Sub-Region Business and Sales Operations Lead role is responsible for CCSM sales and marketing enablement by driving breakthrough improvements in operational excellence, compliance, and change management. This role’s main accountability is the operational excellence of the CCSM Sub-Region and to help ensure the quality, efficiency and impact of business process for both our internal people and external partners. In addition, the Business and Sales Operations Lead role in the sub-region is driving the people plan alongside the CCSM Sub-Region Lead, owning the communications for the Sub-Region, and managing the rhythm of business for both internal and external events including work back schedules, LT partner engagements and partner visits.  The Business and Sales Operations Lead constantly identifies areas to improve the impact and compliance of key partner sales motions, investment programs, processes, and account planning. This individual contributor role, who is part of the Sub-region leadership team, requires the ability to think both at a strategic and programmatic level, be able to effectively drive processes and consistency across the business of the whole region and deliver impactful business outcomes, and ensure effective running of business for the sub-region team. The individual needs to be comfortable engaging senior leaders while managing priorities with influencing skills and executive maturity while making decisions in a fast-paced, complex, and matrixed environment.  The Business and Sales Operations Lead role will report to the CCSM Sub-Region Lead and is one of only a handful of roles which will look left-to-right across the sub-region and all CCSM businesses in the sub-region - creating the contractual framework through which we sell 1st party and 3rd party physical and digital products through multiple partner channels to market and managing the related marketing and incentive programs. An affinity for learning, the ability to form educated recommendations and strategic thinking and an ability to influence at executive level are critical to this position. This role gives the opportunity to plan and build end-to-end processes, projects and programs with significant complexity and drive innovation and change for the consumer business. A positive attitude, a team mentality, growth mindset and adaptability creativity are crucial for success in this role. This role will also be responsible for the sub-region people plan initiatives, culture building and driving the sub-region rhythm of business to ensure we think people first while keeping the partner in the center.  Key Responsibilities Include  PLANNING Drives the partner onboarding process in the sub-region Managing the Region/Sub-Region ROB (Planning work back schedule, LT partner engagement, LT team meetings, strategic presentation management incl. agenda, stakeholders and action facilitation) Supporting the culture work in the Sub-Region through leadership team development and execution of the People Plan initiatives Drives partner engagement rhythm of business including corporate visits and virtual tours planning EXECUTION Driving account segmentation and profiling, and ensuring good CRM hygiene on the region level Driving regional reporting capability for account level, market data and insights, and owning partner reporting and data management platforms (1P/3P) Owning MS Sales and/or O2 account mapping and queries management (i.e. TPIDs) Overseeing of tools and processes, and driving readiness and adoption across the region Process management and change management excellence (new process requirements, process “fixing”, central point for all process and tool change rollouts, excellent communication skills) Driving awards nominations for the Sub-Region Owning onboarding of new hires to the team Driving Sub-Region communications plan including internal communications, external interview support for the leadership team, and communications related to the internal and external events MEASURE AND MONITOR Business compliance champion Driving CPE action planning with the account teams Qualifications  The ideal candidate is required to possess the following skills and competencies: 8+ years of experience within operations or partner facing sales and/or marketing roles Other Consumer/Retail sales and marketing or partner related background is preferred Experience with sales agreements and investment programs (e.g. rebates and marketing) preferred Proven track record managing inclusively in a highly diverse team with both direct and indirect reports Change Management certification or Project Management certification preferred Previous experience leading project teams and working with senior executives in fast paced, high pressure, often ambiguous environments Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

Our client has an award-winning cybersecurity product – and they are looking to expand their sales team in a new territory. Exciting time to join this Series B start-up...  The product provides threat-visibility, so that attacks can be predicted in real-time before they happen.  The Job  Both Hunting and Farming responsibilities – build new business relationships and expand current accounts of channel partners. Assist with the partner onboarding process Meet and beat sales targets and objectives with assigned partner accounts Based ideally in Singapore but open for the right person  About You  Previous experience as a partner account manager and channel sales Have previously built relationships with business in the APAC/APJ region Knowledgeable about the Cybersecurity space ideal but not essential - SaaS at least MUST have strong local relationships in priority countries ideally in Southeast Asia and ANZ, Japan and South Korea  Package  $130k - $140k US Dollars Up to $240k OTE Company benefits and equity

description: At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.  Job Description Summary: We are seeking an experienced B2B Inside Sales Rep to join the Inside Sales Acquisition Team. The primary purpose of this role to reach out to acquire new business to achieve the monthly sales target. This includes building up of a strong sales pipeline, following up on all sales leads and driving applications and activation of Paypal’s products and services. You will be selling to Businesses based in the South East Asia Markets. You will support your merchants from acquisition through to integration and ensure they are live and running. To be successful, you should have experience in cold calling, consultative selling and strong pipeline management.  Job Description: Core responsibilities: Cold call, self-prospect, and build network to generate prospect pipeline to acquire new merchants Develop sales strategy and identify high value prospects within Mid-Market segment Support channel partner initiatives such as joint events to represent PayPal and meet new prospects Robust pipeline management via Salesforce to ensure accurate forecast of performance and deliver strong results Meet and exceed productivity / pipeline metrics and monthly revenue targets  Experience And Qualifications Proven track record in exceeding sales targets Ability to develop sales strategy and identify key prospects for pipeline building Identify potential partners for vertical acquisition and leads generation Pipeline management expertise, and experience with Salesforce Excellent telephone manner and written communication skills Hunter mentality Self-motivated, positive and results oriented eCommerce and payment industry experience preferred Role will be based in Singapore Experience in B2B will be advantage Fluency in Vietnamese language is required to cover businesses in Vietnam  For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.  PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.  REQ ID R0074183

review, briefing of sales staff, maintenance of outlet census and more To assume the role of an independent auditor for Carlsberg SG by conducting a monthly FIT audit for a defined sample size of on actions that can improve overall sales execution To monitor the performance against the agreed sales force KPIs by leveraging on the FIT analytics’ report and independent audits’ findings, then work other best practices) for the sales force  Requirements Minimum Degree (Marketing or Business) Minimum 2-3 years of working experience in Sales force Effectiveness, Sales Capability, Sales Operations or equivalent areas Team player with strong interpersonal and stakeholder management skills – able to work with and influence stakeholders/colleagues at all levels Proactive, able to work independently, possesses problem solving skills and able to work in a dynamic and challenging environment Strong analytical skills to identify business issues and formulate relevant and actionable recommendations Highly resourceful, creative and open to challenges Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Excel, Powerpoint etc), analytics tools (Qilkview, Power BI etc) and salesforce systems (Distributor Management System, Salesforce.com etc) Fluent in English proficiency  Job Details  Workplace Hiap Hoe Building At Zhongshan Park, SG  Job type Permanent  Part time / Full time Full Time  Working Time Monday - Friday 8:30am - 5:30pm  We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

description: Want to be on the forefront for Parcel Perform's product for B2B software solutions in e-commerce logistics?    Parcel Perform is looking for an amazing team member to support us on the sales front!   We are a dynamic, fast-growing team that’s excited about e-commerce and logistics, and the opportunity to transform these industries with data and technology. Join us in our journey to drive Parcel Perform’s growth in the e-commerce market.  WE NEED YOU ON OUR TEAM!   All our outstanding solutions and happy customers are looking for a Parcel Perform counterpart that can assist in their onboarding, keeps a close eye on their account and advises them on further potential use cases to expand their feature use on the platform. If have knowledge in the arena of tech SaaS products, B2B sales, and account management experience and are ready to go above and beyond for our clients, this role might be for you.  In short, you will be the key driver for Parcel Perform success in the following ways:  Managing relationships and processes in the onboarding of clients: Onboarding of new customers can involve multiple parties on their and our side. We are looking for a well organised Account Manager that can be a knowledgeable counterpart to guide them through the onboarding process and service them throughout their Parcel Perform journey. Manage portfolio of existing enterprise customers to make them successful: You build strong long-term relationship with all key stakeholders, being the first point of contact for any of their inquiries. You will establish a trusted/strategic adviser relationship with each key customer and drive continued value of Parcel Performs products and services. As part of your role, you will work with customers to establish critical goals, or other key performance indicators and aid the customer in achieving their business goals. Ensuring you are aware of all competitive activities within accounts and work with the customer success team to prevent attrition. Leverage upsell opportunities: You love advising customers on new features and use cases within our platform to drive our upsell opportunity into new features or higher subscriptions and convert existing customers to annual subscriptions.  In summary, you will be a business-critical part of our team, focusing on the customers and making them successful in order to cater to the long-term growth of Parcel Perform. key initial prospecting as much as the first key outreach to ensure a constant lead flow for our business managers to follow up. Your strong organization and writing-skills as well as your high interpersonal competence will ensure our constant customer growth.  ESSENTIAL SKILLS & EXPERIENCES Minimum 3 years of experience in SaaS / IT sales or account management; eCommerce experience a plus Previous experience with SaaS contracts / subscription models a plus Readiness to go the extra mile for our customers around the world. Experience navigating through multiple decision makers and influencers within a large Enterprise environment World-class interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to effortlessly make complex contractual, technical, and financial details sound simple Exceptional fluency and articulation in English (both spoken and written) Highly self motivated and ambitious in achieving goals. Strong team player but still a self-starter Well structured with the ability to balance competing priorities and manage multiple projects/deals at the same time High interpersonal skills, ability to identify the needs of our prospects A willingness to keep learning and pushing yourself to higher and higher levels  WHAT YOU WILL RECEIVE IN RETURN! The opportunity to work in a fast-growing, super exciting and innovative business that will revolutionize the e-commerce logistics industry. You will be the needle of success on the growth of a global product that will become a key platform behind successful e-commerce logistics worldwide. The ability to continuously learn and develop in an international setting with you being a critical driver behind the success of us achieving our mission. An environment where everybody never stops growing, and focuses on succeeding - we continuously work with you on your strengths and weaknesses across many important dimensions, and look at ways for you to address them and further your development. Your entry ticket into being part of the Parcel Perform journey, where you will work with and alongside people from around the world that share the same passion and dedication.  ABOUT US Parcel Perform is the leading delivery experience platform. It enables modern e-commerce enterprises to create unique end-to-end customer journeys and optimize logistics operations with powerful data integrations, parcel tracking, delivery notifications and logistics performance reports in real-time.   Parcel Perform's scalable SaaS platform executes more than 100M parcel updates daily and integrates with 700+ carriers. The data-first company is pioneering innovative ML / AI use cases in e-commerce logistics including its 'Date of Arrival' prediction engine. Parcel Perform is the partner of choice for top brands, marketplaces and carriers across all major verticals globally.  In August, we successfully secured US$20M in Series A investments led by blue-chip investors such as Cambridge Capital and SoftBank Ventures Asia. Parcel Perform believes in growing our dynamic and diverse team with the best talent to assist our global expansion. We have a myriad of talented individuals who have assisted in helping us achieve profitability. Join us while we grow in technology, talent and teamwork.  For more information, please visit www.parcelperform.com

Description  To meet the growing demand for AWS Training around the globe and particularly in Singapore, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you have a passion for learning, and can communicate highly technical concepts to audiences at different stages in the AWS journey, we’d like to speak with you.  Here's your chance to work as a Business Development Manager in our Training & Certification team. This is a highly visible position with significant customer impact.  In this role, you will work closely with our Enterprise customers across all customer segments in Singapore to craft training programs. You will assist customers to understand their training requirements, develop detailed training proposals and manage the flawless execution of training plans. You will be fully engaged in all phases of the education sales cycle. This will include identifying, qualifying and recommending the education solution for clients and business partners, closing the opportunity, and working with Trainer and operation team to ensure successful delivery of the education, as well as being responsible for post sales client satisfaction results. This is a great opportunity to combine your passion for business development, learning and technology.  You will have excellent communication skills and proven business development experience, ideally in the IT Training sector and Enterprise customers in Singapore. To be successful in this position, you must be a self-starter who is prepared to Think Big and Dive Deep.  Responsibilities Work closely with AWS Customers and Commercial Sector Account Teams to determine training requirements and build detailed training plans. Define Training & Certification and skills development strategy for Enterprise customer segments and agree with stakeholders on goals and measures for success. Maintain a strong relationship with sales and cross functional teams to ensure flawless execution of training programs. Evangelize AWS Training & Certification at company and industry events. Build & maintain a pipeline of training opportunities and provide regular forecasts / business reviews to senior management. Become proficient in the various AWS Training & Certification offerings and delivery capabilities. Achieve and exceed key goals including number of students trained, revenue, certification and other key business metrics.  Basic Qualifications 10+ year’s sales and business development experience, preferably in Singapore and/or ASEAN Excellent verbal and written communication skills and proven business development experience at CxO level. Experience conducting Training Needs Assessments and developing training plans. Experience engaging and presenting to senior executives (CXO level). Strong commercial experience and business acumen. Previous experience working in large multi-national companies in the IT sector Previous experience working with Enterprises in Cloud adoption. Preferred Qualifications Proven business development experience, ideally in the IT Training sector and with customers in Enterprise across all segments including FSI. A technical background in Engineering or Computer science. Knowledge of Amazon Web Services or Cloud Computing concepts. Marketing, operations and training delivery experience. Experience working in US Technology companies. Strong verbal and written communication skills in English (ability to write proficiently). IT Training industry experience an advantage. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. description: Job Title: Sales Executive Territory: Singapore and the SEA region (Malaysia and Thailand)  ARKRAY, a global health care company, looking for a reliable Sales Executive to market and sell its top-of-the-line diagnostic products, both medical devices and consumables. In this position you can leverage your knowledge and experiences in the medical field by working with our international sales team located all over the world. For more information about ARKRAY’s products, visit our website: http://www.arkray.asia/english/products/index.html  Main Responsibilities: Identify the market potentials and opportunities and plan/execute the strategies for ARKRAY‘s Diabetes diagnostics, Lab Automation, PoC and Oral Care products in 3 countries (Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand). Optimize sales by developing new channel partners such as distributors as well as replacing existing channel partners with better options. Be directly involved in developing new customers and the support for end users in assigned countries. Support and provide advice on the sales & marketing activities as well as other relevant requirements (such as training, after-sales support, logistics, etc.) for existing channel partners for business growth. Provide support to ARKRAY HQ team (in Japan) in such tasks as import and export logistics, commercial, service, regulatory and marketing. description: Job Descriptions Manage and develop business plan and strategy for target market, executing sales action plans and strategies to ensure attainment of Company international sales goals and profitability Prepare action plans by for effective search for international sales leads and prospects Initiates and coordinates development of action plans Provide timely feedback to the Management regarding sales performance Provides timely, accurate, competitive pricing on all completed prospect submitted for pricing and approval, while striving to maintain maximum profit margins Work closely with the Project, Design, Marketing and Production teams to ensure customer requirements are met on a timely basis Maintains contact with all customers to ensure high levels of customer satisfaction Project accurate representation of Company to clients Lead and coordinate all international shipping, distribution and delivery with warehouse and logistic departments to ensure timely delivery of goods Liaise with Finance to ensure timely invoicing and payments are received from clients  Requirements Candidates with experience in F&B or luxury goods industry with international market presence will be preferred International Sales and Business Development experience is required Minimum of 7 years overall work experience, at least 3 years at Senior Management level in wholesale channels Strong communication and presentation skills and a thorough knowledge various international cultures Influencing skills and ability to build strong business rapport at all levels Strong organizational and analytical skills  Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Why Work at Lenovo  Here at Lenovo, we believe in smarter technology for all, so we spend our time building a society that’s brighter and more inclusive.  And we go big. No, not big—huge.  We’re not just a Fortune Global 500 company, we’re one of Fortune’s Most Admired. We’re in 180 markets, working with 63,000 brilliant colleagues and counting. And we’re known for the world’s most complete portfolio of smart technology, from devices to software to infrastructure.  With our ingenuity, we help millions—not just the select few—experience our version of a smarter future.  The one thing that’s missing? Well… you...  Description And Requirements  Lenovo (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY) is a US$60 billion revenue Fortune Global 500 company serving customers in 180 markets around the world. Focused on a bold vision to deliver smarter technology for all, we are developing world-changing technologies that power (through devices and infrastructure) and empower (through solutions, services and software) millions of customers every day and together create a more inclusive, trustworthy and sustainable digital society for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit [1] https://www.lenovo.com,and read about the latest news via our [2] StoryHub.Position Description: The Global Account Manager will take over responsibility for the local and regional business in Singapore for a defined customer set of Global accounts. The successful candidate will concentrate on the development of existing customer relationships in Singapore, as well as winning new customers within the Global Account space. The successful applicant needs to develop effective engagement model with key influencers and decision makers. The successful applicant will focus on the solution oriented sales approach and will need to be able to present on various topics including the strengths of our product portfolio through to reflecting the total cost of ownership to increase our customer’s value. Candidate must have an entrepreneurial approach that is imaginative, smart, passionate, and approachable. A high level capacity for teamwork is needed to manage the close collaboration with internal Lenovo functions, especially within the Global Account community and with Business Partners. The successful applicant will rely on strong communication and presentation skills and his ability to build strong customer relationships on all hierarchy levels. The candidate must be able to manage day to day challenges like providing tailor-made configurations for individual customer situations, dealing with the pricing function, monitoring of orders and supply, maintenance of customized portfolios as well as Customer Relationship Management and Forecasting. Responsibilities include the following: - Conduct a minimum of 10 customer facing meetings per week Actively engages with the customer to identify opportunities, starting from higher levels of customer organization. Translate customers’ business challenges and goals into IT opportunities in a compelling way Create a strategic sales plan for sales territory and execute against it Build strong relationships with key business partners Develop robust account plans for key accounts Provide accurate weekly forecasts Proactively builds and executes a plan to drive growth and profitability across Lenovo’s portfolio in a structured and recurring way Engage in C-level meetings with key customers Closely collaborate with their Internal Sales Rep on a daily basis Position Requirements:- 10 years proven track record in strategic selling to C level executives, strong Inter-personal and communications skills, demonstrated team building, leadership and the ability to manage multiple complex sales engagements concurrently. Degree in any relevant field Excellent sales track record Technical product knowledge & strong understand of PC industry and data center solution Verbal and written communications skills in both English and local language Strong network with business partner/distributor IT industry and business acumen  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

description: Contentsquare is a global SaaS technology company that empowers brands to build better digital experiences for all. Not to brag but… we have been recognized by Gartner as one of the four most innovative e-commerce technologies in the world, and featured in Wired Magazine as one of Europe’s hottest startups.  Contentsquare has 8 main offices across the world (Paris, NYC, London, Tel Aviv, Munich, Tokyo, Singapore & San Francisco) with 750+ clients globally including many accounts from the global Fortune 100. We’ve been experiencing tremendous growth as our team has grown from :300 to over 850+ employees globally, and raised a $500M Series E funding in May 2021, the biggest total VC funding ever for a French start-up! This announcement garnered more than 350 media placements globally.  We can tell you that this growth is not going to stop here as we are anticipating to hire 1,500+ positions globally within the next few years and are looking for talented people like you - unique, ambitious, and enthusiastic - to join us and help us continue to innovate and improve user experience. YOU keep us going and your creativity drives us to be a better company. Come join the #CSquad family!  This role requires a driven individual who is able to achieve and excel targets and who will be able to evangelise and take a new product to market. You will help define and develop our sales process whilst understanding the key business challenges our product and services solve. We are a fast-growing company, and need people who will take initiative and ownership when executing new business. There is a great opportunity to progress within the business.  What you will do: Generate business opportunities through professional, dedicated prospecting via emails, events and cold calling Develop C-Level relationships within target accounts Uncover green field territories and making them your own by becoming a subject matter expert Develop a sales plan, whilst creating and maintaining a monthly sales forecast Review the market to determine customer needs and feeding back into the business Work alongside your dedicated local marketing team to capitalise on engagement generated from events and their lead generation activity Meet and exceed all quarterly and annual sales quotas What you will need to succeed: An intrinsic drive to be successful Minimum 1 year successful sales track record Strong communication and presentation skills (verbal and written) Excellent project management skills and understanding how to manage the priorities of multiple internal stakeholders Strong negotiation skills, highly personable, and confident interacting in-person and over the phone with senior personnel Engaging copywriting skills and experience of delivering compelling emails and communications to stand out from the crowd Enjoys working in a dynamic start-up culture, contributing new and creative ideas Relevant experience in SaaS, ASP, Analytics, eBusiness or CRM software highly recommended Why Should You Apply to Contentsquare?  ✅ Our mission is focused on empowering everyone to create better experiences for all in the digital world.  ✅ We invest in our employees through career development & opportunities, social events, philanthropic activities, and competitive benefits.  ✅ You get to collaborate with and learn from smart and creative people around the globe.  ✅ We are in this together #TeamSpirit.  To keep our employees happy and motivated, we are always assessing the benefits/perks we offer to ensure we are competitive. Here are some we’d like to highlight: Virtual onboarding, Hackathon, and our annual kickoff trip on a global basis! You have the opportunity to interact with our global colleagues. Generous paid time-off policy (every location is different) We offer many benefits in various countries -- ask your recruiter for more information! Competitive parental leave policy (it can vary depending on geographic locations) Fun office culture with a big opportunity to make an impact on our growing global team, culture, including a Culture Crew for every country to organize regular outings such as game nights, movie nights, and happy hours #Uniqueness is embedded in our DNA as one of our core values, and we welcome everyone to apply to our positions.  Contentsquare is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Your personal data are used by Contentsquare for recruitment purposes only. Read our Job Candidate Privacy Notice to find out more about data protection at Contentsquare and your rights.

description: Account Executive Singapore  Our job is to be bold at work. It starts with an insatiable curiosity about clients, colleagues, and the future. At Forrester, we believe curiosity powers progress. Forresterites bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on the ideas and initiatives that change the course of business. As a trusted advisor to the most influential companies in the world, we live at the nexus of what’s next.  About This Role: The Account Executive is a hybrid sales role that generates and closes new businesses, as well as renews and upsells from existing clients within an assigned territory. This role will work on developing and executing a territory plan and strategy that will result in high quota attainment. For qualified prospects, the Account Executive must conduct a needs analysis and demonstrate the value of Forrester to potential clients by addressing critical business issues. Upon new client acquisition, the Account Executive will continue to build strong relationships, enrich existing accounts, and drive retention of existing businesses by ensuring high-level client satisfaction. This position is based in Singapore and will cover global corporate enterprise accounts, government-link companies, and government agencies as a territory.  Job Description Achieve a new business sales quota in the assigned territory on corporate enterprises, government-linked companies, and government agencies. Prospect and close appropriate accounts from a target account list on corporate enterprises, government-linked companies, and government agencies. Keep the relationship on closed accounts and develop them further. Develop and close business by promoting interest from IT, digital, customer experience, and marketing organizations across clients and other prospects. Sell to VP level and above within the prospect’s IT, digital, customer experience, and marketing organizations. Maintain an appropriate sales pipeline to achieve quota, and keep the pipeline updated in Forrester’s CRM system (Salesforce.com). Produce accurate and timely forecasts. Build a strong understanding on assigned industries, as well as the changing business and technology issues and needs that Forrester’s potential clients face. Navigate across teams to better understand the Forrester value proposition for prospects. Develop a complete understanding of Forrester's full array of product offerings, with an emphasis on business outcomes.  Job Requirements A bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience. Five or more years of proven experience in successful sales to C-level executives. Proven experience in working in a complex global business environment and managing stakeholders internally and externally. Proven experience in working in lean organizations with complex internal ecosystems. Possesses a strong domain knowledge in the following areas: IT, digital, customer experience, and marketing, as well as experience in selling to corporate enterprises The ability to align client business objectives with Forrester solutions. A high level of business acumen of corporate enterprises A team player with effective organization and time management skills. Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills. Must be willing to travel.  Explore #ForresterLife on: YouTube Twitter Facebook Instagram LinkedIn Glassdoor  Forrester Research is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing a work environment that is free from all forms of discrimination, including sexual harassment.  Data Protection The information provided by you in this application will be used for the purposes of recruitment and, for successful applicants only, for personnel administration and management purposes and to comply with the employer’s obligations regarding the retention of employee records. If your application is unsuccessful, Forrester Research, Inc., its subsidiaries, affiliates, and/or service providers (collectively “Forrester”) will retain your personal information on secure file solely to consider you for future recruitment opportunities. By submitting your resume/CV, you consent to Forrester’s retention of the information provided on a secure file for personnel administration and management purposes and/or in order to consider you for future employment opportunities and to the transfer of the information provided to: Forrester’s offices in the US and other countries outside the European Economic Area; and Service providers engaged by Forrester for the purposes of processing applications for employment who may be located outside the European Economic Area.
industries: Management Consulting and Research

description: We’re Fever!  Fever is the leading global entertainment discovery platform, and has revolutionised the world of entertainment since 2015, inspiring over 45 million people every month to discover the best experiences in their cities. Fever empowers event organizers to create amazing experiences, with successful examples such as the “Candlelight Concert Series” attended by over 1 million guests, the Los Angeles based “Stranger Things: The Drive-Into Experience”, or the “Mad Hatter G&T Party” in multiple cities across the world.   Fever is a US company with a team of over 550 people, currently present in more than 80 cities, with offices in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, London, Paris, Madrid and Barcelona, and is backed by leading institutional investors, including Rakuten Capital, Accel, Fidelity and Atresmedia among others.  What do we do?  Fever’s marketplace is composed of events and experiences hosted by organizers that we provide visibility to via our marketplace and media network.  However, given that Fever and our Secret Media Network provide us with millions of data points and insights around how people consume offline entertainment, we are now able to go one step further in the value chain and create our own “Fever Originals” experiences, similar to how Netflix has begun to create their own shows. We believe there is a huge opportunity to create more of our own content, and continue to provide an amazing content offering to our users!  ABOUT THE ROLE  Here’s what you’ll be doing:  Create and maintain direct business relationships with the best venues, bars, restaurants and organizers in the city. Meet your sales goals whilst maintaining a high bar of quality Expertly manage contract negotiations with potential and existing clients, ensuring sustainable economics and long lasting value for both parties Evidence strong organizational skills to effectively balance and grow a large base of clients  Collaborate closely with our marketing team to build the Fever brand and promote the partnerships you forge  Keeping up to date with everything cool that’s happening in your city; think of yourself as the expert for new and trending experiences ABOUT YOU  Here’s what you should bring to the table:  At least 5+ years track record of sales success in a fast-paced, quota carrying role Strong desire to bring on new businesses as well as grow and manage an existing book of business Self-starter mentality with an ability to work in a demanding, dynamic start-up environment Demonstrated data-driven approach to business and task prioritization Excellent communication skills both written and verbal along with strong attention to detail Comfort in working with Microsoft Office, Google docs, and a Sales CRM (Sugar CRM is preferred) Knowledge of the city’s entertainment, events, and lifestyle trends Experience in media/ad sales a plus but not required BENEFITS  Here’s what you can expect from us:  The opportunity to help build and scale Fever in your city, just like a founder Competitive salary and bonus structure Numerous training and learning opportunities 40% off on all of Fever’s plans worldwide (Restaurants, Online Experiences, you name it!) A young, hungry and motivated team to achieve epic things with! Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Internet

description: We are looking for a Strategic Account Manager with a strong background in business development and sales. This role will be based in our Singapore office, and will be instrumental in taking a dynamic organisation to the next stage of its growth. You will have significant experience of closing SaaS or software business into financial institutions and be an instinctive and natural ‘hunter’.  You will be responsible for managing a portfolio of key client accounts and establishing yourself as a ‘trusted advisor’. To be successful in this role, you will have experience of engaging with senior level stakeholders, feel comfortable with sales at an enterprise level, and have the gravitas, personality, and ability to represent Xceptor at the highest level.  This is an individual contributor role, demanding a high level of strategic thinking, autonomy, and the ability to be a part of an entrepreneurial business in significant growth mode. The right candidate will be open to the challenges that this ‘start-up’ mentality may present.  RESPONSIBILITIES Manage and strategically develop a portfolio of key strategic accounts (existing and target). Deliver an annual net revenue target of license sales, through upselling and new business. Establish fundamental account plans and go to market campaigns built around our value propositions. Drive all aspects of the sales process, including: relationship management, product demonstrations, client workshops, contract negotiation and sales closing. Qualify leads through the evaluation of requirements and the development of a concise understanding of any decision-making processes and criteria. Work closely with the wider team to drive the delivery of new business wins. Develop relationships with decision-influencing senior executives within prospect organisations, both within IT and the Business. Build and leverage a network of existing and prospective clients.  EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS Significant experience of Financial Services SaaS and/or software license sales. Demonstrated sales experience and a proven track record of winning business within Financial Services institutions. Solution driven sales professional with a proven record of achieving /exceeding annual quota target. Able to demonstrate an understanding of the dynamics involved in selling SaaS & software licenses. Independent in identifying, managing, and developing strategic accounts. Experience of sales processes involving multiple tiers of complex organisations, and where the sales cycles are long and consultative. High level of gravitas, with experience of engaging with senior level stakeholders. Highly competent in delivering product presentations, managing client workshops, and proof of concepts. Strong commercial awareness with a high level of EQ. Excellent client facing, communication and interpersonal skills. A self-starter, who is naturally driven, ambitious and tenacious. Familiar with smaller company mentality.  In return we will offer exposure to global, blue-chip clients and an unparalleled experience of best practice. This is a fast-paced, dynamic, and highly collaborative environment where there are significant opportunities for growth and development.  Xceptor is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion, or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic, or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
industries: Financial Services

description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  Business Integrity's mission is to ensure safe and trusted connections between people, businesses, and Facebook. Our team works together to anticipate and predict potential threats to our platform, design and build tools to protect against these threats, and then implement and enforce these systems at scale. We leverage data analysis, machine learning and a robust infrastructure to review the quality of promoted content on our platform. We partner closely with several cross-functional teams, including product, engineering, and data science, to ensure high quality and safe experiences for both people and businesses across the Facebook family of apps. Successful candidates for this team are adaptable, creative, have a bias toward action, aren't afraid of being wrong, and can successfully work across various teams & countries. This role is based out of Singapore.The scope of this role is APAC region excluding China.  Responsibilities Manage a team that partners with cross-functional teams, in particular our Sales function to lead or contribute to large scale strategic projects as well as solving ongoing operational problems at scale. Build strong, strategic relationships with Leaders across the Sales and Business Integrity organisations. Build and manage dynamic teams, and coach for high performance. Identify and assess risks & opportunities to enable and maintain quality in the ecosystem by thinking of scalable processes and solutions. Develop goals & metrics to assess impact, Improve operational metrics and proactively communicate regular updates, trends and the impact to diverse stakeholders. Effectively communicate our broader policy approach to internal and external audiences, representing specific policy areas as required. Leverage data-informed insights to drive new products and initiatives Work with data and measurement partners to identify and track key program performance indicators, and ensure the results contribute to overall company, product, customer, and community experience goals Identify trends to enhance the support and detection processes and improve team efficiency. Develop domain expertise across Business Integrity, informed by trends in business and technology including knowledge of current/potential Facebook business models and evolving customer needs. Minimum Qualification Bachelors or Advanced Degree 10+ years of Experience in a role involving strategic initiatives (ie: sales support/enablement, operations, project management, consulting experience) in eCommerce / Internet-enabled service industry 5+ years of experience leading global teams Experienced at collaborating effectively with diverse cross functional teams Experienced at influencing and advising senior stakeholders Experience managing with ambiguity and principles in a high-pressure environment Experienced at shaping strategy and execute against that strategy, with appropriate prioritization of people and resources Experienced at communicating effectively with a variety of audiences (internal, external, 1:1 and at scale) Experience being a “connector” across teams and influencing data, business, and engineering teams through an understanding of business and ecosystem needs Preferred Qualification Understanding of relevant landscapes including ad tech, policy, and spam/fraud Experience in APAC online ecosystem

description: Imply, founded by the original creators of Apache Druid, is originating and leading a new category of data analytics focused on analytics-in-motion. With analytics-in-motion, organizations can move away from analytics solutions that are static, difficult to scale, delayed and expensive, and towards analytics solutions that are interactive, highly scalable, real-time and cost effective.  According to our Series C lead investor, Bessemer Venture Partners, Imply is "upending the world of analytics, as it is now a competitive disadvantage to wait hours or days to iterate on insights, to make decisions based on stale data, or to leverage solutions that either crumble or cost a fortune at scale."  Every day, more and more established enterprises and digital natives realize the power of Analytics-in-Motion, and we are far ahead in this race to redefine analytics across the enterprise, with numerous marquee customers and demonstrated customer success worldwide.  Imply is Series C funded, with A16Z and Bessemer Venture Partners as our lead investors. Join our high-performing team!  The Role:  We are looking for a motivated and enthusiastic Sales Development Representative to come aboard! Our SDRs generate leads and build customer pipelines. This is a role with a dedicated growth path and the training to be a great technical sales professional. We are looking for self-starters with a passion for technology and people. Preferred location Singapore but open to Hong Kong based candidates.  Responsibilities: Research heavily into accounts to maximize the value of outreach Generate appointments by means of proactive outbound prospecting and lead activity management in an effort to qualify and market our solutions to potential customers Work directly with marketing to discover opportunities from leads, and set appointments from those leads Use of strong selling and influencing skills to set up qualified appointments Understand Imply's technology enough to provide a high level introduction Leverage taught sales techniques to maximize customer interactions Log, track, and maintain outbound activity Work closely with Sales Directors and attend customer meetings as required Attend sales meetings, vendor training, and local trade shows to keep current with technology  Requirements: Four year college degree from an accredited institution 5+ years experience with 2+ in pipeline generation activities English/Mandarin bi-lingual requirement A passion for research as well as a strong in-person, phone, and written customer communication skills Must be able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization Ability to make formal and informal presentations to staff and clients Ability to prioritize work assignments and shift work efforts based on the needs of the department or business goals Strong PC skills required; knowledge of Salesforce.com a plus Ability to manage time effectively, work independently, and be self-motivated Prior track record of achievement in positions with significant accountability Interested in pursuing a career in technology Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment Proactive, independent thinker with high energy/positive attitude Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and relationship management skills  Imply is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Please note, applications and candidate submissions are subject to our privacy policy and, for California residents, the CCPA terms available at https://imply.io/privacy.

description: Job Description:  Babel Finance is expanding its international Business Development team to help achieve aggressive business growth goals in onboarding clients to our Enterprise-grade custody and execution services offerings. As a member of the international business development team, you will be based in Singapore and your primary objective will be to increase asset under management (AUM) and revenue. You will collaborate with product manager sales support, and other Babel Finance teams to support our client's activities and the growth of our business.  The Purpose of Your Role  As part of our International Business Development team, you will interface with internal & external stakeholders to identify, develop, and execute strategies that create deep and lasting partnerships with high-net-worth (HNW) individuals and institutional clients. As we continue to explore opportunities in digital assets you must be in a position to represent the voice of the client while continuing to achieve production goals.  The Expertise We’re Looking For    2to 10years’ experience in a client-facing role at a bank, broker-dealer or other financial institutions. Understanding of one or more of the following marketplaces: cryptocurrencies, blockchain,. Experienced in sales, business development and/or relationship management, with a strong hunting drive Ability to conduct market research independently and present deal opportunities. Exceptionally strong interpersonal skills in managing internal and external relationships in a proactive, energetic and customer-obsessed way. Comfort managing concurrent priorities across a diversified workload and ability to drive results in a thoughtful and collaborative way. Experience with the sales toolkit, including experience with CRM systems and development of pitchbooks and sales materials.   The Value You Deliver  Manage our high-touch client pipeline from lead generation to implementation Build strong relationships with clients, prospects and other market participants, in order to drive new revenue and ensure customer retention. Develop presentations and sales materials for audiences with varying levels of seniority and understanding of finance, cryptocurrencies. Represent the voice of the market and the client with internal stakeholders in product, marketing, legal, risk, compliance, relationship management, implementation, operations and client service. Identify opportunities for internal process improvement within the Business Development team, present such opportunities and drive change Monitor, evaluate and improve your sales toolkit on market trends and signals, including competitor business models, industry news and regulatory developments. Contribute to a corporate climate that values and rewards contributions, drive, initiative, and achievement of results.
industries: Financial Services

jobTitle: Mid-Market Sales Manager, Google Customer Solutions
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 11 years of experience in sales and delivering on business goals. People or team management experience.  Preferred qualifications: Experience creating and implementing sales strategies with customers. Passion for value-based solution selling with a drive to innovate. Track record of building top performing teams through coaching and frequent, high quality feedback, and role modeling a growth mindset. Ability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment with excellent problem-solving, creative thinking and analytical skills. Ability to take ownership for decisions, secures support, and remove key obstacles. Effective at influencing others, and driving cross-functional collaboration.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  As the Manager of Google Customer Solutions (GCS) Mid-Market Sales (MMS) team, you will help to develop and maintain relationships with customers and internal Google stakeholders, design and implement partnership initiatives, grow and develop a team of MMS representatives, deliver on all business goals, and contribute to growth plan. With an inclination for strategic analysis and planning, you will conduct advanced analytical and strategic work within the Google Sales organization, identifying customer needs, and understanding how our range of product offerings can grow their business.  You will be central to setting the strategy for the Vietnam market and work with market teams to align on the vision for wider market. You will set high standards, define the business culture and be a thought leader in both Vietnam and Southeast Asia. You will define how to optimize growth and drive team performance and product/solution enhancements to deliver an excellent experience to Google's customers at scale.  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  Responsibilities  Manage, inspire and motivate a team of client-facing and high-performing Googlers to create a goal-oriented culture with inclusivity and collaboration in mind. Coach your team on engaging with and influencing stakeholders across your team’s portfolios to deliver client success and shared business results. Lead your team in analyzing customer data and industry trends to develop strategic plans for customers and/or partners. Lead and strengthen executive-level relationships through key C-level meetings, business reviews and speaking engagements. Ensure team readiness to deliver digital complex solutions. Create a culture of sales innovation and customer success on the team based on diverse, equitable and inclusive team environment.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  Reporting to the Shopkeeper, the Sales Specialist maximise sales and to be a source of knowledge and expertise for the team. The Sales Specialist support the efficient work of the IKEA mechanical sales system to ensure the continued execution and success of the IKEA Concept and to give customers a positive shopping experience.  Your assignment You are passionate about our products and actively learn about their features and benefits, and proactively share this knowledge with our customers and co-workers You work with the Shopkeeper to improve range presentation by ensuring it appeals to our local customers and encourages them to buy more You know the department’s working routines, you follow-up and ensure they are done. You work together with your shopkeeper and your commercial team to sales steer products and meet department sales goals. You ensure the department has accurate sales space. You understand the relationship between sales and stock forecast work towards achieving the goals through continuous evaluation and follow up Qualifications  Your profile You are customer-serviced focused with a passion in retail home furnishing business You take initiative and is a problem solver, self-motivated and a strong team player You’re a natural leader, have strong communication and interpersonal skills with knowledge of PC You have strong selling skills and professionalism You are able to guide and coach a team of co-workers to excel as Sales Associates You are physically fit to handle physical work and pro-longed hours of standing You are able to commit to working on AM & PM shift work, weekends and public holidays Additional Information  Please apply by 8 October 2021
industries: Retail, Furniture, and Consumer Goods

description: #TeamSHIELD SHIELD is a mobile-first risk intelligence company that helps world-leading enterprises build trust and safety by stopping fraud and abuse. Trusted across all continents by superapps, top e-commerce platforms, and e-wallets, we protect over 7 billion devices and 700 million user accounts every year. Headquartered in Singapore, we have offices in Germany, the United States, Indonesia, and China. Join our fast-growing team of Agents at the forefront of world-leading fraud and abuse prevention.  RESPONSIBILITIES Following continued growth in recent years and with dedicated sales functions established in EMEA, the Americas and APAC, the Sales Operations Specialist will be responsible for increasing productivity and ensuring smooth running of the sales functions, allowing the global sales team to be more successful in their day-to-day activities.  Develop and execute initiatives designed to optimize sales team efficiency and productivity Take ownership of and manage sales and lead generation frameworks, ensuring that they are adhered to by the team, and drive continual process improvement Gather and analyse a variety of sales data, delivering concise and actionable insights on key performance metrics to senior leadership Leverage the information available on Salesforce for optimum team performance Ensure that Salesforce is accurate and up to date, driving the governance of the Sales Team with regards to timeliness and accuracy of reporting and updates Deliver new and improved Salesforce CRM functionality, driving projects from requirement gathering through to execution Design workflows and playbooks for sales teams Implement enabling systems and tools, working closely with internal systems teams Manage close relationships with the global team of AEs and BDRs. Convert marketing initiatives into a healthy sales pipeline and be able to attribute ROI for marketing lead sources  REQUIREMENTS   3+ years of sales operations and/or sales strategy experience in a B2B tech environment Experience managing critical sales processes (e.g. quota setting, forecasting, sales process optimization and sales program implementation)  Experience managing and administering Salesforce CRM including mapping and integration with other platforms would be ideal Demonstrated ability to drive continuous improvement in business processes and deliver results. Has strong analytical skills and a structured approach to solving unique business problems Works well under pressure, with a high degree of adaptability and flexibility in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment Advanced time management skills including ability to handle multiple projects with competing deadlines.  PERKS  In order to ensure that our Agents are in tip-top condition, we’ve got them covered from their physical to mental well-being: A truly flexible working environment  In-house gym and shower facilities Latest games on the PlayStation and VR Dinner and transportation covered if you ever need to work late Team sports, movie screenings, celebrations and more Tech gadgets you need to help you do amazing work  Possibly the best pantry you have ever seen All the merch and more

description: About Datadog:  Datadog is a monitoring service for hybrid cloud applications, assisting organizations in improving agility, increasing efficiency, and providing end-to-end visibility across the application and organization. These capabilities are provided on a SaaS-based data analytics platform that enables Dev, Ops and other teams to accelerate go-to-market efforts, ensure application uptime, and successfully complete digital transformation initiatives.  The Team:  Our sales team works with a best-of-breed product that solves real problems for our customers. Sellers follow a well-defined methodology that helps them identify the customer's unique needs and clearly communicate the value of the Datadog product. Whether you're looking to learn from the best or be the best, the Datadog sales team is dedicated to furthering personal development and team success.  The Opportunity:  Looking to get into tech sales? No tech experience? That’s okay - we’ll teach you everything you need to know! Kick start your sales career as a member of a fun, hard-working, and self-motivated team. On Datadog’s Sales Development team you will learn everything you need to know about sales amongst the highest achieving sales reps in the tech space. We're scaling our Sales Development team in Singapore to help IT and Technology leaders recognize Datadog’s impact in their digital transformation and migration to the cloud. As a Datadog Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will prospect, qualify, and generate opportunities to support the overall growth of the business.  You Will: Research and map prospective new accounts for strategic outreach Cold call and email prospective customers Utilize lead generation tools such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator, DiscoverOrg, and Salesforce Partner with Account Executives to generate leads Have specific daily, monthly, quarterly and yearly pipeline metrics to help achieve sales goals Develop, present and implement plans for acquiring new business and traction in your assigned area  You Are: Fluent in English Motivated by a career in sales Interested in the tech space A self starter, focused, dynamic, and eager to learn Someone who has excellent written & verbal communication skills  Bonus Points: SaaS/cloud experience, Salesforce experience Prior exposure to a CRM tool Experience in sales or the tech space Proven ability to influence others and create a sense of urgency Additional language skills  Why You Should Apply: Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Sales training in MEDDIC and Command of the Message Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Generous and competitive benefits Friendly and inclusive workplace culture  Equal Opportunity at Datadog:  Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.  Your Privacy:  Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog’s Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.
