description: About Evie.ai Evie is the future of cognitive collaboration - a world where humans and AI assistants work together naturally to intelligently automate business operations and get things done. We deliver cognitive AI assistants that partner with humans to amplify human intelligence and creativity in order to deliver unprecedented operational efficiency and scale. Evie is built on our next-generation cognitive collaboration platform which handles natural language conversations, reasons autonomously and seamlessly orchestrates workflows.  Why us? You'll be inventing the future of work! Evie is the first of many enterprise AI workers that will transform the way companies operate We’re Stanford & Yahoo alums who have a ton of industry experience and we have awesome investors including folks from AirBnB and Google as well as institutions like SG Innovate and Farsight Capital We’re an engineering-driven company tackling hard (and interesting) technical problems and building foundational technology that will power the Intelligent Enterprise of the future We’re young, growing fast and going global, so you’ll get to experience the energy of a startup in its earliest days    Job Description / Responsibilities Sales Operations Prepare sales proposals, contracts, RFPs Draft Data Security questionnaire responses Manage sandbox environment  Ensure all sales leads/prospects are followed up expediently    General Operations Manage grant applications and claims Manage the ISO 27001 certification and compliance process that includes documentation, execution, management of the internal and external audits.  Handle corporate administration matters and other ad hoc projects Manage the on-boarding, off-boarding process of employees and contractors Manage multiple HR Job boards for recruitment   Job Requirements / Qualifications 1-2 years project management/coordination experience  Strong communication skills (verbal, written and presentation) Able to work fast and independently while being a good team player Highly organised with an eye for detail Able to multitask and meet tight deadlines  Reasonably tech-savvy (fluent with Microsoft Office, working on presentations and reports) University Degree/Diploma equivalent education

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES  Sales Strategy Contribute to the sales strategy on assigned Corporate Accounts portfolio growth objectives Determine the strategies for the assigned Corporate Accounts portfolio; Ensure development of cross selling in Country; Build the wallet share of business for GEODIS with the assigned customer portfolio and their subsidiaries or affiliates.  Account Management Ensure the development and maintenance of customer relationships and enhance overall client portfolio, safeguard sales revenue and ensure customer satisfaction Ensure increased consistency of services and pricing linked to “integrated solutions”; Grow the share of business, as well as expand the relationships within the customer identifying influencers, gatekeepers, decision makers but also to direct and align with Regional and Global KAM’s to further penetrate the client organization; Deploy a strong consultative selling approach with assigned accounts to identify their supply chain challenges and develop value creating solutions that drive increased scope of engagement and share of wallet for Geodis; All account issues proactively managed and resolved using continuous improvement principles to enhance service levels; Improve client satisfaction based on formal feedback and surveys of your customers.  New Business Ensure the identification and targeting of opportunities with customized propositions Provide support & leadership to local sales to develop business within portfolio of assigned clients; Participate to the VM Activities by supporting presentations to prospects and other clients and showcasing best practices & innovative solutions from your accounts; Work with VM manager to develop standardized offering from the customized solutions deployed on your customer; Engage with VM manager, product stakeholders, IT & management teams to create value adding service offerings that can be taken back to your clients;  Management Information Gather, consolidate, analyze and report management information Use CRM for all RFQ’s and Meetings; Track key indicators such as volume, revenue, gross profit, manage yield; Gather and provide to the company feedback on competitor information through your ongoing contact with strategic customers assigned to your care; Provide timely and accurate reporting of relevant details as required and requested.  Business Planning Drive behavior towards strategic engagement and value creation for assigned portfolio of accounts and strategic targets; Manage pipeline size and quality.  Organizational Culture Embrace the 5 values of Geodis be an ambassador by demonstrating these values in everything you say and do.  Leadership Steer, develop and motivate the local account managers to sell, maintain and support the assigned clients Customer cards in place and used to drive opportunities, innovations & growth strategy; Hands on Management of the accounts across using all standardized tools: QBR deck, Issue Log, Communication and Escalation Matrix, Monthly report… and ensuring same are maintained by local Account Managers.  REQUIREMENTS  Degree holder in related disciplines Minimum 5 years relevant experience in sales field with at least 3-year senior sales position; In-depth knowledge and experience with Freight Forwarding and Supply Chain Management; Excellent command of spoken and written English Good negotiation & presentation techniques Well-versed sales techniques, consultative selling, customer psychology and purchasing patterns. Fluent in local language, comfortable in English and other languages that the job requires to manage customer and other contacts Basic sales techniques and negotiation skills Presentation techniques, comfortable with meeting and presenting to groups 2-3 people Knowledge of Geodis Singapore tools Knowledge of company goals and strategies Good interpersonal and communication skills Highly proficient in computer skills and common applications (Office, Excel, PowerPoint & Word)  Our Candidate promise  Recruiting passionate people  At GEODIS, we believe that each and every person matters when it comes to achieving long-lasting success and demonstrating our know-how. Our commitment to our customers leads us to recruit passionate and demanding men and women who are ready to fulfill the ambitions of our rapidly changing sector with all their energy.  Join a leader in constant evolution  With more than 100 years of experience in the field of transport and logistics, GEODIS knows how to respond to the major challenges. Throughout its history, GEODIS showed ability to adapt to the needs of its clients, industry-specific constraints and new national boundaries. With its talent pool, GEODIS opens you doors to the world full of dynamism where everyone finds their place in expertise, contributes to their development and succeeds. Being the key player of the supply chain, we are working on the logistics projects of our customers today and preparing those of tomorrow.  Creating daily opportunities  It is true that we are committed to offering autonomy and the opportunity to take initiative to each of our new hires. Therefore, it is necessary that they benefit from personalized and operational support that will allow them to understand the challenges of GEODIS and emphasize their strengths. We encourage openness. “Discuss. Decide. Align.”- this is a genuine moto to guarantee the success of our actions.  And if you were part of this adventure?  Being GEODIS employee means living every day professional and personal adventure. It is about incorporating your personality, your knowledge and your know-how in the culture and the team spirit of GEODIS. Involvement and collaboration make it easier for everyone to take responsibility. We encourage you to go and meet different expertise and our complementary ecosystems whose activities give meaning to the group.
jobFunction: Supply Chain, Business Development, and Sales

description: Coty is a world leader in beauty and home to an illustrious roster of cosmetic, skincare and fragrance brands. And our company has a mission: to challenge the definition of beauty, to encourage authenticity and celebrate diversity. Because to us at Coty, beauty isn’t about conforming to somebody else’s ideal. It’s about inclusion and liberating everyone to shine in their unique way.  This role sits within the sales team, and supports the Key Account Manager for Dept Stores in achieving NR and Sellout targets by ensuring seamless operations both at sales floor, and at Coty backend. This role will require frequent and proactive liaison with Buyers, BAs, Customer Service, Logistics and Finance.  Key Responsibilities: Collate and follow up with stores on promotional calendar, including changes in dates. Coordinate with Marketing team on promotion plans, submit to retailers, and follow up on execution of agreed promotional plans. Manage changes and adaptations as required. Follow up with Buyers on POs and innovation sell-in; check margin, price, cut cases. Follow up with Customer service on PO status, and Logistics on delivery. Book and follow up on animations Monitor estore OOS and plan for replenishments Support KAM on stock management – collate Department Store SOH by SKU vs average sellout, update on expiry status Execute annual price increase, or price adjustments as required (E.g. wrong price/margin maintenance), update retailers on PIPO, code changes, discontinuations Raise returns as required by KAM, prepare and submit DN/CN Coordinate and submit counter vouchers for approval - print and deliver vouchers Collate and process Tester/Gift with Purchase/Non-sellable orders from stores or Marketing managers Master data maintenance and clean-up: needed for replenishments, sell-in, BA App/sales tracking Sales reporting (online and B&M): update sales trackers (daily) and score cards (monthly) with sell-out data, support sell-out reporting templates monthly and quarterly Collate and maintain cat growth and brand ranking data monthly  COTY Ideal Fit Meticulous, with attention to detail and keen follow up. Action-oriented, fast-faced; a person who “gets it done” through proactive action. Takes initiative and ownership of tasks but ensuring at least basic timeliness and accuracy of deliverables Organised, able to multi-task and manage tight timelines Experience managing customers and external stakeholders High energy and drive
industries: Cosmetics

description: Sift's Sales Development Team is looking for an eager & energetic new team member to join our APAC team in a remote working environment in Singapore.  As a Sales Development Representative at Sift, you will be responsible for generating a meaningful pipeline by driving interest with prospective customers on how Sift can positively impact their business. You will help identify and engage with future customers by outbound prospecting, social selling, networking, field marketing events, and any other sales activity that would contribute in expanding the Sift brand. Ultimately, booking qualified meetings for the Account Executive team while developing core sales skills and technical acumen in our career development program.  What you'll do: Handle all inbound leads by following up promptly to qualify, determine if there is a business fit, and set up calendar meetings for Account Executive. Identify Key Personas within your High Value Accounts and lay the foundation for a strong, long lasting relationship. Conduct high volume prospecting, sending personalized social & email touches, as well as 20-30 calls a day. Work closely with prospects and build out the APAC region with Account Executives in the region - aligning on strategy while setting up discovery calls with prospects for the Account Executive. Collaborate with Sales & Marketing to support successful campaigns. Represent the Sift brand at virtual events and industry conferences.  What would make you a great fit: Get Sift Done Attitude: You are self motivated and have the ability to thrive in a results-oriented environment. Win as One Team: You want to build a culture of collaboration and growth where you celebrate each other's successes. Start with the Customer: You are relentless in your goal to help prospects that can benefit from Sift, and will hustle and maintain urgency in all that you do. Courage Over Comfort: You are not afraid to ask hard questions, and strive to constantly reevaluate the status quo. Ever Better: You are constantly looking for growth opportunities and welcome feedback from your peers and managers.  Requirements: 1+ years of prior sales experience (SaaS, Tech, or Startup is a plus) BA/BS degree from leading university (Business or Technical major a plus) Excellent written/verbal communication and organizational skills Passion for sales and a desire to build a career in software and technology Experience with using Sales Tools (eg. Salesforce, Outreach, LinkedIn, etc) Proficient in English Bonus Points for Secondary language: Fluency in Mandarin, Bahasa, Vietnamese, or Thai  A little about us:  Sift is the leading innovator in Digital Trust & Safety. Hundreds of disruptive, forward-thinking companies like Airbnb, Zillow, and Twitter trust Sift to deliver outstanding customer experience while preventing fraud and abuse.  The Sift engine powers Digital Trust & Safety by helping companies stop fraud before it happens. But it's not just another anti-fraud platform: Sift enables businesses to tailor experiences to each customer according to the risk they pose. That means fraudsters experience friction, but honest users do not. By drawing on insights from our global network of customers, Sift allows businesses to scale, win, and thrive in the digital era.  Benefits and Perks: Competitive total compensation package 401k plan Medical, dental and vision coverage Wellness reimbursement Education reimbursement Flexible time off  Sift is an equal opportunity employer. We make better decisions as a business when we can harness diversity in our experience, data, and background. Sift is working toward building a team that represents the worldwide customers that we serve, inclusive of people from all walks of life who can bring their full selves to work every day.  This document provides transparency around the way in which Sift handles personal data of job applicants: https://sift.com/recruitment-privacy
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  Reporting to the Shopkeeper, the Sales Specialist maximise sales and to be a source of knowledge and expertise for the team. The Sales Specialist support the efficient work of the IKEA mechanical sales system to ensure the continued execution and success of the IKEA Concept and to give customers a positive shopping experience.  Your assignment You are passionate about our products and actively learn about their features and benefits, and proactively share this knowledge with our customers and co-workers You work with the Shopkeeper to improve range presentation by ensuring it appeals to our local customers and encourages them to buy more You know the department’s working routines, you follow-up and ensure they are done. You work together with your shopkeeper and your commercial team to sales steer products and meet department sales goals. You ensure the department has accurate sales space. You understand the relationship between sales and stock forecast work towards achieving the goals through continuous evaluation and follow up Qualifications  Your profile You are customer-serviced focused with a passion in retail home furnishing business You take initiative and is a problem solver, self-motivated and a strong team player You’re a natural leader, have strong communication and interpersonal skills with knowledge of PC You have strong selling skills and professionalism You are able to guide and coach a team of co-workers to excel as Sales Associates You are physically fit to handle physical work and pro-longed hours of standing You are able to commit to working on AM & PM shift work, weekends and public holidays Additional Information  Please apply by 8 October 2021
industries: Consumer Goods, Retail, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Sales Performance Consultant, LinkedIn Marketing Solutions
description: Company Description  LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.  Job Description  We are seeking a Sales Performance Consultant (SPC) to join the Sales Readiness team in LinkedIn Marketing Solutions (LMS), a business that is in hyper-growth and innovating quickly. This SPC will partner with regional sales leadership to align sales enablement strategies to key business priorities focused on driving learning effectiveness across the field and leadership teams in the APAC region. This is an exciting opportunity to create and drive enormous impact for LinkedIn Marketing Solutions and across our APAC business!  The SPC team owns the business relationships - they are aligned with specific regions and segments, and serve as an extension of the sales leadership team in their segment. Their remit is to enable and empower the field and sales managers in their region/segment to do the best work of their careers. To raise the bar in how we think about Sales Excellence, and to embrace learning and growth across Sales Competencies, Sales Methodology, Sales Process, and Sales Coaching. This team takes learning programs that are built centrally for scale, and brings them to market across regions and segments in a way that lands deeply, is customized for each business, and is fueled by real customer examples and regional nuances. They provide key input into the centralized program management team, to ensure programs are being built in a way that will best drive value in-market. SPCs bring learning insights to their business and their sales leaders to drive recommendations on where we should prioritize and focus learning programs to close gaps, or to achieve specific business goals. This team is essential to making learning land, stick, and drive meaningful value for our global business.  This person will partner with sales to drive learning effectiveness and business impact across the APAC region in LMS. Your role, as the SPC of this team, is to be an extension of the sales team and provide individualized learning and relevancy with our sales methodology as the foundation. What do great learning experiences look like in this new future of work? How do you partner with the sales leadership team to collaborate deeply, seek leverage programmatically, and measure success? This SPC is passionate about learning (and reinforcement/learning stickiness), they possess the ability to coach and teach, they have deep business acumen and build strong relationships with our sales leaders, they are energetic around owning end-to-end programs themselves and they are innovative, future-focused thinkers. This person needs to be comfortable operating in ambiguity with open-mindedness, agility, positivity, and a continuous commitment to iterating and improving.  Responsibilities  Partner with Sales team to create recommendations for driving impact to the business, plan and execute the sales enablement strategies. Serve as a key partner to the Sales team and establish a trusted partnership in developing learning strategies Consult with leaders, including learning & development planning, team development, management and coaching Consults with leaders to assess and analyze the learning needs of employees based on current and future strategic plans Measure and evaluate the ROI of sales enablement programs, tied directly to core sales competencies and direct impact to key business metrics Manage stakeholders – build relationships, ongoing communication, bring others with you along the journey Identify gaps that centralized programs aren’t solving for – build learning programs to close these gaps Create an enablement strategy around using tech to surface wins and drive learning reinforcement (i.e. Gong, Teams, etc.) Collaborate closely with Sales Readiness colleagues in across APAC and in other regions (EMEAL & NAMER) to ensure we scale globally, think locally Collaborate cross-functionally to uncover business needs and skills gaps, and deliver best in class development for sales professionals Delivers high quality sales training and practice workshops Drive programmatic changes to sales development approach driven by measurement outcomes to continue to demand excellence  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications 4+ years of professional experience working in a sales, sales readiness environment, or marketing  Preferred Qualifications  Adept at presenting and public speaking Modern learning obsessed – passionate about knowing the technology and trends that can make learning stick, today Experience collaborating with cross functional teams Project and program management experience Exceptional communication – know your audience, articulate the “so what?” Experience deploying change and a understanding of change management methodologies Strong ability to simplify complex problems An avid learner Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong consultative skills Highly proficient in MS Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)  Additional Information  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.   Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  This document provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://lnkd.in/GlobalDataPrivacyNotice
industries: Internet

description: Responsibilities: ·        Develop and manage new customer accounts and be responsible for achieving retail revenue target and increasing market share. ·        Perform cold calls, sales pitches and negotiate on sales contract. ·        Foster and build good customer relationship for revenue growth and customer retention. ·        Involve in sales acquisition and customer service support activities (i.e. provide pre-sales and post-sales support services). ·        Involve in the execution of marketing plans, strategies and organized events.  Requirements: ·        Degree in Business or equivalent. ·        A team player with good interpersonal and communication skills, achievement oriented and results driven. ·        Possess good presentation and negotiation skills, and be willing to learn and prepared to grow with the organization. ·        Minimum 1 to 3 years of relevant experience is preferred. ·        For candidates who are unable to meet the above requirements, you may be considered for an Officer Level position.  Other: ·        5-day work week.   Interested applicants, please forward your detailed resume with enclosed photograph including your last drawn salary, expected salary and availability to HR.SG@pacificlight.com.sg  Please indicate the position that you are applying on the subject.  (All applications will be treated in strictest confidence. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified)  By submitting your personal data and/or resume to PacificLight (“us”) or to HR.SG@pacificlight.com.sg, you shall be deemed to have given consent to us collecting, using, and disclosing your personal data for the purpose of assessing your job application. description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What We're Looking For  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  Are you looking to build something greater than yourself? Do you want to work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people in the industry? If so, this might be the place for you. We'll help you build your career in Sales while you collaborate with a diverse team of talented individuals. You are a self starter who is deeply passionate about customer happiness.  We are looking for a highly motivated Business Development Representative to join our fast growing Sales organisation.  What You’ll Be Doing … Work directly with Account Executives (Mid Market, Enterprise & Large Enterprise) to drive pipeline through personalized outreach to multiple stakeholders within Slack’s key prospect & customer accounts Providing a world-class prospect and customer experience through every interaction Become a product expert and learn Slack's selling practices Keep meticulous records of interactions with leads in our CRM (Salesforce.com) Help to build scalable demand generation campaigns based on data Identify inefficiencies and implement improvements in our process Who You Are … 2+ years of experience in sales, preferably in SaaS Fluency in English Commitment to pursuing a career in sales Consistent track record of overachieving Empathic listener and persuasive communicator Competitive, resilient, and highly motivated A great attitude and love for teamwork Bachelor’s degree required About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.

description: Main Purpose Of Role  To be responsible for maintaining and developing a single/ group of key accounts in order to exceed company set sales and profit targets across range of ‘Must have’ product lines. Implementing the hyper market business plan Maximising sales Forecasting and planning Range and category development Promotions planning Managing in stock/product lifecycle Better coordination of business activities  Key Responsibilities  Financials In conjunction with Sales Manager, deliver the financial targets (sales and profitability) for designated key accounts. Relationship Management & Business Planning Establish ongoing business relations with major account buyers Formulate and implement effective sales strategy and promotion plans for key accounts: develop, present and execute plan, sales and promotions, negotiation of trading terms and trade spends. Work in conjunction with Marketing department to formulate the trade promotion programs Participate in the formal quarterly business review process with key accounts. Category Management Maximize sales profit through improving shelving and display, implementing promotions and new product launching Ensure the execution of the Hasbro marketing plan with key accounts in a timely manner. Implement key store drivers (range, space, promotion and display), working with store planning teams where applicable. Ensure appropriate approvals in place for planograms, end caps, display stands and feature areas/ special events as negotiated with buyers. Work with marketing team to review catalogue layouts and content before going to print. Participate in regular local Sales and Marketing meetings Forecasting & Inventory Management Generating sales forecast/analysis and market insights reports on product trend development and competitors' activities Working with key account forecast, work with buying teams on stock flow (taking into consideration agreed business plan and Hasbro’s financial goals). Working with Operations team, ensure inventory is available for upcoming events Look at stand-out issues for inventory: discuss possible action plans with key account (e.g. clearance or increase stock weights), communicate issues internally. Requirements  Professional Know-how University or Diploma graduate in relevant discipline Minimum 5 years in Consumer/Retail Sales and/or Key Account Management, where at least 3 years is on distributor management Multi brand sales experience in the local market Work Effectiveness & Adaptability Excellent verbal and written English Clear persuasive communicator (written and verbal) including active listening ability PC literate with good working knowledge of MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint Results oriented, risk tolerant and persistent in fast paced, pressurised environment Good prioritisation and organisational skills Adapts response to circumstances, flexible in handling change and comfortable working independently. Business Understanding Category management / Trade Marketing exposure desirable Customer/ Consumer Focus Develops effective business relationships and manages difficult people effectively to seize opportunities Strong planning skills – focused on execution and the customer Ability to use influencing and negotiating skills to achieve results (both internally and externally) Excellent Presentation skills Problem Analysis & Decision Making Numerate, ability to analyse data and sales information and use it to generate new ideas

description: The ideal candidate will help drive revenue growth by building a strong pipeline of sales leads and helping create the market strategy. You will be responsible for establishing a strong relationship with new prospects as well as maintaining a strong relationship with existing accounts. Your effective communication and interpersonal skills will help you succeed as a Senior Account Executive.    Responsibilities Build a strong pipeline of prospective clients Manage and track client outreach Strategize innovative ways to reach new clients Communicate strategy to relevant team-members  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience 3+ years' of relevant experience Organized and able to multi-task Strong verbal and written communication skills

What is Splunk?  We have a disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and most meaningfully to each other’s success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey.  Our Splunk Family are a results’ driven and collaborative bunch spanning functions across sales, customer success, support, marketing and G&A functions. We love to work as a team, celebrate success and learn from our losses. We have a phenomenal team culture with weekly catered lunches, end of quarter celebrations, volunteering activities and a culture based on respect, transparency and always doing the right thing!  What will I being doing to help with this vision?  As an Inside Sales Representative you will bring your passion for technology and your desire to make a difference in the way our business operates. You will be part of a team that look to expand and grow territories across the Enterprise and Commercial space. You will be Using your sales, negotiation and leadership skills to prospect, and conduct lead generation and sell Splunk's award winning software in an assigned territory Running entire sales cycle from qualifying to closing deals Managing accounts by building and fostering client relationships through personalised contact and understanding client’s needs, a lot of communication will be done by phone. Inbound lead follow-up and status update through the company CRM system Outbound prospecting/Lead generation Qualifying inbound and outbound leads Scheduling product demos for qualified customers Communicating solution values of products and services Accurately forecasting opportunities based upon realistic assessments Meeting/exceeding assigned revenue goals Partnering with a field representative Working with channel ecosystem Supporting attendance to all field marketing events to include, but not limited to Splunk Lives, Splunk Forum, and all regional trade shows. Who we’re looking for? 5+ years of Experience in selling enterprise IT solutions (BI, data analytics, security software, risk management software or networking performance) 3+ years of End User Software sales experience and carrying a quota Owning & managing the entire sales cycle from prospecting, setting appointments and closing business (own quota not an overlay quota role) Consultative sales experience and challenging companies/business to think differently Successful in finding and uncovering new opportunities with prospects and existing business, cold calling and hunting for business Proven track record of exceeding goals and quota Consistent track record of success in consultative sales environments Consistent track record of developing new business and managing sales cycle, from generating leads through closing A logical and analytical thinker Demonstrated negotiation skills Exceptional organizational skills with the proven ability to prioritize and complete multiple tasks to meet deadlines Self-starter able to work independently but also a contributing member of a team Excellent conflict resolution skills Highly motivated and professional, with excellent communication and interpersonal skills Fluency in English.
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: Company Description  Sleek.com is Asia's fastest growing corporate services platform - it helps entrepreneurs and SME owners to register companies in Singapore, Hong Kong & Australia, and assist them with the management of their accounting, audit and taxes, in a 100% digital manner. We build cutting edge technology to automate manual work, and provide a delightful experience to our 6,000+ clients. Naturally, we are continuously looking for great people to join our dynamic team!  We are a team of 200+ builders from 17 countries, with offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, Sydney & the Philippines, committed to delivering a great experience to our clients.  At Sleek, you will find a fast-paced environment focused on building great solutions, and endless opportunities for learning and knowledge sharing, whether it’s around a coffee with your colleagues at the office, or via video calls with your peers based overseas!  Job Description  Account Executive Focused on the conversion of inbound and self-sourced leads. Constantly on the lookout for new revenue opportunities, cross selling, networking and partnerships with strategic players. Drive Sleek’s revenue growth by over-achieving KPIs and milestones. Nurture prospect relationships through the sales cycle, ensuring alignment with Sleek’s product offering resulting in a long-term relationship. Improve existing lead acquisition channels in conjunction with internal teams. Requirements A minimum of 3 years working with external clients, with a proven track record selling complex products. Proactive with a positive attitude to roll up their sleeves and ensure targets are exceeded. A networker by heart with outstanding verbal and written communication skills. An ability to understand Singapore’s legal and accounting landscape. A passion for technology and the local startup ecosystem. Inside sales experience prospecting and qualifying leads. Sales & Marketing experience essential Hubspot experience preferred
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Because you belong at Twilio  The Who, What, Where And Why  The Outbound Sales Development Representative role holds a key position in the growth and development of our sales pipeline. Success in this role directly impacts the evolution of how the company successfully engages and interacts with our customers, while helping to fuel the continued growth and success of Twilio.  At Twilio, you will be a part of a collaborative sales culture dedicated to the development and advancement of its team members, while maintaining a fun and rewarding atmosphere. You will have the chance to join a company that was just certified as a Great Place to Work! You will be provided a defined career path in sales and sales management depending on your performance.  Who?  They Also Have  Twilio is looking for an Enterprise Outbound SDR who lives the Twilio Magic and has a demonstrated track record of being a team player and result oriented. 1-2 years sales experience in the PaaS/SaaS industries OR 2-3 years of closing experience in another industry. A go-getter attitude, who wants to develop new and innovative communications workflows. General understanding of Sales Enablement Platforms (Outreach), CRM and prospecting tools. Feels comfortable in any vertical and is technically curious. Thrives on helping customers solve their problems. Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required. Native or business level fluency in Mandarin is required What? DON'T SETTLE: Growth mindset of exceeding expectations and targets. DRAW THE OWL: Partnering with our Field Sales and Marketing teams to build creative outreach programs that build pipeline within your territory. RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE: Research and build new and existing accounts via adding contacts, outbound calling efforts and sending strategic email, video and social campaigns. WEAR THE CUSTOMER SHOES: Develop strong relationships (both internal and external), and really excel at building long-lasting partnerships with prospective customers. Why?  The Sales Development team is a strategic component to our go-to-market strategy. The Outbound SDR will look to capture the attention of enterprise level companies that have been around for many years. The Global Sales team plays an integral role in building out our customer base and bringing Twilio’s platform to developers, non-profits and enterprise to make an impact on their services.  Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications for customer engagement. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your career growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We invest in weeks dedicated to tackling hard problems and creating your own ideas. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.  Where?  This position will be located in our Singapore office. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers’ experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.  About Us  Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing the world’s communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world’s most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer’s toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world’s largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Internet, and Telecommunications

description: Hi, I’m Austin Essam, Senior Manager Sales Development at Puppet,  We are looking for a strategic Sales Development Representative to join our highly driven and talented team.  Our SDR's are a key part of selling products and services using modern prospecting techniques and best in class tools. This is a great opportunity for an aspiring inside sales professional or graduate who wants to learn how to prospect and generate business. Cohesion on this team is key, so if you’re applying, you’ll need to be a team player! You will learn how to get and keep the attention of Global 5000 prospects amidst all the noise by researching companies and people, building contact portfolio’s, creating personalised/bespoke prospecting plans and delivering this via a multi-media approach. Our team has a burning desire to be successful and exceed expectations, that means the very best will be demanded of you.   At Puppet, the Sales Development Team is the tip of the arrow for sales and predominantly works outbound with some inbound responsibilities. We work closely with Marketing to make the most of campaigns, events, webinars and workshops, while also work closely with the field team/Account Directors to leverage their territory knowledge and strategies to build pipeline.  As a Sales Development Representative at Puppet, you will:  Drive net new business acquisition Expansion & growth of Tier Two customers  Build strategic outbound prospecting strategies to target G5K accounts, underpinned by an account based sales development methodology Produce qualified prospects by following up on inbound leads Align to force management (MEDDPICC) sales methodology Nurture prospects over time, discover needs, offer relevant resources, and learn where they are in the buying process to help propel the sale forward for Account Directors  Conduct pre-event activities to drive attendance to a specific event or post-event follow up to increase our connection with attendees. Build your knowledge about Puppet offerings and our value proposition so that you can have knowledgeable conversations with potential customers and prospects. Work closely with Account Directors to develop strategies for their territories and execute tactical elements to support those. You will be in a unique position to learn from some of the most experienced Enterprise Sales Reps in our industry. No matter your background or tenure, there’s always something new to learn.  You are...  An excellent communicator with a high emotional IQ. You strive to be articulate and empathetic in your interactions. You have a way with words—you can write a great email and carry on a good conversation. You are a team player who values outcomes over effort—you are someone who is driven to succeed both as an individual but also as a team. You care about quality, wanting to get the job done as well as you can. Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions. Gutsy and self-directed when it comes to problem-solving and working on multiple projects at once. You’re looking to work with a team of high performers where you’ll be responsible for the impact you make and the freedom to explore your creativity. Working with folks in different time zones will be standard issue for you around here, so being able to stay determined, even when the answers aren’t in front of you, is essential. You are determined to succeed. A lot about being a successful SDR is attitude and drive. When the going gets rough, you don’t throw in the towel and accept defeat - you push forward and aim to win.  Valuable experiences and skills you’ll bring to Puppet  Preferred 1 years of work or internship experience in lead generation, sales, business, operations, marketing, or related Proven track record of achieving measurable goals Avid technology evangelist  Bonus, but not required  Sales Development, customer service, or account management experience for a SaaS or B2B solution Language skills (Thai)  Experience with Salesforce.com or other CRM Experience with Salesloft. Best practices and applicability Cold-calling experience a plus  We are hiring at various experience levels and we’re particularly interested in having a diverse team with a broad set of skills and viewpoints. If this seems like your dream job, but you’re not sure if you qualify, apply anyway!  *Visa Sponsorship Please note, this position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.  About Puppet Puppet’s core mission is to eliminate soul crushing work. We created the industry standard for managing infrastructure as code. And we didn’t stop there—our product portfolio has grown to help organizations automate across their entire software delivery lifecycle. With more than two-thirds of Fortune 100 companies using Puppet’s open source or commercial products, our code is helping power thousands of organizations across the world.  As the industry leader in DevOps solutions, we realize that our success is a collective effort; all made possible by the incredible people working here, our customers, partners, and Puppet community. Our culture is built on positivity, diversity, inclusivity and support—and we seek people who are resilient, entrepreneurial-minded, team players who continually strive to be incrementally better every single day. In our work together we aim to be curious, accountable, empathetic and, above all, collaborative. If this sounds like the environment you’d thrive in, why not say hello?  Learn more about Puppet by checking out the values we live by and the awesome benefits and perks we offer employees! description: Hi, I'm Austin Essam, Senior Manager Sales Development at Puppet,  We are looking for a strategic Sales Development Representative to join our highly driven and talented team.  Our SDR's are a key part of selling products and services using modern prospecting techniques and best in class tools. This is a great opportunity for an aspiring inside sales professional or graduate who wants to learn how to prospect and generate business. Cohesion on this team is key, so if you're applying, you'll need to be a team player! You will learn how to get and keep the attention of Global 5000 prospects amidst all the noise by researching companies and people, building contact portfolio's, creating personalised/bespoke prospecting plans and delivering this via a multi-media approach. Our team has a burning desire to be successful and exceed expectations, that means the very best will be demanded of you.  At Puppet, the Sales Development Team is the tip of the arrow for sales and predominantly works outbound with some inbound responsibilities. We work closely with Marketing to make the most of campaigns, events, webinars and workshops, while also work closely with the field team/Account Directors to leverage their territory knowledge and strategies to build pipeline.  As a Sales Development Representative at Puppet, you will: Drive net new business acquisition Expansion & growth of Tier Two customers Build strategic outbound prospecting strategies to target G5K accounts, underpinned by an account based sales development methodology Produce qualified prospects by following up on inbound leads Align to force management (MEDDPICC) sales methodology Nurture prospects over time, discover needs, offer relevant resources, and learn where they are in the buying process to help propel the sale forward for Account Directors Conduct pre-event activities to drive attendance to a specific event or post-event follow up to increase our connection with attendees. Build your knowledge about Puppet offerings and our value proposition so that you can have knowledgeable conversations with potential customers and prospects. Work closely with Account Directors to develop strategies for their territories and execute tactical elements to support those. You will be in a unique position to learn from some of the most experienced Enterprise Sales Reps in our industry. No matter your background or tenure, there's always something new to learn.  You are... An excellent communicator with a high emotional IQ. You strive to be articulate and empathetic in your interactions. You have a way with words—you can write a great email and carry on a good conversation. You are a team player who values outcomes over effort—you are someone who is driven to succeed both as an individual but also as a team. You care about quality, wanting to get the job done as well as you can. Hungry to learn, genuinely curious, and know how to get the answers to your questions. Gutsy and self-directed when it comes to problem-solving and working on multiple projects at once. You're looking to work with a team of high performers where you'll be responsible for the impact you make and the freedom to explore your creativity. Working with folks in different time zones will be standard issue for you around here, so being able to stay determined, even when the answers aren't in front of you, is essential. You are determined to succeed. A lot about being a successful SDR is attitude and drive. When the going gets rough, you don't throw in the towel and accept defeat - you push forward and aim to win. description: Want to be part of the fastest growing startup that is at the intersection of Retail, Fintech and Data?  Qashier is looking for an amazing Business Development Manager to support our growth!  We are a dynamic and fast growing team that is excited about commerce, retail and payments, and the opportunity to transform these industries with data and technology.  We are looking for passionate individuals that can spearhead the growth of the company through the generation of new leads and acquiring of new merchants. If you have knowledge and/or keen interest in the area of point of sale, payment systems and B2B sales, this role might be for you.  In short, you’ll be driving Qashier’s success in the following ways: Generating new leads and sales opportunities through cold calls and emails, direct sales, referrals – main goal here is to be creative (and daring) in your approach! Recommending the best solution to merchants and closing deals: You’ll act as a trusted adviser with each merchant, working with them to establish their business goals and recommending the best solution to achieve those goals. Assist with onboarding of new merchants: Onboarding of new merchants involve setting up and deploying the Qashier system according to each merchant’s requirements. As the initial point of contact, you’ll be working closely with the Account Management team to onboard new merchants according to their requirements.  What you should bring along Diploma/Degree in any field 2+ years of experience in B2B sales, merchant acquisition and/or POS and payments systems Passionate about technology, fintech and the retail space Strong interpersonal skills and readiness to go the extra mile for our merchants Outgoing with good bilingual oral skills Highly driven and energetic individuals with a strong willingness to learn  Why join Qashier? Be at the forefront of a fast-growing startup in an exciting sector. Qashier’s innovative platform combines the latest developments in Cloud technology, Payments and Data to transform the Retail and F&B industries. You’ll play a crucial role on the growth of a revolutionary product that will become a key platform behind successful retail businesses in the region. Amazing growth and learning opportunities. We are a tight knit team where everyone grows together. We’ll continuously work with you to refine your strengths and strengthen your weaknesses to further your personal and career development. Make a strong impact with your work. You’ll be working directly with hundreds of small businesses across the region where the work that you do will make a direct impact to the success of these businesses. Attractive compensation and uncapped commissions  ABOUT QASHIER Qashier (qashier.com) powers SMEs with a technology platform that combines a smart POS terminal and integrated payment acceptance with a diverse app store of both in-house and third party business applications. By pairing technology with a strong commitment to merchant success, Qashier helps retail and F&B businesses increase revenue, streamline operations, and create loyal customers.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Retail, and Food & Beverages

description: BigSpring is a mobile lifelong skilling platform with a mission to provide a direct path to employment for everyone. We empower people with the market-relevant skills they need to be gainfully employed and enjoy a high quality of life, and enable employers to measure ROI from learning to establish it as a core business driver - not a discretionary expense. BigSpring's reach extends globally across over a million learners with customers such as Uber, Google, United Technologies, Tata Steel, and others. The platform offers lifelong skilling for every worker and every job, with use cases including enhancing consumer financial literacy and driving sales channel productivity.  BigSpring was recently covered by Forbes and The Innovator and awarded as a "Technology Pioneer 2020" by the World Economic Forum for our cutting-edge technology and impact (past recipients included Google, Twitter, Spotify, Palantir Technologies, Airtable, and others).  About The Role  As a world-class Mid-Market Sales Representative, you will play a central role in scaling our Go-to-Market team by driving the full sales cycle from pipeline generation to winning new customers. You will build and close a sales pipeline by engaging in professional conversations with executives from targeted companies to drive interest, qualifying inbound demand, and demonstrating strong sales skills to drive the sales process to closure. The ideal candidate will have strong business acumen and communication skills and be both persistent and resilient in striving to exceed goals.  As the first touch point with customers, you will play a key role in establishing BigSpring as a differentiated SaaS platform that focuses on creating value for each prospect & customer. You will need to partner cross-functionally with the Sales, Marketing, Customer Success, and Product teams to help build and execute repeatable sales plays.  For the right person that can bring passion, drive, and innovation to a fast-growing global company, this position offers the unique opportunity to have a considerable impact on the rapid growth of BigSpring. You can build your professional skills and develop an incredibly successful career at BigSpring.  In this role you'll: Engage and evaluate inbound leads with precise qualification Build and execute repeatable outbound prospecting sales plays to build pipeline with high velocity Research & track target companies to understand how BigSpring's solutions can add value to their organization Develop, test, and iterate messaging across multiple industries, use cases, and personas Codify and contribute learnings and best practices to the sales strategy Use a data driven approach to identify success criteria and accelerate sales cycles Leverage your sales acumen to identify decision makers early and progress the sales at each interaction Remotely deliver compelling product demos Track, report, and maintain prospects within CRM database to maximize productivity Consistently achieve weekly and monthly activity metrics & quota targets  What you'll bring to the team: 5+ years of work experience; Bachelor's Degree Quota carrying mid-market and/or enterprise sales experience at a technology company is a big plus You have the aptitude to quickly learn new technologies and industries Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a professional telephone presence Consistent track record of top performance in prior roles Thrive in high volume & high velocity environments Comfortable working with high degrees of autonomy in a global team. Self-starter with the hunger to be great Thrive in ambiguity and are able to create processes to drive productivity Singapore citizenship or Permanent Residence  Why you'll love working here: You'll be part of an innovation-driven, high-growth company on a mission to improve people's lives Competitive compensation package Flexible vacation and PTO Female Founder/CEO Supportive, highly collaborative team environment Bi-Weekly Learning Sessions  BigSpring is an Equal Opportunity Employer. BigSpring does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. You must have authorization to work in the location the position is posted.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What We're Looking For  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  Are you looking to build something greater than yourself? Do you want to work alongside some of the most talented and dynamic people in the industry? If so, this might be the place for you. We'll help you build your career in Sales while you collaborate with a diverse team of talented individuals. You are a self starter who is deeply passionate about customer happiness.  We are looking for a highly motivated Business Development Representative to join our fast growing Sales organisation.  What You’ll Be Doing … Work directly with Account Executives (Mid Market, Enterprise & Large Enterprise) to drive pipeline through personalized outreach to multiple stakeholders within Slack’s key prospect & customer accounts Providing a world-class prospect and customer experience through every interaction Become a product expert and learn Slack's selling practices Keep meticulous records of interactions with leads in our CRM (Salesforce.com) Help to build scalable demand generation campaigns based on data Identify inefficiencies and implement improvements in our process Who You Are … 2+ years of experience in sales, preferably in SaaS Fluency in English Commitment to pursuing a career in sales Consistent track record of overachieving Empathic listener and persuasive communicator Competitive, resilient, and highly motivated A great attitude and love for teamwork Bachelor’s degree required About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. jobTitle: Account Executive, Enterprise Corporate Sales - Malaysia
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  Position: Account Executive , Enterprise Corporate Sales - Malaysia  The Enterprise Corporate Sales (ECS) Account Executive is responsible for managing a large volume of smaller size opportunities within Enterprise clients. Partnering with our most seasoned sales executives this role will suit those who are looking to take their enterprise sales skills to the next level. With a sales model that fosters collaboration and supports your success, this is a great opportunity to forge a successful sales career.  With a business culture that has the customer's interests at the core of everything we do, we'll set you up for success by providing a comprehensive induction and on boarding to the business including a five day bootcamp in San Francisco. On top of your own business development we provide a range of support functions to help create and drive opportunities from internal sales support to highly skilled pre- sales so it is not just you against the world.  Responsibilities To exceed monthly / quarterly sales targets by selling Salesforce solutions into ECS accounts within an assigned within a sub set of major account /customer or vertical market. You will manage the entire sales process to ensure delivery against key performance metrics, with a strong emphasis on new business sales , while expanding existing accounts. Accurate monthly forecasting and revenue delivery. Territory/Vertical identification and research, to formalize a go-to-market strategy and create qualified target accounts. Pipeline development through a combination of cold-calling, email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence. Create and maintain a sales pipeline to ensure over-achievement within the designated market sector(s). Engage with prospect organizations to position Salesforce solutions through strategic value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, references and analyst data. Manage the end-to-end sales process through engagement of appropriate resources such as Sales Engineers, Professional Services, Executives, Partners, etc. Generate short term results whilst maintaining a long term perspective to maximize overall revenue generation. Daily update of the Salesforce system with accurate customer and pipeline data. Required Skills Full accountability to deliver monthly forecasted/committed deals. Strong sense of urgency and always be ready to close deals. Strong drive with growth mindset to drive results and take on big challenges. Experienced and matured enterprise business sales personnel with proven track record of growing net new business and consistent delivery against sales targets. Extensive and relevant experience of selling enterprise software solutions gained within a major software vendor. Extensive experience selling to customers in Malaysia. Compelling communication skill to articulate Salesforce Capabilities, Business Model and Advantages to C-Level and senior business decision makers. Credibility at all levels, including CxO. CRM application sales or vertical Industry sector experience would be viewed favorably. Strong tenure with previous employers.
