description: Job Description  About PLURALSIGHT:  We believe everyone should have the opportunity to create progress through technology and develop the skills of tomorrow. With assessments, learning paths and courses authored by industry experts, our platform helps businesses and individuals accelerate upskilling across a host of technologies and benchmark expertise across roles. Our technology skills learning platform helps companies build life-changing products that better the lives of their customers. It empowers technologists to dream big and do big. And this is what motivates us every day.  We’re on the Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For®, Fortune Best Workplaces in Technology®, and Fortune Best Workplaces for Women® lists in 2020!  BDRs At PLURALSIGHT  Business Development Representatives (“BDRs”) at Pluralsight, are a critical component of our growth. BDRs are specialists at developing engagement in Pluralsight's platform and are the catalyst for new revenue. Our BDRs are actively mentored and developed to become Account Executives and world-class Sales Leaders and professionals. BDRs gain the skills, knowledge, and discipline to succeed, both at Pluralsight and in other professional and personal endeavors. As a team, we cherish a culture of collaboration and competition. While we individually seek to be the best, we care most about succeeding together.  Who You Are Results driven and accountable for work and performance; committed to continuous development and growth Self-starter who is passionate about learning and developing the knowledge and skills for an extraordinary sales career Aligned to Pluralsight’s Mission of Democratizing Technology Skills and committed to living Pluralsight’s Values How to create impact?  Our Top Performers Master The Following Skills And Traits  As a BDR team, our focus is new business opportunities. We master communicating Pluralsight’s platform by aligning our solutions with the business objectives of our customers. Successful BDRs build close partnerships with sales and marketing to optimise engagement with tech leaders. Partnering with sales reps to strategically determine messaging, persona targets, and account strategy Researching target accounts, identifying key players and crafting targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to stimulate opportunities Developing and nurturing accounts and contacts through outbound calls, social messaging, emails, events, and other mediums Creating sales-ready opportunities and transferring those leads to Sales Representatives Handling sales pipeline through qualification to discovery and preparing reports and forecasts on activities and results using Salesforce.com Achieving and exceeding monthly quotas of qualified appointments and pipeline generated Ideally You Will Have  A positive, resilient, and energetic demeanor and ability to thrive on a high-energy and collaborative sales team. Additionally, we seek prior experience with high volume and impact calling/messaging and proven success achieving inside sales goals. Up to 1 year as a Sales Development (SDR/ADR/BDR), Lead Generation, Sales, and/or Marketing Excellent communication, discovery, and presentation skills (written and verbal) to persuasively connect with senior level decision makers Proficiency and experience using Salesforce.com, Outreach, and LinkedIn At Pluralsight, we believe you should live your best life in and out of the office! Benefits include: Generous remuneration package Unlimited Paid Time Off - Take time off when needed...and actually use it Medical coverage - Health comes first! Fully funded comprehensive medical & dental coverage for you and your family Wellness - Stay on your A-game with gym/wellness reimbursements Tuition reimbursement - Learn something new and let us help you with the bill

description: Our job is to be bold at work. It starts with an insatiable curiosity about clients, colleagues, and the future. At Forrester, we believe curiosity powers progress. Forresterites bring a diversity of opinions and the courage of their convictions to collaborate on the ideas and initiatives that change the course of business. As a trusted advisor to the most influential companies in the world, we live at the nexus of what’s next.  About This Role: The Account Executive is required to generate and close new business, as well as renew and upsell from existing clients within an assigned territory. The role also entails working to develop and execute a territory plan and strategy that will result in high quota attainment. For qualified prospects, the Account Executive must conduct a needs analysis and demonstrate the value of Forrester to potential clients by addressing critical business issues. Upon new client acquisition, this person will continue to build strong relationships, enrich existing accounts, and drive retention of existing business by ensuring a high level of client satisfaction. This position is based in Singapore and will cover financial services (FS) as a territory.  Responsibilities Achieve a new business sales quota in the assigned territory on FS enterprises. Prospect and close appropriate accounts from a target account list on FS enterprises. Once closed, keep the relationship with these accounts and develop them further. Develop and close business by developing interest across Technology, Marketing, Customer Experience, Sales & Product roles. Maintain an appropriate sales pipeline to achieve quota, and keep the pipeline updated in Forrester’s CRM system (salesforce.com). Produce accurate and timely forecasts. Build a strong understanding of the financial services industry, as well as the changing business and technology issues and needs that our potential clients face. Navigate across teams to better understand the Forrester value proposition for prospects. Develop a complete understanding of Forrester's full array of product offerings, with an emphasis on business outcomes.  Qualifications Eight or more years quota-carrying experience in successful sales to C-level executive.s Strong understanding and experience in a recurring revenue model business. A bachelor’s degree or higher equivalent experience. A proven track record of prospecting and selling strategic solutions to more than $1 billion FS enterprises. Proven experience in working in complex global business environment, managing stakeholders internally and externally. Proven experience in working in lean organizations with complex internal ecosystems. Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills. The ability to align client business objectives with Forrester solutions. A team player, with effective organization and time management skills. A high level of business acumen, particularly within FS. The ability to work and reside in Singapore without restriction. All potential future employees MUST follow the steps in the 'How To Apply' Section below, providing all required information. Direct LinkedIn applications that do not follow these steps will not be considered for the role.  Livewire is leading the way for brands to talk to the next generation of consumers through their passion of gaming, utilising all aspects of gaming marketing and gametech.  We are focused on making a positive global impact on the video game ecosystem by leading the creation and adoption of new gaming marketing and gametech technologies with our clients.  We are a research and strategy first gaming company, full of ideas and energy and continuing to grow to as a leader in global gaming marketing.  Your opportunity  You love the feeling of winning a new client and we look forward to celebrating with you! As our Commercial Director (SEA), you will have a wide range of brand and agency contacts and hold relationships with decisions makers, from C-Suite to the digital and account managers who finalise strategies, campaigns and budgets.   The opportunity will position you as a leader in talking to brands and agencies about utilising gaming marketing and gametech to engage the gaming audience through their passion points, backed by research, data, and our team. Your relentless work ethic (though we will force you to have a work life balance!), networking abilities and relationships will create new clients who want our gaming research, strategy, digital in-game inventory, and end to end execution capabilities.  We will empower you to utilise your expertise and knowledge to be a dynamic leader to build and lead the commercial team of Livewire SEA. You will strategically approach winning new clients, love presenting to potential leads and integrating with our team to be at the forefront of gaming marketing and gametech.  Where you will shine  You will bring a passion for sales, a flair for building relationships and will become a central point of contact for new and current clients across South East Asia, building the SEA team with our support and your ambition.  Leverage your strong and active brand relationships and contacts to Livewire and the power of marketing through the gaming ecosystem Grow to your current digital and gaming knowledge, while looking for new partnerships and opportunities to create region-based products Obliterate goals (not like Thanos, every one of them) and challenge us to set new ones together to unlock new rewards (yes, we’re gamifying your gaming role) Create a supportive and positive team culture attract the best talent in market to work for Livewire and our clients Become an integrated part of the Livewire APAC team, continually learning new ways to engage the gaming audience and ingesting research and data Understand marketing and strategy metrics and acronyms, where to apply them and how they compare to other options across digital and gaming culture Continually learn and utilise data platforms, research, and trends to uncover new opportunities. Be constantly curious about gaming marketing and gametech, whether you play or not (it’s going to be a fun part of your job!)  What you will bring  5+ years’ experience establishing and/or leading a sales/digital sales team A proven history of selling pioneering marketing services and digital assets The ability to work in a highly autonomous role balancing fun & performance Clear and concise verbal and written skills (English) A positive, solutions focused mindset Your energetic and team first attitude Experience working in gaming verticals is preferable but not necessary (publishers, platforms, influencers, content, media and social)  How you can apply  We’re not here to waste your time writing a novel, we want to see how your brain works!  Please send a Cover Letter (1 page max), Resume (1 page max) and Case Study (1 page max) highlighting a sale you are most proud of, the steps you took to execute it, what you loved, what you learned and what you would do different to careers@livewire.group,  Your subject should be – YOUR NEW SEA COMMERCIAL DIRECTOR, announcing your arrival to our team before Friday the 8th of October 2021 (5pm SGT)  We are an equal opportunity employer focused on building a dynamic and inclusive work culture that is diverse, accepting applicants of all ages, races, religions, disabilities, gender identifications or sexual orientations. If you require additional preparations to support a positive interview experience, please let us know.  What we offer you  An attractive salary, including base, super and holidays The ability to work remotely (we’ll invest in setting up your remote office) A team culture that encourages learning and celebrates success Flexible working hours and a commitment to work/life balance Supportive company that will help you continually grow and develop Opportunities to work with key gaming brands, talent and more

About Us YQueue is a company that deals with self-ordering and payment solutions, food and people. With razor-thin charges and complimentary content marketing services, we play the long game. Join us in our mission to provide more affordable options to F&B vendors!  The Job Sourcing for new leads, proposing suitable solutions to the merchants, and onboarding them. Job Purpose  Implement sales and marketing activities to positively influence key retail accounts and independent lab partners in promoting and selling Transitions lenses. In addition, manage new product introduction in the region and capturing and analyzing market intelligence.  The regionally accountability encompasses all of Asia (excluding Australia/NZ), Turkey, Russia.  This Includes Yet Is Not Limited To Develop close working partnership with key accounts (retail, buying groups and other groups) to improve engagement levels, in store visibility and recommendation of store staff of Transitions lenses; Develop close working partnership with defined labs (lenscaster partners and independent labs) to improve engagement levels, product range held and go to market strategies for Transitions lenses; Deliver educational programs to lab teams, key account teams and eye care professionals [ECP] to expand Transitions knowledge; Partnering with lenscaster teams for development of joint activities for key accounts and labs as required; Capturing, record and analysing market information; Implementing, monitoring and analysing trade promotional programs. Key Responsibilities of the Role Key account and ECP partnership Manage the relationship of defined key accounts labs to enable high engagement on the Transitions brands at head office and individual store level; Develop business plans for key accounts with opportunity, investment, ROI completed, pre, during and post programs, this may include partnership with lab(s) as applicable; Ensure all key accounts are kept up to date with information and activities of Transitions and explore opportunities for collaboration; Identify and creates sales opportunities for Transitions products; Plan, develop and execute market wide promotions, merchandising tools, marketing programs to support the growth of labs Transitions product range; Provide training and education and support with corporate and store staff to increase Transitions penetration. Develops and manages trade promotional programs; Active role in special Transitions events such as new product launches, trade shows, and new communications programs; Actively supports ATL and BTL programs to ensure partners high engagement around the investment. Lab Partnership Under the direction of the General Manager AMERA (and alignment with regional Lenscaster Manager); Manage the relationship of independent labs to enable high engagement on the Transitions brands and products at state, rep and customer service levels; Ensure all independent labs are kept up to date with information and activities of Transitions and explore opportunities for collaboration; Identify and creates sales opportunities for Transitions products; Plan, develop and execute market wide promotions, merchandising tools, marketing programs to support the growth of labs Transitions product range; Provide training and education and support with local sales and customer service teams to increase Transitions penetration. ECP partnership and market intelligence Ensure all targeted accounts (plus those requested through lenscaster & lab partners) have up to date demonstration tools including training on how to use, plus up to date POS materials place in prominent positions in store; Ensures the use & updates of the Transitions customers database; Analyze industry market trends (including competition) and work with management to develop appropriate marketing strategies, tactical programs and see through implementation of such programs; Creates and builds the image of Transitions as an industry leader. The incumbent will be responsible for maintaining the integrity of the brand and the trademark in all communications. Education Implements and/or develops education modules with insight from global teams to ensure understanding of performance and positioning of Transitions family of brands, recommendation processes and overcoming objections; Provide and lead dedicated training sessions, webinars and online education for all key stakeholders on Transitions technology. Education, Experience And Requirements Graduate in Degree / MBA in Business, Sales or any related course. Minimum of 8 years of relevant sales experience with sustained high performance. Results driven and exercise a high degree of ownership and initiative Previous experience with optical and/or retail is an advantage. Must have excellent strategic business planning skills with ability to do detailed analysis of opportunity, investment and ROI is necessary. Strong interpersonal and written communication skills. Excellent presentation skills. Must be able to effectively and professionally represent the Transitions® lenses image to customers and suppliers, and demonstrate the ability to act independently. Ability to influence and drive change within the organization. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment. Be financially astute, aware of budgets while attaining excellent margin results against plan. Able to travel up to 50% of the time. Highly competent in Excel, PowerPoint and CRM systems. Ability to plan ahead, handles multiple projects, set priorities and drive results. Demonstrate creativity and innovative thinking. Fluency in English language is essential Transversal Responsibilities  All employees have a responsibility to contribute to the Group’s sustainability and in doing so ensure that we can continue to fulfil our mission.All business decisions and actions must serve and be in line with the Group’s sustainability goals and mission.An employee must abide by the legal compliance policy in the performing of his/her duties.

description: There is only one Data Cloud. Snowflake’s founders started from scratch and designed a data platform built for the cloud that is effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. But it didn’t stop there. They engineered Snowflake to power the Data Cloud, where thousands of organizations unlock the value of their data with near-unlimited scale, concurrency, and performance. This is our vision: a world with endless insights to tackle the challenges and opportunities of today and reveal the possibilities of tomorrow.  Due to growth plans across the entire APJ region, we are looking for an Enterprise Account Executive to join our thriving Singapore team.  WE ARE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WITH: 8+ years of field sales experience preferred with an emphasis on data, data analytics, database (SQL & NoSQL), ETL, or business intelligence. Proven ability to independently manage, develop, and close new client relationships. A track record of pro-actively building business in the Enterprise market. Proven success in driving consistent activity, pipeline development and quota achievement. Experience determining customer requirements and presenting appropriate solutions. Pro-active, independent thinking and a high energy/positive attitude. Excellent verbal and written communication, presentation, and relationship management skills. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment. BA/BS preferred.  ABOUT YOU: Enthusiastic, self-motivated, and positive attitude with a passion for building customer relationships and closing new business opportunities. The Account Executive must have the confidence and ability to negotiate and close agreements with Clients and support new customers through our on-boarding process. You are driven to exceed performance objectives. You are excited about being positioned right in the middle of the exploding cloud based economy and to develop and maintain a highly desired knowledge of Snowflake’s solutions. You have an understanding of the Cloud application/computing space along with familiarity with data warehouse or analytic technologies. You are familiar with a solution-based approach to selling, have experience managing a complex sales process and possess excellent presentation and listening skills. You have superb organisation and contact management capabilities. You are driven to achieve your mission and you love bringing the team together to achieve results together.  Snowflake is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Snowflake is growing fast, and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. We are looking for people who share our values, challenge ordinary thinking, and push the pace of innovation while building a future for themselves and Snowflake.  How do you want to make your impact?

description: About MMI Asia MMI Asia is a full subsidiary of one of the world largest and leading exhibition organizers; Messe München GMBH (MMG). MMI Asia established in Singapore in 1992, is now embarking on a significant growth and expansion program, bringing some of MMG’s world leading brands to the ASEAN market. Through a combination of, geo clones, partnerships, joint-ventures, M&A and new greenfield launches, MMI Asia is growing its team in Singapore with exceptional, ambitious and innovative staff to assist the company’s growth strategies.  The Role The Sales Executive / Manager will take responsibility for the relationship building and account management of MMI Asia and MMG’s key clients both in Singapore and across the region. The role ensures that client participation in exhibitions and events overseas are seamless and valuable. The position will also support MMI Asia’s show teams to grow exhibition stand, sponsorship, and digital sales for their respective exhibitions.  Responsibilities For MMG international events: Provide detailed information about all Messe München events to exhibitors, visitors, trade association and media representatives located in Singapore Acquisition of exhibitors and visitors Implement tailored promotions, including the formation of Singapore pavilions Work with international project teams regarding exhibitors’ participation Provide support for application formalities, visa application, stand placement etc. Provide information about grant opportunities through government agencies or associations for exhibitor’s trade fair participation  For MMI Asia regional events: Support the show teams for new business acquisition Exhibition stand, sponsorship and digital sales Source, build and maintain a thorough client database Ensure accurate reporting and pipeline management Establish new and strengthen existing relationships with clients Conduct competitive intelligence  Key Skills and experience ·      2+ years in the international exhibition/event industry ·      Proficiency in English, both written and spoken ·      Commercial flair with the ability to innovate ·      Proactive and ambitious in nature is a must for this position ·      Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and observe tight deadlines ·      Familiar with Microsoft office & Salesforce ·      Self-motivated individual with good team spirit

Job Title - Business Development Manager Job Code – TWSJD 05 Job Location - Woodlands, Singapore  About The Company: Twilight is a niche technology company specializing in providing Mobile, Web, Cloud, AI & next generation software development solutions. Being incorporated in Singapore with offshore development center in Pondicherry, India, we provide quality IT outsourcing services.  We work closely with global MNC’s, Enterprises, SME’s and emerging Startups fully empowering their digital transformation. Twilight has more than 200+ engineers catering the technology requirements of clients globally.  About the Role: Twilight Softwares is actively looking for energetic Business Development professionals with an entrepreneurial spirit, passion for sales and a proven track record of success, who take a hands-on approach to building business opportunities.  Requirements: • Degree / Diploma in computer Science or Information Technology / Marketing with minimum 5 + years in IT Sales, Marketing & Business Development functions. • Candidates with IT / Software / SaaS Business Development experience & Recruitment / Staffing Business Development experience would be preferred. • A strong passion for sales in IT Industry and able to drive the sales process from prospecting closing the deal. • Proactive and self -motivated, focused and goal oriented. should be able to work under minimum supervision. • A good hunting mentality and resilience towards rejection.   Roles & Responsibilities: • Responsible for all Business Development & Pre-sales activities in the SEA Region and global markets. • Work on all phases of the end-to-end sales cycle including pre-sales presentations, client persuasions, conducting negotiations, and contracting terms with clients. • Business Research to identify potential clients/ lead generation, and take all the required actions to convert the lead • Derive & define sales strategies / plans and work closely with the Management team to maximize the revenue of the organization • Use emails, phone calls, social media, and other channels to reach out to analytics decision-makers and generate interest • Evolve strategic thinking to introduce new/innovative approaches in acquisition of new clients. • Prepare high quality business proposals, elevator pitches and presentations whenever required to boost the sales cycle. • Experience and Knowledge on web / mobile app developments would be preferable as this role would involve engaging with clients of different level through technical solutions.

Do not hesitate any longer and join the OVHcloud adventure!

description: You will report to the Business Development Director and it will be your primary function to build and lead a sales team to sell products within the chosen division whilst maximizing the company’s sales opportunities for all products within your portfolio. You will also be directly responsible for the company’s revenue within your assigned region. The ideal candidate must be ambitious and career-driven as this is an ideal opportunity for an experienced Sales Manager to develop their career within a fast-paced and rapidly growing application development company that places a strong emphasis on professional development. Here is the basic role and responsibilities; Have full responsibility for overall performance in one of the assigned countries (Vietnam, Singapore, Indonesia, Thailand, Abu Dhabi, or Malta) regarding sales Build and manage a team of sales professionals Implement both short-term and long-term market development strategy Identify business expansion opportunities, analyze market potential, and target new business of the highest value Establish sales objectives and project expected sales volume and profit within the managed territory Maintain sales volume and adjust selling activities in line with the market situation Build effective networks across business areas

The Qualtrics XM Platform™ is a system of action that helps businesses to attract customers who stay longer and buy more, to engage and empower employees to do the best work of their lives, to develop breakthrough products people love, and to build a brand people can’t imagine living without.  Joining Qualtrics means becoming part of a team bold enough to chase breakthrough experiences - like building a technology that will be a force for good. A team committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion because of a conviction that every voice holds value, with a vision for representation that matches the world around us and inclusion that far exceeds it. You could belong to a team whose values center on transparency, being all in, having customer obsession, acting as one team, and operating with scrappiness. All so you can do the best work of your career.  We believe every interaction is an opportunity. Are we yours?  Global Strategic Sales  Mission Of The Team  Qualtrics Experience Management Platform™ is used by the world’s most iconic brands to optimise their employee (EX), customer (CX), brand (BX) and product experiences (PX).  Our mission is to drive the holistic adoption and standardisation of the Experience Management (XM) platform across the largest and most strategic brands in the world. We are laser focused on standardising the next set of major flagship brands on XM. We take a full portfolio view and work across the different product pillars CX, EX, BX and PX.  Job Description  You will be a key member of a focused global team which reports directly into the Chief Revenue Officer and represents the highest level of strategic sales. We operate against a list of our most strategic accounts that represent the future XM flagship customers and work tightly with regional Enterprise Sales Leaders and local AEs. You will drive the full portfolio of XM and standardisation for the firm, develop multi-year account plans and pursue the deployment of our entire product portfolio, not just single product sales. You will be deep in sales execution and sales strategy which includes: developing relationships, negotiating global framework agreements, connecting stakeholders to flagship XM firms, engaging with partners in the right place and right time, and championing C-Level events. You will orchestrate the full-suite of Qualtrics supporting resources for the right plays at the right time, across Marketing/ABM, Solution Strategy, XM Scientists, Program Architects, PSPs, Tech Sales, pricing strategy, SAP and direct line sales management.  Success is creating some of the largest customers of Qualtrics and driving mobilisation across the full XM portfolio -- all XM applications and use cases.  Expectations For Success Achieve and exceed ‘new bookings’ revenue targets across a named account list of Qualtrics’ most strategic customers and the full XM portfolio Lead, inspire and create vision for customers and those around you. In other words, be a beacon and shape and demonstrate the art of the possible Develop multi-year success plans and orchestrate ecosystem to win as many XM use cases as possible and develop a sustainable customer relationship Build champions and rally executives around XM and associated business value Create and leverage best practices for selling enterprise-wide executive adoption of XM Navigate and overcome obstacles and challenges in the way of winning. Effectively navigate Qualtrics as a nuanced, fast-growing organisation Build strong relationships with local sales reps, leaders, customers, and other internal orgs supporting your success In sum, this role is focused on creating Qualtrics’s next set of flagship full XM portfolio customers and ELA’s  Qualifications & Requirements 10-15 years of extensive and relevant market experience, selling into front-office as well as back-office functions Demonstrated track record of meeting and exceeding quotas and developing global accounts with decentralised, regional budgets, where aligning both the customer as well as internal teams is a key success criteria Motivator and leader with a passion for the Qualtrics mission and for developing new approaches to nuanced challenges - easily move others to action by planning, inspiring, and organising Proven ability to execute and implement change - a scrappy self-starter. Ideally, experience in the space of Customer Experience, Employee Experience and/or related product suites (e.g. Experience Cloud, Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud, HCM, VoC, BI) Experience interacting with clients in pre-sales capacity, industry capacity and/or consultant (internal or external consultant) Deep understanding of Qualtrics product portfolio and the competitive landscape Has a good balance of risk taking and judgment Is confident and able to operate independently of a large staff Commands the respect of teams that they work alongside Exceptional presentation skills Willingness and ability to travel between 25-60% Preview YouTube video What is Qualtrics? | The world’s first Experience Management Platform  What is Qualtrics? | The world’s first Experience Management Platform  Preview YouTube video Work at Qualtrics!  Work at Qualtrics!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: The Role: With continuous field training, you will be assisting our Business Development team with campaigns to identify potential clients throughout Asia Pacific by reviewing their current market data strategy and trading solutions, and discussing how the features involved with our solutions could help improve their performance. You will also develop your domain and product knowledge with specific assignments with our Client Services team, supporting the maintenance of existing accounts.  The Impact: You will be helping in targeted campaigns planning to engage with prospects and existing clients to cover QuantHouse Solutions products and solutions. This will be done by working with marketing channels to help create targeted campaigns, both virtual and physical, and doing the follow-up.  You will also take advantage of incoming leads and be responsible for building on them and transforming them into qualified projects for the team or filing them for future efforts when you come too early in the project process. Identifying decision makers, maintaining and expanding the database of prospects and building standard quotations will also be part of your duties.  The Career Opportunity: The natural career path will be to grow into Sales, Pre-Sales and Project Management roles among others within the group.  The Skills: We want to hear from candidates who are highly articulate and able to demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills and are competent in excelling over the phone in a consultative environment. Looking for a challenging role, candidates must also be target-driven, highly motivated and excited about developing relationships over the phone and on the field. A concurrent interest and appetite to learn the technical aspects of capital markets technologies and market data systems is essential, with the capacity to handle level 2 support for our client within the first year an evidence of success.   Key Responsibilities will include but not limited to:  Prospecting and qualifying campaign related or inbound leads through calling and emailing campaigns Researching new prospective clients and carrying out proprietary email campaigns Creating and releasing targeted messaging through various media Calling “suspect” and prospective clients Maintaining and updating the corporate CRM Coordination of ongoing sales opportunities created by the Inside Sales Assisting in client support issues involving business analysis/market data analysis Maintaining client reports and providing a view on open activities as well as raising any potential issues for escalation in a timely manner Continuously growing technical product knowledge and understanding of global financial markets   Skills & Qualification:  Previous experience in the financial IT services industry is preferred. Previous experience in client services B2B or B2C is preferred Previous experience in trading solutions/support/operations would be advantageous. An undergraduate degree or equivalent is required; all degree subjects will be considered though Commerce, Business Administration, Marketing, Business Management or related degree will be a plus.  Highly autonomous, extremely organized and professional with superior written, verbal and non-verbal communications skills, you will ideally have previous experience with a CRM tool. This person will be focusing on the APAC market and Mandarin is required whilst Cantonese, Japanese or Korean would be a plus given our clients coverage in these areas.  About QuantHouse  QuantHouse provides end-to-end systematic trading solutions including ultra-low latency market data, algo trading development frameworks, proximity hosting and order routing to hedge funds, market makers, proprietary desks, brokers and sell-side firms. Related link: https://www.quanthouse.com  The firm is a wholly owned company of Iress. A market leading technology and software provider for financial markets and services listed on the ASX. Related link: https://www.iress.com

description: Overview  To perform well in this role, we are looking for an individual with a proven track record in identifying and generating new business leads through various social platforms. You must also be confident in articulating technical concepts and solutions to various leads, in particular, executive level decision makers.  This role covers both outbound and inbound responsibilities, with a larger emphasis on generating outbound leads.  What You'll Do  Outbound Creating highly qualified opportunities for Account Executives within their Targeted accounts Outbound calling to prospective customers Analysing customer needs in terms of current business obstacles, identifying projects and scoping potential TIBCO solutions. Effectively communicating TIBCO’s solutions Overcoming objections and scheduling meetings with field sales and prospects Responsible to achieve a high level of collaboration with Marketing and Sales teams by developing and delivering against the strategy agreed with the field representatives and regional VP. Actively problem solving during the duration of the campaign to ensure results are met by the end of the campaign Inbound Creating highly qualified opportunities for Account Executives within their Targeted accounts Outbound calling to prospective customers Analysing customer needs in terms of current business obstacles, identifying projects and scoping potential TIBCO solutions. Effectively communicating TIBCO’s solutions Overcoming objections and scheduling meetings with field sales and prospects Responsible to achieve a high level of collaboration with Marketing and Sales teams by developing and delivering against the strategy agreed with the field representatives and regional VP. Actively problem solving during the duration of the campaign to ensure results are met by the end of the campaign Who You Are Fluency in written and verbal English is prerequisite for you to perform well in this role. Any additional proficiency in SEA languages (Thai / Vietnamese / Bahasa / Korean) will give you an edge in your application. Proven track record in identifying business and generating new business leads via the Internet, Telephone or Social media (LinkedIn and other platforms) Strong business development experience, with the ability to present technical concepts and business solutions clearly through conversations and written communications Experience in calling into C-level Executives at Enterprise size organizations along with the ability to work to and overachieve on targets. A strong interest in technology, passion for sales and strong communication skills. Understanding of the use and application of IT systems in a Business environment Objection handling expertise Knowledge of TIBCO’s products or previous experience in the IT industry is a bonus How You’ll Be Rewarded Focus on YOU - Health and Wellbeing : Employee Assistance Programme and an employer-funded Private Medical Insurance plan. You can also benefit from dental insurance, health assessments, and a truly holistic approach to flexible working options. Focus on FINANCES - Financial Future : We understand your financial future is key. That’s why you’ll have access to an exceptionally competitive pension scheme, a bonus incentive plan, automatic enrolment in an income protection plan, as well as a death and disability insurances to provide you with that financial peace-of-mind. Focus on PROGRESSION - Learn and Advance : Develop your skills with best-in-class on-line and in-person learning and development tools. Take advantage of TIBCO’s Career Mapping to enhance and develop your skills to take your career in the direction you choose. Participate in our ‘Elevate Live’ weekly enablement sessions, and for our Sales professionals - attend our Elevate Academy. Focus on COMMUNITY - Collaboration and Inclusion : Team up with our Culture Captains and help us continue to build #TIBCOSpirit. Daily we all strive to create a truly diverse, inclusive and collaborative community where we seek out inspiration, innovation and genuine WOW moments. From inspiring key-note speakers, to mental health awareness, to culture recognition days, we offer you a truly diverse environment where your voice matters. Focus on CUSTOMERS - Make a difference : Take a look at our many customer success stories: https://www.tibco.com/customers The Fine Print  Please note you must have full working rights for the country you are applying for. If on a work permit or visa please make sure the details along with expiry date are included on your application. Applications and CVs must be in English.  TIBCO is an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.  Important: Please note that we have updated our Candidate Data Privacy policy and can be found here: https://www.tibco.com/careers/candidate-privacy  #MSL

description: Senior Sales Development Representative – One of the hottest Cybersecurity start-ups on the globe - $110,000 OTE – Singapore  Henderson Scott are currently recruiting for one of the hottest cybersecurity start-ups on the planet. This organisation has had an incredible amount of funding already and are already classified as a ‘cybersecurity unicorn’. They are still pre-IPO (and you would get shares in the business) – and as part of their universal scale-up, they are really investing in APAC  We are growing their Singapore sales function and looking for their second SDR across this region. This organisation are in one of the fastest-growing verticals of cyber-security, and they are complete market-leaders in it. They have limited competition in the APAC region, so there’s a strong chance that you can come in and absolutely smash your targets!  Key Information We are looking for this person to have experience working in Sales Development, having previously worked in a SDR or BDR position Experience working for SaaS, security, or software vendors Strong cold-calling experience Tenacious and enthusiastic sales attitude Experienced booking in meetings, liaising with Account Executives and customers Ability to manage sales pipelines  As you can tell, this is a long way from your average SDR position, this is with an absolute market-leader in one of the quickest growing areas of security. The stock you would receive from joining this vendor could be life-changing  For the initial conversation, apply today!

description: Business Chain: Dura-Line Position Title: Regional Sales Manager Reports to: Commercial Director, Emerging Markets East Location: Singapore. Penetration into new business opportunities in the South East Asia Region  As this is a newly created role, we are looking for an individual who has the mindset of an entrepreneur, understand the culture and have the experience in doing sales in the South East Asia Region.  MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES  The Regional Sales Manager position will be responsible for developing, growing and managing a team of direct and indirect reports including Account Managers across SEA.  The position will be accountable for an annual booking/revenue quota / budget, with significant growth in subsequent years. This management position is responsible for driving overall growth in regional market, she/he will have overall sales leadership responsibilities for the business in both across segments / industries.  The key performance traits for this role include • Local market knowledge across SEA. • Go to Market Sales Model - Leading /coaching teams through transformation with Account Planning/Opportunity Identification, Business Relevant / Customer Value Selling and Business Disciplines. • Financial Performance - Exceeding booking goals (by geography, solutions and vertical), managing Opex goal, profitability, and maintaining forecast accuracy; providing in depth knowledge into numbers (customer insights, macro/micro trends, consumption models) • Team Development - Attracting, developing and retaining high performance Account Team talent (career development, coaching, performance management and hiring). • Building a Winning Capability and Leading Change - Strategically leading and influencing his own team along with an integrated cross-functional team, Services, Operation, Partners, Marketing, and others.  Desired Skills  This Regional Sales Manager, SEA is expected to strategically drive the organization’s end-to-end vision for our customers, as well as maintain an in-depth understanding of competitive conditions, industry practices, market opportunities, and customer requirements. This key leadership role will develop the sales delivery model through coaching and motivating the talented sales organization. Setting a vision and building strategic business decision-making capability to the next level will be a major success factor for this position.  This person will motivate, inspire, and continually develop his/her teams and channel partners while taking on new competitors as the organization continues to gain market share outside its core business. He/her will need a strong background in executive-level communication with experience building customer and partner relationships, and territory planning and segmentation. This person ought to possess both the sales skills and technical knowledge to make presentations and lead customer discussions to advance the sales process. This role involves positioning and promoting the partner value proposition, leading sales specialists in the development and expansion of opportunities, and reinforcing existing relationships.

description: A Bit About Whispir  Whispir is a cloud software and communications platform that seeks to help organisations communicate like people. Our platform enables our customers to build powerful communications workflows and automate interactions between systems, business, devices and people - with no coding required.  The outcomes are powerful – people everywhere can have access to the right information at the right time so that they can make informed decisions, take action, engage and communicate with each other.  Organisations can finally start to behave how they have always wanted to – they can engage with people the way people do... in a timely, personal and contextually sensitive way with actionable, useful insights that promote richer and deeper engagement.  We know this because leading organisations use Whispir's technology locally and globally every day for this reason. Whispir becomes their competitive advantage as they streamline their operations, improve their resilience and bring innovative new services to market quickly. We also see first-hand the capacity of these innovative solutions to assist saving lives and materially improve community outcomes.  Role Description:  As an outbound Sales Development Representative, you will be a key part of our sales and growth efforts. You will work closely with our existing Sales Development Representative and our team of Account Executives. You will be reaching out to decision makers and influencers in midsize companies across a range of different industries, providing engaging content and insights that explain why Whispir can help their company/organization. You will have a suite of tools at your disposal including Outreach, Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other lead mining and research tools. You will have the support of the sales and marketing team to train and equip you with the knowledge you need to do your job. Success will come from being a great listener, highly organized with plenty of energy and enthusiasm for hitting your personal goals and being accountable for helping your team win.  Main Responsibilities: Outbound emailing (high volume, supported by specialized software tools) Outbound prospecting calls, using Outreach (40 - 50 per day, supported by software) Fast and proficient research via social media and google Salesforce lead and list management Efficient use of sales enablement software (Outreach) Lead and activity management and tracking Maintaining a high volume of activities Responsibility for your daily and weekly reporting  Key skills/Attributes required: 1-3 years sales experience Hunter mentality Great listening skills and ability to quickly become a trusted resource for decision-makers Strong communication and objection handling skills  Why we think you will love working at Whispir: Uncapped commission Leadership Training - Grow your career with Whispir and take advantage of our future leadership training program with specialised training. Engage Humanity - Take advantage of our Engage Humanity program and give back to our community with a day of leave available provided. In-House Barista and Concierge - Meet colleagues at the Whispir Social Club for a morning coffee or an evening beverage hosted by our in-house concierge. Health and Wellbeing - Expand your personal mental and health with our dedicated personal training and employee assistance program.  You are encouraged to discuss with your direct manager any systems or solutions you deem useful for performing your duties and managing your obligations with respect to the scope of this position description.  Please note that this position description is not intended to constitute a complete list of your duties. You may be required to carry out other duties consistent with the position. Further, the Company may also, from time to time and at its discretion, change your duties in any reasonable manner after consultation with you.  Diversity & Inclusion  Whispir places a high value on inclusion. Those from under represented communities are encouraged to apply. This includes, but is definitely not limited to, people with a lived-experience of mental ill health, culturally and linguistically diverse people, LGBTQIA+ people, and people with disabilities.  We take our core values seriously and work hard to create an environment where you feel welcomed. Teams who reflect a diversity of experience, identity, perspective, and background help us to create a healthy & inclusive working culture  If this has resonated with you, we look forward to hearing from you soon!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.  Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.  To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.  Are you a passionate and enthusiastic Account Manager with a wealth of experience managing customers in the SaaS industry? Are you looking for your next challenge in an emerging and exciting market? Do you have experience working with customers across Asia? If yes then we want to hear from you!  The impact you will have:  You will join our global Commercial team, and champion uncovering and developing new commercial opportunities within our base of existing customers. As an Account Manager, you will be responsible for managing a nominated list of customers, based in the Asia Pacific region, specifically Japan, Singapore, Hong Kong, the Philippines etc. Your focus will be to drive profitable annual contract revenue contribution and increased market share from the Elliptic solution and service portfolio.  Working in partnership with the Customer Success team, you will manage the upsell sales cycle including identifying opportunities, qualifying, negotiating terms, developing custom proposals and closing upsells and renewals to ultimately deliver profitable revenue growth and >100% net account retention for those named accounts.  This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual looking for a role where you can make an impact not just on the company you work for but also on the market you work in. Fascinating and challenging work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!  What you’ll do: Develop net new business through upsell and cross sell opportunities within existing accounts in Asia Pacific Contribute to or build strategic customer account plans, and manage the commercial cycle in partnership with the Customer Success team Prospect and generate high quality leads in existing accounts Convert customer needs and challenges into qualified opportunities leading to upsells and account growth Develop custom proposals based on customer requirements Conduct presentations and product demos Negotiate terms and close the business Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quotas for your region and target customers  You will be a great fit here if you: Have experience in Account Management and can successfully deliver an upsell target across target accounts Have experience in working with a broad set of customers across the Asia Pacific region, and can easily adapt to cultural differences Can understand the customer’s business model, and how digital assets fit into their strategy Have the ability to analyse customer usage and engagement data to identify trends and opportunities for additional services Can manage difficult client relationships, such as churn or downesell conversation, and obtain the best outcome for both the company and our customers. Can evaluate customer needs and preferences in relation to pricing, product terms and conditions to ensure that client requirements are addressed in commercial proposals Have a collaborative mindset, and experience working with a larger account team, including Customer Success. Address problems immediately and can work across functions to solve problems Enjoy working with pace and energy, building team spirit and cultivating unity and commitment among the team Have an understanding of complex B2B sales methodologies Are flexible, adaptable and comfortable with changing priorities  Requirements  Our ideal candidate has: Extensive experience in customer facing roles Account Management experience selling SaaS solutions Experience working with customers distributed across multiple countries Strong relationship building skills, with track record of retention and generating net new business Demonstrated track record of success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer at your last company A collaborative mindset, and the ability to share the spotlight A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur’s mindset. You’re comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient Interest and curiosity about digital assets and the crypto economy  Bonus Points for: Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments Experience selling SaaS solutions to Financial Services Borderline obsession with emerging technology Additional language: Mandarin, Japanese  Benefits Competitive salary Share Options Holiday - 24 days of annual leave in addition to Singapore gazetted holidays Health insurance Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription Laptop + equipment you need Home office allowance Full access to Spill Mental Health Support  We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: Company Description  Writing the future. Together.  Avaloq is a value driven, fast-paced financial technology and services company and we are committed to developing the banking solutions of tomorrow.  By joining Avaloq, you’ll become a key part of our effort to power the digital transformation of the financial services industry. Our ambition is big and bold – to provide full end-to-end digital solutions by combining our leading efficiency with a flexible, responsible digital user experience. Headquartered in Zurich, Avaloq has over 2,000 employees globally. More information is available at www.avaloq.com.  Job Description  Your Team  You will be part of a commercial team managing client relationships and new business developments activities globally.  Your Mission  You will be responsible to manage and further develop the business in APAC of one of our largest and key strategic customers, a leading global financial institution having outsourced key business processes and IT operations to Avaloq.  Your role will be to manage and coordinate all commercial and contractual aspects between Avaloq and the customer. This includes mastering the upselling process for products and services, ensuring compliance with the various contracts, overseeing financials, acting as an escalation point for all matters relating to the delivered services and ensuring highest client satisfaction.  Other Responsibilities Include Build and maintain effective long-term relationships with key stakeholders of this highly complex account to ensure a high level of satisfaction, profitable account and increasing revenues by upselling activities Build up in-depth knowledge of the customer’s business, build up and maintain a network within the customer on various levels (IT, Business, team-leader, management leads, upper Management). Identify the major decision-makers and maintain relationship Coordinate inside Avaloq the different functions serving the customer like service management, banking operations, project delivery, product sales, application management services or IT infrastructure to ensure an aligned approach to customer topics/issues/requests and address inefficiencies or failures in service delivery in tight collaboration with service management Ensure consistent communication to each of the client stakeholders as first point of contact and serve as escalation point and primary interface for all products and services Manage commercial discussions, handle contract negotiations and billing/ invoicing control Ensure projects follow-up with the client Increase actively the share of wallet by promoting Avaloq products and services (offers preparation) and identifying opportunities, promoting and proposing new products or services to the existing clients Ensure opportunity management and customer account plans are updated regularly in Avaloq’s CRM Qualifications  What You Need At least 5-6 years of relevant sales experience in financial institutions Have been a client partner or customer success role in a services or consulting business Prior experience in managing and selling banking software packages Bachelor's/Masters’ from a recognized institute, preferably specializing in Business / Banking / Computer Science related disciplines Strong in creating trustworthy long-term relationships with demanding stakeholders in situations of conflicting interests Savvy in networking Exceptional problem-solving skills Experience in several banking domains Ability to maximize customer value and embrace intrapreneurship Strong in communication, presentation and conflict management skills Capable in generating trust and manage resources effectively Process competence and adherence Prior work experience in South East Asia markets You will get extra points for the following Knowledge and experience in the wealth management industry Experience in selling large IT and business outsourcing / operations engagements Additional Information  Now let's talk about perks and compensation  We offer high flexibility in regards to working models (e.g. part time and home office models are possible depending on business requirements). Our base salaries are competitive and if you prove to be a superstar, you might even be entitled to an extraordinary achievement reward. Avaloq aims to share its success with all its employees by paying out “Success Share Units” depending on its performance in a given year.  At Avaloq we embrace diversity, we embrace difference. We are whole-heartedly committed to equal employment opportunities and we foster an inclusive culture where everyone’s' contributions are valued and their voices are listened to. We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other fascinating characteristics that make us different. Please note that our job descriptions are intended to be written in an inclusive and gender neutral language.  Don’t be shy – apply!  Please only apply online, preferably with pdf documents.  Note to Agencies: All unsolicited résumés will be considered direct applicants and no referral fee will be acknowledged.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Internet, and Banking

description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 8 years of experience in software sales, channel management/sales and strategic account management at an enterprise B2B software company. Experience with managing sales or channel teams.  Preferred qualifications: 7 years of experience in channel management or selling Infrastructure Software, Databases, Analytic Tools, or Applications Software with a experience exceeding business goals. Experience working with partners in complex implementation projects. Demonstrated success with complex commercial and legal negotiations working with procurement, legal, and business teams in enterprises. Experience leading cross-functional teams within the organization and partner organization. Ability to work with pre-sales and customers’ technical leads to inventory existing software estate, define migration plans, and build business cases for migrations. Ability to leverage C-level relationships with executives to sell cloud solutions.  About The Job  The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are engineered for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.  As a Channel Territory Manager (CTM), your primary responsibility is to grow Google Cloud’s market share across the identified set of accounts through partners. You will build executive-level relationships, align our cloud offerings and partners’ value proposition to your customers’ needs. You’ll be excellent at prospecting, qualifying, and leading a cross-functional team, while leveraging the right resources including partner engineering, corporate sales, and partner sales to maximize outcomes.  Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.  Responsibilities  Align to the identified corporate accounts within a defined territory and drive business growth in those accounts through a set of suitable partners on various engagements Lead account planning process that aligns partner and Google resources to maximize growth, customer satisfaction, and market share Drive consistent business growth by managing business cycles (including prospecting, qualifying, forecasting, and managing a book of business) in the identified accounts through partners Discuss and manage complex business cycles, often presenting to C-level executives in the identified accounts. Ensure identified accounts attain business growth goals by aligning, managing and holding partners accountable in engagements; be responsible for managing partners' success and increase Google Cloud Platform (GCP) consumption in partner-led customer engagements  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

description: Company Profile  Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services firm providing a wide range of investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. The Firm’s employees serve clients worldwide including corporations, governments and individuals from more than 1,200 offices in 43 countries.  As a market leader, the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together, we share a common set of values rooted in integrity, excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career – a place for people to learn, to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles, perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture.  Department Profile  Morgan Stanley Investment Management (MSIM), together with its investment advisory affiliates, has over $1.4 trillion in assets under management or supervision. With over 40 years of global investment experience, MSIM strives to provide outstanding long-term investment performance, service and a comprehensive suite of investment management solutions to a diverse client base, which includes governments, institutions, corporations and individuals worldwide. MSIM offers its clients the personalized attention and service of a boutique, the intelligence and creativity of some of the brightest professionals in the industry and the global resources of Morgan Stanley. We show unwavering commitment to investment excellence, diversity of perspective, and differentiated values. We have distinctive and highly complementary strengths in investment management and distribution.  Team Profile  The Client Relationship Management (CRM) team is positioned within the distribution (sales and marketing) division and has a global presence with individuals based in New York, Boston, London, Dublin, Singapore, Beijing, Melbourne and Mumbai. The CRM function is central to MSIM’s client service model and acts as a conduit between our clients and MSIM’s internal functional areas. We partner closely with colleagues in the investment and sales teams to ensure seamless, quality of service to our clients and provide governance and oversight for the implementation of all client requirements and related controls, including the onboarding of new accounts.  The position is Singapore based and would be focused on servicing clients in Asia ex-Japan, primarily in China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Korea, Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand, reporting to the senior client account manager in the region who is also Singapore based.  Key Area Of Responsibly Include All aspects of servicing of client relationships including due diligence meetings, portfolio review meetings and handling daily questions and queries. Ownership for driving global best practice across the client service organization. Ownership for client matters ensuring effective cross-functional coordination, enhancing execution and problem resolution. Facilitate client AML and KYC reviews, working closely with internal compliance and GFC teams. Responsible for facilitation of client events, such as take-on and termination. This requires close cooperation with all the relevant teams including investments, legal, compliance and the transitions team within operations. Ownership to ensure that any regulatory changes impacting the service model and requirements of clients are known and assessed in advance. Required Skills Good understanding of the asset management industry Ability to communicate with clients in Mandarin (traditional and simplified) Strong experience in managing separately managed and intermediary client relationships Strong understanding of equity, fixed income, alternative investments and private equity Good understanding of Investment Management functions like Operations, Legal, Compliance, Risk management and other related functions Strong attention to detail Strong negotiating and influencing skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Strong ability to interact with clients and individuals within the business at all levels and across different time zones/regions/cultures Experienced in presentation Ability to prioritize and work under pressure A track record of delivering innovative business solutions to clients’ needs. Clear understanding of the local and regulatory environment and ability to apply this to individual client situations and relationships Posting Date  Sep 7, 2021  Primary Location  Non-Japan Asia-Singapore-Singapore-Singapore  Job  Sales & Marketing  Employment Type  Full Time  Job Level  Associate
industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Investment Management

description: Regional Head of Sales – Middle East (based in Singapore)  A leading global player in online payments, seeks an experienced, driven, and ambitious sales leader to oversee their team focused on the Middle East market.  You will be responsible for building and managing a team, and growing the business - identifying and developing new business opportunities, and negotiating agreements with key external stakeholders , merchants, and business partners. You will be expert in the Middle East region and be able to draw upon and demonstrate a proven track record of revenue growth through direct sales and capturing market / growth opportunities. You will be work cross-functionally with other senior stakeholders and leaders in the organization and take a leading role in building strategic relationships with key leaders in merchant organizations and partners at the C-level and driving pipeline activity in the region for both sales and market development. The business and e-commerce landscape across the Middle East is experiencing hypergrowth, and the role presents an opportunity to drive growth in the region.  Responsibilities: Define and implement the business strategy to drive and maximize growth for the Middle East market and establish the firm as the leading PSP in the cross-border payment space. Identify new business growth opportunities and clearly articulate the benefits which can be driven. Take responsibility for the overall P&L of the business including establishing business and revenue goals and strategies. Build a high-performance sales team capable of delivering and exceeding targets.  Manage the sales pipeline and drive discipline around prospecting and onboarding new customers, as well as relationship -based growth of existing portfolio.  Drive “operational excellence” by leveraging regional infrastructure to maximize efficiency and synergy of the organizations. Represent the company both internally and externally to communicate key business objectives, build partnerships and seek resources. Partner with all affiliates to cross/up-sell user for merchandise as well as payment volume.  Qualifications & Experience: An experienced “Hunter” with a proven track record of commercial success, both individually and as the developer and leader of teams. Direct sales focus from working for Payment Gateways, Wallets, or Merchant Acquiring in Banks/ Financial Services. Experience of growing Sales teams within a start-up / scale-up business is advantageous. You should not have sold through partners or channels, rather you will be able to demonstrate a history of closing deals with merchants directly. Appropriate industry knowledge of payments and eCommerce. People leadership experience leading and building high-performance sales teams Must have an excellent command of both verbal and written English. Proficiency of one of the commonly used languages in the region is highly desirable, but not necessary.  Interested?         Please contact me to talk in strictest confidence - Andrew Cook | +44 (0) 7801 953 663 | andrew.cook@head-count.com

description: Job Description  This is a commissioned Regional Sales position covering the APJ Client business with one of Intel's leading OEM accounts.  As the Regional Client Sales Development Manager (SDM) for APJ, responsibilities include driving outbound sales engagements, consumption and sell through activities across the OEM's Consumer and Commercial Client businesses, and Driving joint sales motions with Intel fellow travelers.  A strong knowledge of the regional PC ecosystem, market dynamics, competitive challenges and demand drivers will be a definite plus for this role.  Other Key Responsibilities Include Driving Consumption volume growth across Commercial and Consumer Client businesses Developing new and creative sales and marketing programs and strategies to drive accelerated growth Coordination with business operations to accurately track business and evaluate ROI on investments Work closely with Intel Country Sales Teams and Intel BU Sales organizations to drive cooperative selling preference and engagements with the OEM customer Drive customer awareness and adoption of differentiated Intel technologies like vPro Collaborate with cross-geo teams to support and scale sales engagement programs globally Drive regular business and strategy interlock sessions with OEM customer leadership Analyze market data, industry trends and make investment decisions accordingly Gain strong understanding of Intel Client roadmap, new technologies and offerings A Successful Candidate Would Require Ability to separate tactical and strategic goals, but drive both concurrently Strong executive presence, an ability to build and develop relationships with the Customer and Intel leaders across the region Being highly motivated, entrepreneurial, self-starting and a quick-learner Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to influence key stakeholders at multiple levels on product and GTM strategies Capable of working across multiple geographies and time zones Excellent time management and organizational skills to prioritize tasks in a fast paced, dynamic and broad operating environment Qualifications Track record of driving successful sales results ideally managing large strategic customers 10 years of work experience with at least 5 years of sales and marketing being preferred Bachelors in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, MBA, or related disciplines would be a plus 3 years of previous experience in the PC/Client ecosystem Located in Singapore, with flexibility and willingness to travel frequently when permitted as per local Covid guidelines Inside this Business Group  Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.
