description: Careers That Change Lives  As a global leader in medical technology, services and solutions, Medtronic improves the health and lives of millions of people each year. We believe our deep clinical, therapeutic and economic expertise can help address the complex challenges – such as rising costs, aging populations and the burden of chronic disease – faced by families and healthcare systems today. But we can’t do it alone. That’s why we’re committed to partnering in new ways and developing powerful solutions that deliver better patient outcomes.  Founded in 1949 as a medical repair company, we're now among the world's largest medical technology, services and solutions companies, employing more than 85,000 people worldwide, serving physicians, hospitals and patients in more than 160 countries. Join us in our commitment to take healthcare Further, Together.  A Day in the Life  Sales Operation Supervisor Manage overall Singapore commercial operations from order to cash effectively and successful. Enhance the operational procedure, systems and principles in the areas of information flow and management, business processes. Enhanced management reporting and looks for opportunities to expand systems Carry out supervisory responsibilities to the sales & operation team Organizing the budget of the Singapore businesses in collaboration with the Sales & Marketing directors Responsibilities: Enhances administrative support to the sales function such as preparing sales and/or expense forecasts, budgets and quotas; coordinating sales meetings; etc. Conducts statistical analysis on sales data and information to ensure optimal sales execution and attainment of growth objectives. Improve consignment management & field cycle count accountability Track & improve demo & loaner deployment efficiency Communicate customer issues with operations team and devise ways of improving the customer experience, including resolving problems and complaints Work closely with commercial leadership team to set and/or implement policies, procedures and systems and to follow through with implementation. Communicate all operating policies and/or issues at department meetings Improving billing process and visibility Work closely with the inventory manager and team to perform analysis of our inventory and ensure we are utilizing our inventory effectively Must Have: Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree required Minimum of 1 year of relevant experience Nice to Have Bachelor’s Degree in business/marketing discipline 8 - 10 year sales & marketing experience with people management Postgraduate business qualifications will be highly regarded Some overseas travel may be required. Some out of hours work will be required. About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. For Office Roles: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile. The employee is also required to interact with a computer, and communicate with peers and co-workers. Contact your manager or local HR to understand the Work Conditions and Physical requirements that may be specific to each role. (ADA-United States of America)  Additional Information Posting Date: Sep 23, 2021 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: At Razer, you will be at the forefront of the most exciting industry in the world—video games, undertaking the greatest mission of all: bringing gamers closer to the games they love. With fifteen offices and three R&D labs worldwide, you will be part of a global team that transcends time zones and geographical boundaries. You get to enjoy working in an environment that values transparency and collaborative effort. Most importantly, both work and play are equally important to us.   The ideal candidate is experienced with business planning globally across various verticals and sales channels to manage pricing, lifecycles, promotional calendars in the technology or consumer electronics industry. We are looking for someone who is resourceful, adaptable, team-oriented and the ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines. Responsibilities Manage financial analysis, pricing and promotional calendar to ensure that we increase our leadership and market share position Conduct and run competitive benchmarking and product price comparison Work with the Head of Sales & Marketing to ensure regional sales teams are guided in terms of product knowledge, pricing and promotional planning Drive product lifecycle planning for peripherals Responsible for developing and maintaining tools to track, measure and share sales data on Razer and competitive offerings Manage the internal pricing approval system  Requirements Degree in Business / Marketing with 5 years of product marketing or business analyst experience with consumer / lifestyle products Proven business planning background with excellent understanding of sales channel management Good analytical and high adaptability skills Excellent interpersonal, communication, and time management skills Possess strong people skills, with the ability to work with the regional Sales & Marketing Teams to bring about increased sales to the market  Be part of a phenomenal team today!

description: WHO WE ARE:  We believe the best ideas come from the collaboration of happy, talented people. That’s why we seek to promote a truly inspiring work environment and create a space where people can grow, learn new skills, be creative, work independently and make decisions that shape the future of the company.  is the leading Promotion Engine for e-businesses. Our B2B product helps companies automate, manage, and optimize promotional marketing campaigns for their end-users. The beauty of the software is that it empowers the whole team to create and maintain promotions, and also allows you to choose the best application for your business model.  Developers get a powerful promotion toolkit and infrastructure to set up incredibly sophisticated campaigns in minutes rather than weeks. Marketers can create, automate, and manage discounts, coupons, loyalty, and referral programs without taking developers away from the company’s core product. Customer Success and Sales teams can offer any type of incentive or appeasement instantly to customers, improving satisfaction, and reducing churn. ABOUT THE ROLE:  As a sales development representative, you are responsible for identifying and creating new qualified sales opportunities for the sales team. You will work closely with our marketing team and the account executives and interact with potential customers through calls and email to identify pain points and schedule meetings with our account executives. You should have excellent communication skills and demonstrate the ability to meet deadlines and achieve sales targets.  Tasks  ONCE YOU ARE HERE YOU WILL: Identify and research potential target customers and company profiles Manage various prospecting channels to target and gain the interest of potential customers Provide research within targeted accounts to identify contacts, important account information, and relevant promotional use cases prior to contact approaches Get decision-makers at target companies excited to get on a demo call with , mostly through sending outbound email campaigns to prospects Analyze the results of the outbound campaigns and provide actionable insights Set up qualified demos for our account executives Manage lead status, data integrity, and accuracy in Salesforce Analyze and manage the sales funnel Handle inbound inquiries for the sales team and qualify prospects’ business goals through cold-calls and emails to determine if can be a strategic investment for their business’ growth Learn and express good knowledge of our product and its relation to the customers’ marketing stack and technical setup Requirements  WHAT WE NEED YOU TO BRING TO THE TABLE: Previous (SaaS) sales experience in which you demonstrated the ability to meet or exceed sales quotas a plus (but not required) Strong ability to take responsibility for successes and failures Strong initiative and creative problem-solving skills Have exceptional consultative selling skills You have strong attention to detail You thrive in an unstructured work environment You can hit the ground running & take ownership from day one Self-motivated with a strong desire to succeed Entrepreneurial mindset with a drive to be strategic as well as hands-on Effective verbal and written communication skills in English (C1 or C2 level, German is a plus) as well as excellent phone and email etiquette Benefits  WHY YOU SHOULD WORK WITH US: The right attitude: modern methods and a diverse, creative workspace with an open and international culture. Everyone for the product: Together we create a flexible, highly scalable product with state-of-the-art technologies. We can only succeed if everyone works as a team. Healthy Growth: Growing our company means growing everyone on the team. We love to share knowledge and learn. A great environment: Flexible and family-friendly environment, bright and easily accessible offices, modern software, and hardware. High flexibility degree: Prefer to work early or late at night? Do you have to pick up your children from kindergarten? Do you prefer working abroad? We believe in results and motivated employees AND THERE IS MORE:  Competitive remuneration package. Budget for ongoing professional development. Financial support to create your comfy, productive home office. Monthly knowledge-sharing sessions. Regular Team events. Work on the world's most powerful and most flexible promotion engine. in times of COVID-19:  Your health and ours are very important to us! In times of COVID-19, we have fully adapted and digitized our application process so we can continue to be there for our applicants. Stay healthy!  Can’t wait to join? Then we’d love to hear from you! To apply, please answer a few quick questions and upload your CV by clicking the button below.  We process the personal data provided by you during the application process solely to decide about your application. The legal basis for this processing activity is Article 6 Paragraph 1 b) of the EU General Data Protection Regulation. The online application tool is provided by Bamboo HR LLC on our behalf. Your data will be processed in the United States. Appropriate safeguards to guarantee compliant data processing are established through Bamboo HR’s certification under the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield. Further information can be found in our Privacy Policy.

description: DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is currently recruiting for a Business Development Manager for the Joint reconstruction and Sports medicine portfolio. DePuy Synthes provides one of the most comprehensive orthopaedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide.  The individual is responsible for overseeing the capital sales and digital surgery solutions portfolio for Joint Reconstruction and Sports Medicine. A key priority of the role is to launch and lead the capital equipment portfolio within Sports medicine, and to equip the sales team with capital-selling capabilities to drive growth. The individual will also lead the digital surgery solutions portfolio for Joint reconstruction in the space of hip and knee surgery, and engage both clinical and non-clinical stakeholders to ensure successful implementation of the solutions in partnership with the sales team.  In addition, the role will be heavily involved in strategic business planning, launching new products and devising solutions to meet healthcare needs of the patients. At this level, the role has increased responsibility including, but not limited to, additional skills, multiple lines/products, diverse teams, etc. This job is eligible for sales incentives/sales commission.  Critical to this role’s success will be the individual’s leadership skills and the ability to communicate and work well with all levels of internal and external partners.  Reporting line  This position reports to Franchise Manager (Joints, Mitek and Extremities), Johnson and Johnson Singapore.  Job Responsibilities  Sports Medicine Capital Sales Launch and lead sports medicine capital equipment portfolio Understand and analyze market dynamics and competition to develop business opportunities Develop effective contracts and financing schemes to grow customer base Participate in national tender negotiations and evaluation placements Lifecycle management of capital equipment including after-sales support Training of team to improve capital selling capabilities and case support Engage external partners including clinicians, procurement bodies and healthcare institutions  Digital Surgery Solutions Lead strategic marketing and drive growth for portfolio Collect competitive insights on product portfolio to recommend and develop marketing programs to adjust product positioning Build and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and non-clinical partners to facilitate buy-in and launch of digital surgery solutions Manage strategic accounts identified with creative solution-selling and market business development Establish and improve relationships at CXO level and build long-term strategic alliances with the portfolio of accounts to continue to add value Subject matter specialist including technical matters Conduct training for healthcare professionals (HCPs) Assists sales team with questions and supports customers requiring additional support Enable and train sales team to ensure uptake of solutions Hold stretched sales targets for portfolio  Qualifications University/Bachelor’s Degree or Equivalent in Engineering or Business At least 8 years of selling and/or marketing experience in the medical devices industry with consistent track record, preferably in Orthopaedics. Strong understanding of the Singapore capital healthcare market and buying groups Excellent presentation, negotiation and closing skills Strong relationship-building skills Outstanding influencing, interpersonal and networking skills to drive collaborative culture at all levels Strong business acuity, strategic and critical thinking skills with understanding of healthcare ecosystem trends Exposure to new product launches valued Strong, demonstrated leadership skills, driven by a passion to excel in a customer-centric organization.  Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore-Singapore-  Organization  Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435)  Job Function  Sales  Requisition ID  2105953947W

description: MariaDB is making a big impact on the world. Whether you’re checking your bank account, buying a coffee, shopping online, making a phone call, listening to music, taking out a loan, or ordering takeout – MariaDB is the backbone of applications used every day. Companies small and large, including 75% of the Fortune 500 run MariaDB, touching the lives of billions of people. With massive reach through Linux distributions, enterprise deployments, and public clouds, MariaDB is uniquely positioned as the leading database for modern application development.  The Opportunity Business Development Representatives play a key role in our growth by producing qualified sales opportunities.  MariaDB has a consistent track record of promoting BDRs, and we are looking for candidates who are excited about advancing their sales careers by revolutionizing the way data is stored and accessed.   Responsibilities Follow up with, qualify, and develop inbound leads via phone, email, and social media Set up sales discovery calls with prospective clients and MariaDB Account Executives Respond to website instant message chats and our sales phone line Develop Asia-Pacific territory with outbound (“cold”) prospecting Promote MariaDB via social media Collaborate with our marketing team on campaigns, messaging, and prospect feedback Record and manage daily work in tools such as Salesforce and Salesloft  Qualifications Must-haves are: A relentless work ethic: you’re a hustler and committed to aggressively prospecting. A great attitude: you’re positive, coachable, adaptive to change, and a great teammate. You take full ownership of your quota and monthly performance. You can brush off the feeling of rejection that happens in sales. Organization and quality: you are process-oriented and take pride in the quality of your work. Your emails and presentations are polished. Your verbal communication is concise and precise.  Preferred are: Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience Ability to read/write Korean, Mandarin, or Japanese - this may provide more opportunity for territories you cover Previous sales experience with a technology company  Location Singapore  What’s in it for you? Impact the world of technology by pushing the boundaries of technology and business models, working at MariaDB. Be part of a game-changing organization that encourages outside-the-box thinking, empowerment, and is truly shaping the future of the software industry. You’ll be collaborating with high-caliber colleagues around the world, offering unparalleled learning and growth opportunities. We provide a very competitive compensation package, 25 days paid annual leave (plus holidays), stock options, a massive degree of flexibility and freedom, and more.  +++++  MariaDB does not sponsor work visas or relocation.  MariaDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.  MariaDB is an equal opportunities employer.

description: Purpose and Passion Comprehensive Benefits Life-Work Integration Community Career Growth  At Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we’re one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose—improving lives through your life’s work.  About The Role  The Medical Sales Representative will have the opportunity to sell and promote company products within a defined territory. This will be accomplished by developing new accounts and expanding usage of company products within current accounts in an effort to meet a sales quota based on company sales goals and to directly increase sales revenue of the company. Boston Scientific is looking for high energy, driven, passionate people, looking to not just change jobs, but start an amazing career!  Responsibilities Develop as a professional sales rep by acquiring working knowledge and selling techniques fundamentals. Able to tackle routine issues, limited knowledge in the medical device industry (BSC and competitors). Visit customers and/or potential customers of Boston Scientific on a regular and planned basis to promote products and services to achieve monthly, quarterly, and yearly sales targets, as agreed with the Manager. Manage existing and acquire new customers in the assigned territory under close supervision & guidance of the Manager. Follow instructions of Manager in order to plan and develop the market for our existing and new products according with divisional goals and objectives, through execution, while optimize available tools (consignment, etc). Provide ongoing technical training and support to customers directly in the operating room. Begin establishing business relationships with hospital management, purchasing department and hospital staff. Attend meetings, conferences and exhibitions as required to promote Boston Scientific products and services. Analyze and report to the Manager and/or others (monthly & year basis) the market and business feedback by using all available support tools To represent Boston Scientific values and integrity Upon request may participate in project teams.  Key Skills & Experiences Completed undergraduate degree from a reputable tertiary institution. Fresh graduates from with a strong aptitude for learning & passion to join the medical device industry are welcome to apply! Ability to build and maintain strong customer relationships Be able to attend cases and provide product support in the operating room. Possess excellent communication and presentation skills as well as leadership qualities Able to work independently, as well as a team player Have the ability to handle multiple projects and initiatives while maintaining a strong sense of urgency  This position is on local employment terms and conditions only.  Boston Scientific is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Disability, Veteran
industries: Medical Devices

Grow customer pipeline by identifying potential business opportunities and prospecting new customers through cold calling.  Achieve sales targets associated with the territory. Tailor Services scope definition, including client specific project plans, cost benefit analysis, resource requirements and contract related documentation to suit customer’s business strategies. Collaborate closely with various teams, such as product, channels, pre-sales, finance and service delivery to develop business relationships and achieve sales goals. Accurately forecast sales prospects according to services, timeline, and value. Prepare sales reports to management to update customer needs, problems and interests, sales volume, potential sales, and areas of proposed opportunity. Maximize customer satisfaction through timely communication and follow up to expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints. description: Summary: The Account Development Representative (ADR), India is for developing business in India Market and establishing and developing new customers for PEI Genesis, as well as maintaining and enhancing existing customer relationships. Reading, writing, and communicating effectively in English.  The ADR must be able to identify customers with high potential for growth, know how PEI’s product offerings can be used to provide solutions for customers, and be knowledgeable and persuasive in selling those solutions to customers. The ADR will make outgoing calls for the majority of his/her workday and must be organized, disciplined, able to work at a quick pace, able to multi-task and be self-sufficient in carrying out his/her job responsibilities. Ultimately, the ADR must meet published KPI’s, including exceeding the budgeted sales and Gross Profit targets for his/her assigned accounts and/or territory, and convert leads into sales.  Education/Experience/Skills: Diploma or equivalent in any field; or minimum of three years sales experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  Our ideal candidate is an experienced professional with knowledge of telesales/telemarketing and customer service best practices, working in an outbound sales environment. The candidate must be able to read, write and communicate effectively in English and Hindi. The candidate should be goal oriented, possess outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with emphasis on excellent telephone etiquette.  Essential Tasks and Responsibilities: Proactively generating. qualifying sales leads opportunities, negotiation and sales close Establish and develop new customers for the company in a defined geographic, market or industry; utilizing cold calling, lead follow-up, lapsed customer activation, sample follow-up, PEI-Genesis literature mailings, etc. Maintain and enhance existing customer relationships to increase the amount of business and the diversity of products that PEI-Genesis sells to these customers by pursuing possibilities and opportunities beyond those initiated by the customer. Meet or exceed outbound call KPIs, and quote follow up requirements. Understand the potential of each account to maintain or grow sales and communicate potential to management. Be responsive to customer calls and inquiries in a timely manner, consistently follow up on all outstanding quotes, and communicate feedback to the management team to assist in closing the business Understand all pertinent government regulations and customer terms and conditions and how they relate to PEI-Genesis’s processes and capabilities. Ensure that all price, delivery, quality and special handling requirements requested by customers are met in a timely and satisfactory manner. Coordinate large bids, quotes, orders and opportunities with your Manager, and appropriate people at PEI Work with available resources not only within PEI, but Manufacturers’ Representatives, Factory Representatives, and other outside sources to assist customers and expand personal knowledge of product capabilities and solutions. Participate in annual budgeting process, providing suggested customer or geographic sales dollar budget, GP dollar budget and GP percent  Expected Outcomes: Discover accounts within our existing data base, with large potential growth. Excellent collaborative communication with internal and external resources on large quotes, bids, and opportunities, will result in more large orders. Ability to communicate PEI-Genesis’ value proposition to capture more business, repeat orders with existing and new accounts. Ensure customer data and segmentation for the geography is maintained to enable accurate analysis of trends and to maximize Marketing campaign outcomes. Delighting customer always, thus building long term customer loyalty Deliver sales growth by exceeding sales, GP and active customer targets  Requirements: Microsoft Office (including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word) Experience using any ERP system (eg ASW, SAP, Oracle) Experience using any Customer relationship management software (eg NetSuite or Salesforce) Must be able to read, write and communicate effectively in English Enjoy learning about prospects and customers to find innovative ways of engaging effectively with them to drive sales Ability to handle rejection, objection, difficult prospects or customers, yet remain driven and positive even in the face of adversity to transform leads into sales Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both over the phone and in writing. Basic math skills for accurate pricing and quotes

description: About Us  At WeWork, we provide inspiring and flexible workplace solutions to help businesses - small, medium or large - thrive in more than 150 cities globally. The future of work is happening right now, and we are leading this moment. United by a common purpose, here we will empower tomorrow’s world at work. Join us on our journey as we give our members the freedom and support to push boundaries in their industries, and work to redefine our own.  About The Opportunity  WeWork All Access allows you to hot desks, conference rooms and private offices worldwide. It is redefining how businesses manage their workspace, and the All Access team is at the forefront of this flexible working revolution.  This role will be pivotal in the success of WeWorks hybrid work solution in the Pacific area, contributing to its development, its growth and ultimately its success.  In This Role, You Will  We are looking for an Account Executive, All Access to be the main point of contact for All Access sales in Pacific.  Drive all 10+ All Access card deals Partner with the International Accounts and Leasing teams on their All Access requirements Shares best practices in selling strategies and operations with the other International All Access sales teams (MLB, Unnamed Accounts and Named Accounts) Execute net new and upsell bookings for the All Access product to companies with 500+ FTEs Position the value of All Access and the future of flexible work Serve as a bridge between sales and the All Access product team, constantly looking to improve the product and customer experience Be a positive WeWork brand ambassador and effectively communicate our value proposition to members Provide unmatched customer service to members to ensure the best possible member experience  About You  Does the below sound like you? If so, we’d love to hear from you!  A relevant Bachelor’s Degree 5+ years of professional experience in sales, account management or related industry Comfortable using CRM platforms – Salesforce experience highly desirable Demonstrated experience in nurturing, negotiating and closing sales Experience in high growth SaaS is highly desirable Experience working on a team and leading a team player mentality Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills Exceptional organization skills and multi-tasking skills  Life At WeWork  Being a WeWorker is more than just a job. We believe the magic of work is sparked by the passion you bring, the places you go, the people you meet and the purpose you follow. And it starts here. Here you will brush shoulders with those who dare to dream and do. Here you will be welcomed by a diverse community that embraces and inspires you—because together we can achieve more. Here we challenge ideas, and explore new ways of getting things done. Whether you are part of our Employee Community Groups, or part of a global project, we ask you to bring your open-minded attitude and collaborative spirit. In return, you will be part of a team where your unique perspectives are celebrated.  WeWork is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil status, pregnancy (or pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression, transgender status or gender reassignment, race, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including genetic testing and characteristics), military or veteran status, or any other grounds or characteristic that is protected under the law.

description: Company Description:  Flashpoint delivers actionable intelligence that empowers organizations of all sizes to take rapid, decisive actions to protect against threats. The company's technology, advanced data collections, and human-powered analysis uniquely enable teams to mitigate threats related to cybersecurity, fraud, insider threats, corporate and physical security, executive protection, and third-party risk. For more information, visit https://www.flashpoint-intel.com/ or follow us on Twitter at @FlashpointIntel.  What we are looking for:  The Business Development Representative position is an integral part of our company's growth strategy in the APAC region . The main objective of the Business Development Representative is to evaluate and qualify prospects through multi-channel efforts, resulting in highly qualified meetings and contributing in building pipelines for our team.  This role reports into the Revenue Operations team, and will be tightly aligned with sales. The person in this role will have tremendous opportunity for growth within the sales organization from this starting point. This particular Business Development Representative will focus on prospecting and outbound activities to help fuel the sales pipeline, and will use data procurement tools to source contacts that meet target profiles in order to drive engagement and support sales opportunities.  What you will do: Source contacts through procurement and social platforms for outbound meeting scheduling for Generate appointments for insides sales and field sales organizations focusing in APAC Region Work directly with marketing and sales leaders on messaging, positioning, and best content for meeting procurement Use of strong selling and influencing skills to set up qualified appointments Log, track and maintain all contact records in Salesforce Maintain and nurture the lead generation funnel from the first touch point to conversion Collaborate with the APAC team in Singapore and Australia on regional strategic and tactical outreach.  What you will bring: Minimum 1-2 years of experience in B2B prospecting Self-motivated, future sales leader that takes personal satisfaction in every meeting booked Proficient in using Salesforce.com (required), LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Salesloft (preferred) Ability to work remotely on a full-time basis Must be able to interact and communicate with individuals at all levels of the organization Strong in-person, phone, and written external communication skills. Ability to prioritize work assignments and shift work efforts based on the needs of the department or business goals. Previous experience with technology or cybersecurity background is a plus Having selling and cultural experience in the APAC region is a plus, including managing outreach in different time zones.  Why Flashpoint is a Great Place to Work: Diversity. Flashpoint is committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity, inclusion, belonging, and equity. We recognize that diversity is key to achieving our vision. We believe that every person and their experiences contribute to building a work environment and a product that will change the world. Culture and Belonging. Our company's culture isn't something you join, it's something you build and shape, and each person's unique backgrounds and experiences contribute to who Flashpoint is and will become. You will have ample opportunities to connect with coworkers through various communication channels and company-funded events: dietary & allergy conscious catered lunches, book clubs, happy hours, committees and much more. Benefits. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including unlimited PTO, 401(K), mental health and wellness benefits, commuter benefits, and generous parental leave policies. Perks. Flashpoint understands that personal wellness is one of the keys to a happy, healthy and productive work environment. That's why we also prioritize health and wellness perks like gym reimbursements and daily meditation, well-stocked kitchens, cool cultural initiatives and inclusive employee events. Career Growth. Flashpoint is invested in the growth of our team members and understands that frequent, two-way feedback is critical to that growth. We encourage regular one-on-ones with your manager, a regular schedule of performance reviews, learning and development opportunities, and guidance through formalized career paths; whether that be towards being a great manager, being a great individual contributor, or a lateral move to gain breadth of knowledge and experience. A Great Place to Work. Literally. According to the 99% of employees surveyed, Flashpoint earned designation as a Great Place to Work-Certified™ Company for 2021. 100% of employees agree that new hires are made to feel welcome and appreciated. If you are interested in learning more, please check out our Certified Profile.

description: Enjoy working in the enterprise segment acquiring and developing key accounts? Passionate about building long-term relationships and making customers succeed?  Interested in joining a team that will invest in your development, and take your career to the next level?   Apply now to join our team as a Senior Account Executive for Crayon Singapore!   Crayon is a global leader in Cloud Optimization and Software & Cloud Analytics services. We specialize in enabling customers in all industry sectors with complex local, regional, and Global IT estates. As specialists, we have solid partnerships with all the major software vendors, including Microsoft, Oracle, AWS, Adobe, and VMware. We are passionate about paving the way for our customers' digital transformation journey, and with our unique tools and skilled team members, we optimize their ROI on complex technology investments. Thus far, we are a team of 2500 colleagues, spanning 37 countries around the globe that collaborate across borders and time zones to deliver customized IT solutions. Our flat organizational structure promotes an innovative and results-oriented culture where everyone gets the opportunity to be an integral part in developing our services and products.    We are currently looking for a new Senior Account Executive to join our Direct Sales Team in Singapore. When appointed for this role, you will assume accountability for planning, building, and managing long-lasting relationships with top accounts and work with them to grow the direct business market share. You will own a customer portfolio and develop your customers through collaboration with Licensing Sales Specialists, Software Advisors, and Solution Advisors. As such, you will have the opportunity to identify, qualify, and close new customer relationships based on our model and local sales strategy, as well as to manage, secure, and grow existing client relationships.   Your primary responsibilities will be:  Customer acquisition in a dedicated segment  Creating opportunities with key customers, by identifying how Crayon services and vendor portfolio can increase customer profitability  Strategic conversations in the interface between business and IT, discussing with all levels of stakeholders, technical and non-technical  Further developing contacts at the customers' by building solid relationships with relevant stakeholders and decision-makers  Assessing business risks and opportunities and discussing strategic impact on financial investments communicated on C-level   We find that you will have success in this role if you are a results-oriented and motivated self-starter, who thrives in a dynamic and fast-paced environment. We believe you to be a sales professional with excellent negotiation and communication skills, who enjoys collaborating at all levels. Furthermore, we envisage you to translate technically related challenges to business language, and that you understand the big picture, as well as the value of collaboration and leveraging the full Crayon ecosystem.   Desired Competency & Experience:  5+ years of experience in IT solution selling   Experience with hunting, identifying, and qualifying leads for IT products and services  Proven track record driving new and existing accounts, with a focus on growth and expansion   Experience driving net new business focused on enterprise accounts and building customer relationships in a designated market segment  Experience with selling and/or deploying Microsoft solutions is highly regarded   Practical Information:  Location‌: ‌Singapore  Language ‌required‌: ‌Business level English‌‌, written and spoken  Application deadline: ASAP. We will evaluate the candidates as they apply and consequently conduct the selection  Visa requirements: Must have work visa/work permit. We are looking for someone who is ideally already based in Singapore and that could start relatively quickly

description: ABOUT AUTO GERMANY  Auto Germany was established in January, 2012 to operate and manage the sole exclusive dealership for Opel passenger and commercial vehicles in Singapore. With the launch of its modern 3S facilities at Alpine Centre, Auto Germany embarked on a 5 year plan to energize the Opel brand and make it one of the top 5 European brand in Singapore.  In 2016, the European Car of the Year was awarded to Opel Astra. And by 2017, The Opel brand was acknowledged by local journalists as the 2nd fastest growing brand by unit sales. By end of 2017, Opel sales had increased by more than 300%. Today, the Opel brand has firmly established itself as a top performer in the mainstream continental market segment, consistently achieving top 3 positioning amongst its competitors.  Auto Germany continues to be a major player in the complex and competitive automotive market in Singapore. Forging forward and embarking on the journey toward electrification, Auto Germany continues to win industry trust and partnerships from Banks/Financial Investors, Insurance Corporations, and Government Regulatory bodies and most importantly it’s ever expanding consumer base.  SALES EXECUTIVE, OPEL SINGAPORE  RESPONSIBILITIES  • Drive sales of Opel vehicles by conducting focused customer presentation and effective test-drive experience to highlight the product features, functions, and benefits of the Opel vehicle. • Provide professional and high-quality customer service in accordance with Opel standards to improve customer satisfaction and promote brand loyalty. • To follow up on all leads provided diligently and effectively to maximize conversion to physical showroom walk-in and test drive. • To be an Opel brand ambassador for our products which also includes being involved in production of media content for communication purposes. • To attend all needed training sessions internal/external and to actively participate in training to ensure maximum learning.  REQUIREMENTS  • Have a passion for cars and the automotive industry. • To be a highly self-motivated individual with ability to find solutions effectively. • Team player. • Right aptitude and has excellent communication skills. • Possesses selling and negotiation techniques. • Experience in handling and managing customers needs and expectations. • High customer and service orientation. • Able to work in rostered shift including weekends. • Must possess a valid Class 3 driving license minimum.

Our heritage is proudly Australian, but we're creating a global footprint. With a workforce of employees across more than 20 countries, we're working towards our vision of becoming a world-class technology company that empowers people to connect.  To deliver on this, we're creating a culture that is more diverse, innovative, and collaborative than ever before. It means everyone in Telstra plays a role in achieving our strategy and purpose.  We are looking for Senior Account Manager in our Singapore office who will propose and sell services-based technology solutions for Telstra Enterprise customers in Singapore. You will have a positive impact on achieving Telstra's sales, revenue and NPS targets. You will drive connectivity and Network Application Services (NAS) revenue and sales for our global products within the respective markets and ensure that global product portfolio is represented in your account plan.  Key responsibilities:   Identifying and winning NEW high value and strategic enterprise customers to achieve targets and Customer Satisfaction Measures Establish a sales portfolio plan that sets out the strategy to achieve your key performance metrics and build a sustainable pipeline over the next 12-24 months Establish and maintain long term relationships with "C"' level decision makers to maximize business opportunities Develop and maintain in depth knowledge of the Prospects business and technology environment and drivers, relevant for the application of network IT services Develop and maintain an understanding of the organization's Network Application Services (NAS) portfolio to effectively develop and present business led propositions to our Prospects Participate actively in sales calls and bid reviews as appropriate and contribute to the rapid growth of sales, demonstrating excellent account and relationship management and 'closing skills' to the team Manage internal sales business management responsibilities including sales opportunity forecasting, reporting, account reviews and opportunity management Conduct regular knowledge sharing and coaching with peers, sharing best practices and industry insights to build motivation, and selling skills Work in close cooperation with internal teams and collaborate well with Peers across the International Region Occasional traveling across Asia as required Skills and Experience   Previous high sales performance as an individual contributor Good technical knowledge in Telecommunications, IP networks & technologies, Cloud, S/I/P-SaaS, Design & Quality drivers in the Enterprise environment Experience in managing Global accounts Experience in developing and executing strategy Experience influencing senior stakeholders - internal and external with the ability to navigate through complex process Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills required in English Experience working for an International company that achieves success through cross-regional collaboration. Highly desirable skills   Proven sales capacity in new business development, within Asian Telecommunications market - Where no previous billing relationship exists Ability to articulate the value of a complex enterprise sale in business terms, outlining the value proposition, ROI and total cost of ownership Familiarity with Miller Heiman methodology Proficiency with Salesforce.com If this opportunity sounds like a perfect fit for you, we'd encourage you to apply!  Additional Information  Not only will you be rewarded with a competitive salary package, but there are a range of lifestyle products and services that you can access, including medical and life insurance, volunteer leave and the list goes on. And, in case you hadn't heard, we champion flexibility and flexible working in all our roles  To learn more about how we support our people, including accessibility adjustments we can provide you through the recruitment process, visit tel.st/thrive
industries: Telecommunications

description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 8 years of experience within account management and sales. Experience in mobile, advertising sales, account management, and/or customer services.  Preferred qualifications: Experience with effective sales/operations management and strategic planning. Experience in sales coaching and mentoring, and demonstrated success developing sales individuals to hit their development goals. Understanding of the app developer ecosystem and industry. Ability to take on complex, ambiguous topics, build strategy, and influence stakeholders. Entrepreneurial thinker with a track record of developing new business growth streams. Ability to speak and write in Vietnamese, Indonesian, Urdu, or Thai fluently to effectively communicate with stakeholders in-market, who may be from Southeast Asia or South Asian Frontier markets.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  As a Team Lead for App Developer Sales (AppDev), you will lead and coach business development teams that use consultative sales skills to understand our advertisers' needs and deliver measurable solutions that grow their businesses. You will also work with the sales leadership team to set strategic objectives and run the day-to-day operations for the business.  You will create strategic growth opportunities and cultivate relationships with key customers. You will partner closely with App Developers global leadership team, external industries as well as stakeholders within the wider Google organization to accelerate our position in the fast growing and strategic app/gaming business. You will on-board, lead, and coach a customer-facing team. You will implement a coaching culture and will develop sales specific behaviors throughout the organization.  You will work with your team to set and execute strategy to grow the up and coming existing app advertisers across different regions.  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  Responsibilities  Deliver against product growth and sales goals. Manage, inspire, and motivate a team of sales consultants. Assess the needs of our customers and gather user feedback to improve our solutions. Work with global AppDev teams to drive initiatives including product excellence, sales excellence, and building one global team.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: ­  TraceLink has built the world's largest cloud-based network dedicated to protecting patients, ensuring compliance and growing profits across global life sciences. The TraceLink Life Sciences Cloud is our network, our platform, and the community that we’ve built, that links life science people, processes and information everywhere, from ingredient to patient. Over 1,000 businesses across the globe, from the largest drug manufacturers to small street corner pharmacies, trust us to help them manufacture and deliver safe, secure medicines to the patients who need them, anywhere in the world.  The Sales Development Representative position is perfect for someone that wants to quickly grow a (or build upon an existing) solid foundation in one of the country’s fastest growing companies. Promotion into leadership and quota-carrying Account Executive roles will be swift for top performers. The criteria for upward advancement will be outlined for you from Day 1. As a Sales Development Representative, you will proactively generate new business opportunities for TraceLink’s Essential Supply Chain Service Platform.  ­ Meet and/or exceed daily, weekly, and monthly performance targets for number of outbound calls, qualified sales opportunities passed and pipeline contribution. Work within an assigned territory to qualify, develop, and mature marketing supplied leads resulting in high quality sales opportunities for Account Executives. Uncover needs at each level of an organization, and match with well-articulated value proposition. Perform research on companies as a component of opportunity qualification and creation activities utilizing various prospecting technologies that the company has invested in. About Wintermute  Wintermute is a hyper-growth fintech startup and one of the largest players in the global digital asset markets. We provide liquidity algorithmically across most cryptocurrency exchanges and trading platforms, as well as support high profile blockchain projects and traditional financial institutions moving into crypto.  Culturally, we combine the best traits of both trading companies and technology startups. As a trading company, we manage hundreds of millions in assets, trade more than $5B+/day across dozens of trading platforms and are highly profitable in doing so. As a technology startup, we build, innovate and move incredibly fast, we create best-in-class liquidity products that create more efficient markets. We believe that traditional finance has to change and we are on a mission to define and build the decentralized future of finance.   Wintermute is a hyper-growth highly profitable proprietary trading business. We are backed by top tier global venture capital investors such as Lightspeed, Pantera Capital, Sino Global Capital, Blockchain.com Ventures, Avon Ventures by Fidelity Investments, DeFi Alliance and others.  Working at Wintermute    We are looking for a Business Development & Partnerships Director Asia who will bring our Asia business to completely new heights. We are looking for someone who knows the Asian crypto market and is excited to make a big impact for Wintermute in Asia (China and beyond).   You will be responsible for building new as well as growing Wintermute's existing business in Asia. You will own opportunities in the region from end to end and develop your own strategic growth plan, while also getting advice and guidance from the Management Team. We have the best liquidity products in the market, we work with many of the most prominent blockchain projects, we have many strategic growth opportunities in the pipeline, and a long line of counterparties wanting to develop relationships with us. We have no legacy processes, no corporate bureaucracy, no multiple levels of approvals, yet the highest standards of professionalism.     What will you work on  As we are a hyper-growth startup in one of the most dynamic industries, we are constantly changing and so do the roles of everyone in the company. Your role will be truly varied and will include some of the core ownership areas, as well as various projects based on both your talents/preferences and business needs of the company. There is a lot of room to shape and expand this role - there is no limit set by the company! Some representative responsibilities and projects are described below.   • Grow the OTC business in Asia (both manual and RFQ) - this includes developing and executing your own growth plan which will have many of angles to it: acquiring new counterparties, developing existing relationships, cooperating with developer teams on productizing the solution and execution of trades • Grow the crypto project market making business - deepen relationships with existing crypto projects and acquire new ones • Develop new relationships with high-profile crypto projects, crypto VCs, institutional investors, miners and other parties of the crypto eco-system; note that we are connected to many of these parties or can get introduced, so this is all about systematically developing the relationships and bringing them to the next level • Work with various cross-functional teams to drive brand awareness in the key markets in Asia (China, S. Korea, Japan) • Develop existing relationships with exchanges globally and bring them to the next level • Keep track of key launches and news in the crypto eco-system and proactively identify cooperation and business development opportunities  Hard Skills Requirements  • BSc/MSc in Business/Economics/Finance or any related degree • Top tier MBA is preferred (or other proven ability to see the bigger picture, understand new functional areas quickly, having a cross-functional mindset) • Professional-level Mandarin is strongly preferred, but isn’t a requirement; fluent English; other Asian languages would be a plus • Deep understanding of both Asian and Western mindsets and ways of doing business • 2-5 years of experience with Asian crypto markets • Experience in business development or any client-facing role (B2B sales, management consulting, investment banking, etc) • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written - this is not about pitching, but being convincing, concise, precise, a good listener; being clear on next steps and always following up on promises • Experience delivering business results - be ready to talk about numbers/quota achievement, etc • Experience in BD or similar role facing institutional crypto, institutional traditional finance, blockchain projects is a significant advantage • At least one of - trading knowledge or crypto knowledge - is a strong advantage; willingness, aptitude and curiosity to understand the fundamentals of blockchain technologies, algorithmic trading and market making is crucial Other Requirements   • Have an owner mentality: you focus on the ultimate result for the company (short and long-term growth) • Able to understand the bigger picture and be very hands-on and practical • Love problem solving, and love seeing the tangible results of you work • Determined, ambitious yet humble, willing to work hard, take feedback and learn on the way • Like meritocracy and being judged by what you deliver • Have an entrepreneurial mindset versus working 9-to-5 mentality; prepared to work non-standard working hours (since we are a high-growth startup operating in 24/7 crypto world) • Like working in the team collaborative environment (not fully remote), at least half-time working from our office  Wintermute Offer  • A unique opportunity to work on very interesting projects, get the level of responsibility and ownership that would take 5-10 years longer to get in a traditional trading company/bank/hedge fund • A unique opportunity to join a high growth startup and one of the strongest and highest potential crypto startups globally • Great culture: highly professional and ambitious, yet informal, friendly, non-hierarchical, collaborative and entrepreneurial    • A cool office in central London with a sci-fi touch (Singapore office is in the works) • Weekly team events, such as team lunches, team dinners, team board games and Dota playing sessions; these are not obligatory in any sense, but this is what we like to do • Aligned incentive structure: on top of competitive fixed compensation you get significant performance-based variable pay  Tips for Successful Application  • Only apply to us if you are genuinely interested or curious about this role and this space; this is not for someone who is just looking for "a job" or pursues purely mercenary objectives • Do your research: look at our website and social media channels • Write us a short, honest, and direct message if you'd like to apply. Tell us about why you are interested in Wintermute generally and your specific role in particular • Do not send us generic copy paste applications, we are looking for authentic people who share our interests, values and ambitions. If you don't have some obviously matching experience or skills, make sure you state very clearly what you can bring or how your experience is relevant/transferable  • Prepare to be tested on our hard skills requirements • Prepare to demonstrate “Other requirements” • Do your basic homework on crypto markets and what hft/market making/algo trading is • We get a lot of applications, so unfortunately, we won't be able to proceed if you simply press "submit button"; we do promise to reply to everyone who puts time and effort into making the application relevant!

description: Swapcard digitalizes events while preserving the magic of real-life interaction. Behind this dream, stands a passionate, curious, and down-to-earth team. We believe an environment of trust, autonomy, and support is integral to our success. As a result of putting people first, career evolution and rapid growth have become regular commodities. We've even managed to revolutionize our industry through true teamwork, sharing our ideas and listening to each other!  With 39 nationalities amongst a team of more than 168, we enjoy an open-minded environment where opinions and ideas are encouraged and exchanged freely in order to create a product and company we can all be proud of. We’ve also learned that the more moments we share, the more comfortable, communicative, and confident we are when working together. That’s when the real magic occurs. We’ve made some incredible memories around the globe together so far & it's only the beginning!  We've opened offices in Paris, Montreal, Dubai, Seattle, London, and New Delhi. Where's next for us? Singapore!  Prior to the pandemic, our team supported remote-work. This has helped us transition smoothly to a full-remote company this year. We'll be keeping our HQ in Paris as home base while staying flexible to see what the future holds for our growing team. Currently, we're spread out throughout the world. We're looking for ambitious and curious teammates to take part in this adventure of growing from a start-up to a scale-up.Your focus in this role Outbound sales efforts to targeted accounts Working with Country Manager/Account Executive to identify key targets and build engagement and outreach plans Leverage multi-channel engagement strategies to approach and engage target accounts. Develop sales opportunities with territory to pass to Country Manager/Account Executive Manage inbound lead flow, qualifying in and out opportunities for Swapcard to pursue a sale. Your Profile 1+ year experience in outbound sales, or equivalent experience with a strong desire to pursue a career in sales. Fluent in English and Mandarin – additional languages are a plus! Availability to work in Singapore timezone Exceptional comfort while speaking on the phone and video conference Exceptional communication, listening, and presentation skills Organized, persistent, optimistic & charismatic! Experience in CRM technology or proven software usage capabilities Desire to learn and grow professionally within a sales environment Sales administration and pipeline management are critical for effectiveness in this role Experience in SaaS and the event technology industry preferred Reasons to join us International Team with 39 nationalities (more on the way!) 🌍 Paris HQ with offices in USA, UAE, CA, UK, & IN 🇫🇷 🇺🇸 🇦🇪 🇨🇦 🇬🇧 🇮🇳 🇸🇬 Fast-growing startup with many opportunities for growth 🌱 Open-minded culture that appreciates differences 👽 Feedback driven, supportive & curious team with DIY mindset 🤔 🛠 Family Leave & remote work to ensure you have time for what matters most ❤️ 🏡 Team that seizes every opportunity to celebrate success 🍾 🕺🏼💃 Learning support & sponsorship 📚 WFH Budget to help you feel comfortable 😊 Generous Paid Time Off program to ensure your happiness 🎁 Team Vacations to celebrate our achievements ✈️

Job Description Position Overview We are hiring high-energy sales professionals with sound business acumen, natural sales instincts and strong technical aptitude. Primary efforts include responding to and qualifying inbound / outbound telephone inquiries for Autodesk solutions, as well as partnering with Digital Ecommerce teams to help generate pipeline and close sales opportunities. At Autodesk, we believe a salesperson's success depends on our customer's success - and we offer our clients technology solutions to help them grow their business and maximize the return on their software investment. This ability requires our sales team to have varied skills and talents, including thorough knowledge of the targeted business, understanding of complex technologies, and the ability to sell effectively. Responsibilities  Work with key stakeholders and management to drive quarterly sales goals Engage in inbound and outbound calls to assist customers and prospects in choosing the right Autodesk solution and products, helping them to purchase over the phone or online, during ANZ business hours Create, build, close and transact a qualified pipeline of inbound/direct customers Create and manage a database of leads in Salesforce.com, efficiently processing all opportunities, tracking, reporting and maintaining to close Work with the Digital Ecommerce ecosystem to plan and execute promos to drive compelling reasons for closures  Minimum Qualifications 3+ years of work experience in Digital sales rep, with SaaS sales experience a plus Be highly motivated, tenacious, and a self-starter with a can-do attitude who want to be successful Strong desire to be in technology sales Experience in a phone-based role, making high volume of outbound calls, preferably in a sales environment Experience in SFDC Excellent English written and verbal communication skills with a confident and professional phone manner Ability to take initiative, prioritize, and manage time effectively is essential Ability to work both alone and as part of a team Drive to continually improve your sales skills through on the job coaching, self-learning and as defined by Autodesk sales capability and career progression framework  Only Singapore Citizen or Singapore PR's applications are considered.  Send in your updated profile to me on lakshmi.ramaraju@autodesk.com

description: At Aiven, we turn top Open-Source data technologies into frustration-free cloud services to serve the needs of customers of all sizes. Today, we offer eight fully-managed services - Apache Kafka, PostgreSQL, MySQL, Elasticsearch, Cassandra, Redis, InfluxDB and Grafana that work across major cloud providers such as Google, Amazon, Azure, Digital Ocean and more.  Aiven in a nutshell:   We are open-source and cloud experts Our platform delivers bulletproof data ops Global service footprint & support organization Security in our DNA 500+ customers in 50+ countries $150M in VC funding   We are now looking for a Sales Manager to join our newly-founded Aiven Sales team in Singapore.   Responsibilities:  Qualify new customers and prospects and sell the Aiven product suite to them Prospect and open new leads by identifying and qualifying opportunities for Aiven Become an expert on Aiven's services and conduct discovery calls, presentations, and demos with prospects and customers Articulate the business values your prospects can benefit from using Aiven services Support customers during the sales cycle and optimize the selection of Aiven's service offering in alignment with customer requirements Assist customers during the onboarding process and align closely with our Support Team to ensure a smooth transition to becoming an Aiven customer with a best-in-class customer experience Coordinate resources throughout the sales cycle, including product & engineering support Visit customers on site as appropriate in alignment with our Sales Enterprise Director Track all opportunity and customer details in Salesforce  Requirements:  3-5 years of software selling experience; SaaS experience preferred, familiarity with the Open-Source space is a major bonus Experience selling to Developers as well as Director/VP-level leaders Some basic IT education Outbound prospecting experience A consistent track record in meeting / exceeding quota Proficiency using Salesforce.com Skills in virtual presentations, online web demos, remote sales processes A Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience Extraordinary verbal and written communication skills The ambition to be an amazing salesperson (or maybe you are already - congrats!). As we are growing so fast - "the Sky's the Limit" for your own personal career here at Aiven.  Benefits:  We are proud of our supportive and pragmatic organizational culture. We are solution-oriented, and at the same time we cultivate an environment of trust and diversity where everyone can strive for excellence.    Besides our people and culture, at Aiven you'll have   A dynamic environment in a rapidly growing, international business Highly experienced colleagues from a variety of backgrounds Flexible working hours, including remote working when needed Ability to choose the devices and tools that make you work the best Mobile phone and subscription Participation in employee stock option plan  You will be part of a highly-skilled, tight-knit and growing team, making your contribution essential to what is becoming a truly unique success story. If you're interested, send us your application and we'll take it from there.   Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes.   Aiven complies with applicable local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.

description: We’re iSabel, a tech-led health care startup that helps organizations build holistic and sustainable cultures of workplace wellbeing. iSabel is actually an acronym for it’s Such a beautiful life... we really believe that and we want every human to truly feel that way. This is an exciting opportunity to join us at the start of our journey, make an impact and go to market with a fresh, innovative solution.   In this full cycle sales role, you’re equal parts thinker and doer. You’ll work with the CEO to codify the sales process for large and SMB accounts - including lead generation and qualification, pitching and negotiating, and work collaboratively with the Head of Customer Success to onboard your new clients.  This role would be great opportunity for a high performing executive who consistently meets their sales KPIs and is looking to help shape the sales function of a startup. Please apply with a detailed CV, including achievements.

Advantage for strategic consulting background or other similar experience. Sales orientation and proven record of meeting growth targets Be the best multi-tasker you know, manage multiple complex projects in parallel, and hit your deadlines in advance Technical aptitude and curiosity: Know and understand how things work Internally-motivated self-starter with ability to plan, organize, and establish priorities to take ownership of business processes and produce results Degree-level education in quantitative/ business field, MBAs encouraged Master at presenting data and telling stories with data Ability and willingness to travel to corporate customer sites
