description: Finacle is the industry-leading digital banking solution suite from EdgeVerve Systems, a wholly owned product subsidiary of Infosys. Finacle helps traditional and emerging financial institutions drive truly digital transformation to achieve frictionless customer experiences, larger ecosystem play, insights–driven interactions and ubiquitous automation. Today, banks in over 100 countries rely on Finacle to service more than a billion consumers and 1.3 billion accounts.  Finacle solutions address the core banking, omnichannel banking, payments, treasury, origination, liquidity management, Islamic banking, wealth management, analytics, artificial intelligence, and blockchain requirements of financial institutions to drive business excellence. An assessment of the top 1250 banks in the world reveals that institutions powered by the Finacle Core Banking solution, on average, enjoy 7.2% points lower costs-to-income ratio than others. To know more, visit www.finacle.com  Responsibilities/Requirement  Master/Degree/Diploma in Business Management  At least eight years of prior relevant work experience in performing competitor analysis for the segment of account, client introduction, provide analysis and ground intelligence, prepare customer maps of named customers, support in contract negotiations, to identify right contacts in the client organizations and to inform about customer complaints on project delivery with the objective of leveraging first-hand experience against competitors, demonstrating business value to the client, growing accounts and minimizing revenue leakage WITHIN the boundaries of company policies and guidelines.              Knowledge of basics of outsourcing, cost & revenue drivers for an IT Software Products organization,  Should have excellent communication and analytical skills. The ability to display initiative and work in an unstructured environment is a must.  Prior sales and account management experience in BFSI vertical for an International Application Software company is a MUST  The role involves hunting for new logos as well as farming existing BFSI accounts of Infosys Finacle in the assigned territory. We are looking for success-oriented people who have proven track record and understanding of processes, solutions in the Financial Services area  Candidates with established market network in BFSI and a proven track record of closing Enterprise Application Software deals in South East Asia will be preferred.  Relevant Solution/Experience areas in Core Banking (Retail Banking/ Corporate Banking) , Digital Banking, Payments or Wealth Management  What will you do? Market Development Customer Prospecting Opportunity Identification & Qualification Proposal Development Proposal Negotiation & Closure Contracting & MSA Account Planning & Review Account Mining Account Operations Relationship Management Merger & Acquisition

description: With two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory is a world leader in premium spirits. As a truly global business, we bring together the best of our culturally diverse heritage. We value both agility and long-term thinking, we share a collective commitment to excellence and a dedication to craftsmanship, and across borders and roles, we collaborate to delight our consumers responsibly, and contribute to a more sustainable society for all of our stakeholders.  Our Vision is Growing for Good and our mission is to be the world’s most admired, fastest-growing premium spirits’ company. We’re a business that runs on responsibility, integrity, ambition and drive, and we celebrate exceptional performance. We welcome our people to dream big and tenaciously pursue ambitious goals – we call it our Yatte Minahare Spirit. But perhaps most importantly – we value difference, and we appreciate what each of us can contribute. We inspire each other, and challenge ourselves to innovate, improve, advance new ideas and try new things. We create endless opportunities to Unleash Your Spirit every day in a culture that is charged, creative, challenging and fun. What makes this a great opportunity?   We are on an exciting journey across our GTR business with the mission to be Beam Suntory’s global brand building, financial and talent growth engine. 2021/22 will be exciting and rewarding transformational year for us as we strengthen capabilities to enable us to become the recognized industry leader for showcasing brands, partnering with customers, and driving mutually beneficial growth. We aim to build a shopper centric organization, with agile marketing and Joint Customers Plans grounded in Category Management insights. And you can be part of this exciting journey of transforming the business and achieve your personal growth!  PURPOSE & SCOPE OF ROLE:  Deliver the regional strategy to achieve overall GTR business goals Manage allocated accounts to achieve volume and value targets, as well as other financial performance indicators whilst assisting with implementing brand strategies and activations. Assigned to airport locations and customers, the Key Account Manager is responsible for the execution of all key priorities including distribution, brand activation, share of shelf, permanent visibility, Joint Business Plan delivery, local account management and creation/implementation of local opportunities. Manage the relationship and partnership with Key retailers and Buyers and deliver against clear market plans. Hold the ‘shop floor’ relationship with all sales staff and ensures they are fully educated in our brands, whilst delivering required shop floor compliance and reports back to business, for example RSP’s, availability, facings, competitor activity etc. Own the relationship with the internal stakeholders such as Marketing, Supply etc on behalf of the region to support overall GTR delivery  Role Responsibilities:  Business Performance Management  Achieve sales and NSV targets by delivering the agreed annual JBP plan internally and with retailer. Adapt and implement the S&OP process such as forecasting, reviews etc with supply chain as a way of working to create efficient and effective business Collaborate with Shopper marketing team to develop the shopper and customer centric business plans Work collaboratively with the Domestic team to deliver on best overall outcomes for Beam Suntory, aligning on brand and pricing priorities where possible  Customer Management:  Leading relationships across territory with local buying teams/Store Managers/Key Staff ensuring that Beam Suntory is a preferred partner, via excellent customer management and strategic relationships with priority customers, RTM distributor & internal stakeholders. Lead the team of Brand Ambassador and agenda on efficiency & optimization across all relevant markets, coaching and developing team to lead to brilliant execution of the BA plan Develop, negotiate, and implement annual promotion & activation plans across brands, as per guidelines, as a vehicle to deliver the established objectives Deliver on RSVP3 execution goals annually (Range, Space, Visibility, Price, Promotion and Persuasion) at Account and store level Lead the negotiation on trading terms and pricing and implement changes with Key Customers  Qualifications & Experience:  Degree qualified Proven Key Account Management experience preferably with international customers Ideally 5 years’ experience Consumer Goods category background. Travel Retail experience will be preferred Able to work well and add to a diverse and inclusive team. Strong personal leadership skills in influencing, collaborating, and bringing diverse stakeholders onboard Ability to travel regionally – up to 35% Excellent negotiation and influencing skills A balance of strategic thinking and execution for results  Key Skills & Competencies Commercial and Financial understanding Relationship and Account Management P&L management Leadership skills Strong Networking skills Stake holder management Goal & results oriented Strategic thinking Influencing/negotiation skills Data driven with a keen focus on sales analysis and forecasting

STEINWAY & SONS offers unique opportunities within our retail sales team for those who possess the desire, passion, and experience to join our organization selling the world’s finest pianos in our showroom at ION Orchard.   The right candidate has a passion for luxury and a love of music and arts. A proven track record in a competitive sales environment combined with past experience in business development and lead generating activities is key. In addition, the candidate must have an outgoing and engaging personality in order to build relationships with clients on many different levels. The ability to play piano is highly preferred as our clients often seek guidance and recommendations during instrument selections.  The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.  This position offers excellent earning potential and full and comprehensive benefits. If you are interested in learning more about becoming part of STEINWAY & SONS, apply now and send us your resume and cover letter. Provide excellent customer service and recommend the right instrument that suits customer's requirement Develop new networks such as music teachers/friends of Steinway/VIPs/Steinway Owners database Maintenance and update of CRM database Handle and assist in store events, cross-branding collaborations and marketing initiatives Participate in off-site special events and other related activities outside store operation Inventory management  Qualifications Minimum 1 year of working experience Must have experience in sales, ideally for luxury goods or high-end services Willingness to take a long term view and building relationship with our customers Transport allowance will be provided. Piano playing and music appreciation would be an advantage  Others Overseas training opportunities Career development opportunities Attractive commission and incentives Working hours: 4 weekdays & 1 Weekend Shift: 10.30 a.m. to 7.30 p.m. (1 hour lunch break) OR 12.30 p.m. to 9.30 p.m. (1 hour dinner break)

jobTitle: Assistant Manager, Regional Market Sales & Management (Asia)
description: Secretlab is an international gaming chair brand seating over a million users worldwide, with our key markets in the United States, Europe and Singapore, where we are headquartered.   You will be an Assistant Manager in our Business Development (BD) team, responsible for the management and growth of key markets (Asia). In this role, you will be expected to work closely with in-country partners to drive Secretlab sales on marketplace platforms and identify new opportunities to grow in-country Secretlab brand equity in non-english speaking markets. This role reports to the Regional Market Management & Development Manager.   Our Business Development team is involved with all Secretlab’s D2C growth for non-English speaking markets, including collaborative efforts with world-renowned brands such as Game of Thrones, Batman, Cloud9, Team Secret, as well as international esports organisers such as Riot Games for their League of Legends global tournaments.    Your key responsibilities (but not limited to): • Be the key driver of sales and increased customer lifetime value (CLV) for the assigned markets through various means including (but not limited to): Sales planning, Joint Business Planning (JBP) discussions, and negotiations Plan & implement data-backed campaign mechanics to drive year-round sales performance Manage in-country local partners to execute market strategy Activate marketplace tools to increase user engagement, store followers, feed, chat, etc., to drive repeat purchase and higher cart check-out value. Gain favorable year-round exposure for marketplace & Mall stores across markets, especially for product launches, high-key, and tactical sales campaigns Research and recommend marketplace sales investment (e.g. paid media/ ad spend, sponsorships, giveaways etc.) based on projected sales returns and other KPIs  • Become a subject matter expert for the assigned markets, in the areas of: Local market sentiment, buyer demographics, and buy behavior Key competitors’ in-country strategy, business models, sales performance, pin-to-pin analysis SKU assortment based on market demand, especially for Special Edition chairs Market trends, consumer interests/ sentiment toward our relevant industries, including but not limited to gaming, esports, and pop-culture. Support internal marketing and in-country teams in the research, planning and execution of key launches and brand campaigns  • Manage seller centre operations for markets with Amazon as the main point of sales  • Collaborate with the wider Secretlab organization to manage end-to-end in-market operations (e.g. Marketing, Product, Customer Service and Finance)  • Identify new opportunities to grow Secretlab’s online & offline presence outside of key points of sales, for example, brand collaborations, bank partnerships, etc.  • Assist the Regional Market Manager in the planning and executing of new market entries.  Requirements: • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in business, marketing • At least 3 years’ sales experience in an e-commerce environment (Brand and/or marketplace)  • Strong working knowledge of seller centre operations for marketplaces including but not limited to Lazada, Shopee, Tokopedia, Amazon (good-to-have) • Strong ability to analyze, interpret and extract trends from data • Excellent verbal communication and presentation skills • Able to work in a fast-paced environment, while managing multiple projects.  Bonuses: • Additional language capabilities beyond English, preferred language(s): Thai, Japanese, Bahasa Indonesia, Tagalog (for localization of marketing content in Thailand, Japan, Indonesia, or Philippines). • Passion for and knowledge of the gaming & esports industries • Strong understanding of consumer psychology • Experience in working with multiple markets, preferably, non-English speaking.    For more details on this position and other opportunities, please refer to our careers page

description: Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.  The Account Management team is a sales team that is part of Facebook’s Global Business Group. This team is focused on connecting every business in the world with their customers on Facebook and then helping them grow through solutions like Facebook Pages and Advertising. Account Managers are directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients grow their own business results on Facebook through consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will have the ability to drive marketing strategy coupled with a willingness to roll up their sleeves and execute their sales tactics. Success in this position requires exceptional consultative sales, coaching, and client service skills; a willingness to experiment; the ability to thrive in a dynamic, team-focused environment; and a passion for helping others to achieve results. This position is full-time and located in our Singapore Office.  Responsibilities Become an expert in Facebook’s digital marketing solutions for small and medium clients and adapt recommendations quickly to suit varying client needs Grow revenue, educate and lead strategic conversations with small and medium clients, and manage complex relationships Demonstrate vertical expertise in all matters relevant to your book of business, including escalation and troubleshooting to resolve client issues Work with small and medium clients to improve the performance of their overall Facebook campaigns Minimum Qualification BA/BS degree 0-2 years of work experience in account management, brand management, performance marketing, digital marketing, sales or consulting Strong communication skills Fluency in Vietnamese language & knowledge of Vietnam market are essential as the role requires to manage local accounts & communicate business strategy in local language Ability to effectively prioritise and manage tasks within a fast-paced environment while maintaining strict attention to detail Structured problem solving and quantitative analytical skills Sales discipline and feel aspired to go after sales goals

description: Employment Hero is one of Australia's fastest-growing tech companies. Our world-class software is the easiest way for small to medium-sized businesses to manage HR, payroll, employee engagement, and benefits. Having expanded globally in late 2020 we will continue to grow rapidly in 2021 and beyond.  We believe in distributed employment and take a ‘Remote First' approach with our team. We don't mind where in Singapore you're based, if you've got the skills for the role and the passion for our mission then we want to hear from you.  This position, based in Singapore, is a newly created role. Although working remotely, you'll be part of an engaged, high-performing and driven sales team of 50.  This is the perfect opportunity to join an innovative business that challenges the status quo and sets the benchmark for others to follow. You'll be part of an open, team-oriented and results-based culture where your input is encouraged and your success is rewarded. Uncapped Commission structure - OTE of $180k +  Want to know more about this role? Check out our hiring video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=elkXiSlEJjA  Employment Hero celebrates diverse perspectives and experiences, we invite people of all backgrounds and identities to apply for this position.  Responsibilities This role is best suited to an experienced and self motivated Business Development Manager / Account Executive with an engaging personality and strong work ethic. You will be selling to SMEs (businesses with 10 - 120 employees) and speaking to business owners and C-Level Executives. Similar experience in this capacity, especially within a SaaS environment, would be well regarded. Your ability to learn quickly, take initiative and embrace technology will see you succeed. This is a high volume role, so a proven record in managing a large pipeline with a fast paced sales cycle will be highly beneficial. You will utilise warm leads from the marketing team and outbound SDR team to pitch, demo, present, and win new business. Lead generation has a hybrid model with a 70/30 split between your calendar already filled from our energetic SDRs and self-generated opportunities through cold calling, prospecting, networking and developing strategic partnerships.  Requirements 2+ years' experience in a B2B sales role (performing the full sales cycle) SaaS industry experience Experience selling to C-Level Executives and stakeholders within the SMB market Experience managing a high volume of opportunities and a fast sales cycle Proven sales track record Exposure to the Human Resources and/or payroll industry would be advantageous, but is not required Training in sales techniques including Challenger, SPIN, or consultative selling would be an added bonus!  Benefits Uncapped commission (OTE $180k +) Work from home Self, health, wealth and happiness programs Remote-first and flexible working arrangements A generous budget to spend on setting up your home office (if you need a desk, chair, screen? You name it!) We set you up for success with the latest and greatest hardware, tools and tech Virtual yoga classes Weekly virtual happy-hour and social events to get to know your new colleagues Quarterly & yearly team celebrations  Why join Employment Hero? Raised $140M Series E round led by Insight Partners July 2021 The Australian Top 100 Innovators List 2021 Raised $45M Series D round led by Seek 2021 Deloitte Technology Fast 50 2020, ranked #42 in Australia LinkedIn Top 10 Startups 2020 Raised $22M Series C Round led by Seek July 2019 Raised $8 mill series B round led by Seek and OneVentures Deloitte Technology Fast 50 2019, ranked #20 in Australia GetApp Category Leader Q1 2019 Deloitte Technology Fast 50 2018, ranked #12 in Australia HRD Gold Medalist - Human Capital Management Systems 2018 HRD Gold Medalist - Rewards and Recognition Service Provider 2018 HRD Rewards and Recognition Employer of Choice 2018 LinkedIn Top 25 Startups 2018 EY Entrepreneur of the Year National Finalist 2018 Dynamic Business Top 10 Entrepreneurs, our CEO Ben Thompson ranked #2 BRW Most Innovative Companies 2015 Anthill Smart 100 List 2015 Startup Daily Top 50 Emerging Leaders 2015 HRD Employer of Choice Award 2015 Aon Hewitt Best Employers 2013

description: Reports to: Managing Director Commercial Business, Asia Pacific  Job Summary  This is an experienced sales support role assisting Bell’s Asia Pacific sales region by developing product literature, proposals, purchase agreements and customer quotes. This position will also require organizing resources, presentation venues, preparing sales presentation materials, maintaining details on all contacts, preparation of sales reports and any other aspect related to the effective administration of the Sales Team. After a period of learning the business, the successful candidate may have the opportunity to take on increasing levels of responsibility.  Responsibilities Compare, differentiate and communicate product features based on customer needs and requirements. Advance into roles of increasing customer interface and responsibility Develop sales literature, sales proposals, and purchase agreements Coordinate delivery of marketing materials to Sales Managers Develop & implement plans for aircraft demonstrations, trade shows and sales meetings Forecast annual sales goals Ensure that Sales Force.com is current for assigned region Coordinate aircraft deliveries Support achievement of annual sales goals for assigned region Monitor budget for assigned region Work with Finance, Customer Support Services, Contracts and Legal to ensure compliance Potential growth into international role supporting region  Education Bachelors degree in business, engineering or related field. In lieu of degree, six years of closely related experience in aviation/aerospace industry may be considered. (Rotorcraft experience preferred) Position Requirements At least four years of experience in a Sales or Marketing capacity with two years being in the aerospace/aviation industry (Rotorcraft experience preferred) Fluent in English. Sales Representative handling Chinese speaking market, proficient in Chinese is required. Spoken and written fluency in an Asian language (Bahasa Indonesia, Thai) is beneficial. Previous Asia-based education or work experience is strongly preferred. Excellent relationship building skills Knowledge of aviation and in particular, Helicopter operations is preferred Demonstrated organizational skills, written/oral communication skills and proficiency in Microsoft Office software Position will require travel throughout the Asia Pacific Region Ability to grasp concepts and skills along with potential to assume more responsible role Job Field  Sales  Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore  Recruiting Company  Bell Textron Inc.  Schedule  Full-time  Job Level  Individual Contributor  Shift  First Shift  Travel  Yes, 20 % of the Time  Job Posting  03/07/2021, 5:46:24 PM

description: As part of the Customer Business Development team, you will help deliver retail sales target, optimize customer profits, manage inventory holdings to a mutually agreed target, and develop channel trade plans with customer to ensure timely execution of trade plans of the online boutique/s of the brand/s you manage. Equipped with enthusiasm and skill, you will be primarily responsible to:  Strategic account planning, leveraging our product and service capabilities, driving profitable business growth; Set sales growth targets with clients and ensure end-to-end account profitability and growth of key accounts assigned; Maintain as the main point of communication contact between clients and the various internal departments, in support of client’s specific e-commerce business needs, which includes channel distribution, creative and content creation, marketing support, other IT services related to e-commerce store management or website management; Daily management planning of inventory for both consignment and outright-purchase stocks, maximizing sales, while leveraging on e-marketplace campaigns and brand’s marketing, promotional campaigns, while minimizing stock-out and excess stockholding risk; Regular business reviews with key clients to ensure that key performance indicators are met and strategize to improve KPIs; Regularly present or consult with senior level management on business trends with a view to developing new services or introduction of new products or product categories; and Use knowledge of the market and competitors to identify and promote company’s unique selling propositions and differentiators to potential new clients  Synagie believes that you are a good fit for this role, if you: With at least diploma/bachelor’s degree in any discipline; With at least 2 years of relevant working experience; Keen to work in e-commerce Have an entrepreneurial spirit and strong commercial acumen; Possess good communication skills and able to work in a fast paced but nurturing environment; Hardworking with positive attitude; Are a team player   About Synagie Synagie is an eCommerce company that provides end-to-end commerce enablement solutions to businesses selling online and offline. Our mission is to simplify commerce and make it easier for brands and businesses to sell online. Established in 2014, our clients include some of the world’s leading MNCs in the consumer goods sector and SMEs who are looking to simplify the complex commerce process.  Why Choose to join Synagie:   The vision. Synagie wants to be the best. We thrive on innovation. We are competitive, but we compete only with ourselves. The feeling of working on something that will only get bigger and better is unparalleled.  The culture. We have and startup culture and everyone has a voice. We promote an environment of open discussions and we treat each other as a family.  The people. We have such an incredible and diverse mix of people from all walks of life. You will work with the smartest, warmest, and most talented people in this industry. Working with such remarkable professionals makes one beam with pride.  The expertise. The main thrust of Synagie is continuous improvement of talent through mentoring, testing & learning, and training. We make sure you grow where you want to. With us, you will be able to learn so much about products, processes and providing excellent customer experience - all of which may pave future opportunities to manage the company’s business while chartering the next chapter of Synagie’s growth and a lot more!  The E-Commerce. Be in the thick of the E-Commerce action where we work with FMCG and Prestige Beauty brands as well as Channel partners to drive business growth, consumers' penetration and enhance shopping journey.
industries: Internet

description: Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 87 million registered learners as of June 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.  Job Overview  The Enterprise Solutions team serves global organizations, including leading companies, governments, and nonprofits, who seek to upskill or retrain their workforce with the world’s best education. This team is made up of three sub-teams: Sales, Customer Success, and Revenue Strategy & Operations. The teams operate globally and have members based out of our offices in Mountain View, New York, London, Gurgaon, and Abu Dhabi. As a part of Coursera’s APAC team, you will play a key role in increasing global access to world-class education in the Singapore Market. You will lead a team of Enterprise Account Executives. The Enterprise AE team drives revenue across Coursera’s Enterprise customers (5,000+ employees) in Singapore. The role also requires working across the organization (with marketing, inside sales, product, university partnerships, skills transformation, customer success, technical implementation and legal) in service of Coursera’s growth and long-term success. This is a senior role that is expected to grow in remit with growth in the Singapore market. Reporting to the APAC Enterprise Director, the person fulfilling this role is expected to be a key senior leader in the region and play a significant contributing role in developing strategy and go to market execution in Singapore as well as input into APAC growth plans.  Responsibilities Driving your team’s success and delivering the team's opportunity creation and revenue goals in the Enterprise space Meet and exceed all team quarterly and annual sales quotas, drive pipeline growth across Singapore Enterprise accounts, ensure accurate reporting of leads, pipeline, activities and forecasts Partner with Customer Success to meet and exceed all quarterly and annual renewal quotas; partner with marketing & sales leadership on prospecting, campaigns, and other initiatives Improve time to productivity for new AEs while maintaining performance in existing team; develop experienced team members for promotion and internal mobility opportunities; coach team members on inbound/outbound techniques, sales process and Challenger sales Attend key prospect and client meetings to support sales opportunities; use knowledge of industry trends to consult and support the team with customers; provide analyses to inform the team on general trends, product, competitors and act as a senior leader for the business and play an active role in GTM strategy Check out life at Coursera on The Muse!  Basic Qualifications 15+ years of demonstrated success across sales and team leadership roles where enterprise selling is the core of revenue generation, delivering revenues of $10M+ Demonstrated history of driving revenue in an enterprise software environment, with ideally an experience of HR / LMS / Talent or education-based solutions Experience as a leader of customer functions, with a bias to sales, and ability to influence marketing and customer success Demonstrated history as a sales business manager capable of evaluating, building, and executing on a strategy to drive accelerated growth in Singapore & engage top C-level customers on their strategic talent transformation initiatives Entrepreneurial drive and comfort working as part of a team in ambiguous, quickly-changing environments Preferred Qualifications Understanding of digital transformation imperatives & initiatives from customers of key Industries in Singapore Past experience in setting up Singapore operations of a global company and scaling them Business written and verbal communication skills, strong analytical and creative problem solving abilities, excellent interpersonal skills, organizational, and operational skills If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:  Foundations of Business Strategy  Successful Negotiation: Essential Strategies and Skills  Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class.  If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.  Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Want to be part of the fastest growing startup that is at the intersection of Retail, Fintech and Data?  Qashier is looking for an amazing Sales Coordinator to support our growth!  We are a dynamic and fast growing team that is excited about commerce, retail and payments, and the opportunity to transform these industries with data and technology.  We are looking for a detail-oriented Sales Coordinator to contribute to the achievement of sales targets by supporting sales representatives and coordinating sales activities. The Sales Coordinator main responsibility is to act as a force multiplier to the sales team to improve their productivity. This is an exciting entry level role with a strong mix of sales, administrative and customer service responsibilities.  In short, you’ll be driving Qashier’s success in the following ways: Maximising the productivity of the Sales team by assisting with the generation of quotations/invoices and being the first point of contact with merchants regarding government grant applications and merchant payment account setups. Collaborate closely with Operations and Account Management departments to ensure that merchant onboarding, account setup and order fulfilment are handled accurately and efficiently. Assist with qualifying and nurturing potential leads that may enquire through the company’s sales hotline, emails and messages. Developing and maintaining proper documentation and systems so as to maintain sales records, prepare reports and provide financial information to the Finance department.   What you should bring along 0-1 year of experience in Sales, Business Development or Administration Diploma/Degree in Business Administration or a related field Strong interpersonal skills with good bilingual oral abilities (English and Chinese) A keen attention to detail and customer service oriented Excellent organisational and administrative skills with a strong ability to multitask Passionate about technology, Fintech and the retail space  Why join Qashier? Be at the forefront of a fast-growing startup in an exciting sector. Qashier’s innovative platform combines the latest developments in Cloud technology, Payments and Data to transform the Retail & F&B industries. You’ll play a crucial role on the growth of a revolutionary product that will become a key platform behind successful retail businesses in the region. Amazing growth and learning opportunities. We are a tight knit team where everyone grows together. We’ll continuously work with you to refine your strengths and strengthen your weaknesses to further your personal and career development. Make a strong impact with your work. You’ll be working directly with hundreds of small businesses across the region where the work that you do will make a direct impact to the success of these businesses. Attractive compensation and bonuses  ABOUT QASHIER Qashier (qashier.com) powers SMEs with a technology platform that combines a smart POS terminal and integrated payment acceptance with a diverse app store of both in-house and third party business applications. By pairing technology with a strong commitment to merchant success, Qashier helps retail and F&B businesses increase revenue, streamline operations, and create loyal customers.
industries: Information Technology and Services and Financial Services

description: About Tritium is a Brisbane-based technology company whose mission is to offer energy freedom. We do this as a world-leading electric vehicle charging infrastructure developer that enables the acceptance and growth of e-mobility. Tritium is a fast-growing global company with offices in Brisbane, Los Angeles, Amsterdam and Singapore. In a global environment that is hungry for innovation in the use and storage of energy, Tritium leads the way in the design, manufacture, and distribution of fast-charging infrastructure for electric vehicles.   The Sales Coordinator will be based in Singapore and report to Regional Vice President, APAC and Middle East. The sales coordinator will provide vital support to the front-end sales team. For example, handling critical back-office sales tasks, such as SalesForce administration, order processing, customer complaints and resolution, sales lead management and communication, delivery schedule management for internal and external.  You You are naturally an upbeat, positive person who is eager to learn as well as being customer-focused. Highly organized, with excellent attention to detail, you can work in a fast-paced environment and adhere to strict deadlines. You will also have the following skills and abilities:   The ability to multitask without losing the quality of work A dedicated team player  Ability to work under strict deadlines You thrive in an ever-changing environment. You love to keep busy and are always looking to find a way to help out Ability to work autonomously, within a team but not afraid to communicate your needs Strategic thinker with a solutions mindset  Role We require someone who can come in and make an impact, generate leads, and build up our brand awareness. This role will require a working horse who doesn't mind autonomy and can't wait to get started. You will be responsible but not limited to:  SalesForce – ability to navigate and provide admirative support to front end sales team.  Proposals – prepare proposals for given opportunities  Order processing – ensure sales order from conformity  Customers complain, and resolution – capture customer, complain and coordinate internally for an effective resolution  Sales lead management and communication – lead response and follow up  Delivery schedule management – ensure timely status updates and coordinate on-time delivery to all customers  Strategic presentation – ability to develop PowerPoint presentations   Qualifications & Competencies Degree/Diploma in Business Administration  5-10 years of proven work experience as a sales team administrator, proposals, and/or back-office sales support function Experienced with CRM software and M.S. Office. Ability to develop an executive-level strategic presentation based on market research and database.   Reward This is an incredible opportunity to join a thriving business that is just getting started. It is fast-paced, and Tritium is kicking some major goals within the industry and its sector. Offering competitive salaries and plenty of growth opportunities, joining is a no brainer.  Tritium is an equal opportunity employer. Therefore, we will not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, gender, gender expression, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status.

description: Company Description  The IKEA vision is to create a better everyday life for the many people. We do this by offering a wide range of well-designed, functional home furnishing products at prices so low that as many people as possible can afford them. We operate in Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand – and have an ambitious expansion plan to bring a little bit of Sweden to new markets in the region. We are part of the Ikano Group of companies and the only IKEA franchisee owned by the Kamprad family that founded IKEA.  We also develop, own and operate Shopping Centres that are anchored by IKEA and create walkable communities by including residential, office and other types of real estate in our development plans.  We work towards making sustainability a natural part of our everyday work. We are active in our communities, driving and supporting social initiatives that benefit children, women and the environment.  Job Description  About the job  IKEA Jurong is a unique city centre store in a popular shopping mall. It is a smaller store with a big turnover and with 3 milion visitors. It will be lead by an ambitious team consisting of the Store, Commercial, Operations, IKEA Food and a Retail Foundation Manager.  In your role as Sales & Service Generalist, you will ensure end to end shopping experience and apply home furnishing knowledge to provide relevant solutions to customers.  Your assignment To know and understand the customers’ shopping behaviour, retail trends & life at home and use this knowledge to provide the relevant solutions for our customers; To ensure that sales and profitability is secured through sales steering and range efficiency to maximise growth; To know the importance and actively work with replenishment proposal- securing the right parameters to ensure product availability ; To ensure that my area of responsibility is in excellent shape as new, fully stocked and that a high level of merchandising basics is always in place; To contribute towards improving the customer experience in the store and maintain a high level of service standard with a “First time right” mindset; To support a customer-friendly and efficient execution of the payments, exchange & returns and click and collect process. Qualifications  Your profile You have the ability to make things happen by championing flexibility, speed and simplicity; You have the ability to align customer needs and expectations with business needs. You have the ability to communicate with various levels of co-workers from different functions; You have the ability to work on agreed working methods independently and reliably You have the ability to find solutions for customer and operational issues. Additional Information  Please apply by 15 September 2021
industries: Consumer Goods, Retail, and Financial Services

description: About us: Zoho Corporation is a leading technology company with over 9000+ employees worldwide with customers in over 180+ countries. With more than 50 million business users around the globe, Zoho is excited to be driving innovation in every aspect of business software and is now looking for the right candidate to join our team. If you are interested to be associated with a global leader in cloud and business solutions, please read on.  Job Description: We are looking for a Regional Sales Director who would be responsible for all sales in the region. The regional role includes a broader ASEAN region including all countries from Hong Kong to Sri Lanka.  This role will work in collaboration with the sales, technical team and solution experts to deliver a compelling value proposition that helps win deals.  Responsibilities: Provide regional sales leadership and guidance to help grow revenue (direct and via partners) from new and existing customers. Mentor a regional sales, technical and partner team. Orchestrate internal teams to build collaboratively and present right solutions to customers Help, guide and mentor the team to meet the quarterly sales target set. Close complex sales deals and ensure customer success. Create presentations and proposals and meet with and talk to C-level executives as needed to close deals. Manage sales and partners.  Role Requirements: Proven 12+ years experience in software sales with the knowledge of handling direct and channel sales. You should be familiar with the region. Exceptional team leadership and people-management skills and the ability to work with multiple internal teams to close complex deals. You should have excellent communication skills. Being a thought leader, you will provide the right context and recommendations  to decision makers through extensive business and product knowledge You will have proven experience servicing Singapore and other countries in South East Asia as this is a must for job success. Collaborate with Zoho product teams and update product knowledge constantly. Experience in engaging with SI Partners/ Tier 1 resellers in the SaaS space would be an added advantage Experience with other CRM or relevant SaaS vendors would be an added advantage.  Qualifications: Degree or equivalent experience in relevant area. Years of experience : 12+ years experience in a sales role in software. Ability to write and communicate in fluent English and one local language. Salary includes variable Pay and will be based on experience & outcomes. This role is based out of our office in Singapore and will require you to travel for product  team interactions to our international headquarters in Chennai, India (~ yearly once) when the overall situation is favourable for travel.

description: As the Head of BD and Sales, Esports, you will drive new business opportunities with strategic partners and brand partners across our owned and operated esports properties in Southeast Asia and Globally . You will build valuable alliances and drive incremental revenue across esports, and co-marketing opportunities. As a member of the SEA leadership team, you will drive cohesion across our markets and act as a sounding board for all markets into the efficacy and potential of new business opportunities for MOONTON Esports.  Responsibilities Based in Singapore, you will join an internationally and culturally diverse team of professionals that share our goal of reinforcing and building on MOONTON Esports our market position and growth:  Lead a team of Business Development and Partnership Management professionals to achieve both MOONTON and partner objectives Drive the commercial and sponsorship sales funnel and pipeline, including sourcing new business, negotiating terms, executing contracts, and overseeing fulfillment of obligations. Produce MOONTON Esports regional and global sponsorship marketing and sales proposals and subsequent go-to-market strategies Collaborate across esports teams to identify new business opportunities, technologies, and assets to build unique and valuable opportunities for partner integration Identify opportunities to bundle MOONTON Esports properties together for higher impact Oversee partnership management across both sports, ensuring S-tier collaboration with partners and industry-leading activations Maintain a deep and current understanding of esports, sports and entertainment industries  Required Qualifications 6-8+ years of experience in partnerships or business development, successfully structuring, negotiating and closing deals and owning projects from inception through launch and ongoing execution You have experience working with partners, both internal and external, at all levels You have experience leading a team Have an existing extensive network of brands and advertisers across SEA Comfortable with ambiguity; you can effectively shift gears quickly and comfortably, decide and act without having the complete picture, and comfortably handle uncertainty  Desired Qualifications Comprehensive understanding of the players in the gaming, esports, technology and entertainment verticals Experience with product development and innovation; not only do you execute sales but you possess the creativity to design new and compelling products to sell Proven experience in partnerships and/or business development in gaming, esports, sports, content distribution, and/or live entertainment Significant contract negotiation and management experience in a wide variety of regional, international and local deal structures Excellent relationship management, communication, and project management capabilities Excellent writing and presentation building skills Track record of successful partnerships and deals with proven KPIs like high renewal rates Command of a relevant language preferred, but not required (Mandarin, Tagalog, Bahasa Malay/Indonesian)

We strive to ensure all our people practices are non-discriminatory and provide a fair, performance-based work culture that is diverse, inclusive and collaborative.  Join us and experience what it’s like to be with an Employer of Choice*. Together, let’s create a brighter digital future for all. *Awarded at the HR Fest Awards 2020.  Responsibilities A focused strategic selling role, identifying and driving qualified opportunities from pre-sales to close of business contracts whether it is a master agreement or a single mobile line & equipment contract Close businesses (whether new, win-back or renewal) that will add and maintain overall business and account top line revenue growth while managing and up-selling customers to avert revenue erosion Identify, lead and drive sales focused activities in scoping (prioritizing) and communicating the account opportunities, objectives, strategy and resource requirements (whether new, win-back or renewal businesses) with colleagues like Account managers and marketing managers to achieve a healthy revenue stream for Singtel from the business won or maintained Work with Account managers to identify and qualify to develop an account To lead and conduct regular account discussions with the account managers and account directors to ensure alignment in customer experience To lead and drive the sales process from meeting the customer to scope, prepare sales proposals, conduct presentations, negotiate up to the closing of business with qualified customers Proactively monitor market changes and competition and feedback on important activities (e.g. technical developments, industry trends, new features and services etc.) to Sales and Marketing teams Requirements A diploma or degree is preferred At least 5 years of enterprise sales experience in telco/IT industries, with experience in opportunity and account leadership and a track record of successful sales in complex environments and solutions

description: Trames is looking for a Sales Development Executive with B2B sales experience who is passionate about growing the sales function in a tech start-up environment. You will be responsible for marketing Trames’ products and/or services by leveraging a multi-channel approach that consists of telephone, email, LinkedIn, events and partnership with other service providers and/or associations - to engage new prospects and/or existing SME customers. Your primary focus is to generate discovery meetings with prospects and convert such prospects to customers.  As the startup is relatively young, there will be various opportunities to take on new tasks if there is interest, and contribute significantly all the way from the start. The team is growing rapidly, and you will be part of an extremely dynamic and flat team.   Responsibilities Drive signup and usage of the Trames platform Prospect consistently through a multi-channel approach to engage and convert prospects to customers Manage sales pipeline and track metrics to ensure targets are hit Analyze market and establish competitive advantages Provides routine analytical and administrative support for customers and partners to guide them through their renewal opportunity and process Apply critical thinking to make recommendations in situations not covered by defined work parameters Collaborate well with others, in person and remotely, to achieve team or individual sales objectives Provides routine analytical and administrative support for customers and partners for up-sell and cross-sell opportunities Working closely with product team to ensure high adoption of the solution and collaborate internally to maximise the value of the solution for customers Effective internal and customer communication skills with proven sales record and rapport with customers and partners Generate reports as required  Qualifications Bachelor's degree 2+ years in B2B sales industry Experience in full sales cycle including deal closing with demonstrated sales success is preferred Familiar with MS Office Strong negotiation skills Strong communication and presentation skills Proficient in English and Mandarin  What Does Success Look Like? Driven with a strong desire to succeed and grow your career in sales Target orientated, proactive, open-minded and organised Willing to constantly experiment with different sales structure and processes Ability to manage multiple stakeholders simultaneously  Company Profile Trames is a supply chain digitisation tech solution designed to improve collaboration and visibility between disparate stakeholders across long and complex supply chains. We achieve this through a collaborative workflow management tool, real time track and trace capabilities and advanced analytics.

description: Business Development Manager - Remote (Singapore)  App Annie is always looking for extraordinary candidates with Mobile, SaaS, analytics background and we'd love to get to know you! We do not have any current openings for a Business Development Manger in this location, however, in the event that a position opens up, we'd love for you to be the first person to know! Below is what we traditionally look for:  Something About Us...  App Annie is the industry’s most trusted mobile data and analytics platform. Our mission is to help customers create winning mobile experiences and achieve excellence. We created the mobile app data market and are committed to delivering the industry’s most complete mobile performance offering. More than 1,200 enterprise clients and 1 million registered users across the globe and spanning all industries rely on App Annie as the standard to revolutionize their mobile business. We are headquartered in San Francisco with 12 offices worldwide.  Along with a market defining product, we take great pride in our culture and values and strive to embody them daily! We set a high bar for our success and have made Excellence as our standard, hold each other Accountable, continuously push Innovation and Win with Style.  What can you tell your friends when they ask you what you do?  As an App Annie Business Development Manager, you are a high-energy, driven individual with knowledge of technology and solid business-to-business sales and account management experience. AA offers a fast-paced, innovative environment where you will be empowered to sell advertising analytics to the world's most innovative brands and publishers. Our goal is to build an organization of smart, ambitious team members committed to our mission and focused on winning, but always doing it right. Bias to action, bias to learning everyday, self-starter, great collaborator, and focused on learning and growing daily.  At AA, integrity and reliability are as important as talent and effort.  You will be responsible for and take pride in…. Drive adoption, engagement, and usage across the Connect product set for all market segment Showcase the value of our App Annie Connect offering to new and existing customers Forecast sales activity and critical achievements in salesforce.com, while creating satisfied and reference-able customers Ability to decipher key product gaps within the current product offering and regularly provide feedback to the product team. Ability to work effectively Cross-functionally as well as globally Exceptional customer relationship skills, and time management Bias towards high activity, (calls, emails, webinars, content, etc) Strong analytical ability to spot data trends, and uncover key customer insights desired. You should recognize yourself in the following… Experience managing complex sales-cycles Previous Sales Methodology training 3-4 years sales experience w/at least 24 months in closing role Strong, demonstrated written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in a fast paced, team environment Track record of over-achieving quota (top 10-20% of company) in past positions Strong customer references What We Offer… We provide a WFH allowance to set you up for remote work success. Internet allowance for stable internet connection, so your video does not freeze on Zoom. Flexible working days. We love to meet, but if you need to get your kids behind school-zoom, need to leave early to get to your band repetition or gym classes, do your thing. Paid leave, so long as you promise to come back! Health and dental benefits. An international team of talented and engaged people from different cultural backgrounds and locations. Wellbeing allowance for any activity that matters to your wellbeing; (online) gym classes, fitness equipment, mindfulness apps or even childcare support! Unlimited access to online learning platform Udemy to help you develop your skills. Virtual initiatives and events to keep you connected with your colleagues. Yes, I want this job!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: JOB SUMMARY  As Sales Support Executive, Oleochemicals, the key responsibilities are to provide sales administrative support to facilitate the business and information flow, as well as trade execution for the Oleochemical group. This can be done through the following accountabilities:   Order and Trade Management – Monitor trade flows between various sales offices and manufacturing sites, and provide necessary support and follow up on documentation, and assist with time order entry, analysis and issuance of documents such as purchase/sales contracts etc.  Sales and Administrative Support – Provide necessary administrative assistance and support to the various sales and marketing functions (demand planning, product management, material sourcing etc.), including but not limited to submission of sample requests, meeting preparation, minute-taking, dissemination of market updates.   MAIN DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Submission of Purchase Orders to Vendors Input of Sales/Purchase legs into enterprise system (SAP, CXC) Support Demand Planner on Sales Forecasting and Planning efforts, such as Forecast consolidation and compilation Consolidate individual Sales Manager’s Weekly Flashes, Lost Sales, Import/Export Data (where applicable) for use in sales forums Manage submission of Call Reports from SMs post-customer visits Disseminate Market Updates (ICIS/Oleoline/LMC etc.) to the sales team Provide support on Brochures/Print/Marketing Material Liaise with external Market Reporting agencies on Subscription Renewal, where necessary Any other administrative matter pertaining to Sales as required   JOB REQUIREMENTS:  EDUCATION At least a Diploma in Commerce, Business or equivalent.  EXPERIENCE With 1 to 3 years of experience in sales administration or equivalent function Applicants with strong interest and no prior work experience are also encourage to apply  PERSONALITY TRAITS Keen eye for detail and analytical mindset. Interpersonal skills to manage between key stakeholders Works independently and also in a team Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint and Word.

description: Description  What You Will Do In Your Role  Early Sales Development Activities Lead Generation and Management in Salesforce from nurturing to prospecting. Customer mapping with distributors to continuously identify new opportunities and focus customers. Identifying new market, application, new trending demand through research, news or customers feedback. Pre-sales Activities Support customers’ RFQ, customer inquiries, Salesforce Case Management and leads from MLQ or distribution channels, periodic business review which includes price negotiation, new opportunity, and business award. Provide related documents (sales drawing, product specification, testing report, etc.) and samples of existing product through Case Management and create PDR when necessary Manage project qualification process and support customer in all requirements to make sure we are on-track to successful conversion of revenue. Ensure Molex product and design approved in the BOM as AVL (Approved Vendor List) by tracking opportunity conversion rate through bookings and orders. Sales Activities Prepare sales call/customer visit, periodic business review and monthly sales reports. Share market and industry insight through information gather from distributors and customer in regular update of the upside opportunity and downside risk with detail information to DSM/RSM. Build strong relationship with customer key decision-makers across different functional groups and Molex distributors to grow Molex brand awareness with them. Build a strong project pipeline and timely tracking of the assigned key customers/programs by maximizing Molex footprint in new/existing programs. Analyze order trend, review Customer/distributor inventory status to ensure sufficient backlogs. Manage all contracts with customers, including negotiates general T&C with customers on payment terms, shipping terms etc. Regular review with distributor partners, maintain & increase order share in targeted accounts and review new business opportunities, focus customers with them on regular basis in QBR (Quarterly Business Review) and Monthly review. Support company's initiatives on Social Responsibility, TS16949, ISO9001/14001, TQM, Six Sigma, Kaizen etc. Grow in value creation to the company, promoting and exercising MBM guiding principles and cultures. Other duties as assigned by management The Experience You Will Bring  Requirements Bachelor’s Degree holder or its equivalent Applicants without relevant experience welcome to apply, training will be provided Interpersonal skills to effectively work with co-workers and external contracts to respond positively to situations Strong organization skills to anticipate, plan, organize and self-monitor workload Good presentation skills that demonstrate the ability to prepare and deliver concise and effective presentations to internal and external stakeholders Working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint and Word) What Will Put You Ahead Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical/ Electronics/ Mechanical Engineering 2-3 years sales experience in electronics industry Experience in design-in with OEMs/ODMs Proven track record and contacts with key decision maker/influencer and other executives within the industry will be an added advantage

description: Company  Description  LingoAce is a global leading EdTech (education technology) company, headquartered in Singapore, that currently focuses on providing a quality and immersive Chinese language learning experience to students aged 4 to 15 years old. In addition to its headquarters in Singapore, LingoAce also has a presence in Beijing, Wuhan, Chengdu, Silicon Valley, Bangkok and Jakarta and will continue to expand into other parts of the world to meet the growing demand for language learning.  Founded in 2017, LingoAce leverages its experienced teaching team, AI-powered tools, gamification features and research-backed methodology to provide students with the best learning experience and results.  LingoAce has raised several rounds of venture funding from leading global investors, including Sequoia, Tiger Global and Owl Ventures, to support its vision for revolutionizing learning across the world.  Today, LingoAce has a total registered student base of 300,000 students across 80 countries – coming from families of different nationalities including international expats, Chinese immigrants, and local parents. The company has more than 3,000 teachers and 1,250 employees globally.  The Role  At LingoAce, we’re on a trajectory of quick growth, owing to excellent product, customer obsession and great execution. Our course consultants (CCs) are the enablers of these growth by being the product ambassadors who guide our customers: the parents, through an introduction to the product and eventually onboard them as customers.  We are looking for a highly qualified Course Consultant Manager to lead our Course Consultants. Integral to the topline growth of the company, you will recruit, train, and lead all functions within the Course Consultants team, including course consultants, quality assurance and training.  Responsibilities Lead and own the sales & sales ops team that is dedicated to growing the business 360 through delivering an excellent trial and conversion to paid users at scale. Being a strong customer advocate and able to insightfully identify users’ pain points to better attune our product and services to answer to those relevant points. Manage day-to-day operations of your team including escalations from your direct reports, the delivery of high-quality conversation and follow-ups with the parents, and ensuring teams meet the monthly revenue and expense targets. Collaborate effectively and work closely with various stakeholders ranging from marketing, product, curriculum, teacher management & training, product marketing, learning advisors & operations in driving rapid and scalable growth for the company. Spearhead ambitious yet achievable sales planning & forecasting in ensuring business operations achieve the business objective. Empower and advise our respective teams in making the right decision with data support and insights from a varying perspectives using the right data and analysis. Guide team to conduct ad hoc research on Singapore’s external landscape (eg. Competitions) for current products and SEA external landscape in the future. Requirements BA/BS degree with at least 4 years of experience working in either consulting/ strategy/ commercial/ planning role of a fast-paced consulting / banking / high growth company. At least 1 year of team management experience. Strong proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint and comfortable with datasets and quantitative analysis. Good communication skills and ability to articulate priorities to cross-functional audiences. Self-starter, entrepreneurial mindset, growth, and action-biased mentality that can operate with ambiguity. Fluent in both English and Chinese to handle Chinese speaking partners. Candidates who possess Ed-tech experience is a plus.
industries: E-Learning

We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.  Join us. Shape your story here. Compiles On-Air Transmission reports, Digital Performance reports, post-campaign Reports, CD-compilations, checking of monthly client invoices, as briefed by the Sales team Research (10%) Monitors competitor channels and provides information to the sales teams on competitor activity Administration (20%) Regularly update product information (credentials presentation, media kits, programme grids, distribution, sales policy, Ratecard etc.) to maintain alignment with other global offices and deliver consistent messaging Submit monthly sales forecast, pipeline and sponsorship information in the standard format Job Requirements Educated to degree level or equivalent Min. 2 years of relevant experience of working in agency / media owner required Interested in and possessing some knowledge of Media/News Broadcasting Sales A strong proficiency in the English language will be important for the position Working proficiency in any additional languages an advantage Strong administrative and organization skills Immediate availability is preferred The Perks Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies Access to in-house learning and development resources Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. description: Full Time Position, Sales and Marketing Executive, KiteSense  About KiteSense KiteSense is a learning analytics company. Our mission is to empower educators to shift from a one-size fits all approach, to provide personalised learning experiences. Our proprietary software modules – Student 360, Learning Journey, MyKiteSenseBot, Grader, Insights and Worksheets, provide a seamless and complete system for the littlest of learners to those in higher education, and empowers educators to effectively integrate learning data, educational interventions and curriculum development. KiteSense is dedicated to making the best learning systems in order to empower teachers, through data analytics, to be better educators. We care a lot about personal development and will lend emphasis on your growth and development.  Job Brief We are looking for a talented Sales and Marketing Executive with an analytical mindset. You will work closely with the Marketing Director for generating, managing and executing sales and marketing initiatives for our products. This includes running experiments across the funnel, improving conversion rates and working cross-department to collaborate on new initiatives.  Responsibilities: ● Identify and contact potential customers to market solutions provided by KiteSense.  ● Handle ad-hoc enquiries from potential customers.  ● Support management for strategic meetings with potential customers  ● Create, manage and experiment with new user acquisition and lead generation campaigns. Conceive and execute on a wide range of content campaigns to drive education and engagement.  ● Manage the company’s digital marketing platforms, including the company’s website, social media, email marketing etc.  Benefits  ● Flexible working hours  ● Competitive salary.  ● Fun, positive and great learning environment.  We are looking for someone who is a self-starter with a can-do attitude and welcomes the opportunity to roll up their sleeves to get things done and drive results.  About you We hope you’re excited about the position! To make the most of the role, you would have to be: ● A graduate holding a Bachelor’s Degree in Business/ Marketing/ Communications or a degree in a related field ● Comfortable with digital marketing tools such as Google Analytics, Mailchimp, Hootsuite, Squarespace. ● Proficient with Analytics.  If the above description sounds somewhat like you, we strongly encourage you to apply by sending your resume and cover letter to shiting@kitesense.sg. All applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. We look forward to learning more about you!

description: Unlock Better with TAIGER Everything we do at TAIGER is driven by a common belief that work as we know it can be done better. This is why at TAIGER, we develop hybrid artificial intelligence that understands language and logic, helping enterprises unlock better automation, better insights and ultimately better growth and human fulfilment.  Together with our clients and partners, we are solving challenging tasks in various industries. Tasks that involve billions of dollars of man-hours and infrastructure. Tasks that are thought to be impossible to apply cognitive automation and AI. Today, some of the world’s leading enterprises and government organisations use our technology for complex and high value work like digital non-client onboarding, fraud detection, customer service and engagement amongst others.   Our game-changing work on emerging technologies like Ontologies and Graphs, and Natural Language Technologies is featured on Gartner’s Hype Cycles in 2021. TAIGER is also named as an IDC innovator in AI in 2019, and we are proudly accredited by Singapore’s Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA).  TAIGER is looking for a Sales Manager to join our award winning team.  SALES MANAGER We are building a team passionate about cutting-edge AI technology and the potential of TAIGER. You should be motivated by growth opportunities with your responsibilities expanding in scope. You can also look forward to being part of a dynamic start-up environment where your contribution matters.  Responsibilities Close business with new and established accounts: building a strong and sustainable business pipeline. Identify key decision makers, approvers, and influencers and develop strategies to increase deal confidence. Drive incremental revenue inside named accounts by uncovering new use cases, growing adoption of current opportunities and upselling and cross-selling additional solutions. Solution-sell by mapping business challenges with technology solutions. Able to sell end to end solutions as part of digital transformation inside organisations. Lead generation, qualification and opportunity management to contract closure. Partnership with solution, marketing, business development, product, delivery. Past experience with working with IDP (Intelligent Document Processing) related solutions or AI sector. Forecast and pipeline management using CRM tools (Hubspot).  Requirements Demonstrated sales management with proven track-record of consistently exceeding quotas and performance targets. Strong account management successes in Singapore. Ability to sell new cutting edge technology solutions to clients: out of the box thinking, visioning, educating, consulting skills, customer success, etc. Effective account management skills in upselling solutions and making sure client implementations are successful. Experience developing new sales strategies. Ideal candidate will have strong experience of B2B direct and channel software sales, ideally in AI space. Consultative solution sales - hungry to drive and close business. Ability to articulate complex ideas and strategies. Strong collaboration and communication within departments with like-minded goal of achievement. Attention to detail. Execution excellence in using CRM and managing OKRs/KPIs.  You are right for the team if You have a good eye for business and excellent organisational, analytical, and influencing skills as well as strong business ties in our target region. Apart from being a savvy negotiator with competitive drive and determination, you should also be customer centric with good interpersonal and networking skills. You adapt to change well and are able to tackle complex problems using new and innovation solutions. You have a global mindset working in HQ in Singapore  You possess effective time management skills.  TAIGERs are different.  With a multinational and multicultural team headed by talents drawn from leading global companies, diversity is our strength. TAIGERs come from all walks of life, bringing to every piece of work varied experiences and expertise. Just as every TAIGER is unique, no two days at TAIGER are the same. Through working on diverse projects across geographies, every day is a new opportunity to master our craft and impact the future of work. Here at TAIGER, we share a common question—what else can we unlock better?  *TAIGER does not engage any recruitment agencies for recruitment of talents into our company. All job applications should be submitted directly to TAIGER.

description: What You Do At AMD Changes Everything  At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible. We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center.  Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results. It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world. If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team.  Manager, Commercial Sales  The Role  The BDE Manager will own end-user relationships to drive sales of the entire AMD portfolio. The BDE will work in tight collaboration with the End Customers, VARs, SIs and distribution to help drive OEM sales in Singapore/ASEAN countries. The successful candidate will be responsible for executing the AMD sales strategy - including partnerships and market approach to drive large enterprise, corporate, and SMB sales of AMD platforms across PC client, server, cloud, workstation/graphics, and thin client.  AMD's environment is fast paced, results oriented and built upon a legion of forward-thinking people with a passion for winning technology!  The Person  The BDE should demonstrate the following characteristics: An intense drive to “win,” combined with sound business perspective High level of confidence, maturity, and integrity Open communication style and presence to work effectively at multiple levels, from salespeople to senior management Honest and trustworthy in dealings with internal/external customers, colleagues and stakeholders Ability to listen to the customer and articulate the customer’s needs internally Key Responsibilities Deliver on AMDs revenue, unit and market share goals Manage a detailed forecast & multiple quarter pipeline (SFDC) Implement go-to-market and sales-out strategies that grow revenue base and market share Be the face of AMD to all key customers in the assigned regions Build/Execute, in partnership with AMD Marketing, GTM strategy across multiple distributors and partners in Singapore/ASEAN markets Identify customer challenges and insert a compelling AMD value proposition to address challenges Ideally have existing relationships with key SIs, VAR & resellers. Previous experience selling into Enterprise and Government highly desirable. Strong historical interaction and relationship with Partner Sales team of key OEM’s (For example HPi, HPE, Dell, Lenovo, LG, Acer, Asus and others) Build confidence and awareness around AMD offerings within the sales teams at key OEMs and resellers Business relationship with ecosystem partners such as Microsoft and others. Preferred Experience  The BDE will ideally have the following attributes: Proven success in a comparable role, developing strong customer relationships which have led to sales success An established background in technology sales with at least 5 years’ progressive experience Ideally also have previous experience working with OEMs such as HPI, HPE, Lenovo, Dell and others Ability to learn, understand, and work with new and emerging technologies, methodologies, and solutions in the Cloud/IT technology space Experience in SaaS, IaaS and PaaS sales and/or consulting is a plus Demonstrated effectiveness working in a cross-matrix organization Thrives in an autonomous environment Academic Credentials Undergraduate degree as a minimum Location:  Singapore/ASEAN countries  AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and will consider all applicants without regard to race, marital status, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.
