description: Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.  Job Purpose  The Sales Program Manager (SPM) will be part of the Field Sales channel, a member of the regional team responsible for the commercial success of the region. The SPM is responsible for pre-sales and post-sales activities for the region, such as sales lead funnel management, sales and shipper programs, and sales promotions to accelerate the sales effectiveness of the countries  Intro of Field Sales  The Field Sales channel will focus on offering final mile delivery solutions in the express domestic parcel segment to SMEs. The department is responsible for the revenue development and profitability of this segment within Ninja Van in the local market. The regional channel is seen as a major source for diversification of revenue for the Ninja Van organization and is heavily involved in supporting the local countries with sales processes, measurements, and governance.  Responsibilities Define and own the lead generation framework regionally. Responsible for top, mid, and bottom of the funnel performance as it feeds into the country sales process. Unify the various stakeholders in the process from Digital Marketing, Trade Marketing, Lead Qualification, and the sales team into achieving a robust yet scalable process in the supply through conversion of leads. Create and spearhead outbound lead generation programs to identify strong potential prospects. Lead in-country Lead Management team to achieve their intended performance and KPIs. Collaborate closely with Sales Enablement colleagues to ensure alignment of channel priorities and deliverables. Work in collaboration with Content, Marketing Program Managers, and Product Marketing to develop effective messaging for outbound communications to support the Customer Journey. Supporting country teams in building and aligning their sales promotions and conformity to regional commercial guidelines. Develop and prepare performance scorecards, dashboards, and data analysis by country, channel to reflect own performance and achievement. Align with regional sales planning teams on theirs observations of the country sales process gaps and support with the required sales campaigns to boost performance. Define, deploy and administer sales campaigns launched from the region. Requirements Minimally a Bachelor Degree with at least 5 years of demonstrable experience in a similar capacity Direct experience in sales, customer success, presales, or sales support roles. Advantageous to possess regional experience and familiarity in Salesforce CRM system Advantageous to possess experience in digital marketing and/or the logistics industry Excellent analytical skills and stakeholder management Good organizational and time management skills with the flexibility to reprioritize as necessary Strong communication skills as the role require lines of communication with multiple audiences across the region Submit a job application  By applying to the job, you acknowledge that you have read, understood and agreed to our Privacy Policy Notice (the “Notice”) and consent to the collection, use and/or disclosure of your personal data by Ninja Logistics Pte Ltd (the “Company”) for the purposes set out in the Notice. In the event that your job application or personal data was received from any third party pursuant to the purposes set out in the Notice, you warrant that such third party has been duly authorised by you to disclose your personal data to us for the purposes set out in the the Notice.

description: 200 years ago, Bolloré Group was born. Today, one of Bolloré Group’s fastest growing business sectors, Bolloré Logistics, have grown to become the world’s top 10 players in freight forwarding and logistics with a powerful network spread across 106 countries, 607 sites with over 20,000 employees. We pride ourselves having developed specific expertise in providing end-to-end supply chain solutions tailored to our customers’ growth and constantly driving innovation to adapt and better cater to their evolving needs. We place our customers at the heart of all our processes, delivering customized solutions while ensuring ethical and responsible business practices.  Here, we believe in People Powered Innovation. It’s the people who brought us to where we are right now, and it’ll be the people who bring us to greater heights. We invite you to join our diverse team on our journey to becoming Global Top 5 in the coming years.   About the role  As a Regional Account Manager, you will ensure the delivery of expected outcomes along with providing high quality services to our customers. It will be your responsibility to come up with strategies to develop and/or maintain Bollore’s position with existing and prospective accounts. You will also be required to work cross-functionally to participate in tender opportunities, draft legal contracts, as well as generate performance reports.  As our team is currently expanding in various verticals, prior experience in F&F, FMCG, Automotive, Chemical or Pharmaceutical/ Healthcare verticals would be advantageous.   What you will be doing  Extend Bollore’s reach within existing network Identify key account targets in ASPAC Send sales leads to network in order to increase Bollore Logistics’ presence in ASPAC Establish a referencing strategy for regional or international accounts Develop relationships with prospective key accounts to promote Bollore Logistics and obtain the opportunity to participate in future tenders Implement new business strategies to gather sales leads and expand customer base  Service support Determine a tariff policy in conjunction with Middle Office and Regional Sales Management Participate in negotiations with suppliers Monitor customer account profitability and problems linked to receipts with site managers Transfer obtained contracts to Operations team in order to provide high quality service to customers Support services or operation sites through advising on relevant SOPs  Synthesis of information Consolidate statistical elements from various operations for reporting purposes Report sales actions undertaken to further develop key customer accounts Update CRM with weekly activities and monthly reports for key accounts   The ideal candidate  Essential: Bachelor’s degree and above At least 10 years’ experience in a fast paced and dynamic MNC environment Prior experience in the logistics/warehousing industry Prior experience in key account management (preferably in ASPAC region)  Desirable: Prior experience in F&F, FMCG, Automotive, Chemical or Pharmaceutical/ Healthcare verticals Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office suite Good sales and analytical skills Customer-centric mindset Self-starter Strong interpersonal skills Highly adaptable  Bollore Logistics is proud to be an equal opportunities employer and places high importance on promoting diversity and inclusion in the organization. We embrace all people regardless of age, race, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, marital status, political opinions or disability. We are strongly committed to providing a safe working environment for our employees, free from violence, bullying, harassment, or threats.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain

description: Koble is a young and fast-rising smart home solutions provider.  As our Smart Home Sales Specialist, you will get the unique opportunity to direct the business development of Koble's smart home solution.  Being our smart home sales specialist, you will learn to tailor home automation products according to a homeowner's family needs. Equipped with smart home knowledge, you are the front person communicating to homeowners on how smart home brings unprecedented convenience and comfort to them.  As part of project management, you will be liaising with various stakeholders in the home renovation industry to incorporate smart home solution in a new house.  You will understand how to provide a fuss-free and functional smart home transformation experience and enjoy the fulfilment of giving homeowners unprecedented convenience, comfort, and security.  We are looking for independent, driven and innovative candidates who embrace leadership and are able to articulate effectively.  Be part of a team that transform homes into a fully functional and beneficial smart home! Commitment: Full Time

description: First Digital Trust is looking for an experienced Head of Business Development to lead our sales and partnership efforts. The role is responsible for leading and running all aspects of the business development process, from lead identification and qualification to developing deep market analyses, exploring new revenue models, and creating strategic business partnerships. Outstanding presentation and negotiation skills are required as well as the ability to close US$100k+ deals and maintain year-over-year growth of over 30%. Of particular interest are candidates with an excellent grasp of the blockchain and digital assets industry and the cultural trends of the crypto community.  Responsibilities:  Deliver and manage a sales and business development strategy that aligns with the company's direction for growth, revenue, and profit Lead the pipeline of opportunities, prioritize according to growth value, and deliver timely reporting on sales funnel and progress towards goals to the leadership team, broader team, and other senior leaders Produce incremental value from ongoing strategic relationships and identify, structure, negotiate and close significant new strategic partnership opportunities and sophisticated deals with strategic partners, such as (but not limited to) tech providers, banks, money service businesses, and other financial intermediaries Identify, lead and negotiate key deals from end-to-end (from due diligence to contract negotiations and post-deal management) with cross-functional input aligned to business/service strategy. Overseeing the day to day management and mentoring of the business development team Explore and implement new possible revenue streams as well as develop new business models Work closely with the CEO, marketing, and product teams on deal structures and product strategy. This will include an ongoing focus on discovery around the products, pricing, recurring revenue opportunities, and more Influence and connect with key internal partners, including regional country heads, brands, and the strategic team at HQ, including Finance, Legal, Marketing, and Product teams. Act as a brand ambassador - attend conferences, panels, and events where you advocate for FDT  Experience & Proficiencies:  University Degree in Business Administration, Marketing or Finance desired At least 5-10 years of deal-making experience, with a solid understanding of and exposure to the financial services industry or another high growth tech environment Business level proficiency in English and a second language Executive presence with outstanding presentation, communication, and consultative selling skills Experience working with financial institutions, Banks, and Broker/Dealers, Exchanges, and Asset Management partners is a plus. Excellent organizational and project planning/leadership skills coupled with the ability to operate in an ambiguous environment or unstructured situations with a high degree of autonomy People-oriented and a great teammate combined with entrepreneurial skills Excellent analytical and finance skills with a good understanding of contract law with the ability to work in a self-directed manner Proven track record of adapting to new environments and working effectively with people from all levels and from a diverse group of backgrounds through excellent influencing and adaptable communication skills – comfortable making pitches to the board and C-suite and skilled at developing relations with key stakeholders.

Success waits for no one. Opportunities come to those who grabs it. They should be able to think critically when making plans and have a demonstrated ability to execute a particular strategy. Maximize market/ sales potential and develop strong relationships at various levels with network Partners; ensure delivery of my client services and profitable outcomes. Budget responsible Experience of using LOS to manage key business areas Project set up, management and completion   #automotive #sales #b2bsales #newclientacquisition #businessdevelopment #singaporejobs

Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.  At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry. description: Donaldson is committed to solving the world’ s most complex filtration challenges. Employing innovation and breakthrough solutions, we are advancing filtration for a cleaner world. We look for the best people to help us succeed, offering opportunities to learn, effect change, and make meaningful contributions at work and in our communities. This is a place where you can make a world of difference.  Follow Us on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/donaldson/  Strategic Accounts have been identified as one of the key strategies to grow business, improve market share and maintain/improved profitability sustainably. The purpose of this role is to maintain and expand relationships with strategically important customers (end users) and is responsible for growing our business, improving our market share, ensuring our sustained profitability and achieving assigned strategic account objectives. The role will lead the customers’ account planning cycle and ensure assigned customers’ needs and expectations are met.  Role Responsibilities Plans and manages all sales activities to optimize sales and profits. Retains all profitable existing business through continued efforts to maintain maximum service, quality and on-time delivery. Establish productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned customer accounts for profitable sales growth (prospect accounts and existing accounts). Formulates and implements effective strategic plans and annual operating plans for assigned customers. Coordinates the involvement of company personnel, including support, service and management resources, in order to meet account performance objectives and customers’ expectation. Proactively leads a joint company-strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets and critical milestones. Proactively assesses, clarifies, and validates customer needs on an ongoing basis (through business reviews). Drive sales by following the Donaldson sales process (Impax). Develops, recommends and implements pricing strategies. Develops and maintains market share information and competitive data to be used in the development of market, product, strategic and annual plans. Meets revenue targets by increasing revenue spend per customer and by identifying, developing and closing new sales opportunities. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Business/Marketing/Engineering. More than 3 years of outside sales experience, preferably in strategic account selling. Previous experience in manufacturing sales. Proven track record in managing strategic accounts. Proven account planning and closing skills. Good negotiation, influencing and follow up skills. Technical selling. Excellent sales, negotiation, and team building skills and techniques are required. Consistent achievement of sales goals. Proven ability to manage major programs and major customer penetration and account maintenance is required. Technical sales experience and/or possess strong technical aptitude. Ability to build and maintain long-term customer relationships. Ability to multi-task and prioritize customer needs. Computer literacy and proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software is required. Excellent oral and written communications skills are also required. Previous experience with Microsoft Dynamics or related CRM systems. Managing and measuring work. Influencing others. Good business acumen. Managing up and across (Sharing of information with management). Extensive travel required. Conversant in multiple SE Asian languages would be a plus. Come make a World of Difference! jobTitle: Director of Sales and Business Development APAC
description: COMPANY  Janes enables militaries, governments and defence companies to make critical decisions. Our expert-driven tradecraft, developed over 120 years, combined with human-machine teaming, delivers assured open-source intelligence across military capabilities and order of battle, equipment, events, countries, companies and markets.  Linking millions of assured data points, Janes data model creates a framework of interconnected open-source defence intelligence. This allows our customers to integrate all relevant data and connections into a single intelligence environment to deliver a more complete and accurate answer. Using Janes, our customers can use their scarce resource more effectively, to get to better decisions with higher confidence, more quickly.   JOB PURPOSE  Janes is searching for a Director of Sales & Business Development for the APAC region. This is a key leadership role in developing and executing the Janes business strategy for the APAC region, and will be focused on managing a team of sales and business development executives.   The key mission of the team is to renew existing business with customers and grow revenue through upsells at existing customers and new customer acquisition. The leader will be responsible for providing cross-functional leadership and be able to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.   HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE AT JANES  Develop and execute detailed strategy and business plan for retaining and growing Janes APAC business while understanding Janes overall strategic direction. Ensure the team is building and maintaining qualified pipeline of opportunities to hit targeted growth. Develop the sales team’s skills through active coaching, account and opportunity reviews, and participation in customer meetings. Establish consistent account management process to ensure high rate of retention and upsell for current customers. Screen and qualify opportunities to determine probability to win (PWin) and make Bid/No Bid decisions. Direct sales forecasting activities and set performance goals accordingly. Track, measure, and report progress and performance to Janes Senior Leadership team. Continuously analyse market strategies/efforts and pipeline opportunities to  develop strategic partnership relationships Supportive leader to get involved and coach to close/help team close new business.  THE IDEAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE FOR THIS ROLE ARE  Proven successful leadership experience within Sales/Business Development. Previous experience in Defence and/or Intelligence Community either selling to this customer base and/or being employed directly in the community. Strong knowledge of cultural norms across the APAC region.  Ability to coach and guide team on successful strategies to employ for success. Proven ability to work in cross-functional and resource constrained environment. Experience developing, managing, and leading sales and business development teams. Ability to coach and develop talent and create high-performing teams. Passion to succeed and achieve meaningful business results with a strong sense of accountability and ownership; strong organisation, prioritisation, and persuasive communication skills. Strategic thinker balanced with strong attention to detail. High-energy, results-oriented, creative leadership approach.   For successful candidates, Janes provides a supportive, stretching and dynamic environment with the ability for you to grow rapidly both personally and professionally.   We value diversity at Janes and are committed to equal opportunities and creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues. We welcome applicants regardless of ethnic origin, national origin, gender, race, colour, religious beliefs, disability, sexual orientation and age.
industries: Information Services

description: We are looking for a Sales Associate to join us at our Cartier ION boutique to be a star player to the team and effectively contribute to the success of our brand. If you have a heart for luxury jewellery and passionate about serving people, we welcome you to apply now!  HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?  As an Ambassador of the Maison, you are responsible for creating a unique client experience before, during, and after a sale. You will also proactively develop your client portfolio and meet individual and boutique targets, both quantitative and qualitative. You will cultivate strong client relationships and develop client loyalty. Participate in daily boutique operations as and when required.  HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?  We believe in shared success, and understanding that with your actions you elevate your team and brand.  To Contribute To Team Success You  Have commercial ability and selling skills Maintain excellent communication in English and Mandarin Provide excellent service and client-focused Exercise flexibility and take the initiative to serve at the highest standard  HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?  A great opportunity to be a part of a dynamic and diverse team that goes the extra mile to uphold outstanding service for our beloved clients This role will also help deepen your knowledge of luxury whilst enhancing your expertise in boutique operations and sales Finally, a plethora of opportunities within Cartier and the Richemont Group to help you develop and take your career to the next level  Your Journey With Us  After being shortlisted, you will first meet the HRBP to get to know YOU and give you a preview of the team dynamics and company culture Subsequently, you will be meeting with the Boutique Manager to dive deeper and assess your fit for this role. He/she will also share potential growth opportunities should you be successful in this position Finally, you will meet with the Commercial Director to find out more about how we operate and an opportunity for you to ask questions about the business and the Maison.

description: GEP is a diverse, creative team of people passionate about procurement. We invest ourselves entirely in our client’s success, creating strong collaborative relationships that deliver extraordinary value year after year. Our clients include market global leaders with far-flung international operations, Fortune 500 and Global 2000 enterprises, leading government and public institutions.   We deliver practical, effective services and software that enable procurement leaders to maximise their impact on business operations, strategy and financial performance. That’s just some of the things that we do in our quest to build a beautiful company, enjoy the journey and make a difference. GEP is a place where individuality is prized, and talent respected. We’re focused on what is real and effective. GEP is where good ideas and great people are recognized, results matter, and ability and hard work drive achievements. We’re a learning organization, actively looking for people to help shape, grow and continually improve us.  Are you one of us?  GEP is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, national origin, religion, sex, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We are committed to hiring and valuing a global diverse work team.   For more information please visit us on GEP.com or check us out on LinkedIn.com.  The Services- Business Development team is responsible for revenue growth primarily through driving new sales (i.e. new logos). The position is part of a strategic sales channel that requires prospecting, qualification and generating new business for our management consulting business. This is a quota carrying, solution selling position. The role requires forecasting, account planning, pipeline management, lead development and reporting and the ideal candidate will utilize experience selling Supply Chain, Sourcing or Procurement services or BPO services sales in the areas for F&A, Shared Services and Operational Excellence.  Identify & create strong revenue generating opportunities and lead service line sales through strategy & execution. Lead the development of sales leads to a win through the development of sales strategies, solution proposal and deal closing for large, complex opportunities. Develop and strengthen relationships with key decision makers/influencers in the prospect organization to showcase GEP’s services as a strategic fit for their business through calls, value proposition workshops and strategy meets. Utilize GEP’s unique value proposition & industry experience to shape opportunities by leveraging perspectives and competitive intelligence on prospect end to win new logos. Regularly monitor sales trends, market dynamics and then incorporate into existing sales strategy and plan. Exemplify GEP’s global leadership within the Procurement space i conferences/events & meetings, by presenting thought leadership and networking with key individuals. Meet revenue targets as an individual contributor through all the required support from Sales Enablement teams (i.e. Marketing, Operations, Inside Sales & Solution Design/Presales).  Main Skill Sets:  Min 7+ years of demonstrated successful career record in selling Consulting Services in Supply Chain, Procurement, Sourcing, and Business Process Outsourcing (BPO). Proven track record in influencing Fortune 500 Executives by creating compelling business cases. Consultative, solutions focused mindset. Experience working within a large, heavily matrixed company environment. Strong leadership skills in a client-facing environment Excellent communication and client management skills Local language proficiency will be a plus for the candidate Strong teamwork, problem solving, organization and process improvement skills Bachelor’s Degree required, Masters in business or operations preferred Able to travel ~30-40% of the time if required

description: Job Description  Business Development Representative- Thai Speaking-for business generation in Thailand  Are you looking for a chance to continue and grow your Sales career in the tech industry?  Zendesk is the world’s leading Customer Support Platform and we are fast-growing quickly with a suite of products our customers love! We are looking for hardworking individuals - Our growth builds more opportunities to progress faster. We want to develop and support you in your career. You will be a key team member of the sales team, driving new business and delivering on the strategy for your region-Thailand. Run a busy outbound pipeline of leads and provide top class customer experience Use innovative prospecting cold accounts Generate high-value pipeline through both strategic and targeted prospecting into start-ups and unicorn, or enterprise businesses Show creativity that will flourish naturally in a Zen environment, actively source new leads through the use of social tools. We want your brains! Just not literally Be motivated to overachieve on daily, weekly, and monthly targets and metrics Be the face of the brand, 100% focussed on building an outstanding customer experience You Have Business Development experience within the Enterprise and Commercial segment, particularly managing prospects from Thailand Passion to kick-start or continue a career in consultative sales A minimum of 2 year of experience in a Sales related environment Solid business experience (SaaS sales preferred), curious, and customer-centric A “Can Do” / “Winner” attitude, with a hunger and 'self-starter' commitment to overachieve and succeed Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Thai for business communications in Thailand. Bachelor's degree is preferable. About Zendesk - Champions Of Customer Service  Zendesk started the customer experience revolution in 2007 by enabling any business around the world to take their customer service online. Today, Zendesk is the champion of great service everywhere for everyone, and powers billions of conversations, connecting more than 100,000 logos with hundreds of millions of customers over telephony, chat, email, messaging, social channels, communities, review sites and help centers. Zendesk products are built with love to be loved. The company was conceived in Copenhagen, Denmark, built and grown in California, taken public in New York City, and today employs more than 4,000 people across the world. Learn more at www.zendesk.com.  We believe in service. Learn more about how we provide support to our local communities with volunteering, grants and product donations.  Zendesk is an equal opportunity employer, and we’re proud of our ongoing efforts to foster global diversity, equity, & inclusion in the workplace. Individuals seeking employment and employees at Zendesk are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, medical condition, ancestry, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. If you are based in the United States and would like more information about your EEO rights under the law, please click here.  Zendesk endeavors to make reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities and disabled veterans pursuant to applicable federal and state law. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to submit this application, complete any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participate in the employee selection process, please send an e-mail to benefits@zendesk.com with your specific accommodation request.  By submitting your application, you agree that Zendesk may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. Zendesk's Candidate Privacy Notice explains what personal information Zendesk may process, where Zendesk may process your personal information, its purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over Zendesk’s use of your personal information.

With a unique data-driven approach to restaurant management and customer engagement, TabSquare helps partner restaurants drive higher sales, streamline operations, and provide a better customer experience. Entrepreneurial ability - open to try out new things / ideas, high ownership and can work independently, with minimum guidance Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization, including executive and C-level Experience in delivering client-focused solutions based on customer needs Proven ability to manage multiple projects at a time while paying strict attention to detail Natural relationship builder with integrity, reliability, and maturity Critical thinking and problem-solving skills Comfortable in a fast-paced, changing environment Experience working with KPIs and achieving targets  What we Offer Growing company in a sunrise sector of F&B tech with amazing AI powered products. description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Love being in a fast-paced working environment where you will be constantly challenged? Always the problem solver and able to make quick decisions? Want to be a key stakeholder in the strategizing of sales in a company? Restless to achieve and outperform your goals? Love the opportunity to lead a team? You’ll be perfect as our DM!  Here’s what your responsibilities will be: Maintaining an overview of your department to drive sales and profitability Acting as a role model to your team, inspiring and developing them to be future leaders Always be thinking of innovative ways to drive business Provide excellent customer service, inspiring your team to deliver a great shopping experience Managing back office routines including scheduling, loss prevention and budget planning to maximize profit Executing campaigns and activities in store Qualifications  Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our DM! Be passionate about H&M Possess a customer-focused mindset Have excellent interpersonal skills to inspire and motivate staff Practice great leadership and coaching skills, to influence and inspire your team and provide constructive, straightforward feedback Have a strong commercial sense, working to push sales Have good analytical skills, with the ability to work on reports and react with action plans Have great planning skills, with a strong ability to set goals, delegate work and follow up on results Join us on this adventure! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M. Our goal is for a job at H&M to be more than just a job – it’s the beginning of a career full of opportunities!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

jobTitle: Account Strategist, Managed Agency, Google Customer Solutions
description: Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 3 years of experience in Digital Media and/or Advertising Sales  Preferred qualifications: Sales experience in a technology, advertising, media sales and/or internet environment. Experience with Google Ads and YouTube account management, managing advertising and/or media campaigns. Media experience across a variety of platforms (TV, Radio, Print, Sponsorship, etc.). Ability to multitask; with experience managing multiple accounts simultaneously while paying attention to detail. Ability to thrive in a rapidly changing environment with excellent problem-solving, creative thinking and analytical skills.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing businesses grow. Using your relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  The Managed Agency Sales team is a high performing Sales team that drives customer success by partnering with a wide range of independent agencies in Singapore, Malaysia, and Philippines.  Our Agency Account Strategists are ambitious and customer focused front-line sellers who serve as the face of Google, promoting and cross-selling the best solutions Google has to offer. As an Account Strategist, you will activate initiatives across both agency and end customers via improving account and campaign performance, driving thoughtful Google product adoption, and designing short, medium, and long-term strategies to meet customer business objectives. You will collaborate with our teams of technicians, analysts, and solution specialists to analyze and solve customer challenges, capitalizing on industry opportunities, and delivering great sales experience.  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  Responsibilities  Manage a portfolio of businesses by understanding growth drivers, identifying opportunities for growth, managing risks and building quarterly plans for achievements. Drive customer growth by delivering outstanding customer sales experience and achieving customer business and marketing objectives. Own end-to-end sales process, by driving customer outreach, sales pitches, solution implementation and performance evaluation. Work towards quarterly business and product growth goals.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: First Derivatives plc is a global leader in consulting, business services and technology. We are the home for diverse thinkers and innovators. We know that our people are vital to our success and we are proud of the diverse and vibrant team we have built across the globe. We are committed to hiring top talent, creating an environment where they can thrive, and recognizing and rewarding their dedication as they progress within the company.  To meet the growing demand for our technology and services, we are currently growing our Business Development Team.  We have opportunities to get involved in our KX product suite. Within KX you would be responsible for sourcing new KX sales opportunities and liaising with our clients, who leverage the speed of KX technology for everyday data analytics.  You will work closely with global senior sales members across the world, creating opportunities for First Derivatives across all sectors of our business. You will train with SME’s & Sales Management on our Technology and offerings which will broaden your knowledge on pitching, buying signals, and sales strategies.  When joining us as a Business Development Representative, you will embark on an initial 4-week training program, which will take you through First Derivatives’ wide range of services spanning financial consulting and KX technology. Following this, you will join a team responsible for growing business across our target markets worldwide. Your role could range from assisting in the expansion of our US financial consulting services to finding new KX sales opportunities within the Asian manufacturing market. No two days are the same and you could be responsible for the next big deal for FD!  Key Responsibilities: Win Business for KX Prospect new clients by reaching out via outbound sales calls, emails & LinkedIn, introducing KX and our relevant services to key decision-makers Liaise with senior management to share knowledge and market intelligence to help drive the overall company strategy  Criteria: Minimum 3.4 GPA in a BS/BA degree or equivalent A genuine interest in technology, financial products & services, manufacturing, automotive, telco and utilities Strong communication and relationship building skills Ability to work on own initiative with a proactive, business-driven approach Flexible to work various shifts Ideally 1+ year experience in a customer-facing or sales role

DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson family of companies, is currently recruiting for a Business Development Manager for the Joint reconstruction and Sports medicine portfolio. DePuy Synthes provides one of the most comprehensive orthopaedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide.  The individual is responsible for overseeing the capital sales and digital surgery solutions portfolio for Joint Reconstruction and Sports Medicine. A key priority of the role is to launch and lead the capital equipment portfolio within Sports medicine, and to equip the sales team with capital-selling capabilities to drive growth. The individual will also lead the digital surgery solutions portfolio for Joint reconstruction in the space of hip and knee surgery, and engage both clinical and non-clinical stakeholders to ensure successful implementation of the solutions in partnership with the sales team.  In addition, the role will be heavily involved in strategic business planning, launching new products and devising solutions to meet healthcare needs of the patients. At this level, the role has increased responsibility including, but not limited to, additional skills, multiple lines/products, diverse teams, etc. This job is eligible for sales incentives/sales commission.  Critical to this role’s success will be the individual’s leadership skills and the ability to communicate and work well with all levels of internal and external partners.  Reporting line This position reports to Franchise Manager (Joints, Mitek and Extremities), Johnson and Johnson Singapore.  Job responsibilities Sports Medicine Capital Sales - Launch and lead sports medicine capital equipment portfolio - Understand and analyze market dynamics and competition to develop business opportunities - Develop effective contracts and financing schemes to grow customer base - Participate in national tender negotiations and evaluation placements - Lifecycle management of capital equipment including after-sales support - Training of team to improve capital selling capabilities and case support - Engage external partners including clinicians, procurement bodies and healthcare institutions  Digital Surgery Solutions - Lead strategic marketing and drive growth for portfolio - Collect competitive insights on product portfolio to recommend and develop marketing programs to adjust product positioning - Build and maintain relationships with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and non-clinical partners to facilitate buy-in and launch of digital surgery solutions - Manage strategic accounts identified with creative solution-selling and market business development - Establish and improve relationships at CXO level and build long-term strategic alliances with the portfolio of accounts to continue to add value - Subject matter specialist including technical matters - Conduct training for healthcare professionals (HCPs) - Assists sales team with questions and supports customers requiring additional support - Enable and train sales team to ensure uptake of solutions - Hold stretched sales targets for portfolio

description: KnowBe4, Inc. is the provider of the world's largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform. KnowBe4 enables organizations to manage the ongoing problem of social engineering by helping them train employees to make smarter security decisions, every day. Tens of thousands of organizations worldwide use KnowBe4’s platform to mobilize their end users as a last line of defense and enable them to make better security decisions, every day.  We have ranked a best place to work for women, millennials, and in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine as well as #1 or #2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last six years.  Please submit your resume in English.  The International Sales Performance Coach will act as a sales expert and partner with sales representatives to help assess, measure and enhance the performance of sales generating activities in our International locations as needed. In addition, this position is responsible for training, mentoring, and coaching the sales representatives to ensure these teams are stronger and more effective.  Responsibilities Partner with the sales leadership team to identify and analyze opportunities of revenue generation for KnowBe4’s products and/or services in support of its global business goals and monitor the sales representatives’ overall effectiveness throughout the sales process Perform on the job training for sales representatives in his or her assigned territory by drilling the sales process and providing additional training resources and assistance as needed Assist the Training Department with all new and existing Sales Representatives as they are on or finish their training from the University with drills, tests and any other requirements Consult, train, mentor and coach sales representatives in the assigned territory in areas that include revenue generation performance issues and overall sales effectiveness Monitor the statistics for sales representatives in his or her assigned territory to identify any red flags affecting their performance, and recommend techniques that could help improve such performance Evaluate sales team performance to ensure sales representatives adhere to KnowBe4’s established sales policies and procedures Inspect pipelines and accounts for any administrative errors, or mishandling of customer accounts, and recommend techniques that could help improve such performance. Listen in on demonstration phone calls or webinars and identify areas of improvement for each individual sales representative, create coaching plans as needed. Work in coordination with the sales leadership team and Growth to implement and successfully execute training programs developed by the CGO Identify lost sales opportunities and work in coordination with the sales representative to employ sales techniques that can recover the opportunity Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in Education or Bachelor’s Degree in Business, or equivalent work experience A minimum of one year of demonstrated experience in managing people A minimum of one year of proven work experience in training, coaching or mentorship A minimum of one year of demonstrated experience in managing people A minimum of one year of outbound B2B sales experience (cold calling experience a plus) Experience with Gmail and Google Docs Experience with MS Office (Word and Excel) Experience with web browsers (Chrome, Internet Explorer, etc.) Strong verbal and written communications Excellent time management and organization skills Excellent listening skills Ability to identify the root cause of a lost sales opportunity Ability to identify revenue generating opportunities Strong statistical analysis skills Strong skills in working with people Strong skills in developing plans and drills to help sales reps Strong overall sales knowledge (closing, prospecting, etc) Fluency in English required; additional languages a plus but not required Note: An applicant assessment and background check may be part of your hiring procedure.  Individuals seeking employment at KnowBe4 are considered without prejudice to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please visit www.knowbe4.com/careers/request-accommodation.  No recruitment agencies, please.

Insider is a B2B SaaS company with a unique approach to multichannel experience orchestration. Recently, Insider announced its $32 Million Series C funding round by Sequoia. Insider was named the #1 leader on G2’s Mobile Marketing Software and Personalization Grids, with a 4.6/5 rating based 100% on user reviews, 19 quarters in a row. Insider was also named as the #1 Leader in the Forrester Wave for Cross-Channel Campaign Management (CCCM) with the highest overall score among all vendors, with a 5/5 rating in numerous criteria. CrunchBase recently ranked Insider’s co-founder and CEO Hande Cilingir as one of the top women CEOs outside the US.  Many of the most prestigious Fortune 500 companies and top brands in retail, automotive, and travel use Insider to deliver AI-backed personalized experiences that exceed customer expectations. Insider is trusted by over 800 global businesses, including UNIQLO, Singapore Airlines, Virgin, Toyota, New Balance, IKEA, Samsung, Newsweek, MediaMarkt, Nissan, AVIS, Marks & Spencer, Allianz, BBVA, Dominos, Avon, and CNN.  So… you’re wondering what is this role about?  To be honest, we are not looking for an Inside Sales Specialist, that’s merely a title. What we are looking for is Hunger! For people who are hungry to go out a play in the major leagues even though they have no name, to sit down and drive results that create an impact, and to go out of their way to get things done when it matters most. We’re looking for freshers who possess the energy, the passion, the drive, but most importantly, the desire to prove themselves and create an impact.  The Sales Development Specialist is a role that can be considered the backbone of sales at Insider. A crucial part of this role is to identify and reach out to prospective sales opportunities. This is where our ‘growth’ begins.  We also realize that most Job Descriptions almost always sound like the description of an A-380 but when you’ve arrived at the airport what you find is a Cessna twin-seater!  We want to write a JD that’s realistic and as close to the real thing as possible.  How can we do this? So, we thought about it and realized that the best JD for this role is one that comes from the insights of other Business Development Specialists.  Day in and day out a Sales Development Representative in Insider Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up and outbound cold calls and emails; Understand customer needs and requirements; Research accounts, identify key players, and generate interest; Ability to multitask and manage time effectively; Excellent oral and written communication skills; Maintain and expand your database of prospects within your assigned duty; What we expect from you; New Graduates are highly encouraged; University degree in related fields; Inside sales experience is a plus; Good exposure to the e-commerce society will be an advantage; Ability to multi-task and manage time effectively; Excellent oral and written communication skills; Should be creative about researching markets, identifying key players, and generating lead; You’re a natural around the phone and dialing dozens of numbers a day is a piece of cake for you; Ability to be flexible and adapt quickly in a fast-paced, start-up environment; Strong problem identification and objection resolution skills; Preferably digital marketing related experience in a customer-oriented position; While we are conquering the world, we are offering you: The chance to work in an international, diverse, and inclusive environment. The chance to become a Shareowner with the "Shareowner System" that we offer to all Insiders who meet certain criteria. Healthy lunches, dinners, and afternoon snacks. Upgrade, improve and challenge yourself with the many soft skills trainings that we offer. You’ll have access to Udemy’s business plan and Masterclass, where you can choose over 10,000 courses to satisfy your hunger for knowledge. You’ll have space to share your skills and even deliver trainings and workshops if you wish. Sharing is caring! We’ll provide you with a paid Spotify account subscription, how do you fancy working to the beats of your favorite audio while blocking out the rest of the world? You’ll be part of an industry that’s shaping the future of customer experiences. Still not sure? Just ask Google. No Dress Code! Occasional TGIF happy hours! We provide equal opportunity in a zero-discrimination workplace and not just welcome but also embrace everyone without regard to sex, race, color, nationality, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, citizenship, or marital status.  Please follow Insider on LinkedIn, Instagram, Youtube, Stack Overflow, and Medium!
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Retail

description: AccelerAsia provides fast growing technology companies from Europe, Israel and the US with a suite of growth services to help them expand their businesses into APAC and ensure long term success in this region. We have offices in Singapore, Bangkok, Jakarta and Melbourne, a team of highly experienced international business builders and a well-established network in the region. Over the past 11 years we have created a unique culture and a very successful business that has helped dozens of companies build their business in these parts of the world. We are looking for an enthusiastic and driven Sales Development Representative to join our Sales Development Team. This position focuses on feeding the top of the sales funnel and you will play a key role in finding prospects and qualifying them, before passing them on to Senior Business Development Managers and Business Development Directors. This involves researching companies, identifying the key decision makers and generating leads through cold outreach such as cold calling and social platforms (LinkedIn). The right candidate has at least 1 to 3 years of SDR experience, is passionate in digital technology, enthusiastic, smart, sales driven, able to focus and eager to learn. Key Duties: Enthusiastic about enterprise software Ability to grasp the business needs of AccelerAsia’s client(s), be able to think on your feet, and possess the drive to become solution/product experts Outbound prospecting, cold calling to hunt for new leads for AccelerAsia’s client(s) and meeting daily minimum quota/targets Qualify inbound leads from regular marketing campaigns and follow up with leads who have attended events, with the aim of booking meetings Develop and maintain a high-quality lead funnel Qualify leads using a structured sales methodology Work closely with Senior Business Development Managers and Business Development Directors to support in developing and implementing appropriate prospecting strategies and plans Maintain high level of CRM hygiene by ensuring all customer interactions from LinkedIn messages, calls and emails are updated and recorded in our CRM Key Skills: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal Excellent management of the top of sales funnel Solid commercial acumen; the ability to spot opportunities in the territory A proactive, service-oriented attitude towards AccelerAsia’s client(s) and prospects Self-starter and autonomous Ideally 1 to 3 years experience software Sales Development On Offer: Good remuneration package includes performance based variable compensation Medical Strong Culture driven by AccelerAsia’s values Flexible working hours and uncapped annual leave Opportunities for internal growth within or beyond Sales Development
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Hodie Marketing Singapore is a leading workforce solutions company that helps organizations transform in a fast-changing world of work by sourcing, assessing, developing and managing the talent that enables them to win. We are a front-runner in the B2B space, representing well-known brands to market their services in different industries in FMCG, Telecommunications, e-Commerce, Tech and Energy. With the Covid situation still ongoing in many countries, and many companies down-sizing or closing down, our client has done the opposite! Right now, we’re looking to expand on a couple of key projects, and are looking for new additions to the team!  Our Team Values:     •  Fun Loving: We are very serious about work and our goals, but beneath our professional exterior, we are really a bunch of people who love to have fun.      •  Resilient: We are a team of hard-working individuals that strive to get the job done in the best possible manner. We are committed to high quality work.      •  Intellectual Curiosity: We are curious, and we have a hunger to consistently learn. We are very open to ideas and innovation.    Job Responsibilities:     •  Locate or propose potential business deals by contacting potential clients & exploring opportunities     •  Build contacts with prospects and follow-up on every business opportunity     •  Manage customer enquiries through multiple channels (emails, WhatsApp, calls…)     •  Source for new business partners/vendors for an existing business to achieve sales target     •  Provide exceptional customer experience and maintain a high standard of service  Job Requirements:     •  A team player with excellent communication and interpersonal skills     •  Able to take initiative and to work independently and within a team     •  Eager to learn and willing to go the extra mile     •  Good working attitude & good learning attitude. Being open to changes & having the courage to step out of your comfort zone  What We Offer:     •  1 to 1 coaching     •  No experience required     •  Fun and enjoyable work environment     •  Traveling opportunities     •  Fast career progression & personal development

Company Description  LinkedIn was built to help professionals achieve more in their careers, and every day millions of people use our products to make connections, discover opportunities and gain insights. Our global reach means we get to make a direct impact on the world’s workforce in ways no other company can. We’re much more than a digital resume – we transform lives through innovative products and technology.  Job Description  Searching for your dream job? At LinkedIn, we strive to help our employees find passion and purpose. Join us in changing the way the world works.  We are looking for a Solutions Consultant in our LinkedIn Sales Solutions (LSS) line of business. Your role will be to partner with our sales teams to showcase the value of LinkedIn for the sales organization. You will work across segments, focusing on large, complex deals and addressing technical and product questions so that our customers and prospects better understand how to implement our products effectively. You will be responsible for being a product specialist across LSS products, with a deep understanding of all product integrations and enterprise features.  Responsibilities  Serve as a thought leader and resident expert on product questions, technical integrations, success stories and general industry knowledge for the sales team and clients Possess a deep, up-to-date understanding of the entire LSS product portfolio, including both Sales Navigator, LinkedIn Sales Insights and their related integrations with the CRM and other partners. Partner with Sales reps to understand the customer needs, and use that understanding to provide compelling product demonstrations, sales presentations, and responses to questionnaires/RFPs. Contribute to documentation of best practices and other supporting materials for internal content repository Create and maintain demonstration environments across our products and related integrations Provide structured feedback and product enhancement insights to Product Management based on customer engagements  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications: 7+ years of proven experience in product, consulting, or client-facing roles at online companies. 7+ years of experience working in the B2B tech space in a product, consulting, or enterprise sales role BA/BS or equivalent degree  Preferred Qualifications  Experience in pre-sales or sales engineering Experience in product management, consulting, engineering, or sales Experience working in SaaS, preferably in sales productivity and/or ad tech Excellent communication skills, able to deliver killer demos Ability to work cross-functionally  Additional Information  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.   Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  This document provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://lnkd.in/GlobalDataPrivacyNotice
industries: Internet

description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  Welcome to the Salesforce Enterprise Sales team! We are looking for a talent with great energy, leadership, and initiative to drive team performance and sales for our Enterprise Business Unit for the Singapore market.  The Regional Sales Director (RSD), reports to the Area Vice President (AVP) for Singapore. This talent will spearhead a sales team recognized for high-growth, long-term sustainable success and its dedication to Salesforce values of Trust, Customer Success, Innovation, and Equality.  Your Impact Provide support and mentorship to direct reports by participating and coaching in client and prospect meetings or engaging other corporate resources as the need arises Development of a winning team, including recruiting, hiring, and training new account executives Conducting weekly forecast meetings Mentoring direct reports on strategies to drive sales wins Accurate reporting on sales activity and forecasting to senior sales management Consistent monitoring of the sales activity of the team, and tracking of results Mentoring and supervising demand generation activities Spearheading initiatives to drive customer awareness and engagement Develop and execute successful sales campaigns Engaging at the C-level in enterprise customer organizations Capable of successfully managing significant client escalations and issues Develop required Corporate relationships and Executive engagement to support the success of our business Develops relevant Industry expertise, brand, and network Required Skills Proven experience in enterprise sales In-depth industry knowledge advantageous A proven, successful background in sales leadership in the enterprise customer space Consistent track record to build high performing teams and lead them to success Proven experience with GTM channel and alliance selling Excellent presentation and executive engagement skills Excellent negotiation skills A self-starter that can thrive in a fast-paced environment Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.
