description: Kiehl’s Customer Representative  Who are we?  We wake up every morning because there is excitement in knowing that everyone we work with has a tremendous impact on a larger vision. We empower billions of people to be the canvas for self-expression inspiring confidence and self-belief every day. When they feel good, we feel good. It's contagious! That’s why we surround ourselves with other 86 000 L'Oréal driven thinkers and doers to spark innovation and build a true leading brand powerhouse offering beauty for all across 36 international brands and 150 countries.  When we create a product or experience that makes our hearts beat faster, we know we’re onto something. Something that will win the hearts and minds of another billion.  What are we looking for?  Do you love skincare? Do you enjoy talking to customers? Are you a good salesperson? We are looking for Kiehl’s Customer Representative who enjoys providing friendly, professional and knowledgeable service to all clients.  In This Role, You Will Provide beauty advice to customers Drive sales and foster good relationships with customers by providing excellent customer service Demonstrate product usage Meeting sales target Maintain healthy stock inventory Make our boutique stores clean and tidy The Ideal Candidate Should Have Keen interest in retail/client service industry experience Effective time management, problem solving and communication skills. Ability to multi-task, while providing professional and outstanding client service. Aggressiveness in sales Candidates without experience are welcome to apply.  Why should you work for L’Oreal?  L’Oréal is richly endowed with a portfolio of international brands that is unique in the world and that covers all the lines of cosmetics and responds to the diverse needs of consumers the world over. Visit us to know more.  We provide  Career Development Opportunities Training opportunities Fast track career progression Attractive Remuneration Package Basic salary + Monthly sales commission + Allowances + Variable performance bonus Quarterly free products across various brands in L’Oreal group and staff discounts Employee Referral Incentives Various type of leaves Medical and dental benefits + Insurance coverage
industries: Consumer Goods and Cosmetics

description: We are looking for a junior role to cover one of the following territories: South East Asia, Oceania, Middle East, Europe. They should be confident with building new client relationship and maintaining existing ones. They should have evidence of strong skills and possess good negotiation skills.  Responsibilities Generate leads through cold calling and emails Build relationships with prospective clients Maintain consistent contact with existing clients Manage sales pipeline Analyze market and establish competitive advantages Track metrics to ensure targets are hit Able to assist ad hoc duties from time to time  Qualifications Strong negotiation skills Strong communication and presentation skills Able to communicate in native language(s) of the mentioned territories is preferred

Scantist is looking for an ambitious sales representative to join our growing team. The ideal candidate must be a self-starter who embraces the challenges associated with a start-up company and enjoys being a part of the success story. You should be comfortable with value-selling SaaS solutions and technologies to customers across varying domains in a competitive landscape.  Responsibilities Book new business meetings with key stakeholders to generate a consistent sales pipeline Actively engage with the marketing efforts for targeted lead generation Qualify and manage inbound leads and opportunities for large accounts Execute the full sales cycle for small to mid-size accounts Build sustainable, trust-based relationships with early customers and adopters Track and create data-driven reports to influence product development based on market needs and trends Track and monitor potential leaders in CRM Advocate for Scantist platform and our position within the Application Security Market  Qualifications Diploma/Bachelor’s degree in Business/Computer Science/IT or similar  1+ years of professional phone sales or sales support experience with SaaS products Must be familiar with fundamental IT concepts and terminologies Prior experience with CRM Systems like Hubspot Prior experience or specialization in the cyber-security domain is a huge plus Native fluency in English (Mandarin is plus)

Endeavor are offering the perfect opportunity for graduates to join IMG Media & Events as part of the Strategic Partnerships Sponsorship Sales Trainee Programme. Successful candidates will gain varied experience by shadowing existing members of the APAC Strategic Partnerships Sponsorship Sales team, working across many events across Culinary, Arts, Entertainment, Tennis, Golf business divisions. The training programme will take place over 2 year period. In Year 2 of the programme (upon successful completion Year 1), the Strategic Partnerships Trainee will have the opportunity to start to sell sponsorship (and be included in the incentive scheme) for Endeavor Properties and if successful, could graduate to the position of Strategic Partnerships Executive.  Key Responsibilities & Accountabilities Conducting research, collecting and analysing data to prepare reports prior to meetings Researching appropriate industries/categories and leads for event partnerships Assisting with ad hoc projects  Preparing documents and presentations for clients   Conducting data entry onto CRM system and drawing relevant reports / dashboards Becoming familiar with all our processes and Panther/CRM/Power BI systems used in the Strategic Partnerships team Managing pipeline reports and trackers Shadowing sales execs at meetings Liaising with Sales Operations team on all tasks General office duties & administration for the Sales Operations and Strategic Partnerships team Possibility of attending events, gaining experience with account management and hosting of clients at events Attending meetings and taking minutes, as well as post meeting CRM entry Coordinating multi-party meetings, conference calls and video-conferences Attending introductions with various other parts of the business to understand the wider company   Key Results Areas Learn and soak up as much knowledge about Endeavor and all the different parts of the company from introduction meetings you will attend. Become familiar of all aspects of the events we own, operate, represent in the UK by spending time with different business units and event managers and attending events where possible. Understand rights and benefits of an event partnership and be familiar with the reasons a company chooses to sponsor a certain event. Garner as much knowledge and training on strategic partnerships and sponsorship sales from the wider team and by shadowing the sales execs. Be actively researching industries and categories to be able to generate a decent number of leads weekly for chosen events. Think creatively about intuitive partnerships for new categories and companies we are not yet working with, including activation ideas. Be familiar with all tools and systems and follow all due Sales Operations processes.  Knowledge & Experience Be commercially aware and have knowledge of brands associated with sponsorship of international events Previous work experience on events Numerate with ability to analyse and work with numbers Strong knowledge of digital landscape, active in social media Understanding of latest trends, new concepts in sponsorship Knowledge of other languages and international awareness would be beneficial Be educated to degree level (or equivalent qualification)Events, Sports, Business Studies, Marketing related degree (or equivalent)  Skills & Abilities Be a good administrator with attention to detail Possess strong IT skills – Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook Have excellent organisational skills with ability to prioritise and multi-task, and stay organised under pressure Showcase strong interpersonal communication skills to provide first rate service internally to colleagues and externally to clients Be completely discreet when handling/dealing with confidential information Demonstrate commercial and cultural awareness (as dealing with multi-national companies and international events) Be driven to achieve success and possess the hunger and curiosity to learn and be proactive in finding and chasing leads Enjoy working in a team environment with the ability to collaborate, seek feedback and build credibility through interaction with others  About IMG IMG is a global leader in Sports, Fashion, Events and Media, operating in more than 30 countries. The company manages some of the world’s greatest sports figures and fashion icons; stages hundreds of live events and branded entertainment experiences annually; and is a leading independent producer and distributor of sports and entertainment media. IMG also specializes in sports training and league development, as well as marketing, media and licensing for brands, sports organizations and collegiate institutions. IMG is part of the Endeavor network.
industries: Entertainment, Broadcast Media, and Sports

description: Vonage Sales Mission  We strive to innovate and enhance our customers' ability to communicate within today's digital, cloud and real-time business environment. Our sales & SDR teams are composed of highly-motivated, energetic and customer-focused Team Members that expand existing accounts/channels and find new clients for company products and services.  Why This Job Matters  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is required to perform account-based development in SEA market . As part of the Sales team, the SDR will leverage the latest tools and techniques to develop target accounts. Success will be measured in Appointments scheduled and discovery of new sales opportunities.  Our ideal candidate is a self-motivated team player with high social intelligence and a natural inclination for selling, who understands the value of research and the importance of personalizing value propositions and messaging to target contacts. He or she is highly driven and values the benefits of being part of an agile growing team.  You will be the very first point of contact for potential customers for Vonage and play a vital role not only in generating sales pipeline, but helping us refine sales and marketing strategy based on your interactions and successes with prospects.  If this sounds like you, continue reading below...  What You Will Do Research and develop insights on target accounts Setup ICP persona-based account plans, including personalized digital/online assets Orchestrate account strategy plays; email, phone calls, and direct mail to target contacts Measure results and refine outreach accordingly Daily Adventures Include Performing outbound & inbound sales activities, contacting potential clients through phone, emails, LinkedIn and other channels; Discovering new leads through creative internet research and social media monitoring/messaging, Inbound Lead flow in Salesforce.com, using LinkedIn Navigator, etc Qualifying & disqualifying potential customers based on a thorough knowledge of Vonage API platform products Keep meticulous and detailed notes updated in Salesforce.com Schedule meetings for assigned Regional Account Executives Collaborating with Marketing counterparts, assigned Regional Account Executives and sales leadership to optimize performance Develop and maintain territory plans with assigned Regional Account Executives for their assigned territories What You Will Bring Sound writing abilities, in particular crafting relevant communications that engage senior executives Strong research, organizational and time management skills Track-record of success in previous jobs What Is Required Of You Well-developed interpersonal, listening, verbal and written communication skills; 2-5 years of relevant experience in a B2B technology/software environment preferred 4-year degree mandatory; a specialization in Technology Communications, or Business a plus Experience with Salesforce, Outreach.io, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, G Suite Highly focused with a goal-oriented mindset Creative and communicative about new ideas to help the team be successful Autonomy and ability to make things happen without supervision or tight control Interest in growing your career in tech What Is In It For You  In addition to providing exciting work, career advancement opportunities, and a collaborative work environment, Vonage provides competitive pay and benefits including unlimited discretionary time off and tuition reimbursement.  Note: The purpose of this profile is to provide a general summary of essential responsibilities for the position and is not meant as an exhaustive list. Assignments may differ for individuals within the same role based on business conditions, departmental need or geographic location.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: About Have Halal, Will Travel (HHWT)  HHWT is the leading lifestyle and travel platform for Muslims, with a reach of almost 10 million monthly. Our ultimate vision is to foster peace between people through travel as we believe it is the greatest tool to break down stereotypes and biases.  We work with internationally renowned brands such as Google, Unilever, Nestle, Mitsubishi as well as government ministries such as the Health Promotion Board, Singapore Tourism Board & Malaysia Tourism Board.  We are a START-UP that embraces talent from diverse backgrounds. We hire regardless of race, gender, language, or religion. Be prepared to roll up your sleeves and work in a dynamic, multi-cultural, and exciting environment!  More about us: Forbes 30 under 30 award Our work with STB Our work with Microsoft  Key Responsibilities  This is a position based in Singapore. Ideal for people who are transitioning or looking for new opportunities!  Working closely with the team, your key responsibilities will be to: Go door to door to cultivate new leads Maintain records and client database of all sales leads and/or customer accounts Convert leads collected into sales by effectively communicating HHWT's value proposition (eg. proposals) Meet targets of 50 live leads collection and sales conversions of at least 20%  Requirements Preferred: At least 1 year in a sales-oriented role Highly organised with strong analytical ability and adaptable to changes Strong communication, negotiation and interpersonal skills Self-motivated and driven  Benefits Be mentored by an ex-listed company CEO with deep experience in media, publishing, & travel (Dow Jones, BBC, Lonely Planet, PropertyGuru) Work alongside Forbes 30 Under 30 winners Flexible working hours Great working environment and culture Allowance with very attractive commission & incentive structure  All shortlisted candidates will be invited to an interview. All the best!
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: About Capgemini  The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2019 combined revenues of EUR 17 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.  Account Executive (Banking) (Director)  Account Executive develops and owns the relationship within assigned account to maximize Capgemini’s footprint within them. Incumbents effectively collaborate with other extended teams to formulate go-to-market strategies and drive growth. Your focus will be helping our clients deliver results against some of their most complex business and technology initiatives in Financial Services. The Account Executive will partner with and ensure the long-term success of our clients. Different projects could challenge you to succeed as a highly consultative senior management advisor or to drive highly visible technical projects based on your planning, execution, and client relationship management skills.   Expand sales within existing accounts while building relationships with key decision makers. Develop & execute a comprehensive business plan, including identifying core customer requirements and mapping Capgemini’s solutions to them. Establish collaborative partnership with key stakeholders to assess and recommend optimal business and technical solutions. Accountable for accurate forecasting, regular revenue delivery, and the implementation of agreed account and business plans. Maximize brand recognition and mindshare at all levels, and publicizes success stories. Provide customer feedback to internal stakeholders for solutions and process improvements. At this level, incumbents will have expert-level knowledge of selling the solutions within financial services market. Incumbents routinely sell-to and interact with executive-level customer decision makers, to include up to CXO levels.  Key Requirements  8+ years of professional experience Experience in shaping & structuring sales proposals in Consulting or IT Services solutions, preferably in Financial Services space. Experience in selling Digital Solutions, Transformation / M&A projects, preferred Expert-level presentation, customer service, financial/business acumen, and negotiation skills at all levels of customer engagement. Complete, “big-picture” understanding of the business and technical contexts of the account. Driven, self-starter who exudes leadership on account set and compels others to get on board. Fully adept at consultative effectiveness and establishing trust with internal and external customers.
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Information Technology
industries: Information Technology and Services and Banking

description: Responsibilties Account Management and Growth Ensure smooth onboarding process of new clients to use Ninja's Platforms Build and maintain positive working relationship and strong rapport with assigned accounts so as to achieve high retention rate and client satisfaction Ensure escalations and issues are handled in a timely manner with appropriate solutions provided to achieve positive customer experience Upsell and cross-sell services available services to client in order to increase and grow stickiness of accounts Work closely with internal departments and stakeholders to identify and resolves operational blockers Build regular monthly performance reports using relevant data and statistics available for clients Working closely with business development sales team to identify opportunities, industry analysis and solutioning Requirements 0 - 2 years experience in a account management/client-facing role Strong communication and interpersonal skills to build relationships with internal and external stakeholders Strategic service excellence Competent in providing technical sales support

description: Job Description At Beyond Rentals, we’re well aware of the impact our solutions, But we won’t rest until everybody knows. We’re seeking a qualified business development executive to extend our market reach through expert discovery and exploration of new and untapped business opportunities and relationships.  Our ideal candidate will be trusted to dive right in, take the lead, use initiative, and help build Beyond Rentals to the next stage that help make business operations easier with robotics, automation and data for businesses in Singapore. Highly skilled at sales and business operations, this person will join and inspire a team of like-minded go-getters to achieve our company vision.  Objectives of this Role Managing both our existing sales pipeline and developing new business opportunities Take a lead role in the development of proposals and presentations for new business materials to create and nurture business opportunities and partnerships Identify trends and customer needs, building a short/medium/long-term sales pipeline in accordance with targets Develop strategies and positions by analyzing new venture integration Assist in the coordination and implementation of marketing strategies, and delegate tasks that achieve strategic goals Motivate the team, track performance, and report metrics  Daily and Monthly Responsibilities Monitor and evaluate industry trends and customer drivers and meet regularly with management and stakeholders to discuss strategy Manage proposal response process, including detailed RFP requirements, content creation, and inputs from various sources Generate new leads, identify and contact decision-makers, screen potential business opportunities, select the deals in line with strategies, and lead and facilitate pitch logistics Develop and implement overarching outbound sales and business development strategy, sales processes, structure, and best practices across the company Support deal structure and pricing with business value analysis; negotiate prices for proactive bids and proposals Maintain and share professional knowledge through education, networking, events, and presentations  Skills and Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in business or management Successful track record in B2B sales and negotiation Excellent verbal and written communication skills Working experience with sales techniques Proficiency with data analysis, forecasting, and budgeting Proven ability to plan and manage resources

jobTitle: Account Executive, Large Enterprise, Singapore Industry
description: Do what you love. Love what you do.  At Workday, we help the world’s largest organizations adapt to what’s next by bringing finance, HR, and planning into a single enterprise cloud. We work hard, and we’re serious about what we do. But we like to have fun, too. We put people first, celebrate diversity, drive innovation, and do good in the communities where we live and work.  About the Team Account Executives are key players in our Field Sales Operations organization and fuel Workday’s growth and drive net new business. They are knowledgeable about our product value and portfolio, and use their extensive sales experience and consultative selling skills to drive complex sales cycles and initiate long-standing relationships with prospective customers and executive sponsors.Our enterprise applications are positively disrupting the industry and transforming how businesses operate and make decisions in today’s ever changing global market. If you are passionate about selling software that can impact some of today’s biggest brands and are a self-starter with a stellar sales track record, join us. About the Role  As a Workday Sales Representative, you will be on the ground floor of a dynamic, burgeoning field operations organization. You will employ effective selling strategies to successfully position Workday as a viable alternative to legacy ERP solutions and help develop customers into key references for Workday.   In this role, you will:   Effectively position Workday’s products as the enterprise application of choice by understanding the competitive landscape and customer needs. Drive complex sales cycles through orchestrating internal teams of pre-sales, value management, bid management, inside sales, marketing and sales support. Cultivate mutually beneficial relationships with strategic partners. Maintain accurate and timely customer, pipeline, and forecast data. Mentor new presales and sales managers. Provide support for marketing activities and events.  About You Prior experience in business application sales, preferably in an ERP environment. Deep experience selling to Singapore accounts. Proven ability in managing complex sales cycles from start to finish with a track record of successful revenue attainment. Familiarity with consultative selling methodologies.  Workday is an Equal Opportunity Employer including individuals with disabilities and protected veterans.
industries: Computer Software, Human Resources, and Information Technology and Services

description: Role: Senior Business Development Executive Location: Singapore  Term: Full Time  Start Date: Immediate Reporting to: CEO   Company Profile Commsens is an IoT energy management and optimisation solution provider. We monitor assets and processes – securely monitoring health and performance.   We develop and deploy secure and robust multi-sensor wireless IoT devices to gather real-time data from factories, hospitals, homes and smart city installations.   Our devices and software suite are suited for condition monitoring, diagnostics and automation. We enable, condition monitoring, energy management, predictive maintenance, resource planning, capacity utilisation, process optimisation, performance warnings, decision insights, digital twin visualisation, etc.   Our team has over twenty years of experience in the IoT, AI and cybersecurity space, and we transform domain know-how and expertise into value-driven products for our customers  Summary of Responsibilities Generate new leads and connect through cold calls/emails Build relationships with prospective clients  Maintain consistent contact with existing clients  Manage healthy sales pipeline  Track sales metrics to ensure targets are hit Analyze market and establish competitive advantages  Qualifications Bachelor's degree with 3+ years in sales industry [OR] Diploma degree with 5+ years in the sales industry  Experience in full sales cycle including deal closing Demonstrated sales success  Strong negotiation skills  Strong communication and presentation skills  CRM experience is a must, comfortable with making cold calls/emails Knowledge of Internet of Things (IoT) and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) is preferred but not mandatory (We will provide training on our product/solutions business line)  Detailed day to day activities You will be responsible for providing overall direction, sales strategy, and team management to meet and exceed profitable sales targets for IoT solutions in Singapore and Globally. On a day to day basis, you will be driving the following areas. Develop plans to increase the market share of all assigned product lines through communications with government officials, consulting engineers, engineering firms, industrial and utility companies Develop and execute strategic plans to achieve sales revenue to meet and/or exceed assigned targets. Monitor performance metrics and key performance indicators for the team Coordinate sales distribution by establishing quotas and goals with resellers and distributors Establish and ensure effective/clear communication/coordination within the internal teams to maintain a common, corporate message and share best practices Establish sales channels and recommend the development of alternate sales channels Ensure Customer Relationship Management (CRM) system usage and sales processes are being diligently followed in a timely manner Assist with the negotiations of contracts for the purchase Conduct techno-commercial sales presentations Keep company management informed of business conditions that may affect assigned products or markets Stay current with competitive activity and organize sales response to market changes Provide accurate forecasts of projected sales and growth covering weekly, monthly, quarterly, and yearly numbers Focus on cultivating organic sales opportunities, and targeted messaging, with a goal of generating new leads locally and globally Create linkages between lead-generation marketing, and wider corporate marketing efforts, such as thought leadership, and broader brand-based marketing Actively participate in webinars, trade shows, roadshows, and training activities Ensure that profit margins are maximized for the assigned product/solution lines  Few things we'd like to know from you Have you converted customers from cold calls and cold emails? Have you used CRM software to manage your sales activities? Have you closed sales deals virtually (over Zoom calls or equivalent)?  Apply Now We are looking to onboard suitable candidates immediately. Singaporeans & PR are preferred. For applying email us at aloysius@commsens.ai or call at 92323699. Thanks!

POSITION SUMMARY: This individual will be responsible for the sales, marketing, and business development of avionics products in the region. This individual will drive sales and cultivate lasting relationships in the general aviation, business aviation, commercial aviation, aviation services, and the military and government markets.  Essential Functions Directly interface with customers, including dealers, fleet operators, OEM representatives, business partners, governments, and end users by way of visits, product presentations, correspondence, and other means of communication Demonstrates advanced knowledge of the avionics industry and Garmin aviation products Builds and presents product presentations demonstrating advanced knowledge of Garmin aviation products and showing a high level of comfort presenting in front of customers, including high-ranking executive/leaders Demonstrates ability to effectively develop persuasive, well-organized, and informative proposals and business case analysis in response to customer proposal requests; execution will be completed with minimal oversight and support from management or the team Work with the internal global team to drive customer contract negotiations effectively across cross-functional teams with minimal oversight and guidance Develop, review and revise regional and OEM-specific forecasts and be accountable for those sales commitments to the business Pursue and develop opportunities in a variety of aviation market segments expanding Garmin’s global reach within the region Develop and maintain a short term and long-term regional sales strategy for increasing market share in each market including the general aviation, business aviation, commercial aviation, military & government, and services segments. Demonstrates the ability to build strong working relationships with key points-of-contact and key management representatives at each of your customers as the primary commercial representative for Garmin Assist in collecting, compiling and presenting competitive intelligence internally Demonstrates ability to proactively provide timely, detailed and actionable trip notes after customer visits with a good level of detail; submits weekly reports with the appropriate detail and on time Survey product markets to determine product potential or needs for new products and assist in the implementation of new product offerings in the assigned region Plan, organize and attend industry trade shows and events; and represent Garmin in a professional manner duringall interactions with customers, media and government/regulatory officials Coordinate efforts of Marketing, Product Support, and Engineering departments to solve customer problems and be a strong internal voice of the description: As an Account Executive at Stripe, you will drive Stripe’s future growth engine by building relationships with prospective clients and turning them into happy Stripe users. You are an adept salesperson, capable of engaging in business-level and technical conversations at multiple levels of the organization, including the CTO, COO, and CFO. You have experience working with upper middle market and enterprise companies. You have an in-depth understanding of the buyer journey and can lead a complex, multi-party sale in a highly consultative manner. You are used to building value in competitive situations and enjoy working on products that require deep product understanding, combined with technical knowledge. You are naturally analytical and enjoy digging into business models and helping customers quantify their investment decisions. You get excited about prospecting, and are capable of independently leading a sales cycle from start to finish. Finally, you enjoy building – you like to actively participate in the development of our sales process, the articulation of our value proposition, and the creation of key tools and assets. If you’re motivated, smart, persistent, and a great teammate, we want to hear from you!  You Will Own a named account list and develop account plans for winning and expanding business with upper middle market and enterprise companies Develop outbound strategies to create and nurture opportunities Own the full sales cycle from lead to close for upper middle market and enterprise companies Develop relationships with executive stakeholders at new and existing clients Work with company leaders from multiple functions (e.g., Engineering, Product, and Finance) to lead complex product workshops and financial analyses Lead and contribute to team projects to develop and refine our sales process Engage with Product and Engineering teams to help drive product strategy We’re Looking For Someone With 8+ years of sales experience, preferably at a technology company, with a track record of top performance Ability to understand complex technical requirements and craft solutions across multiple products Ability to develop and execute account plans spanning multiple business units across complex organizations Strong presentation skills, particularly for in-person meetings with multiple stakeholders Proven ability to lead complex negotiations involving bespoke commercial agreements Superior verbal and written communication skills Ability to operate in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment Strong interest in technology Experience working in one or more markets in Southeast Asia You Should Include These In Your Application A resume or LinkedIn profile
industries: Computer Software, Financial Services, and Internet

description: Rapyd Is Building the Future of Fintech  Rapyd is a financial technology company that allows businesses to accept and make payments anywhere, using any method. By building the largest local payments network, we’re unleashing global opportunities, letting businesses reach new markets faster and giving more consumers access to innovative goods and services.  Built from the ground up as a global organization, diversity is in our DNA. We have offices in London, Tel Aviv, Singapore, California, and Reykjavik, and employees around the world. Our investors include Stripe, General Catalyst, Oak FT, Tiger Global, Durable Capital, Target Global, and TaL Capital.  At Rapyd, we believe in straight talk and quick decision making, fast execution, and simple elegant solutions. Global payments is complex enough, navigating your way around office politics shouldn’t have to get in the way.  If you’re looking to be part of a fast-growing company that’s disrupting the payments industry by building transformative technology, then join our team and play a pivotal role in developing the future of fintech.  We are looking for a friendly, well-spoken Sales Development Representative (SDR) to assist our company in expanding our customer base in the APAC region. The SDR’s responsibilities include generating leads (self-prospecting), soliciting potential customers, facilitating sales and connecting customers with the most appropriate sales representative.  To be a successful SDR you should have excellent communication, interpersonal and customer service skills. You should also demonstrate the ability to meet deadlines and have strong analytical and problem solving skills.  Responsibilities Generate leads that would match a given criteria Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market Initiating contact with potential customers through cold calling or responding to inquiries generated from marketing campaigns Providing feedback to the marketing team regarding the quality of marketing-sourced leads Creating relationships with customers to identify their needs and qualify their interests Presenting product information to customers after identifying their needs Moving leads through the marketing funnel, connecting them to a salesperson and arranging meetings Following up with potential customers who expressed interest but did not purchase any goods or services Performing regular follow up calls or emails and identify new potential needs Reporting on activities and results to sales management Collaborating with sales executives to ensure sales targets are met Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Sales, Marketing, Business, or related field At least 2 years of Sales Development / Inside Sales experience Strong communication, interpersonal, team working and customer service skills Independent, self-starter, problem solver Ability to negotiate skillfully, promote/sell ideas persuasively and close transactions with mutually beneficial results Ability to think strategically and tactically. Ability to maintain a positive attitude in the face of criticism, rejection or failure Ability to research complex information online Ability to leverage software and tech tools to automate and optimize outreach Comfortable with data, ability to interpret it Hands-on experience with multiple sales prospecting techniques like cold calling, cold emailing and social outreach Track record of achieving sales targets Good time management skills Experience working with a CRM tool
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: At Automation Anywhere, we are passionate in our belief that Software Bots can free people to create, think, discover, and ultimately build great companies. With our Digital Workforce platform, we are contributing to build a Digital Workforce more than three million digital workers by 2022. Our platform includes Robotic Process Automation, Cognitive technologies and Analytics and is adopted by over 5000 companies globally.  We have dedicated the last decade to driving the adoption of Robotic Process Automation technology in leading Financial Services, BPO, Healthcare, Technology, and Insurance companies to name a few, across more than 90 countries. We are taking the lead to define the category and create the blueprint to make it successful. This clearly is a once in a lifetime opportunity to make a difference and change the world.     Senior Sales Account Executive (Enterprise/ ASEAN Focus)  Responsibilities: Take ownership of revenue generation, develop new opportunities, manage pipeline, create and execute account strategies and close enterprise-level deals for new, expansion and renewal bookings  Conduct on-site and remote customer meetings to include initial pitch presentations and demos with marketing qualified leads.  Attend tradeshows and other events to develop leads.  Conduct standard and custom product demos and answer technical Q&A  Interface with client technical teams to present our product architecture, engage in solutioning discussions customized to the client and overcoming technical objections, if any   Collaborate with our sales engineers to manage and execute Proof of Concept exercises where the sales engineer will go onsite to build a Bot (i.e., process automation) live in front of the client automating one of the client’s processes using their systems in a test environment.   Lead RFX responses coordinating with our RFX team, sales engineers, products team and services team as required   Coordinate closely with technical support, engineering and service resources to align solution design with client’s business requirements.  Work closely with key management team to ensure product success and define future roadmap.  Required Experience: Strong account management experience for large strategic accounts. Experience in full sales cycle helping to create and execute a vision with companies leadership teams around the value of a Digital Workforce and the strategy to onboard etc. Thorough knowledge of consultative selling including prospecting, qualifying, objection handling and closing Knowledge of enterprise software architecture and Cloud / SaaS technologies Knowledge of business process management and the ability to sell to lob business owners. High energy with the ability to excel in an entrepreneurial, fast changing environment Experience and knowledge of working with channel partners Technical depth with the ability to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders Computer knowledge including proficiency with software applications including Salesforce Degree qualified preferred Experience with RPA and/or in related fields of automation a bonus.  Why Automation Anywhere? At our company each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. As the leader in Robotic Process Automation (RPA), we provide a very compelling product where our teams are breaking new ground every day and given an environment to grow their skills and have fun along the way.  Our technology is the game changer, and our people give us the edge to better our world and go be great!   Great learning environment, collaborating with experienced industry leaders.  Competitive salary and stock options  Flexible Work culture  Automation Anywhere is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.  **All unsolicited resumes submitted to any @automationanywhere.com email address without HR/Recruiting approval, whether submitted by an individual or by an agency, will not be eligible for an agency fee.
industries: Computer Software, Management Consulting, and Information Technology and Services

description: Job Description:  As a Business Development Representative (Customer-facing), you will play an essential role in DataRobot’s direct sales team. Your role will consist of conducting in-depth research into organisations and key decision makers across the region and proactively engaging them in discussions on how DataRobot’s platform can help them overcome some of their biggest challenges.  We are looking for exceptional candidates for our fast-growing team of young and ambitious people. This is an opportunity to be part of one of the fastest growing software companies on the planet, in the technology field that will have the most impact on all of our lives for generations to come, whilst also developing your career as a world-class sales representative.  This is a perfect role for any hard-working and ambitious candidate. If you have a track record of making tough decisions and demonstrating the drive, grit and determination to achieve your goals, our development programs will provide you with the perfect opportunity to progress your career quickly.  The work environment is high-energy, performance focused, data-driven and demanding but also extremely rewarding (and fun) for high-performers. DataRobot invests heavily in developing our team and commits to promoting from within, based on merit alone.  Responsibilities :  Diligently research target accounts assigned to you and keep on top of new announcements, annual reports, press releases and other publicly available information that may be pertinent to the sales organisation. Map out the organisation structure and key influencers within each target account. Research areas of interest for key decision makers and potential routes to engage them. Craft well researched, creative outreach campaigns tailored to the findings of your research. Professionally and persistently follow up via phone, email, LinkedIn and other means identified from the research. Conduct initial introductory and discovery discussions to help qualify potential. Book qualified meetings and provide the sales team with detailed, well formatted handover notes from initial discussions. Consistently meet or exceed Key Performance Indicators and contribute to the continued hypergrowth of the region. Understand industry trends and show dedication to continuous learning on all professional fronts Provide feedback to peers and internal teams to help develop and improve marketing materials and messaging. Adapt messaging to suit the needs of the local market. Maintain up-to-date information in Salesforce.com and Outreach.io.  Main Requirements :  2-3+ years experience of qualifying and engaging with prospects in a B2B environment. Track record of consistently achieving targets. Strong academic background from a leading university. Excellent verbal and written English essential, other languages preferred. Ability to comprehend topics and translate them into easy to understand, concise explanations. Ability to conduct meaningful, rigorous research and distill findings into concise summaries for sharing with the sales organisation. History of high-achievement in any field with a demonstrable track record of making tough decisions to achieve your goals. Ability to showcase creative, considered approaches to messaging and communication that is tailored to the audience and effectively captures their attention. Commitment, attention to detail, organizational skills, and multitasking needed to thrive in a performance-oriented culture Must be a self-starter, be comfortable with limited supervision, and have solid problem-solving skills  Good to have :  Experience with Salesforce, LinkedIn, Outreach.io, Chart.io Singaporean Citizens and Permanent Residents preferred.  DataRobot is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. DataRobot is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Please see the United States Department of Labor’s EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: At Algolia, we are passionate about helping developers & product teams connect their users with what matters most in milliseconds!  We are looking for highly driven individuals with strong technical aptitude and natural sales instincts to join our growing sales organization. As a Business Development Representative (BDR) at Algolia, you will play a critical role prospecting and expanding business opportunities for our APAC Enterprise and Mid Market team. You will take part in a wide variety of responsibilities that will help foster, qualify, and mature our pipeline with high profile customers. We need someone with a hunter attitude who can take direction as well as have the drive and motivation to work autonomously. We expect a strong go-getter!  Are you a resilient problem solver who isn't afraid to think outside the box and get their hands dirty? We expect you to take ownership and be able to execute against best practices, as much as be creative in the way you reach out to your prospects. We're looking for candidates who raise the level of our teams. You should value and practice transparency, have the humility to accept your weaknesses and continuously strive to improve both personally and professionally. Are you ready for the challenge?  Your Role Will Consist Of Work closely with our APAC Enterprise or Mid Market teams to build global pipeline and strategize on how to approach targeted accounts Identify, prospect key contacts at target accounts and build the foundations for a strong, long lasting relationship Execute appropriate strategies by building out right content ie. case studies, screencasts, presentations, demo hacks. This is where we expect you to unleash your creativity! Be an active part of the team, sharing best practices and participating in the Sales Development organisation's projects Manage, track and report sales activities and results using SFDC A typical morning for Tristan looks like : "Every morning, my goal is to reach out to new people to raise their interest for Algolia. First, I would be looking for new companies to target and find the relevant people I want to reach out to. Then I would craft a personalized messaging to help them realize the value they would get from evaluating Algolia. Eventually, I would own the conversation with them and pass them over to a senior Account Executive when they'll be ready to evaluate Algolia."  You Might Be a Fit If You Have Prior experience in lead generation and sales (SaaS experience preferred, but not required) Highly motivated with a competitive edge Communication and writing skills are on point Strong ability to quickly learn and adapt to change Demonstrated success overachieving (professionally/ personally) You have a keen interest in the tech industry Experience at our current stage and beyond ($50-200M ARR range, high growth, lots of change and building internal infrastructure) We're Looking For Someone Who Can Live Our Values GRIT - Problem-solving and perseverance capability in an ever-changing and growing environment. TRUST - Willingness to trust our co-workers and to take ownership. CANDOR - Ability to receive and give constructive feedback. CARE - Genuine care about other team members, our clients and the decisions we make in the company. HUMILITY - Aptitude for learning from others, putting ego aside. _______  Remote Strategy  Algolia’s workplace strategy, Hybrid Remote , is designed to harness the power of the opportunities that remote work offers both employees and the company, while also providing an engaging in-office experience for the times when an employee is in an office. Our workplace approach reflects the belief that an employee’s impact, contribution, and output are more important than their physical location.  The majority of employees will be able to choose if, and when, they come into an office on a regular basis. There will be times when our people are asked to come into an office for “moments that matter:” activities like critical planning meetings and team social gatherings. Beyond those events, 80% of our workforce may choose the location from where they work in the country in which they were hired.  We have physical offices in San Francisco, NYC, Atlanta, Paris, London, Bucharest, and we will be opening a small office in Austin soon. https://www.algolia.com/about/  _______  About Us  Millions of developers around the world use Algolia to unleash the power of search across their digital properties. They use Algolia because we are API-first. We unlock incredible flexibility. We build blazing fast speed into our APIs. We do this because we know developers want to build cool things and innovate. Under Armour, Lacoste, Birchbox, Stripe, Slack, Medium, Zendesk and 10,000+ other companies use Algolia to build not just great search, but search that converts at higher rates because of the relevancy. We help their customers find the right goods, offers, and content really quickly. So quickly, in fact, that they don’t go anywhere else. Algolia helps businesses build and optimize the search and discovery experience resulting in significantly enhanced online engagement, increased conversion rates and enriched lifetime value that generates profitable growth. Today, Algolia powers 1.5 Trillion searches a year – that’s 4 times more than Bing, Yahoo, DuckDuckGo, Baidu and Yandex combined. Our amazing technology is used by one in eight online users.  Founded in 2012, we're backed by $184M in funding from Accel Partners, Alven, DAG Ventures, Founders Circle, Owl Rock Capital, Point Nine Capital, SaaStr Fund, Salesforce Ventures, Storm Ventures and World Innovation Lab. The team is headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Paris, London, Tokyo, New York, and Atlanta. To learn more, visit www.algolia.com.  Who We're Looking For  We’re looking for talented, passionate people to build the world’s best search & discovery technology. As an ownership-driven company, we seek team members who thrive within an environment based on autonomy and diversity. We're committed to building an inclusive and diverse workplace. We care about each other and the world around us, and embrace talented people regardless of their race, age, ancestry, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, color, veteran status, disability and socioeconomic background.  READY TO APPLY?  If you share our values and our enthusiasm for building the world’s best search & discovery technology, we’d love to review your application!
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: What We Offer  Our company culture is focused on helping our employees enable innovation by building breakthroughs together. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from. Apply now!  Role Description  The Next Gen Rise team is a central team acting as a deal support center for SAP Account Executives across Asia Pacific and Japan and supports and processes SAP RISE PCE deals by processing them in Harmony and CRM system. This team also provides support to all procurement processes like back to back contracting with premium suppliers and procure to pay process working along with Global Procurement organization, SAP partners and AEs to administer POs for partners. The team is expected to contribute to revenue growth and profitability by processing SAP RISE PCE sales opportunities for both existing and net new customers and achieve orders targets.  Responsibilities Responsible for execution of the SAP RISE PCE deals. Process customer requests for selling SAP RISE PCE deals and completing the required paperwork (CRM Opportunities, Margin Calculator, Quotations, Order Forms, Resource Requests) Responsible for procurement processes related to premium suppliers and Hyper-scaler partners Comply with operational procedures e.g. for sales, delivery, financial and legal requirements Become expert with SAP sales tools and processes Working with Industry AEs , support the overall relationship between the customer, the partners and SAP to ensure all opportunities are maximized and sales bids are successful. Create contracts for submission for SAP’s existing and potential new customers: Responsible for drafting, modifying and finalizing contracts, including new and add-on business for SAP RISE PCE. Contract Validation: Closely cross-collaborate with the Industry AEs, Pricing and Revenue Recognition teams in the local market units during the contract drafting and negotiation process. Verify customer, user and pricing information provided by Account Executives and Pricing teams, work  with the Revenue Recognition teams to prevent revenue deferrals and ensure final business and contract terms. Customer Support/Administration: Monitor contract cancellation dates, trial agreement dates, as well as provide contract amendments for non- revenue generating issues (Terminations, Service Level Agreements etc.). Archiving and maintaining all contractual documentation Provide active quarter-end and year-end close deal support to the sales community in a dynamically driven environment. Work Experience Preferably at least 3 - 4 year experience with Sales Operations or Deal Support Working experience within a shared service center environment (preferred) Experience with Harmony and CRM tools and experience with SAP systems is a plus Education And Qualifications / Skills And Competencies Proficient in written and spoken English Bachelor´s degree in any discipline Excellent communication skills are a must Team player Extremely detail-oriented, organized and with strong follow-up skills Ability to multitask, prioritize and solve problems with little direct supervision Good command of MS Office (Excel, word, PowerPoint and Outlook) Experience with SmartSheet application We are SAP  SAP innovations help more than 400,000 customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with 200 million users and more than 100,000 employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, we build breakthroughs, together.  Our inclusion promise  SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com.  EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.  Requisition ID:305904 | Work Area: Sales Operations | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations:

description: Company Description  MicroStrategy transforms organizations into intelligent enterprises through data-driven innovation. We match smart people to dynamic projects and technologies that truly challenge their talents. Curious and creative in outlook, our success is built on the talent and energy of smart and driven people. MicroStrategy (Nasdaq: MSTR) is a worldwide leader in enterprise analytics and mobility software. A pioneer in the BI and analytics space, MicroStrategy delivers innovative software that empowers people to make better decisions and transform the way they do business. We provide our enterprise customers with world-class software and expert services so they can deploy unique intelligence applications.  Job Description  The Account Executive is Key Account Manager and Territory Owner who will lead the winning strategy to Go-To-Market, identify opportunities, sell and maintain customer relationships within his/her assigned territory.  This position requires strong leadership to develop and drive successful sales strategy and activities via collaborate with internal departments such as Inside Sales, Sales Engineering, Sales Operations, and Customer Success.  Join an elite team of Sales Professionals that sell Business Intelligence software Solution and services to new and existing clients!  Your Focus Develop Territory Business Plan and drive successful execution to achieve revenue target and long term business goal. Lead Account Strategy to achieve revenue target and long-term account plan. Work with sales consultants to discover, identify and meet customer requirements. Identify and qualify business opportunities. Sell MicroStrategy Business Intelligence software Solution and services to new and existing clients . Cover C-suite and present Solution Value Lead Competitive Strategy to win Lead negotiations and overcome objections for deal closure Manage complex sales cycles and multiple engagements simultaneously Prepare accurate sales forecasts and sales cycle reporting Provide project management to ensure the success of the potential or current clients Leverage and enhance partner relationships to drive additional value and revenue Qualifications  Required experience and skills: Bachelor's degree or equivalent business experience At least 8 years of professional selling experience in Software and solution sales In-depth understanding the Singapore and Malaysia market Fluent in English is a prerequisite, Mandarin, Cantonese and Malay are preferred. Experience with selling Analytics or Business Intelligence and Software Application Solution preferred. Additional experience with Cloud, Mobile, Big Data, Hadoop, or Social Media optional but preferred Proven track record of consistently exceeding corporate objectives and quotas Successful experience at new account development (Hunting) and large account management (Farming) Proven prospecting and sales cycle management capability Experience and training in a value-based enterprise sales methodology (Solution Selling, Customer Centric Selling, etc) Ability to track activity in Salesforce High levels of social perceptiveness and customer service Self-driven, motivated, well-structured, results oriented and integrity. Excellent communication, presentation, negotiation and collaboration skills

description: The Dir – Business Development will find new and manage existing partnerships as well as coordinate our approach and sales strategy on large business opportunities. This role identifies, pursues, and secures business with new clients to meet or exceed individual and vertical sales goals within a geographical region, country, and/or territory. The Dir – Business Development also establishes and maintains relationships with key customer executives within the industry. Grows the company’s revenue and profitability by expanding client base. Identifies prospective clients through analysis of current marketplace data and a strong understanding of the industry, its challenges and opportunities. Establishes and owns relationships with key contacts at prospective clients, and develops prospects into becoming new clients. Owns client relationship from prospect stage to client stage. Works to maximize net sales, volume, share position and promotes the company to meet strategic business objectives. Builds and uses simple business models to analyze profitability of various business cases and make recommendations to next level management for approval to improve company profitability. Directs a specific annual revenue target based on estimated forecasts for new clients. Develops and maintains prospective clients’ pipeline, forecasts and revenues, and provides regular activity reports to Senior Management and Leadership. Develops effective forecasting models considering the company’s product/service umbrella, existing clients’ experience, current market and business conditions, and gathered prospective client’s intelligence on business challenges and needs to help establish strategies and priorities, and drive decisions. Develops effective responses to Requests for Proposals (RFP) as needed. Organizes and facilitates meetings with targeted prospective clients and internal teams to identify adequate services/offerings to meet prospective clients’ needs. Creates strong and effective internal partnerships with client and product teams to ensure services are properly scoped and priced to meet prospective client needs, and initial projects stay within scope, budget, timeline, quality and other Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Participates in the Strategic Account Planning (SAPs) process; drives the growth required to meet financial goals by developing and executing the annual strategic Account Plans as it pertains to new clients. Participates in, and often leads, the development and delivery of innovative proposals to capture both account growth and new business opportunities. Develops and implements the strategic and tactical plans (e.g., pricing, products, programs) for each major account and drives results directly through the District Sales Managers and Regional Managers. Takes best practices of Major Accounts and works to execute them within the Division’s smaller accounts. Collaborates with management of major accounts to develop sales programs/presentations, and marketing initiatives to be used by the major accounts. Develops sales tools and collateral materials for both internal & external customers. Plans, directs, and coordinates activities of employee(s) to ensure goals or objectives are accomplished. Mentors, coaches, trains and develops team. Additional duties as assigned. Bachelor’s Degree in Business Development or related field Advanced degree (MBA, Master’s) preferred 10+ years progressive sales and business development experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience Understand margin calculations, profit and loss. 8+ years in a leadership role (direct or indirect) Periodic travel either locally, nationally, and/or internationally may be required. High degree of proficiency MS Office Suite, Outlook & Internet applications Strong analytical, prioritizing, interpersonal, problem-solving, presentation, budgeting, project management (from conception to completion), & planning skills Strong verbal and written communication skills (including analysis, interpretation, & reasoning) Solid understanding and application of mathematical concepts Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization, as well as, internal and external clients Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment. Ability to work with and influence peers and senior management Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines and reporting

description: Senior Business Development Executive  Senior Business Development Executive responsibilities include discovering and pursuing new sales prospects, negotiating deals and maintaining customer satisfaction. If you have excellent communication skills and feel comfortable reaching out to potential customers to demonstrate our services and products through email, phone and in person we’d like to meet you.  Ultimately, you’ll help us meet and surpass business expectations and contribute to our company’s rapid and sustainable growth.  Responsibilities Conduct market research to identify selling possibilities and evaluate customer needs Actively seek out new sales opportunities through cold calling, networking, websites, and social media Set up meetings with potential clients and listen to their wishes and concerns Prepare and deliver appropriate presentations on products and services Create frequent reviews and reports with sales and financial data Use personal discretion in establishing best prospecting practices as well as scheduling prospective client meetings in and out of the office per the client’s and employee’s mutual agreement Participate on behalf of the company in exhibitions or conferences Negotiate/close deals and handle complaints or objections Collaborate with team members to achieve better results Gather feedback from customers or prospects and share with internal teams Checking through all merchant’s documents tallies with the system Other business development duties assigned from the management from time to time   Requirements Ability to meet and exceed individual revenue goals Daily sales activity, including new prospective client outreach, client meetings, proposals, etc. Ability to communicate to senior leadership on sales outreach activity and individual revenue pipeline projections Proven experience as a Sales Executive or relevant role Experience in Financial Services/ SaaS/ E-commerce or Digital Platforms is preferred Proficiency in English and Bahasa, ability to speak other languages is advantaged. Excellent knowledge of MS Office Thorough understanding of marketing and negotiating techniques Fast learner and passion for sales Self-motivated with a results-driven approach Aptitude in delivering attractive presentation

The ideal candidate should be comfortable moving about, speaking to others, and willing to learn.  Description Build and manage a portfolio of accounts for the client Set up appointments to understand needs and provide solutions at customer sites Develop positive relationship with the clients' customers Attend to customer’s sales enquiries, and ensure proper follow up with customers Performance based  Qualifications Singaporeans only Any experience being in the frontline will be an advantage Good interpersonal skills or any form of presentation skills Candidates with different backgrounds are welcome to apply as product training will be provided.

Description  Singapore based: The Regional Sales Operations role is responsible for the sales operations function within its regional location with Asia-Pacific. Sales operations is a set of business activities and processes that help a sales organization run effectively, efficiently and in support of business strategies and objectives.  Your Opportunity  This business function supports the company's End User Sales and Partner Manager teams works closely with the APAC Sales Operation handling Quote to cash on every opportunities, Deal desk functions and providing meaningful reports to business.  This role requires knowledge and experience in providing analytical reports, Deal desk function, Sales Force application and managing licensing.  The roles main objective is to bring and maintain a system to selling that supports and positively influence the organization behavior of the teams involved in the sales function. In true Blue Prism way this is expected to be achieved through collaboration, teamwork and constant support from teams such as Sales, Finance, Sales enablement and Business development etc. As a member of the APAC Sales Operation team, this role will be constantly supported by peers to learn new skills as the business grows.  Blue Prism is an exciting, fast-paced organization which is growing at an exponential rate with plans to continue this expansion. AS well as being the support of the sales function the key function of this role is collaboration. Therefore, the role requires an energetic and enthusiastic individual, who can embrace fast change with excellent but diplomatic communication skills. Highly organized with good Excel and knowledge and preferably experience of a CRM system and enjoys the reward of their role having direct impact on the success of the company in the region.  Requirements Experience of working in a busy sales environment (Sales Operations/Sales Administration) Administration around the Purchase Orders Process Sound understanding of organisational behaviour and culture. Experience in process design and documentation Experience of using a CRM database and finance system. Event Management experience an advantage. Good Excel knowledge Attributes Self-motivated, self-sufficient and results orientated. Proactive, reliable, enthusiastic Strong communicator with excellent relationship building skills who has tenacity, ability to influence whilst being diplomatic. Multitasker, juggling multiple projects all of which could have tight deadlines. Creative in problem solving and solution finding. High energy and shows passion and commitment. Credible and have gravitas to deal with C-Suite. Team player Capable to work with lots of different personalities. Additional Information The role is home based although travel may be required to regional offices and some wider travel will be needed from time to time. Some meeting attendance will be required outside of local time zone. This is to be monitored to stay in line with best practise work/life balance expectations. Opportunity to advance and progress within the organisation as the company continues to grow. Benefits Employee Share Scheme 25 days Paid time off Flexible working hours Remote working Blue Prism is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  Blue Prism is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Blue Prism via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Blue Prism. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Blue Prism as a result of the referral or through other means.
