description: Company Description  Fashion, fun and action!  As one of the world’s largest fashion retailers, H&M offers endless career opportunities. A fast-paced, buzzing environment with great diversity that’s anything but dull – a place where the customer is always the centre of attention.  But what truly makes us stand out are our remarkable employees. From stylish Sales Advisors and Visual Merchandisers to computer whizzes and business savvy planners – all our employees share a great ambition and an anything-is-possible attitude. Not to mention an excellent eye for fashion. It’s thanks to them that we have grown – with over 4,826 stores in more than 60 markets worldwide. And we are continuing to grow!  Since we are constantly growing, we’re always on the lookout for talent – for every area of the company. Join us in an inspiring, fast-paced, exciting and ever-changing environment where your career possibilities are endless.  Job Description  Like to spread the fun of fashion? Can’t sit still? Always eager to help others with your outgoing personality? You’ll be perfect as our Sales Advisor!  Here’s what your responsibilities will look like: Offering great service to our customers at the fitting room, sales floor and cash point Creating conversation with our customers to help them find the perfect outfit to look and feel good Processing deliveries and assisting with stock replenishment Merchandising the latest garments on the floor Intrigued? Here’s how you can be our Sales Advisor Possess a customer-focused mindset, always thinking of how to create a great shopping experience Be passionate about H&M, acting as a brand ambassador Have a friendly, social and helpful personality with a positive attitude Be open to feedback Have great communication skills Come with a willingness to learn Write your own H&M story! Apply today!  Additional Information  We believe in our people and always encourage new ideas and initiatives. Along with training and leadership guidance, there’s no end to the potential for a successful and global career within H&M. Our goal is for a job at H&M to be more than just a job – it’s the beginning of a career full of opportunities!
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Apparel & Fashion, and Retail

description: Globalization Partners simplifies global business by enabling companies to hire great talent anywhere in the world, without the complexity of setting up foreign branch offices or subsidiaries. You find the talent, and we put YOUR candidate on OUR fully compliant, in-country payroll. This enables you to expand into almost any country around the globe – quickly and easily. Our platform enables you to leapfrog over the legal, HR and tax complexities without having to figure out “how” to do business in a foreign country, while getting all the benefits of a global team.  Globalization Partners’ Globalization Partners’ Global Expansion Platform™ enables you to hire in more than 170 countries within days, and without the need to set up costly international subsidiaries. You identify great talent anywhere in the world, and we put them on our fully compliant global payroll—lifting the burden of global corporate tax, legal, and HR matters from your shoulders to ours. Our systems are accessible at the touch of a finger via our software platform and app.    We make it easy for anyone to do business anywhere and hold ourselves to high standards of doing business by maintaining our triple bottom line philosophy that emphasizes happy clients, happy employees and happy shareholders. And not to brag, but we’ve won multiple awards for our culture, including being named as one of the Top 150 Company Cultures in America by Entrepreneur Magazine  Globalization Partners International Business, Simplified.  Responsibilities:  Develop and maintain a deep understanding of both the product and our customers' specific needs in order to drive customer value Lead customer communication, providing demonstrations of our product, identifying and strategizing on the most relevant use cases, and discussing technical integrations during the sales process Educate and train customers to successfully partner with GP and provide product and subject matter expertise to support adoption and increasing product usage Ensure every customer has a plan in place for rollout and successful adoption of GP’s platform Work with Account Executives to help drive pre and post-sales activity and relationships with our customers Work closely with our Product and Engineering team to identify and prioritize strategic product enhancements Be the voice of the customer providing internal feedback on how GP can better serve our customers  About you: Proven success in customer-facing, problem-solving positions at fast-paced, high growth software companies Familiar with software development process and/or project management Proven ability to juggle a mix of proactive and reactive customer priorities at once Creative, resourceful, and self-driven • Strong verbal and written communications - you can clearly and thoughtfully explain product concepts to our customers, and customer use cases to our internal team members Team-oriented and collaborative Technically proficient, aptitude for analyzing data

description: About EVFY: EVFY - An apt merger of logtech and traditional logistics businesses, with a mission to evfy delivery fleets, contributing towards the goal of the Singapore Green Plan 2030. Evfy is the first company in Singapore to own a 100% electric vehicle fleet, which at the point of writing is one of the largest EV fleet owners on the island. Proprietary logtech and crowdsourcing algorithms to enhance fleet management and operations for all last mile logistic needs. Evfy’s mission is zero carbon emissions and contribution to green logistic initiatives.  Vision - “To be the ‘best-in-class’ sustainable logistics company of the region by electrifying last-mile logistics through a driver-centric approach. We aim to be the thought leader in the green last-mile logistics sector, constantly staying ahead by pioneering sustainable initiatives that provide value for the environment, our drivers and our customers.”  Mission - “To make a social impact with businesses and consumers to adopt sustainable and environment friendly options, now.”  Job Description: • Identify new business opportunities via cold call, email, and other marketing channels • Engage prospects in discussions to discover their needs and propose relevant solutions • Develop and maintain good relationships with existing and new clients • Drive sales numbers through aggressive development of new opportunities, sales pursuits, including revenue, contracts signed, customer satisfaction and profitability • Achieve monthly and annual sales target • Work with the operations team seamlessly to deliver desired results • Prepare and maintain accurate records for presentation in weekly sync  Requirements: • A proven track record in significant/complex consultative services-led sales engagements and negotiations with partners and clients • 2 to 4 years experience in sales and business development is preferred • Knowledge of the logistics and smart mobility sector is a plus • Driven with keen interest to learn new solutions, including performing presentations and demonstrations  Working Environment & Culture: • Fun Working Environment with No Office Politics! • Close-Knit Team • Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Entertainment Facilities • Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding Activities, Covid Restriction Compliance • Inclusive & Enjoyable Company Culture

jobTitle: APAC Senior Channel Strategy & Sales Planning Manager
description: Are you a strategic thinker with strong commercial and project management skills? Come join our customer development team and help us better analyse and plan our sales!  Core Responsibilities  Drive the development, review and governance of the APAC Channel strategy Lead the integrated commercial planning (ICP) process for the APAC Market group together with regional marketing, and in close collaboration with other various stakeholders; and drive the follow-up governance process Enable and govern integration of regional commercial directions into local Business unit (BU) plans and Customer business plans (CBP); successfully coordinate the BU ICP and CBP process to guide the local BU CD leads Regularly review our channel performance, working together with MCD and Business Intelligence (BI) to develop key insights for relevant stakeholders and to input into our strategic priorities Assess the needs of the Sales Department and proactively drive system, process, planning improvements including the necessary skill/capability development. This includes working closely with the global Sales Academy team to ensure relevant delivery of sales training to the APAC sales teams.  Play your part in our team succeeding The APAC Market Group is a diverse and rapidly growing within the LEGO Group, covering 6 Business Units and 12+ countries.  This position is very different from other roles due to the opportunity to have a diverse learning experience across different markets within the area of responsibility (APAC) as well as close interaction with Global teams. It offers in depth understanding of the LEGO Customer Value Proposition and our channel strategy, combining both long term strategic direction aligned to global / regional priorities while also considering local market needs to maintain flexibility and agility. This position provides an opportunity to engage with sales management in various areas (e.g. channel development, customer business planning), regional marketing and the global Market Commercial Development (MCD) and regional marketing to define strategic directions, and shape plans, processes, and initiatives to frame the course for the APAC region. This role provides exposure to holistic problem-solving driven by fact-based insights in collaboration with global, regional and local stakeholders and facilitation of decision-making with senior executives.  Do you have what it takes?  At least a Bachelor’s degree, ideally in business or commercial equivalent 8+ years experience in similar roles in FMCG/CPG company (e.g. sales strategy, sales planning roles) Strong strategic thinking, ability to think conceptually (critical to develop regional/global concepts and strategies such as channel strategy) Strong programme / project management skills with the ability to manage coordinate many stakeholders across multiple functions Proven ability to work cross-functional and cross regional (internally and externally). Proven broad stakeholder management, leadership and project management skills, regional role experience is an advantage Very strong communication skills Strong analytical skills with the ability to effectively analyse, draw insights from and present data Practical Sales experience (Key Account management or similar)  Join the global LEGO® family Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued, and they belong.  The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.  We support our employees in being there for the moments that matter in life and celebrate families of all kinds, the loved ones that make us who we are. Being part of the LEGO Group also means taking part in our annual Play Day, playing a part in building a sustainable future and continuing our mission to “inspire and develop the builders of tomorrow.”  The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.  Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.  Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.
industries: Consumer Goods

description: Job Description  Procore is expanding our international reach into the ASEAN market to help construction companies revolutionise and digitise their business. We’re breaching greenfield territories with tremendous market potential and are building out our team to lead this exciting endeavour. Are you up for the challenge?  We’re looking for an Account Executive, Majors to join Procore’s Sales Team. In this role, you’ll apply an understanding of Procore’s products, sales methodology, processes, prospecting techniques, and customer base while selling to strategic mid-market accounts. You’ll focus on companies that can benefit from Procore’s world-class project management tool for the construction industry. This position’s primary function is new account acquisition, where you’ll grow revenue with an emphasis on new product sales to our customer base. This includes following up on inbound leads, prospecting, qualifying, solution selling, negotiation, and closing.  This position is based in Singapore and will report to our Head of ASEAN, Sales. International travel may be required, specifically in the ASEAN territories, when borders reopen and travel safety improves. We’re looking for someone to join us immediately.  What you'll do: Timely follow up and qualification of new prospects from either inbound leads or customer requests generated by marketing Develop prospecting plans for territory development to build rapport and create opportunities Research accounts, identify key players, generate interest and obtain business requirements Maintain accurate and up-to-date forecasts Provide sales management with reports on sales activities and projects as requested forecasts Pursue an increase knowledge of key competitors to ensure that our value proposition communicated effectively to customers Manage and maintain accurate leads, opportunities, and account information within Salesforce.com Achieve or exceed monthly and quarterly targets Obtain repeat business, referrals, and references by applying an understanding of the unique requirements of your customers Networking, relationship building, cold calling, lead follow-up through emails, product demonstrations, and execution of service agreements  What we're looking for: BA/BS or equivalent experience preferred 3+ years of demonstrated successful software sales, preferably B2B Desire to sell into a new market for Procore Experience using a consultative, solution-based sales methodology desired Proven record of success in an inside sales and or outside sales based selling model Proven ability to communicate effectively via telephone and email with customers Ability and resilience to work in a fast-paced sales environment Ability to develop trusted relationships Proficiency in Microsoft Office products and online collaboration tools Experience with CRM and opportunity management systems, preferably Salesforce.com Proven ability to build and manage pipeline and forecasting Successful candidates will share our Procore Values of Openness, Optimism and Ownership  Additional Information  If you'd like to stay in touch and be the first to hear about new roles at Procore, join our Talent Community.  About Us  Procore Technologies is building the software that builds the world. We provide cloud-based construction management software that helps clients more efficiently build skyscrapers, hospitals, retail centers, airports, housing complexes, and more. At Procore, we have worked hard to create and maintain a culture where you can own your work and are encouraged and given resources to try new ideas. Check us out on Glassdoor to see what others are saying about working at Procore.  We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome builders of all backgrounds. We thrive in a diverse, dynamic, and inclusive environment. We do not tolerate discrimination against employees on the basis of age, color, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.  We will provide further details during the interview process on the proposed contractual arrangement and relationship you will have with Procore if you are successful in applying for this role.

We are building a diverse, inclusive, fun, dynamic and rewarding culture to build tomorrow’s leaders. Your Responsibilities: Build a strong prospect pipeline, customer relationships and deliver revenue targets and forecasts. Research potential leads, qualify prospects, and generate interest through discovery calls, Linkedin outreach, and email campaigns Develop expertise to diligently progress prospects through our sales process until deal closure Become an expert in uncovering customer requirements, challenges, goals, and concerns. jobTitle: Regional Lead, Strategy and Operations, Global Strategic Initiatives
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 10 years of relevant work experience including experience building and executing strategic operational initiatives.  Preferred qualifications: MBA or Master's degree. Experience with Cloud business models and relevant experience partnering with Sales and/or Product Management in a B2B business. Experience creating and completing complex projects in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment. Understanding of business processes with a focus on complex agreements. Understanding of analytics “basics” (i.e., spreadsheet modeling; financial and decision analysis; working with large datasets, basic probability and statistics) Excellent verbal, written, presentation, and communication skills with the ability to tailor communications to any audience.  About The Job  In this role, you partner with APAC Global Strategic Initiatives (GSI) leadership to create and manage the strategic initiatives and operational processes that support Google Cloud customer agreements.  Google Cloud provides organizations with leading infrastructure, platform capabilities and industry solutions. We deliver enterprise-grade cloud solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology to help companies operate more efficiently and adapt to changing needs, giving customers a foundation for the future. Customers in more than 150 countries turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to solve their most critical business problems.  Responsibilities  Identify, structure, and lead strategic initiatives for the GSI team in alignment with Google Cloud Go-to-Market Strategy and Operations, Regional Sales Operations, Finance, Sales, and the broader Alphabet organization. Ownership of the APAC GSI operational cadence, including business planning, objectives and key results, and resource management, and preparation of business reviews and performance metrics. Manage initiatives that expand across Cloud and other Google and Alphabet businesses to ensure agreements are successfully executed. Collaborate with GSI leadership for strategy and operations, including analysis and content creation. Support the business cycle, including win strategy, solution strategy, and agreement reviews.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

description: Job Description  Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!  F5 empowers creators of the new digital world  The F5 Digital Sales organization is a global sales organization with an opportunity to be a tremendous revenue growth engine for the company. The F5 solution, now combined with NGINX, Shape Security and Volterra bridges the gap between NetOps and DevOps with multi-cloud application services that span from code to customer. This role is part of an exciting new team that is at the forefront of establishing cutting-edge opportunistic sales motions leveraging AI, digital marketing, big data and analytics to drive impactful and targeted sales coverage.  The F5 Multi-Cloud Application Services Platform enables enterprises undergoing digital transformation to modernize legacy, monolithic applications, as well as deliver new, microservices-based applications. Companies like Netflix, Starbucks, and McDonalds rely on F5 Networks to reduce costs, improve resiliency, and speed innovation.  F5 Networks is searching for an enthusiastic, eager-to-learn Business Development Representative (BDR) to join the growing sales team in China. If you are an early aspirant in your sales career or looking to work in a fast-paced dynamic work environment, F5 is the perfect place for you!  This position requires previous experience in an outbound role interacting with C-suite buyers. BDR candidates during the interview should not only be able to demonstrate the ability to comprehend F5 Solutions, but also the ability to pitch this effectively to new customers. They will also be expected to articulate how they would be creative and thoughtful in their approach to create market interest and solicit a response from prospects. This position is an in-office role that requires working from the office. However, due to the ongoing COVID pandemic, this role will require working from home as stipulated by the local country and company mandates.  Responsibilities Schedule highly qualified meetings from outbound campaigns within a very select group of targeted major accounts. Mapping the organization hierarchy, identifying new buying centers and engaging different personas within the account (NetOps, SecOps, DevOps, Cloud Architects, Security and Fraud leaders etc). Working closely with Account Executives to refine ideas and develop new strategies to deliver F5’s message to our buyers. Leverage prospecting tools such as Salesforce’s High Velocity Sales, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, ZoomInfo, Lusha or other local social media and outbound calling techniques to schedule meetings with identified target accounts. Effectively turn prospects into opportunities and revenue pipeline by qualifying through the PANT criteria (Pain, Authority, Need and Timeline). Collaborate with marketing, field sales, and product teams to facilitate new programs, messaging, campaigns, and offerings. Communicate and engage through video conferencing and navigate phone systems, voicemail systems, front desk operators and administrative assistants to reach intended business contacts. Ensure opportunity handoffs to sales are successful and exceed the customer's satisfaction. Ensure reporting and communications are frequent and bi-directional. Exhibit qualities of overachievement, self-motivation, good teamwork, and positive attitude. Meet and exceed minimum activity metrics: 50 Dials, 10 conversations, and 50 emails per day. Qualifications BS/BA degree or equivalent work experience. Minimum 3 years of sales prospecting experience through social media, cold callings, emails and writing qualification notes. Core sales skills related to initiating conversations, uncovering basic needs, connecting needs to high level F5 solution and driving interest in continued discussion with sales team members. Skill in using Salesforce CRM tool for leads management, prospecting, emailing, and calling is a must. Previous experience with technology companies selling SaaS, IaaS, or PaaS is a plus. Fluency in English. F5s culture is built upon our core values: progress, excellence, openness, and curiosity. We’re a growing company with a startup feel and products that are chosen for high performance and efficiency by innovators around the world. If our team has one thing in common, it’s our passion for a multi-cloud application services and dedication to a global suite of products that’s loved by a loyal base of F5 fans for over 20 years.  Physical Demands and Work Environment Duties are performed in a normal office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane, not exceeding 10% of the time spent traveling. If this sounds like you, we want to meet you!  The Job Description is intended to be a general representation of the responsibilities and requirements of the job. However, the description may not be all-inclusive, and responsibilities and requirements are subject to change.Phishing Alert  Please note that F5 only contacts candidates through F5 email address (ending with @f5.com) or auto email notification from Yello/Workday (ending with f5.com or @myworkday.com).  Equal Employment Opportunity  It is the policy of F5 to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and employment applicants without regard to unlawful considerations of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, sensory, physical, or mental disability,marital status, veteran or military status, genetic information, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws.This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, discipline, and termination. Reasonable accommodation is available for qualified individuals with disabilities, upon request.

description: Our Client: Adecco is collaborating with one of the largest System Integrators in Singapore. Our client is a leading MNC in the ICT industry with a regional presence to help governments and enterprises to achieve their business value via innovative use of technology and digital transformation.  Through their diverse team of experts, our client utilizes the power of technology to deliver the latest technologies, develop new ideas, and drive transformation across their clients in APAC, Public Sector and Enterprise alike.  Job Responsibilities: The Sales Manager (Public Sector) would be responsible for developing, implementing and managing the entire sales process from pre to post-sales to attain short- and long-term growth in company’s revenue and profit You will develop and maintain a high-level comprehension of end-to-end IT offerings (IT infrastructure, Security Technologies, IT application, Managed Services & Digital Transformation) in the local competitive environment You will be responsible for managing and building business relationships with clients, acting as their trusted advisor specializing in customized solutions and services. You will be collaborating closely with different functional teams across the organisation in order to provide a one-stop experience for clients.  Job Requirements: At least 5 years of working experience in IT solutions sales, with the capability to display a high level of understanding of the latest technologies, preferably from the SI environment Diploma/Degree in Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent Demonstrated experience in sales pipeline management Experienced in selling with partners and enterprise customers Added advantage for Public Sector (Government / Education / Healthcare) sales  Next Step: If you are looking for a role where you can contribute effectively and challenge yourself, please send your resume in Word format to gordon.quek@adecco.com with your current and expected salary. We regret to inform only shortlisted candidates will be contacted

description: About Mixpanel  Mixpanel helps companies measure what matters, make decisions fast, and build better products through data. With our powerful, self-serve product analytics solution, teams can easily analyze how and why people engage, convert, and retain—in real-time, across devices—to improve their user experience.  Mixpanel serves over 30,000 companies from different industries around the world, including Expedia, Uber, Ancestry, DocuSign, and Lemonade. Headquartered in San Francisco, Mixpanel has offices in New York, Seattle, Austin, London, Barcelona, and Singapore.  About The Role  Mixpanel is in a stage of high-growth and partnerships is a key piece of the puzzle to our growth across the Asia-Pacific (‘APAC’) region. We are looking for a highly motivated leader and team player to join our Partnerships team to support the growth of Reseller partnerships in APAC.  In this role, you’ll identify, recruit and operationalize new reseller partnerships to help expand Mixpanel’s indirect sales reach across Asia-Pacific. You will build a regional partner business plan with quantified goals and milestones to achieve partner sourced revenue metrics to meet all quarterly sales requirements.  This role manages existing reseller partners in Asia, as well as being responsible for acquiring and nurturing new reseller relationships across all of APAC. You will drive the strategy for your partners, be responsible for managing your partner relationships, executing GTM activities with your partners, accountable for exceeding quarterly quota, generating pipeline and forecasting revenue, and helping your partner reps resell Mixpanel to generate revenue. You have experience working with Channel Resellers, Distributors, System Integrators (SIs), and Digital Agencies to understand channel dynamics, and will leverage previous experiences to accelerate your partnerships and grow the region.  Responsibilities Own and drive relationships with Solution Provider Reseller partners in Asia to generate significant resell revenue in region through new customer acquisition and existing customers upsell. Identify, recruit, enable and manage long-term relationships with new reseller partners (Regional Service Integrators (SIs), Digital agencies, Product Development agencies, etc.) to support business goals and to execute channel strategies Develop a deep understanding of partner business models, needs, and challenges including an understanding of our mutual customers’ needs. Develop GTM plans with partners to achieve and exceed revenue targets. Execute GTM activities and lead cross functional teams on activities such as onsite trainings, email campaigns, remote training sessions, webinars, and events. Generate resold revenue and assist partner sales teams to close deals. Manage pipeline generation and revenue forecast reporting. Leverage existing relationships at partners to influence decision makers, increase mindshare, and accelerate engagement from partners. Assist partners with product positioning, configuration, demonstrations, sales strategy, and closing deals. Forge strong Mixpanel-internal relationships with key managers and support organizations in a dynamic and growing environment to ensure the right people and connected at the right time. We're Looking For Someone Who Has  Aside from having channel / indirect sales experience, you exhibit the two core characteristics of the Mixpanel Partnerships Team: low-ego and self-motivation. This is a great opportunity for an experienced Business Development professional to join a growing channel program or an Account Executive looking to shift to a channel sales role and make a significant impact in the region.  Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of channel or direct sales experience in a Channel Sales role or equivalent quota-carrying role Execution focused but able to see larger picture Self-starter with great time management skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills Hard working and willing to put in the extra effort to get it done Ability to work in a fast-paced changing environment Team player who can collaborate across the org with various departments Travel as necessary (and when possible), typically 25% or more depending on territory/region coverage Multi-lingual preferred. Benefits And Perks Comprehensive Medical, Vision, and Dental Care Mental Wellness Benefit Generous Vacation Policy & Additional Company Holidays Enhanced Parental Leave Volunteer Time Off Additional US Benefits: Pre-Tax Benefits including 401(K), Wellness Benefit, Holiday Break Culture Values Be Open: When knowledge becomes open, we can come together as a team to collaborate around a shared purpose Customer Focus: Our customers’ success is our success Lead Change: Everyone at Mixpanel has the capacity to make an impact on the business Results Oriented: Driving results in a measurable way ensures we stay focused on the highest impact initiatives One Team: We can’t win without each other Why choose Mixpanel?  A clear market leader in the product analytics space, Mixpanel has raised $77M from world-renowned VC firms like Andreessen-Horowitz, Sequoia, and YC, and our revenue has grown significantly since then. Our ambitious, collaborative team makes it possible by finding creative solutions to new challenges with scaling, reliability, design, and customer service.  Mixpanel is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity. We actively encourage women, people with disabilities, veterans, underrepresented minorities, and LGBTQ+ people to apply. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance or other similar laws that may be applicable, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
industries: Computer Software

description: Hewlett Packard Enterprise is an industry leading technology company that enables customers to go further, faster. With the industry’s most comprehensive portfolio, spanning the cloud to the data center to workplace applications, our technology and services help customers around the world make IT more efficient, more productive and more secure.  Business used to rely on technology, now business is technology, and customer experience is the IT experience. HPE Pointnext services are designed to help accelerate digital transformation by making Hybrid IT simple and powering the intelligent edge. By leveraging HPE’s strength in infrastructure, partner ecosystems and end-to-end lifecycle experience, solutions are optimized supporting unique business demands.  This is a great graduate opportunity for Sales Graduate to join HPE. As the Sales Specialist Graduate, he/she is passionate and interested in the Startup Ecosystem, Venture Capital Funds, Accelerators, etc to build a strong programmatic framework. . Supports sales by analyzing opportunities, and communicating sales collateral within their area of focus. Works with Startups, VCs, Accelerators and HPE Partners to build a strong program framework for HPE. Focus on Singapore, Korea, Hong Kong and ASEAN countries Education And Experience University or Bachelor's degree preferred, or equivalent experience. Possess 1 years of selling experience. Knowledge And Skills Articulate, confident and passionate about technology industry Experience developing positive relationships and solving customer problems. Understanding channel sales dynamics with the ability to develop long term partnerships 1082227  This role has been designated as ‘Edge’, which means you will primarily work outside of an HPE office  HPE is an equal opportunity employer/Female/Minority/Individual with Disabilities/Protected Veteran Status

description: Company Description  At Beyond Meat, we started with simple questions. Why do you need an animal to create meat? Why can’t you build meat directly from plants? Thus, we make plant-based meats that allow families to eat more, not less, of the traditional dishes they love while feeling great about the health, sustainability, and animal welfare benefits of plant protein. Our goal is to bring exciting change to the plate—and Beyond.  Overview  Regional Sales Director will be responsible for building profitable sales of all products of Beyond Meat through expansion into Asia and the Pacific Region. This position is to work in conjunction with our existing Asian and Australian partners to develop and achieve sales objectives, manage budgets, prepare and execute product programs, assess competitive environments and analyze/evaluate results by brand. This role is in addition to our existing importers.  Responsibilities Execute international strategic expansion plan Evaluate viable International distributor partners -existing and potential. Assist in developing local marketing and customer execution plans with distributor partners Effectively communicate key commercial plans and initiatives to distributor partners providing training as needed Review and evaluate performance in achieving sales and execution objectives for each country that are clearly quantified, mutually agreed upon and effectively measured Maintain ongoing distributor contact to expedite resolution of marketplace/customer opportunities Conduct country market audits to assess the products’ position in the marketplace; monitor competitive activity and distributor effectiveness Efficiently manage Trade, Selling and T&E expenses within budget Monitor ongoing business trends to effectively forecast sales volumes for each distributor Evaluate existing supply chain route-to-market QUALIFICATIONS 4-year university degree. 8+ years’ experience in sales management within Asia-(preferably China) Ability to speak multiple languages a plus. (Mandarin and English a must) Exceptional interpersonal and communications skills (verbal/written) with the ability to interact effectively internally as well as with external contacts. Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. Must excel in multi-tasking within a fast-paced organization. Work well both independently and as a team. Strategic and committed to success. PHYSICAL DEMANDS Ability to travel on flights to International markets and work long, flexible hours, including nights and weekends, as required. Valid driver license and registered vehicle with insurance is required. Beyond Meat is an equal employment opportunity employer. Candidates are considered for employment without regard to race, creed, color, national origin, age, sex, religion, ancestry, veteran status, marital status, gender identify, sexual orientation, national origin, liability for military service, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. If you are interested in learning the status of your application, please note you will be contacted directly by the appropriate human resources contact person if you are selected for further consideration. Beyond Meat reserves the right to defer or close a vacancy at any time.  Please note that Beyond Meat has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees. All U.S. employees who (a) physically enter a Beyond Meat facility in the United States, (b) represent Beyond Meat at work-related events, including but not limited to trade shows and product demonstrations, or (c) physically enter customer or potential customer sites in connection with their work for Beyond Meat must take all necessary steps to be Fully Vaccinated as a condition of employment, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved.
industries: Food & Beverages, Food Production, and Consumer Goods

description: This is a key role in driving business growth in Singapore. You will take the lead in developing new accounts and business expansion. It is also important to take a hands-on approach when required. Candidates from pharmaceutical industry are welcome to apply. Keen to take on interesting challenges with limited resources Resourceful in utilizing existing structure & set up Able to adapt to diverse work environment Independent and takes ownership Strong collaborative mindset Able to view isolated & separate processes from a strategic viewpoint Must be able to do case support in the operating theatre  We regret that only shortlisted applicants will be notified.

description: About Fluence Fluence, a Siemens and AES company, is the global market leader in energy storage products, services, and digital applications. The Fluence Trading Platform helps energy storage and renewable asset owners maximize revenue in wholesale electricity markets through AI-enabled optimized bidding software. Through our products and services, Fluence is helping customers around the world drive more resilient electric grids and a more sustainable future.  Our Culture and values We are guided by our passion to transform the way we power our world. Achieving our goals requires creativity, diversity of ideas and backgrounds, and building trust to effect change and move with speed. We are Leading Fluence currently has 2,750+ MW of energy storage projects operated or awarded worldwide in addition to the 3,400+ MW of projects managed by our trading platform—and we are growing every day. We are Responsible Fluence is defined by its unwavering commitment to safety, quality, and integrity. We are Agile We achieve our goals and meet our customer’s needs by cultivating curiosity, adaptability, and self-reflection in our teams. We are Fun We value the diversity in thought and experience of our coworkers and customers. Through honest, forthcoming, and respectful communications we work to ensure that Fluence is an inclusive and welcoming environment for all.  ABOUT THE POSITION: ·       In this role, you will drive within the Asia Pacific Sales team the growth of our standard, product business for battery energy storage, supporting and developing new channels to win new business across multiple segments and countries.  ·       You will work in coordination with our global teams to bring tools and expertise to the region and be an integral part of our long-term success, which will come from defining standardized offers to serve new customers. We want to innovate in this area! And we will expect you to take ownership of our efforts across the region to develop partnerships.  ·       You will be expected to establish strong relationships both internally and externally to be able to act as the central point of contact throughout the process in relation to products sales. ·       You need to have a relentless appetite to drive the organization to meet our mission, which to continue leading the energy transition globally and in APAC with storage by developing markets and growing our business.  What will our ideal candidate bring to Fluence? ·       Drive and be responsible for products sales growth with ambitious growth objectives  ·       Work in full collaboration with the rest of the regional sales team members – focusing on services, leading deal team for such offering and defining and promoting the optimized product offering  ·       Prepare proposals with the broader team based on strategy, requirements, stakeholder inputs, research as required, and be part of the team presenting to customers and negotiating contracts until closure  ·       Channel management expertise will be required as this business will grow, incuding experience in screening, training, developing and following growth programs with partners to ensure objectives are met.  ·       Ensure a full coordination with the global teams who drive innovation, define new services, and be the coordinator within the region to ensure that global strategy and tools are adapted, implemented, and differentiated to bring our value onto the market  ·       Be the voice of the region to direct and drive innovation around customer requirements, market opportunities with the global product team  ·       Ensure the use of standardized Proposal tools and processes, and be part of the continuous improvement efforts from the organization towards increasing our agility, market response time and quality  ·       Close coordination with all the other functions as needed across the organization (such as proposal management, sales engineering, operations, field services, CPM)  Skills, Knowledge & Experience:  ·       Experience in selling a value proposition and specifically Battery Energy Storage products ·       Must have strong verbal and written communication skills to be able to negotiate with customers and key stakeholders, ability to develop relationships across all facets of the business and build advocacy ·       Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering or alternatively significant (5+ Years) experience in similar role with demonstrated success – this role requires detailed technical understanding of our products ·       Ideally a strong background and understanding of battery energy storage across APAC – technology, market, requirements in different segments. Possibly a strong track record in power generation services sales – with a passion to move to battery energy storage ·       Collaborative, problem solving mentality and experience in working in matrix organizations ·       Ability to professionally communicate at all levels including C level. ·       Ability to work to tight deadlines and handle pressure, to prioritize and multitask within a fast-paced, challenging and highly interactive deadline-driven environment. ·       Travel will be required, when this becomes possible.  APPLY Fluence uses LinkedIn Talent Hub to manage our recruitment process. To be considered for this and all roles at the company, applicants must apply directly on LinkedIn here.  Fluence IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER and fully subscribes to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity to ensure that all applicants and employees are considered for hire, promotion, and job status without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital or familial status.

description: Today, most countries across the world lack access to the internet and with that, the resources to do business, exchange ideas and learn.   Severe bottlenecks at all levels, what we call the Global Internet Distribution Challenge, has led to more than 50% of the world left unconnected entirely OR connected but with extremely poor access to the Internet. The outcome is that large swaths of the global population are hence prevented from accessing life-changing and economy-driving tools and services offered by the Internet.  What if you could really change the future?  We are building a space laser network to deliver the future of Internet Distribution worldwide. This will be the fastest way to bring the rest of the world up on the bandwidth and connectivity curve. Right now, we are using the same technology to provide a rapidly deployable, affordable, low cost and high speed Last Mile Connectivity solution, CENTAURI, which speeds up adoption of 4G and 5G globally, especially dense residential areas during COVID-19 period which require urgent bandwidth upgrades.  Join our team if you want to define the rules of how our civilisation communicates!  Global Sales Lead   RESPONSIBILITIES:  Drive the revenue generation & margin contribution for the CENTAURI product across all major markets and relevant industry verticals Full ownership for executing the sales strategy for driving growth in APAC, Oceania, EMEA and US, Canada & LATAM markets Lead the Growth (Product Marketing), Sales, Sales Engineering and Customer Success teams (which, together, form the entire Commercial team)  Improving and building the entire customer lifecycle from entry, to continued success Connect with global leaders in Telecommunications industry to build brand recognition and the disruptive nature of the technology Overall accountability for financial results including annual budget for the Global Commercial Team, bookings, revenue and margin contribution, cost center management, and incentive programs Working closely and collaboratively with the Product, Engineering and Finance team leads to ensure our commercial learnings are brought into the organization as soon as possible   QUALIFICATIONS:  Degree in Engineering or Business More than 10+ years of progressive sales leadership roles, including leading a direct sales organization in the telecommunications sector  PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:  Track record of closing large deals consistently, including deals up to 100 million USD in size A demonstrable track record of building a multi-theatre sales team for both direct and channel sales while delivering budget expectations Experience selling wireless transmission products and solutions (including hardware, software and services)  Experience defining and executing GTM strategies for new products and new markets. Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong business relationships with stakeholders at senior levels Strong business acumen coupled with the ability to understand pivots in bids and recommend to our customers and stakeholders the best solution that meets business objectives Executive presence with excellent written and verbal communication skills Consistent track record of building and scaling high achieving sales teams for long term success Demonstrated ability to build trust and relationships at senior levels across different customers, cultures and industries Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively across functions and geographies, and to influence and support beyond formal reporting lines World class understanding of sales and marketing in the digital world and proven experience in execution Creative and challenging mindset – Senior strategy or sales and marketing professional with strong business acumen   Building the Future of Internet Distribution  Founded in Dec 2016, the Transcelestial team is located in Singapore and is backed by major investors such as Wavemaker Partners, EDBI, Airbus Ventures, Cap Vista, SEEDS Capital (Enterprise SG), Entrepreneur First, Partech Ventures, 500 Startups, AirTree Ventures, Tekton Ventures, SGInnovate, SparkLabs Global Ventures, Michael Seibel (CEO of Y-Combinator, Founder of Twitch.tv), Charles Songhurst (Microsoft’s former Head of Corporate Strategy) and other investors.  Transcelestial has won numerous industry and global awards such as SPIFFY San Andreas Award for Most Disruptive Technology by Telecom Council, The Most Ambitious Start-Up in Photonics Award by The Optical Society (OSA), etc.   COMPENSATION & BENEFITS:  A monthly book and hobby fund 1 Friday for “Space Themed” personal projects Personal Office Computer Flexible work hours Best in industry health plans  JOIN US: You should include in your application  Your CV, and/or LinkedIn page Links to projects or other work which will definitely impress everyone  Email us at jobs@transcelestial.com
industries: Telecommunications, Internet, and Research

description: Meero’s core mission is to empower photographers to focus on what they love: photography! We take care of the rest by relying on tech and AI.  Started in 2016, Meero is on a mission to make life easier for photographers and customers alike by bringing the top-name brands directly to image creators all the while expediting all of the tedious work. From its state-of-the-art image editing technology to our teams positioned around the world, Meero is helping creators do what they do best: create.  Meero is always looking to add fresh new talents in an already amazing team. Have a look if you needed more reasons to become a Meeronaut: https://bit.ly/2UDSXiJ  Check Out This New Position  What You'll Do Based in Singapore, you will develop our global marketplaces business (Deliveroo, Just Eat, Airbnb type of clients). Engage your customer portfolio, lead negotiations and successfully close the deals. Act as a specialist in your region and with your clients. Draft business proposals. Report on your activities (reviews, summary, customer dunning procedure), Being able to precisely forecast your accounts is key. Following a precise sales methodology What You’ll Need You have 2-5- years of professional experience in Business Development, from prospecting to closing. An experience in Real Estate / Hospitality / Food Delivery is a plus. Fluent English speaker- ability to speak other languages is highly advantageous. Good relationship skills. Rigorous, dynamic and autonomous, you are also results-oriented and very comfortable on the phone. Ambition and over achievement is your fuel. Good awareness of the startup / tech / digital ecosystem (e-commerce, B2B / SAAS companies etc). You have a closer mindset. Ability to think out of the box. An entrepreneurial mindset WORK @ MEERO  Dream big and do bigger - Dreaming big is step one, but we don’t stop there. By realizing our ideas at  a global scale, we can transform the industry with new tools, processes, and opportunities.  Make work play - Work should never be boring. Bold ideas and big laughs make everyday exciting, so we never get complacent. We are a family that loves each other, pushes each other, and laughs with each other.  Champion creators - Creatives are the architects of our visual world. We work tirelessly to support their skills and business, so they can feel inspired to create.  Rise faster than you fail - We celebrate resilience in the face of failure. We truly support one other, so we’re free to fall, but quick to get up and try again.  Give a shit - Success doesn’t happen by accident. We work with focus, determination, and pride towards our goals. We care deeply about each other, our clients, creatives, and our impact on the world.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Renewals Manager Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process—from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest, most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position The Renewal Manager (RM) is a high impact position combining equal parts relationship management, contract negotiation and client satisfaction. The RM will work with existing DocuSign customers, increasing usage, adoption and overall satisfaction to ensure renewal of their next contract. The Renewal Manager is accountable for customer retention through the annual renewal process, proactive client management, forecast accuracy, and driving growth with customers in collaboration with internal teams and the broader DocuSign partner ecosystem. This position is an Individual Contributor and reports to the Manager of Renewal Managers, APAC. This role is designated Flex.  Responsibilities Retain and grow customer accounts, including increased commitment. Develop and leverage customer relationships to improve customer retention. Manage the renewal process and negotiate multi-variable contracts. Develop a strategy to ensure assigned accounts are renewed in a timely basis. Provide accurate and timely forecasts on a weekly basis. Monitor outstanding renewals and develop a robust follow up system. Liaise with internal teams to ensure smooth processing of quotes and renewals for customers. Identify areas for growth within the account upon renewal. Communicate risk to management and lead resolution strategies. Align with the Adoption Manager to ensure campaigns run effectively. Deliver business reviews for low adopting customers who require a 1:1 engagement. Be the principal point of contact for key customers and leverage the internal organisation to meet the needs of your customers. Act as the customer champion, by constantly looking for improvement areas and ways to retain our customers through better product and customer service  Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required. 5 + years experience in B2B sales or account management focused on customer renewals within the technology or software industry.  Preferred Qualifications Proven track record of success in managing a high-volume portfolio of accounts. Track record of success and over-achievement of quota in past positions. Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment. Exceptional time management, organization, and multi-tasking skills are a must. Strong verbal and written communication skills, specifically at the executive level.  About Us DocuSign® is changing how business gets done by empowering hundreds of thousands of customers and tens of millions of users in most countries around the world to sign, send and manage documents anytime, anywhere, on any device with confidence. DocuSign replaces printing, faxing, scanning and overnighting documents with the easiest, fastest, most trusted way to make every approval and decision digital. Organizations of all sizes and industries are accelerating contracts, approvals and workflows with DocuSign's Digital Transaction Management (DTM) platform and eSignature solution. DocuSign keeps life and business moving forward. DocuSign is committed to building a diverse team of talented individuals who bring different perspectives to the discussion and who feel a sense of inclusion and belonging when they join our team. Individuals seeking employment at DocuSign are considered without regards to race, ethnicity, colour, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.  #LI-CH1

description: Responsibilities: • Identify, develop, and execute an overarching sales strategy to acquire new customers • Growing revenue via prospecting, qualifying, selling and closing client accounts (Enterprise & SMBs) • Establishing sales processes, reports and analytical deliverables such as sales pipeline and forecasting • Engage customers via presentations, prepare and submit proposals • Drive and manage beneficial value-added partnerships and collaborations • Meet and exceed quarterly and annual objectives • Prepare monthly updates on sales pipeline for management reporting • Work alongside other key functions to ensure a successful sales strategy  Requirements: • Knowledge on eProcurement systems (SESAMi, GeBiz, etc) or past experience doing Procurement locally is required. • Diploma & Degree holder in any field with at least 2-3 years of relevant work experience • Effective and excellent communication skills internally and externally • Experience with and adept in dealing with Senior Stake Holders/ C Level executives • Good contacts in the industry and network with partners and eco systems will be a plus  Salary is non-commission based, and will commensurate with the experience of the candidate. Flexibility to work from home up to 4x/week.  Salary $4,000 to $5,500/monthly

About Temenos  We’re passionate about helping banks to perform better, so we solely focus on creating banking software. Temenos offers cloud-native, cloud-agnostic, API-first digital banking, core banking, payments, fund management, and wealth management software products, enabling banks to deliver consistent, frictionless customer journeys and achieve market-leading cost/income performance. Our products combine the richest end-to-end packaged country model bank functionality and the most advanced technology, helping our clients go-live faster, giving them the freedom to innovate and deliver personalized experiences.  We are technology first, with 700+ published APIs, we partner with 100+ Fintechs in our marketplace. We have been recognized year after year by Gartner, IBS, and Forrester for our award-winning solutions.  Temenos is the 4th largest European Software company, with over 3000 clients in 150 countries. We are proud of our 7500+ Temenosians working across the globe to make banking better!  THE ROLE  A key position in the Regional APAC sales team and has primary responsibility for achievement sales targets through the implementation of sales strategies driven from a local territory sales and go to market plan. This role is a Business Development Role, focused on New Business / Logo’s only.  Key Responsibilities  Achieve New Business sales wins to exceed target supported by local cross functional support teams and the Sales Director Provide insight and plan effective sales campaigns together with a skilled Pre-Sales team, Marketing and Inside Sales teams to operate successfully in competitive bid scenarios Proactively address the Indonesian market to expand the brand reach and achieve a high rate of meetings, demonstrations, workshops, quotes and proposals Maintain four times your Annual quota in Pipeline with New Business opportunities by working closely with Marketing, Inside Sales our In-country Partners by and Sales support teams by establishing relationships with primary alliance partners and identify new market and growth opportunities to build a strong sales pipeline Skillfully negotiate profitable contract agreements for license, consulting and support services Provide leadership in client relations to set the company head and shoulders above the competition Leverage existing business relationships with decision makers, executives and key players in the banking and financial services sectors Provide leadership in client relationship management, address clients’ business needs and constraints. Build long-term relationships and referrals with senior managers and key opinion leaders in the banking and financial services sectors.  Skills & Experience  Proficient in both spoken and written English and local language i.e. Malay, Indonesian, Thai A high-caliber individual with the right breadth and depth of experience, strong credential, influence within the financial arena in Indonesia with the focus and acumen to cultivate profitable and lasting customer relationships Proven track record of leading and achieving “big ticket” sales to exceed targets in the banking and financial services software industry with substantial relevant experience within the same domain Minimum 7-10 years Sales and New Business Development experience in a banking software company or related companies (e.g. local Software Industry) Confident in operating at “C level” and can demonstrate strong sales and negotiating skills with key decision makers Must have the presence together with strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills to establish interest, trust and credibility Has mastered technical and business skills required to accomplish the job Good general understanding of banking operations and relevant processes (front, middle, back office) with a reasonable understanding of IT infrastructures and implementation approaches from both functional and technical perspectives Self-motivated, ambitious, independent, organized, focused and able to multi-task Can work independently and in a collaborative nature Willing to travel on a frequent basis  WHY TEMENOS  You will work at the cutting edge of technology innovation; we challenge the status quo and are transforming banking every day. You will experience in a fast-paced environment, ambitious team; we look forwards and continuously strive to be the best. You will be part of a team that values integrity; we support each other and keep our promises. You will be able to work freely, flexibly and true to your authentic self; we champion diversity. You will be joining a global and diverse family that works together through the good times and bad; we care deeply about each other and our clients. You will experience what we call – Temenosity!  We value applications from people from all walks of life; if you are excited to be part of our journey and want to make a real impact, we would love to hear from you.  Please make sure to read our Recruitment Privacy Policy

description: Globalization Partners simplifies global business by enabling companies to hire great talent anywhere in the world, without the complexity of setting up foreign branch offices or subsidiaries. You find the talent, and we put YOUR candidate on OUR fully compliant, in-country payroll. This enables you to expand into almost any country around the globe – quickly and easily. Our platform enables you to leapfrog over the legal, HR and tax complexities without having to figure out “how” to do business in a foreign country, while getting all the benefits of a global team.  Globalization Partners’ Globalization Partners’ Global Expansion Platform™ enables you to hire in more than 170 countries within days, and without the need to set up costly international subsidiaries. You identify great talent anywhere in the world, and we put them on our fully compliant global payroll—lifting the burden of global corporate tax, legal, and HR matters from your shoulders to ours. Our systems are accessible at the touch of a finger via our software platform and app.  We make it easy for anyone to do business anywhere and hold ourselves to high standards of doing business by maintaining our triple bottom line philosophy that emphasizes happy clients, happy employees and happy shareholders. And not to brag, but we’ve won multiple awards for our culture, including being named as one of the Top 150 Company Cultures in America by Entrepreneur Magazine  Globalization Partners  International Business, Simplified.  Responsibilities Develop and maintain a deep understanding of both the product and our customers' specific needs in order to drive customer value Lead customer communication, providing demonstrations of our product, identifying and strategizing on the most relevant use cases, and discussing technical integrations during the sales process Educate and train customers to successfully partner with GP and provide product and subject matter expertise to support adoption and increasing product usage Ensure every customer has a plan in place for rollout and successful adoption of GP’s platform Work with Account Executives to help drive pre and post-sales activity and relationships with our customers Work closely with our Product and Engineering team to identify and prioritize strategic product enhancements Be the voice of the customer providing internal feedback on how GP can better serve our customers About You Proven success in customer-facing, problem-solving positions at fast-paced, high growth software companies Familiar with software development process and/or project management Proven ability to juggle a mix of proactive and reactive customer priorities at once Creative, resourceful, and self-driven Strong verbal and written communications - you can clearly and thoughtfully explain product concepts to our customers, and customer use cases to our internal team members Team-oriented and collaborative Technically proficient, aptitude for analyzing data

description: The Role: As a Business Development Representative, you’ll act as part of the sales team interfacing closely with marketing to develop new sales opportunities across India. The ideal candidate should be eager to advance in our organization and have keen business acumen, strong technical aptitude, and natural sales instincts. You should have the confidence, discipline, and drive to hunt for new customers. You’ll be directly involved in powering our sales to the next level! This is a role for someone who is hungry, willing to learn and grow into a world class technology sales executive. If you have the work ethic and commitment to be a top sales executive, we will give you the tools and training to become one.  What you'll do as a Business Development Representative: Surface and develop qualified sales opportunities across India Work with inbound marketing to cultivate customer/prospect relationship Execute on outbound prospecting techniques and qualifying leads at a pace and quality to consistently hit and exceed monthly goals Log activity consistently and reliably in Salesforce.com Work collaboratively with Account Executive team to develop territory and strengthen pipeline  What you'll bring to the Business Development Representative role: Ability to take direction, be coached, mentored and working autonomously Desire to pursue sales as a career Experience with Business Development into India Demonstrated success interacting with people by phone, leading and persuading and overcoming obstacles associated with prospecting Strong presence and interpersonal skills Experience with or ability to learn web applications such as Salesforce.com and LinkedIn Fluent English language skills  Why should you join Recorded Future? With over 600 employees, $140M ARR, 1,000 clients, and 50% year-over-year growth, Recorded Future is the world’s largest privately-held security intelligence company! Recorded Future employees (or “Futurists”), represent over 35 nationalities and embody our core values of being passionate, practicing inclusion, and acting ethically. Our dedication to empowering clients with intelligence to disrupt adversaries has earned us a 4.7-star user rating from Gartner and 8 of the top 10 Fortune 100 companies as clients.  We are committed to maintaining an environment that attracts and retains talent from a diverse range of experiences, backgrounds and lifestyles. By ensuring all feel included and respected for being unique and bringing their whole selves to work, Recorded Future is made a better place every day.  If you need any accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our recruiting team at careers@recordedfuture.com  Recorded Future is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Recorded Future does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender including pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.  Recorded Future will not discharge, discipline or in any other manner discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because such employee or applicant has inquired about, discussed, or disclosed the compensation of the employee or applicant or another employee or applicant.

description: Hire Digital is looking for an analytical and effective Business Development Director, Enterprise who is adept at driving key account revenue and growing our consultative sales. The Business Development Director, Enterprise will be responsible for owning the target accounts pipeline and driving our client acquisition programs, analyzing client acquisition metrics, and working with adjacent teams to develop strategies and campaigns to enhance client acquisition.  This is a remote position. We welcome candidates from any location. Resumes are to be submitted in English.  Responsibilities: Build a client acquisition pipeline, ranging from Fortune 500 companies to mature growth companies, as well as nurture and close client deals. Lead the day to day execution of consulting with clients and developing client engagement plans for key target accounts, advising them to utilize our talent network and build on demand teams. Develop a tailored plan to address current needs and create a roadmap for future growth opportunities. Analyze results, propose new strategies and implement them. Set up tools and applications required for the role and conduct new programs to optimize results. Train Business Development Representatives specialized in key channels to take on successful experiments and optimize them for performance.  Requirements: 5+ years of enterprise sales and account management experience in a reputed company. Proven record of high performance and outstanding achievements in past positions. Strong understanding of the digital transformation needs and challenges faced by clients in industries such as financial services, high-tech, telecommunications, manufacturing, energy, retail, pharmaceuticals, or travel and logistics. Skills to communicate complex ideas effectively. Exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills.  About Hire Digital  Hire Digital is a freelance network of top talents in digital marketing, web development, and design. Our clients work with high-performing teams as well as individual talents who have gone through a rigorous screening process. Clients such as Shopify, Expedia, and Stripe have access to high-performing talents on-demand, with guaranteed performance.  Powered by JazzHR  B0zPhe7aIg

Profound understanding of structured products and derivatives in general Finance degree or equivalent certification Strong excel skills Fluent in English Open-minded, thoughtful and proactive approach Ability to think strategically, drive change and implement projects Excellent interpersonal, analytical and problem-solving skills Commitment to a dynamic, entrepreneurial and results oriented culture

Win: - Getting out of the rat race - A better version of yourself as you go through different challenges - Having a work-life balance - Choices in life  Jobscope: - Learn to do effective face to face sales presentations to mask individuals - Guiding newer batch of brand ambassadors - Going through leadership programmes  What's the prizes: - Speed of advancement - Performance package as your earnings will not be cap - Character development as you will face challenges - Fun, enthusiastic and family oriented culture - Traveling to different countries  How to be part of the game: - Great work-ethics - Don't give up easily - Positive attitude  If you're up for the challenge, apply and send in your resume.
