description: Manager, Sales Development Representative  Sales & Business Development | Singapore  Our agreement with employees  DocuSign is committed to building trust and making the world more agree-able for our employees, customers, and the communities in which we live and work. You can count on us to listen, be honest, and try our best to do what’s right, every day. At DocuSign, everything is equal. We each have a responsibility to ensure every team member has an equal opportunity to succeed, to be heard, to exchange ideas openly, to build lasting relationships, and to do the work of their life. Best of all, you will be able to feel deep pride in the work you do, because your contribution helps us make the world better. And for that, you’ll be loved by us, our customers, and the world in which we live.  The team  Our Sales & Business Development teams collaborate with customers and partners across the globe to help them leverage the DocuSign Agreement Cloud to transform the entire system of agreement process - from preparing to signing, acting on, and managing contracts and other types of agreements. Our team’s partner with some of the largest most innovative companies in the world in dozens of industries to bring the power of DocuSign to more customers. Whether you are selling to a small business or a large enterprise, you will apply your extensive knowledge of our solutions, and leverage our strategic partnerships to help our customers grow their top and bottom line.  This position  The Manager, Sales Development will possess the ability to manage and motivate Sales Development Representatives (SDRs) to achieve individual sales and opportunity generation quotas. They also must be able to measure, monitor and hold SDRs accountable for their activities and results as well as lead by example.  The Sales Development Manager is required to make lead qualification calls with SDRs, assist in appointment setting, and effectively present DocuSign's corporate overview and value proposition. They will work with the Director, Sales Development to increase efficiencies and processes within the department. The Sales Development Manager will mentor each SDR on their team individually while also building a strong, cohesive, collaborative team and is responsible for monitoring pipeline, conversion rates and delivering on quota and forecast.  This position is a management position and reports into the Director, Sales Development. It is designated flex.  Responsibilities Grow Monthly Recurring Revenue (MRR) in defined vertical markets and geographic territories from new SMB, Corporate, and Enterprise accounts Develop and execute sales process and strategies and ensure compliance to internal data management and reporting, including use of Salesforce.com Assess sales activities and forecasts to determine sales progress and required improvements. Recommend and implement improvements to achieve sales and opportunity creation goals Collaborate with Marketing Demand Generation team to ensure effective follow up on leads to generate sales opportunities Communicate results and adjust plans according to evolving business needs. Provide detailed reporting of lead flow and key performance indicators to senior management Manage and coach a team of SDRs to develop their sales skills including vertical market knowledge, forecasting, prospecting, and other necessary skills, while maintaining individual accountability to goals Maintain and protect DocuSign’s core values, leading by example Work with each SDR to develop and implement business/sales plans to achieve sales quota Identify and support opportunities for the training and professional development of department personnel Operate well in a fast paced, dynamic environment without requiring significant supervision Basic Qualifications BA/BS in a business or a technical related field of study from an accredited college or university 2 years’ experience managing an entry to associate-level sales team 2 years prior experience working in an individual contributor sales position, preferably in a SaaS/Cloud Software organisation Preferred Qualifications Demonstratable ability to consistently exceed sales/prospecting targets Strong understanding how to successfully resolve situations that are broadly defined, complex, diverse, and occasionally unprecedented Excellent communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written Demonstrated ability to identify new, creative ways to drive more SMB, Corporate, and Enterprise businesses to purchase and utilize DocuSign’s diverse solution suite About Us  DocuSign helps organizations connect and automate how they prepare, sign, act on, and manage agreements. As part of the DocuSign Agreement Cloud, DocuSign offers eSignature: the world's #1 way to sign electronically on practically any device, from almost anywhere, at any time. Today, over a million customers and hundreds of millions of users in over 180 countries use DocuSign to accelerate the process of doing business and simplify people's lives. And we help save the world’s forests and embrace environmental sustainability.  It’s important to us that we build a talented team that is as diverse as our customers and where all employees feel a deep sense of belonging and thrive. We encourage great talent who bring a range of perspectives to apply for our open positions. DocuSign is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes hiring decisions based on experience, skill, aptitude and a can-do approach. We will not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected category.  Accommodations  DocuSign provides reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in job application procedures, including if you have any difficulty using our online system. If you need such an accommodation, you may contact us at accommodations@docusign.com.

Good command of PowerPoint and Excel for reporting initiatives Hands-on personality with a can-do attitude to support the startup's growth Ability to communicate in Mandarin to support Marketing in their mandarin campaigns for retailers What's On Offer  This is an opportunity to be a part of an amazing journey supported by a leading MNC, but within a small, fast growing brand. description: Deliveroo for Business (DFB) is on a path to be the next billion-dollar business unit at Deliveroo. As Deliveroo for Business Lead, you will have the opportunity to lead our B2B function in Singapore. You will manage the sales and account management areas to deliver amazing food experiences at work. You will work closely with the local and international leadership teams in order to strategise and execute ambitious plans and you will be the owner of the full corporate P&L for Singapore. We are only just getting started so we are looking for a talented individual who can think strategically at the highest level while simultaneously managing and executing the day-to-day actions necessary to achieve our goals.  What You’ll Be Doing  Oversee corporate sales and account management in Singapore to grow our B2B business; Manage key accounts directly and strategise on how to build strong B2B relationships and grow our portfolio in Singapore; Work with local and HQ management to make sure your team’s priorities are aligned with local and global Deliveroo goals; Work with the heads of operations and customer service to streamline processes and deliver great experiences for existing clients; Liaise with the marketing team to roll out corporate marketing initiatives; Take ownership over the full P&L and strategise on how to hit top line and bottom line targets; Participate in calls and off-sites with other international corporate heads to share best-practices.  Requirements  You have a natural commercial attitude, understand the corporate world, and are customer-obsessed. You also are:  A talented commercial professional You have +3 years of experience in a B2B commercial role You have a track record of achieving and surpassing commercial targets A strategic thinker, communicator and negotiator: You have strong analytical and organisational skills A demonstrated ability to design strategic plans and execute on goals with high impact results Excellent interpersonal, communication, teamwork, presentation and project management skills You are an empathetic leader, who can not only build but also mentor and inspire a team A relentless executor, motivated and process-driven: You exhibit an ability to motivate and self-motivate You are results-driven You are driven, passionate, entrepreneurial, and a self-starter who questions the status quo and strives for exceptional results An Innovative and creative being You design new opportunities and build internal and external excitement for a new project   Why Deliveroo?  At Deliveroo, it is our mission to build the definitive food company. In order to do that, we’re building a company where everyone can belong, grow and do the best work of their lives  Our mission is to be the definitive food company. We are transforming the way the world eats by making food more convenient and accessible. We give people the opportunity to eat what they want, when and where they want it.  Our journey began with our founder Will, arriving in London and finding it almost impossible to order great food, despite living in one of the world’s best cities for food. In 2013 he got on his bike and founded Deliveroo.  Fast forward to today and Deliveroo can be found in 12 markets, with over 100,000 riders delivering orders from over 140,000 restaurants and stores serving millions of customers in hundreds of cities worldwide.  Delivering great food from restaurants is how we started, but isn’t our only offering. We pioneered the delivery-only kitchen model, Deliveroo Editions, where we use data to identify gaps in the market and bring new brands and cuisines to new areas, giving people more choice in their local neighbourhood. And using our network and technology we provide a growing on-demand grocery service, which has not only brought incredible levels of convenience to our customers but has been a lifeline to so many during COVID.  We operate one of the most complex three sided marketplaces, and we do this in real-time. Millions of customers and thousands of restaurants and riders rely on us to match them within milliseconds, and the algorithms behind our marketplace are the secret sauce that allow us to deliver our orders in under 30 minutes.  There are so many questions we are working on and plenty more we haven’t even encountered. How do we give low income families access to affordable healthy meals? How do we tackle waste? How can we scale our network to tens of millions of orders a day? What does a future layout of a restaurant look like? How do data and technology help restaurants to grow as consumer habits change? How can we take what we know about a customer and offer a personalised selection?  At Deliveroo these are just some of the tough problems we are solving - and there is no challenge that cannot be yours. No solution is owned by a particular team, which means the scope for growth and personal impact is enormous. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, seeking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.  And we’re just getting started  The size of the opportunity ahead of us is immense. Only 3% of the global food market is online. Contrast that with the digital disruption of other industries, such as from travel (45%) and retail (10%), and it is clear we are at the very beginning of our journey. Despite being one of the world’s fastest growing multi-billion dollar companies, we’re only just getting started.  We hope you’re as excited about the scale of the opportunity as we are and, if you share our ambition, that you’ll join us and be part of this incredible story.  Workplace & Diversity  At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth and relocation.  We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing startups in an incredibly exciting space.
industries: Food & Beverages

description: OVERVIEW  The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for developing new accounts within assigned territory, with a clear set of growth targets to achieve. You will also maintain and grow revenue from existing accounts.  You will be a champion of our CDN and cloud security solutions, providing strong service and support to our existing customers’ needs at every interaction and to lead the resolution of their issues within the company. You will also be orchestrating direct sales engagements, win competitive opportunities, as well as establish and collaborate with channel partners in a fast pace for sell-to and sell-through strategies to reach a high and continuous growth.  The ideal candidate should be a tenacious, results-oriented sales professional, with a passion for nurturing strong relationships with customers, passionate about the industry and possess excellent communication skills. Success in this position will require a positive attitude, great time management, strong work ethic, and a passion to build solid and sustainable relationships with customers.  RESPONSIBILITIES:-  This position will prioritize more on Business Development and Hunting responsibilities.  Drive new business directly from customers, identify and develop effective and scalable channel partners based in respective territories for building robust sales pipelines. Oversee and manage a portfolio of assigned accounts, seek additional revenue opportunities through up-selling and renewals. Accountable for owning all aspects of the sales cycle, whilst consistently generating pipeline to meet and/or exceed quota. Create and maintain all major customer deliverable (proposals, statements of work, etc.) to provide over-the-top customer service and support. Understand the value proposition of our CDN and cloud security solutions and more productively, communicating all offerings to C-level executives and decision makers. Continuously keep abreast of industry and market trends, whilst building strong knowledge in our products and services. Drive business cadence for weekly team meetings on pipeline update, opportunities review, customer account reviews, etc. As CDNetworks country representative, to present on external symposium, conferences, media and industry events.   REQUIREMENTS:- Bachelor’s degree required. Proven track record of exceeding sales goals/quotas. Good key account management skill and business acumen. Ability to gain access and interact with C-level executives with effective interpersonal and presentation skills. Minimum 3 years of relevant sales management experience, preferably in IT solutions/Cloud or similar Hi-tech environment, with Indonesia Market Experience. Knowledge of Content Delivery Networks (CDNs), internet and Cloud Infrastructure, Media and Cyber Security Services is highly desired. Energetic, self-motivated, result-oriented and thrive in a fast-paced dynamic growth environment. Familiarity with CRM platform especially Salesforce is highly desired. Possessing of experienced and resourceful channel partner such as Systems Integrator, Value Added Resellers in network and security field will be a plus.
industries: Computer & Network Security

description: Osome is an international fintech startup with the mission to to help business owners spend less time on routine admin and more time on managing their businesses. We use machine learning (AI) and complex algorithms to automate accounting, tax, company formation, and other tasks.   With Singapore as the headquarter, Osome has expanded to Malaysia, Hong Kong, United Kingdom with a total staff strength of more than 200 employees servicing more than 6000 clients.   Here at Osome, we provide an inclusive and collaborative environment, offering a promising career plan for our employees. You can expect to be rewarded for your contribution. If you are a diligent team player, who is not afraid of challenges, willing to think out of the box and find creative ways to reach the shared goal, think no further! description: Who We Are  NanoString Technologies ( NASDAQ: NSTG ) is a leading provider of life science tools for discovery and translational research. The company’s nCounter® Analysis System is used in life sciences research and has been cited in more than 3,800 peer-reviewed publications. The nCounter Analysis System offers a cost-effective way to easily profile the expression of hundreds of genes, proteins, miRNAs, or copy number variations, simultaneously with high sensitivity and precision, facilitating a wide variety of basic research and translational medicine applications. The company’s GeoMx® Digital Spatial Profiler enables highly-multiplexed spatial profiling of RNA and protein targets in a variety of sample types, including FFPE tissue sections. Built on pioneering principles in 2003, NanoString is blazing new trails and exploring new frontiers to adapt to the everchanging landscape and becoming smarter and more innovative in the process. We are dedicated to advancing scientific discovery and providing solutions that can have a meaningful impact in research and discovery.  Our purpose is to Map the Universe of Biology . We enable scientists to answer questions they have always wanted to ask to explore the boundaries of cellular structures and create an atlas of biological interactions that define life. We are relentless in our quest to Catalyze the Next Biological Revolution leading to Advancing the Human Condition . In addition to a pioneering spirit, we value: Grit. Authenticity. Ambition. Ingenuity. Customers. Join our team!  Job Summary  The Sales Development Representative will engage in generating prospective clients via phone and email to qualify their interest and fit for NanoString's product portfolio, then pass the leads to the field sales team. This is a perfect opportunity for the individual who has a passion for sales and life sciences. Come join us for a rewarding, fast paced environment with a great culture. We look for people that are curious, energetic, coachable, tenacious and who can work well in a team environment.  Location: This person will work out of our Singapore office covering sales in the APAC region.  Essential Functions Research and call prospects for new sales opportunities within Academic, Biotech, and Pharma businesses by discussing prospects’ research goals and methodologies, and provide overview of Nanostring’s products and services. Meet or exceed quotas for qualified leads passed to sales team. Document all activities and interactions in CRM tool. Utilize CRM and ERP to generate sales quotes. Perform various outbound call campaigns around trade shows, specific events, or targets in addition to ongoing primary lead generation activities. Meet or exceed quotas for direct sales of instrument service contracts. Demonstrate excellence and exemplify NanoString Corporate Values. Requirements Bachelor's degree in life sciences. Excellent written & verbal communication skills. English required, multiple languages a plus! Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and learn quickly. Proficient computer skills in Microsoft Office Suite, Outlook, Sharepoint, CRM and ERP experience desirable. Flexible and interested in a company with huge growth opportunity . NanoString is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. NanoString does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that it does not have a signed agreement with.  Accommodations  If you require assistance or accommodation when applying for open positions please contact recruiting@nanostring.com  #IND123

description: What's the Role:  We're looking for a Business Development Representative (BDR) to join our Singapore office, the newest addition to our expanding global presence.  You will learn how to achieve your sales goals while building the most essential skills for a long, successful career in sales and marketing.  What You'll Do: Rapidly learn the essential skills and strategy and be ready to start identifying and contacting new prospects. Use research and lead generation tools to build targeted, accurate lists of strategic contacts Execute sales development best practices with email, phone, and social drips Utilize smart, targeted questions and speak knowledgeably with decisions makers - like VPs of Marketing Evangelize Blueshift and build interest and opportunities with new prospects Partner with your assigned Account Executive to intelligently and strategically develop new opportunities and achieve a successful territory penetration plan Manage meetings on account executive's calendar and log activities in CRM Exceed quota of qualified appointments by 2nd full month  We're looking for someone who has: A minimum 1-3 year of sales experience (1 year of selling in tech or selling to marketing preferred) A fervent focus on solving customer problems/challenges Demonstrated track record of success Over-the-top work ethic and "hustle" Strong written communication, phone, presentation, and interpersonal skills Ability to work in fluid environment that is extremely dynamic; self-starter Fast learner; "student mentality" Strong time management skills Detail oriented with a focus on accuracy of data management Simultaneously and equally humble and self-confident  You might also have experience in one or more of the following: College degree is preferred Naturally interested in technology and marketing  Who we are:  At Blueshift, our vision is to be the global category leader in the SmartHub Customer Data Platform (CDP) space by delivering AI in the hands of the marketer. We believe that every brand will move away from one-way conversations (batch and blast or "one size fits all" type experiences) to two-way conversations with every consumer & we can make it happen. We are a leading SmartHub CDP that empowers consumer brands to leverage their first-party data to deliver one-to-one personalized experiences at scale. Our clients include some of the top brands around the world including Discovery, Udacity, LendingTree and more. We're backed by top tier VCs, have been named to Deloitte's Technology Fast 500 and have been recognized as a "Cool Vendor for AI in Marketing" by Gartner.  Why Work Here! World-class commission plan; uncapped Clearly laid out and communicated career progression and promotion plan Fast career growth and development Work/partner with a world-class sales professionals Represent one of the most exciting movements in the marketing technology space Represent the company as the first point of contact (including working trade shows!) Receive best in class onboarding and long-term training and development; build the skills that will set up your career for a lifetime of success Competitive salary and meaningful equity, including medical insurance Unlimited PTO, and friendly work from home policy  Are you ready to make the SHIFT?

jobTitle: Account Manager, Large Customer Sales (English, Vietnamese)
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently, we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 5 years of experience in media account management and/or in the advertising industry. Ability to speak and write in Vietnamese and English fluently.  Preferred qualifications: 6 years of experience in the digital media space. Experience in Consumer Goods or Healthcare Industry Work experience in client side, agency, or digital platform selling digital media solutions. Work experience in sales environments, selling digital media solutions or with Google products to drive results. Experience with analytics and spreadsheet software, and ability to use creative approaches to develop solutions through data. Knowledge of Google advertising products across Apps, Video, Display, and Search.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  As an Account Manager on the Large Customer Sales team, you will be the product expert who brings the best of Google solutions to solve customer business and marketing challenges. You will cultivate robust consultative relationships and deliver leading strategic perspectives to customers in Vietnam. You will be a performance-driven digital marketing professional, with experience in Search, Display/Video, Apps solutions and can deliver exceptional customer service. You will work with internal and external stakeholders demonstrating your project management capabilities and coordinate implementation, execution and troubleshooting of Google solutions across multiple stakeholders.  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Be the product expert guiding customer and agencies on key Google products and solutions which can support customer's business and marketing objectives and act as the primary contact for troubleshooting, how-to emails, new products and policy, and implementation questions. Develop tactical account planning/execution, implement customer strategy and cultivate and develop key relationships with execution teams at customers and agencies guiding them through product execution and handling troubleshooting. Manage campaign delivery and account performance. Support a brief response process, provide product insights, develop media plans, and collaborate with the Industry Manager on responding to briefs from agencies and customers. Educate and advocate for Google when presenting to customers and agencies on new products, campaign results, and performance. Foster and develop key relationships with new and existing Vietnamese and English-speaking partners in region/covering Vietnam business.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Preferred qualifications: Experience in the gaming, mobile apps, or digital industry and possess knowledge of the app developer ecosystem. Experience with Google Ads. Ability to take initiatives and thrive in a team environment, with the ability to work well in a global team. Solution selling skills, ability to understand the goals and identify the opportunities, provide customized solutions to help customers achieve success. Effective communication skills with the ability to present comprehensive advertising solutions. Passion for entrepreneurship and eager to help small and medium customers grow.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. In this position, you will proactively manage a portfolio of customers, including English and Urdu-speaking customers in Pakistan, by offering solutions and insights in account optimizations, product betas, strategic performance reviews, and business expansion plans. You will be their go-to business partner at Google.  When our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! Our Google Customer Solutions (GCS) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of Google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. We are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. Our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. In collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses.  Responsibilities  Effectively develop and manage the pipeline of app businesses across various channels. Work closely with Google business teams to onboard app developer partners into the Google Ads ecosystem. Ensure customers achieve their business success through advertising goals, develop compelling and specific pitches, build up strategies and business proposals that uplift the customer success, and help them to set up expansion plans for the global market. Thrive in forming cross-­functional relationships with internal teams like Google Play, Business Sales, Online Partnerships Group, and other stakeholders, and external relationships with English and Urdu-speaking customers to realize and achieve advertiser goals. Company Description  ServiceNow is making the world of work, work better for people. Our cloud‑based platform and solutions deliver digital workflows that create great experiences and unlock productivity for employees and the enterprise. We're growing fast, innovating faster, and making an impact on our customers' and employees' lives in significant and important ways. With over 6,900 customers, we serve approximately 80% of the Fortune 500, and we're on the 2020 list of FORTUNE World's Most Admired Companies.®  We’re looking for people who are ready to jump right in and help us build on our incredible momentum, our diverse, engaged workforce, and our purpose to make the world of work, work better.  Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.  Job Description  ServiceNow is looking for a high achieving Commercial Inside Sales Representative ("Commercial ISR") to join our expanding Inside Sales team. You have a track record in new business pipeline generation through to close, over the phone. The Commercial ISR will produce new business sales revenue from software licenses within Small and Midsize Business (SMB) and Mid-Market accounts for clients with less than 1,000 employees in a defined geographic territory. This will be achieved through territory planning, including researching prospect customers, using business development strategies and completing field-based sales activities within an assigned territory.  Performers within the Inside Sales Team have gone on to excel in many different roles at ServiceNow.  What You Get To Do In This Role  The Commercial ISR builds relationships with clients while achieving quarterly and annual sales quotas for an assigned territory. Lead and nurture your sales opportunities and manage your territory Run sales from start to finish where the average sales cycle is 4-6 months Make a difference within a growing team and company Communicate accurate information to your management such as forecasting, territory plans, goals, etc. Build healthy business relationships to support customer adoption Partner with a team to collectively achieve success (solutions consultants, sales operations, field leadership and product line specialists) Qualifications  To be successful in this role you have: 1+ years of experience in a direct or support role on a software or solution sales team Experience in Business-to-Business sales (B2B) Experience establishing trusted relationships with current and prospective clients and other teams An understanding of the sales process, with the ability to progress and manage complex sales cycles Experience communicating with CxO personas Travel for training or meetings may occasionally be required FD21  Additional Information  ServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin or nationality, ancestry, age, disability, gender identity or expression, marital status, veteran status or any other category protected by law.  If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying, you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.  For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations, including Export Administration Regulations (EAR), ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.  Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.

description: About the role: Expand In Asia is looking for a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to help drive a range of B2B outbound campaigns in close collaboration with our clients’ Sales reps, Sales enablement, Sales Operations teams to fuel engagement and drive pipeline. The ideal candidate has a start-up mindset or is an entrepreneur at heart with a can-do attitude. He/she will have the chance to make an impact on the growth of tech and innovative companies evolving in various industries such as Media, Ad Tech, Health Tech, Cloud services (IT infrastructure). You will gain exposure to some of the world's best B2B customer acquisition practices, and will be responsible for managing the outbound campaigns for one of our international customers. What you will do: Craft, execute, supervise and improve a variety of Sales outbound campaigns and activities through email, LinkedIn, Video, etc. for various clients located in North America and in Asia. Identify key customer segments & customized approaches for each country. Help defining the go to market strategy and territory planning. Optimize email cadences by improving the Open Rate & Click to rate Work with the contact research teams to build contacts pipelines. Data mining from various sources of information on the web. Write up campaigns content and creatives. Plan thematic campaigns and launch campaigns tailored to different regions, vertical and targeted products, confirm delivery details. Project managing all relevant client’s stakeholders (reps, sales managers, sales ops) to make sure they are aligned and planned activities are fully executed on-time. Propose solutions to optimize the market research processes. Track campaigns performance and optimize them to ensure the campaign KPIs are met. Iterate and optimize content to improve the funnel including some AB testing. Create post-campaign presentations to impress clients. Your experience: You are aspiring for a career in sales automation, or consulting and are highly motivated to constantly learn new ways of generating results for your client’s successes. 2 to 3 years experience for a lead generation role or Sales development representative experience Experience managing B2B outbound email campaigns Market research and analysis Experience with inbound marketing campaigns, or copywriting is a plus Experience with the Media, Health Tech or cloud (infrastructure) industries is a plus Your profile and soft skills: Passion for learning/understanding various business models and business organizations from different industries (Media, Health Tech, IT infrastructure) Strong interpersonal, and communication skills (written and verbal), you love interacting with clients. Adaptable and quick to learn new processes and tools, demonstrating strong technical/operational capabilities Self-directed, goal-oriented and flexible to change methods when needed. Driven by results and by hitting KPIs. Ambitious with an entrepreneurial attitude. A go-getter with a can-do attitude. Perfect written English to write up clear and engaging messages. Additional languages are a big plus. A candidate highly organized, independent with a healthy attention to details and sense of quality. Leadership and capacity to get others to act, you are a natural project manager. Sense of curiosity to find solutions, new methods or new tools to continuously improve our processes. About Us: Expand In Asia is a dynamic digital lead growth and B2B sales consulting and execution firm based in SIngapore. Our mission is to help tech companies expand their sales pipeline globally leveraging digital technologies. We do that by offering state of the art B2B outbound lead generation multilingual services and by focussing on the early stages of a sales cycle to significantly increase our clients’ top of the funnel. Typically our clients outsource to us the sales development representative services allowing their sales reps to focus on accelerating their sales cycle and closing deals rather than prospecting. As a team we are driven by our 3 core company values which are : passion to create value for our customers, resilience to deliver results, lead with compassion in everything that we do, with our clients and within ourselves.
industries: Management Consulting

description: Why You'll Love Cisco  We change the World, you will become passionate about your employer and the brand you represent. Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more meaningful than ever before in our lives. Our employees' groundbreaking ideas impact everything. Here, that means we take creative ideas from the drawing board to dynamic solutions that have real world impact. You'll collaborate with Cisco leaders, partner with mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. You'll be part a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and you'll take part in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be encouraged and inspired!  What You'll Do  Cisco is seeking a Business Development Manager (BDM) to drive and address market opportunities with a proven track record of optimally driving the strategy, operation strategy, process consulting, high level architecture of sales in the market.  The BDM will bring expertise in leading and delivering sales growth in the Service  Provider market segment. You will possess deep knowledge and subject matter expertise in this area and will provide instant credibility - both internally and externally.  You will help transform customers' new business and technology architectures, and will be responsible for leading Cisco's drive into the marketplace, providing creative sales leadership and driving the expansion of the client base.  You will collaborate across global teams, and program manage complex, global initiatives. You are a problem solver with experience in risk and issue management, escalation, and resolution. You provide constructive coaching and feedback to all levels within the team as vital  You will have a variety of objectives and responsibilities to develop Cisco's Vertical Go To Market capabilities, including the following Lead service business proposals, especially for professional service and managed service, which needs cross architecture solutioning, detailed scoping, service level definition, and coordination with delivery members. Lead commercial scheme building, including quoting and SOW building with defined service scope and service level Build customer’s executive level relationships, jointly with the account team, understand the business priorities, and position the best Cisco service solutions to solve business challenges With holistic understanding of service providers system architecture, work with cross-functional groups (sales, product management, delivery, operations, marketing) to develop service strategy, lead opportunity creation, and support presales activities for service provider customer Actively engage global BDM community, to share standard methodologies and customer case study.  Who You Are You have more than 12 years of experience in business development/strategy/consulting, with an understanding of sales, with at least 5 solid years in the technology industry You are skilled at building presentation materials, proposals, case studies as well as at presenting towards external clients You are proficient in Service Provider, Data Center, Security and IT architecture (service providers platforms, networking, mobility, programmability, automation, virtualization, security, computing, endpoints, cloud services) You are an active learner, and a fantastic communicator You have strong performance as an individual contributor and are able to make a positive impact in a team environment You are ideally tuned in with Cisco’s product offering  Why Cisco  At Cisco, each person brings their different talents to work as a team and make a difference.  Yes, our technology changes the way the world works, lives, plays and learns, but our edge comes from our people.  We connect everything - people, process, data and things – and we use those connections to change our world for the better.  We innovate everywhere - From launching a new era of networking that adapts, learns and protects, to building Cisco Services that accelerate businesses and business results. Our technology powers entertainment, retail, healthcare, education and more.  We benefit everyone - We do all of this while striving for a culture that empowers every person to be the difference, at work and in our communities.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description: TeleGeography, a telecommunications research and consulting firm, is expanding and looking for a new member of our business development team in Singapore.  The Business Development Assistant has a critically important role at TeleGeography, assisting with a variety of duties, including writing and editing proposals, managing all sales documentation, inputting and tracking all sales activity using Salesforce.com, send informative emails to current end users. Extraordinary attention to detail and excellent organization skills are required in order to be successful in this role. The successful candidate will have great writing and editing skills and will be able to work independently, prioritizing tasks without being micromanaged.  This is a great opportunity for someone looking to launch their career in sales! Our expectation is that as this individual’s experience and knowledge increases, this person will assume more responsibility for inside sales work (e.g. expanding existing client work, closing smaller deals, etc.). Prior experience is not required for this position, but may be helpful. Responsibilities include: -Coordinate and submit RFP responses- Communicate with clients regarding contracts, proposals, etc- Track sales activities in CRMs (SalesForce and Hubspot)- Serve as point of contact for client’s procurement tools and manage the contract process- Send informative emails to current end users- Coordinate and schedule sales calls and teleconferences- Triage incoming leads (via internet and phone)- Write and edit proposals- The successful candidate will possess the following:Ability to build rapport with clients- Excellent attention to detail and organization skills- Business (proposal) writing skills- Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite- Excellent oral and written communication skills- The ability to multi-task and prioritize work is a must- Takes ownership for work, always ensuring standards and deadlines are met and keeping others informed and up-to-date- "Can do" attitude, taking initiative in accomplishing agreed-upon goals- Self-motivated with an eagerness to learn- Have the desire, drive, and creativity to find solutions- Self-driven and results-oriented- Excellent English oral and written communication skills. Fluency in Mandarin or Japanese is preferred.- Experience with Hubspot or Salesforce is a plus, but not required TeleGeography is a boutique firm with a global scope covering a critical, dynamic industry. It offers a collegial, intellectual atmosphere with a bit of quirky charm in an energizing remote-friendly workplace. During non-pandemic times, we have active offices in California, Washington DC, Exeter, and Singapore. If you’re ready to put your skills to work for a team dedicated to authoritative industry analysis, we want to hear from you! Edit job description

jobTitle: Regional Key Account Manager, APAC - High Tech
description: The Regional Key Account Manager, APAC – High-Tech is responsible for leading the development of the assigned strategic Global Accounts in the High-Tech Market. He/she is also responsible for leading the Country Key Account Managers (KAMs) to drive business opportunities and support the assigned clients. The incumbent is also expected to work closely with the Global Account Managers to develop and grow the wallet share of business for GEODIS.  Roles and Responsibilities  1. Account Management Ensure the development and maintenance of customer relationships and enhance overall client portfolio, safeguard sales revenue and ensure customer satisfaction Ensure increased consistency of services and pricing linked to “integrated solutions” Grow the share of business, as well as expand the relationships within the customer identifying influencers, gatekeepers, decision makers within the region of APAC but also to direct and align with Global and Regional KAM’s to further penetrate the client organization Deploy a strong consultative selling approach with assigned accounts to identify their supply chain challenges and develop value creating solutions that drive increased scope of engagement and share of wallet for Geodis Proactively managed and resolved account issues using continuous improvement principles to enhance service levels Improve client satisfaction based on formal feedback and surveys of your customers  2. Business Development (BD) Determine the strategies for the selected Global Accounts Ensure development of cross selling in Asia Build the wallet share of business for GEODIS with this customer AND its subsidiaries or affiliates Provide support & leadership to APAC BDs to develop business within portfolio of assigned clients Participate to the VM Activities by supporting presentations to prospects and other clients and showcasing best practices & innovative solutions from your accounts Work with Regional VM manager to develop standardized offering from the customized solutions deployed on your customer Engage with Regional VM manager, product stakeholders, IT & management teams to create value adding service offerings that can be taken back to your clients  3. Management Information Gather, consolidate, analyze and report management information Use CRM for all RFQ’s and Meetings Track key indicators such as volume, revenue, gross profit, manage yield Gather and provide to the company feedback on competitor information through your ongoing contact with strategic customers assigned to your care Provide timely and accurate reporting of relevant details as required and requested  4. Business Planning Drive behavior towards strategic engagement and value creation for assigned portfolio of accounts and strategic targets Manage pipeline size and quality  5. Leadership Steer, develop and motivate the country KAM’s to sell, maintain and support the assigned clients Regional and Country Customer cards in place and used to drive opportunities, innovations & growth strategy Hands on Management of the accounts across all APAC countries using all standardized tools: QBR deck, Issue Log, Communication and Escalation Matrix, Monthly report and ensuring same are maintained by country KAMs  *KPI for RKAM is accumulated result of the country KAMs  Education Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in related field  Work Experience Strong Sales or Business Development experience in Supply Chain Management and Freight Forwarding Minimum 10 years relevant experience in sales field with at least 3 years senior management position Experience in key account management role managing Retail or Retail sector customers Experience in working in regional role, with regional or sub-regional client scope is an advantage  Our Candidate promise  Recruiting passionate people  At GEODIS, we believe that each and every person matters when it comes to achieving long-lasting success and demonstrating our know-how. Our commitment to our customers leads us to recruit passionate and demanding men and women who are ready to fulfill the ambitions of our rapidly changing sector with all their energy.  Join a leader in constant evolution  With more than 100 years of experience in the field of transport and logistics, GEODIS knows how to respond to the major challenges. Throughout its history, GEODIS showed ability to adapt to the needs of its clients, industry-specific constraints and new national boundaries. With its talent pool, GEODIS opens you doors to the world full of dynamism where everyone finds their place in expertise, contributes to their development and succeeds. Being the key player of the supply chain, we are working on the logistics projects of our customers today and preparing those of tomorrow.  Creating daily opportunities  It is true that we are committed to offering autonomy and the opportunity to take initiative to each of our new hires. Therefore, it is necessary that they benefit from personalized and operational support that will allow them to understand the challenges of GEODIS and emphasize their strengths. We encourage openness. “Discuss. Decide. Align.”- this is a genuine moto to guarantee the success of our actions.  And if you were part of this adventure? Being GEODIS employee means living every day professional and personal adventure. It is about incorporating your personality, your knowledge and your know-how in the culture and the team spirit of GEODIS. Involvement and collaboration make it easier for everyone to take responsibility. We encourage you to go and meet different expertise and our complementary ecosystems whose activities give meaning to the group.

description: At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives. We’re a purpose-driven company, and our beliefs are the foundation of how we conduct business every day. We’re guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Collectively, these values inspire us to work together as One Team with our customers at the center of everything we do, and to take care of ourselves, each other, and the communities in which we live and work. We challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. Join us as we enable the hopes, dreams, and ambitions of millions of people around the world.  Job Description Summary: In this exciting role you will be responsible for prospecting and acquire new accounts for Malaysia. Building strategic relationships with key client leaders, driving pipeline activity and increase revenues with new business opportunities for PayPal. You are a seasoned sales professional (7-10 years+ of experience) with a hunter mentality. Skilled at uncovering opportunities through research, networking, and driving portfolio growth and expansion. With the ability to clearly articulate the PayPal value proposition to prospective customers, you will complete customer discovery, identifying key value drivers and identifying the correct product offering to pitch, with responsibility for leading and developing the sale, negotiating contract terms and closing the deals. Your success in this role will be measured by quota attainment as part of the sales cycle. This position is based in Singapore and responsible for expanding Malaysia market.  Job Description: New sales prospecting, building strategic relationships with key leaders in client’s organizations Clearly articulating the PayPal value proposition to prospective customers Completing customer discovery, identifying key value drivers, and identifying the correct product offering to pitch Leading and managing the sales process including developing the sale, negotiating contract terms, and closing the deal Developing strategic relationship with merchants’ C-level management Active pipeline building and identifies opportunities for PayPal  Prospecting & Pipeline Management Ability to follow the set sales process (including maintaining a record of activity, updating SFDC etc.) and create an action plan to approach multiple contacts and merchants to generate enough new business interest Experience of designing and executing against a winning sales process Ability to comprehensively plan and develop a trade scenario, can manage all aspects of negotiation process Ability to create effective, successful, and strategic short and long-term plans, and forecast with accuracy Ability to understand pipeline economics, and forecast and action plan with merchants accordingly Ability to build up a large pipeline that allows for higher level of dropouts, as opportunities are new business Ability to prioritize and qualify deals, including identifying when to proceed and being able to start with a “no” Ability to quickly identify decision makers, influencers, and advocates regardless of organizational structure  Acumen Knowledge of the features and benefits of the broader product portfolio, including how core products achieve key value drivers and deliver against competitors Knowledge of the prospect’s value drivers, indicators and technical attributes that make the customer a fit for products and solutions. Ability to identify these indicators and attributes during discovery Dedicated to maintaining professional and technical knowledge by attending trainings, reviewing industry knowledge, and maintaining professional industry networks Ability to understand emerging technologies and products and the company’s strategies to address them Ability to gather industry insight and monitor competition and communicate the company’s differentiated value proposition vs. key competitors  Customer Orientation & Relationship Management Ability to quickly identify decision makers, influencers, and advocates regardless of organizational structure Ability to build trust and credibility quickly with new stakeholders Building strong rapport with contacts for the life of the relationship, with a longer-term plan to hand over to CSMs or AEs Ability to onboard a new customer using the standard process  Communicating Ability to sell to multiple and diverse stakeholders (technical, finance, business) Ability to communicate with c-level stakeholders and drive c-level conversations Ability to present the key facts and gain interest quickly with new stakeholders, including strong whiteboard and presentation skills Ability to confidently articulate new business value proposition in core verticals and gain interest quickly Ability to be persistent and tenacious in approach Ability to cold start and manage knock-backs with resilience Ability to complete high quality, standard new merchant contract  Negotiating & Influencing Ability to develop internal networks with peers both within and outside own team, and by growing external contact networks Ability to build on existing relationships and build new connections/contacts, and successfully leverage new relationships where strategically important Ability to successfully engage and collaborate with cross-functional counterparts Ability to identify true objections vs. blockers, and handle objections accordingly Ability to effectively negotiate with merchants Ability to start building an external brand presence in the industry, such as joining relevant groups on LinkedIn  For more than 20 years, PayPal has remained at the forefront of the digital payment revolution. By leveraging technology to make financial services and commerce more convenient, affordable, and secure, our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 400 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.  PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.  REQ ID R0063755

Fresh graduates are welcome to apply University or Polytechnic Graduates from Business Administration or Accountancy or relevant discipline Entry Level candidates will be considered (On-the-job training will be provided) Proficiency in MS Words and Excel  Internet applications e.g. Internet Explorer, Microsoft Outlook and Outlook Express, etc. Good written and oral communication skills in English Language are essential. Able to write and communicate in Mandarin is an added advantage (to deal with Chinese Clients)

jobTitle: Business Development Manager (International Customers and Strategic RTM Transformation)
description: Location: Singapore, Singapore  Summary  This position will be responsible for developing and implementing strategy for the long-term business with international customers in APAC, based on our 3 key pillars of growth. Position as a strategic partner Collaborate bigger and better Provide exclusive offering The role requires to assess and implement RTM transformation base on APAC model, achieving market financial goals which includes but is not limited to: revenue in terms of net sales, gross profit, category/market share (where applicable) and operating income by developing and executing sales and trade marketing plans, working closely with Marketing, Finance and Supply Chain and ensuring effective coverage of sales territories and execution of agreed marketing strategies.  Where applicable, this role is responsible for achieving channel and customer profitability as well as market share goals vis a vis identified customers or channels. The delivery of the Net sales and gross profit are the key deliverable of the role. Within the function – the role delivers on controlling of sales expenses and controllable portions of the SG&A line. The role also coordinates and delivers on achieving the optimal supply chain platform for his or her market/s.  The role entails developing and implementing an effective and coordinated trade marketing and sales plan in support of organizational and regional/ business unit strategies and other globally or regionally driven efforts. The role is also a customer facing role representing the corporation with recognized customers and/or relevant organizations, partners, and suppliers within the markets  The role is ultimately responsible for the development and training of key distributor personnel for markets under his or her business unit. He or she must be abreast of current trade trends, market conditions and marketing, finance, supply chain and sales enablers through continued education and training.  The business development manager role is expected to leverage and grow partnerships with key customers for the markets under the business unit. He or she is the main liaison with the Marketing, Finance and Supply Chain regional or sub-regional support teams.  Major Duties/Responsibilities  MARKET STRATEGIES Defines and grows the business through effective customer marketing and sales business plans, Channel, category, and key customer strategies at trade level. Clearly establishes: “where to win” and “how to win” trade, customer, category, and shopper programs that deliver the outcomes required with clear marketing, sales and financial deliverables. The role leads customer marketing, field sales, and Supply Chain in delivering profitable growth for key customers. Leads the articulation of geographic, channel, customer, and category priorities and what it will take to deliver against the strategies – he or she is the key communicator of this at all forums. Communicates and consistently monitors progress of the execution of the strategy with internal and external stakeholders. Develops and executes joint business plans with identified key customers within markets. In all called out areas below, the role will comply with or develop the right measurables at all levels to ensure delivery and visibility of progress (or the lack of it) in achieving business goals. SALES AND CUSTOMER/TRADE MARKETING EXECUTION Owns and manages the total trade spend budget for the Countries/ Customers. Plans full year trade spend in line with yearly activity plan, monitors actuals vs budget on a monthly basis, and adjusts year to go plan as needed in order to meet business objectives within agreed budget. Delivers the agreed market strategies in-store or channels. The role articulates and delivers to his or her marketing partners ideas, positions and insights that will deliver the right positioning, price, product, promotion and place for markets under the business unit. The role is a key participant in the development of marketing plans and strategies and owns the delivery of marketing ambitions in channels, customers and categories. Oversees the delivery of the sales and customer/trade marketing goals through the distributor by creating well defined Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). The KPIs reflect and show sales and customer/trade strategies being executed as planned across the market. KPIs includes but is not limited to: gross invoice sales, in-country sales, speed to shelf, distributor and trade inventory, meeting retail driver standards, proper execution of in store activation strategies (perfect strore blueprint execution, point of materials management, store dressing at category/segment level), channel strategy and plans (Effectively translating marketing plans into store format plans, identifying correct assortment, creating tailor made promotions), category strategy and plans (cross category promotion, cross merchandising initiatives, building consistent platform of projects dedicated to key retailers) . The role owns the delivery of the sales and trade/customer marketing KPIs. Delivers adequate and relevant sales training directly or through others for his or her direct distributor sales team. It is expected that the role manages sales operational support systems internally in the areas of customer/trade marketing, consumer promotions, merchandising, sales analysis and sales administration. Externally, the role is the main driver of the distributor relationship – the main driver of joint business performance. FINANCE, SUPPLY CHAIN Co- owns and co- leads the execution of a healthy P&L for the market which includes but is not limited to: total business, brands, channel and customer P&Ls as well as sales to expense and controllable SG&A lines. He or she articulates the right and relevant financial deliverables with respect to channels, customers and/or shoppers for the market which reflect the investment in the marketing strategies. He or she also owns the execution of the appropriate levels of control and audit processes within the sales organization and with the distributor partners. It is his or her responsibility to coordinate both reporting and funding requirements with key internal and external partners with the region or sub-region. He or she has a full understanding of distributor financials and drives and influences the directions taken by distributors toward financial expectations of the Hershey Company. The role requires that he or she co-plans and executes an optimal supply chain (in-bound) for the markets in conjunction and partnership with internal stakeholders. He or she is responsible for ensuring the delivery of the right stock, at the right time at the right price (out bound within the market). He or she co-owns the product freshness at the market and trade level with internal supply chain partners. He is or she constantly seeks for ideas and arrangements that allow the company to improve on Supply Chain KPIs such as fill rates and product quality. Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities: Deep knowledge and exposure to sales and customer/trade marketing Financially savvy and able to own and manage total trade spend budget. Proficient in MS Office based applications Excellent oral and written communication skills; strong interpersonal and presentation skills A high level of understanding of finance and Supply Chain (logistics) of the business Minimum Education And Experience Requirements He or she must know and understand current trade trends, market conditions and sales enablers through continued education and training. Minimum of 8 years solid work experience in customer/trade marketing (in store activations, channel and category strategy and plans, shopper insights) and sales (key account management, distributor management) Demonstrated ability in key functional tasks and a clear progression or expansion in terms of areas of responsibility or increase in business size and complexity. The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of The Hershey Company is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veterans
industries: Consumer Goods

description: Do you believe in the future of the creator economy? Do you love education and see its power to transform lives? We do, which is why we are building Nas Academy, an online education platform to empower creators to share their knowledge. https://nasacademy.com/  Nas Academy is looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic Business Development Representative to join our growing outbound sales team. You will be responsible for the development of the lead generation program and nurture outbound sales lead campaigns for Nas Academy products and services.  Key responsibilities include: Managing the top of the funnel and middle of the funnel leads generation Collaboratively work with the Head of Outbound sales to develop lead generation strategies to generate lead opportunities with prospective customers Hands on experience with email marketing and running email sequence campaign Providing consistent, concise, accurate and timely weekly/monthly sales lead gen activity reports to management Solving complex technical integration solutions and issues with the Lead generation tool Achieving sales lead gen and appointment quotas  Qualifications Minimum of 3 - 5 years of sales email marketing experience in an education, internet, or solutions selling environment. Experience with lead generation and marketing automation software Must be an experienced successful prospector, and be able to independently develop new prospects in a highly competitive environment. Show a proven track record achieving sales lead gen and appointment quotas Must have strong inner drive and self-discipline, proficiency in EXCEL, Word, PowerPoint and Lead Generation Tools  About Nas Academy  Nas Academy is an Ed-tech platform for the creator economy founded by Nuseir Yassin (Creator of Nas Daily). Nas means people in Arabic, and as the peoples academy, we want to help every creator monetize their knowledge. We believe content creators on the Internet will be the future journalists, commerce sellers, and educators of the world. We are on a mission to turn creators into academy's, empowering them to become the world's best educators. Think of it like Masterclass...but for everybody else.  With team members around the world, we are a global platform for creators founded by creators. We are passionate about being a force for good in the world, and providing a platform for voices that are not always heard. Our social media pages have more than 13 billion views and 38 million followers across the internet.  Content creators and storytelling are the future - and we want to help build that future. Our goal is to be the Global leader for online learning. So far, 10,000+ students from over 140 countries have already taken our courses and are part of our community for a lifetime! We aim to grow these numbers by 10x in 2021.  ** Remote position**
industries: E-Learning

description: Reporting to Senior Vice President of Worldwide Sales, you will play a critical role in building and executing the go-to-market strategy for ThycoticCentrify in Asia-Pacific, setting the company up for success long term in the region. Benefitting from having a market-leading product and strategic relationships in the region, you will be responsible for growing the company’s revenue in the region at this critical stage. Being resourceful and hunting down opportunities with a relentless customer focus and an approach aimed to build up sales channels in the region will set you up for success. In parallel, as the organisation scales, you will have significant influence over the shaping of the company’s broader go-to-market infrastructure. Immediately on joining the business, you will work with the management team to understand the current sales channels within the region, existing relationships, and new business opportunities upon which a pipeline to support near-term growth can be built and converted. You will help define the go-to-market strategy to meet market expectations and customer needs to drive faster adoption of the product. Simultaneously, you will begin developing key business strategies across Japan, Singapore, and Australia, leveraging the additional resources made available by the growing revenue base and institutional investment to support this. You will also be responsible for hiring and developing the team within the region to scale the business and continue to develop the local team to build a sales team with the primary focus of building the business regionally. Following a period of integration, you will conclude a series of customer wins, increase revenue velocity, and establish yourself as a senior leader in the organisation. You will then seek to accelerate revenue growth, taking the product and the business to market as a larger sales team, targeting new geographic markets, and partnering with a capable marketing organisation to drive exponential growth. You will look to scale the product’s footprint across the region and build the commercial performance to support an ultra-high growth business as a category leader. Ultimately, you will play a key role in significantly growing the company’s valuation through to the next funding round and beyond.  Key Responsibilities Execute and formulate a sales strategy within an assigned region, drive revenue growth by penetrating the current customer base, and develop a net new customer base. Work with the SVP to manage and control P&L within the region building a successful, sustainable and dynamic regional sales performance. Continually monitor the sales activity of the team and track the results; report on sales activity and forecast to the SVP. Provide market feedback to the leadership team influencing product strategy and positioning. Perform regular individual meetings with the sales team, as well as supporting client visits with sales reps where necessary. Work closely with the Senior Director of Channels, Director of Pre-Sales, Senior Marketing Director to inspire the local teams of Channel Sales, Pre-Sales Engineers, and Marketers to execute on regional strategy. Hire, train, and develop team members to align with company values, growth, and business objectives. Provide ongoing training and development of the sales team. Define new business campaigns into horizontals and verticals to generate new opportunities with a demonstrable Return on Investment. Support, manage and motivate the local team of Account Executives by participating in New Business and Existing customer meetings and helping the team reach the Company's goals. Build upsell/cross-sell strategies and reference programmes to develop and grow relationships with our current customer base. Identify the customer approvers, decision-makers, and influencers, and develop strategies for each to mitigate risk and increase deal Growth & Scale beyond $10m ARR across the region ideal. Strong experience in building strong channel partner relationships across the Asia Pacific. Consistent record of exceeding annual team quotas and performance targets. Experience scaling and managing enterprise and strategic sales teams within a region. Prior experience in developing a high-performance culture. Demonstrated ability to manage complex sales cycles including the ability to provide coordination and direction to your extended team. Evidence of contributing to the development of growth strategies and lead generation programmes as an executive leader. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to solve complex problems and articulate ideas and strategies effectively. A naturally curious, problem-solving self-starter with low ego and high self-awareness. Culturally sensitive and creative, versatile, and strategic thinker. High energy and attention to detail. Expert negotiation skills. Self-Awareness and a desire to learn from all those; above you, equal to you and below in role. Thorough knowledge of Salesforce.com to maintain a current and accurate pipeline. Skills  Must have at least 5+ years successful track record of managing a team of 8 or more individual contributors in SaaS, enterprise software company, or a security vendor.
