In line with pre-planned budget, the regional / sales manager shall be the first-line contact to develop customer accounts to market Phaos products in the designated area.  Phaos Technology, is an advanced microscopy technology company originated from NUS with patented Optical Microsphere Nanoscope (OMN) technology, developed with NRF grant, to be commercialized into super-resolution optical microscope products and business. With active engagement with product team, the sales manager shall be responsible for Market exploration and discovery and identifying sales leads; Developing and acquiring customers – both channel partners and end customers and managing customer accounts and full cycle of sales process from sales quotation, sales order execution through payment collection; Market and application discovery in the designated area through customer engagement towards productive and constructive feedback to product development.  - Bachelor's degree, preferred in engineering or science major. A diploma candidate with good working experiences can be considered as well. - Strong commitment in work ethics and team-work - Proficient in common office tools

The ideal candidate will possess strong sales, interpersonal and organizational skills. They should be comfortable with multitasking and be able to budget their resources in order to meet the assigned quotas for their role.   Responsibilities Build and maintain client relationships Track and record metrics throughout sales process Meet and exceed financial goals Understand and keep up to date with industry and competitive landscape knowledge  Qualifications Bachelor's degree 2-3 years of business experience Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office Ability to harness financial data to inform decisions

At Delta Air Lines, we are focused on building an organization operated by people with an unwavering commitment to superior customer experience to further position Delta as the world's most trusted airline in the eyes of our employees and customers.  As a Customer Experience Specialist, you will join a service and sales focused team in high energy call center environment, focused on listening to, caring for and connecting with customers. In this position, you will answer calls in an efficient, courteous and accurate manner, while assessing customer needs and offering solutions and additional products. Ideal candidates should demonstrate the desire to make our customer's travel not only superior but memorable.  This position is full-time with comprehensive health and wellness benefits, performance incentive programs, and Delta's industry-leading travel privileges. Successful candidates will form a hiring class scheduled as early as August 2021 in our Singapore Engagement Center.  Life At Our Singapore Customer Engagement Center Centrally located at the Singapore Post Center 2 minutes away from Paya Lebar MRT station, surrounded by 3 shopping malls, entertainment, and 24-hour food center 5-7 minutes away Modern break room offering snacks and beverage options and free Wi-Fi Local community engagement activities within Singapore as well as participation with Relay for Life and Day of Hope, Breast Cancer Research Foundation (BCRF), and Family Fun Day Delta employees, spouse/children can take advantage of interline agreements that provide space available travel at a reduced rate on many other airlines from around the world. Discounts available to global attractions, hotels and cruises through Delta Perks! Job Summary  Customer Experience Specialists connect with customers via phone and create an experience where customers know they have been heard and understood and feel valued and important, which is accomplished by: Effective listening Quickly identifying and owning customer issues Actively search for solutions to problems Making quality decisions Interacting with a globally diverse group of customers and colleagues Specialists sell travel related services, including car rental and credit card vendor partner products. Customer Experience Specialists demonstrate strong verbal and written communication skills, a professional attitude, excellent dependability, the ability to handle stressful situations, possess strong computer skills, flexibility in a fast-paced environment, and the ability to learn and react quickly. Specialists must understand and adhere to all Delta and U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT) compliance requirements.  Employees will have future opportunities to progress to specialty teams that respond to customer escalations or resolve complex international ticketing issues. As Delta continues to offer new ways for our customers to connect with us, Specialists may also have opportunities to assist customers via Twitter, Facebook or other emerging social media platforms.  Compensation And Training  The starting pay for this position is SGD$1,983.00 per month, with an increase to SGD$2,045.00 after 6 months, and to SGD$2,138.00 after one year. The position is also eligible for performance-based incentive after 6 months’ probation, shift premium for PM shifts, monthly shared rewards if company meets KPIs and annual pay increases.  Successful candidates will participate in a comprehensive classroom and on-the-job training. Classroom training includes instruction, observation, exams and performance measures.  After training, we will assign new employees to a shift that may be significantly different than your training shift and will include two consecutive days off likely midweek. New employees will remain on that shift until the employee is eligible to bid on a shift they select. New hires are eligible to bid on a new shift during the first shift bid following completion of new hire training. Employees bid on preferred shifts every 3-4 months. New hires are often awarded PM shifts with midweek days off until they are able to hold different shifts based on seniority. Delta is a 24/7 operation, and we will always have customers that need us.  Your health and safety  Our values-based culture puts people at the heart of every decision. Since the beginning of the pandemic, protecting Delta people, their families, our customers, candidates and making your health and safety our first priority has been the driving force behind every decision we have made. We adhere to the latest Local Ministry of Health (MOH) Guidelines. Temperature checks/screenings are performed at every Delta facility before entry. In addition, Delta requires wearing a mask while in the office, staying 1 meter apart and practicing good hygiene. Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles Consistently makes safety and security, of self and others, the priority Possess correct legal documentation to live and work in Singapore Be fluent written and verbally in English This role requires computer skills and comfort with navigating software applications, email, instant messaging, and internet searches. Must be able to demonstrate clear, pleasant, and courteous verbal and written communication using appropriate grammar, tone, and pronunciation Must have a flexible schedule as this position will require you to work weekends, holidays and including night shift Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based job, if not currently employed by Delta Air Lines, Inc. Preferred education requirement for this position is an A-Level, O-Level, or HS Diploma (equivalent accepted). Consideration will be given to candidates with an N-Level if they also have a Polytechnic Diploma (equivalent accepted), WSQ Level 7, or 6 years of work experience. At least one year of experience working in sales At least one year of experience providing customer service
industries: Airlines/Aviation and Consumer Services

description: We are looking for an ambitious and energetic Business Development professional to help us expand our vertical client based. You will be the front of the company and will have the dedication to create and apply an effective business development strategy.  Summary of job Working with large key accounts in Singapore in Public or Private Sector (please specify vertical specialization), this position requires a knowledgeable and experienced business professional with strong account management capabilities in engaging customers at the executive level to provide solutions, develop new business and ensure high levels of customer satisfaction while maintaining positive ongoing relationships. This professional must be able to demonstrate the ability to engage at all levels within project groups and to influenced the opportunity at the early stage. The actions of this position will result in Hikvision being seen as the “Trusted Advisor” to the End-user communities while creating pull-through sales value to the supply channel for Hikvision products and solutions. The business development professional shall feel at home being the “voice of Hikvision” in front of customers, the decision makers.  What we are looking for: Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. Execute Hikvision Singapore strategic plan: Study the selected vertical’s value chain/players; Identify, prioritize, schedule, pursue, and deliver strategic Key End-user project opportunities for target fulfillment, Building long term relationships through direct and indirect touch, Use of innovative marketing tools to nurture this relationship, Work as a Team with Hikvsion project sales and System Integration partners to manage Key End User accounts in the Public or Private Sector (please specify vertical specialization) Make the knowledge available to Hikvision project sales and product marketing teams for planning and fulfillment purposes Deep dive into End-User organization structure and ability to understand the different Group down to the Department level of the End User to identify the opportunities area Conduct Key End-user events to better understand the required features & functions of future technologies in the video based IoT space. Provide Key End-user presentations during “face to face” and Virtual introductory meetings. Develop and schedule the deployment of required Key End-user programs to address individual End-user needs and pain-points Identify & understand the business models of the Key End-user accounts as it relates to security and not limited to security functions Cooperate with and coordinate company internal technical resources and project teams to effectively communicate the expansion / transition to future technology. Provide educational/awareness briefings for End-users to reinforce Hikvision role as “Trusted Advisor”. Interface, collaborate and communicate effectively with other departments and business units addressing the end-user in support of Hikvision goals. Expand and maintain a comprehensive database of key and named end-user accounts in the Public or Private Sector (please specify vertical specialization) Maintain a high degree of product knowledge, more on the spectrum/benefit/road map level. Attend applicable industry tradeshows, meetings and other Hikvision internal and external events, especially with focus on speaking and presentation opportunities. Participate in applicable End-user seminars and conferences and drive Hikvision engagement. Provide timely and accurate monthly status report of group activities and progress using CRM & during the weekly / monthly / quarterly briefing session.  Qualifications, Education and Experience  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Bachelor’s degree and/or minimum of 5-10 years of proven business development experience Minimum of 5 years of work experience in CCTV or a technology-related industry. Candidate with Project Sales experience with a System Integration Company in the Physical Security Industry is a plus. Excellent communication, analytical and financial skills Strong account management skills with experience in collaboration in a global team Ability to think critically and creatively and to contribute in a team environment Ability to use the internal and external tools to gather and interpret data  Language Skills      Ability to effectively communicate in English language, both verbally and in writing. Ability to communicate in Chinese language verbally Ability to read and interpret technical journals, technical specifications, international technical standards (such as ONVIF), etc.  Computer Skills Proficient in MS Office & CRM software. Familiar with operating systems, such as Windows, etc.   Work Requirements Compliance with all relevant Hikvision Global policies and procedures related to Quality, Security, Safety, Business Continuity, and Environmental systems. Travel and fieldwork, including international travel may be required. Therefore, the employee must possess, or be able to acquire a valid passport. Must be legally eligible to work in Singapore  In your application please specify the vertical specialization! E.g Transportation, Education, BFSI, Government, etc for consideration

OUR TEAM VALUES Intellectual Curiosity: We are curious, and we have a hunger to consistently learn. We are very open to ideas and innovation. Authenticity: We treasure the concept of intrinsic motivation. We encourage genuine conversations and constructive debates. Resilient: We are a team of hard-working individuals that strive to get the job done in the best possible manner. We are committed to high quality work. Reflective: Personal Growth is about being aware of one's strength and weaknesses. We are obsessed about improving ourselves. Adaptable: Being in a fast-paced environment requires flexibility and being agile to changes that would bring impact. Fun Loving: We are very serious about work and our goals, but beneath our professional exterior, we are really a bunch of people who love to have fun. WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING Lead Generation Acquire new clients & maintain existing customers Perform lead generation and canvassing to acquire new accounts. Sales Presentation Prepare quotations and arranging sales presentations. Maintain and achieve customer satisfaction in pursuit of business targets Share sales-related or market information internally & externally Develop content for sales presentations or other materials. Customer Management Maintain and achieve customer satisfaction in pursuit of business targets Create win-win solutions for clients, establishing long-term partnerships

description: Globalization Partners simplifies global business by enabling companies to hire great talent anywhere in the world, without the complexity of setting up foreign branch offices or subsidiaries. You find the talent, and we put YOUR candidate on OUR fully compliant, in-country payroll. This enables you to expand into almost any country around the globe – quickly and easily. Our platform enables you to leapfrog over the legal, HR and tax complexities without having to figure out “how” to do business in a foreign country, while getting all the benefits of a global team.  Globalization Partners’ Globalization Partners’ Global Expansion Platform™ enables you to hire in more than 170 countries within days, and without the need to set up costly international subsidiaries. You identify great talent anywhere in the world, and we put them on our fully compliant global payroll—lifting the burden of global corporate tax, legal, and HR matters from your shoulders to ours. Our systems are accessible at the touch of a finger via our software platform and app.  We make it easy for anyone to do business anywhere and hold ourselves to high standards of doing business by maintaining our triple bottom line philosophy that emphasizes happy clients, happy employees and happy shareholders. And not to brag, but we’ve won multiple awards for our culture, including being named as one of the Top 150 Company Cultures in America by Entrepreneur Magazine.  Globalization Partners, is on track to deliver 130 percent of it’s 2021 forecast of new customer acquisition and similarly exceed its original revenue projections.  The company’s dramatic growth reflects the demand for high-quality, scalable, global remote work solutions in a business environment that has quickly shifted towards a “remote-first” work culture. Globalization Partners is reporting record-breaking results with an upwards revised financial forecast of more than USD$1 billion dollars in annualised recurring revenue (ARR) by the end of 2021.  At the onset of 2021, Globalization Partners planned to hire 300 new employees over the course of the year. Now, the company is upgrading that initial projection to 150 internal employees per month in the second half of 2021 and beyond, while maintaining its commitment to customers by ensuring a continued 97 percent customer satisfaction rating.  Globalization Partners  International Business, Simplified.  About The Position  As a Sales Executive, you will be joining a team that is laser-focused on taking over the world, building a company we are proud of, and meeting the needs of 30,000 employers hiring internationally. With our record of phenomenal growth, we need to recruit the best of the best, with the potential to grow with us as we expand.  What You Will Do  You will be responsible for all aspects of the sales cycle including reaching out and following on both incoming and self-generated leads, generating deal proposals through to deal close. Although we close sales on the wire, this is a very consultative sales process, where we act as a trusted advisor to educate our clients about overseas expansion, and at the same time differentiate ourselves through our knowledge and client service. We are looking for someone with high energy, high integrity and exceptional attention to detail, who is focused on provide an outstanding client experience from the very first contact with Globalization Partners.  Responsibilities  The team is responsible for the generation of new revenues for Globalization Partners by meeting corporate sales targets. As a member of this key team, you would be responsible for meeting your individual sales targets and other metrics established by the Sales Manager. Understand prospective client requirements and validate their suitability for Globalization Partner’s solution Complete sales and achieve quarterly sales targets Meet activity KPIs set by your sales manager Build and sustain a strong understanding of the Globalization Partner’s solutions using the education materials provided Maintain a strong understand of the competitive environment by engaging in internal training, self education and research Follow up on company-sourced and self-generated leads from multiple sources including website, partners, sales team colleagues, trade shows, marketing campaigns, etc. Proactively call prospects, build relationships by understanding their business and challenges Educate prospects on the opportunities and benefits of our solution Draft and follow up on proposals, overcome objections and close sales, while working to a quarterly sales target Maintain a strong pipeline to meet assigned sales quotas and metrics Identify potential prospects through LinkedIn, news feeds, online research, etc. Constantly learn about our business, follow industry-related developments and maintain an entrepreneurial drive Develop, maintain and engage in business related networking online via LinkedIn, Twitter (etc.) and physically through local networking and industry events. Build partnership with sales executives in adjacent solutions to maximise lead opportunities Maintain high quality data in Salesforce What We Are Looking For  We are creating this company together as a team, so it is incredibly important that we have the best and brightest people all working together towards our common goals. In order to be successful in our culture, we look for the following demonstrated attributes: Ability and experience in researching prospect industries and providing insight as relates to talent acquisition Ability to build and develop excellent customer relationships Outstanding communication skills both written and verbal Active listening skills Attention to detail Collaborative and support skills to team Presentation & product demonstration experience Problem solving skills Information gathering skills Self starter with strong time management & organizational skills Ability to understand and explain complex solutions Successful record in selling solution in a remote environment Qualifications Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a business or finance discipline Minimum of 2 - 5 years’ experience in sales, with a track record in meeting sales targets and pitching to C-Level Experience in global operations, or a B2B product with a financial focus preferred Structured Sales training in established sales methodologies preferred International work and/or travel experience a strong plus. Experience working in a start-up environment an advantage Very good English language skills Working knowledge of Salesforce or similar CRM preferred
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

jobTitle: Entry Level Sales and Marketing Associates (Fun and Young Startup Environment, Immediate Starters!!)
description: Entry Level Sales and Marketing Associates (Fun and Young Startup Environment, Immediate Starters!!)  Location & Salary: - Raffles Place MRT, CBD office -$2500 to $4000  Introduction: - Our awesome company is looking for graduated Poly/University Students, ORD Personnels (Singaporeans or PR ONLY) for a Full-Time Associate - Start Date: Flexible, any month from October 2021 - Work with Singapore's #1 Player in the Outsourced Marketing Industry - Fun, Young & Dynamic Working Environment, Smart Casual Working Attire  Learning Scope: - Assist with day-to-day Business Development and Marketing ventures  - Valuable experience in managing marketing campaigns & networking - First-hand experience of working with clients in real-time & being actively involved in all stages of the business process - Learn relevant modern-day marketing skill-sets such as techniques to make a stellar Sales Pitch, establishing strong Client Relationships, and Personal Branding  Benefits: - Fun Working Environment - Smart Casual Working Attire, Exciting and Fast-paced Setting - Enjoyable Start-Up Culture with close team of 20-25 Pax - Spacious Office with Modern & Fun Facilities (Games, Smart TV, Office Pantry) - Company Meals / Outings / Events / Bonding & Networking Activities  APPLY NOW!!

Application Instructions: Interested applicants please apply here: https://grnh.se/86e39b212us  Workato is the only integration and automation platform that is as simple as it is powerful — and because it’s built to power the largest enterprises, it is quite powerful.  Simultaneously, it’s a low-code/no-code platform. This empowers any user (dev/non-dev) to painlessly automate workflows across any apps and databases.  We’re proud to be named a leader by both Forrester and Gartner and trusted by 7,000+ of the world's top brands such as Box, Grab, Slack, and more. But what is most exciting is that this is only the beginning.  Why join us?  Ultimately, Workato believes in fostering a flexible, trust-oriented culture that empowers everyone to take full ownership of their roles. We are driven by innovation and looking for team players who want to actively build our company.  But, we also believe in balancing productivity with self-care. That’s why we offer all of our employees a vibrant and dynamic work environment along with a multitude of benefits they can enjoy inside and outside of their work lives.  If this sounds right up your alley, please submit an application. We look forward to getting to know you!  Also, feel free to check out why Business Insider named us an ‘enterprise startup to bet your career on”! #WeAreBlushing  All full-time employees in Singapore will also have the following benefits: Workato Stock Options at one of Silicon Valley’s fastest growing startups Flexible and personalized medical and wellness benefits (protection for hospitalization and surgical procedures, clinical outpatient visits, accident coverage and more...) Up to 20 weeks of paid maternity leave, and 10 weeks of paid paternity leave Responsibilities  We are looking for an exceptional Commercial Account Executive (Asia) to join our growing team. In this role, you will be responsible to: Present, promote and sell products/services using well-formed arguments to existing and prospective customers; provide product demonstration to prospects Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs; proactively help customers to assess Workato throughout the decision process Regularly evaluate market potential, track sales and status reports; analyze market to formulate plans to win and grow new and existing businesses by working with Marketing, Customer Success and Product Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales potential; create detailed prospecting lists using various methods to identify and win new enterprise customers Establish and maintain positive business and customer relationships. Increase visibility of Workato across all departments within customer accounts Schedules customer onboarding calls; transitions the customer to Customer Success; expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Work effectively in teams to maximize revenue potential and ensure customer success Prioritize and deliver outstanding customer service experience to Workato’s customers Meet and exceed sales targets and outcomes within schedule Identify and leverage trends within industry of expertise/focus Continuously improve through feedback Requirements  Qualifications and Experience At least 1 - 2 years of Commercial Software Sales experience in a technology space. Needs to be based in Singapore Has prior experience in closing deals in software or technology sales in Asia (Excluding Japan) Technical background or good understanding of technology and industry trends, especially in the app integration space preferred Experience in customer sales, account management or consulting preferred Skills High level of comfort presenting key client issues, be the customer advocate within Workato Strong critical thinking, analytical skills with an entrepreneurial and proactive mindset Ability to effectively prioritize tasks and manage time, even under high-pressure situations Strong collaboration skills, ability to adapt to a dynamic start-up environment with a passion for making an impact Excellent written and oral communication skills in English

description: The Company Our client operates the world’s largest independent advertising exchange connecting tens of thousands of top brands with consumers across the most trafficked websites and mobile apps globally. The company stands uniquely alone in the marketplace as the recognized leader in quality, scale, and performance, delivering value across every type of connected screen and format.  Founded in 2007, they have 7 offices worldwide — Pasadena (HQ), San Francisco, New York, London, Kraków, Tokyo and Singapore.  The Role We are looking for a Business Development Manager/Director who will play an integral role in maximizing revenue and driving relationships with agencies, advertisers, and other demand partners (e.g. DSPs, Top 6 agency hold co). Based in Singapore, the role will report to the VP, Business Development SEA. You will have an entrepreneurial spirit because this is one of the founding team members for the organisation in SEA. You will have 5-7 years experience building a network within the demand ecosystem with proven success in driving long-term recurring revenue. You will manage day-to-day workflow and partner engagement, including monitoring key performance indicators to ensure partners’ success and satisfaction with their products, and driving revenue by identifying client growth opportunities.  The Candidate This role will suit a candidate 5-7 years of online advertising sales and/or technical account management experience in mobile, video, online advertising and ad technology with a proven successful track record. You will need to have well-established contacts across the main agency groups in Singapore and in the SEA region. The right candidate must also have experience working in a platform or demand generation role with Ad Exchanges, DSPs/SSPs, Ad Networks, digital advertising agencies or ad servers.  Responsibilities Own and manage demand book of business, including achieving and surpassing revenue targets Develop and execute plans to drive deep engagement, especially with key strategic relationships Proactively identify customer engagement opportunities to ensure strategic alignment and to achieve revenue growth, including conducting recurring meetings via phone and in-person, and preparing/delivering quarterly business reviews Identify opportunities for upsell and cross sell products including private marketplaces, ad exchange, mobile, video and supply side platform Serve as internal advocate for clients by identifying common needs/opportunities across portfolio of clients to develop product roadmap for demand partners Develop and maintain a deep technical understanding of the client's monetization suite of products and how demand partners can most effectively engage with those various products Represent the company at trade-shows and other industry events  Requirements Strong network of local and regional demand relationships and knowledge of the online media business and technology landscape in region Experience in growing a book of business with a history of managing strategic relationships, and attaining and surpassing revenue goals Practical “hands-on” experience interacting with clients using advertising products and technology Familiarity with CRM, analytics tools, incident tracking systems (ex: SFDC, MMX, Tableau, JIRA) Clear understanding of both the business as well as the technology of digital advertising relating to display, mobile, or video with focus on account management, trafficking, ad ops, platform/inventory management, media planning/buying, or similar experience
industries: Staffing and Recruiting

description: About Us  At WeWork, we provide inspiring and flexible workplace solutions to help businesses – small, medium or large – thrive in more than 150 cities globally. The future of work is happening right now, and we are leading this moment. United by a common purpose, here we will empower tomorrow’s world at work. Join us on our journey as we give our members the freedom and support to push boundaries in their industries, and work to redefine our own.  About The Role  This position will serve in the front-line of the sales process. This client-facing role will assist in driving revenue growth by filling the top-of-funnel sales pipeline with qualified leads. This individual will be responsible for working within a Sales Development team, sitting within the wider Inside Sales team, to achieve both personal and team sales goals for their assigned Territory or Region.  As a successful Sales Development Representative you will be expected to: Nurture, develop, and handoff leads that result in qualified opportunities to the Sales team Own a territory and be responsible for driving qualified tours and handoffs to accelerate sales performance Own the sales process: contact identification, lead qualification, prospecting, pipeline building and opportunity identification Work with automation platforms to efficiently input and track data Execute strategy and process implemented by Inside Sales Leadership Be a positive WeWork brand ambassador and effectively communicate our value proposition to prospects Provide unmatched customer service to potential prospects to ensure an excellent start to their member experience Experience And Requirements Bachelor’s Degree At least 6 months of professional experience in sales or related industry Experience in working and thriving in a fast paced environment Track record of sales in cold calling and emailing are helpful Comfortable using marketing automation platforms and CRM – Salesforce experience highly desirable Demonstrated experience in prospecting, developing and handing off sales Experience in customer service and relationship building are highly desirable Experience working on a team and leading a team player mentality Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills Fluent verbal and written English, and a second language of written and verbal Bahasa Indonesia is an added advantage to support Indonesia market that speak Bahasa dominantly Exceptional organization skills and multi-tasking skill Life At WeWork  Being a WeWorker is more than just a job. We believe the magic of work is sparked by the passion you bring, the places you go, the people you meet and the purpose you follow. And it starts here. Here you will brush shoulders with those who dare to dream and do. Here you will be welcomed by a diverse community that embraces and inspires you—because together we can achieve more. Here we challenge ideas, and explore new ways of getting things done. Whether you are part of our Employee Community Groups, or part of a global project, we ask you to bring your open-minded attitude and collaborative spirit. In return, you will be part of a team where your unique perspectives are celebrated.  WeWork is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon gender, sexual orientation, marital or civil status, pregnancy (or pregnancy-related conditions), gender identity or expression, transgender status or gender reassignment, race, color, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, age, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including genetic testing and characteristics), military or veteran status, or any other grounds or characteristic that is protected under the law.
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

General creative tips and best practices 6. Bidding/Budget/targeting recommendations 7. Communicate top-up/budget increase with advertisers and encourage them to increase investment on TikTok ads. 8. Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution, or must have reached college level with at least 2 years of prior work experience in a BPO and/or captive service organizations 3. Experience working in a fast-paced, client-facing technical service environment supporting web-based products 6. Fluency in Bahasa and / or Tagalog will be advantageous for purposes of working with regional advertisers based in Malaysia and Philippines markets

description: Who we are:  Bean Media Group is a thriving media company with global headquarters in Sydney, Australia, and offices in Stockholm, India, Singapore, and Manila. We produce The CEO Magazine, a leading, global, luxury, digital business magazine.  The role:  The CEO Magazine is seeking vibrant, highly motivated and driven individuals that have a desire to learn and join our journey as a Media Sales Manager in our highly driven sales team. The role involves selling advertising space into our digital magazines throughout Asia. You will spend your days speaking with senior executives on the phone, gaining unrivalled exposure to a whole new network of game changers and decision makers from all industries.  Responsibilities include:  Achieve sales revenue of $20,000USD or above per month. Meet key activity and productivity metrics, including an average of 40 calls per day or 1 hour, 30 minutes dedicated to phone calls throughout the workday. Build and maintain strong, effective client relationships via engaging phone conversations. Accurately maintain and input sales data into Salesforce daily. Maintain the productivity spreadsheet with accurate daily activities. Respond promptly to customers enquiries and effectively handle any customer complaints as they arise. Continually pursue and develop new business opportunities. Attend weekly sales meetings with the Regional Sales Manager – Asia & Greater China to communicate pending sales. Build brand awareness and act as a Brand Ambassador for The CEO Magazine. Maintain a strong level of awareness of the economic & commercial market. Possess a desire to continually learn and adapt to new skills, sales techniques and ways of working. Live and breathe our values of Passion, Accountability and Creativity & Innovation!  Skills required:  Fluent in English and/or Mandarin languages, highly desirable. 1 - 2 years of sales experience, with experience working to KPIs in a high pressure sales environment. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. An impressive telephone manner (interesting tonality, clear mature sound, etc.) Outstanding time management and organisational skills. The ability to maintain the accuracy of a CRM/database by inputting data correctly and efficiently. A positive attitude, self-motivation, and a natural persistence. Ability to work well autonomously and as part of a team. Confidence in speaking with senior executives of large international companies. Able to handle constructive feedback from external and internal stakeholders. A hunger to learn, you enjoy being mentored and constantly seek improvement and ways to develop yourself.  What's in it for you?  Good base salary package with uncapped commission! Work in our fantastic office in Singapore from 9:00am to 5:30pm. Monthly team events and employee awards. Working from home options available when you pass your six month probationary period.  How to apply:  As part of the recruitment process, we require you to upload a copy of your CV when submitting your application.  Applicants must be Singaporean or Permanent Residents of Singapore. We do not offer any work visas.  This role requires working from our Singapore office five days per week (given Covid 19 rules and regulations) for the first six months of employment.
industries: Publishing

jobTitle: Key Account Business Development Manager, APAC
description: Role Purpose:   Responsible for sourcing and qualifying new accounts that have the potential growth and business use case match to Jumio’s service offerings. The Business Development Manager role will work closely with the Account Executive team to achieve business revenue targets from the identified key accounts.    Role Value:   The Key Account Business Development Manager plays a vital role in identifying and qualifying companies across the various industry sectors who are looking towards digital transformation of their business and would have a need for identity verification services to support their online customer acquisition strategies.    Responsibilities:  Prospecting, educating and qualifying contacts - build a solid understanding of the industry in order to spark meaningful conversations.  Research prospective company’s background and prepare Jumio business pitch Engage new prospective client account’s contacts to establish connection Research Industry news / development to identify new target accounts Build PPT / Messaging on Tailored Value Proposition Represent Jumio in Industry Associations to network for new business Maintain key accounts from list (In collaboration with Jumio Account Executive) Working alongside Marketing to support the Account Executives on outbound strategies. Providing detailed information to the Account Executives to enable more productive follow-up meetings. Helping to spread awareness of special events/ projects e.g. blog posts, webinars, press releases etc.   Experience and Qualifications:  Degree educated Experience selling into the APAC market - ideally including relevant verticals such as Financial Services, Gaming, Sharing Economy or Mobility  Proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.  Hands on experience with multiple prospecting techniques e.g. videos, social outreach etc.  A solid grounding in technology or engineering - comfortable understanding and conveying technical concepts and information   Great to have Experience and Qualifications:   Experience using Outreach Existing industry knowledge would be a strong asset  Key Characteristics and Attitudes:  In a recent global survey these attributes were valued by Jumios in all locations and functions - we firmly believe in hiring for attitude as well as skill.   Friendly and supportive Adaptable and flexible Articulate and persuasive Industry Knowledge of Online Identity Verification Curious and coachable Commercially Aware Resilient and tenacious Big picture and the detail  Jumio Values:   IDEAL: Integrity, Diversity, Empowerment, Accountability, Leading Innovation  Progression:  This position offers lots of opportunities to learn and to gain experience in this field. After having gained a good understanding of this role, there are several ways to progress to other roles such as ISR and on to Account Executive or Management roles.   @Work:  Jumio Singapore office is located at Centennial Tower. It is the APAC headquarters comprising a small team of energetic, motivated staff members across sales, consulting, marketing functions. It is a friendly, social culture where everyone comes together to celebrate each other’s success and provide support in resolving challenges.  Honest Positive Knowledgeable Caring Listening Energy  Company:  Jumio is the future for online and mobile ID verification. We are the largest and fastest growing company in the ID verification space. With a global footprint, we’re expanding the team to meet strong client demand across a range of industries including Financial Services, Travel, Sharing Economy, Fintech, Gaming, and others.   Equal Opportunities:  Jumio is a collaboration of people with different ideas, strengths, interests and cultures. We welcome applications and colleagues from all backgrounds and of all statuses.
industries: Computer Software

A job with a purpose!  Market for Good is the first online B2B marketplace for sustainable impact supporting the United Nations Social Development Goals. This unique platform helps companies to implement their ESG goals, and measure their impact in every purchase and over time.  The Primary Roles Of The Account Manager Are To Position Market for Good as the leading platform for sustainable impact, top provider of gifts, products and, services with a social cause for corporates capture new business accounts and maintain existing customers nurture them into long-term business relationships with some targeted as key accounts develop these key accounts into sustainable high revenue annuity businesses Other Roles And Responsibilities Include  Roles & Responsibilities  Business Development Know the market and environment – trends, opportunities, competition, government regulations on the environment and sustainability etc Identify and target selected potential customers as agreed with Dagiz management Know the targeted accounts – their business needs for corporate gifts and services Identify the targeted accounts as key accounts Develop business plan for each key account and update / calendarize the plan on an-going basis of the ecosystem – customers, beneficiaries, business partners, relevant government agencies, suppliers of services etc Sales Engage with the customers to convert their needs into sales Be creative and agile in meeting customers’ requests especially for special events Work and communicate with the internal team and business partners to make the sales happen, including cross-selling and up-selling and any challenges faced Ensure end-to-end sales completion from order to cash with on-time delivery and quality service Capture the sales into the CRM system Perform sales analysis to gain insights, trends and needs of customers Performance Management Achieve the KPIs (Key Performance Indicators) as measured by and agreed with Dagiz management Solicit customer feedback of Dagiz’s services annually Your performance will be reviewed half-yearly Other Responsibilities You are required to keep the company and customers information confidential unless the information is in public domain You are required to protect and enhance the company’s reputation You will be assigned any other responsibilities as required in carrying out your work Requirements Excellent communication skills Personable, creative, resourceful and strong problem-solving skills Proven sales track record Proficiency in English Relevant market knowledge Communication and negotiation skills Ability to build rapport

jobTitle: SVP Sales & Marketing, South East Asia & Indian Subcontinent
description: Company Description  At Toll, we do more than just logistics - we move the businesses that move the world. Our 20,000 team members can help solve any logistics, transport or supply chain challenge – big or small. We have been supporting our customers for more than 130 years. Today, we support more than 20,000 customers worldwide with 500 sites in 25 countries, and a forwarding network spanning 150 countries. We are proudly part of Japan Post — www.tollgroup.com  Global Forwarding delivers cargo across our global network via road, rail, sea, and air. From loose cartons for consolidation and palletised cargo to moving dangerous goods and bulk commodities, we have the experience, the infrastructure, and the global network to get freight moving – across towns, across countries and across continents.  Job Description  This role oversees the entire Sales & Marketing strategies and business development on Freight within the SEA-ISC Region. This role will manage the sales teams (through matrix reporting lines) and develop key processes and procedures to deliver business intelligence, drive our CRM strategy, and develop sales content and related tools to ensure our Sales teams have the resources to meet their goals and enhance overall sales effectiveness. The role will maximize profitability by reviewing, developing and linking sales sources, market trends, cost allocation and the company’s capabilities.  Qualifications  Technical Strategic thinking and strong networking abilities Knowledge of global freight forwarding operations and markets Strong selling & presentation skills based on solid experience in working in a diverse cultural environment\ Demonstrated critical thinking, using logic and reasoning to identify strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and risks, and identifying alternative solutions or approaches Good negotiation skills to close contracts with customers Business Air freight industry experience Ocean freight industry experience Marketing & Sales Management Experience(s) Commercially focused & result orientated Strong analytical skills and sensible to market trends Innovative Human Relations Good communication skills Strong interpersonal skills and able to build respectful relationship with all levels of people Team building & encourage collaboration Good leader and influence behaviours Supportive and ability to provide mentoring / training. Additional Information  Be Connected  With a bold vision and innovative drive, join our 44,000 colleagues as we lead industry change and transform how customers best meet their global supply chain needs in a meaningful and sustainable way. There are countless opportunities to learn and make a real impact in shaping our industry’s future. Grow with diverse challenges amongst a friendly and inclusive global culture. Take pride in building relationships that matter, because being connected is at the centre of what makes Toll great – it’s what makes our possibilities endless.  Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality, built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages, genders and abilities.  To find out more about us visit www.tollgroup.com/careers  To be considered, you must be entitled to work in the specified country and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical assessment.
industries: Logistics and Supply Chain, Financial Services, and Transportation/Trucking/Railroad

description: Job Description Summary  The Services Growth Manager, ASEAN is a key leadership role that will be responsible for driving growth and ensuring the financial performance of the Ultrasound Services segment, a high double-digit growth segment. In this role, you will lead product positioning, market segmentation, new offerings development and launch, as well as installed base marketing. To be successful in the role, you should demonstrate an ability to identify market trends and customer needs, as well as possess a track record in leading demand generation and funnel acceleration activities. The role reports to the ASEAN Services Growth Director. GE Healthcare is a leading global medical technology and digital solutions innovator. Our mission is to improve lives in the moments that matter. Unlock your ambition, turn ideas into world-changing realities, and join an organization where every voice makes a difference, and every difference builds a healthier world.  Job Description  Key Responsibilities  Product & Market Expertise Formulate and implement solid strategies and differentiation to secure profitable services business growth for the Ultrasound portfolio Plan the launch of new service offerings and solution, manage the cross-functional and wing-to-wing roll-out of the plan Lead new business initiatives – provide ASEAN input, develop business case justification for new service offerings and/or upgrades from concept stage, to test/prototype, launch planning and roll-out. This will be done in conjunction with collaboration with Global teams, Modality, commercial excellence and commercial operation team Responsible for ensuring country commercial teams have the right tools and training to sell -- interface with Global and regional counterparts to share and gain best practices, adapting training material, brochures and other sales tools to local market needs as necessary Own the success of Ultrasound Services portfolio Monitor and drive improvements for key metrics such as capture rates, profitability, installed base growth and $ per installed base, influencing countries to strive for improvement Own the growth of the Ultrasound Services Contract business by developing market suitable offerings including market opportunity prioritization, opportunity mining, market/competitive analysis Collaborate with Inside Sales Leader to drive towards alternative, more efficient way of contract renewal, conversion and win back Conceptualize and launch demand generation programs for on demand services leveraging digital ecommerce platform Drive the options and upgrades portfolio to drive potential lifecycle solutions to add value to customers Work closely with the product/modality teams to drive improvement in Point of Sale attachment for service contracts as well as support their market share gain programs Build and sustain relationships with key channel partners in the region and ensure execution of strategy via the partners including training, launching incentives and various marketing programs in collaboration with them. Own the short- and longer-term business planning activities related to the portfolio. Build the growth strategy story and engage in dialogues with senior leaders to share the same and drive alignment. Ensure suitable stocking/inventory management for portfolio Collaborate closely to launch key new 3rd party adjacent solutions in the portfolio & ensure strategic alignment to core portfolio for the GTM.  Preferred Qualifications    MBA or Master’s degree in Marketing, Business Administration or related field 7-10 years’ experience in marketing, product marketing or related field Proven commercial experience driving sales for a portfolio Channel partner management experience Healthcare product/industry acumen, ideally in related product segments Innovation – develop new ideas through collaboration and execute on creative ideas being comfortable with ambiguity Influencing skills – ability to motivate individuals and demonstrate organizational influence Excellent oral and written communications skills Team oriented – ability to motivate and work well with diverse, cross-functional Teams Strong analytical and process skills Strong in MS Office Suite especially MS Excel and MS Powerpoint  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  Ourtotal rewardsare designed to unlock your ambition by giving you the boost and flexibility you need to turn your ideas into world-changing realities. Our salary and benefits are everything you’d expect from an organization with global strength and scale, and you’ll be surrounded by career opportunities in a culture that fosters care, collaboration and support.    Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Description  At Amazon, we are working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you would like to help us build our Public Sector team in Singapore, then this is your chance to make history.  The Public Sector Global Lead Development Team is expanding in Singapore! As a Lead Development Representative (LDR) covering the Singapore market, you will be an important member of the account management organization, playing a critical role in qualifying leads, profiling customers and providing input on which lead development campaigns generate the best leads. Working in collaboration with your global peers, marketing, account managers and the partner channel, your primary objective is to identify and create qualified opportunities for the team you support. Quite often you will be the customer’s very first introduction to the AWS experience!  The Successful Candidate Will Manage inbound and outbound leads to meet SLAs Conduct discussions with prospects and existing customers over the phone to identify and qualify opportunities Understand customer pain points, gather technical requirements and correlate business value to customer needs Generate interest and provide vision of the portfolio of AWS solutions to potential customers Understand existing and developing technologies as it relates to cloud computing Achieve monthly qualification goals Update and maintain customer information within SalesForce.com Provide account management team with detailed call notes to ensure the opportunity is understood and next steps are clearly defined Present a high level, technical solution to diverse audiences relevant to target industry or market  Basic Qualifications  BASIC QUALIFICATIONS University Degree or equivalent experience Fluent in English and other languages native to the geography you support Excellent time management. Ability to multi-task and manage high volume of leads Experience using a CRM/Customer Relationship Management tools (preferably Salesforce & Tableau) 2+ years prospecting & cold calling for new sales business  Preferred Qualifications  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Target orientated, ambitious, creative, customer focused Working knowledge of emerging technologies, especially as it relates to Iaas, PaaS, and SaaS. Technical interest with 1-2 years or more of experience in IT prospecting or business development in technology business Track record of meeting and exceeding established business goals Excellent written and verbal communication skills Self-starter with highly developed interpersonal skills and organizational skills, decisive and result oriented who is prepared to work in a fast-paced, demanding environment Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.   Company - Amazon Web Services Singapore  Job ID: A1753670
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

description: What’s in it for you? World-class training through our Sales Academy when you join and on-going training from our L&D team and sales leadership Unlimited advancement potential as a sales professional or progression into people leadership Unmatched resources to support your success Inclusive environment with great balance for personal and family life Generous compensation including uncapped commission, accelerators, bonuses & incentive trips About The Team  Our diverse sales team is one with a track record of continuous learning and overachievement. 46% of our sales associates achieved our annual sales recognition trip, Winner’s Circle, in 2019 and 18% were promoted to new roles. Most people leaders have been promoted internally and have delivered great success as an individual contributor in the past. They’re hands-on and enjoy working through challenging client scenarios alongside their team!  What You Need To Be Successful  We’re a traits-based organization that seeks diverse talent to best meet our clients’ needs. We look for sales professionals with strong executive presence, intrinsic drive, natural curiosity and coachability. The experience level we look for is as follows: 5-8 years of consultative, B2B sales experience Experience prospecting to the C-Suite and senior-level leadership of enterprise businesses Quick learning attributes that enable you to pivot and work through ambiguity Ability to demonstrate strong sales process and strategies Track record of over achievement on goals or quotas Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s or advanced degree is a plus Who are we?  Gartner delivers actionable, objective insight to executives and their teams. Our expert guidance and tools enable faster, smarter decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s most critical priorities. We’ve grown exponentially since our founding in 1979 and we're proud to have nearly 16,000 associates globally that support our 14,000+ clients in more than 100 countries .  What makes Gartner a great place to work?  Our teams are composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations. We believe that a variety of experiences makes us stronger—as individuals, as communities and as an organization. That’s why we're recognized worldwide as a great place to work year after year. We've been recognized by Fortune as one of the World’s Most Admired Companies, named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality by the Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index and a Best Place to Work for Disability Inclusion by the Disability Equality Index. Looking for a place to turn your big ideas into reality? Join #LifeAtGartner  What We Offer  Our people are our most valuable asset, so we invest in them from Day 1. When you join our team, you’ll have access to a vast array of benefits to help you live your life well. These resources are designed to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being. We encourage continued personal and professional growth through ongoing learning and development opportunities. Our employee resource groups, charity match and volunteer programs keep you connected to your internal Gartner community and causes that matter to you.  The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.  Gartner is committed to being an Equal Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers, including job seekers with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Company’s career webpage as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by calling Human Resources at 203-964-0096 or by sending an email to ApplicantAccommodations@gartner.com .  Job Requisition ID:60238  By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you have read and agree to the country or regional recruitment notice linked below applicable to your place of residence.  Gartner Applicant Privacy Link: https://jobs.gartner.com/applicant-privacy-policy  For efficient navigation through the application, please only use the back button within the application, not the back arrow within your browser.

jobTitle: Strategy and Operations Lead, News Partnerships
description: Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.  Due to the current health crisis related to COVID-19 and the escalating visa/travel restrictions in place, we're currently unable to extend offers to anyone who cannot work from Singapore due to lockdown visa/travel restrictions, or other restrictive measures until further notice. Consequently, we will be prioritizing candidates who can start in this location by set date as expected. We're keeping the situation under review and would adjust our position should the restrictive measures be removed later on.  Minimum qualifications: 9 years of experience including management consulting, corporate strategy, global business operations, chief of staff or equivalent. Experience building and executing processes that support launching products, managing sales pipelines, and building/managing new organizations. Experience in analytics (strategic thinking, data analysis, forecasting, research), problem solving and quantitative modeling.  Preferred qualifications: Master's degree in a Business-related field. Experience in the technology industry. Experience influencing senior stakeholders in a matrixed organization. Experience with sales, partnerships and/or business development organizations. Communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.  About The Job  News Partnerships (NP) manages partnerships for Google’s News’ products and programs. These partnerships take many forms - premium content licensing, product integrations, consultative engagements to Digitally Transform, or running innovation workshops to develop new solutions with the Industry.  Strategy and Operations works with NP’s leadership team to develop partnership strategies, build and align operating priorities, and drive global execution. We are critical thinkers, influencers, and leaders with expertise in simplifying complexity and managing scaled programs at pace.  You are an outstanding Strategy and Operations practitioner who will partner with NP’s APAC team to help set strategy. You will work closely with the NP APAC leadership team to develop partnership strategies for our products and programs with the news industry.  In order to deliver on these goals, you will be comfortable doing many things in parallel - running the operations for a program, thinking critically about strategic issues, structuring ambiguity, framing key decisions, and building consensus around them, and generally being a strategic thought partner to Executive Leaders playing both the role of advocate and challenger.  Google’s Global Partnerships team works with a wide range of partners to bring the best of Google to power their business. The team partners with Publishers and App Developers of all sizes to promote their ad inventory, working with Google's broad range of partner solutions including AdSense, AdMob and Google Ad Manager, across mobile, display, and video formats, helping our partners and their audiences get the most out of the web. In addition, the Partnerships team supports Google’s own product teams with essential partnerships to help power Google’s user experiences in search, maps, travel, shopping, payments and more.  Responsibilities  Provide day-to-day strategy and operations support to the NP leaders and their teams across multiple product areas. Deliver thought leadership and strategic guidance on specific topics (e.g. partnership strategy, go-to-market strategy, negotiation strategy) and collaborate with the broader NP team and other Product and Program Leads on news efforts. Create clear, simple, and persuasive narratives to inform and influence senior-level executives. Drive operational excellence to support execution of the highest priority partnership goals, including but not limited to project prioritization, resource planning and allocation, and cross-functional coordination. Build consensus and alignment across region and global teams, as well as critical cross-functional stakeholders in other teams (e.g. Policy, Communications, Marketing).  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
industries: Information Services and Internet

jobTitle: Entry Level - Junior Brand Marketing and Sales
description: Just graduated? Looking for a stepping stone into a new career?   Category: Business. Entrepreneurship. Sales. Marketing. Mentorship. Hard-work  A business that is build with the basis of sales. Selling your smile, your product, your personality. We aim to create a record breaking revenue for the clients, smashing the sales figures with quality. A guaranteed-return-on-investment!   Be The Best Bet!  We are looking for the next business minded individuals with the heart to learn and grow with us!   Role:  (1) Face to Face Sales & Marketing - Approaching Businesses  (2) Create a lasting impact on customer & Follow-ups (3) Coordinate Meetings; Trainings  Requirement  (1) Good Learning Attitude  (2) Good Fighting Spirit  (3) Humbleness & Drive   Incentives (1) Fast Tracked Career Progression (2) Self Discovery  (3) High Potential Weekly Income

We are looking for Sales and Marketing Associates that can help tackle our client’s business problems, while learning the skills to grow your career. You’ll get to work in diverse and nimble team where you have a say and can make a difference. WHO YOU ARE (We like this!) Willing and Coachable. You’re open to new ideas and trying things out to see what works and what doesn’t.  You love feedback, make smart adjustments based off it, and realize that is the main way you can improve at what you do.  You are self-aware. Enjoys building relationships. You’ve been able to handle the jive and deal with all types of people. Passionate. Whatever you love, you can talk for hours on it. You get excited when someone mentions your favourite things. Optimistic and Resilient. You know after a “No” there could be a “Yes”, and negative responses don’t bring you down. You are the king/queen of follow up and always work hard. Creative. You challenge the way people think and look for better and more efficient ways of doing things Great Communicator. You are concise and can also explain intricate details in a simple and easy to understand way. Curious. You are a sponge and learning is fun to you. You ask lots of questions and want to develop your skill-set and knowledge base. WHO YOU ARE NOT (We don’t like this so much…) Someone who requires hand-holding. You should be able to think for yourself and be able to make decisions - even if they don’t have the outcome you were expecting. You learn from those mistakes. Rigid. You can adapt to whatever is thrown at you and think change is fun. You operate well in a fast-paced environment and are a self-starter. Someone who is not interested in sales for the foreseeable future. You are ready to grow your career, and while you may not be in sales for the rest of your life, you see this role as a stepping stone, not a placeholder. Average. You have grit. You set an internal quota higher than the one we give. You fail. A lot. But it’s because you set your goals high and push yourself hard. RESPONSIBILITY & OBJECTIVE (Prospect & Follow-up) Make a good first impression and be initial point of contact with prospects Generate interest, respond, engage, and qualify leads to create sales-ready opportunities Hold engaging conversations through face to face meetings, outbounds calls, email, and social mediums Be able to react to and overcome objections and competitive questions You’ll be expected to work your territory weekday business hours of 830am-5pm, but we’re flexible for those dentist appointments. We provide the opportunity to occasionally travel to attend networking events and workshops, so pack your bags. We promise to help you build your skills and foundation in sales to provide value for the rest of your career.  You’ll use our own tool to make you marketable and develop your talent for your next role.
industries: Marketing and Advertising

description: At Blackpanda, our sales team is the engine that drives our success. We are seeking a motivated Sales Analyst with a love for tech to help us drive growth across Asia. This is a role which will balance both strategic and operational responsibilities – you will think big picture and also roll-up your sleeves to drive execution of strategic initiatives.  The Sales Analyst will enable the driving of growth of a wide variety of cybersecurity proactive defense services and products as well as cyber resiliency solutions, while helping to position Blackpanda as the premier cybersecurity Digital Forensics and Incident Response team in Asia. The right candidate will possess excellent energy and enthusiasm with a desire to build business across a portfolio of accounts, as well as be capable to manage sales operations, assist in building forecasts, and meet target projections.  Applicants must be based in Hong Kong or Singapore with long-term plans to reside and stay in the city.  Roles and Responsibilities Play a pivotal role in strategic initiatives to accelerate sales and growth, ensuring progress against business objectives Support new growth opportunities for Blackpanda and contribute to the development of associated business cases Set individual and company sales targets with the executive leadership team Track sales goals and report results to executive leadership Coordinate with Marketing on lead generation and service support Coordinate with the Revenue team on channel sales development Understand our ideal customers and how they relate to our product / services Represent the organization and its products / services Support other company personnel and projects, as necessary  Qualifications and Experience This is an entry level position, 2-3 years in tech preferred but not required Ability to learn CRM & connected planning systems, developing systems and process across the organization Knowledge of consulting business models and associated KPIs Ability to work within a multi-national sales team Extroverted, positive attitude with a drive to build relationships Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English Based in Hong Kong or Singapore with long-term plans to remain in the region Bachelor’s degree in a related field Cantonese or Mandarin language skills a plus  Benefits Possible equity awards based on performance Annual bonus based on performance Sales commission program participation Future relocation opportunities to your office of choice Enrollment in the company health plan Future travel and training opportunities Due to the volume of applicants, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. We appreciate your understanding.  BLACKPANDA is Asia’s premier cyber security incident response group, hyper-focused on digital forensics and cyber crisis response. Our team consists of an elite cadre of risk and security experts from International military special forces, intelligence, forensics and law enforcement backgrounds. We are highly trained, ready to respond to and help manage crises on short notice, when and wherever needed.   www.blackpanda.com | hello@blackpanda.com

Our ideal candidate  You are a giver, problem solver, listener, and persuasive communicator.  You are a proactive self-starter, always looking to test new strategies to convert leads..  Your experience in B2B technical sales will be highly valuable.  You are empathetic and dependable. Clients must develop great confidence in our ability to deliver on their expectations effectively and in a timely manner.  You are detail oriented - delving into client concerns and addressing them down to the smallest details.  You are organized, working comfortably on dozens of prospects at a time.  You genuinely like people and enjoy collaborating across service functions.  How This Role Drives Positive Impact  You will be growing and onboarding an expanding pool of ecommerce companies and linking their business processes to impact organisations around the world. Impact starts with you.  These organisations are protecting and enriching the lives of vulnerable communities, cleaning the seas, and regenerating critical ecosystems.  Regenerative business makes economic sense for your clients too, so you will be truly working at the leading edge of shaping a healthier, planet-positive economy.  Job Responsibilities Grow an international portfolio of e-commerce clients. Analyse competitors' activities and industry trends. Understand client behaviours, psychology and how to generate new needs. Lead demos on video calls or face to face. Provide an outstanding client onboarding experience. Work closely with the Marketing team to implement e-commerce initiatives and marketing campaigns. Work closely with the Customer Success and the Product teams to ensure an exceptional user experience; implement systematic feedback loops and shape new product development. Build rapport and good business relationships with customers and portray good company image. Be the voice of the client, building positive long-term relationships. Minimum Requirements Excellent presentation and verbal and written communication skills in English. Represent the company’s core values. Excellent listening and problem solving abilities. Team player. Experienced with CRM software. Preferred Requirements BA degree in Management, Social Sciences, Data Science, Communication, or relevant fields. Singaporean Citizen or PR preferred. Tech savvy. Existing network of sustainability e-stores. Proficiency with one or several SEA languages.

Our headquarter is based in Shanghai and we have operations across the world such as in New York, San Francisco, London, Singapore, Taiwan, and Hong Kong. This will be done by developing an appropriate level of communication with clients and internal team members to better understand and mitigate any issues the customers may face. Company Overview Our client, an international company with a diverse range of areas covering Fibre-Optic, Power Cable, Construction and Maintenance, Financial Service, Capital Investment, Information Technology and Tourism. It has 80 wholly owned companies and holding companies (some are listed on various Stock Exchanges: Shanghai, Singapore, Hong Kong and Indonesia) with 10 manufacturing overseas facilities based in Africa, Europe, South America, South Africa, South Asia and Southeast Asia. As well as sales offices in over 30 countries and regions around the world supplying products to over 130 countries. It is the largest Optical Fibre and Power Cable manufacturer in China and the second largest in the world. It is also the largest Optical Fibre communication producer globally. Successful previous experience as a sales representative or sales manager or market related within that sector Committed to continuous education through workshops, seminars and conferences Demonstrated ability to communicate, present and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization Experience with international bandwidth sales would be beneficial Hard working and able to work autonomously  Strong business sense and industry expertise Attention to detail with genuine care and pride for what they do
