jobTitle: Regional Account Manager (Position located in Singapore)
description: KnowBe4, Inc. is the provider of the world's largest security awareness training and simulated phishing platform. KnowBe4 enables organizations to manage the ongoing problem of social engineering by helping them train employees to make smarter security decisions, every day. Tens of thousands of organizations worldwide use KnowBe4’s platform to mobilize their end users as a last line of defense and enable them to make better security decisions, every day.  We have ranked a best place to work for women, millennials, and in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine as well as #1 or #2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last six years.  Please submit your resume in English.  To learn more about our team and office culture in Singapore, visit the following links.  Careers Page: https://www.knowbe4.com/careers/locations/singapore  Glassdoor: https://www.glassdoor.com/Location/KnowBe4-Singapore-Location-EI_IE969384.0,7_IL.8,17_IC3235921.htm  The Regional Account Manager position is responsible for managing the customer accounts in their assigned territory and maximizing all sales opportunities within those accounts. More specifically, this position will be charged with promoting and selling KnowBe4’s products and services to small and medium sized businesses (organizations with 101 - 999 employees), with the objective to achieve and exceed monthly sales quota. This can be achieved by targeting new business as well as reactivating dark (lapsed) customer accounts.  Responsibilities Promote and sell KnowBe4’s range of products and services Identify and close net new customers in the assigned territory Build and maintain pipeline of potential customers by developing and managing relationships with prospects Forecast new business prospects that result in successful client relationships and sales Identify key decision makers while developing and qualifying new business opportunities within the targeted markets through cold calling, networking and high-level prospecting Articulate the value proposition of KnowBe4’s products and help the customer understand how it will improve their business’s security awareness training (and security overall) Achieve or exceed monthly quotas and/or targets established by KnowBe4 Be well versed in KnowBe4’s product offerings and promote the products and services at trade shows as requested Follow up on marketing leads to generate new sales opportunities and pipeline Act strategically in offering free templates or negotiating discounted pricing, in line with established policies and procedures Maintain accurate and thorough records for customer calls, emails, notes, tasks, demos and other relevant information in compliance with the Administration Policy Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree a plus Proven track record in sales 3 years selling software to Small Medium Enterprise Familiarity with standard concepts, practices and procedures within the IT Security Field Experience with Salesforce and Gmail Network or Security Plus preferred Excellent verbal and written communications Stats driven business professional Motivated, energetic self-starter Strong collaborative and teamwork skills Must be able to work with minimum supervision Note: An applicant assessment and background check may be part of your hiring procedure.  Individuals seeking employment at KnowBe4 are considered without prejudice to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please visit www.knowbe4.com/careers/request-accommodation.  No recruitment agencies, please.

Understanding organization mission/vision and demonstrate organization values through self. Expand sales in existing customers and distribution partners while actively looking for new customer generation. Maintains intense market knowledge of competitors and market gaps. jobTitle: Business Development Manager, Global Accounts & Solutions
description: About Asendia  Asendia empowers businesses to grow across borders with a range of international e-commerce and mail delivery services. Launched in 2012 by La Poste and Swiss Post, Asendia has the combined expertise of over 1,500 employees across 4 continents. With opera­tions across the world, we bring together a wealth of international and local expertise, and a network that delivers to over 200 countries and territories. Asendia’s heritage as a mail busi­ness is unrivalled, but today we are also at the forefront in providing e-commerce par­cel solutions for e-tailers selling internationally. We provide a number of value added services too, including returns, fulfilment and let­tershop, and we have acquired a number of companies to enhance our ser­vices, including eShopWorld a global e-commerce software business.  About The Role  Business Development Manager, Global Accounts & Solutions  As Business Development Manager, you will work for the Asendia Group as a member of the Global Accounts & Solutions. This is a key role with responsi­bility for retaining and developing some of our most important clients in the APAC region. You will support our end-to-end sales process by analysing business performance, forecasting, and assist with business planning and budgeting. This role will give you the opportunity to work with all of our global subsidiaries and several key stakeholders across a fast-growing business. Strong focus and permanent development on cross-border e-commerce market and logistics solutions shall strengthen the relationship with customers.  About Your Tasks You are the main representative of the GAS team in the APAC region and work closely with and also the key connector to the Global GAS Team in Europe Headquar-ters to set-up the new cross-border commercial products for the existing and new customers in the APAC region. With strong understanding of the European and Asian customers’ behaviours of eCommerce products, together with the respective Market Research teams in the Euro-pean Headquarters, to complete specific market researches and shape the commercial strategy of the Global Accounts & Solutions teams, that targets to attract potential customers in APAC countries, especially in Singapore, Southeast Asia, China and Hong Kong. You are the key contact to the local sales teams in Asendia APAC entities to deliver right service & propo-sitions to customers, and also responsible for onboarding new global accounts for the Group in APAC region. You build strong relationship with subsidiaries and key stakeholders across the business (e.g. finance, solutions and commercial functions) so that you are able to support on the account management of our global accounts. You will take ownership of the GAS team sales pipeline and ensure follow up is done on the opportunities to en-sure successful conversation. You are required to initiate new business opportunities together with the commercial GAS teams situated in different regions and bringing these opportunities between APAC countries and other regions. About Your Profile 5+ years experience in a sales or business development role, if possible in the cross-border transport / e-com-merce / logistics sectors. You have great experience in MS office (especially in Excel and Power Point) as well as strong process and data mapping skills & data analysis and market research experiences. Experience in Sugarcrm.com or a simi-lar CRM is a plus. You are a self-motivated, persistent, and flexible person with the capacity to listen and understand customers’ requirements. You are organised, and able to prio-ritise and manage time effectively. Your strong communication skills in English ensure the capability of working with people of various nationa-lities, on varying levels of hierarchy. Business fluency in English language. Additional business fluency in French, German or Dutch is a welcomed asset. Our Facts  Our mission is to excel in every interaction with our customers. Our values are trust, friendliness, ease of use and our commitment to sustainability. Employees wellbeing and corporate social responsibility are at the heart of our core values.  We wish to instill a strong culture of corporate social responsibility within every employee and hope to create a positive and productive environment where employees can thrive. If this sounds like the kind of place you would like to work and the sort of role you are looking for, then get in touch, we are waiting to hear from you. Please send your application in English to: apac.recruitment@asendia.com, reference number “Asendia 21-17”.

Assist in strategic planning and research of potential partners and company profiles Draft proposals to present to prospects Obtain sponsorship fees from potential partners for the various events that Regpac organize Conduct and manage events held Maintain keen interest and awareness of industry trends and emerging market players Be comfortable to pitch to potential clients our core product and services Perform any other duties relative to position as needed or assigned by management Manage the brand, media partnerships and client relationships Requirements 2-5 years of work experience in related field (Regulatory Technologies, Sales) Familiar with the tech and regulatory ecosystem and business Interest in financial technology, regulatory technology field Quick learner and possess strong DB, sales & presentation skills Proactive, think out of the box Good interpersonal skills, people oriented Have an affinity with technology & computer literacy Comfortable to work in a start-up organization Independent and able to self-manage projects Immediate start, commission based Possibility to convert to permanent role

description: 🗺 Company Overview  We’re the #1 peer-to-peer platform for student recruitment - at Unibuddy we believe no one should have to make life’s big decisions alone.  Our technology helps improve the Higher Education recruitment journey by enabling institutions to offer prospective students real human interaction when making the tough and all important decision of where to go to university.  Since launching in 2017, we’ve grown rapidly and now work with over 450 Higher Education institutions in 35 countries worldwide. We’ve raised over $33M from top-tier investors to help fuel our expansion, and achieve our ambitious goal of empowering 10 million students to make the right choices on their Higher Education journey.  We’re now looking to take a huge step forward. We're transforming our product offering. We're changing the student life cycle on a global scale. And we want you to come on board. We're looking for people to help us supercharge our growth, while we continue to embody the values that have helped us reach success so far.  🧗🏾‍♂️ Your Mission  As a higher-education industry expert and our first Business Development Manager based in APAC, you will help drive Unibuddy’s future growth in the APAC region by building relationships with prospective universities and turning them into happy and successful users of Unibuddy.  We’re looking for an energetic and enthusiastic sales executive to join our entrepreneurial team and help accelerate our next phase of growth. Our clients come from all over the world and you will be responsible for developing and securing opportunities across Asia, Australia and New Zealand, working with the rest of the sales team to identify key target regions, sectors and organisations.  As we are a rapidly growing company you will gain exposure to all areas of the business, understanding the key success drivers at an early stage company and gaining invaluable experience for your future career. Success in this role will lead to opportunities for growth across the entire sales team with significant scope for future development.  👩🏻‍🔧 Your day to day tasks will be… Act as an ambassador on behalf of Unibuddy at events and conferences across Asia including, but not limited to Unibuddy’s own, sponsored or partnered events Acquire new Unibuddy university clients to hit/exceed quarterly sales targets through a consultative sales approach Conduct fortnightly 1:1s with regional team members reviewing strategic deals, regional strategy, and coaching around higher ed industry knowledge Support in the generation of a regionally specific higher-ed playbook to aid in the speed and efficiency of rep onboarding and ramp Actively participate in internal discussions around Product and GTM positioning, feeding back customer feedback and challenges of the sales team to the wider organisation Support Customer Success in ‘Land and Expand’ deals, positioning Unibuddy as a strategic partner in their overall strategy Participate in benchmarking activities: evaluating the competitive landscape and helping to inform product roadmap Work with the sales team management to develop and implement an effective sales strategy Effectively manage your pipeline of deals to meet your personal, and the team’s, revenue goals Measure and report on sales metrics and performance to redefine sales outreach best practice Participate in team improvement activities and ongoing sales coaching 👨🏽‍💻This might be for you if… You have experience of closing customer deals in a B2B SaaS sales environment with a demonstrable record of hitting and exceeding your sales targets. Or you have experience in a target driven student recruitment role with a demonstrable record of hitting and exceeding recruitment targets and are motivated to move into a B2B sales role. You have exceptional written and verbal communication skills with experience of consultative sales approaches You have excellent leadership skills to inspire and coach junior sales. Analytical ability and understanding of sophisticated sales processes with a data-driven mindset is essential . You feel at home in a high-growth environment where we don’t know all the answers, but are willing to learn and improve what we do with plenty of opportunities to expand your skills. You are fluent in Mandarin or another Asian Language. If you don't meet all the requirements but think you might still be right for the role, please apply anyway. We're always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.  🎁 What's on offer Competitive salary plus stock options. Highly flexible work culture. This is a remote position in the APAC region, choose where you work. Flexible working hours because life happens! Learning & development budget of £1000 for books, conferences, courses, or any other ways you like to learn! With time in your working week dedicated to development activities. 25 days of annual leave plus 4 additional days for the Christmas break and national holidays. Family friendly policy. Enhanced maternity, paternity and adoption leave. Latest MacBook or PC. Monitor for your home is also provided. Home working setup. If you need a desk, chair, headphones or keyboard & mouse we have you covered. Socials. Company-wide get togethers (or virtual!) on us happens on an annual basis. ✉️ Ready to apply?  Great! Please send a CV and supporting statement which outlines why you would like to work with Unibuddy, and why you are well suited to this role. We encourage you to send us something that showcases your skills!  Not ready to apply or have some questions? Then please get in touch with yasmin.russell@unibuddy.com  Unibuddy is an equal opportunity employer. We're actively looking to increase the diversity of our buddies across the company and we encourage people to apply from minority groups.  🛂Please note that Unibuddy does not sponsor visas for this role.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Singapore based: The Regional Sales Operations role is responsible for the sales operations function within its regional location with Asia-Pacific. Sales operations is a set of business activities and processes that help a sales organization run effectively, efficiently and in support of business strategies and objectives.       Your Opportunity   This business function supports the company's End User Sales and Partner Manager teams works closely with the APAC Sales Operation handling Quote to cash on every opportunities, Deal desk functions and providing meaningful reports to business.   This role requires knowledge and experience in providing analytical reports, Deal desk function, Sales Force application and managing licensing.   The roles main objective is to bring and maintain a system to selling that supports and positively influence the organization behavior of the teams involved in the sales function. In true Blue Prism way this is expected to be achieved through collaboration, teamwork and constant support from teams such as Sales, Finance, Sales enablement and Business development etc. As a member of the APAC Sales Operation team, this role will be constantly supported by peers to learn new skills as the business grows.   Blue Prism is an exciting, fast-paced organization which is growing at an exponential rate with plans to continue this expansion. AS well as being the support of the sales function the key function of this role is collaboration. Therefore, the role requires an energetic and enthusiastic individual, who can embrace fast change with excellent but diplomatic communication skills. Highly organized with good Excel and knowledge and preferably experience of a CRM system and enjoys the reward of their role having direct impact on the success of the company in the region.   Requirements:  Experience of working in a busy sales environment (Sales Operations/Sales Administration) Administration around the Purchase Orders Process Sound understanding of organisational behaviour and culture. Experience in process design and documentation Experience of using a CRM database and finance system. Event Management experience an advantage. Good Excel knowledge      Attributes   Self-motivated, self-sufficient and results orientated. Proactive, reliable, enthusiastic Strong communicator with excellent relationship building skills who has tenacity, ability to influence whilst being diplomatic. Multitasker, juggling multiple projects all of which could have tight deadlines. Creative in problem solving and solution finding. High energy and shows passion and commitment. Credible and have gravitas to deal with C-Suite. Team player Capable to work with lots of different personalities.      Additional information   The role is home based although travel may be required to regional offices and some wider travel will be needed from time to time. Some meeting attendance will be required outside of local time zone. This is to be monitored to stay in line with best practise work/life balance expectations. Opportunity to advance and progress within the organisation as the company continues to grow.  Benefits:  Employee Share Scheme 25 days Paid time off Flexible working hours Remote working      Blue Prism is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.   Blue Prism is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Blue Prism via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Blue Prism. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Blue Prism as a result of the referral or through other means.

description: ADVANCE.AI is a data-driven AI technology company with multiple offices in the APAC region. Combining the best domain knowledge in big data, artificial intelligence, and credit rating technology, ADVANCE.AI brings the next generation of data centric platforms to support digital transformation transform across multi-verticals such as banking, insurance, consumer finance, e-commerce, payment, and healthcare in Asia.  Our core product offerings include digital ID verification, alternative credit scoring, anti-fraud detection, and AI solutions as a Service. Advance.AI is built and backed by experienced and successful entrepreneurs and investors in Singapore, China, and US who are from top-tier schools like Stanford, CMU, UIUC, Tsinghua, Fudan, SJTU, NUS, and NTU with rich industrial experiences from Goldman Sachs, Farallon Capital, Two Sigma, Amazon, Accenture, Tencent, Baidu, and HSBC.   We’re looking for a Business Development Manager to join our high performing team. If you’re looking to be a part of a team who tackle real-world problems that can be addressed by AI technology, Advance.AI might just be the place for you! Work alongside world-class talent and join us as we use sophisticated data and analytics to make a change in the financial world.   Job Responsibilities  Drive the software and service revenue by achieving the individual sales quota. Develop and enhance sales and business development plans through market intelligence, understanding of client markets (quantitative and qualitative) and competitor analysis Focus on solution selling for prospecting and engaging key stakeholders / C-levels and closing opportunities  Identify and define needs, articulating value proposition, differentiating competition and positioning for new market entry  Report on sales activity, pipeline development and revenue forecast. Develop the Go To Market strategy for the respective territory  Job Requirements Minimum 6 years of work experience in enterprise software sales, account management, business development with regional exposure in SEA counties. Industries include financial services (Bank, Insurance), financial technology eCommerce, and Payment with a strong sales track records in the last 3-4 years. Solid understanding of enterprise credit risk decision solution, eKYC, digital lending, digital fraud prevention, AML, AI/big data and analytics modelling  Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal  Proactive with successful track record of working in a team based environment  Independent and highly-motivated, results-driven with an ongoing curiosity for growth

description: This role is responsible for working with management (country and regional) to lead, shape and build Sales Force Effectiveness capabilities and standards across APAC. Develop Salesforce Consultation toolkits, selling processes and standards, enabled by Sales Force Platform, focused on transforming sell-in to sell-out customer propositions. Develop and implement customer segmentation based selling framework, sales force deployment, salesforce performance and incentives in line with customer and channel strategy. Lead and develop coaching capabilities and processes of sales leaders to raise standards in business consultation and competitive selling skills. Shape and implement Sales Force Effectiveness and Coaching data capture and performance goals through a newly designed launch and expansion of Sales Force platform.  Partners with the Commercial and country sales leads in the development and preparation of Sales Force Effectiveness and Sales Force Training plans, ensuring the consistency of those plans with the broader business requirements. Ensures the timely integration of defined objectives and expectations. Prepares specific business plans for new products and/or service lines. Participates in the planning, evaluation and execution of key business alliances. Develops and implements a system of monitoring and reporting progress on established strategic and tactical objectives; evaluates and reports on alternatives when course corrections are needed. Implements new business technology opportunities to meet evolving business and market requirements. Monitors expenses from and the implementation of an annual operating budget and capital budgets.  Sales Force Effectiveness (SFE), APAC (excluding Japan) Co-create strategic SFE vision, strategies, and initiatives, in close collaboration with markets, and in support of the customer and channel strategies for the business, to create a world class sales force Shape the deployment of Salesforce software platform for CRM. Lead, shape, and build SFE capabilities, standards, and processes, deployed in accordance with local nuance Lead, and develop selling framework (including selling toolkits & customer selling proposition), rooted into customer segmentation framework, to disproportionately grow the priority customers Lead and shape SFE & coaching enablers/metrics through a newly designed launch & expansion of Sales Force Platform Drive continuous improvement through management of data, leveraging of technology, and the redesign of business processes, creating business sustainability across the organization. Implement SFE performance dashboards for ongoing monitoring and course correction, as needed Annual budget plan and monitoring of the expenses/ capital  Sales Training, APAC (excluding Japan) Leads development and implementation of a sales training program, rooted in the competency framework and in support of the commercial strategy Co-create, in partnership with markets, a sales training curriculum to dial up the critical skills (i.e. data literacy) to aid in successful implementation of the commercial strategy to win with customers Leverage technology for ongoing monitoring of training effectiveness and ROI Annual budget plan and monitoring of the expenses/ capital  Qualifications Master's Degree or Equivalent. Generally requires 8-10 years related experience of successful commercial management, such as marketing, sales and business development. Prior experience in commercial excellence and/ or sales force effectiveness in a regional setting preferred. Strong experience in design and implementation of Salesforce software platform for CRM. Strong and proven track record in Sales Management & Processes, Coaching, Customer Engagement & Account Management, Competitive Selling Skills, and end-to-end Order Flow Management. Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with all relevant stakeholders like customers, partners, suppliers and employees, driving collaboration across multiple functions, teams and geographies. Strong executional focus with a keen eye for details Proven ability to deliver results in challenging and complex environments. Strong Project Management.  Primary Location  Singapore-Singapore-Singapore-  Organization  Johnson & Johnson Pte. Ltd. (8435)  Job Function  Sales  Requisition ID  2105951875W

description: About Oracle Cloud SaaS Applications Oracle’s Software as a Service (SaaS) business applications includes Customer Experience (Sales, Marketing, Social & Service) Cloud, HR Cloud, ERP Cloud, EPM Cloud, SCM Cloud, Oracle Internet of Things (IoT) Applications Cloud, Oracle AI/ML Analytics, and Blockchain Cloud offerings. Oracle APAC Applications business is transforming to become the #1 SaaS provider in the region and offers one of the industry’s most comprehensive portfolios (breadth and depth) with a modern set of best-practice business applications that leverage Oracle’s Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) to deliver business outcomes to our customers.  About APAC Applications Solution Engineering (SE) To achieve our business goal of being the #1 SaaS provider in the APAC region, the Applications (SaaS) Solution Engineering (SE) mission is as follows: ·      DELIVER TRANSFORMATIONAL BUSINESS: Identify, Develop, & Win More Transformational Opportunities ·      INSPIRE CUSTOMERS: A New Benchmark (Best-Practice) Standard for Every Solution Engineering engagement ·      MAXIMISE EFFICIENCY: An Integrated Solution Engineering eco-system Delivering Highest Quality Services ·      ENERGIZE OUR CULTURE: A Positive, Continuous-Learning, High-Performance Culture  Job Overview The Business Solution Lead (BSL) leads consultative engagements with complex enterprise customers, partnering with key stakeholders to create compelling visions while advising and executing on strategies. They serve as hands-on advisors, using strong interpersonal skills, functional and/or technical knowledge, Oracle SaaS product knowledge, industry experience, consulting experience, and knowledge of their client’s business to deliver ROI.   The BSL obtains customer acceptance by understanding and delivering the right strategic vision, and driving the difficult conversations necessary to execute business strategies. They are proficient at analyzing issues and obstacles, weighing options, choosing appropriate courses of action, and measuring and revising strategy based on results. They interact with both technical and functional stakeholders to understand requirements, analyze information, and design comprehensive solutions. They also show a strong understanding of typical business challenges faced by customers and common objectives. Oracle seeks an agile, high-energy, and passionate individual who can build on past success in developing and implementing new formats of customer engagements, lead boardroom conversations with authority, coach & mentor Sales and Solution Engineering teams on the subject and changing market dynamics, and drive towards the successful outcome of exceeding revenue targets. We offer you a truly international working environment that is fun, exciting and always challenging.  Job Responsibilities ·      Provide Solution Engineering (SE) leadership role on large, complex, multi-pillar SaaS sales opportunities by working with the Oracle Sales Teams and Sales Executives, Oracle Pillar SEs, and Customer stake-holders, including at the executive level ·      Engage with Product Management for solution blue print and status ·      Engage/ communicate with Pillar-specific solution teams like CX, HCM, ERPM, and PaaS to define overall solution strategy for a customer ·      Engage with Sales on strategy, such as Customer-to-Cloud approaches business/ IT transformation, and complex hybrid solution architecture ·      Manage solution pursuit to secure appropriate resources for all qualified opportunities ·      Provide specific industry expertise, architect the solution, and develop/ execute solution strategies to win opportunities ·      Present/ demonstrate solutions to high-level clients and industry conference attendees ·      Build the structures and culture to ensure teams in the region are leveraging their combined strengths to drive success for Oracle and our customers ·      Design/ leverage and implement programs that result in pipeline necessary to ensure over-achievement of APAC SaaS revenue targets ·      Coach Sales Teams on effective ways to address competitive traps and objection handling ·      Act as an acknowledged technical authority within the organization and provide mentoring to less experienced SEs. Act as a leader of large-scale company initiatives. Be viewed by peers as a leader and top contributor and by line management as a key business partner  Required Skills & Experience ·      > 15 years’ technical experience in enterprise applications ·      >7 years’ progressive experience in IT consulting ·      >5 years in experience in Cloud, ideally in SaaS acquisition and implementation ·      Demonstrated experience leading change on complex programs resulting from new digital channels, social and adoption of mobile technologies across business and IT stakeholders ·      A strong understanding of the Cloud marketplace and Oracle’s Cloud offerings portfolio ·      Strong understanding of the sale and consumption of cloud services, as well as the role of a Solution Engineer in driving customer and sales success ·      Knowledge around key industries and domains ·      Knowledge around areas such as applications integration & customization, native cloud & mobile application development, hybrid cloud setups and variety of existing social platforms ·      Ability to articulate business value and benefits of variety of end user applications and carry persona based conversations. Credibility at all levels including lines of business and CXOs ·      Core Solution Engineering / Business Analyst Skills: ·      Discovery, business process/ use case definition, solution presentation ·      Demonstrated project management skills ·      Demonstrated excellent verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, closing techniques ·      Ability to persuade others through presentations, demonstrations, and written communication ·      Bachelor degree or equivalent; advanced degree highly desirable
industries: Information Technology and Services

description: Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose? An inclusive company that empowers you to do your best and be innovative?  We are looking for Regional Service Business Manager to make an impact!  At Schneider Electric, we believe access to energy and digital is a basic human right. We empower all to do more with less, ensuring Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, at every moment. We provide energy and automation digital solutions for efficiency and sustainability.  Schneider Electric has an opportunity for a Regional Services Manager for the East Asia Japan region focusing on the Services Business Development in the Semiconductor and eMobility segments.  “More Digital. More Services!” – Jean Pascal Tricoire! In a dynamic and rapidly evolving part of the business, you will have great autonomy to DISRUPT the status quo, be ENTREPRENEURIAL, and make a huge difference to CUSTOMER relationships.  This HIGH PROFILE position will develop your LEADERSHIP skills and gain you exposure to many senior leaders giving you fantastic EXPOSURE and EXPERIENCE to develop your career. This Job is really made for you.  What you will do:  The Regional Service Business Manager (RSBM) is accountable for developing the Services business for eMobility and Semiconductor customers in the EAJ/Greater India/Pacific zones. The RSBM will work with Country Services team to grow the Services business at Strategic Accounts, Multi-Country Target Accounts and selected CTAs. Growth will be measured by order growth of Services, but also includes key business metrics such as Digital Services ratio, overall Service Ratio, Share of wallet, CAGR, key Service Offer growth, pipeline of major opportunities/iniatives.  She/he will be as the SPOC for the Segment in the region.  Key Responsibilities: For assigned Region, develop Field Service business 3-year plan and current year action plan with eMobility & Semicon Regional leadership and specific Accounts Managers, and Country FS V2 management. Monitors execution of annual plan and reports to eMobility & Semicon stakeholders success and challenges. Makes annual evaluation of customer profile to ensure focus is on highest value customers for Services. Ensures the quality and accuracy of BFO and IB Intel Engages directly with customers to understand asset life cycle needs and creates service plan OPEX strategy for maintenance and modernization of critical electrical infrastructures Engages directly with customers to understand CAPEX investments and opportunities for Installation, Commissioning and Testing (IC&T) services. Engages with Schneider Execution Centers to attach IC&T services. Participates in SOC / CPP stage gate reviews to bring customer expectations and define Services attachment strategy Uses account management skills and tools to identify and build strong relationships with Decision Makers, Influencers and Executives at assigned customers. Uses relationships to drive preference for Schneider Services Works with country V2s on local site coverage plans including IB tracking and contract development. Shares upstream customer information on investments, local influencers/decision makers Animates community of Country V2s to share best practices, replicate wins and provide account leadership Works to develop, directly and through networks of V1 and FSV2s a qualified pipeline of opportunities, and then drives to convert into Service business orders. Manages the BFO dashboards and related Tableau reports. The Regional Service Business manager is responsible for the Services BFO quality for assigned customers and region In collaboration with Digital Services team, promote digital offers and discover opportunities for pilots. Collaborates with GFS Global Services Operations (GSO) team to develop and close multi country tenders Acts as Voice of Customer (VoC) to bring segment and customer needs to Services LoBs. Brings competitive insights to Service Division Working with Legal Business Partners, lead commercial and contractual negotiations with customer for centralized agreements (Framework, T&Cs, Master Service Agreements) across multiple countries.  Qualifications  Experience and skills we are looking for: Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering or Automation or equivalent Masters in International Business Management will be a plus 5-10 years of experience with International Strategic Account Business Development and Contracting Proven ability to lead functional and remote team including various profiles (Contract, Technical, SMEs)  Benefits we offer: Global family leave Comprehensive medical coverage for employee and dependents Blue sky Friday Worldwide Employee Stock Ownership On-site gym …and more!  We are looking forward to welcoming you in our team!  Schedule: Full-time  Req: 0076O0
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: As digital assets and cryptocurrency become more widely adopted every day, our products are essential to ensure cryptocurrency is safe and accessible to all. Our solutions help to prevent financial crime and allow cryptocurrencies to be used for good. Our products are used by some of the world’s leading cryptocurrency exchanges, financial institutions and government agencies to screen over $1 billion of transactions every single week.  Elliptic is backed by some of the top VCs: SBI Group, Albion VC, Octopus Ventures, SignalFire, Paladin Capital, Santander InnoVentures, and Digital Currency Group, and we have grown globally with teams in the UK, USA, Singapore and Tokyo.  To achieve our mission, we depend on our incredible team of Elliptites. Our values are reflected in everything we do and every decision we make, both internally and outwardly to our customers. We actively encourage Elliptities to challenge the status quo and allow the freedom to innovate and learn every day. We encourage new ideas and learning, whether that’s through collaboration, our curiosity sessions, or utilising your professional development budget - personal growth is important to us all.  Are you a passionate and enthusiastic Sales Manager with a wealth of experience selling SaaS solutions to government entities? Are you looking for your next challenge in an emerging and exciting market? If yes then we want to hear from you!  The impact you will have:  You will join our global Commercial team, and champion uncovering and developing new customer relationships across the APAC region. As a Government Sales Manager you will become an expert in Elliptic’s value proposition, helping build our revenues with government bodies (central banks, law enforcement and regulators) to develop their understanding and help them to navigate the impacts of increased adoption of digital assets.  You will manage the full sales cycle including prospecting, qualifying leads, negotiating terms, developing custom proposals and closing business to ultimately deliver profitable revenue growth and exceed your targets.  This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced individual looking for a role where you can make an impact not just on the company you work for but also on the market you work in. Fascinating and challenging work is the norm - working at Elliptic is never boring!  What you’ll do: Develop net new business and cross sell opportunities Build out strategic market penetration plan, prospect, and manage full sales cycle Prospect and generate high quality leads Develop custom proposals based on customer requirements Conduct presentations and product demos Negotiate terms and close the business As applicable, work alongside our Customer Engagement team to develop deeper relationships and upsell to set and hit aggressive revenue goals Meet and exceed quarterly and annual quota  Requirements  You will be a great fit here if you: You have experience of selling into central banks, law enforcement and regulators. Have the ability to analyse data to identify market trends and opportunities for cryptocurrency and compliance. Can evaluate customer needs and preferences in relation to pricing, product terms and conditions to ensure that client requirements are addressed in commercial proposals Have a collaborative mindset Address problems immediately and can work across functions to solve problems Enjoy working with pace and energy, building team spirit and cultivating unity and commitment among the team Have an understanding of complex B2B sales methodologies Are flexible, adaptable and comfortable with changing priorities  Our ideal candidate has: 5+ years full sales cycle experience selling SaaS solutions to public sector entities Strong outbound prospecting skills, with track record of generating net new business Demonstrated track record of success and quota over achievement - top 10% performer at your last company A strong work ethic and an entrepreneur’s mindset. You’re comfortable creating value in a low structure environment while being agile and resilient Interest and curiosity about digital assets and the crypto economy  Bonus Points for: Can understand how compliance of digital assets fit into public sector plans Intimate understanding of AML/KYC and Forensics space, either in cryptocurrency or traditional financial environments Experience selling SaaS solutions to government/public sector. Borderline obsession with emerging technology  Benefits Share Options Holiday - 24 days of annual leave in addition to Singapore gazetted holidays Health insurance Quarterly full-day off-sites & annual company 3-day offsite Personal training budget & LinkedIn Learning subscription Laptop + equipment you need Home office allowance Full access to Spill Mental Health Support  We know Diversity and Inclusion is much deeper than just hiring, but it’s important for us to mention it here. We welcome and embrace individuals of all backgrounds and identities at Elliptic, and this is an ongoing priority for us. We know incredible people don’t all think in the same way. We want to be challenged every day. We believe our diverse team of individuals underpins this by bringing creative thinking and innovation to Elliptic every day. We are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable workplace, so we welcome applications from everyone, even if you may not think you fit all of the requirements of our roles. We foster an environment of psychological safety, where everyone feels comfortable to bring their whole self to work.

companyName: The Green Collective SG Pte Ltd
description: About The Green Collective SG  We are Asia's first Collective concept providing retail as a service to early stage D2C brands curated based on the UN SDGs. As an impact driven business, since 2018, we have empowered over 120 brands, expanded and established our unique omnichannel approach and most importantly created a vibrant community of changemakers who have taken their first steps towards a sustainable lifestyle through us.  We are headquartered out of Singapore but have a regional team expanding with us as we expand into overseas markets.  Business Development Associate (Distribution)  Our distribution business involves developing new sales channels as well as servicing and increasing sales from existing channels. We already have made inroads into some large channels and are looking to expand our reach. The Business Development Associate will be someone who has an entrepreneurial mindset, a ‘can-do’ attitude and is prepared to lead strategic business growth and drive transformational change in our distribution business.  You will be reporting directly to one of the cofounders and eventually developing a team as the business scales up.   What are you expected to do?  Develop and strategize company’s business development strategy for distribution Conduct relevant market research or studies (if required) for distributing products Prospect for new clients and promote by networking, webinar, cold calling, or other means of generating interest from potential clients Set sales targets, develop rapport with new clients and provide support that will continually improve mutual relationships. Grow accounts’ revenue, market share and profit goals to meet objectives.  Develop and provide pre-sales technical assistance and product education to customers. Negotiate tenders and contract terms and conditions to meet both customers’ and company’s needs.  Maintain effective teamwork with members of the Sales Team and other functional teams Work closely with marketing and operations team to ensure achievement of targets  Who you are expected to be ?  Entrepreneurial mindset with at least 1-2 years of sales experiences Must have a good understanding of all aspects of retailing products Experience in driving revenues, collaborating with multiple brand/business stakeholders is key. Strong communication skills Excellent public relations skills Ability to understand the client base Analytical skills with a knack for dissecting market reports Prior experience of working in sustainability preferred  What do we provide you?  Opportunity to work in an international, small entrepreneurial set up Competitive compensation with huge chances to grow within the company, Being part of a high growth dynamic environment, Working directly with experienced co-founders and being part of driving the strategic direction for the Collective Flexible working environment with independence Free access to the Green Academy to upskill yourself  Discounts and benefits if you are looking to shop sustainably  This role is only open for Singaporeans and PRs. Please send your resume to hello@thegreencollective.sg

Because you belong at Twilio  The Who, What, Why And Where  Who?  Twilio is looking for a proven Enterprise Account Executive who is interested in growing their career in the fast-growing cloud communications platform market. You'll be responsible for net new logo acquisition of key Enterprise accounts in the Philippines market . You’ll be able to sell across all Twilio products and services to help businesses improve their Customer Engagement through communications and solve complex business problems.  As The Ideal Twilion, You Live The Twilio Magic , Have a Demonstrated Track Record Of Success In Sales As Well As 8+ years of Enterprise Sales experience and a track record of personally selling and closing complex technical solutions to Philippines enterprises and software companies in excess of $100K. Comfortable with selling sophisticated enterprise platform solutions, understanding of API value prop, and success on seven figure deals in the past. Demonstrated success by exceeding quota on a consistent basis. Responsibilities will span from driving the sales process from internal leads to qualifying new prospects and managing deals to closure. Native or Business level proficiency in Tagalog is a plus This role reports to the Senior Director, Enterprise Sales for Rest of Asia(RoA) and will be based in Singapore  What? BE AN OWNER : Responsible for new customer acquisition and driving new revenue for a specific territory while being assigned greater than $2M quota and maintaining the highest levels of customer satisfaction. WEAR THE CUSTOMER'S SHOES: Mastered crafting pricing proposals, negotiating terms and managing the contract process. Ideally, you also have experience selling communications to a technical and business audience, building trust and mutual respect with technical customers and peers. DRAW THE OWL : Passionate about what you do and you are able to think outside of the box and have world-class interpersonal and communication skills to make complex contractual, technical, and financial details sound simple. RUTHLESSLY PRIORITIZE : Ability to balance competing priorities and manage multiple project/deals at the same time. As an added bonus, you’ve previously sold cloud or enterprise software. Travel may be required Why?  The Enterprise Sales team is a strategic component to our go-to-market strategy. We bring incredible value to enterprise companies, and thrive on finding new use cases to optimize their customer engagement. With no vertical restraints, the sky's the limit to what we can accomplish.  Twilio is a company that is empowering the world’s developers with modern communication in order to build better applications. Twilio is truly unique; we are a company committed to your growth, your learning, your development, and your entire employee experience. We only win when our employees succeed, and we're dedicated to helping you develop your strengths. We have a cultural foundation built on diversity, inclusion, and innovation, and we want you and your ideas to thrive at Twilio.  Where?  This position will be located in our Singapore office. Around the world, Twilio offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your loved ones. No matter where you are based, you will experience a company that believes in small teams for maximum impact; seeks well-rounded talent to ensure a full perspective on our customers’ experience, understands that this is a marathon, not a sprint; that continuously and purposefully builds an inclusive culture that empowers everyone to do their best work and be the best version of themselves.  About Us  Millions of developers around the world have used Twilio to unlock the magic of communications to improve any human experience. Twilio has democratized communications channels like voice, text, chat, video and email by virtualizing global communications infrastructure through APIs that are simple enough for any developer to use, yet robust enough to power the world’s most demanding applications. By making communications a part of every software developer's toolkit, Twilio is enabling innovators across every industry — from emerging leaders to the world’s largest organizations — to reinvent how companies engage with their customers.  Twilio is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, gender, gender identity, parental or pregnancy status, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or Veteran status and operate in compliance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

description: A technology client is looking for an analytical and effective B2B Sales Development Specialist who is adept at seeking new business opportunities and building long- term trusting relationships with prospects to qualify leads as sales opportunities.  This is a remote position. We welcome candidates from any location. Resumes are to be submitted in English.  Responsibilities: Create new opportunities for sales and generate leads by nurturing warm prospects and networking with potential customers. Manage the pipeline of prospective customers and engage the sales team for the next steps. Reach out to prospects and leads daily via phone, email, Linkedin, and other channels. Set and meet activity targets- outbound calls and conversions. Maintain industry networks and relationships to stay informed of competitor activities. Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation process.  Requirements: 3+ years of experience with a Bachelor’s degree is preferred. An understanding of outbound B2B tech sales development / inside sales role. An understanding of international markets would be an advantage. Strong analytical skills and proven ability to solve problems creatively. Capable of working independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Communicate effectively with C-Suite executives. A positive and energetic phone presence, combined with excellent oral and written communication skills is a must.  About Hire Digital  Hire Digital is a freelance network of top talents in digital marketing, web development, and design. Our clients work with high-performing teams as well as individual talents who have gone through a rigorous screening process. Clients such as Shopify, Expedia, and Stripe have access to high-performing talents on-demand, with guaranteed performance.  Powered by JazzHR  UjNJkdkLcC

description: Description  We are a growing group of 140+ talented people, spread over three continents and united by one common mission: To improve efficiency in shipping through transparency and data-driven decisions.  Being at the forefront of a movement that's leading to a new digital era for shipping, we continuously set ambitious goals that often produce complex challenges and drive us to constantly innovate.  Each day at MarineTraffic presents numerous opportunities to develop skills, share knowledge and have fun. We are an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, one that is fair and honest and gives our people the confidence to be bold, to try new things and to grow.  As a result of our significant growth we are looking to add a seasoned sales hunter to drive sales activity in APAC region as part of the Singapore sales team. It requires an entrepreneur and self-starter mentality, someone who can bring new logos across various key verticals.  We are looking for a competitive and trustworthy Territory Sales Manager to help us build up our business outbound activities. You will be responsible for managing new and existing customer sales requests and maintaining customer satisfaction. The goal is to meet and surpass the company’s expectations to drive rapid and sustainable growth.  Responsibilities Of Your Role Managed an assigned territory with the associated revenue targets and commission structure. Able to develop and present a thorough territory plan within the first 90 days. Execute business development activity to strategically grow the customer base through prospecting and cold calling. Leverage a repeatable sales process to drive to closure. Be expert at selling to both commercial organizations and government across a range of industry verticals. Exceed activity, pipeline and revenue targets and lead contract negotiations. Keep accurate and complete information on the Salesforce CRM system including prospecting activity, closing, sales pipeline and forecasting, close ratios and market intelligence. Obtain in-depth knowledge of MarineTraffic’s products and services. Follow a consultative approach in order to understand client’s needs and business challenges. Accurately calculate quotations, handle invoices and license agreements. Collaborate with internal stakeholders (Pre-Sales, Product, Engineering) regarding existing and new clients to identify and resolve client concerns. Establish and maintain current and potential client relationships. To research and utilize industry tools to identify opportunities for business growth. Sharing Customer feedback, communicating product and services opportunities, with internal teams at MarineTraffic. Participate in marketing events, trade shows and company events. Approximately 30% to 40% travel. Report to the Regional Sales Manager on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results. It’s Essential That You Have  Requirements 3-5 years of prior sales experience working for a technology vendor selling Enterprise solutions (Data, Cloud, Software, SaaS). Previous experience of working at established and early-stage companies. A track record of developing a greenfield territory, adding net new logos. A hunting mentality with a very strong Sales DNA and demonstrated success. The ability to identify use cases and value propositions across a broad range of verticals. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Fluent in English, knowledge of other languages is beneficial. Have strong numeracy and analytical skills. Have good IT skills: you are comfortable using Microsoft Office. The ability to work cross-culturally and cross-functionally. The right level of entrepreneurship, creativity, and commitment. Maritime domain experience is a plus. Have a prior experience in shipping or fleet operations will be an added advantage. A Bachelor’s degree or higher. Benefits Work in an international, dynamic and fun environment, at a growing company Attractive remuneration package Continuing education and training Pleasant and fun working environment Huge learning experience and room for experimentation. Remote work flexibility If you’ve read the description carefully and feel you are a genuine fit for this role, which is both challenging and fun, we would like to hear from you.  Get your career on course by joining a globally recognised industry leader. Apply now.

description: A unique opportunity to be part of Tubular’s growing team in APAC working in an exciting and fast-moving industry. Tubular Labs is looking for an Account Executive to grow its client base of China and Singapore HQ’d brands looking to expand internationally. You will be empowered to prospect, build relationships, and close business with leading brands, platforms, media companies and agencies in APAC to help drive our new business goals. You will be responsible for creating excitement, trust, and driving revenue for Tubular’s unique video insights platform.  About The Role And What You Will Be Doing Consistently meet quarterly and annual quota and revenue goals. Engage with internal stakeholders to collaborate on opportunities, resolve customer issues, share best practices and partner with cross-functional teams. Solicit and validate prospect’s critical business issues to inform and demonstrate relevant Tubular solutions. Lead discussions to convey Tubular’s value to prospects and demonstrate that value and resulting ROI. Ability to develop compelling pitch decks aligned to customer business issues. Proven ability to develop and maintain strong relationships with executive-level decision makers and champions. Engage with Tubular’s value-driven customer methodology to identify new business opportunities and key stakeholders, then shepherd deals swiftly and diligently through the Tubular sales process from discovery to closed-won. Demonstrate timely actioning of leads, proposals and customer pitch follow-ups. Quickly generate compelling insights from Tubular platform and other sources for prospect presentations and outbounding. Actively build pipeline by owning your prospecting efforts via targeted account research and strategic outreach. Maintain pipeline with diligence and timeliness to support accurate reporting and forecasting for current & future quarters. Partner with Marketing, SDRs and Pre-Sales teams to strategically target accounts.  Experience We Are Looking For 2-3+ years of successful SaaS and/or consultative sales experience focused on new business working with leading brands, platforms and agencies in the APAC region. Experience working with video platforms or gaming industry with a focus on China brands and platforms expanding overseas. Knows companies like Tencent, Alibaba, Baidu well. Mandarin speaker required, Japanese / Korean a plus. Track record of building and maximizing strong relationships with key contacts at prospect accounts. Proven top performer (consistently achieving sales goals) that delivers an exceptional customer experience. Demonstrated experience selling technology solutions or applications at the C-Suite level.  Bonus If You Have This Experience Experience working with brands and agencies HQ’d in Singapore. Passion for YouTube, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram video ecosystems, social media marketing, online content and related insights. Understanding of enterprise SaaS sales process. Strong “hustle” mentality with desire to work in a dynamic startup environment where your input can help shape our offerings. Tubular is riding the wave of digital video. Smartphones, social media, and new streaming apps are revolutionizing media and entertainment. Viewers have never had so much great content to choose from, from so many diverse creators, available to watch in so many ways. As advertising, TV, and social media converge, new industries will emerge. Tubular is the worldwide leader in online video intelligence. We are guiding firms through the new digital video landscape. We serve the world’s greatest media companies and brands, including top movie studios & TV networks, leading technology companies, and the creme of digital-first publishers. We are a team of tech-savvy media enthusiasts. We offer a fast-paced environment with an opportunity to make a real impact on your career, on our company, and the global media industry. description: Account Executive – Singapore  Olofsson & Company is an elite Executive Search focusing on global technology and Start-up hiring. Our client is a next generation, well-funded, hyper growth unicorn in the Application Performance Monitoring space, with ambitious and exciting growth plans for Asia Pacific. Due to rapid growth and phenomenal adaptability and success in today’s changing market conditions there is an urgent need to strengthen the APAC team with multiple Account Executives. This is an extraordinary opportunity offering the successful candidate unparalleled career growth and financial rewards with one of the most exciting software firms to enter the market in recent years.  As the Account Executive, you will be responsible for the entire sales cycle, collaborating with lead generation, marketing, presales and product resources, to bring leading APM capabilities to prospective enterprise customers and transforming the way they do business.  Responsibilities Consistently deliver aggressive license, support and service revenue targets – dedication to the number and to deadlines. Non Named Account penetration, account planning and opportunity management, managing the full sales cycle Negotiate favourable pricing and business terms with large commercial enterprises by selling value and return on investment. Effective use of Sales Engineering and our sales methodology and processes. Collaborate with both international and domestic colleagues to expand deal size and value to the customer. Good corporate citizen – two-way flow of relevant information; work as a team for the most efficient use and deployment of resources. Provide timely and insightful input back to other corporate functions, particularly product management and sales engineering.  Qualifications Minimum of 5 years experience in direct New Business Account Management, selling into Enterprise Accounts. Comfortable with prospecting and cold calling to Technical Users, IT and Engineering Leaders, C-Suite experience is a plus. Strong executive presence and polish, with extraordinary management, interpersonal, written and presentation skills. Thrives in a dynamic, fast-growing, rapidly changing environment while being able to work independently and remotely from other members of your team and corporate. Relevant software industry experience in any of the following: IT systems, enterprise or infrastructure management, application development and management, security, and/or analytics. Track record of success and knowledge with prospects and customers in the defined territory. You should be passionate about the projects you work on and hence should show great passion for the tech space my client is in. Desire to Learn and Adapt: Sales Methodologies Training & New Technologies Experience in using Salesforce Professionally adept in English and one other local language (Chinese, Bahasa, Thai, etc.)   If this resonates with you and you are interested in knowing more about this opportunity, please reach out to me via LinkedIn or directly at nitin@olofsson.sg.

description: About Us  WeWork began in 2010 with a vision to build the first global physical platform designed to bring people together. Today, we offer access to a desk, an office, a headquarters, or an entire building in hundreds of cities around the world; with over a third of the Fortune 500 companies being part of the WeWork community.  About The Opportunity  This is a key position within our Sales Team where the candidate will be responsible for the commercial success of a portfolio of small offices. This will include renewing existing members as well as sourcing and closing new business.  As a successful Inside Sales, Account Executive you will have the opportunity to:  Nurture, develop, and close renewal opportunities in a fast-paced and evolving environment. Source, nurture and close new business opportunities by ensuring that prospects’ needs are met and exceeded. Act as the owner of the commercial success of your portfolio, working with your colleagues in the Community team and the wider sales team.  Day To Day Responsibilities Include (but Not Limited To)  Maintain high activity through regular touch points with clients. Partner with Community Teams to ensure the successful placement of new members. Maintain our CRM to ensure you are showing an accurate view of your pipeline. Execute strategy and process implemented by Sales leaders, Marketing and Sales Operations. Be a positive WeWork brand ambassador and confidently communicate our value proposition to members. Provide unmatched customer service to members to ensure the best possible member experience.  About You  We’d love to hear from you if you have:  A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent qualifications. Advanced verbal and written communication skills in English. Experience of the SEA Market as well as fluency in any other Asian language. Demonstrable experience in succeeding in fast-paced, KPI driven sales environment Two years or more of professional experience in sales, account management or related deal closing fields. Demonstrated experience in nurturing, negotiating, renewing and closing sales (required). Excellent experience in customer service and relationship building. Strong work ethic and entrepreneurial spirit. Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills.

description: The Sales Executive will be responsible for maintaining relationships and further penetrating business with existing shipping clients that are purchasing fuel from WFS, as well as development of new accounts. Manage and execute fuel requirements from existing customers Proactively develop new business opportunities from existing customers Proactively prospect for new business opportunities from new customers – research and analyze client opportunities and develop/implement action plans for attaining the new business Analyze and disseminate appropriate market information to identify new business opportunities Frequently visit existing and new customers Be a reliable point of contact for customer requests and transactions Monitor customer use of credit line and credit exposure Assist in operational/logistic support where needed. These activities include supplier service, fuel delivery coordination, claims resolution and ensure optimal customer satisfaction.  PERSON SPECIFICATION (BACKGROUND AND SKILLS): Essential  The successful candidate is likely to be a fresh graduate or with in excess of 1 year of sales experience. An understanding of commodity market dynamics. A resilient and tenacious character. Strong numerical ability and analytical skills Strong written and oral communication skills. description: Company Description  We’re on a mission to help move the businesses that move the world. With over 130 years’ experience, Toll Group, proudly part of Japan Post, operates an extensive global logistics network, covering road, air, sea and rail across 1,200 locations in more than 50 countries.  Global Forwarding delivers cargo across our global network via road, rail, sea, and air. From loose cartons for consolidation and palletised cargo to moving dangerous goods and bulk commodities, we have the experience, the infrastructure, and the global network to get freight moving – across towns, across countries and across continents.  Job Description  Regional Client Relationship Manager Based in Clementi, Singapore Reports in to SVP, Sale, ASEAN & ISC Key enabler of GF’s account management and customer care process The Role  The Regional CRM will serve as the internal sales point of contact for designated key and/or strategic accounts within the region. As a key enabler of GF’s account management and customer care process, the Regional CRM is responsible for ensuring the overall positive customer experience and managing the delta between customer expectations and GF performance, working closely with the designated stakeholders (e.g vertical heads) across all regions and divisions of Toll Group.  The position exists to support and develop the business relationships with our key clients in the Region. The position takes an active lead in all commercial areas by using the resources available to own & drive client relationships & satisfaction to grow share of wallet and profitability.  The position is required to comply with all necessary controls and procedures, whilst maintaining a high standard of customer care at all times.  As a Regional Client Relationship Manager, You Will Pro-actively manage and develop relationships with your allocated portfolio of customers Actively identify and pursue new sales opportunities within allocated portfolio, including cross selling Develop & implement strategies & tactics to increase revenue flows from the allocated portfolio or to grow newly identified strategic clients for the country/region Identify and be alert to new business opportunities within customer organization to generate new revenue opportunities; coordinate with the (Global/Regional) Account Owner to gather information to further qualify the opportunity for pursuit and development Maintain data compliance in the CRM to showcase new opportunities (e.g. pipelines, account plans,…) Attracting new opportunities and develop existing clients to generate additional volume & profit and to oversee contract preparation & deal negotiations, ensure compliance to company standards Qualifications  To Be Successful In This Role, You Will Need Degree/Diploma in transportation/logistics/marketing or above 5+ years’ of relevant working experience in development and client relationship building within the Freight Forwarding industry Experience in Key Account Management across multiple countries preferred High degree of communication skills Good problem-solving skills; ability to find core issues and creatively address Must be results-orientated with a strong customer orientation and ability to operate effectively at many levels within the organization in a virtual environment Additional Information  Be Connected  With a bold vision and innovative drive, join our 44,000 colleagues as we lead industry change and transform how customers best meet their global supply chain needs in a meaningful and sustainable way. There are countless opportunities to learn and make a real impact in shaping our industry’s future. Grow with diverse challenges amongst a friendly and inclusive global culture. Take pride in building relationships that matter, because being connected is at the centre of what makes Toll great – it’s what makes our possibilities endless.  Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality, built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages, genders and abilities.  If this sounds like the opportunity you are looking for, apply now or for more information contact yen.lim@tollgroup.com  To find out more about us visit www.tollgroup.com  You must be entitled to work in the country where the role is based and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical.

We will help you learn how to navigate through a sales process, develop consultative selling skills and refine your ability to manage and focus in a complex and dynamic environment. Qualify in-bound leads and arrange sales appointments. Track all qualification and lead management activity using SalesForce.com (including calls, prospect pipeline & account notes).
