description: ZA Tech is on a mission to redefine insurance with advanced technology. We are backed by a leading venture investor and have partnered with a number of unicorns and financial services companies across Asia.   ZA Tech continues our rapid growth and we are looking for a driven, empathetic, and results-oriented individual to join our Sales team. This is an incredible opportunity to help the regional fintech leader to shape a technology platform that is redefining insurance. You will have an opportunity to learn from our team and interact closely with our client-partners.   As the Sales Development Manager, you will be joining a hyper scaling insurtech startup. This will be a tremendous growth opportunity for you and will combine a challenging and fun environment. You will instrumental to our continued Southeast Asia success story and will become a key member in our expanding regional sales team. You will work closely with the sales executives across Southeast Asia to support them to meet ambitious growth targets.   Your responsibilities will include the day-to-day management and execution of number important aspects across Sales and Sales Operations as well as acting as a key player and maintaining relationships with Finance, Accounting, Legal and various other organisations across APAC.    A career with ZA Tech provides invaluable experience in a rapid growing fintech firm, with leading ecosystems and financial institutions as partners, as well as a cool startup culture.   Responsibilities   Outbound sales activities including research, reach-out and qualifying calls Development of sales materials with inputs from sales execs Support sales activities events, including conferences, meetings, and roadshows  Work closely with the regional sales leaders to drive operational cadence and run strategic initiatives.  Get to know our products inside and out and help to shape prospect communication for the feature launches by the company, work closely with the various departments to ensure that latest information of sales pipeline, progress is accurately recorded  Generate deal registration checkpoint reports as required  Follow through process of invoice collection, attendance list collection Support on customer onboarding, registration, and documentation  Requirements:  Three years of work experience in Sales Development, Operations or Sales Support   Self-starter with a strong drive and work ethic.  Be willing to drive initiatives, working across the organization and creative problem solving in a real-time, fast-paced sales environment  Bachelor's Degree preferred  Proficient computer skills, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Word  Academic background at software or information system is a plus  Good communication skills Able to work independently and flexibly with minimal direct supervision   What we offer   Attractive compensation package   Opportunity to work on the most interesting and impactful problems in insurance  Incredible learning opportunities across international markets  Health insurance  The amazing personal growth experience   About ZA Tech   ZA Tech is a technology venture founded by ZhongAn Online, a global leader in online insurance, and backed by Softbank’s Vision Fund. ZA Tech’s solution originated from the use-cases of ZhongAn and is utilized by external partners, including leading insurers to enable them to unlock the value of digital partnerships and accelerate the go-to-market for the new generation of online insurance.  ZA Tech is redefining the insurance landscape by enabling digital ecosystems to easily embed relevant protection within their customer journeys.

At Evooq, we are building an ecosystem of solutions that combine data, technology and investment expertise.  Wealth and asset managers use our solutions to rapidly identify investment opportunities, make informed decisions and manage the risk and the lifecycle of the investments.  Description  You are a talented and driven candidate who will thrive in a fast paced sales environment. Ideal for an energetic and ambitious candidate who is looking for a career move into sales and is passionate about technology.  You will work alongside our sales team mentored by a Sales & Relationship Manager with more than 7+ years of track record and 10+ years of experience in banking and Fintech. You will learn firsthand how to identify the right targets, how to approach them, how to present our products, how to engage in procurement processes and discussions as well as in contract negotiations. By a mix of self-driven curiosity and willingness to learn about our products and services as well as mentoring you will become a specialist in B2B financial technology sales.  Scope  Your role is to seek out and speak to leads, carefully understand their needs, qualify opportunities, qualify out when necessary, then proceed to making recommendations to the sales team. Your focus will be on prospecting and approaching potential clients and partners, on leveraging partner contacts and your own network, and on managing the relationship with existing contacts. You will initiate the marketing effort by setting up meetings with key decision makers and by coordinating subsequent client meetings, presentations and workshops, while enhancing the required marketing material. We expect you to develop sustainable relationships with our clients and partners to be able to gain and translate their insights as input for the further development of our product and service offerings and identification of new market opportunities.  Qualifications Must be a self-motivated and positive person, accountable and resourceful Strong listening, verbal and written communications skills to be able to build relationships with clients and internal partners to gain buy-in and commitment Confidence in having 1-to-1 conversations that focus on unlocking opportunities Ability to prioritise tasks and manage time effectively Some experience in finance Bonus Education in finance Experience in sourcing new sales opportunities through outbound cold calls and emails Exposure to Private banking and Wealth management domain Established network to key decision makers  About Us  Evooq is a global provider of technology-driven solutions for wealth and asset managers. We aim to radically simplify the investment process and make investments more accessible and more understandable for professional investors and their clients.  Our clients include some of the world’s largest banks, as well as wealth management companies and pension funds across Europe and Asia.  We have offices in Switzerland and Singapore.

description: Founded in Singapore in 2013, Castlery is an online furniture brand that creates its own distinctive, quality furniture designs and offers them at accessible prices via a seamless, fuss-free experience for the modern furniture shopper. Since then, we have grown into overseas markets like the United States and Australia.  As an e-commerce tech start-up, we move decisively on insightful data and leverage on technological solutions to supercharge our operations. We combine our individual passions and skills to create innovative work that is as exciting and unconventional as the business itself. It is a place where all ideas are listened to; where brainstorming means job titles get left at the door and where a self-starter can really make their mark.  If you are eager to make an impact at a fast-growing technology company and you have a passion for moving the needle, come join us!  Job Responsibilities  Our Sales Team seats central in providing a seamless online-to-offline strategy for our Singapore Market – situated in our Showroom at Jit Poh Building, they are responsible for providing a great shopping experience in store as well as helping potential customers choose the right products for their dream home. As our Head of Sales, you will be taking on a leaderships position and overseeing the current Sales Team, as well as executing various strategic initiatives to scale the business. Your job responsibilities are as per below. Responsible to articulate and implement organisation’s strategy for selling products and to develop forecasts and strategies to achieve sales. Lead the team to motivate and ensure effective performance of Relationships Managers and Sales Consultants. Manage sales team individual performance – sales targets, leads conversion and customer engagement. Develop and maintain sales training program to train and retrain sales full timers and part-timers. Focusing on sales techniques, product knowledge, customer services and personal grooming. Set sales strategy, align sales structure with the strategy and manage staff to implement sales processes. Work closely with marketing in launching new collections to ensure best showroom exposure. Constantly seeking to increase average order value. Store operational excellence by ensuring general store maintenance, visual merchandising and monthly stocktake. Monitor closely in business intelligent (BI) to drive performance from various main categories to SKU level. Assist and influence the HQ team to provide insight to the wider team. Work closely with marketing and purchasing team to influence forecast demand and ensure consistent supply amidst seasonal trends. Work closely with marketing and demand team to execute exit strategies for unproductive inventory. Build staff hiring plan to fully execute business vision. Organise effective regular sales meeting with team and cross departments. Engage regularly with Castlery management and department heads to ensure continued alignment between brands and functions. Keeps abreast of Castlery’s product range, product applications, technical services, market conditions, competitive activities, advertising and promotional trends by consulting with various departments.  Requirements Strong track record in retail operations management and driving strategic growth. Excellent communication and customer service skills. Prior leadership/people management experience, taking care of a team of more than 5 sales representatives. Preferred university qualifications or professional equivalent. At least 8 to 10 Years of experience in a similar role, with a minimum of 5 years in a Managerial & Leadership level role. Be able to perform under volume workload and stress during peak season. A professional, pro-active and ‘can do' attitude with good attention to detail and a passion for providing outstanding customer service. Familiar with Freshworks or similar software is preferred. description: Description Decathlon is one of the biggest sporting goods designer, manufacturer, and retailer headquartered in France! With an international network of 90,000 employees working in over 1400 stores in 42 countries, we are ready to open our sixth experience store in Singapore, Punggol! And we need you on our team!  Your Role: As a Sport Leader your responsibility will be to make your sport accessible within your community by sharing the benefits of your sport with others in alignment with “We Connect Sports Lovers” project in Singapore. Digital – As the retail continues to evolve, you will have the freedom to discover new ways to build your brand through social media and other digital channels. Here is where you will apply your networking skills in order to strengthen your brand and to make your sport accessible within your community.  Customer Service – Your customers will always be your number one priority, you will have the means to listen to their feedback in order to make improvements to your business. At Decathlon we ensure that all our customers remain loyal through our Satisfied or Satisfied policy.  Project Driven – You will build your local sport project and contribute to the City Project of your Sport.  Requirements Open minded with a natural sense of service to help others. A team player who is responsible and thrives in fast paced and changing environments. People who are digitally minded and business-centric with an entrepreneurial spirit. Self-motivated with a clear passion for sport. Full-Time and Part-Time roles available!  Benefits Regular practice of sports Be a shareholder, with exclusive annual option to invest in Decathlon’s Shares Variable monthly performance bonus (capped at 20%) Generous staff discount on Decathlon products Comprehensive medical and insurance benefits Wide range of career opportunities locally and globally Internal and external training available  Think you're a good fit for the role?* Apply Now!  *Due to restrictions on work pass quota, we are currently open to Singaporean and PR candidates only

description: Microsoft is on a mission to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. Our culture is centered on embracing a growth mindset and being an ally for the inclusion of all diversities, a theme of inspiring excellence, and encouraging teams and leaders to bring their best each day. Growth mindset encourages each of us to lean in and learn what matters most to our customers, to create the foundational knowledge that enables us to make customer-first decisions in everything we do. In doing so, we create life-changing innovations that impact billions of lives around the world. You can help us achieve our mission.”  The Consumer Channel Sales and Marketing (CCSM) organization creates value with our channel sales partners to market and sell innovative consumer solutions. We work closely with our external ecosystem and internal business groups to deliver amazing customer Modern experiences powered by Microsoft Windows, Surface, Office M365, and Xbox.  CCSM strategy is articulated around 3 goals: win with at-home and on-the-go compelling experiences for consumers through intelligent edge devices and services, accelerate cloud and subscription adoption through innovative solutions while increasing our customer satisfaction, engagement & loyalty and drive digital excellence and e-commerce capability with our partners to deliver innovation in omni-channel experiences.  CCSM S-KI covers the geographies across Southeast Asia, Korea and India and is one of the 12 sub-region globally, but not the least in terms of growth opportunity, due to the size of the consumer population (1.2Bn people) and untapped business opportunity.  Within CCSM S-KI team, the Singapore Channel Sales Executive is accountable for managing Top Key managed retail account, the Market makers, Strategic Accounts & Telco in driving sales through partnerships and opportunities, working with the Distributors to optimize Microsoft advocacy, presence and sales through our optimized both in store & digital reach. The sales executive is leading the relationship between Microsoft and its customers, responsible for delivering a well-managed and growing business for Microsoft by understanding both the customers’, and Microsoft’s business strategies and initiatives, and by selling (and co-selling with partners) Microsoft experiences and solutions that bring value to our customers and Microsoft.  Responsibilities  Partner Relationships (40%) Uses plans to contact decision makers for engagements. Exercises independent judgment and discretion to maintain and develop tactical relationships with decision makers. Adapts rhythm of business (ROB) to customer and partner needs. Facilitate partner-to-partner discussions and Microsoft executive meetings to support Retailer’s innovation and differentiation strategies. Orchestrates annual and seasonal planning process with partner and implement through your virtual team to exceed shopper and partner expectations and goals. Demonstrates a solid knowledge of customers’ positions within an industry or channel, partners’ strategy, impertives and profitability drivers. Acts as a partner advocate for all Retailer’s interests, goals, and objectives. Results are demonstrated by an ability to identify and close opportunities, and by positive customer/partner satisfaction results in relevant surveys. Demonstrates good understanding of Retailer’s contracts with Microsoft, ensures the partners is fully informed and sponsors Microsoft runs on Trust and ensure their understanding on all aspects of Microsoft roadmaps, timelines, and program terms to improve partner satisfaction. Account Management (35%) Builds and executes sales plans through regular contact with assigned partners, resulting in meeting or exceeding the success metrics (for example, increased revenue, devices activations). Builds and executes plans that produce full utilization and participation in applicable incentive programs. Ensure all discretionary funding produces an ROI aligned to corporate guidance. Demonstrates knowledge about customers’ and partners’ business models and cycles, build joint plans serving Microsoft and partners’ objectives, and create value through the chain. Develop strategies to compete and win share by ensuring the right assortment at the right price through strong portfolio management across all product categories including first and third party portfolios. Results are demonstrated by an increased ability to identify and close opportunities in competitive situations. Supports partner through the digital transformation journey to ensure omni-channel presence and growth Drive and land regular account performance reviews internally and with partner, and secure inclusion into the partner business cycle Business Operational Excellence (25%) Track progress of sales versus agreed plans, reporting on ROI, refining plans to meet and exceed agreed results. Provides feedback to Channel sales management and regional teams, sharing local updates, and managing and escalating roadblocks and supply gaps. Provides accurate forecast at the beginning of each quarter, with transparency, accountability. Drives improvement in partner satisfaction (CPE) through timely issue resolution and partner support. Ensures all agreed programs and investments are executed as agreed and in 100% alignment with our policies and Microsoft Standard Business Conduct Core Priorities Act as a central and strategic point of contact for Singapore Channel Sales GTM strategy, budget, forecasts meetings Account Planning and Strategy: Generates long-term, agile, and customer-centric plans that align customer, partner, and Microsoft business priorities. Customer Relationship Development: Understands customers’ businesses and builds relationships with key decision maker Business Value Selling: Presents customers with Microsoft solutions that address business needs, value and returns, align with joint expectations, and are successfully executed. Industry/ Competitive Knowledge: Understands changing trends, how the industry and competitors are evolving, and how Microsoft can address these changes. Account v-Team Leadership: Orchestrates Microsoft resources to meet and support customer and Microsoft needs. Fosters an environment of teamwork and accountability. Business and Opportunity Management: Seeks both short- and long-term opportunities. Optimizes forecasts, pipelines, and new opportunities to meet revenue, units, and share growth goals.Emulate high ethics and trust to comply with our standards of business conduct Land all Channel partner programs compliantly and within the local laws Complete all FRI Readiness activities on time Qualifications  Experiences Required: Marketing/Business Bachelors Degree preferred 5+ years Consumer / Consumer Electronics/IT ecosystem experience across consumer segments Deep understanding of consumer channels, retail channel landscape and impact of emerging trends incl. social plateform Deep experience of partner engagement and/or account management - Building strategic relationships and partnering with senior executives across various types of accounts, such as Consumer Electronics Stores, Mass Merchants, E-tailers, Distributors Proven business operational excellence and sales results through joint business planning, landing channel strategies, account management, and performance monitoring. Driving long-term sustainable sales growth with partners Executive & Intercultural communication skills Cross group collaboration, team player attitude Eagerness to learn, has a stronger challenger mindset to work with multilevel with partners & Microsoft across organization Skills Ability to transform strategic initiatives into actionable plans Apply entrepreneurial and innovative thinking to identify and execute business opportunities Solid knowledge and understanding of Marktplace business and ecosystem. Possess high standards for performance and compliance Influence for impact: ability to identify and influence multiple stakeholder groups, and navigate across complex organization. Story teller: must be able to effectively articulate technology and product positioning to internal audiences and channel partners Burning desire to compete and win, with passion for technology, modern devices and solutions. Diplomacy and comfort managing complex partner conversations Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.  Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

description: SalesTribe is exclusively partnered with Asia Market Entry; a modern business who help international software companies that want to land and expand into the Asia Pacific region. Without the heavy upfront investment.  Established in 2012, Asia Market Entry has worked with a number of up and coming technology vendors to build out Asia expansion strategies, drive partner and channel programs, build government relations and incorporate in Singapore.  The team enjoy extreme client loyalty and are now looking to accelerate the business through the rest of 2021 and beyond.  As a Business Development Advisor, you will be a critical cog in the wheel for their success.  What will you do? Work closely with partner organisations to position enterprise software solutions to the Asia Market. Following up on incoming leads received in the region on behalf of AME customers. Channel development on behalf of AME customers, including researching, pitching, and securing an ecosystem of partnerships to complement AME customers, including system integrators, resellers, and consultants. Managing existing accounts, including increasing AME revenue from existing accounts through the upsell of additional services, offerings and markets. Take a strategic approach to prospecting within new industries and targeting new companies Partnering with marketing to plan and organise marketing campaigns and initiatives, including webinars, seminars, whitepapers, and trade events.  What do you have? Experience in the technology world, in a customer facing role. A hunger and drive to get into a full cycle sales role. Organisational skills, able to manage multiple priorities. A can-do, high-energy attitude, driven to exceed goals A passion for helping people and an understanding An ability to self-motivate and work within a start-up environment  Asia Market Entry is a wonderful entry to the world of technology sales. Giving you exposure to a wide technology landscape, incredible mentors and a career path that sets you up for success. The future is very bright.  If you would like to discuss this role further, please apply or contact Peter Dowling on 97980122 or by sending your CV to peter@salestribe.com

description: Macro (FX & Rates) Salesperson  Singapore  As a Barclays Macro (FX & Rates) Salesperson, you’ll be part of a dynamic Sales team in Singapore that delivers Barclays’ global and regional FX and Rates content, views, product offerings and services to its client franchise in Southeast Asia, which includes institutional clients, such as sovereign wealth funds, central banks & regional banks. You will have the opportunity to develop specialized skillsets and product knowledge in the relevant markets via both structured and on-the-job training.  This role will require the role holder to hold mandatory registrations with:  Financial Industry Regulatory Authority  Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.  What will you be doing?  Distribute timely and relevant macro related market updates and views to the various client segments based on in-house research, traders’ views and other relevant sources Work together with trading and structuring teams to identify and structure trading and investment ideas and to communicate and distribute those to the client franchise Price and execute the various FX and Rates instruments offered by Barclays, and ensure trades are booked correctly and settled in a timely basis Ensure trades are done is a proper manner with the relevant product and credit lines properly setup and clients are properly on-boarded in accordance to relevant regulations Escalate and report any risk related events in a timely fashion to the team lead and/ or senior management  What are we looking for?  Demonstrable working knowledge of FX/ Rates cash and derivative products, including interest rate swaps, cross currency swaps, FX/ Rates options, and asset swaps Good working knowledge in DM/ EM sovereign; supranational and agency bonds is also essential Deep understanding of the main drivers of key macro markets, and ability to engage clients on macro content and ideas exploration Proven track record in managing client relationships across various types of financial institutions and at various seniority levels  Skills That Will Help You In The Role  Excellent fundamental/ macro analytical and mathematical skills Good attention to detail and ability to follow through Ability to take ownership of tasks, work independently and adaptively in a fast paced/ changing environment Quick learner, an independent thinker and a good communicator with the ability to handle stress, persevere and work as part of a regional and global team environment  Where will you be working?  Our office is located in Marina Bay Financial Centre, which has been carefully crafted into a “city in a garden”. Overlooking the scenic skyline along the Marina Bay waterfront, the green spaces and rooftop terraces have been designed to optimise employee well-being. The centre provides an integrated live-work-play development, surrounded by shops, restaurants, gyms and an alfresco dining area. Our convenient office location means you’re just a 5-minute walk from the nearest MRT station.  90287322

description: Who are we?  HubSpot is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform for scaling companies. Tens of thousands of customers all over the world use our marketing, sales, and customer success software to grow their businesses. It's our mission to not just help them grow, but to help them grow better.  At HubSpot, we believe that our values live in our hearts, not our hallways. We want to build a company where people feel empowered to do their best work, wherever they are.  What’s the role?  As a Channel Account Manager (CAM), you will be responsible for building a long term successful strategy for HubSpot channel partners. Using strong consultative skills, you will work with partners (agencies, value added resellers, distributors, system integrators...etc) to sell HubSpot software and associated services to their clients. In addition, you will dissect their business goals and develop a better plan for achieving them.  What will I do? Close new business consistently at or above quota level by focusing on partners with the most potential while also building and advancing a channel pipeline Successfully onboard new partners with the goal of driving their first resell within the first 6 months of the partnership Co-sell partner services (e.g agency retainers, integration, migration, architecture mapping...etc) and HubSpot software with partners Provide sales training and deal-level sales coaching to help partner drive resell and advance in partner tiers Develop a long-term successful strategy for the partners in your book of business, focused around sales planning, sales execution, and business development Develop the ability to dissect a partner’s business goals and help them develop a better plan for achieving them Work collaboratively with marketing, sales, services, ops and technology departments to execute sales strategy as the firm introduces enhancements to existing solutions and/or releases new products Bring your thinking, strategies, and ideas to advance our company’s values, unique culture, and vision for the future Who are you? Driven and committed to exceeding goals and driving success with partners in the India market. Ability to hold partners accountable and proven track record of exceeding revenue targets. Have extensive experience in onboarding and training partners ranging from agencies, value added resellers, distributors and system integrators. Familiar with co-selling with the direct sales team. A positive outlook and a strong ability to take responsibility for your successes as well as your failures. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Exceptional consultative selling skills and closing skills Accurate forecasting and pipeline management Evidence you are a Top Producer in your current role A sharp focus on your goals and a belief that your daily, weekly and monthly activities will help you achieve them. What are the benefits? Generous remuneration + uncapped commissions! Work From Home options available. You choose Home, Office or Flex! World Class New Hire Training Stock units - so that you can share in HubSpot’s future success An education allowance up to USD$5,000 per annum Unlimited Time Off Policy Private health insurance allowance Free books program Annual fitness reimbursement Five-year sabbatical - Paid 4 week sabbatical with USD$5k bonus! A clear career advancement path, with potential for global mobility opportunities Primary Caregiver Leave of 16 weeks and Secondary Caregiver Leave for 6 weeks HubSpot culture is driven by a shared passion for our mission and metrics. It is a culture of amazing, growth-minded people whose values include using good judgment and solving for the customer. Employees who work at HubSpot have HEART: Humble, Empathetic, Adaptable, Remarkable, Transparent.  We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates, so please don’t hesitate to apply — we’d love to hear from you.  About HubSpot  HubSpot (NYSE: HUBS) is a leading customer relationship management (CRM) platform that provides software and support to help businesses grow better. We build marketing, sales, service, and website management products that start free and scale to meet our customers’ needs at any stage of growth. We’re also building a company culture that empowers people to do their best work. If that sounds like something you’d like to be part of, we’d love to hear from you.  You can find out more about our company culture in the HubSpot Culture Code, which has more than 5M views, and learn about our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, too. Thanks to the work of every employee globally, HubSpot was named the #4 Best Place to Work on Glassdoor in 2021, and has been recognized for award-winning culture by Great Place to Work, Comparably, Fortune, Entrepreneur, Inc., and more.  Headquartered in Cambridge, Massachusetts, HubSpot was founded in 2006. Today, thousands of employees work across the globe in HubSpot offices and remotely. Visit our careers website to learn more about culture and opportunities at HubSpot.  By submitting your application, you agree that HubSpot may collect your personal data for recruiting, global organization planning, and related purposes. HubSpot's Privacy Notice explains what personal information we may process, where we may process your personal information, our purposes for processing your personal information, and the rights you can exercise over HubSpot’s use of your personal information.

Your sound understanding of the software solution industry will enable you leverage our partnership and develop sales through our partners channel as well as through direct customer acquisition, across APAC. Define, Plan and Execute the sales strategy and Go-To-Market in your territory Acquire direct and indirect prospects and assess sales opportunities Grow sales opportunities within your territory and existing customer base Deliver accurate business metrics, forecasts, as well as pipeline development reports Raise awareness of NetGuardians in all targeted territories resulting in increased interest from prospects in strong collaboration with the Marketing and Event team You possess excellent negotiation and selling skills, along with excellent presentation skills. You hold a DNA of a high skilled and successful sales professional. You display great engagement skills. You are highly objective driven, show strong ownership and tenacity. University degree in Business Administration, Marketing or Sales 5-7 years’ experience with a proven track record of success in selling software solutions in the Finance sector / banking industry Previous experience in a Fintech or Software company is a strong plus Alternatively, sound knowledge of the risk and compliance field Willingness to travel up to 60%-80% across the APAC region Why join us Commission will be entitled for this role Excellent career development opportunities An international experience with a global customer base A dynamic environment with passionate colleagues The opportunity to be a part of an exciting adventure This is an exceptional opportunity to join a fast growing successful and innovative company

description: Veeva [NYSE: VEEV] is the leader in cloud-based software for the global life sciences industry. Committed to innovation, product excellence, and customer success, our customers range from the world’s largest pharmaceutical companies to emerging biotechs. Veeva’s software helps our customers bring medicines and therapies to patients faster.  We are the first public company to become a Public Benefit Corporation . As a PBC, we are committed to making the industries we serve more productive, and we are committed to creating high-quality employment opportunities.  The Role  Our team is looking for a Sales Development Representative to support our growing commercial business in APAC. In this role, you’ll drive renewal sales and also have the opportunity to build foundational sales skills to support our new growth initiatives.  We’ll invest in your career growth, teaching you about the Life Sciences industry, SaaS technologies, and support you as you develop an authentic sales approach.  What You’ll Do Proactively manage the renewal sales for commercial accounts in Asia Pacific Manage activities and opportunities correctly in our CRM Support Account Executive’s as they close net-new add-on opportunities Work closely with Account Executives and ensure any account-specific risks are addressed proactively Generate and qualify new leads and opportunities in ASEAN Rapidly develop sales skills on the job and through training Requirements 2-3 years of professional experience in a fast-paced environment, preferably in sales, inside sales, sales development or demand generation Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills Ambitious and comfortable taking initiative Team player; able to take accountability and direction Ability to manage time and priorities Nice to Have Experience with Salesforce or other CRM systems Experience or demonstrated interest in Life Sciences, or Technology solutions Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.  Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

description: This is a critical role to help generate funds through sponsorship, philanthropic giving, partnerships and managing existing key accounts to ensure that Esplanade continues to receive the required funding to remain viable through matching funds.  This involves but not limited to, the key areas of corporate sponsorship, public and private fundraising initiatives, maintaining strong partnerships as well as maintaining strong relationships with key sponsors and donors with the objective of maximising revenue and cultivating financial support for the organisation.  Key Responsibilities  To drive the growth of corporate sponsorship for Esplanade’s programmes with a solid strategic sales plan. To develop, nurture and manage long-term relationships between Esplanade and the corporate community, Foundations, embassies/consulates/trade offices, donors and high-net worth Individuals. To help develop strategies and framework for the team on sponsorship and fundraising with the objective of generating revenue, funds and support for Esplanade. This encompasses working with Head, Relationship Management in developing a structure for sponsorships, donations, naming rights, etc. and setting dollar targets as well as timeline. To work closely with marketing partners and sponsors in the areas of sponsorship and partnership marketing via experiential marketing (branding, positioning and etc.) through the arts and The Esplanade Experience. Together with the team, to work in tandem with programming, marketing, and operations to ensure sponsors’ and donors’ deliverables and expectations are met. Budget planning and cost management for the unit including planning, tracking and overseeing overall budget for the unit. Set target revenues and forecasted expenditure and ensures targets are met and expenditures are within budgets together with Head, Relationship Management. Ensure adoption of CRM by team members. Seeking new business opportunities and developments undertaken for the department Working with Head, Relationship Management on staff requirements and training needs Assist in operations and efficiency of projects undertaken and ensure best practices for the unit. To keep abreast of competitive environment and ensure Esplanade’s competitive advantage is always relevant  JOB REQUIREMENTS  Tertiary education in business or marketing or related discipline (or equivalent work experience). Minimum 10 years' experience in business development or marketing with proven track record or minimum 6 years’ experience as a Senior Arts Administrator in a reputable arts centre, major festival or major arts company. Some form of training in the arts will be an advantage Strong leadership skills and business acumen. Excellent interpersonal and communications skills with a flair for liaising with members of the public, corporate community and high-net-worth individuals. Possess strong network of corporate companies and/or high profile contacts. Enthusiasm and personal motivation is paramount. Required to host in the evenings / weekends and Public Holidays  If you are keen to apply for the position and satisfy the requirements, please email us your resume (hr@esplanade.com) with an indication of expected salary and relevant working experience.  We thank you for your interest in the position and Esplanade. Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
industries: Performing Arts

description: Business Development Representative   Do you believe in the future of the creator economy? Do you love education and see its power to transform lives? We do, which is why we are building Nas Academy, an online education platform to empower creators to share their knowledge. https://nasacademy.com/  Nas Academy is looking for a dedicated and enthusiastic Business Development Representative to join our growing outbound sales team. You will be responsible for the development of the lead generation program and nurture outbound sales lead campaigns for Nas Academy products and services.   Key responsibilities include: Managing the top of the funnel and middle of the funnel leads generation  Collaboratively work with the Head of Outbound sales to develop lead generation strategies to generate lead opportunities with prospective customers Hands on experience with email marketing and running email sequence campaign  Providing consistent, concise, accurate and timely weekly/monthly sales lead gen activity reports to management Solving complex technical integration solutions and issues with the Lead generation tool  Achieving sales lead gen and appointment quotas  Qualifications Minimum of 3 - 5 years of sales email marketing experience in an education, internet, or solutions selling environment.  Experience with lead generation and marketing automation software Must be an experienced successful prospector, and be able to independently develop new prospects in a highly competitive environment. Show a proven track record achieving sales lead gen and appointment quotas Must have strong inner drive and self-discipline, proficiency in EXCEL, Word, PowerPoint and Lead Generation Tools   About Nas Academy Nas Academy is an Ed-tech platform for the creator economy founded by Nuseir Yassin (Creator of Nas Daily). Nas means people in Arabic, and as the peoples academy, we want to help every creator monetize their knowledge. We believe content creators on the Internet will be the future journalists, commerce sellers, and educators of the world. We are on a mission to turn creators into academy’s, empowering them to become the world's best educators. Think of it like Masterclass...but for everybody else.   With team members around the world, we are a global platform for creators founded by creators. We are passionate about being a force for good in the world, and providing a platform for voices that are not always heard. Our social media pages have more than 13 billion views and 38 million followers across the internet.  Content creators and storytelling are the future - and we want to help build that future. Our goal is to be the Global leader for online learning. So far, 10,000+ students from over 140 countries have already taken our courses and are part of our community for a lifetime! We aim to grow these numbers by 10x in 2021.  ** Remote position**
industries: E-Learning

jobTitle: Business Development - Marketing and Commerce, ASEAN
description: Introduction  At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.  Your Role and Responsibilities  At IBM iX, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, let’s talk.  About IBM IX  We think bigger than an agency and more creatively than a consultancy with the power to integrate the whole system. We are IBM iX. We were in the leader’s quadrant in Gartner’s 2018 Magic Quadrant for Global Digital Marketing Agencies and rated by IDC as Leader in Digital Strategy in Asia Pacific. In 2019 Forrester Wave for Global Digital Experience Agencies salient quote “compared with other service providers we evaluated, IBM iX has higher customer adoption and ratings of its experience design, analytics, and artificial intelligence and machine learning services”. IBM iX  Your Role And Responsibilities  What You'll Do  Nurturing and building the partnership with Adobe and Magento in the region Work with customers to develop a mutual plan on how IBM iX can help them transform their digital business Partner closely with Service Line and Industry/Sector teams to ensure strong/ compelling customer proposals and recommendations Collaborate closely with local and CIC delivery teams to handle customer concerns and issue resolution Be a trusted advisor for clients in their Digital Transformation journey, and develop a strategic partnership between them and IBM.  What You Need To Succeed  10+ years’ prior experience in an enterprise-level software consulting or services sales role; with a consistent track record for attaining and exceeding annual sales targets. Digital Marketing and Commerce experience is essential, as is knowledge of SaaS and Cloud-based offerings. Experience with and success in Adobe products selling is highly preferred. Ability to build and scale relationships with customers across ASEAN region. Ability to quickly assess Customer environments from a business process, organizational and technological perspective Nurture and develop positive relationships with existing Customers and extend reach within their organizations. Excellent team-building, verbal, and written communication skills as well as reporting and presentation expertise  SG_hotjobs  Required Technical and Professional Expertise  As above  Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise  As above  About Business Unit  IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants that design, build, and run foundational systems and services that is the backbone of the world's economy. IBM Services partners with the world's leading companies in over 170 countries to build smarter businesses by reimagining and reinventing through technology, with its outcome-focused methodologies, industry-leading portfolio and world class research and operations expertise leading to results-driven innovation and enduring excellence.  Your Life @ IBM  What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?  Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.  Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.  About IBM  IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.  Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.  At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.  Location Statement  For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.  Being You @ IBM  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, pregnancy, disability, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

description: This Job is supported by SGUP.  Sanford C. Bernstein wishes to recruit an Institutional Equity salesperson to  work closely with its existing sales team in Singapore, and to focus on both Long Only and Hedge Fund clients. He/she will participate in continuing to build a regional presence in Asia for Bernstein.  As An Institutional Sales Associate, You Will Acquire expertise in multiple equity products and industries while working with our leading global research product, senior sales people, and best-in-class trade execution teams. Interact directly with key investment decision makers at institutional clients including mutual funds, hedge funds, and advisors managing pensions and endowments. Have a high level of responsibility and be empowered to make an important contribution to a sales group organized around geography and investment mandate. While our culture is intellectually rigorous, it is also very collegial and fun. Associates participate in a range of activities including philanthropy, social events, mentoring and annual on- and off-sites.  Qualification  Our Sales Associates Typically Possess Graduated on or before 2019 Track records of outstanding academic performance Breadth of interests and a cosmopolitan outlook Excellent analytical skills Intellectual curiosity Extracurricular activities and leadership Strong interpersonal skills Strong communicators Comfortable in a quantitative environment with a high level of attention to detail Committed to client service We want consummate team players who seek a highly rigorous and challenging environment for their career development. Some Institutional Sales Associates will advance to more senior, producing positions, while others may go on to graduate school.  Sanford C. Bernstein is widely recognized as Wall Street's premier sell-side research and brokerage firm, with a global equity trading platform that spans the U.S., Europe, and Asia. Our firm was founded in the U.S. in 1967 and in the U.K. in 1999. Our research and trading capabilities are sought out by leading investment managers around the world, and we are annually ranked at the top of our industry by acknowledged arbiters. In independent surveys of major institutional clients, Bernstein's research is ranked #1 for overall quality, industry knowledge, most trusted, best detailed financial analysis, major company studies, most useful valuation frameworks and best original research. In Institutional Investor’s latest annual client survey, the leading survey by which research analysts in our industry are evaluated, over 90% of our U.S. analysts and the majority of our European Analysts were recognized as among the best in their respective fields – more than any other firm in our industry. We began operations in Hong Kong in 2010, and now cover a range of sectors across Asia. Our European research team is also home to Extel's #1-ranked analyst across Europe. We are a wholly-owned subsidiary of our buy-side parent, AllianceBernstein.  Singapore
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

10 years of experience in the acquirer or payment gateway company with exposure to regional merchants with multiple market in Southeast Asia Owned and maintain P/L responsibilities Demonstrate experience with a successful track record in managing accounts, building partnership relationships, and driving revenues In-depth knowledge of the payment industry and its competitive background Excellent understanding of payment development processes, pipelines, workflows, and tools Good analytical skills, capable of doing in-depth analysis, to provide business insights and develop strategic to counterchallenges and grow new business Own and maintain an extensive partnership, merchant & channel network in payment industry Experience in working with international partners and multi-countries partnerships Experience of managing a diverse set of stakeholders

description: Overview  Pico is currently seeking candidates for the role of Sales & Account Manager position. The role requires being a content expert in all services provided by Pico as well as having strong project management & time management skills, attention to detail, outstanding oral / written communication skills, and someone that thrives within a fast-paced environment. We are seeking a mix of an aggressive hunter with outstanding sales acumen, laser focused pipeline management and a keen awareness of industry trends as they relate to our clients as well as someone that can deliver top quality services and support for our existing clients in region to grow the business with them. This position will report to Pico’s Head of APAC Sales. The role offers direct interaction with various clients in the financial market space from Global Tier 1 investment banks to sophisticated latency sensitive trading clients, market makers and other technology vendors in addition to internal sales engineering and client delivery staff.  Responsibilities And Duties (include But Are Not Limited To) Develop strong client relationships with prospective clients and research assigned new leads and qualify opportunities via telephone and email. Act as the primary point of contact for all existing client requests, administrative and technical matters, and new business inquiries in a pre-defined set of accounts. Maintain accurate and up-to-date account plans and opportunity information leveraging Salesforce.com, Confluence, and SharePoint for direct accounts under management. Work closely with the product and business team to provide feedback on any client, prospect or partner requirements. Develop overall knowledge of assigned accounts including products sold, asset classes traded, clients, and business issues; proactively and regularly communicate account status to senior management. Collaborate with sales engineering team to help qualify and ultimately win business. Promote a positive, collaborative environment throughout the organization. Contribute to Pico’s understanding of the competitive landscape, differentiation, and industry trends. Gather high-level requirements from client/prospect and confidently tell the Pico ‘story’ with a high-level overview of our products, services, and value proposition. Build proposals and deliver a curated value proposition to client/prospect. Share client feedback on product, service, and pricing with respective internal team members including Product and Engineering. Interact with various stakeholders on the client side at all levels from junior resources up to C-level; identify decision makers; build and maintain client relationships. Win business with the overall goal of maintaining and growing monthly recurring revenue in your account base relative to established sales targets. Participate in regular team forums, meetings, and training sessions. Education, Skills, And Background (including Experience Requirements) Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) from a 4-year university. Minimum 5 years work-related experience in financial technology service industry, with at least 3 years of account relationship experience supporting large Tier 1 banks; equally comfortable and capable interacting with clients in person as via calls and emails. Practical experience with sales, account management, financial markets and/or the securities industry including client interactions via telephone and face-to-face meetings. Experience with Salesfore.com (or other CRM), MS Office, SharePoint, JIRA. Professional demeanor a must. Self-starter with the ability to prioritize, multitask, and take direction when required. Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Team player (as you will be working with others on larger accounts globally), energetic, enthusiastic and organized. Emphasizes on attention to detail & comfortable acting as a de facto project coordinator who will advocate for both the company and client. Driven and proactive, comfortable escalating issues in context of possible solutions.

description: About Us  Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Our global team helps the world’s most-innovative eCommerce merchants eliminate risk and uncertainty from their business. Merchants integrate Riskified’s machine learning platform to create trusted customer relationships, driving higher sales while reducing costs. Riskified has reviewed hundreds of millions of transactions and approved billions of dollars of revenue for global brands and fast-growing businesses across industries, including Wayfair, Wish, Peloton, Gucci, and many more. As of July 29th, 2021, Riskified has begun trading on NYSE under the ticker RSKD.  About The Role  As Riskified’s VP & GM of Sales for APAC, you will be charged with building out and driving alignment across regional GTM teams to meet the financial targets. You will build a GTM strategy for the APAC region that aligns with and delivers on the company’s expansion and revenue goals. You will work closely and collaboratively with business leaders to generate growth, build the regional company culture, and establish strong partner relationships.  The VP & GM of Sales is charged with leading and developing the APAC region driving the company’s expansion strategy, and for generating profitable growth for the company. The VP & GM of Sales will be tasked with driving adoption of Riskified’s solution in the wider enterprise markets. He/She/They will continuously strive to improve Riskified’s sales process, build and growth partners ecosystem, people and tools, in order to deliver the highest value to its customers. This individual should have proven success selling SaaS products to enterprise level clients and be comfortable with lengthy sales cycles in high-growth technology sectors.  What You'll Be Doing Collaborate across cross-functional teams and business leaders to develop and deliver on a holistic GTM strategy that aligns with the company’s revenue goals Build, lead and scale the high performing enterprise sales team in the APAC region and drive performance against the growth targets for the business Act as the regional point of contact to C-level and other senior executives, aligning on company goals and priorities, as well as communicating corporate messaging to regional team members Build a regional company culture aligned with the company’s operating principles, building a sense of team and driving engagement and effectiveness Build valuable relationships in our key verticals to grow the Enterprise business Forecast, track and report sales performance with our internal tools Develop sales processes Establish account strategy, set goals, and manage pipeline Build strong, long-lasting relationships with mid-to-large enterprise level clients Plan, implement and manage sales activities and pipeline to meet annual revenue targets and business goals Guide opportunities through to successful closure Develop, expand and leverage partner ecosystem to expand new routes to market Scope projects, shape engagements, and help define business solutions that best satisfy clients' needs and achieve their desired business outcomes Responsible for new business across developers, tech platforms and other key buyers of location based services inclusive of API, SDK and the Foursquare Places Database Clearly and precisely communicate up and across the organization Develop strong relationships across the organization, including the legal, finance, product, marketing and engineering organizations Qualifications Experienced sales executive, with a minimum of 10 years experience building and scaling successful Enterprise B2B sales teams Proven success navigating large organizations by identifying decision makers and necessary processes for SaaS investments Broad understanding of the general internet, software, fintech, payment, and B2B SaaS marketplaces, strong industry contacts, and the ability to respond quickly to critical business issues Consistent track record as a high velocity performer throughout his or her career, preferably with strong revenue growth experience Demonstrated ability to execute, to make things happen, and to create ubiquitous brand awareness is key A reputation for team building and a demonstrated track record managing a global team to high levels of performance and establishing effective and efficient processes Demonstrated experience using data and market insights to drive decision making A natural inclination to solve problems in a creative and resourceful manner An ability to develop a coherent, forward-looking strategies to create new business opportunities Strong leadership skills and superb written and verbal communication skills In The News  Reuters: General Atlantic-Backed Riskified is Valued at 4.3 BLN in NYSE Debut  FoxBusiness: Fraud Protection Platform 'Riskified' Begins Trading on NYSE  Announcing Riskified's $165M Funding Round  TechCrunch: Riskified Prevents Fraud on Your Favorite eCommerce Site  Inc Magazine: Best Workplaces  Calcalist: Riskified is the Most Promising Startup  Inc.com: 15 Israeli Startups You Need to Know

description: Location: Singapore, Singapore  Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.  Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.  Position Summary  Provide a general statement regarding the overall objective of the positon (e.g., the purpose of the job and why this position exists)  Reporting to the Vice President of Worldwide Sales and Marketing, the Sales and Business Development Director for APAC works with customers (internal and external) to sustain and develop new business for Guavus within the region of APAC. Closing and successfully delivering new business within assigned territory  Maintaining and reporting an accurate sales forecast and update on sales opportunities/leads  Chorus Role(s)  Insert Chorus Role(s) link here  Minimum Requirements: Skills, Experience, Education, Technical/Specialized Knowledge, Certifications, Language  Include minimum experience qualifications, required proficiencies with specialized knowledge, computer proficiencies, etc. 7 -15 years of experience in Sales and Business development to CSPs and potentially other vertical segments within the APAC region ideally in the field of AI/Analytics field. Bachelor’s degree / Master’s in Computer Science or equivalent Must be fluent in English, Additional languages relevant for the APAC region are a plus Preferred Qualifications  Preferred attributes for the position, which are not required in the minimum qualifications (e.g., master degree)  Knowledge of APAC Telco market and ideally other vertical markets (Gov, Transport, etc…)  Knowledge of advanced analytics, AI based platform and Cloud transformation domains is an asset  Track record in Sales/Business development  Physical Demands  Include the amount of time on physical activities and whether the job requires that weight be lifted, that force be exerted, or has specific vision requirements, etc.  Travel if/when needed (up to 40% of the time if necessary)  Trade Compliance Requirements  Mandatory Section: addresses direct or indirect access to hardware, software, technology or technical data controlled under Canadian and/or US export control laws. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. description: Company Description  Twitter, Inc. is the best and fastest place to see what’s happening and what people are talking about all around the world. From breaking news and entertainment to sports and politics, from big events to everyday interests. If it’s happening anywhere, it’s happening first on Twitter. Twitter is where the full story unfolds with all the live commentary and where live events come to life unlike anywhere else. Twitter is available in more than 40 languages around the world. The service can be accessed at Twitter.com and on a variety of mobile devices. For more information, visit about.twitter.com  Job Description  Twitter is seeking an exceptional digital leader to lead the China Twitter Client Solutions business. This is a rare opportunity to lead one of the most exciting communication products ever invented as Twitter continues to the future of healthy conversations.  The Head of Greater China Sales will lead Twitter into its next horizon of growth and market impact. This role will lead revenue generation of $XXXM+ and client relationships across a portfolio of industries with the market’s most strategic accounts and their advertising agencies. In addition this position will continue to build a strong culture and be the spokesperson, both internally and externally for one of the most exciting communication products ever invented; during its period of development and expansion.  The ideal candidate will bring a combination of business leadership, strategic thinking, analytical problem solving and deep product knowledge all with a country-specific perspective. He/she will be a spokesperson for the company at external conferences and events as well as interactions with the press. He/she will also be expected to foster a creative, productive and innovative cultural aligned with Twitter overall.  Cross-functional collaboration will also be of paramount importance as this highly visible role must partner successfully with Marketing, Product Management, Finance, Engineering and Human Resources.  Critical Competencies for Success Strong collaboration, communication & Influencing skills In the context of a management team that succeeds through collaboration and teamwork, this person will introduce fresh thinking in a compelling, fact-based way without driving a personal agenda. This person will build trust by focusing on measurable results, adding value to the country & wider organization and identifying new ways to remove blockers to enable faster execution. Will have a reputation for partnering at all levels and constituencies within an organization. In the absence of direct reporting lines, this person must possess effective influencing skills to secure cross functional buy in collaboration. Driving country revenue and advertiser/partner satisfaction while fostering a cohesive environment and culture consistent with Twitter’s values. Being well recognized as an influential industry thought leader and spokesperson for Twitter to help shape the Company’s reputation and the direction of the country. Strong Leader and Builder of teams This person should have strong track record of building and leading great teams. This executive will be able to demonstrate a track record in hiring and developing talent who have gone on to be leaders in other organisations, or have followed this person to new roles and wanted to work for her/him again. This former team will attribute their success to their time working with her/him. Leading complex cross functional projects to successful outcome both in terms of meeting objectives and doing so in a way that is true to our Corporate Values. Business Acumen This leader will serve as coach, collaborator, facilitator and senior advisor. Like all executives at Twitter, she or he must demonstrate a track record of flexibility, innovation and engagement. She or he will operate like all other business leaders, in a thoughtful and metrics oriented fashion. Publically represents the company's interests and position to interest groups, journalists and policy makers etc. Qualifications  Qualifications 15+ years of demonstrated career progression and strong performance as a senior leader, ideally in digital content, platform sales or related business. A minimum of 10 years leading a sales or partnership development organization. Proven track record of successfully negotiating deals at senior levels of major brand and/or media companies; ideally brings deep relationships from the media and agency landscape. Knowledge of mobile and internet products and technologies; well-developed product sensibility and experience leading creative discussions regarding potentially innovative, unique and engaging context and product offerings Track-record of collaboration and influencing across a large organization to deliver to expectations. Management of a team across countries in a client-facing environment. Proven ability to use measurements and analytics to position data to illustrate impact. Bachelor’s degree with a strong academic record. Strong communication skills. Fluent English and Mandarin to support our business in the Greater China region. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
industries: Internet

description: Here at Anaplan, we have reinvented how companies see, plan, and run their businesses. Our platform allows our customers to uncover new insights, connect their strategy to their plans, and work in ways they had not previously thought possible. We’re growing fast, constantly innovating, and couldn’t be prouder to help our customers move forward with confidence in a sophisticated and changing world.  We are looking for forward-thinking people who bend over backward to put customers first. Individuals who thrive on challenge and are ready to grasp the opportunity of a lifetime. Because we fundamentally believe every colleague brings unique value to our whole. We are a workplace where each person feels seen, heard, and valued, and can contribute their unique talent to our collective effort. We believe that for ourselves and for our customers.  Being a part of the Emerging Markets team in Anaplan means being part of one of the fastest growing cloud vendors and making your mark on the industry. You have the opportunity to work with a team of professionals that are hugely successful, every one of which exceeding their quotas last year (and we have outstanding commission structures). The potential for rapid career growth based on performance and success.  The Emerging Markets business in Anaplan work specifically with partners (for scale of growth and speed to value) with the aim of growing net new business. Based in Singapore and covering Hong Kong, this role allows you to define your market, allowing your true entrepreneurial skills to flourish. The opportunity within this segment is huge. This is no ordinary role, no ordinary team and no ordinary company!  Do you have boundless energy, persistence, and a strong desire to “pursue the win? Are you inspired to bring new ideas to market? Able to challenge the old way of doing things? Are you able to define an addressable market, build multiple GTM plans with multiple partners and support them in joint execution whilst bringing all the stakeholders with you along the way? Then this job is for you!  Core Responsibilities  Reporting directly to the Regional VP Asia, you will work with both internal resources and Partner sales/implementation talent to drive joint customer revenue and expand out the Enterprise & Commerical Markets. Identify, create and lead key sales opportunities, while closely engaging Partners for pre-sales support and Customer implementation Build and drive Anaplan’s business value throughout the selling engagement. Navigating complex prospect environments to align both Partners and Customer Prospects around the Anaplan solution Develop and execute joint value propositions, and Partner/Customer centric strategic plans Ongoing, non-stop development of relationships with both Partners and Customers Build and maintaining a pipeline and forecasting of high-quality opportunities Utilize Anaplan’s value-based selling methodology and Salesforce.com to lead sales processes and accurately forecast business Achieve/Exceed revenue targets Evangelize the Commercial Market team and our directive, as it expands within the region Use your local of the partner ecosystem to support the recruitment and leverage partners and existing customers in your territory to build your Anaplan “franchise” Exemplify Anaplan Core Values, Goals and Objectives Requirements 3-6 years software sales experience - preferably selling EPM, ERP or BI software solutions Experience with Partner Eco-Systems or selling through Partners & GSI’s Network with major clients and partners in your territory Experience selling into commercial & Enterprise companies Strong technical aptitude to learn Anaplan solution quickly Consultative selling skills; customer and partner oriented Team based attitude Excellent communication, presentation skills Balanced decision making and ability to take initiative—Get Stuff Done Consistency and reliability Ability to understand and navigate in a complex sales/software environment Validated ability to meet and exceed a sales quota Travel up to 40% Bachelor’s degree Cantonese language speaking is preferred What We Offer A rewarding, progressive career with a company that values diversity, flexibility and understands the need for a good work/life balance. Market-leading salaries combined with generous bonuses, equity and a range of comprehensive benefits. Regular agile meetups, events and hackathons (both attending and hosting!) Flexible working, catered lunches, a fully stocked kitchen and plenty of parties and events A range of sports, health and wellbeing initiatives 3 days of paid leave every year to help support the charity or cause of your choice. Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  Build your job in a place that thrives on diversity, inclusion, and belonging. We believe in maintaining a hiring and working experience in which all people are respected and valued, regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes people unique. We hire you for who you are, and we want you to bring your true self to work every day!  COVID-19  Protecting the health and safety of our communities, including our employees and of those considering a career at Anaplan, is our highest priority. We continue to closely monitor the evolving situation and we appreciate your understanding and flexibility with any related changes to our interviewing process.

Relationship builder, who can communicate at different levels of the organisation and business partners effectively.
