description: Collaborate with members of the Marketing team to penetrate key markets. Define the approach for the overall sale of new business and account retention. Develop a comprehensive sales and distribution strategy to maximise sales opportunities. Develop sales and distribution policies that reflect the organisation's goals. Direct the Sales team in generating proposals that define a clear path to client satisfaction and revenue growth. Establish customer relationship management (CRM) systems and guidelines to manage customer relationships. Establish internal guidelines for personal data protection based on applicable legislations, to manage customer data. Foster relationships with new partners to achieve desired revenue. Influence senior stakeholders within customers' organisations and premier buyers in the industry. Investigate factors impacting sales performance. Leverage innovations to maximise revenue of traditional and digital assets and products. Monitor changes in the industry and leverage them for business opportunities. Outline objectives in key target areas such as sales volume, market share, distribution channels and profit margins to guide promotions and sponsorships. Participate in forums to keep abreast of new changes in the industry and practices. Promote positive relationships with major customers to understand their needs. Provide advice when preparing bid documents and integrated proposals for key accounts. Provide input on sales incentive structure and key performance indicators to help monitor targets. Provide input to the Content Development team based on customer and industry feedback. Recommend changes in pricing structures in product lines or products. Review sales performance by analysing performance reports.
industries: Apparel & Fashion, Retail, and Luxury Goods & Jewelry

description: Job Responsibilities Kickstart the agency sales team as the new sales arm of Daily Vanity Setup processes, recruitment, training, and sales direction of the new agency arm Approach potential clients and conduct sales pitch via a consultative approach based on their needs and budget Research and be in touch with the industry's trends and clients' campaigns Monitor sales and pipelines closely Maintain excellent relationships with clients Communicate with Campaign and Content team to ensure successful execution of client's campaigns Requirements Excellent communication skills, telephone and video conference manners A competitive streak Dynamic, focused and self-motivated Ability to work under pressure to meet targets Takes ownership and able to work independently Takes the initiative to offer solutions to problems Comfortable analysing numbers and reports Preferably at least 3 to 5 years of related experience
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Online Media, and Events Services

description: About the role  As a Senior Business Development Specialist, you play a critical role in creating new business opportunities for Telstra through delivering creative and market defining sales solutions for your client portfolio. You are hyper aware of current and emerging market trends and what they mean for your client's business. Your ability to infuse Telstra's products and services into tailored, new solutions that anticipate the needs of our client's sees you contribute to the growth of Telstra's business and to forge strong relationships within the market.  Your collaborative and customer-centric mindset means the sales solutions you design are integrated and balanced, delivering value to our business and our customers. You use your exceptional relationship building and negotiation skills to successful close complex, multi-domain sales that directly shape Telstra's growth.  Key Responsibilities  As a Senior Business Development Specialist, you apply your excellent relationship management skills, ability to identify growth opportunities and intimate understanding of the client's business to deliver against the following responsibilities:    Actively identify, develop and qualify new business opportunities with new and existing customers, leveraging your strong interpersonal skills to liaise with the acquisition, account management and sales teams to define and execute commercial growth strategies for your portfolio. Make a strong contribution to revenue growth within your portfolio through your ability to actively develop a strong sales pipeline, identify new sales opportunities through competitive research and partnership deals, and negotiate complex commercial constructs with clients (including drafting contracts) to close sales. Lead the establishment, maintenance and execution of portfolio pursuit plans, ensuring they align to Telstra's broader business plan, and integrate products, solutions and service offerings in order to achieve the sales strategy. Authentically engage with and effectively influence a diverse, multi-stakeholder client (including executives e.g. CIO, CTO) and internal landscape (i.e. solution sales, opportunity owners, Account Executives) to build an in-depth understanding of customer needs in order to identify solution requirements, anticipate future needs and foster relationship building. Leverage your extensive knowledge of new and emerging enterprise technology solutions, Telstra's products and solutions, intimate knowledge of the customer's business, industry and their current portfolio to broaden the scope of opportunities and deliver sales revenue growth. Take an innovative and creative approach to addressing current and future customer needs through combining several existing Telstra products/services and partner products/services in developing sales solutions and supporting new collaborative business models with customers. Gather relevant sources of information and insights to build an in-depth understanding of new business opportunities, including actively following local and international industry trends to pre-empt opportunities as well as potential risks, issues and challenges to drive business growth for Telstra. Contribute to or lead components of knowledge sharing initiatives (market insights, customer focused cross-functional collaboration) that have a significant degree of impact to portfolio revenue growth and team member development. Interested?  We're committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce in all its forms. We encourage applicants from diverse gender, cultural and linguistic backgrounds and applicants who may be living with a disability. We also offer flexibility in all our roles, to ensure everyone can participate.  To learn more about how we support our people, including accessibility adjustments we can provide you through the recruitment process, visit tel.st/thrive.
industries: Telecommunications

description: Responsibilities Work with senior management to design, develop and execute a broad range of strategic initiatives with the goal of helping Ninja Direct grow Take direct responsibility for the business’ sales strategy Lead the charge in securing our value proposition with our target customer segments while helping to define and improve on our core customer journey Formulate and implement sales best practices across our local sales teams Ensure that the performance of sales teams is tracked and managed accurately Play an active role in developing our local sales teams through hiring and training Manage stakeholders across multiple layers, functions and geographies to ensure alignment across the business Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in relevant business discipline 3 - 5 years of relevant experience in sales management, business development, management consulting or similar roles. Prior P&L ownership will be highly favored. Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and Gsheets Proven track record of success in high-pressure environments, comfortable dealing with ambiguity and change Strong stakeholder management and communication skills - Proven track record of driving complex regional projects and working with senior stakeholders across the business Exposure to working across geographies, teams and individuals of different cultures, particularly across Southeast Asia Strong analytical abilities and a structured, data-driven approach to problem solving while possessing commercial acumen Organised, highly motivated and able to handle multiple projects / timelines concurrently
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: Are you ready to trade your job for a journey? Become a FlyMate!  Passion, excitement & global collaboration are all core to what it means to be a FlyMate. At Flywire, we’re on a mission to deliver the world’s most important and complex payments. We use our Flywire Advantage - the combination of our next-gen payments platform, proprietary payment network and vertical specific software, to help our clients get paid, and help their customers pay with ease - no matter where they are in the world.  What more do we need to truly be unstoppable? Perhaps, that is you!  Who We Are  Flywire is a global payments enablement and software company, founded a decade ago to solve high-stakes, high-value payments in education, using modern technology.  Today, we’ve digitized payments for more than 2,400 global clients across education, healthcare, travel & B2B, covering more than 240 countries and territories and supporting over 130 currencies. And, we’re just getting started!  With over 500 global FlyMates, representing more than 40 nationalities, and in 12 offices world-wide, we’re looking for FlyMates to join the next stage of our journey as we continue to grow.  The Opportunity  We, at Flywire, are seeking a Senior Sales Manager who will spend most of their time with prospective clients! Flywire is seeking an experienced and motivated Senior Sales Manager to join our growing team in Singapore for the Asia market (Less Japan & ANZ). This position is accountable for the full sales cycle from start to getting them onboard, pursuing new business and opportunities in order to effectively acquire, lead, and profitably grow our client database. This person will convert client conversations into qualified, developed, proposed, and closed sales opportunities. Focus on developing strategic education accounts Work autonomously to meet and exceed sales targets Investigate and solve problems for clients by tailoring plans which addresses their needs Develop in-depth knowledge of the business product offering and value proposition Work with internal teams to engage audiences and develop business strategies Be involved in Presentations, Demos and events to build up a robust client base Here’s What We’re Looking For: At least 8 years of experience in selling across APAC Experience in sourcing prospects - including account development and cold calling Experience in the Education or payments industry will be advantageous Experience in planning and implementing sales strategies Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficient in Microsoft Office/ Google Workspace What We Offer Competitive compensation, including stock options Flying Start - Our immersive Global Induction Program (Meet our Execs & Global Teams) Work with brilliant people that will keep you on your toes, learn more about their journeys by checking out #InsideFlywire on social media Dynamic & Global Team (we have been collaborating virtually for years!) Wellbeing Programs (Mental Health, Wellness, Yoga/Pilates/HIIT Classes) with Global FlyMates Be a meaningful part in our success - every FlyMate makes an impact Competitive time off including FlyBetter Days to volunteer in a cause you believe in Great Talent & Development Programs (Managers Taking Flight – for new or aspiring managers!) Submit today and get started!  We are excited to get to know you! Throughout our process you can expect 4-5 rounds of interviews with different FlyMates including the Hiring Manager, Peers on the team, the VP of the department, and a homework assignment (don’t worry - this is the fun part!) your Talent Acquisition Partner will walk you through the steps and be your “go-to” person for any questions.  Additional Information  Flywire is an equal opportunity employer. With over 40 nationalities across 12 different offices, and diversity and inclusion at the core of our people agenda, we believe our FlyMates are our greatest asset, and we’re excited to watch our unique culture evolve with each new hire.
industries: Financial Services

jobTitle: Business Development Manager - L'Oreal International Distribution (LID)
description: Who are we?  L’Oréal International Distribution (LID) is a new Go-To-Market, multi-brand structure, which will mainly work regional or national distributors and, in specific cases, directly with certain regional retailers or directly via e-commerce (multi – country sites).  What are we looking for?  The role of Business Development Manager will have the strategic responsibility to drive the multi-division brand commercial strategy across certain channels and regions.  In This Role, You Will Develop, monitor and manage a portfolio of accounts / distributors / retailers, in accordance with the strategy of the division and the brands Develop and design the go-to-market strategy of the brand in the respective market Along with the partners, create and monitor the annual business plan/trade plan, to achieve brand results (sell-in, sell-out, market share) and the profitability of brands within the account. Lead or participate in the discussions with clients on key launches, space, location and stock. Determine the eComm strategy and sustainable vision to increase weight of business Create and maintain an eComm plan, e-promotional calendar, product exclusivities, cross selling mechanisms, data ownership along with the eComm partner Identify the potential for commercial development of existing customers and develop their loyalty Help customers to develop their own business: sales, merchandising, technical assistance, coaching, training and team motivation. Visits customers and retail regularly to help develop the business while maintaining excellent relationships Identify prospects within the industry and develop new business relationships. Work close with all functions marketing/ finance/ supply chain to ensure the strategic priorities are in line across functions The Ideal Candidate Should Have 5+ years previous experience within a similar role within a similar environment Entrepreneurial mindset and digital savviness are keys for this role to drive the Go to Market strategies for the multi divisions B2C / eComm channels Strong leadership & business acumen Strong comfort levels with quantitative and qualitative measures and analysis Strong collaborative skills to work with all key stakeholders, internal and external Excellent interpersonal skills, natural ability to build strong business relationships Problem solving skills and contingency planning mindset to operate in a proactive vis-a-vis reactive mode. A willingness to own the strategic direction whilst maintaining a passion for grass-roots Comfort in operating in a fast-paced, agile and ever-changing dynamic environment Other Requirements  The role will require travelling in the region (approximately 20-30%)
industries: Consumer Goods and Cosmetics

description: As an Account Executive, you will be responsible for building strong customer relationships in the field and ensuring an outstanding customer experience with existing and potential customers.  You Will Develop an understanding of customers’ business and solution requirements Gain share of spend across Dell Technologies portfolio of technology solutions: client, server, storage, networking, software, security and led services Run territory and or accounts, including account planning, sales forecasting, engaging cross-functional resources and working with the virtual teams to ensure alignment across the organizations Regularly engage with decision makers at client facilities in performing primary duties Provide sales leadership and experience on large, sophisticated opportunities Take the first step towards your dream career  Essential Requirements  Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: 8 to 12 years of experience selling technology solutions Extraordinary customer management and strategic selling skills Aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions tackle business problems Strong communication, collaboration and executive presentation skills, and the ability to provide insight and thought leadership to senior management Desirable Requirements Bachelor’s degree (BS/BA)
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Computer Software

description: The person will be responsible for achieving Sales from the respective geography. It will broadly encapsulate managing Leads, coordinating with Channel Partners (CP), making calls to International Leads, explaining the projects, follow up with them and converting into sales. It will also include completing the documentation of sales with the customers and maintaining customer database. The JD also includes handling of CP relationships.  Conversion of enquiries into sales Lead Management, touch base with International Leads Helping the customers in booking apartments and related documentation Responsible for targets prescribed for the market. Channel Partner Engagement Build on rapport with existing CPs Create newer CP relations in the market. Train CPs on our products and constantly monitors CP performance Handles payouts of CP by coordinating with the regions. KEY DELIVERABLES / KEY RESULT AREAS Meeting International Sales Target set for APAC market. Completion of International sales documentation Cross selling of projects Internationally Maintaining CP Relations and add more CPs in the market. Representation at exhibitions and expos internationally. Requirements For Language Proficiency  Should be able to converse fluiently in English and Hindi.

Seeking for opportunities and advancements? We are on a lookout for individuals with talents, and whom are willing to learn and develop themselves.   Tasks: - Presenting client's product to potential customers - Leading and coaching a team - Engaging with customers  Requirements: - Singaporeans only - Full-Time commitment levels - Strong learning attitude  Benefits: - One-to-one coaching and mentorship - Personal development and leadership workshops - Traveling opportunities to gain exposures - Thrive in a 100% performance-based industry

Description  It’s an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of Inc. magazine’s Best Workplaces for 2020, Infoblox is the leader in cloud-first networking and security services. Our solutions empower organizations to take full advantage of the cloud to deliver network experiences that are inherently simple, scalable, and reliable for everyone. Infoblox customers are among the largest enterprises in the world and include 70% of the Fortune 500, and our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way.  We are looking for a Business Development Representative – Singapore & Philippines to join our APJ team in Singapore, reporting to the manager of Business Development. In this role, you will generate and qualify sales opportunities for follow-up by the direct sales teams. This role will provide an opportunity to work for an industry leader in cybersecurity and to gain fantastic experience within a sales environment.  You’re the ideal candidate if you are passionate about technology, are results-driven, and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.  What you’ll do:  Understand the business needs of our potential customers, be able to think on your feet, and possess the drive to become a product expert Engage in heavy calling, use of email, and other methods to target and qualify potential prospects Carry out presales activities to develop a high-quality lead funnel and maximize these efforts to meet or exceed quotas for calls and qualified meetings Develop and use your understanding of Infoblox technology to be a reliable customer resource Set meetings with prospective clients Partner closely with the sales team to develop and implement prospect strategies and plans—including ensuring that representatives have the essential budget, key party, and project information before handing over an opportunity Support multiple states within an assigned territory  What you’ll bring:  0 to 3 years of experience calling on IT executives within all sizes of organizations A high level of energy and motivation, as well as strong attention to detail A strong desire to grow your career in sales Strong organizational and customer service skills required Ability to organize and prioritize work independently with minimal supervision Excellent telephone selling skills are a must Must be able to converse in a business level English, proficiency in Tagalog is an added advantage A diploma, bachelor’s degree, or equivalent Priority will be given to applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore and do not require sponsorship of work visa  What success looks like:  After six months, you will…  Gain Infoblox products knowledge and security offerings Articulate the Infoblox benefits based on solutions Effectively use BANT to qualify new prospects Partner with the sales team on customer meetings and on developing a high-quality lead funnel Hit or overachieve your monthly targets  After About a Year, You Will…  Build a strong pipeline and close lead opportunities Be able to fully qualify an opportunity Gain more experience in expansion of customer and/or vertical coverage Become a subject matter expert in qualifying and pitching Infoblox’s unique selling proposition Meet or exceed your annual targets  We’ve got you covered:  Our holistic benefits package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness—as well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, including a Provident Fund with company match and paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our values every day—we believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers.  Why Infoblox?  We’ve created a culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you’re a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out what it’s like to be a Bloxer. We think you’ll be excited to join our team.
industries: Computer Software, Computer Networking, and Computer & Network Security

description: At a glance Our Sales Managers are the front-line leaders of Chope’s market growth through software sales and F&B merchant acquisition. They report directly to the Head of Sales, and have a pivotal role in leading, grooming, and shaping the Singapore Sales team. In addition to their leadership role, they might also need to generate leads, build partnerships with key actors in the F&B scene, follow up, and close sales opportunities for high-yield accounts.  As part of nurturing strong account relations, the sales team will be key contact for their clients, and also undertake contractual and marketing-related account management. Like the team they lead, they will be expected to meet ambitious quarterly sales targets, and work closely with our marketing, account management, and operations teams to help our clients get the most out of the Chope platform, both operationally and marketing-wise.  Ideal candidates should have at least a two year’s experience in managing and motivating a sales team, as well as at least 2 to 3 years’ in B2B sales. Previous exposure to e-commerce and/or SaaS will definitely be an advantage. Candidates should have a keen understanding of performance metrics for sales people, and preferably be able to ‘lead from the front’, juggling both their own performance as well as that of their team.   About the role Lead a team of sales individuals to acquire and develop sales opportunities through a combination of channels, including but not limited to, referrals, networking, cold calls, and face-to-face meetings Consistently find ways to increase inbound and outbound lead generation through a combination of internal and external resources, to ultimately increase the overall sales team’s output Diligently monitor sales team stakeholders’ performance and take part/follow up on key account and large-scale group acquisition Impart consultative skills and hard sales skills within the team to ensure their ability to make purposeful recommendations to restaurant decision makers on our products and services while communicating the value of joining the Chope network Build a lasting relationship with decision makers in the F&B industry (e.g. restaurants, associations, agencies, etc) to maintain the possibility of future sales or client referrals Work closely with the Operations team’s leaders to facilitate successful product adoption by new clients Enable team to upsell additional paid-services to existing clients Manage the expectations, morale, and performance of their sales executives Recruit, develop, and retain a high-performing sales team Generate partnership opportunities that enables impactful client engagement, monetisation of our paid marketing offerings, and large-scale restaurant acquisition  Requirements At least 5-6 years’ experience in B2B sales, with 2-3 years managing a team Possesses a natural ability to network and build lasting business relationships  Understands the techniques of a consultative sell Independent and result-driven mindset, with the ability to be productive and efficient with minimal or no supervision in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment Analytical, detail-oriented, and conscientious  Resilient and methodical Proven track record of exceeding set sales targets Basic computer literacy in the Microsoft Office suite of software  While not required, the following skills/experience will be favourably considered Experience in the sale of restaurant reservations/table management systems such as ResPak etc., or in other food and beverage related SaaS products  Why Chope? Meaningful work - you’ll have ownership over and the ability to make a direct impact on the experience we’re delivering to our customers (you’re not here “just to execute”) Autonomy - you’ll be in an environment that enables you to challenge yourself, challenge team members, learn new skills, shape discussions and new initiatives, and try out new things Collaborative and an open culture that values receiving and giving feedback   A competitive salary  Flexible work arrangements that provide you the balance you deserve  We regret to inform that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted
industries: Internet

description: Come create the technology that helps the world act together  Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.  We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.  The team you’ll part of  The Customer Experience (CX) organization provides a common interface to customers including account and relationship management, acting as the voice of the customer internally and creating demand across our business groups. While bringing deep understanding of local markets for our customer, the CX organization ensures strong alignment between sales and delivery teams.  The ambition of Enterprise Sales within CX organization is to grow faster than the market and develop premium margin revenue streams with a focus on disruption trends such as private wireless, Industrial automation, IoT, to unfold opportunities in the Information & Communications Technology (ICT) industries. It would also drive Nokia’s business in the Industrial and Government space with direct and indirect partner sales, including accountability for pre-sales, marketing, market services and building segment expertise. The team will also drive Nokia’s partnership, particularly the service provider as a partner channel, to jointly deliver digital platforms of the future enabled by 5G and beyond.  What You Will Learn And Contribute To  As the Head of Sales, Enterprise ASEAN, you will Be responsible for working with a team of Account Managers and Partner Sales Managers responsible for capturing new business while maximizing ongoing revenue from existing accounts. Some of these resources will be matrix-managed. Identify priority customer targets and develop strategies to penetrate using a combination of direct touch and partner relationships. Hold accountability for orders, sales and SVM according to agreed targets. Ensure the highest degree of compliance with company policies and directives and statutory regulations. Act as a champion for Enterprise ASEAN business by providing insight into current and future total addressable market (TAM), segment opportunities, emerging trends and specific customer needs. Hold responsibility for creating and maintaining the regional strategic plan with a 3-year window. Support Nokia’s Governance frameworks by providing regular, timely and accurate reporting of customer and project status. Create and maintain Strategic Account Plans for top customers. Maintain executive relationships with key customers and external stakeholders. Provide an escalation path for critical operational issues. For indirect business, direct the selection of the most appropriate channels and manage potential conflicts in coordination with the Channel and/or Distribution teams. Create and maintain a list of key dependencies for business growth, including marketing support needs, product feature gaps and operational support requirements. Take responsibility for end-user customer satisfaction. Provide personal growth opportunities for team members and ensure their ideas and issues are listened to and shared where appropriate. Your Skills And Experience  You have Minimum of 15 years working in ICT at senior technical and/or sales levels (at least 5 of which at senior management levels) Detailed knowledge of the ICT market in ASEAN, including infrastructure requirements and regulatory environments. Experience as CSO/CBT Head would be preferred Proven track record of sales success in ASEAN. Existing personal network covering Government and Enterprise end users, regulatory and planning bodies, system integrators/VARs and local industry groups. Proven track record in leading sales or sales support teams. It would be nice if you also had Dynamic, results-driven sales mentality Can do approach, high energy, used to an environment where closing new business is key Strong leadership skills with high degree of motivational capability Ability to achieve clearly aligned goals in complex, matrix-oriented organisations with multiple stakeholders Ability to plan and execute complex sales including multiple product lines, suppliers, and partners Visionary thinker – able to see past the next horizon Able to work under pressure and with tight deadlines Highly disciplined approach to sales management, especially pipeline management Strong interpersonal and influencing skills Values the contribution of employees and acts as an employee champion Professional / diplomatic approach What We Offer  Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.  Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer  Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg Workplace Pride Global Benchmark LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.  Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.  We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.  Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.  Job  Account&Cust. Relatnshp Mgmt-Entrprise - Head of Sales  Primary Location  Asia Pacific & Japan-Singapore-Singapore-Singapore  Other Locations  Asia Pacific & Japan-Indonesia-Indonesia, Asia Pacific & Japan-Malaysia-Malaysia-Kuala Lumpur  Schedule  Full-time
industries: Information Technology and Services and Telecommunications

jobTitle: Account Executive, Mid Market Sales - Slack
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  Job Category Sales Job Details  About Slack, a Salesforce Company  Slack has transformed business communication. It’s the leading channel-based messaging platform, used by millions to align their teams, unify their systems, and drive their businesses forward. Only Slack offers a secure, enterprise-grade environment that can scale with the largest companies in the world. It is a new layer of the business technology stack where people can work together more effectively, connect all their other software tools and services, and find the information they need to do their best work. Slack is where work happens.  What We're Looking For...  We are very excited to welcome Slack to our ever growing Ohana at Salesforce. With the recent announcement of the Slack acquisition, we have brand new opportunities to grow our Singapore team.  We are looking for Account Executives to join our Sales team and focus on our Mid Market customers in Singapore. This segment represents a huge opportunity for Slack and we want someone who is eager to do the best work of their lives while supporting others in doing the same.  You will be responsible for driving the sales process with prospective customers as well as the expansion of existing accounts. You will work closely with our customers to understand their business objectives and act as their trusted guide for using Slack most effectively. You’ll also work with cross-functional teams to help align our product roadmap and marketing materials with customer feedback. If you enjoy working with customers from a variety of industries in a rapidly changing environment, then come and join us!  Some of the things you’ll be doing include … Educate customers on the value of Slack in a thoughtful way Provide recommendations based on a customer’s business needs and usage patterns Manage multiple customers simultaneously at various stages of the Slack buying cycle Handle inbound customer communication and organize/escalate issues appropriately including billing, legal, security, and technical inquiries Drive revenue through proactive outreach to existing customers Serve as the voice of the customer and collect feedback to drive continuous improvement across all areas including product Who You Are ... You have 3+ years relevant work experience in an account management or sales role, preferably in SaaS You are a self-motivated teammate that can act independently You take an active interest in opportunities to increase customer satisfaction and deepen customer relationships You have a consistent track record of identifying customer needs and successfully implementing solutions You have a proven track record of managing large scale accounts for the duration of the sales cycle and beyond You are flexible, adaptive, and resilient You have excellent written and verbal communication skills About Us  Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us!  Accommodations  If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.  Posting Statement  At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We are committed to creating a workforce that reflects society through inclusive programs and initiatives such as equal pay, employee resource groups, inclusive benefits, and more. Learn more about Equality at Salesforce and explore our benefits.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org will not pay any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Salesforce.com or Salesforce.org .  Salesforce welcomes all.
industries: Computer Software, Information Technology and Services, and Internet

We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, the World's Most Innovative Company according to Forbes, and one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For six years running. The growth, innovation, and Aloha spirit of Salesforce are driven by our incredible employees who thrive on delivering success for our customers while also finding time to give back through our 1/1/1 model, which leverages 1% of our time, equity, and product to improve communities around the world. Salesforce is a team sport, and we play to win. Join us! jobTitle: Head of South East Asia (B2B2C Category)
description: Our client is the leader in their category and sees huge potential in the SEA market. It is now pursuing an aggressive commercial expansion plan and hiring their 1st Head of SEA who will play a critical role in this global expansion into Singapore and future into the SEA region.  Responsibilities  You will actively lead the Southeast Asia organization to achieve its vision, maximizing sales, profitability, distributor journeys and new revenue streams in line with the company’s overall strategic directions. Working closely with the Managing Director, APAC this role will be instrumental for developing the RTM for the SEA markets, accountable for building up the team and lead successful business transformation via challenging the norms and pushing boundaries for untapped business opportunities. Leading/ building a team, you will align marketing and product portfolio mix, working closely with R&D to meet existing and prospective customer demands as well as to ensure improved service level and customer satisfaction together with Logistics and Customer Services.  Requirements  You are degree qualified with at least 15 years’ commercial experience in the FMCG industry, with food and beverage category experience. Knowledge of distributor management, sales channel development, working across multiple functional teams is required. Past exposure in B2B2C categories is highly preferred. You would have demonstrated commercial acumen, with a classic FMCG experience plus past entrepreneurial stint is highly preferred. To succeed in this role, you would be associated with the following traits: hands on, ability to deal with ambiguity and enjoy building from scratch.     To apply, please submit your resume (in MS Word format) to Jacee Liau at jl@partnersconsulting.com.sg, quoting the job title and reference number JL 17080.  Due to the high volume of applicants for this role, we regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.  (EA License: 21S0597 ; Registration ID: R1107902)
